data.v: तपःस्वाध्यायनिरतं तपस्वी वाग्विदां वरम् । नारदं परिपप्रच्छ वाल्मीकिर्मुनिपुंगवम् ॥
data.es: Ascetic Valmiki enquired of Narada, preeminent among the sages ever engaged in the practice of religious austerities or study of the Vedas and best among the eloquent.
data.anv: तपस्वी ascetic, वाल्मीकि: Valmiki, तप: स्वाध्यायनिरतम् highly delighted in the practice of religious austerities and study of vedas, वाग्विदां वरम् eloquent among the knowledgeable, मुनिपुङ्गवम् preeminent among sages, नारदम् Narada, परिपप्रच्छ enquired.
data.md: The ascetic Vālmīki asked Nārada, the best of sages and foremost of those conversant with words, ever engaged in austerities and Vedic studies.

data.v: को न्वस्मिन्साम्प्रतं लोके गुणवान्कश्च वीर्यवान् । धर्मज्ञश्च कृतज्ञश्च सत्यवाक्यो दृढव्रतः ॥
data.es: "Who in this world lives today endowed with excellent qualities, prowess, righteousness, gratitude, truthfulness and firmness in his vows?
data.anv: अस्मिन् लोके in this world, साम्प्रतम् now, गुणवान् endowed with excellent qualities, क: नु who indeed, वीर्यवांश्च with  prowess, धर्मज्ञ: च knower of righteousness, कृतज्ञ: च grateful (who remembers even little help done by others), सत्यवाक्य: truthful in his statements, दृढव्रत: firm in his vows (till such time he achieves the results), क: who?
data.md: Who at present in this world is like crowned with qualities, and with prowess, knowing duty, and grateful, and truthful, and firm in vow.

data.v: चारित्रेण च को युक्तः सर्वभूतेषु को हितः । विद्वान्कः कः समर्थश्च कश्चैकप्रियदर्शनः ॥
data.es: Who is that one gifted with good conduct, given to the wellbeing of all living creatures, learned in the lore (knowledge of all things that is known), capable of doing things which others can not do and singularly handsome?
data.anv: क: who?, चारित्रेण with good conduct, युक्त: is endowed, क: who?, सर्वभूतेषु for all living beings, हित: benefactor, क: who?, विद्वान् learned man (knower of everything which is to be known), क: who?, समर्थ: च competent (capable of doing things which cannot be done by others), क: who? एकप्रियदर्शन: च solely delightful in  appearance  to everyone,
data.md: Who is qualified by virtue of his character, and who is engaged in the welfare of all creatures? Who is learned and capable. Who alone is ever lovely to behold?

data.v: आत्मवान्को जितक्रोधो द्युतिमान्कोऽनसूयकः । कस्य बिभ्यति देवाश्च जातरोषस्य संयुगे ॥
data.es: Who (among men) is selfrestrained? Who has conquered anger? Who is endowed with brilliance and free from envy? Who is that when exited to wrath even the devatas, are afraid of (let alone foes)?
data.anv: आत्मवान् selfrestrained, क: who?, जितक्रोध: one who has conquered anger, द्युतिमान् one who is endowed with splendour, अनसूयक: one who is free from envy (envy depicting one's merits as weak points), क: who?, जातरोषस्य excited to wrath, कस्य to whom, संयुगे in the battle, देवा: च celestial beings, devatas, बिभ्यति are afraid of.
data.md: Who has subdued his heart, and controlled his anger, is endowed with splendour, and devoid of malice; and whom enraged in battle, do even the gods, fear?

data.v: एतदिच्छाम्यहं श्रोतुं परं कौतूहलं हि मे । महर्षे त्वं समर्थोऽसि ज्ञातुमेवंविधं नरम् ॥
data.es: O Maharshi, I intend to hear about such a man whom you are able to place? Indeed great is my curiosity".
data.anv: एतत् this, अहम् I, श्रोतुम् to listen, इच्छामि am desirous, मे my, कौतूहलम् curiosity, परं हि is great, महर्षे O Maharshi, त्वम् you, एवंविधम् of such (virtues), नरम् man, ज्ञातुम् to know, समर्थ: असि are competent.
data.md: I have great curiosity to hear of such a person. You can, O Maharşi,* know about a man of this description. *A great saint. The word, however, signifies one belonging to a particular order of saints.

data.v: श्रुत्वा चैतत्त्रिलोकज्ञो वाल्मीकेर्नारदो वचः । श्रूयतामिति चामन्त्र्य प्रहृष्टो वाक्यमब्रवीत् ॥
data.es: Invited by Valmiki to take his seat Narada, knower of the three worlds heard him and said with delight "listen to me". And thus spoke.
data.anv: त्रिलोकज्ञ: knower of the three worlds, नारद: Narada, वाल्मीके: Valmiki's, एतत् वच: these words, श्रुत्वा च having heard, श्रूयताम् इति "Listen to me", चामन्त्त्र्य च having invited, प्रहृष्ट: was delighted, वाक्यम् words, अब्रवीत् spoke.
data.md: Hearing Vālmīki's words, Nărada, cognizant of the three worlds, said with alacrity, “listen to me”!

data.v: बहवो दुर्लभाश्चैव ये त्वया कीर्तिता गुणाः । मुने वक्ष्याम्यहं बुद्ध्वा तैर्युक्तः श्रूयतां नरः ॥
data.es: "O sage rare indeed are men endowed with the many qualities you have described. I ascertained one. Listen carefully.
data.anv: मुने OSage Valmiki, बहव: many, दुर्लभा: च एव rare indeed are the ordinary people endowed with such qualities, ये गुणा: those qualities, त्वया by you, कीर्तिता: described, तै: with those qualities, युक्त: endowed with, नर: man, श्रूयताम् listen, अहम् I, बुद्ध्वा having ascertained, वक्ष्यामि shall tell you.
data.md: Rare as are the qualities mentioned by you, I will, O sage, having duly considered, describe to you a person endued with them.

data.v: इक्ष्वाकुवंशप्रभवो रामो नाम जनैः श्रुतः । नियतात्मा महावीर्यो द्युतिमान्धृतिमान्वशी ॥
data.es: People have heard his name as Rama, who was born in the race of king Ikshvaku, having steady nature, possessing incomprehensible prowess, selfeffulgent, selfcommanding and subjecting senses under his control.
data.anv: इक्ष्वाकुवंशप्रभव: born in the race of king Ikshvaku, राम: नाम known as Rama (one who delights others), जनै: by people, श्रुत: is heard, नियतात्मा steady natured (meaning thereby immutable form), महावीर्य: incomprehensible prowess, द्युतिमान् selfeffulgent, धृतिमान् selfcommanding, वशी subjecting the senses (subjecting the entire world under his control).
data.md: There is one sprung from the line of Ikşvāku, known by the name of Rāma. He is of subdued soul; and is exceedingly powerful; effulgent; endowed with patience; having senses under control.

data.v: बुद्धिमान्नीतिमान्वाग्मी श्रीमाञ्शत्रुनिबर्हणः । विपुलांसो महाबाहुः कम्बुग्रीवो महाहनुः ॥
data.es: He (Sri Rama) is a great intellectual, adherent to rules, eloquent, handsome, destroyer of foes (sins), broadshouldered, strongarmed, having conchshaped neck and prominent cheeks.
data.anv: बुद्धिमान् great intellectual, नीतिमान् learned in ethical (statecraft) philosophy, वाग्मी proficient in speeches, श्रीमान् possessing vast auspiciousness, शत्रुनिबर्हण: destroyer of foes (sins), विपुलांस: broad shouldered, महाबाहु: strongarmed, कम्बुग्रीव: possessing conchshaped neck, महाहनु: having prominent and strong cheeks.
data.md: He is intelligent; learned in morality; eloquent; crowned with grace; the slayer of foes: broad-shouldered; possessed of mighty arms, a conch-shaped neck, fleshy jaws.

data.v: महोरस्को महेष्वासो गूढजत्रुररिंदमः । आजानुबाहुः सुशिराः सुललाटः सुविक्रमः ॥
data.es: Possessing a broad chest, armed with a great bow, with fleshy collar bones, kneelong arms, a noble head, a graceful forehead and great prowess, he is the destroyer of foes (sins).
data.anv: महोरस्क: having a broad chest, महेष्वासः armed with a great bow (meaning thereby having a body strong enough to carry a bow), गूढजत्रुः has fleshy collar bones, अरिन्दमः is destroyer of foes (sins), आजानुबाहु: knee-long arms, सुशिराः head with noble qualities, सुललाटः has a large and beautiful forehead, सुविक्रमः valiant
data.md: And a broad chest; a powerful bowman; the repressor of foes; having plump shoulder-blades; of arms reaching down to his knees; with a beautiful head, and a graceful forehead; and endowed with excellent might.

data.v: समः समविभक्ताङ्गः स्निग्धवर्णः प्रतापवान् । पीनवक्षा विशालाक्षो लक्ष्मीवाञ्शुभलक्षणः ॥
data.es: Mighty and powerful, he has a wellproportioned body, neither tall nor short, shining complexion, welldeveloped chest, large eyes, lustrous body and good qualities.
data.anv: समः neither too tall nor too short, समविभक्ताङ्ग: has wellproportioned limbs, स्निग्धवर्णः has shining complexion, प्रतापवान् is mighty and powerful, पीनवक्षा: strong welldeveloped chest, विशालाक्षः has expansive eyes, लक्ष्मीवान् lustrous body, शुभलक्षणः has auspicious qualities (according to science of palmistry).
data.md: And having symmetrical limbs, and of a cool hue; and possessed of prowess; and having a well-developed chest; with expansive eyes; crowned with auspiciousness and favourable marks.

data.v: धर्मज्ञः सत्यसंधश्च प्रजानां च हिते रतः । यशस्वी ज्ञानसंपन्नः शुचिर्वश्यः समाधिमान् ॥
data.es: Pious, firm in his vows, he is ever intent on doing good to his subjects. He is, illustrious, wise, and pure at heart. He is obedient to elders (or accessible to those who are dependent on him) and ever meditating (on the means of protecting those who take refuge in him).
data.anv: धर्मज्ञ: knower of duties (of protecting those who take refuge in him) of life, सत्यसन्ध: firm in his vows, प्रजानाम् for his subjects, हिते doing good, रतः intent on, यशस्वी renowned, ज्ञानसम्पन्नः omniscient, शुचिः pure and devout, वश्यः obedient to elders (or accessible to those who are dependent on him), समाधिमान् meditating on the means of protecting those who took refuge in him.
data.md: Knowing duty; firm in promise; always engaged in the good of his subjects; of accomplished renown; furnished with knowledge; pure in body and spirit; obedient towards superiors; versed in self-knowledge.

data.v: रक्षिता जीवलोकस्य धर्मस्य परिरक्षिता । वेदवेदाङ्गतत्त्वज्ञो धनुर्वेदे च निष्ठितः ॥
data.es: He has performed the duties of a king and protected his subjects. knowledgeable in the true nature of the Vedas he is accomplished in military science (he is a great archer).
data.anv: स्वस्य of his own, धर्मस्य duties of a king, रक्षिता protector, स्वजनस्य च of his own subjects, रक्षिता protector, वेदवेदाङ्गतत्त्वज्ञ: knowledgeable in the true nature of vedas and vedangas, धनुर्वेदे च in military science, one of the upavedas (a great archer), निष्ठित: accomplished.
data.md: Practising all the duties of his class; and preserving those cleaving to him; versed in the profundities of the Vedas and the Vedāngas; accomplished in archery.

data.v: सर्वशास्त्रार्थतत्त्वज्ञ स्मृतिमान्प्रतिभानवान् । सर्वलोकप्रियः साधुरदीनात्मा विचक्षणः ॥
data.es: Sri Rama knows the true meaning of all scriptures and has a retentive memory. He is talented (possessing brightness of conception). He is beloved and welldisposed towards all people (and courteous even towards those who have done him harm). He has an unperturbed mind (even in times of extreme grief) and is circumspect (in doing right things at the right time).
data.anv: सर्वशास्त्रार्थतत्त्वज्ञ: knower of the true meaning of all scriptures, स्मृतिमान् has infalliable retentive memory, प्रतिभानवान् is talented (possessing brightness of conception), सर्वलोकप्रियः is beloved of all people, साधु: welldisposed and courteous (even towards those who have done harm), अदीनात्मा unperturbed mind (even in times of extreme grief), विचक्षणः has dicrimination (is circumspect in doing right things in right time).
data.md: Well versed in the dicta of all the sciences; brilliant; gifted with a good memory; the darling of all; unreproved; of unvanquished spirit; proficient in every branch of learning.

data.v: सर्वदाभिगतः सद्भिः समुद्र इव सिन्धुभिः । आर्यः सर्वसमश्चैव सदैकप्रियदर्शनः ॥
data.es: Sri Rama, like sea to rivers, is accessible to men of virtue and has equal disposition towards all. He always has a pleasing appearance.
data.anv: समुद्रः sea, सिन्धुभिः the rivers, इव like, सद्भिः good persons, सर्वदा ever, अभिगतः is approachable, आर्यः man of virtue, सर्वसमः च एव having equitable dispostition towards all, सदैकप्रियदर्शनः always has delightful countenance.
data.md: Ever resorted to by the good persons even as the ocean is by the rivers; worthy of being honoured; having an equal regard for all; and capable of filling the heart with ever new sensations.

data.v: स च सर्वगुणोपेतः कौसल्यानन्दवर्धनः । समुद्र इव गाम्भीर्ये धैर्येण हिमवानिव ॥
data.es: Sri Rama, bestowed with all virtues, enhanced the joys of Kausalya, He is like the sea in deportment and like Himavant in fortitude.
data.anv: कौसल्यानन्दवर्धन: he, who is enhancing the joys of Kausalya, स: च he also, सर्वगुणोपेत:  endowed with all virtues, गाम्भीर्ये in depth of his thoughts, समुद्र: इव like a sea, धैर्येण in fortitude, हिमवान् इव like Himavat mountain.
data.md: Crowned with all sort of qualities, he enhances the joys of Kausalyā; being like that of the sea in gravity, and that of the Himavat in patience.

data.v: विष्णुना सदृशो वीर्ये सोमवत्प्रियदर्शनः । कालाग्निसदृशः क्रोधे क्षमया पृथिवीसमः ॥
data.es: Sri Rama is like Visnu in prowess, the Moon in pleasing appearance, the allconsuming fire in anger, the earth in patience, Kubera in chartiy and the Sun in steadfastness.
data.anv: वीर्ये In prowess, विष्णुना सदृशः similar to Visnu, सोमवत् in appearance like the Moon, प्रियदर्शनः pleasing to the sight, क्रोधे in anger, कालाग्निसदृशः like the all-consuming fire, क्षमया in patience, पृथिवीसमः equal to earth, त्यागे in charity, धनदेन समः like Kubera, सत्ये in truth (here steadfastness), अपरः धर्मः इव like the Sun.
data.md: In prowess, he is like as Vişnu, and boasts of the personal attractions of the Moon. In anger he resembles the fire raging at the time of dissolution; and in forgiveness, he is like that of the Earth.

data.v: धनदेन समस्त्यागे सत्ये धर्म इवापरः । तमेवंगुणसंपन्नं रामं सत्यपराक्रमम् ॥
ज्येष्ठं श्रेष्ठगुणैर्युक्तं प्रियं दशरथः सुतम् । यौवराज्येन संयोक्तुमैच्छत्प्रीत्या महीपतिः ॥
data.es: With a desire to promote the welfare of the people king Dasaratha decided to install Sri Rama, his eldest and affectionate son as heir (apparent) who was bestowed with all excellent qualities and true prowess, beloved of the people he was ever intent in the welfare of the people.
data.anv: महीपति: दशरथ: lord of earth, Dasaratha, एवं गुणसम्पन्नम् him who was possessing all such good qualities, सत्यपराक्रमम् him who had not a vain prowess, श्रेष्ठगुणै: with excellent virtues, युक्तम् endowed with, प्रियम् beloved, प्रकृतीनाम् for his subjects, हितै: with good deeds, युक्तम् endowed with, ज्येष्ठम् eldest, सुतम् son, तं रामम् Sri Rama, प्रकृतिप्रियकाम्यया ever intent on the welfare of the people, प्रीत्या with affection, यौवराज्येन heirapparent, संयोक्तुम् to install, ऐच्छत् wished.

data.v: तस्याभिषेकसंभारान्दृष्ट्वा भार्याथ कैकयी । पूर्वं दत्तवरा देवी वरमेनमयाचत । विवासनं च रामस्य भरतस्याभिषेचनम् ॥
data.es: Thereafter, having seen the preparations for installation of Rama, queen Kaikeyi who had been promised earlier with boons by Dasaratha demanded of him the exile of Rama and enthronement of Bharata.
data.anv: अथ thereafter, तस्य Rama's, अभिषेकसम्भारान् preparations for the installation, दृष्ट्वा having seen, पूर्वम् previously, दत्तवरा was promised with boons, भार्या wife, देवी queen, कैकयी Kaikeyi, रामस्य Rama's, विवासनम् exile, भरतस्य of Bharata, अभिषेचनम्  enthronement, वरम् boon, एनम् अयाचत begged of Dasaratha.
data.md: Beholding the provisions of the installation, that lady the king's consort, Kaikeyī, who had previously been promised two boons, even asked him for those viz., the exile of Ráma, and the installation of Bharata.

data.v: स सत्यवचनाद्राजा धर्मपाशेन संयतः । विवासयामास सुतं रामं दशरथः प्रियम् ॥
data.es: Dasaratha, true to his word and restrained by the bond of duty, sent his beloved son Rama to the forest.
data.anv: स: दशरथ: Dasaratha, सत्यवचनात् due to being truthful to his word, धर्मपाशेन by the bond of duty, संयत: restrained, प्रियं सुतम् beloved son, रामम् Rama, विवासयामास sent (to the forest).
data.md: Bound by the ties of duty in consequence of his promise, king Dasaratha banished his favourite son Rāma.

data.v: स जगाम वनं वीरः प्रतिज्ञामनुपालयन् । पितुर्वचननिर्देशात्कैकेय्याः प्रियकारणात् ॥
data.es: Mighty Sri Rama inorder to please Kaikeyi and obey the word of command of his father, went to the forest and help the king to keep his promise to Kaikeyi.
data.anv: वीर: स: that mighty  Sri Rama, कैकेय्या: Kaikeyi's, प्रियकारणात् with a view to gratify, पितु: father's, वचननिर्देशात् by the word of command, प्रतिज्ञाम् his promise, अनुपालयन् while obeying, वनम् forest,  जगाम went.
data.md: In pursuance of his father's promise, and with the view of compassing the pleasure of Kaikeyī, that heroic one, commanded by his sire, repaired to the forest.

data.v: तं व्रजन्तं प्रियो भ्राता लक्ष्मणोऽनुजगाम ह । स्नेहाद्विनयसंपन्नः सुमित्रानन्दवर्धनः ॥
data.es: Lakshmana beloved brother to Rama is drawn towards him. Endowed with modesty he is an enhancer of the joy of his mother Sumitra. Displaying his fraternal love, he followed Rama who was departing to the forest.
data.anv: विनयसम्पन्न: endowed with modesty, भ्रातु: for brother Rama, दयित: beloved, प्रिय: भ्राता brother with natural affection,  सुमित्रानन्दवर्धन: one who enhances the joy of Sumitra, लक्ष्मण: Lakshmana, सौभ्रात्रम् affectionate brotherhood, अनुदर्शयन् showing, व्रजन्तम् departing to the forest, तं भ्रातरम् his brother Rama, स्नेहात् out of affection, अनुजगाम ह followed.
data.md: On the eve of his departure for the forest, that enhancer of Sumitrā's joy and favourite of his brother (Rāma), his dear brother Lakşmaņa, endowed with humility, displaying brotherliness, followed him out of affection.

data.v: सर्वलक्षणसंपन्ना नारीणामुत्तमा वधूः । सीताप्यनुगता रामं शशिनं रोहिणी यथा ॥
data.es: Born in the race of Janaka and daughterinlaw of Dasaratha, Sita, beloved spouse of Rama is like his vital breath always desired the wellbeing of Rama she followed him like Rohini, the Moon. Endowed with all virtues she is the foremost woman.
data.anv: रामस्य for Rama, दयिता beloved, भार्या wife, प्राणसमा equal to his vital breath, नित्यम् always, हिता doing fit and proper acts beneficial to him, जनकस्य king Janaka's, कुले in the  race, जाता born, निर्मिता created, देवमायेव like Maya Mohini, the assumed form of visnuhnu,  सर्वलक्षणसम्पन्ना endowed with all auspicious characteristics, नारीणाम् among women, उत्तमा the foremost, वधू: daughterinlaw (of Dasaratha), सीतापि Sita also, रोहिणी Rohini, (one of the several daughters of Daksha and consort of moon) शशिनम् यथा like moon, रामम् Rama, अनुगता followed.

data.v: पौरैरनुगतो दूरं पित्रा दशरथेन च । शृङ्गवेरपुरे सूतं गङ्गाकूले व्यसर्जयत् ॥
data.es: The citizens and Dasaratha followed Rama for a long distance. Rama of righteous nature having approached Guha, king of nishadas, at Shrungiberapura sent back charioteer Sumantra and Rama along with Sita and Lakshmana crossed river Ganga.
data.anv: पौरै: by citizens, पित्रा दशरथेन च by his father Dasaratha also, दूरम् for a long distance, अनुगत: followed, धर्मात्मा राम: Rama of righteous nature (the protector of those who take refuge in him), गङ्गाकूले on the bank of river Ganga, शृङ्गिबेरपुरे at Shrungiberapura, निषादाधिपतिम् the king of Nishadas, प्रियम् endeared to him, गुहम् Guha, आसाद्य having approached, गुहेन along with Guha, लक्ष्मणेन by Lakshmana, सीतया च and by Sita, सहित: accompanied सूतम् charioteer Sumantra, व्यसर्जयत् sent back.

data.v: ते वनेन वनं गत्वा नदीस्तीर्त्वा बहूदकाः । चित्रकूटमनुप्राप्य भरद्वाजस्य शासनात् ॥
data.es: Moving from one forest to another and crossing deep and wide rivers with plenty of waters, reached the Chitrakuta mountain by the command of sage Bharadwaja. They raised a hut made of leaves in the forest located in Chitrakuta mountain. and dwelt there happily resembling devas and gandharvas.
data.anv: ते they, वनेन from one forest, वनम् to another forest, गत्वा having gone, बहूदका: नदी: deep and broad rivers with plenty of waters, तीर्त्वा having crossed, भरद्वाजस्य sage Bharadwaja's, शासनात् order, चित्रकूटम् Chitrakuta mountain, अनुप्राप्य having reached, रम्यम् delightful, आवसथम् abode (a hut made of leaves), कृत्वा having constructed, ते they (having enjoyed such comforts), त्रय: three, तत्र वने in the forest located in Chitrakuta mountain, रममाणा: enjoying, देवगन्धर्वसङ्काशा: resembling devas and gandharvas, सुखम् happily, न्यवसन् dwelt.
data.md: Then wending from one forest to another, and having crossed many broad rivers, they, in accordance with Bharadvăja's directions, arrived at the Citrakūta; and constructing a romantic abode, the three began to live there.

data.v: रम्यमावसथं कृत्वा रममाणा वने त्रयः । देवगन्धर्वसंकाशास्तत्र ते न्यवसन्सुखम् ॥
data.es: Moving from one forest to another and crossing deep and wide rivers with plenty of waters, reached the Chitrakuta mountain by the command of sage Bharadwaja. They raised a hut made of leaves in the forest located in Chitrakuta mountain. and dwelt there happily resembling devas and gandharvas.
data.anv: ते they, वनेन from one forest, वनम् to another forest, गत्वा having gone, बहूदका: नदी: deep and broad rivers with plenty of waters, तीर्त्वा having crossed, भरद्वाजस्य sage Bharadwaja's, शासनात् order, चित्रकूटम् Chitrakuta mountain, अनुप्राप्य having reached,  रम्यम् delightful, आवसथम् abode (a hut made of leaves), कृत्वा having constructed, ते they (having enjoyed such comforts), त्रय: three, तत्र वने in the forest located in Chitrakuta mountain, रममाणा: enjoying, देवगन्धर्वसङ्काशा: resembling devas and gandharvas, सुखम् happily, न्यवसन् dwelt.

data.v: चित्रकूटं गते रामे पुत्रशोकातुरस्तदा । राजा दशरथः स्वर्गं जगाम विलपन्सुतम् ॥
data.es: When Rama had set out to Chitrakuta, king Dasaratha, stricken by the grief over the separation from his son and mourning over him departed to heavens.
data.anv: तथा in that way, रामे when Rama, चित्रकूटम् गते had set out to Chitrakuta, पुत्रशोकातुर: stricken by the grief over the separation from his son, राजा दशरथ: king Dasaratha, सुतम् about his son, विलपन् wailing, स्वर्गम् heavens, जगाम went.
data.md: They spent their days in delight, in the company of gods and Gandharvas. And when Rāma had reached the Citrakuța, king Dasaratha, distressed on account of his son, went to heaven, bewailing the latter.

data.v: मृते तु तस्मिन्भरतो वसिष्ठप्रमुखैर्द्विजैः । नियुज्यमानो राज्याय नैच्छद्राज्यं महाबलः । स जगाम वनं वीरो रामपादप्रसादकः ॥
data.es: After Dasaratha had passed away, mighty Bharata did not desire to rule the kingdom against the orders by Vasishta and other brahmins.
data.anv: तस्मिन् when he (Dasaratha), मृते had died, वसिष्ठप्रमुखै: द्विजै: with Vasishta and other brahmins, राज्याय to rule the kingdom, नियुज्यमान: had been ordered, महाबल: mighty, भरत: तु Bharata, राज्यम् kingdom, नैच्छत् did not desire to rule .
data.md: When king Dasaratha had passed away heaven, the mighty Bharata, although pressed by the Brāhmaṇas headed by Vasiştha, to rule the kingdom, did not wish for dominion. And that hero went the forest, with the view of propitiating Rāma.

data.v: पादुके चास्य राज्याय न्यासं दत्त्वा पुनः पुनः । निवर्तयामास ततो भरतं भरताग्रजः ॥
data.es: Having handed over his sandals to Bharata as symbol of authority for ruling the kingdom, Rama persuaded him again and again to return to the capital.
data.anv: भरताग्रज: Bharata's elder brother, Rama, राज्याय to rule the kingdom, अस्य to him, पादुके his own sandals, न्यासम् in deposit, as symbol of authority, दत्वा having given, तत: thereafter, पुन:पुन: repeatedly, भरतम् Bharata, निवर्तयामास persuaded him to return to the capital.

data.v: स काममनवाप्यैव रामपादावुपस्पृशन् । नन्दिग्रामेऽकरोद्राज्यं रामागमनकाङ्क्षया ॥
data.es: Disaaponted in his mission to take Rama back, Bharata worshipped the sandals of Rama and ruled the kingdom from Nandigrama, awaiting his return.
data.anv: स: Bharata, कामम् desire, अनवाप्यैव without fulfilling only, रामपादौ sandals of Rama, उपस्पृशन् touching with reverence, रामागमनकाङ्क्षया eagerly awaiting the return of Rama, नन्दिग्रामे in Nandigrama, राज्यम् अकरोत् ruled the kingdom.
data.md: And then Bharata, finding his desire not fulfilled, touched Rama's feet, and began to rule at Nandigrāma, expecting the return of Rāma.

data.v: रामस्तु पुनरालक्ष्य नागरस्य जनस्य च । तत्रागमनमेकाग्रे दण्डकान्प्रविवेश ह ॥
data.es: When Bharata departed, Sri Rama, a man of good fortune and steadfast in vows one who had conquered under control perceiving that the citizens from Ayodhya would arrive there, entered the Dandaka forest with single minded determination (so that there would not be breach of his promise).
data.anv: भरते when Bharata, गते तु had gone, श्रीमान् one possessing brightness, सत्यसन्ध: steadfast in his vows, जितेन्द्रिय: conquered the  senses, राम: तु Rama, नागरस्य जनस्य च of citydwelling citizens', पुन: again, तत्र in that Chitrakuta mountain, आगमनम् arrival, आलक्ष्य perceiving, एकाग्र: with undivided concentration of mind and resoluteness (to fulfill the promise given to his father), दण्डकान् Dandaka forest, प्रविवेश ह entered.
data.md: And when the auspicious Bharata, firm in his promise and of subdued sense, had gone away, Rāma again perceiving there the influx of citizens and others, eagerly entered Dandaka.

data.v: विराधं राक्षसं हत्वा शरभङ्गं ददर्श ह । सुतीक्ष्णं चाप्यगस्त्यं च अगस्त्य भ्रातरं तथा ॥
data.es: Having entered the dense forest Dandaka, Rama slew the demon Viradha and saw the sages Sarabhanga, Sutikshna and Agastya with his brother.
data.anv: राजीवलोचनः lotuseyed, रामः Rama, महारण्यम् dreary forest (Dandakaranya) प्रविश्य तु having entered, विराधम् Viradha, राक्षसम् Rakshasa, हत्वा after slaying, शरभङ्गम् sage Sarabhanga, सुतीक्ष्णं च also sage Sutikshna, अगस्त्यं च sage Agastya, तथा and, अगस्त्यभ्रातरं च brother of sage Agastya, ददर्श ह saw.
data.md: Having entered that mighty vast, the lotuseyed Rāma slew the Räkşasa Virädha, and saw Sarabhanga, Sutiksna, Agastya and Agastya's brother.

data.v: अगस्त्यवचनाच्चैव जग्राहैन्द्रं शरासनम् । खड्गं च परमप्रीतस्तूणी चाक्षयसायकौ ॥
data.es: As directed by sage Agastya, Rama received with extreme delight a bow, a sword and quivers with inexhaustible arrows, given by Indra to Agastya (to be passed on to Rama).
data.anv: अगस्त्यवचनात् च एव as directed by sage Agastya, ऐन्द्रम् given by Indra, शरासनम् bow, खड्गं च a sword, अक्षयसायकौ inexhaustible arrows, तूणी च and quivers, परमप्रीतः extremely delighted, जग्राह received.
data.md: He then, advised by Agastya, gladly possessed himself of Indra's bow, the inexhaustible arrows, the scimitar, and the quiver.

data.v: वसतस्तस्य रामस्य वने वनचरैः सह । ऋषयोऽभ्यागमन्सर्वे वधायासुररक्षसाम् ॥
data.es: While Rama was dwelling in the forest (in the hermitage of sage Sarabhanga), all the ascetics along with others (sages) inhabiting the forest approached Rama requesting for the destruction of the asuras and rakshasas seizing upon their lives.
data.anv: तस्य रामस्य when Rama, वने in that forest (in the hermitage of sage Sarabhanga), वसत: was dwelling, सर्वे ऋषय: all the ascetics, वनचरैः सह along with those inhabiting the forest, असुररक्षसाम् asuras and rakshasas (seizing upon the lives), वधाय for destruction, अभ्यागमन् approached.
data.md: While Rāma was dwelling there with the rangers of forests, the sages came to him in a body, for the destruction of the Asuras and Raksasas.

data.v: तेन तत्रैव वसता जनस्थाननिवासिनी । विरूपिता शूर्पणखा राक्षसी कामरूपिणी ॥
data.es: During his stay there a demon called Surpanakha living in Janasthana (resting place for the army of Ravana in Dandakaranya) and capable of assuming any form at will was rendered deformed by Lakshmana.
data.anv: तत्रैव वसता while living in that place itself, तेन by Rama, जनस्थाननिवासिनी resident of  Janasthana area (of Dandakaranya), कामरूपिणी capable of assuming any form at will, राक्षसी शूर्पणखा female demon Surpanakha, विरूपिता was deformed.
data.md: It was while he was living there that, that dweller of Janasthāna, the Rākṣasī Śūrpanakhā, capable of assuming any form at will, was disfigured.

data.v: ततः शूर्पणखावाक्यादुद्युक्तान्सर्वराक्षसान् । खरं त्रिशिरसं चैव दूषणं चैव राक्षसम् ॥
data.es: Thereafter Rama killed in the fight all the rakshasas, Khara, Trisira, and Dushana with their followers in a battle who were instigated by Surpanakha's words.
data.anv: ततः thereafter, शूर्पणखावाक्यात् (instigated) by the words of Surpanakha, उद्युक्तान् ready for a battle, सर्वराक्षसान् all the rakshasas, खरम् एव Khara only, त्रिशिरसं च Trisira also, दूषणम् Dushana, राक्षसं च एव rakshasa also, तेषाम् their, पदानुगान् च एव followers also, राम: Rama, वने in the forest, निजघान killed.

data.v: निजघान रणे रामस्तेषां चैव पदानुगान् । रक्षसां निहतान्यासन्सहस्राणि चतुर्दश ॥
data.es: During his stay in that forest Rama killed fourteen thousand rakshasas who were inhabitants of Janasthana.
data.anv: तस्मिन् वने in that forest, निवसता by Rama who was living, जनस्थाननिवासिनाम् of the inhabitants of Janasthana, रक्षसाम् of rakshasas, चतुर्दशसहस्राणि fourteen thousand of them,  निहतानि आसन् were killed.

data.v: ततो ज्ञातिवधं श्रुत्वा रावणः क्रोधमूर्छितः । सहायं वरयामास मारीचं नाम राक्षसम् ॥
data.es: Having heard the slaughter of fellow rakshasa, Ravana became violent with anger and sought the help of a rakshasa named Maricha.
data.anv: तत: thereafter, रावणः Ravana, ज्ञातिवधम् slaughter of fellow rakshasas, श्रुत्वा having heard, क्रोधमूर्छितः became violent with anger, मारीचं नाम named Maricha, राक्षसम् rakshasa, सहायम् help, वरयामास sought for.
data.md: Having learnt of the destruction of his relatives, Rāvaņa wrought into frenzy by anger, sought the help of a Rākşasa named Mārīca.

data.v: वार्यमाणः सुबहुशो मारीचेन स रावणः । न विरोधो बलवता क्षमो रावण तेन ते ॥
data.es: Maricha repeatedly dissuaded him saying, 'O Ravana It is not proper for you to enter into hostility with the mighty and powerful Rama'.
data.anv: "रावण O Ravana, बलवता with that mighty and powerful (because of slaying of Khara etc. rakshasas), तेन with that Rama, विरोध: hostilities, ते to you, न क्षम: is not proper" in this way, मारीचेन by Maricha, सुबहुश: well in many ways, वार्यमाणः dissuaded, स: रावण: that Ravana.
data.md: And although strongly dissuaded by Mārīca, saying. You ought not to enter into hostilities with that powerful one. Do you, therefore, O Ravana, excuse me! yet, disregarding those words of his, Ravana, urged on by Fate, went into that asylum in company with Mārīca.

data.v: अनादृत्य तु तद्वाक्यं रावणः कालचोदितः । जगाम सहमारीचस्तस्याश्रमपदं तदा ॥
data.es: Disregarding his words Ravana incited by fate left for the hermitage of Rama along with Maricha.
data.anv: रावणः Ravana, कालचोदितः incited by destiny, तद्वाक्यम् those words, अनादृत्य तु disregarding, सहमारीचः followed by Maricha, तस्य आश्रमपदम् towards his hermitage, तदा then, जगाम went.
data.md: And although strongly dissuaded by Mārīca, saying. You ought not to enter into hostilities with that powerful one. Do you, therefore, O Ravana, excuse me! yet, disregarding those words of his, Ravana, urged on by Fate, went into that asylum in company with Mārīca.

data.v: तेन मायाविना दूरमपवाह्य नृपात्मजौ । जहार भार्यां रामस्य गृध्रं हत्वा जटायुषम् ॥
data.es: He with the help of deceitful Maricha drew the princes (Rama and Lakshmana) far away from their hermitage abducted Sita the wife of Rama and slaughtered vulture Jatayu,
data.anv: मायाविना by the deceitful, तेन by him (Maricha), नृपात्मजौ princes (Rama and Lakshmana), दूरम् far away, अपवाह्य drawing them away, जटायुषम् Jatayu, गृध्रम् vulture, हत्वा having killed, रामस्य Rama's, भार्याम् wife, Sita, जहार carried away.
data.md: That one (Mārīca) commanding illusions, having drawn far the king's sons (Rāma and Lakşmaņa), he (Rāvana) carried away Rāma's wife, slaying the vulture Jatayu.

data.v: गृध्रं च निहतं दृष्ट्वा हृतां श्रुत्वा च मैथिलीम् । राघवः शोकसंतप्तो विललापाकुलेन्द्रियः ॥
data.es: Having seen and heard from the eagle Jatayu struck down by Ravana that Sita had been abducted Rama bewailed, choked with tears his senses dulled by distress.
data.anv: राघव: Rama, निहतम् struck down, गृध्रम् eagle Jatayu, दृष्ट्वा having seen, मैथिलीम् the princess of Mithila, Sita, हृताम् abducted, श्रुत्वा च having heard (from Jatayu), शोकसन्तप्त: distressed with grief, आकुलेन्द्रियः with obscured senses, विललाप bewailed.
data.md: And beholding the vulture slain and learning of the kidnapping of Mithila's daughter, the descendant of Raghu, deprived of sense, bewailed in grief.

data.v: ततस्तेनैव शोकेन गृध्रं दग्ध्वा जटायुषम् । मार्गमाणो वने सीतां राक्षसं संददर्श ह ॥
data.es: Then he performed in the midst of tears the funeral rites of the vulture Jatayu. Wandering in search of Sita, he beheld a rakshasa named Kabandha who was dreadful, in deformed in appearance.
data.anv: तेनैव शोकेन pervaded by that sorrow, तत: then, गृध्रं जटायुषम् vulture Jatayu, दग्ध्वा having  consigned to flames, वने in the forest, सीताम् Sita, मार्गमाण: wandering in search of, रूपेण in form, विकृतम् deformed, घोरदर्शनम् dreadful appearance, कबन्धन्नाम named Kabandha, राक्षसम् rakshasa, सन्ददर्श ह beheld.
data.md: Having with unassuaged sorrow burnt the vulture Jațāyu, as he was searching for Sità in that forest, he fell in with a Rākṣasa, Kabandha by name, of a dreadful and deformed shape. Having slain him, the mighty-armed one burnt his body,-and thereupon he went to heaven.

data.v: कबन्धं नाम रूपेण विकृतं घोरदर्शनम् । तं निहत्य महाबाहुर्ददाह स्वर्गतश्च सः ॥
data.md: Having with unassuaged sorrow burnt the vulture Jațāyu, as he was searching for Sità in that forest, he fell in with a Rākṣasa, Kabandha by name, of a dreadful and deformed shape. Having slain him, the mighty-armed one burnt his body,-and thereupon he went to heaven.

data.v: स चास्य कथयामास शबरीं धर्मचारिणीम् । श्रमणीं धर्मनिपुणामभिगच्छेति राघव । सोऽभ्यगच्छन्महातेजाः शबरीं शत्रुसूदनः ॥
data.es: Mightyarmed Rama, having killed Kabandha, consigned his body to flames. While leaving for heavens he informed him saying, 'O Raghava, there is a female ascetic in Sabara community, performing religious duties and proficient in practising austerities. You may visit her'.
data.anv: महाबाहु: mightyarmed Rama, तम् that Kabandha, निहत्य having killed, ददाह consigned him to flames, स: he (his soul), स्वर्गतश्च ascended heaven, स च Kabandha (while leaving for heavens), राघव O Raghava,  धर्मचारिणीम् performing religious duties, धर्मनिपुणाम् proficient in practising austerities duties, श्रमणीम् female ascetic, शबरीम् belonging to Sabara community, अभिगच्छ visit her, अस्य to Rama, इति कथयामास informed.
data.md: And the Rākşasa addressed Rama saying, O descendant of Raghu, Do you repair to the ascetic, Śabarī, conversant with all systems of morality.

data.v: शबर्या पूजितः सम्यग्रामो दशरथात्मजः । पम्पातीरे हनुमता संगतो वानरेण ह ॥
हनुमद्वचनाच्चैव सुग्रीवेण समागतः । सुग्रीवाय च तत्सर्वं शंसद्रामो महाबलः ॥
data.md: Than he met with Hanuman on the banks of the Pampā. Then, agreeably to Hanumān's advice, the exceedingly powerful Rāma saw Sugrīva. And detailed to him all specially touching Sitā.

data.v: ततो वानरराजेन वैरानुकथनं प्रति । रामायावेदितं सर्वं प्रणयाद्दुःखितेन च । वालिनश्च बलं तत्र कथयामास वानरः ॥
data.es: Thereafter Sugriva, king of monkeys filled with sorrow narrated to Rama out of friendship the entire account of his hostilities (with Vali).
data.anv: तत: thereafter, दु:खितेन by him who was filled with sorrow, वानरराजेन by the king of monkeys, Sugriva, वैरानुकथनं प्रति his story about hostilities (with Vali), रामाय to Rama, सर्वम् entirely, प्रणयात् out of friendship, आवेदितम् was communicated.
data.md: Then the king of monkeys, out of friendship, mournfully related to him all about his hostilities with Vali.

data.v: प्रतिज्ञातं च रामेण तदा वालिवधं प्रति । सुग्रीवः शङ्कितश्चासीन्नित्यं वीर्येण राघवे ॥
data.es: Then Rama vowed to slay Vali. The monkey (Sugriva) described about Vali's prowess to Rama.
data.anv: तदा then, रामेण by Rama, वालिवधं प्रति about slaying of Vali, प्रतिज्ञातम् vowed, तत्र there, वानर: Sugriva, वालिन: Vali's, बलम् च prowess, कथयामास described.
data.md: Then Ráma vowed that he would slay Vālī. Thereupon the monkey described to Raghava the prowess of Vālī, and he feared lest Räma should not prove a match for Válī.

data.v: राघवः प्रत्ययार्थं तु दुन्दुभेः कायमुत्तमम् । पादाङ्गुष्ठेन चिक्षेप संपूर्णं दशयोजनम् ॥
data.es: The strongarmed Rama, who was endowed with great strength looked at the skeleton and smiled within himself for a while. He kicked off the skeleton with the great toe of his foot completely to a full distance of ten yojanas (eighty miles).
data.anv: महाबल: one endowed with strength, महाबाहु: strongarmed (Rama), अस्थि skeleton, प्रेक्ष्य having looked, उत्स्मयित्वा smiling at a depth for a while, पादाङ्गुष्ठेन with the great toe of the foot, सम्पूर्णं completely, दशयोजनम् to a distance of ten yojanas (eighty miles), चिक्षेप kicked off.
data.md: And with the view of convincing Raghava (as to Vali's might), Sugriva showed to him the huge corpse of Dundubhi, resembling a hill.

data.v: बिभेद च पुनः सालान्सप्तैकेन महेषुणा । गिरिं रसातलं चैव जनयन्प्रत्ययं तदा ॥
data.es: Again inorder to create confidence (in Sugriva), he released a single mighty shaft which penetrated seven palmyra trees, a mountain and the Rasatala.
data.anv: तथा then, पुनश्च again, प्रत्ययम् confidence, जनयन् creating, एकेन with one, महेषुणा mighty shaft, सप्त सालान् seven palmyra trees, गिरिम् a mountain, रसातलं चैव Rasatala (one of  the seven lower worlds under the earth), बिभेद penetrated.
data.md: With a single mighty shaft he pierced seven palmyra palms, a hill, and the sixth nether worlds, carrying conviction to Sugriva.

data.v: ततः प्रीतमनास्तेन विश्वस्तः स महाकपिः । किष्किन्धां रामसहितो जगाम च गुहां तदा ॥
data.es: Pleased with Rama's action and convinced of his prowess he left thereafter with Rama he left for Kishkindha which was like a cave.
data.anv: तत: thereafter, तेन by that act, प्रीतमना: well pleased, स महाकपि: that mighty monkey Sugriva, विश्वस्त: च was convinced, रामसहित: together with Rama, तदा then, गुहाम् a cave,  किष्किन्धाम् city of Kishkindha, जगाम approached.
data.md: Thus convinced, the mighty monkey well pleased went with Rāma towards the cave called Kiskindha.

data.v: ततोऽगर्जद्धरिवरः सुग्रीवो हेमपिङ्गलः । तेन नादेन महता निर्जगाम हरीश्वरः ॥
data.es: On entering the city of Kishkindha, Sugriva the best of monkeys of reddish yellow hue roared with a great voice. There upon Vali, the lord of monkeys came out (of the cave).
data.anv: तत: then, हरिवर: best of monkeys, हेमपिङ्गल: yellowish hued like gold, सुग्रीव: Sugriva, अगर्जत् roared, तेन महता with great, नादेन voice, हरीश्वर: lord of monkeys (Vali), निर्जगाम came out.
data.md: And having arrived there, that best of monkeys, Sugrīva of a tawny and golden hue, set up loud roars. And at those mighty sounds, out came the lord of monkeys; and having obtained Tārā's consent came before Sugrīva for battle. Then Rāghava killed Vālī on the spot with a single shaft.

data.v: ततः सुग्रीववचनाद्धत्वा वालिनमाहवे । सुग्रीवमेव तद्राज्ये राघवः प्रत्यपादयत् ॥
data.es: After he killed Vali in the combat in compliance with the words of Sugriva, Rama installed Sugriva as king.
data.anv: राघव: Rama, सुग्रीववचनात् in compliance with the words of Sugriva, वालिनम् Vali, आहवे in the battle, हत्वा having killed, तत: thereafter, तद्राज्ये in that kingdom of Vali, सुग्रीवमेव Sugriva itself, प्रत्यपादयत् proposed (installed).
data.md: And, in compliance with Sugrīva's request, having slain Vālī in battle, Raghava conferred the kingdom on Sugriva.

data.v: स च सर्वान्समानीय वानरान्वानरर्षभः । दिशः प्रस्थापयामास दिदृक्षुर्जनकात्मजाम् ॥
data.es: The best of monkeys (Sugriva) gathered his monkey forces and despatched them in various directions in search of Janaka's daughter (Sita).
data.anv: स: वानरर्षभ: च the best of monkeys, Sugriva, जनकात्मजाम् Janaka's daughter, Sita, दिदृक्षु: desirous of seeing, सर्वान् all, वानरान् monkey forces, समानीय after summoning, दिश: in various directions, प्रस्थापयामास despatched.
data.md: Then that best of monkeys having summoned all the various monkeys, sent them in various directions in search of Janaka's daughter.

data.v: ततो गृध्रस्य वचनात्संपातेर्हनुमान्बली । शतयोजनविस्तीर्णं पुप्लुवे लवणार्णवम् ॥
data.es: At the suggestion of the vulture, Sampathi mighty Hanuman leapt over the saltocean extending over a hundred yojanas.
data.anv: तत: thereafter, बली हनुमान् mighty Hanuman, सम्पाते: Sampathi's, गृध्रस्य vulture's, वचनात् in accordance with suggestion, शतयोजनविस्तीर्णम् extending over a hundred yojanas (about 800 miles), लवणार्णवम् saltsea, पुप्लुवे leapt over.
data.md: Then at the suggestion of the vulture Sampāti, the mighty Hanuman crossed the salt sea extending for a hundred Yojanas (900 miles).

data.v: तत्र लङ्कां समासाद्य पुरीं रावणपालिताम् । ददर्श सीतां ध्यायन्तीमशोकवनिकां गताम् ॥
data.es: Hanuman arrived at the city of Lanka ruled by Ravana and found Sita in the Ashoka garden meditating on Rama.
data.anv: रावणपालिताम् ruled by Ravana, लङ्काम् पुरीम् city of Lanka, समासाद्य having reached, तत्र there, अशोकवनिकाम् गताम् who had gone to Ashoka garden, ध्यायन्तीम् contemplating (on Rama), सीताम् Sita, ददर्श found.
data.md: Thereby arriving at the city of Lankā, ruled by Rāvana, he found Sītā in the midst of an Asoka garden, absorbed in thought.

data.v: निवेदयित्वाभिज्ञानं प्रवृत्तिं च निवेद्य च । समाश्वास्य च वैदेहीं मर्दयामास तोरणम् ॥
data.es: Hanuman delivered Rama's ring to Sita as a token of recognition, related the whole story and consoled her. He then crushed the arch (of the outer gate of the garden) before leaving.
data.anv: अभिज्ञानम् as token of recognition (Rama's ring), निवेदयित्वा having presented, प्रवृत्तिं च the entire account, निवेद्य च having related, वैदेहीम् daughter of the king of Videha with its capital at Mithila, Sita, समाश्वास्य having consoled, तोरणम् outer gate of the garden, मर्दयामास crushed.
data.md: Then having shown her the sign, he rtlated to her all about the friendship between Rāma and Sugrīva, and having convinced Videha's daughter, he smashed the gate of the place.

data.v: पञ्च सेनाग्रगान्हत्वा सप्त मन्त्रिसुतानपि । शूरमक्षं च निष्पिष्य ग्रहणं समुपागमत् ॥
data.es: After killing five commanders, seven sons of the counsellors, stamping out valiant Akshayakumara, the son of Ravana, Hanuman got himself captured (to be taken as captive).
data.anv: पञ्च सेनाग्रगान् five commanders, सप्त मन्त्रिसुतानपि seven sons of counsellors, हत्वा having killed, शूरम् valiant, अक्षं च Akshaya Kumara, son of Ravana, निष्पिष्य having stamped, ग्रहणम् समुपागमत् got caught, to be taken as captive.
data.md: Then having slain five generals, and seven counsellors' sons, and crushed the heroic Aksa, he was bound fast (by the arms of Indrajit.)

data.v: अस्त्रेणोन्मुहमात्मानं ज्ञात्वा पैतामहाद्वरात् । मर्षयन्राक्षसान्वीरो यन्त्रिणस्तान्यदृच्छया ॥
data.es: The heroic Hanuman came to know that he could be released from the entanglements of the weapon granted to him through a boon by Brahma. He allowed himself to be restrained by the rakshasas with the ropes for the sake of achieving his other objective of seeing Ravana. Thereafter, he burnt the whole of Lanka except the place where Sita was and returned to deliver the good news to Rama.
data.anv: वीर: mighty warrior, महाकपि: great monkey, Hanuman, पैतामहात् by Brahma's, वरात् boon, आत्मानम् his own self, अस्त्रेण by the weapon (given by Brahma), उन्मुक्तम् released, ज्ञात्वा coming to know, यदृच्छया casually (in the expectation of his another objective of seeing Ravana), यन्त्रिण: restrained by ropes, तान् राक्षसान् those rakshasas, मर्षयन् while enduring, तत: after completion of that act, मैथिलीम् सीतां ऋते except Sita (Mythili), लङ्कां पुरीम् the city of Lanka, दग्ध्वा having burnt, रामाय for Rama, प्रियम् welcome tidings, आख्यातुम् to deliver, पुन: आयात् returned again.
data.md: Then knowing that in virtue of the grandsire's boon, he was free, he forgave those Raksasas that were leading him (to Ravana.)

data.v: ततो दग्ध्वा पुरीं लङ्कामृते सीतां च मैथिलीम् । रामाय प्रियमाख्यातुं पुनरायान्महाकपिः ॥
data.es: The heroic Hanuman came to know that he could be released from the entanglements of the weapon granted to him through a boon by Brahma. He allowed himself to be restrained by the rakshasas with the ropes for the sake of achieving his other objective of seeing Ravana. Thereafter, he burnt the whole of Lanka except the place where Sita was and returned to deliver the good news to Rama.
data.anv: वीर: mighty warrior, महाकपि: great monkey, Hanuman, पैतामहात् by Brahma's, वरात् boon, आत्मानम् his own self, अस्त्रेण by the weapon (given by Brahma), उन्मुक्तम् released, ज्ञात्वा coming to know, यदृच्छया casually (in the expectation of his another objective of seeing Ravana), यन्त्रिण: restrained by ropes, तान् राक्षसान् those rakshasas, मर्षयन् while enduring, तत: after completion of that act, मैथिलीम् सीतां ऋते except Sita (Mythili), लङ्कां पुरीम् the city of Lanka, दग्ध्वा having burnt, रामाय for Rama, प्रियम् welcome tidings, आख्यातुम् to deliver, पुन: आयात् returned again.
data.md: Then having burnt down the city of Lankā, with the exception of the place occupied by Mithila's daughter, the mighty one returned, with the intention of delivering the glad tidings to Rama.

data.v: सोऽभिगम्य महात्मानं कृत्वा रामं प्रदक्षिणम् । न्यवेदयदमेयात्मा दृष्टा सीतेति तत्त्वतः ॥
data.es: Reaching Rama the great Hanuman gifted with boundless intellect circumambulated him and infact informed him that he had seen Sita.
data.anv: अमेयात्मा possessing boundless intellect, स: he (Hanuman), महात्मानम् highly courageous, रामम् Rama, अधिगम्य having reached, प्रदक्षिणम् circumambulation, कृत्वा having made, दृष्टा seen, सीता Sita, इति in this manner, तत्त्वत: truthfully, न्यवेदयत् informed.
data.md: That one of immeasurable soul having come before the high-souled Rāma, and circled him addressed him, saying,— I have truly seen Sītā.

data.v: ततः सुग्रीवसहितो गत्वा तीरं महोदधेः । समुद्रं क्षोभयामास शरैरादित्यसंनिभैः ॥
data.es: Thereafter, Rama reached the shore of the ocean together with Sugriva and saw the ocean agitated with shafts burning like the Sun.
data.anv: तत: thereafter, सुग्रीवसहित: together with Sugriva, महोदधे: तीरम् shore of mighty ocean, गत्वा having reached, आदित्यसन्निभै: resembling sharp and hot rays of sun, शरै: with shafts, समुद्रम् Samudra, lord of the waters, क्षोभयामास agitated.
data.md: Thereafter accompanied by Sugrīva, Rāma repaired to the shore of the mighty ocean, and with shafts resembling the sun, vexed the deep.

data.v: दर्शयामास चात्मानं समुद्रः सरितां पतिः । समुद्रवचनाच्चैव नलं सेतुमकारयत् ॥
data.es: Samudra, lord of rivers, (afraid of Rama's anger) and having appeared in his own form, and on his advice got a bridge built with the help of Nala.
data.anv: सरितां पति: lord of rivers, समुद्र: Samudra, आत्मानम् in his own form, दर्शयामास appeared (to Rama), समुद्रवचनात् च एव on the advice of Samudra , नलम् through Nala, सेतुम् a bridge, अकारयत् got it built.
data.md: Then that lord of rivers, the Ocean, showed himself. And agreeably to the advice of the Ocean, Nala constructed a bridge (over the water.)

data.v: तेन गत्वा पुरीं लङ्कां हत्वा रावणमाहवे । अभ्यषिञ्चत्स लङ्कायां राक्षसेन्द्रं विभीषणम् ॥
data.es: Rama entered the city of Lanka by means of that bridge, killed Ravana in the battle and recovered Sita. Thereafter he felt greatly embarassed (for accepting his wife who had stayed in an others.
data.anv: राम: Rama, तेन through that bridge, लङ्कापुरीं city of Lanka, गत्वा having reached, आहवे in the battle, रावणम् Ravana, हत्वा after slaying, सीताम् Sita, प्राप्य having recovered, अनु thereafter, पराम् great, व्रीडाम् embarassment, उपागमत् experienced (pursuant to her stay in others' house for a long time).

data.v: कर्मणा तेन महता त्रैलोक्यं सचराचरम् । सदेवर्षिगणं तुष्टं राघवस्य महात्मनः ॥
data.es: All the animate and inanimate beings, gods and sages in the three worlds were very pleased at this noble deed of the great Rama.
data.anv: महात्मन: of highly courageous, राघवस्य Rama's, तेन महता कर्मणा by that great act, सचराचरम् all the animate and inanimate beings, सदेवर्षिगणम् including  groups of gods and sages, त्रैलोक्यम् in three worlds, तुष्टम् wellpleased.
data.md: Thereupon assured by Agni as to the sinlessness of Sītā, Rāma became exceedingly pleased, and was honoured by all the deities. And at that great act of Rāma's the three worlds with all that was mobile and immobile in them, along with the sages and gods, were well pleased with the mighty-souled Rāghava.

data.v: तथा परमसंतुष्टैः पूजितः सर्वदैवतैः । कृतकृत्यस्तदा रामो विज्वरः प्रमुमोद ह ॥
data.es: After coronating the rakshasa chief Vibhishana in the city of Lanka, Rama free from distress, exceedingly rejoiced after having accomplished his objective.
data.anv: राम: Rama, विभीषणम् Vibhisana, राक्षसेन्द्रम् king of rakshasas, लङ्कायाम् in the city of Lanka, अभिषिच्य coronated, तदा then, कृतकृत्य: having accomplished his objective, विज्वर: free from distress, प्रमुमोद ह was exceedingly rejoiced.
data.md: Then installing that foremost of Rākşasas, Vibhișana, on the throne of Lankā, Rāma was perfectly easy, and rejoiced exceedingly.

data.v: देवताभ्यो वरान्प्राप्य समुत्थाप्य च वानरान् । पुष्पकं तत्समारुह्य नन्दिग्रामं ययौ तदा ॥
data.es: Having obtained a boon from the devatas (who had come to see him) Rama, revived all monkeys (fallen in the battle) and set out for Ayodhya accompanied by friends in the pushpaka (aerial car).
data.anv: राम: Rama, देवताभ्य: from devatas, वरम् boon, प्राप्य having obtained, वानरान् monkeys fallen in the battle, समुत्थाप्य च revived, सुहृद्वृत: accompanied by friends, पुष्पकेण by  Pushpaka, the aerial car, अयोध्याम् Ayodhya, प्रस्थित: set out.

data.v: नन्दिग्रामे जटां हित्वा भ्रातृभिः सहितोऽनघः । रामः सीतामनुप्राप्य राज्यं पुनरवाप्तवान् ॥
data.es: At Nandigrama sinless Rama arrived, met his brothers. They shed their matted locks. With Sita restored he regained his kingdom.
data.anv: अनघ: sinless, राम: Rama, नन्दिग्रामे in Nandigrama, भ्रातृभि: सहित: along with his brothers, जटाम् matted lock, हित्वा shedding, सीताम् Sita, अनुप्राप्य having regained, राज्यम् kingdom, पुन: again, अवाप्तवान् got (back).
data.md: Having arrived at Nandigrāma, the sinless Rāma sheared himself of his matted locks along with his brothers, and having regained Sītā, got back his kingdom

data.v: प्रहृष्टमुदितो लोकस्तुष्टः पुष्टः सुधार्मिकः । निरायमो अरोगश्च दुर्भिक्षभयवर्जितः ॥
data.es: The entire world rejoiced with happiness with their desire fulfilled they were content. All people were following the path of righteousness. There was no fear of sufferings or agonies, diseases or famine.
data.anv: लोक: entire world, प्रहृष्टमुदित: rejoiced with happiness, तुष्ट: contended (because of fulfillment of their desire), पुष्ट: grown in strength because of happiness,  सुधार्मिक: with righteousness, निरामय: without sufferings or agonies, अरोग: without diseases,  दुर्भिक्षभयवर्जित: च and without fear of  famine.
data.md: (During his reign) his subjects will enjoy happiness, and contentment, and become hale, and grow in righteousness, and be devoid of mental disquietude and disease, and free from the fear of famine.

data.v: न पुत्रमरणं केचिद्द्रक्ष्यन्ति पुरुषाः क्वचित् । नार्यश्चाविधवा नित्यं भविष्यन्ति पतिव्रताः ॥
data.es: During the period of Rama's rule, no where would men witness the death of their sons or women widowed. They would ever remain chaste and devoted to their husbands.
data.anv: पुरुषा: men, क्वचित् any where, किञ्चित् even little, पुत्रमरणम् death of ones's own son, न द्रक्ष्यन्ति will not see, नार्यश्च women, अविधवा: will not be widowed, नित्यम् always, पतिव्रता: भविष्यन्ति will be devoted to their husbands.
data.md: Where a no person is to witness his son's death, and women will be ever chaste, and never bear widow-hood.

data.v: न वातजं भयं किंचिन्नाप्सु मज्जन्ति जन्तवः । न चाग्रिजं भयं किंचिद्यथा कृतयुगे तथा ॥
data.es: There (in the kingdom of Rama) was no fear of fire, water, wind, disease, hunger and also theft.
data.anv: तत्र in that kingdom of Rama, अग्निजं भयम् fear due to fire, किञ्चित् न not even little, जन्तव: creatures, अप्सु in water, न मज्जन्ति will not be drowned, वातजं भयम् danger due to wind, किञ्चित् न not even little, तथा and, ज्वरकृतम् अपि न also no fear from fever, न क्षुद्भयम् अपि no fear from hunger, तथा and, तस्करभयं न no fear from thieves.

data.v: अश्वमेधशतैरिष्ट्वा तथा बहुसुवर्णकैः । गवां कोट्ययुतं दत्त्वा विद्वद्भ्यो विधिपूर्वकम् ॥
data.es: Highly renowned Rama, having satisfied the gods with the performance of a hundred of aswamedhas and many suvarnakas bestowing hundreds of thousands of cows and immense wealth on the brahmins, will return to Brahmaloka.
data.anv: महायशा: highly renowned, अश्वमेधशतै: by hundreds of Aswamedha sacrifices, तथा and  बहुसुवर्णकै: Bahusuvarnaka sacrifices (where gold is given as charity on large scale),  इष्ट्वा satisfying the gods, गवाम् cows, कोट्ययुतम् hundreds of thousands, दत्वा having bestowed, असंख्येयम् countless, धनम् wealth, ब्राह्मणेभ्य: for brahmins, दत्वा having bestowed, ब्रह्मलोकं प्रयास्यति will proceed to Brahmaloka.

data.v: राजवंशाञ्शतगुणान्स्थापयिष्यति राघवः । चातुर्वर्ण्यं च लोकेऽस्मिन्स्वे स्वे धर्मे नियोक्ष्यति ॥
data.es: Rama will establish hundredfold royal dynasties and employ the four castes to do their respective duties, in this world.
data.anv: राघव: Rama, अस्मिन् लोके in this world, शतगुणान् hundred times, राजवंशान् royal dynasties, स्थापयिष्यति will establish, चातुर्वर्ण्यम् four castes, स्वे स्वे in their respective, धर्मे duties, नियोक्ष्यति will employ.

data.v: दशवर्षसहस्राणि दशवर्षशतानि च । रामो राज्यमुपासित्वा ब्रह्मलोकं गमिष्यति ॥
data.es: Rama, reigning the kingdom for eleven thousand years, will attain Brahmaloka.
data.anv: राम: Rama, दशवर्षसहस्राणि for ten thousand years, दशवर्षशतानि च ten hundred years, राज्यम् kingdom, उपासित्वा reigning, ब्रह्मलोकम् Brahmaloka, प्रयास्यति will attain.
data.md: And having reigned for ten thousand and as many hundred years. Rāma will depart for the regions of Brahmā.

data.v: इदं पवित्रं पापघ्नं पुण्यं वेदैश्च संमितम् । यः पठेद्रामचरितं सर्वपापैः प्रमुच्यते ॥
data.es: This story of Rama is sacred and holy. It destroys sins and is equal to the Vedas. Whosoever reads it will be freed from all sins.
data.anv: इदं रामचरितम् this story of Rama, पवित्रम् sacred, पापघ्नम् destroyer of sins, पुण्यम् auspicious, वेदै: by vedas, सम्मितं च equal to, य: who, पठेत् reads, सर्वपापै: from all sins, प्रमुच्यते will be released.
data.md: He that reads this sacred, sin-destroying, merit-bestowing history of Rāma like that of the Veda itself, becomes cleansed from all sin.

data.v: एतदाख्यानमायुष्यं पठन्रामायणं नरः । सपुत्रपौत्रः सगणः प्रेत्य स्वर्गे महीयते ॥
data.es: This story of Ramayana enhances longevity of those who read it and recite it. They will be worshipped in heavens after their death along with their sons and grandsons, servants and relations.
data.anv: एतद् रामायणम् this Ramayana, आख्यानम् true meaning, आयुष्यम् longevity, पठन् reading, नर: men, सपुत्रपौत्र: with sons and grandsons, सगण: with servants and relations, प्रेत्य after death, स्वर्गे in heavens, महीयते worshipped.
data.md: And the man that reads this Rāmāyaṇa conferring length of days, after death, is on honoured in heaven, along with his sons, and grandsons, and relations.

data.v: पठन्द्विजो वागृषभत्वमीया;त्स्यात्क्षत्रियो भूमिपतित्वमीयात् । वणिग्जनः पण्यफलत्वमीया;ज्जनश्च शूद्रोऽपि महत्त्वमीयात् ॥
data.es: A brahmin becomes proficient in the eighteen branches of learning a kshatriya gets lordship over landed possessions a vaisya gets the fruits of his business and sudra also attains greatness by reading Ramayana". इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये बालकाण्डे (श्रीमद्रामायणकथासङ्क्षेपो नाम) प्रथम: सर्ग:॥ Thus ends the first sarga of Balakanda of the holy Ramayana in synopsis of the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.
data.anv: पठन् जन: People by  reading this, द्विज: स्यात् if he is a brahmin, वागृषभत्वम् proficient in the eighteen branches of learning, ईयात् attains, क्षत्रिय: kshatriya, भूमिपतित्वम् lordship over landed possessions, ईयात् gets, वणिग्जनः vaisya, पण्यफलत्वम् fruits of his merit, ईयात् gets, जनश्च men, शूद्रोऽपि sudra also, महत्वम् greatness, ईयात् attains.
data.md: If a Brāhmaṇa reads it, he attains excellence in speech; if a Kșatriya, he will acquire lordship over landed possessions, if a Vaisya, abundance of wealth in trade; and if a Sudra, greatness.

data.v: नारदस्य तु तद्वाक्यं श्रुत्वा वाक्यविशारदः । पूजयामास धर्मात्मा सहशिष्यो महामुनिः ॥
data.es: On hearing the words of Narada the distinguished and righteous sage Valmiki, proficient in composing slokas worshipped him along with his disciples.
data.anv: नारदस्य Narada's, तत् वाक्यम् those words, श्रुत्वा तु having heard, वाक्यविशारद: proficient in (shastras which are in the form of) speech, धर्मात्मा righteous, महामुनि: distinguished sage, सहशिष्य: along with his disciples, पूजयामास worshipped (praised) him.
data.md: Hearing those words of Nārada, that one of virtuous soul, skilled in speech, together with his disciples, worshipped that great sage.

data.v: यथावत्पूजितस्तेन देवर्षिर्नारदस्तदा । आपृष्ट्वैवाभ्यनुज्ञातः स जगाम विहायसम् ॥
data.es: The divine sage Narada after having been worshipped by Valmiki in a befitting manner sought his leave and went to heaven.
data.anv: देवर्षि: divine sage, स: नारद: Narada, तेन by him, तथा in that way, यथावत् in a fitting manner, पूजित: having been worshipped, आपृष्ट्वैव having taken leave of him, अभ्यनुज्ञात: having been permitted, विहायसम् to heaven, जगाम went.
data.md: Having received due honours, that Devarși Nārada taking leave of him went to his ethereal regions.

data.v: स मुहूर्तं गते तस्मिन्देवलोकं मुनिस्तदा । जगाम तमसातीरं जाह्नव्यास्त्वविदूरतः ॥
data.es: After Narada had gone to devaloka, sage Valmiki reached the bank of river Tamasa which is not very far from the Ganges for morning ablutions.
data.anv: तस्मिन् when Narada, मुहूर्तम् instantly, देवलोकम् devaloka, गते having gone, तदा then, मुनि: sage Valmiki, जाह्नव्या: of river Ganges, अविदूरत: not very far from, तमसातीरम् bank of the river Tamasa, जगाम went.
data.md: And when Nārada had left for the celestial regions, that holy person went to the banks of the Tamasā not very far from Jāhnavī.

data.v: स तु तीरं समासाद्य तमसाया महामुनिः । शिष्यमाह स्थितं पार्श्वे दृष्ट्वा तीर्थमकर्दमम् ॥
data.es: The eminent sage Valmiki reached the bank of Tamasa and seen a descent into the river with pellucid waters, spoke to the disciple standing by the side.
data.anv: स: that, महामुनि: eminent sage, तमसाया: तीरम् the bank of the river Tamasa, समासाद्य  having reached, अकर्दमम् free from mud (pure and clear), तीर्थम् descent into the river दृष्ट्वा having seen, पार्श्वे by the side of, स्थितम् standing, शिष्यम् to the disciple, आह spoke.
data.md: And having arrived at the banks of that river, the pious one, observing a holy spot devoid of mud, spoke to his disciple standing by.

data.v: अकर्दममिदं तीर्थं भरद्वाज निशामय । रमणीयं प्रसन्नाम्बु सन्मनुष्यमनो यथा ॥
data.es: "O Bharadwaja, behold the beautiful and pleasant waters of this river. This holy spot is as clear and pure as the mind of a virtuous man.
data.anv: भरद्वाज: O Bharadwaja, सन्मनुष्यमन: यथा like the mind of a virtuous man, अकर्दमम् clear and pure (without sin), प्रसन्नाम्बु pleasing waters, रमणीयम् beautiful, इदम् this, तीर्थम् holy spot, निशामय behold.
data.md: Saying-O Bharadvāja, behold this holy spot devoid of mud. And it is beautiful, and contains pleasant waters, even like the minds of good men.

data.v: न्यस्यतां कलशस्तात दीयतां वल्कलं मम । इदमेवावगाहिष्ये तमसातीर्थमुत्तमम् ॥
data.es: O dear one Put down the pitcher on the ground. Give me my garment. I shall take a dip in Tamasa, the holiest of places".
data.anv: तात O Dear, कलश: waterpitcher, न्यस्यताम् be placed on the ground, मम my, वल्कलम् bark garment, दीयताम् be given, उत्तमम् best (of holy spots), इदम् this, तमसातीर्थमेव spot on the bank of river Tamasa, अवगाहिष्ये I will enter.
data.md: O child, do you, put down your pitcher, and give me my bark. I will bathe even in this Tamasā, the best of holy spots.

data.v: एवमुक्तो भरद्वाजो वाल्मीकेन महात्मना । प्रायच्छत मुनेस्तस्य वल्कलं नियतो गुरोः ॥
data.es: Asked thus by the nobleminded master Valmiki, Bharadwaja, ever obedient to his spiritual master, gave the sage the bark garment.
data.anv: महात्मना by the nobleminded, वाल्मीकेन by Valmiki, एवम् in this way, उक्त: having been asked, गुरो: of the spiritual master, नियत: obedient, भरद्वाज: Bharadwaja, तस्य मुने: for that sage Valmiki, वल्कलम् bark garment, प्रायच्छत gave.
data.md: Thus accosted by the high-souled Vālmīki, Bharadvāja ever intent upon serving his spiritual guide, presented the sage his bark.

data.v: स शिष्यहस्तादादाय वल्कलं नियतेन्द्रियः । विचचार ह पश्यंस्तत्सर्वतो विपुलं वनम् ॥
data.es: Valmiki who had his senses under his command received the barkgarment from the hands of his disciple and wandered about in that extensive forest, looking all around.
data.anv: नियतेन्द्रिय: possessing fully restrained senses, स: Valmiki, शिष्यहस्तात् from the hands of his disciple, वल्कलम् bark garment, आदाय having received, विपुलम् extensive, तत् वनम् that forest, सर्वत: all around, पश्यन् looking, विचचार ह wandered.
data.md: That one of subdued senses, having received his bark from his disciple, began to range around, surveying that extensive forest.

data.v: तस्याभ्याशे तु मिथुनं चरन्तमनपायिनम् । ददर्श भगवांस्तत्र क्रौञ्चयोश्चारुनिस्वनम् ॥
data.es: Sage Valmiki espied a pair of melodious kraunchas. Flying about in each other's in separable company there in its vicinity.
data.anv: भगवान् the revered one, तत्र in that forest, तस्य of that holy spot, अभ्याशे in the vicinity, अनपायिनम् without being separated from each other even for a moment, चरन्तम् ranging through the forest, चारुनिस्वनम् melodiousvoiced, क्रौञ्चयो: krauncha birds, मिथुनम् pair of, ददर्श espied.
data.md: In the vicinity of the forest, that worshipful one espied a pair of Krauñcas, emitting melodious notes, and ranging around never parting from one another.

data.v: तस्मात्तु मिथुनादेकं पुमांसं पापनिश्चयः । जघान वैरनिलयो निषादस्तस्य पश्यतः ॥
data.es: A sinful and cruelhearted hunter struck down the male bird of the pair in his very presence.
data.anv: पापनिश्चय: of sinful intent, वैरनिलय: full of cruelty, निषाद: a hunter, तस्मात् मिथुनात् from that pair, एकं पुमांसं तु one male bird, तस्य पश्यत: neglecting his very presence, जघान killed.
data.md: At this juncture, a wicked-minded fowler, singling out the male, without any cause of hostility, slew him in the very presence of the holy man.

data.v: तं शोणितपरीताङ्गं वेष्टमानं महीतले । भार्या तु निहतं दृष्ट्वा रुराव करुणां गिरम् ॥
data.es: The female companion saw the male bird struck down by the hunter and rolling on the earth, drenched in blood. Separated from her winged comparion with coppercrested head intoxicated with her love, the female companion lifted a piteous wail.
data.anv: पतिना by her husband, सहचारिणा by the constant companion, ताम्रशीर्षेण with coppercrested head, मत्तेन with the one intoxicated by love, पत्रिणा by one possessing wings, सहितेन united, तेन द्विजेन from that male companion, वियुक्ता got separated, भार्या तु the female companion, निहतम् having been struck down, महीतले on the earth, वेष्टमानम् rolling (in blood), शोणितपरीताङ्गम् body drenched in blood, तम् that male bird, दृष्ट्वा having seen, करुणाम् causing pity, गिरम् words, रुराव uttered (wailed).
data.md: Observing him struggling on the earth, bathed in blood, his female companion began to bewail in piteous accents.

data.v: तथा तु तं द्विजं दृष्ट्वा निषादेन निपातितम् । ऋषेर्धर्मात्मनस्तस्य कारुण्यं समपद्यत ॥
data.es: Then, having seen the bird struck down by the fowler, the pious sage Valmiki was filled with compassion.
data.anv: तदा then, निषादेन by the fowler, निपातितम् struck down, तं that, द्विजम् bird, दृष्ट्वा having seen, धर्मात्मन: of the righteousminded, तस्य ऋषे: of that sage, कारुण्यम् compassion, समपद्यत filled.
data.md: Finding the bird in that condition thus brought down by the fowler, the pity of that pious and righteous-souled Rși was excited exceedingly.

data.v: ततः करुणवेदित्वादधर्मोऽयमिति द्विजः । निशाम्य रुदतीं क्रौञ्चीमिदं वचनमब्रवीत् ॥
data.es: Having heard the wailing of the female bird, the sage (Valmiki) moved to pity at this irreligious act uttered the following words.
data.anv: तत: then, द्विज: sage Valmiki, रुदतीम् wailing, क्रौञ्चीम् female bird, निशाम्य having heard, करुणवेदित्वात् moved to compassion, अयम् this act of slaying during mating time, अधर्म: unrighteous act, इति thus,  इदम् वचनम् these words, अब्रवीत् uttered.
data.md: Then considering it to be an unrighteous deed, with a heart moved with pity, that twice-born one, beholding the weeping Krauñci, spoke these words.

data.v: मा निषाद प्रतिष्ठां त्वमगमः शाश्वतीः समाः । यत्क्रौञ्चमिथुनादेकमवधीः काममोहितम् ॥
data.es: "O fowler, since you have killed one of the pair of infatuated kraunchas you will be permanently deprived of your position".
data.anv: निषाद O Fowler, त्वम् you, यत् for which reason, क्रौञ्चमिथुनात् from the pair of krauncha birds, काममोहितम् when they were infatuated by love, एकम् one, अवधी: have killed, (तत् for that reason), शाश्वती: permanently, समा: for long years, प्रतिष्ठां glorious, मा गम: you will never get.
data.md: O fowler, since you have slain one of a pair of Krauñcas, you shall never attain prosperity (respect)!

data.v: तस्यैवं ब्रुवतश्चिन्ता बभूव हृदि वीक्षतः । शोकार्तेनास्य शकुनेः किमिदं व्याहृतं मया ॥
data.es: Brooding over his utterances, he reflected, 'What is this that I uttered in reaction to the grief of this bird?'
data.anv: एवम् in this manner, ब्रुवत: having uttered, वीक्षत: reflecting, तस्य हृदि in his heart, अस्य शकुने: शोकार्तेन distressed by the grief of this bird, मया व्याहृतम् uttered by me, इदम् these words, किम् what?, चिन्ता बभूव a thought arose.
data.md: Having uttered this, he got worried within himself, What is this that I have said, afflicted with grief for the bird?

data.v: चिन्तयन्स महाप्राज्ञश्चकार मतिमान्मतिम् । शिष्यं चैवाब्रवीद्वाक्यमिदं स मुनिपुंगवः ॥
data.es: Very wise and learned, he (Valmiki), preeminent among sages, pondered over it (for a while) and spoke these words to his disciple.
data.anv: महाप्राज्ञ: highly learned, मतिमान् wise, स: Valmiki, मतिं चकार thought, स: मुनिपुङ्गव: that  preeminent one among sages, चिन्तयन् pondering,शिष्यम् addressing his disciple, इदम् this, वाक्यम् statement, अब्रवीत् च and said.
data.md: Resolving thus in his mind, that highly-wise one and best of sages addressed his disciple, saying.

data.v: पादबद्धोऽक्षरसमस्तन्त्रीलयसमन्वितः । शोकार्तस्य प्रवृत्तो मे श्लोको भवतु नान्यथा ॥
data.es: "Occasioned by the griefstricken (state of the bird) and composed in rhymed lines each of equal number of syllables tuned to the accompaniment of stringed instruments, let it be known as a sloka and not by any other name".
data.anv: मे for me, शोकार्तस्य born out of sorrow (of slain bird), प्रवृत्त: came out without effort, पादबद्ध: consisting of four lines, अक्षरसम: each of equal number of syllables, तन्त्रीलयसमन्वित: with rhythm tuned to the accompaniment of stringed instruments, श्लोक: sloka, भवतु let it take a form, अन्यथा न not otherwise.
data.md: This speech that I have uttered is of equal bound with metre and accents; it has rhythm and is capable of being chanted according to measure to stringed accompaniment. Let it therefore go forth as a sloka!

data.v: शिष्यस्तु तस्य ब्रुवतो मुनेर्वाक्यमनुत्तमम् । प्रतिजग्राह संहृष्टस्तस्य तुष्टोऽभवद्गुरुः ॥
data.es: His disciple, delighted by the excellent verse composed by the sage, committed it to memory which left his spiritual preceptor pleased.
data.anv: शिष्यस्तु his disciple on his part, ब्रुवत: when words were spoken in this manner, तस्य मुने: that sage's, अनुत्तमम् excellent, वाक्यम् statement (verse), प्रतिजग्राह received (committed to memory), सन्हृष्ट: well pleased, गुरु: spiritual preceptor, तस्य in the matter of his disciple, तुष्ट: अभवत् was gratified.
data.md: When the sage had spoken thus, his disciple, well pleased, assented to his excellent speech; and thereat that pious person was gratified.

data.v: सोऽभिषेकं ततः कृत्वा तीर्थे तस्मिन्यथाविधि । तमेव चिन्तयन्नर्थमुपावर्तत वै मुनिः ॥
data.es: After having performed his ablution at that holy spot according to the prescribed ritual, the sage (Valmiki) returned (to his hermitage), pondering over the matter.
data.anv: तत: thereafter, स: मुनि: Valmiki maharshi, तस्मिन् तीर्थे at that holy spot, यथाविधि according to the prescribed ritual, अभिषेकम् bathing, कृत्वा having performed, तम् that, अर्थमेव the matter itself, चिन्तयन् pondering over, उपावर्तत वै returned (to his hermitage).
data.md: Then having duly performed his ablutions at that holy spot, the reverend sage retraced his steps, pondering over the incidents touching the sloka.

data.v: भरद्वाजस्ततः शिष्यो विनीतः श्रुतवान्गुरोः । कलशं पूर्णमादाय पृष्ठतोऽनुजगाम ह ॥
data.es: Then saint Bharadwaja, his disciple humble and learned in scriptures, followed him with a pitcher full (of water).
data.anv: तत: then, शिष्य: disciple, विनीत: humble, श्रुतवान् learned in scriptures, मुनि: saint, भरद्वाज: Bharadwaja, पूर्णम् filled with water, कलशम् waterpitcher, आदाय having received (carrying), पृष्ठत: behind him, अनुजगाम ह followed.
data.md: His disciple also, accomplished in learning, and of meek demeanour, followed Vālmīki, carrying on his back a pitcher filled with water.

data.v: स प्रविश्याश्रमपदं शिष्येण सह धर्मवित् । उपविष्टः कथाश्चान्याश्चकार ध्यानमास्थितः ॥
data.es: Valmiki who knows dharma entered the hermitage along with his disciple and sat in meditation and composed other stories.
data.anv: धर्मवित् knower of righteousness, स: Valmiki, शिष्येण सह with his disciples, आश्रमपदम् the hermitage, प्रविश्य having entered, ध्यानम् आस्थित: meditating on the incident, उपविष्ट: sitting, अन्या: other, कथा: stories, चकार composed.
data.md: Having entered the hermitage along with his disciple, conversant with righteousness engaged in diverse kinds of talk, revolved in his mind the circumstances connected with the verses.

data.v: आजगाम ततो ब्रह्मा लोककर्ता स्वयं प्रभुः । चतुर्मुखो महातेजा द्रष्टुं तं मुनिपुंगवम् ॥
data.es: At that moment, the effulgent, fourfaced Brahma, creator and lord of the world, himself, desirous of seeing him (Valmiki), the best among sages, arrived.
data.anv: तत: at that moment, लोककर्ता creator of the world, प्रभु: lord of the world, चतुर्मुख: fourfaced, महातेजा: effulgent, ब्रह्मा Brahma, मुनिपुङ्गवम् best among sages, तम् that Valmiki, द्रष्टुम् desirous of seeing, स्वयम् himself, आजगाम arrived.
data.md: It came to pass that desirous of seeing the best of sages, there arrived, that lord and creator of all, the effulgent Brahmā, furnished with four countenances.

data.v: वाल्मीकिरथ तं दृष्ट्वा सहसोत्थाय वाग्यतः । प्राञ्जलिः प्रयतो भूत्वा तस्थौ परमविस्मितः ॥
data.es: Greatly surprised to see him, Valmiki, purified by austerities and disciplined in speech, immediately got up and with folded palms stood before him.
data.anv: अथ thereafter, प्रयत: purified by austerities, वाल्मीकि: Valmiki, तम् him, दृष्ट्वा having seen, परमविस्मित: was greatly amazed, सहसा immediately, उत्थाय got up, वाग्यत: disciplined in speech, प्राञ्जलि: भूत्वा with folded palms, तस्थौ stood.
data.md: Beholding him Vālmīki rose up suddenly and, wondering greatly, humbly and silently stood before him with clasped hands.

data.v: पूजयामास तं देवं पाद्यार्घ्यासनवन्दनैः । प्रणम्य विधिवच्चैनं पृष्ट्वानामयमव्ययम् ॥
data.es: Bowing with reverence as enjoined by tradition and having enquired of his well being, Valmiki worshipped the immutable Brahma by falling at his feet and welcoming him with a seat and water to wash his feet with.
data.anv: तम् एनं देवम् that god, विधिवत् as enjoined by tradition, प्रणम्य bowing with profound reverence, अव्ययम् immutable (Brahma), अनामयं च welfare, पृष्ट्वा having enquired, पाद्यार्घ्यासनवन्दनै: fell at his feet with respectable offerings of reception, a befitting seat, and water for washing feet, पूजयामास worshipped.
data.md: And duly bending low in reverence, Vālmīki offered that deity water to wash his feet, and other things for reception.

data.v: अथोपविश्य भगवानासने परमार्चिते । वाल्मीकये महर्षये संदिदेशासनं ततः ॥
data.es: Lord Brahma sat down on a highly worshipful seat and showed a seat for the ascetic Valmiki to be seated.
data.anv: अथ thereafter, भगवान् the omnipotent Brahma, परमार्चिते highly worshipful, आसने seat, उपविश्य sat down, ततः from there, महर्षये to ascetic, वाल्मीकये for Valmiki, आसनम् seat, सन्दिदेश showed.
data.md: Having sat-down on a highly-honoured seat, that worshipful one enquired after the welfare of that sage Vālmīki knowing no deterioration, and then asked him to be seated.

data.v: उपविष्टे तदा तस्मिन्साक्षाल्लोकपितामहे । तद्गतेनैव मनसा वाल्मीकिर्ध्यानमास्थितः ॥
data.es: Having been ordered by Brahma, he also sat down on a seat. Although seated in the presence of the lord of the worlds, he was absorbed in the thought of events (leading to the death of the krauncha ).
data.anv: स: अपि he (Valmiki) also, ब्रह्मणा by lord Brahma, समनुज्ञात: having been asked, आसने in the seat, उपाविशत् sat down, तदा then, तस्मिन् सर्वलोकपितामहे when that lord Brahma, the grandsire of the worlds, (साक्षात् in the presence), उपविष्टे having been seated, वाल्मीकि: Valmiki, तद्गतेन एव set only on events (leading to the death of the krauncha bird), मनसा by his mind, ध्यानम् thoughts, आस्थित: was absorbed.

data.v: पापात्मना कृतं कष्टं वैरग्रहणबुद्धिना । यस्तादृशं चारुरवं क्रौञ्चं हन्यादकारणात् ॥
data.es: The hunter killed the sweetvoiced krauncha without any cause. That sinfulminded one with hostile feeling of capturing it, had perpetrated this cruel act, he thought.
data.anv: य: that hunter, तादृशम् such, चारुरवम् sweet voiced, क्रौञ्चम् krauncha bird, अकारणात् without cause, हन्यात् killed, वैरग्रहणबुद्धिना with hostile feeling of capturing it, पापात्मना sinful minded, कष्टं(कर्म) act, कृतम् was done.

data.v: शोचन्नेव मुहुः क्रौञ्चीमुपश्लोकमिमं पुनः । जगावन्तर्गतमना भूत्वा शोकपरायणः ॥
data.es: Griefstricken, Valmiki having become introspective and lamenting the plight of the female krauncha again and again, recited this sloka.
data.anv: शोकपरायण: engrossed in grief, अन्तर्गतमना: भूत्वा having been introspective, मुहु: again and again, क्रौञ्चीम् एव about female krauncha bird, शोचन् lamenting, पुन: again, इमम् श्लोकम् this sloka, जगौ recited.

data.v: तमुवाच ततो ब्रह्मा प्रहसन्मुनिपुंगवम् । श्लोक एव त्वया बद्धो नात्र कार्या विचारणा ॥
data.es: Thereafter lord Brahma smilingly addressed Valmiki, the preeminent among sages, saying, "You have indeed composed a sloka.There is no doubt about it".
data.anv: तत: then, ब्रह्मा lord Brahma, प्रहसन् smiling, तं मुनिपुङ्गवम् addressing that preeminent among sages, उवाच spoke, त्वया by you, बद्ध: composed, श्लोक: एव sloka indeed, अत्र in this aspect, विचारणा doubt, न कार्या need not be entertained.
data.md: Then smiling, Brahmā spoke to the excellent sage,-Those verses of your which you have composed a sloka shall attain celebrity: no doubt need be entertained on this head, It is because I had intended so, that those verses had come out of your lips.

data.v: मच्छन्दादेव ते ब्रह्मन्प्रवृत्तेयं सरस्वती । रामस्य चरितं सर्वं कुरु त्वमृषिसत्तम ॥
data.es: "OBrahmarshi, at my will, this speech had originated from you. Most excellent ascetic, compose the history of Rama in its entirety (in this metre).
data.anv: ब्रह्मन् OBrahmarshi, ते इयम् your this, सरस्वती speech, मच्छन्दादेव at my will, प्रवृत्ता originated, ऋषिसत्तम O most excellent ascetic, रामस्य Rama's, चरितम् history, सर्वम् in entirety, त्वम् you, कुरु compose.

data.v: धर्मात्मनो गुणवतो लोके रामस्य धीमतः । वृत्तं कथय धीरस्य यथा ते नारदाच्छ्रुतम् ॥
data.es: Narrate the history of Rama who is renowned for righteousness, virtues, wisdom and steadfastness in the manner you have heard it from sage Narada.
data.anv: धर्मात्मन: of the righteous natured, लोके in this world, गुणवत: of the virtuous, धीमत: of the  wise, धीरस्य of the steadfast, रामस्य Rama's, वृत्तम् history, ते to you, नारदात् through Narada, यथा in whichever manner, श्रुतम् heard, कथय narrate.
data.md: Do you now, O best of saints, compose the entire history of Rāma. Do you relate to the world the history of the righteous-souled and intelligent Rāma crowned with qualities. And do you, as you have heard it from Närada.

data.v: रहस्यं च प्रकाशं च यद्वृत्तं तस्य धीमतः । रामस्य सह सौमित्रे राक्षसानां च सर्वशः ॥
data.es: The incidents pertaining to sagacious Rama together with Lakshmana, Sita, Bharata, etc. and the rakshasas their deeds, thoughts, unknown or known to everybody and even not known to you, will be revealed to you by my grace.
data.anv: धीमत: sagacious, सह सौमित्रे: along with Lakshmana, तस्य रामस्य Rama's, राक्षसानां च rakshsas, रहस्यं च unknown, प्रकाशं च known (deeds), सर्वश: by all means, यत् which, वृत्तम् history, वैदेह्याश्चापि about Sita and others, प्रकाशं यदि वा whether it is known to every body, रहो वा or unknown, यत् which, वृत्तम् history, तच्च that also, सर्वम् all, अविदितमपि even not known formerly, ते to you, विदितं भविष्यति will be revealed.
data.md: Relate all what is known, and all what is unknown to the world, O wise one, concerning Rāma, and Laksmana, and Videha's daughter, and all the Rākşasas. And even what is not known to Nārada, shall be unfolded to you.

data.v: वैदेह्याश्चैव यद्वृत्तं प्रकाशं यदि वा रहः । तच्चाप्यविदितं सर्वं विदितं ते भविष्यति ॥
data.es: The incidents pertaining to sagacious Rama together with Lakshmana, Sita, Bharata, etc. and the rakshasas their deeds, thoughts, unknown or known to everybody and even not known to you, will be revealed to you by my grace.
data.anv: धीमत: sagacious, सह सौमित्रे: along with Lakshmana, तस्य रामस्य Rama's, राक्षसानां च rakshsas, रहस्यं च unknown, प्रकाशं च known (deeds), सर्वश: by all means, यत् which, वृत्तम् history, वैदेह्याश्चापि about Sita and others, प्रकाशं यदि वा whether it is known to every body, रहो वा or unknown, यत् which, वृत्तम् history, तच्च that also, सर्वम् all, अविदितमपि even not known formerly, ते to you, विदितं भविष्यति will be revealed.
data.md: Relate all what is known, and all what is unknown to the world, O wise one, concerning Rāma, and Laksmana, and Videha's daughter, and all the Rākşasas. And even what is not known to Nārada, shall be unfolded to you.

data.v: न ते वागनृता काव्ये काचिदत्र भविष्यति । कुरु रामकथां पुण्यां श्लोकबद्धां मनोरमाम् ॥
data.es: Not even a single word of yours in this epic will ever prove untruthful. Compose this sacred, delightful story of Rama, set in the form of slokas.
data.anv: अत्र काव्ये In this poem, ते वाक् your  words, काचित् not even one word, अनृता of untruth, न भविष्यति will not be spoken, पुण्याम् sacred, मनोरमाम् delightful, रामकथाम् history of Rama, श्लोकबद्धाम् in the form of slokas, कुरु compose.
data.md: No words of yours in this poem shall contain an untruth sacred. Therefore, now compose into verses. This delightful story of Rama.

data.v: यावत्स्थास्यन्ति गिरयः सरितश्च महीतले । तावद्रामायणकथा लोकेषु प्रचरिष्यति ॥
data.es: As long as the mountains and rivers exist on this earth, the story of Ramayana will prevail among the people.
data.anv: ﻿ गिरय: mountains, सरित: च and rivers, महीतले on this earth, यावत् स्थास्यन्ति as long as they exist, तावत् till then, रामायणकथा story of Ramayana, लोकेषु among the people, प्रचरिष्यति will prevail.
data.md: As long as the mountains and the seas exist on earth, the history of Rāmāyaṇa will remain prevalent among men.

data.v: यावद्रामस्य च कथा त्वत्कृता प्रचरिष्यति । तावदूर्ध्वमधश्च त्वं मल्लोकेषु निवत्स्यसि ॥
data.es: So long as the story of the Ramayana composed by you is remembered in this world, you will live in the upper world, the nether world and Brahmaloka".
data.anv: त्वत्कृता composed by you, रामायणकथा the Ramayana story, यावत् as long as, प्रचरिष्यति prevails, तावत् till then, त्वम् you, ऊर्ध्वम् the upper world, heaven, अधश्च the nether world, मल्लोकेषु in my (Brahmaloka), निवत्स्यसि will reside.
data.md: As long as this story of Rāmāyaṇa shall retain its currency, you shall reside both in this world and in mine.

data.v: इत्युक्त्वा भगवान्ब्रह्मा तत्रैवान्तरधीयत । ततः सशिष्यो वाल्मीकिर्मुनिर्विस्मयमाययौ ॥
data.es: Having spoken these words, lord Brahma vanished. At this he and his disciples were astonished.
