data.anv: नित्यसन्तुष्ट: always contended, स: Rsyasringa, पितु: father's, आश्रमात् from the hermitage, नातिचक्राम never stirred out, तपस्विना by the ascetics, तेन by him, जन्मप्रभृति from his birth, स्त्री वा neither a woman, पुमान्वा nor a man, नगरराष्ट्रजम् born in towns or cities, सर्वम् all, यत् अन्यत् other creatures, न दृष्टपूर्वम् did not see earlier.
data.md: Since his birth he had never before seen men and women, or any other creatures living in cities and towns.

data.v: ततः कदाचित्तं देशमाजगाम यदृच्छया । विभाण्डकसुतस्तत्र ताश्चापश्यद्वराङ्गनाः ॥
data.es: One day this son of Vibhandaka (Rsyasringa) accidentally came to the place where he saw the beautiful women.
data.anv: तत: thereafter, कदाचित् on one day, विभण्डकसुत: son of Vibhandaka, यदृच्छया accidentally, तं देशम् towards that place, आजगाम came, तत्र there, ता: those, वराङ्गना: beautiful women, अपश्यत् saw.
data.md: It came to pass that on one occasion, walking about at will, Vibhandaka's son came to that spot and beheld the courtezans.

data.v: ताश्चित्रवेषाः प्रमदा गायन्त्यो मधुरस्वरैः । ऋषिपुत्रमुपागम्य सर्वा वचनमब्रुवन् ॥
data.es: Those wonderfully attired women singing with sweet voices approached the son of the sage (Rsyasringa) and said:
data.anv: चित्रवेषा: beautifully attired, मधुरस्वरा: having sweet voices, गायन्त्य: singing, ता: those प्रमदा: women, सर्वा: all, ऋषिपुत्रम् Rsyasringa, उपागम्य having approached, अब्रुवन् said.
data.md: Colourfully attired, and singing sweet songs, the women came to the saint's son and said.

data.v: कस्त्वं किं वर्तसे ब्रह्मञ्ज्ञातुमिच्छामहे वयम् । एकस्त्वं विजने घोरे वने चरसि शंस नः ॥
data.es: 'O brahman Who are you? How are you subsisting? We wish to know why you are roaming alone in this dreadful forest? Could you tell us.'
data.anv: ब्रह्मन् O Brahman, त्वं क: who are you? किं वर्तसे how are you subsisting? त्वम् you, एक: alone, विजने in a lonely, घोरे dreadful, वने in the forest, चरसि you are roaming, वयम् we, ज्ञातुम् to know, इच्छामहे desirous, न:शंस tell us.
data.md: Who are you? And where are you going, O Brahman? We wish to learn all this. And why is it that you range alone this far-off forest?

data.v: अदृष्टरूपास्तास्तेन काम्यरूपा वने स्त्रियः । हार्दात्तस्य मतिर्जाता आख्यातुं पितरं स्वकम् ॥
data.es: He had never seen such charming women in the forest. He developed affection towards them and a desire arose in him to speak about his father.
data.anv: काम्यरूपा: women of charming appearance, ता: स्त्रिय: those women, तेन by him, वने in the forest, अदृष्टरूपा: whose forms were never seen before, हार्दात् due to affection, तस्य for him, स्वकं पितरम्  about his father, व्याख्यातुम् narrating, मति: intention, जाता arose.
data.md: Beholding these beautiful damsels never seen before, he from delight, hastened to inform them of his lineage.

data.v: पिता विभाण्डकोऽस्माकं तस्याहं सुत औरसः । ऋश्यशृङ्ग इति ख्यातं नाम कर्म च मे भुवि ॥
data.es: 'My father is Vibhandaka. I am his own son. My name is Rsyasringa. I am known the world over by this name associated with my karma'.
data.anv: विभण्डक: Vibhandaka, अस्माकम् our, पिता father, अहम् I, तस्य his, औरस: सुत: his own son, मे my, ऋश्यशृङ्ग Rsyasringa, इति thus, नाम name, कर्म च through result of an action (having one horn on his head), भुवि world over, ख्यातम् is known.
data.md: My father is Vibhăndaka; and I am his son. My name is Rşyasſiga and my occupation is known the world over.

data.v: इहाश्रमपदोऽस्माकं समीपे शुभदर्शनाः । करिष्ये वोऽत्र पूजां वै सर्वेषां विधिपूर्वकम् ॥
data.es: 'O auspiciouslooking women, our hermitage is nearby. I will extend to you due hospitality'.
data.anv: शुभदर्शना: O auspicious looking women, अस्माकम् our, आश्रमपद: hermitage, इह here, समीपे nearby, अत्र here, व: सर्वेषाम् to all of you, पूजाम् hospitable reception, विधिपूर्वकम् according to scriptural injunctions, करिष्ये I will extend.
data.md: This auspicious hermitage hard by belongs to us; and there I shall receive you all in due form O' lovely ones! .

data.v: ऋषिपुत्रवचः श्रुत्वा सर्वासां मतिरास वै । तदाश्रमपदं द्रष्टुं जग्मुः सर्वाश्च तेन ह ॥
data.es: After listening to the words of the sage's son (Rsyasringa), all the beautiful women with a desire to see the hermitage accompanied him.
data.anv: ऋषिपुत्रवच: words of the son of ascetic, Rishyashringa, श्रुत्वा having listened, सर्वासाम् for all those women, तत् आश्रमपदम् that hermitage, द्रष्टुम् to see, मति: desire, आस वै arose, सर्वा: all of them, तेन with him, जग्मु: च accompanied.
data.md: Hearing the words of the saint's son, they all consented, and the women went to behold that asylum.

data.v: गतानां तु ततः पूजामृषिपुत्रश्चकार ह । इदमर्घ्यमिदं पाद्यमिदं मूलं फलं च नः ॥
data.es: Thereafter the son of ascetic respectfully received the the strangers saying, "(Accept) our offerings, here is water for washing feet and here are roots and fruits".
data.anv: तत: thereafter, ऋषिपुत्र: son of ascetic, इदम् this one, न: our, अर्घ्यम् respectable offerings, इदम् this, पाद्यम् water for washing feet, इदम् this, मूलम् roots, फलं च fruits also, आगतानाम् for all those who have come, पूजाम् homage, चकार ह performed.
data.md: When they had come there, the saint's son received them hospitably, saying, 'Here is Arghya,' 'Here is water for washing the feet,' 'Here are fruits and roots.'

data.v: प्रतिगृह्य तु तां पूजां सर्वा एव समुत्सुकाः । ऋषेर्भीताश्च शीघ्रं तु गमनाय मतिं दधुः ॥
data.es: The anxious courtesans received the offerings and afraid of the ascetic's return, made up their minds to withdraw immediately.
data.anv: ता: सर्वा: all of them, समुत्सुका: anxious persons, तां पूजाम् those offerings, प्रतिगृह्य having  received, ऋषे: of the ascetic, भीता: feared, शीघ्रम् immediately, गमनाय to return, मतिम्  minds, दधु: decided.
data.md: And thereupon they readily received his hospitality. And actuated by the fear of the saint, Vibhāndaka, they bent their minds upon departing soon.

data.v: अस्माकमपि मुख्यानि फलानीमानि वै द्विज । गृहाण प्रति भद्रं ते भक्षयस्व च मा चिरम् ॥
data.es: 'O brahmin, these are excellent fruits. May prosperity be to you. Accept them and eat them without delay.'
data.anv: द्विज O Brahmin, अस्माकम् our, मुख्यानि excellent, इमानि फलान्यपि these fruits also, प्रतिगृहाण you may accept, भद्रम् ते prosperity to you, भक्षयस्व you may eat, चिरम् मा do not delay.
data.md: They said, Do you also, O twice-born one, receive from us these excellent fruits! O Vipra! good betide you, eat them without delay.

data.v: ततस्तास्तं समालिङ्ग्य सर्वा हर्षसमन्विताः । मोदकान्प्रददुस्तस्मै भक्ष्यांश्च विविधाञ्शुभान् ॥
data.es: Then, all the courtesans embracing him with joy, offered plentiful sweetmeats and various items of food.
data.anv: तत: there upon, ता: सर्वा: all of them, तम् him, समालिङ्ग्य embracing, हर्षसमन्विता: they were filled with joy, तस्मै for him, बहून् plentiful, मोदकान् sweetmeats, विविधान् various, भक्ष्यांश्च other articles of food, प्रददु: gave.
data.md: Thereupon, embracing him joyfully, they gave him sweetmeats and various kinds of savoury viands.

data.v: तानि चास्वाद्य तेजस्वी फलानीति स्म मन्यते । अनास्वादितपूर्वाणि वने नित्यनिवासिना ॥
data.es: The lustrous (Rsyasringa) who had never tasted any food other than what was offered by the permanent forestdwellers mistook them for fruits.
data.anv: तेजस्वी Rsyasringa, possessing the lustre of Brahma, वने in the forest, नित्यनिवासिनाम् of  those who are always residing in the forest, अनास्वादितपूर्वाणि which were not tasted earlier, तानि them, आस्वाद्य having tasted, फलानि इति as fruits, मन्यते स्म thought about them.
data.md: And tasting those things, the glorious one took them for fruits, never tasted before by the dwellers of the forest.

data.v: आपृच्छ्य च तदा विप्रं व्रतचर्यां निवेद्य च । गच्छन्ति स्मापदेशात्ता भीतास्तस्य पितुः स्त्रियः ॥
data.es: The ladies apprehensive of (the arrival of) his father took leave of him on the pretext of observance of (evening) rites.
data.anv: तदा then, ता: स्त्रिय: those women, विप्रम् Rsyasringa, आपृच्छ्य bidding farewell, व्रतचर्याम् observance of religious austerities, निवेद्य having made known, तस्य his, पितु: for his father, भीता: afraid of, अपदेशात् on that pretext, गच्छन्ति स्म went away.
data.md: Then, having accosted him the women, feigning the observance of some vow, went away, inspired with the fear of his father.

data.v: गतासु तासु सर्वासु काश्यपस्यात्मजो द्विजः । अस्वस्थहृदयश्चासीद्दुःखं स्म परिवर्तते ॥
data.es: When they all departed, Kasyapa's son, the brahmin roamed (Rsyasringa) with a restless mind charged with sorrow.
data.anv: तासु सर्वासु when all of them, गतासु (सतीषु ) having departed, काश्यपस्य Kasyapa's, आत्मज: son, द्विज: brahmin, अस्वस्थहृदय: restless in mind, आसीत् remained, दु:खम्  sorrow, परिवर्तते स्म moved him around.
data.md: And when they had gone, that twice-born one, Kasyapa's son, became sad, and suffered from grief of heart and became restless due to sadness.

data.v: ततोऽपरेद्युस्तं देशमाजगाम स वीर्यवान् । मनोज्ञा यत्र ता दृष्टा वारमुख्याः स्वलंकृताः ॥
data.es: On the following day, the sage armed with the power of penance, came to the place where he had seen those enticing, welladorned courtesans.
data.anv: तत: afterwards, वीर्यवान् possessing the power of penance, स: he, अपरेद्यु: on the following day, मनोज्ञा: pleasing  to the mind, वारमुख्या: courtesans, स्वलङ्कृता: welladorned, ता: the courtesans, यत्र at which place, दृष्टा: were seen, तं देशम् that place, आजगाम came.
data.md: And the next day his mind momentarily running upon it, the graceful son of Vibhāņdaka, endowed with prowess, came to that spot where he had encountered the comely courtesans, adorned with ornaments.

data.v: दृष्ट्वैव च तदा विप्रमायान्तं हृष्टमानसाः । उपसृत्य ततः सर्वास्तास्तमूचुरिदं वचः ॥
data.es: All of them were rejoiced on seeing the brahmin approaching them, came nearer to him and said:
data.anv: तदा then, ता: they, आयान्तम् approaching, तं विप्रम् that brahmin, दृष्ट्वा एव after seeing him, हृष्टमानसा: rejoiced in mind, ता: सर्वा: all of them, तत: thereafter, उपसृत्य having approached, तम् addressing him, इदं वच: these words, ऊचु: uttered.
data.md: As soon as they observed him coming, they came forward, and said, Do you, O Brāhmaṇa, come into our hermitage.

data.v: एह्याश्रमपदं सौम्य अस्माकमिति चाब्रुवन् । तत्राप्येष विधिः श्रीमान्विशेषेण भविष्यति ॥
data.es: 'O handsome one, come to our hermitage. A special, sumptuous hospitality will be extended to you', they said.
data.anv: हे सौम्य O Gentleman, अस्माकम् our, आश्रमपदम् hermitage, एहि you may come, तत्र there, श्रीमान् lovely, एष: विधि: this hospitable treatment, विशेषेण special, भविष्यति will be extended, इति च also, अब्रुवन् spoke.

data.v: श्रुत्वा तु वचनं तासां सर्वासां हृदयंगमम् । गमनाय मतिं चक्रे तं च निन्युस्तदा स्त्रियः ॥
data.es: Having heard their words pleasing to the mind, he agreed to go with them. And the women took him away.
data.anv: तासां सर्वासाम् all theirs, हृदयङ्गमम् pleasing to the mind, वचनम् speech, श्रुत्वा having heard, गमनाय to go forth, मतिम् decison, चक्रे made, तदा then, स्त्रिय: those women, तं निन्यु: took him away.
data.md: Thereupon hearing those words of theirs capable of influencing the heart, he became bent upon going, and the women brought him away.

data.v: तत्र चानीयमाने तु विप्रे तस्मिन्महात्मनि । ववर्ष सहसा देवो जगत्प्रह्लादयंस्तदा ॥
data.es: As the illustrious sage was being brought (to Anga) the god of rain (Parjanya) suddenly inundated the earth which looked cherful (with rain).
data.anv: महात्मनि when the illustrious, तस्मिन् विप्रे ascetic, आनीयमाने was being brought, तदा then, देव: Parjanya, Presiding deity for rains, जगत् earth, प्रह्लादयन् pleasing, सहसा at once, तत्र there, ववर्ष rained.
data.md: When that great-souled Vipra had been brought over, the god, Indra, suddenly poured forth plenteous showers, enlivening the spirits of men.

data.v: वर्षेणैवागतं विप्रं विषयं स्वं नराधिपः । प्रत्युद्गम्य मुनिं प्रह्वः शिरसा च महीं गतः ॥
data.es: The king (Romapada) went out to welcome the ascetic, the brahmin who brought along with him rains to his country. He humbly bowed down his head and prostrated before him.
data.anv: नराधिपः king Romapada, वर्षेणैव along with rain, स्वम् his own, विषयम् country, आगतम् arrived, मुनिम् ascetic, विप्रम् brahmin, (Rsyasringa), प्रत्युद्गम्य gone out to welcome, प्रह्व: bowed down humbly, शिरसा with head, महीम् ground, गत: touched.
data.md: When the ascetic had arrived, with showers, the king approached him in bumble guise, bending his head to the ground.

data.v: अर्घ्यं च प्रददौ तस्मै न्यायतः सुसमाहितः । वव्रे प्रसादं विप्रेन्द्रान्मा विप्रं मन्युराविशेत् ॥
data.es: He gave that Indra among the brahmins offerings righteously with unstinted devotion and asked for his favour that he should not incur the wrath of the sage (his father Vibhandaka for having brought him to Anga).
data.anv: सुसमाहित: concentrating his mind, तस्मै to him, अर्घ्यम् च offerings, न्यायत: righteously, प्रददौ gave, विप्रेन्द्रात् from the brahmin (Rsyasringa), प्रसादम् favour, वव्रे sought, विप्रम् sage Vibhandaka, मन्यु: anger, आविशेत् did not pervade.
data.md: He offered him Arghya in due form, and with a collected mind; and asked for his favour, so that wrath could not influence the Vipra.

data.v: अन्तःपुरं प्रविश्यास्मै कन्यां दत्त्वा यथाविधि । शान्तां शान्तेन मनसा राजा हर्षमवाप सः ॥
data.es: The king entered the inner apartment, duly offered him his daughter Shanta in marriage and experienced peace and satisfaction.Thus he (Rsyasringa) lived there, with all his desires fulfilled" (said Sumantra). इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये बालकाण्डे दशमस्सर्ग:॥ Thus ends the tenth sarga of Balakanda of the holy Ramayana the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.
data.anv: स: राजा the king, अन्त:पुरम् inner apartment, प्रविश्य having entered, कन्याम् daughter, शान्ताम् Shanta, अस्मै for him, यथाविधि in accordance with rules, दत्वा united him in marriage, शान्तेन peaceful, मनसा mind, हर्षम् satisfaction, अवाप experienced. स: Rsyasringa, एवम् in this way, सर्वकामै: all desires, सुपूजित: respectfully ministered, तत्र there, न्यवसत् lived.
data.md: And taking him into the inner apartments, and in due form conferring upon him in sober mood his daughter śāntā, the king became happy.

data.v: एवं स न्यवसत्तत्र सर्वकामैः सुपूजितः । ऋश्यशृङ्गो महातेजाः शान्तया सह भार्यया ॥
data.md: Thus the highly powerful Rşyaśřnga together with his wife śāntä, began to live there, respectfully ministered to in regard to every desire.

data.v: भूय एव च राजेन्द्र शृणु मे वचनं हितम् । यथा स देवप्रवरः कथायामेवमब्रवीत् ॥
data.es: "Great king, I shall tell you the way Sanatkumara, great among the celestials further narrated the story. Listen to my words which may prove useful to you (said Sumantra)".
data.anv: राजेन्द्र O Great king, स: that Sanatkumara, देवप्रवर: great among celestial beings, यथा in what so ever manner, कथायाम् in the story, अब्रवीत् narrated, एवम् in this way, मे my, हितम्  beneficial, वचनम् words, भूय: एव again, शृणु listen.
data.md: And he said again, O foremost of monarchs, do you listen to me as I relate how that intelligent Sanatkumāra, best of deities, spoke.

data.v: इक्ष्वाकूणां कुले जातो भविष्यति सुधार्मिकः । राजा दशरथो नाम्ना श्रीमान्सत्यप्रतिश्रवः ॥
data.anv: श्रीमान् auspicious one, सत्यप्रतिश्रव: true to his promise, राजा king, दशरथो नाम्ना named Dasaratha, सुधार्मिक: highly righteous, इक्ष्वाकूणाम् of Ikshvaku kings', कुले in the race, जात: भविष्यति will be born indeed.
data.md: In the line of Ikşvāku will be born a righteous king, named Dasaratha, fair of form, and firm in promise.

data.v: अङ्गराजेन सख्यं च तस्य राज्ञो भविष्यति । कन्या चास्य महाभागा शान्ता नाम भविष्यति ॥
data.es: That king (Dasaratha) will develop friendship with the king of Anga. A highly virtuous daughter named Santa will be born to king of Anga.
data.anv: तस्य राज्ञ: to that king (Dasaratha), अङ्गराजेन with the king of Anga, सख्यं च friendship, भविष्यति will develop, अस्य for that king of Anga, महाभागा highly virtuous, शान्ता नाम named Shanta, कन्या daughter, भविष्यति will be born.

data.v: पुत्रस्त्वङ्गस्य राज्ञस्तु लोमपाद इति श्रुतः । तं स राजा दशरथो गमिष्यति महायशाः ॥
data.es: The famous king Dasaratha will approach the son of the king of Anga known as Romapada.
data.anv: स:अङ्गराज्यस्य पुत्रस्तु that Anga king's son, रोमपाद इति Romapada by name, श्रुत:will be wellknown, महायशा: very famous, स: that, राजा king (Dasaratha), तम् him, गमिष्यति will approach.

data.v: अनपत्योऽस्मि धर्मात्मञ्शान्ताभर्ता मम क्रतुम् । आहरेत त्वयाज्ञप्तः संतानार्थं कुलस्य च ॥
data.es: O righteous king I am issueless. Let Rsyasringa, husband of Santa be ordered to perform the a sacrificial ceremony so that I shall be blessed with I son for the perpetuaion of my race.
data.anv: धर्मात्मन् O Follower of righteousness, अनपत्य: अस्मि I am without children, शान्ताभर्ता husband of Shanta, त्वया by you, आज्ञप्त: ordered, मम my, कुलस्य of race, सन्तानार्थम् for the sake of children (for perpetuation of my race), क्रतुम् sacrifice, आहरेत he may perform.

data.v: श्रुत्वा राज्ञोऽथ तद्वाक्यं मनसा स विचिन्त्य च । प्रदास्यते पुत्रवन्तं शान्ता भर्तारमात्मवान् ॥
data.es: On hearing his words and deeply thinking over the matter, the prudent Romapada agreed to send, Santa's husband (Rsyasringa), capable of blessing him with a son.
data.anv: आत्मवान् prudent and wise, राज्ञ: king's, तद्वाक्यम् that statement, श्रुत्वा having heard, अथ thereafter, स: he, मनसा विचिन्त्य च after thinking over deeply in the mind, पुत्रवन्तम् him who has sons, शान्ताभर्तारम् husband of Shanta, प्रदास्यते will offer.
data.md: Hearing these words of the king, and having pondered well, he will make over to him Rsyasînga of subdued senses, together with Santa and his children.

data.v: प्रतिगृह्य च तं विप्रं स राजा विगतज्वरः । आहरिष्यति तं यज्ञं प्रहृष्टेनान्तरात्मना ॥
data.es: The king relieved of his suffering, was highly delighted. He would take the brahmin with him and perform the sacrificial ritual.
data.anv: स: राजा that king, तं विप्रम् that brahmin, प्रतिगृह्य च having received (along with him), विगतज्वर: relieved of his mental suffering, प्रहृष्टेन with highly delighted, अन्तरात्मना heart, तं यज्ञम् that sacrifice, आहरिष्यति will perform.
data.md: And taking that Vipra, that king, his mind free from anxiety, with a glad heart, will prepare for that sacrifice.

data.v: तं च राजा दशरथो यष्टुकामः कृताञ्जलिः । ऋश्यशृङ्गं द्विजश्रेष्ठं वरयिष्यति धर्मवित् ॥
data.es: King Dasaratha, lord of the people, and knower of dharma and truth, desirous of performing the sacrifice would ask Rsyasringa, with folded palms for granting a boon to perform a sacrifice in order to obtain children and to attain heaven. The king will get those desires fulfilled through that chief brahmin.
data.anv: यष्टुकाम: desirous of performing sacrifice, धर्मवित् knower of dharma, नरेश्वर: lord of the people, दशरथ:राजा king Dasaratha, कृताञ्जलि: with folded palms, द्विजश्रेष्ठम् best among  brahmins, ऋष्यशृङ्गम् Rsyasringa, यज्ञार्थम् for the sake of sacrifice, प्रसवार्थं च in order to obtain children, स्वर्गार्थं च to attain heaven, वरयिष्यति will choose him, स: विशांपति: lord of the people, द्विजमुख्यात् from that prominent brahmin, तं कामम् those desires, लभते च will get.

data.v: यज्ञार्थं प्रसवार्थं च स्वर्गार्थं च नरेश्वरः । लभते च स तं कामं द्विजमुख्याद्विशां पतिः ॥
data.es: King Dasaratha, lord of the people, and knower of dharma and truth, desirous of performing the sacrifice would ask Rsyasringa, with folded palms for granting a boon to perform a sacrifice in order to obtain children and to attain heaven. The king will get those desires fulfilled through that chief brahmin.
data.anv: यष्टुकाम: desirous of performing sacrifice, धर्मवित् knower of dharma, नरेश्वर: lord of the people, दशरथ:राजा king Dasaratha, कृताञ्जलि: with folded palms, द्विजश्रेष्ठम् best among  brahmins, ऋष्यशृङ्गम् Rsyasringa, यज्ञार्थम् for the sake of sacrifice, प्रसवार्थं च in order to obtain children, स्वर्गार्थं च to attain heaven, वरयिष्यति will choose him, स: विशांपति: lord of the people, द्विजमुख्यात् from that prominent brahmin, तं कामम् those desires, लभते च will get.
data.md: And king Dasaratha, knowing duty and desirous of fame, with the intention of obtaining offspring and heaven, with folded hands, will appoint that best of Brahmanas, Rsyasriga, to conduct the ceremony. And that bringer of good will attain his object at the hands of that foremost of Brāhmaṇas.

data.v: पुत्राश्चास्य भविष्यन्ति चत्वारोऽमितविक्रमाः । वंशप्रतिष्ठानकराः सर्वलोकेषु विश्रुताः ॥
data.es: Four sons of immense prowess would be born to him bringing glory and fame to their dynasty. They would be renowned in all the worlds.
data.anv: अस्य to him, अमितविक्रमा: men of immense prowess, वंशप्रतिष्ठानकरा: bringing glory and fame to their dynasty, सर्वलोकेषु in all the worlds, विश्रुता: renowned, चत्वार: four, पुत्रा: sons, भविष्यन्ति will be born.
data.md: And four sons will be born to him of immeasurable prowess, bringing fame to the family, and known by all.' Thus spoke formerly in the divine age, that worshipful and foremost of deities, Sanatkumāra.

data.v: एवं स देवप्रवरः पूर्वं कथितवान्कथाम् । सनत्कुमारो भगवान्पुरा देवयुगे प्रभुः ॥
data.es: In early times of Kritayuga, this story was narrated by the holy and competent Sanatkumara, the great one among the devatas".
data.anv: देवप्रवर: great among devatas, भगवान् holy, प्रभु: competent, स: that, सनत्कुमार: Sanat kumara, पुरा in the early period of, देवयुगे in Krita yuga, कथाम् this story, एवम् in this way, कथितवान् narrated.
data.md: And four sons will be born to him of immeasurable prowess, bringing fame to the family, and known by all.' Thus spoke formerly in the divine age, that worshipful and foremost of deities, Sanatkumāra.

data.v: स त्वं पुरुषशार्दूल तमानय सुसत्कृतम् । स्वयमेव महाराज गत्वा सबलवाहनः ॥
data.es: "Greatest among men, O king, along with vehicles and retinue, you may go and bring him (Rsyasringa) personally with due respect".
data.anv: पुरुषशार्दूल greatest among men, महाराज O King, स: त्वम्  such a man you are, सबलवाहन: along with his foreces and vehicles, स्वयमेव personally, गत्वा having gone, सुसत्कृतम् wellhonoured, तम् him, आनय bring.
data.md: Therefore, do you, O tiger among men, repairing there, accompanied with your forces and equipage, yourself, O mighty king, bring Rşyasſrga over with due honours.

data.v: अनुमान्य वसिष्ठं च सूतवाक्यं निशम्य च । सान्तःपुरः सहामात्यः प्रययौ यत्र स द्विजः ॥
data.es: Having heard the charioteer's words and having obtained the consent of Vasishta, he along with his queens and courtiers departed to the place where the brahmin (Rsyasringa) resided.
data.anv: सूतवाक्यम् the charioteer's (Sumantra's) words, निशम्य having heard, वसिष्ठं च अनुमान्य obtaining the consent of Vasishta, सान्त:पुर: accompanied by queens, सहामात्य: along with courtiers, स:द्विज: that brahmin, यत्र to the place where he resided, प्रययौ departed.
data.md: Hearing Sumantra's words, Dasaratha was exceedingly delighted. And hearing these words, and permitted by Vasistha, he, accompanied with the ladies, and his courtiers, set out for the place where that twice-born one was.

data.v: वनानि सरितश्चैव व्यतिक्रम्य शनैः शनैः । अभिचक्राम तं देशं यत्र वै मुनिपुंगवः ॥
data.es: Crossing forests and rivers slowly, the king reached the place where that foremost of ascetics lived.
data.anv: शनै: शनै: slowly and slowly, वनानि forests, सरितश्चैव rivers, व्यतिक्रम्य crossing, मुनिपुङ्गव: foremost of ascetics, यत्र where he was, तं देशम् that place, अभिचक्राम reached.
data.md: And gradually passing by woods and fells, he arrived at the place where that foremost of ascetics was.

data.v: आसाद्य तं द्विजश्रेष्ठं लोमपादसमीपगम् । ऋषिपुत्रं ददर्शादौ दीप्यमानमिवानलम् ॥
data.es: He reached the spot and saw the son of the ascetic, the best of brahmins glowing like fire seated next to Romapada.
data.anv: आसाद्य having reached, रोमपादसमीपगम् seated beside king Romapada, दीप्यमानम् glowing, अनलमिव like fire, द्विजश्रेष्ठम् best of brahmins, तं ऋषिपुत्रम् that  son of sage, आदौ in the begining, ददर्श beheld.
data.md: And coming before that best of regenerate ones, he saw that sage's son near Romapāda, like that of a flaming fire.

data.v: ततो राजा यथान्यायं पूजां चक्रे विशेषतः । सखित्वात्तस्य वै राज्ञः प्रहृष्टेनान्तरात्मना ॥
data.es: Then the king (Romapada), delighted at heart out of friendship with the king (Dasaratha), offered special hospitality with respectful salutations in accordance with propriety.
data.anv: तत: then, राजा king Romapada, प्रहृष्टेन with delight, अन्तरात्मना in the heart, यथान्यायम् as per tradition, सखित्वात् due to friendship, विशेषत: specially, तस्य of that, राज्ञ: king Dasaratha, पूजाम् respectful salutations, चक्रे offered.
data.md: Then the king received him respectfully, and with a delighted mind, on account of the friendship he bore him. He communicated to the intelligent son of the saint, the fact of their intimacy, and then the latter paid homage to Dasaratha.

data.v: लोमपादेन चाख्यातमृषिपुत्राय धीमते । सख्यं संबन्धकं चैव तदा तं प्रत्यपूजयत् ॥
data.es: Romapada explained his friendship and relationship with him (Dasaratha). Rsyasringa of great intellect in return felicitated Dasaratha.
data.anv: रोमपादेन by Romapada, सख्यम् friendship, सम्बन्धकं चैव relationship, धीमते to the intellectual, ऋषिपुत्राय son of the sage, आख्यातम् narrated, तदा then, तम् him (Romapada), प्रत्यपूजयत् in return felicitatetd.

data.v: एवं सुसत्कृतस्तेन सहोषित्वा नरर्षभः । सप्ताष्टदिवसान्राजा राजानमिदमब्रवीत् ॥
data.es: In this manner, the great among men, the king wellhonoured by Romapada, spent seven or eight days there.And then spoke this to Romapada:
data.anv: एवम् in this manner, सुसत्कृत: wellhonoured, नरर्षभ: the great among men, राजा king Dasaratha, तेन सह along with him, सप्ताष्ट seven or eight, दिवसान् days, उषित्वा having dwelt, राजानम् addressing Romapada, इदम् these words, अब्रवीत् spoke.
data.md: Having passed seven or eight days with Romapäda, receiving high honours, that foremost of men, Dasaratha spoke to Romapada,. saying, Let your daughter, O king, together with her husband, O lord of men, repair to my city. I am going to be engaged in a mighty enterprise.

data.v: शान्ता तव सुता राजन्सह भर्त्रा विशाम्पते । मदीयं नगरं यातु कार्यं हि महदुद्यतम् ॥
data.es: O lord of people, O king, It has been decided to commence an important sacrificial rite. You may send your daughter Santa along with her husband to my city.
data.anv: विशांपते O Lord of people, राजन् king, तव सुता your daughter, शान्ता Shanta, सह भर्त्रा along with her husband, मदीयनगरम् to my city, यातु let her go, महत् important, कार्यम् religious rite, उद्यतम् is planned.
data.md: Having passed seven or eight days with Romapäda, receiving high honours, that foremost of men, Dasaratha spoke to Romapada,. saying, Let your daughter, O king, together with her husband, O lord of men, repair to my city. I am going to be engaged in a mighty enterprise.

data.v: तथेति राजा संश्रुत्य गमनं तस्य धीमतः । उवाच वचनं विप्रं गच्छ त्वं सह भार्यया ॥
data.es: Having agreed to the departure of the sage Romapada said, 'Be pleased to go (to Ayodhya) together with your wife'.
data.anv: राजा king, तथा इति be it so, धीमत: of the wise man, तस्य गमनम्  for his departure, संश्रुत्य having agreed, त्वम् you, भार्यया सह along with your wife, गच्छ please go, विप्रम् brahmin, वचनम् words, उवाच spoke.
data.md: Hearing this as to the journey of that intelligent one, the king said to that Vipra, Do you repair with your wife! Thereupon the saint's son, promising to go, said to the king, So be it!

data.v: ऋषिपुत्रः प्रतिश्रुत्य तथेत्याह नृपं तदा । स नृपेणाभ्यनुज्ञातः प्रययौ सह भार्यया ॥
data.es: The son of the sage assented to the king's command saying 'So be it'. And permitted by him, departed along with wife (for Ayodhya).
data.anv: तदा then, ऋषिपुत्र: son of sage, प्रतिश्रुत्य having assented, नृपम् the king, तथा इति so it shall be done, आह said, नृपेण by king, अभ्यनुज्ञात: having been permitted, भार्यया सह along with his wife, प्रययौ departed.

data.v: तावन्योन्याञ्जलिं कृत्वा स्नेहात्संश्लिष्य चोरसा । ननन्दतुर्दशरथो लोमपादश्च वीर्यवान् ॥
data.es: Dasaratha and Romapada, pleased with this, wished each other with folded palms and hugged each other with love.
data.anv: तौ both, दशरथ: Dasaratha, वीर्यवान् valiant, रोमपादश्च and Romapada, अन्योन्याञ्जलिम् each other wishing with folded palms, कृत्वा having done, स्नेहात् with friendship, उरसा heart to heart, संश्लिष्य embracing each other, ननन्दतु: were pleased.
data.md: Then with the king's permission, he set out with his wife. Dasaratha and the puissant Romapāda clasping each other by the palm, and embracing each other in affection, attained excess. of joy. Then Raghu's son, bidding farewell to his friend, set out.

data.v: ततः सुहृदमापृच्छ्य प्रस्थितो रघुनन्दनः । पौरेभ्यः प्रेषयामास दूतान्वै शीघ्रगामिनः । क्रियतां नगरं सर्वं क्षिप्रमेव स्वलंकृतम् ॥
data.es: Then king Dasaratha, took leave of his friend and set out. He despatched swiftfooted messengers to the citizens with the command.
data.anv: तत: then, रघुनन्दन: Dasaratha, सुहृदम् friend, आपृच्छ्य having taken leave, प्रस्थित: set out, शीघ्रगामिन: swiftly going, दूतान् messengers, पौरेभ्य: to the citizens, प्रेषयामास despatched.
data.md: He despatched swift messengers to the citizens, saying, Let the entire city be embellished; let it be perfumed with dhupa, and watered and decked with pennons.

data.v: ततः प्रहृष्टाः पौरास्ते श्रुत्वा राजानमागतम् । तथा प्रचक्रुस्तत्सर्वं राज्ञा यत्प्रेषितं तदा ॥
data.es: The people of the city having heard the king's arrival were overjoyed. They did everything as by the king.
data.anv: तत: then, ते पौरा: the people of Ayodhya, राजानम् the king, आगतम् arrival, श्रुत्वा having heard, प्रहृष्टा: overjoyed, राज्ञा by king, यत् यथा as per, प्रेषितम् sent, तत् सर्वम् all that, तथा in the same manner, प्रचक्रु: fulfilled.
data.md: Hearing of the king's approach, the citizens joyfully did every thing as per message they had been communicated.

data.v: ततः स्वलंकृतं राजा नगरं प्रविवेश ह । शङ्खदुन्दुभिनिर्घोषैः पुरस्कृत्य द्विजर्षभम् ॥
data.es: Then the king entered that welldecorated city amidst blares of conches and the beating of drums, with the best of the brahmins (Rsyasringa) in the forefront.
data.anv: तत: then, राजा king, द्विजर्षभम् foremost of brahmins, पुरस्कृत्य keeping in the forefront, स्वलङ्कृतम् welldecorated, तत् that, नगरम् city, शङ्खदुन्दुभिनिर्घोषै: with conches blowing and drums beating, प्रविवेश ह entered.
data.md: Then the monarch, preceded by the foremost of Brāhmanas before him, entered the decorated city, to the blares of conches and drums.

data.v: ततः प्रमुदिताः सर्वे दृष्ट्वा तं नागरा द्विजम् । प्रवेश्यमानं सत्कृत्य नरेन्द्रेणेन्द्रकर्मणा ॥
data.es: The citizens were delighted to behold that brahmin entering the city duly honoured by the king who was equivalent to Indra in valiance৷৷
data.anv: तत: then, सर्वे नागरा: all citizens, इन्द्रकर्मणां equivalent to Indra in valiant, नरेन्द्रेण by that king, सत्कृत्य having been honoured, प्रवेश्यमानम् entering, तम् that, द्विजम् brahmin, दृष्ट्वा after seeing, प्रमुदिता: were delighted.
data.md: And beholding that Brāhmaṇa entering the city, duly honoured by the prime of men; subservient to Indra, like to Kaśyapa's son entering the celestial regions honoured of the thousand eyed lord of the celestials, all the citizens rejoiced exceedingly.

data.v: अन्तःपुरं प्रवेश्यैनं पूजां कृत्वा तु शास्त्रतः । कृतकृत्यं तदात्मानं मेने तस्योपवाहनात् ॥
data.es: He (king Dasaratha) took him in to the inner apartment and extended welcome. He thought that he has as enjoined by the sastras accomplished his objective by bringing him (Rsyasringa).
data.anv: एनम् Rsyasringa, अन्त:पुरं प्रवेश्य having taken him to the inner apartment, शास्त्रत: traditionally as enjoined by the scriptures, पूजां welcome, कृत्वा having made, तदा then, तस्य उपवाहनात् for bringing him here, आत्मानम् himself, कृतकृत्यम् has accomplished his object, मेने thought.
data.md: Then taking him into the inner apartment, and paying him homage according to the ordinance, the king considered himself as having gained his object, in consequence of the presence of that Brahmana.

data.v: अन्तःपुराणि सर्वाणि शान्तां दृष्ट्वा तथागताम् । सह भर्त्रा विशालाक्षीं प्रीत्यानन्दमुपागमन् ॥
data.es: All the royal ladies, experienced immense delight when they saw the largeeyed Shanta arriving along with her husband in that manner.
data.anv: अन्त:पुर स्त्रिय: royal ladies, सर्वा: all, तथा in that manner, भर्त्रा सह along with her husband, आगताम् arrived, विशालाक्षीम् wideeyed lady, शान्ताम् Shanta, दृष्ट्वा having seen, प्रीत्या affectionately, आनन्दम् delight, उपागमन् experienced.
data.md: And all the inmates of the inner apartment, seeing the large-eyed Săntă thus arrived with her husband, experienced excess of joy.

data.v: पूज्यमाना च ताभिः सा राज्ञा चैव विशेषतः । उवास तत्र सुखिता कंचित्कालं सह द्विजा ॥
data.es: Honoured and worshipped by royal ladies, especially by king Dasaratha, Santa dwelt there for some time comfortably with the sage.इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये बालकाण्डे एकादशस्सर्ग:॥ Thus ends the eleventh sarga of Balakanda of the holy Ramayana the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.
data.anv: सा she, ताभि: with them, विशेषत: especially, राज्ञा चैव with the king, पूज्यमाना honoured and worshipped, सुखिता comforted, ऋत्विजा सह along with sage Rsyasringa, कञ्चित् कालम् for some time, तत्र there, उवास dwelt.
data.md: Then honoured by them and the king in especial, she happily spent there some time along with that twice-born one.

data.v: ततः काले बहुतिथे कस्मिंश्चित्सुमनोहरे । वसन्ते समनुप्राप्ते राज्ञो यष्टुं मनोऽभवत् ॥
data.es: After a long time, at the advent of charming spring a desire arose in the mind of the king (Dasaratha) to perform the sacrifice.
data.anv: तत: afterwards, बहुतिथे काले after a lapse of long time, सुमनोहरे charming, कस्मिंश्चित्   some time, वसन्ते spring season, समनुप्राप्ते having arrived, राज्ञ: for the king, यष्टुम् to perform sacrifice, मन: अभवत् desire arose.
data.md: Then after a long while, when the charming spring had appeared on the earth, the king conceived the desire of celebrating the sacrifice.

data.v: ततः प्रसाद्य शिरसा तं विप्रं देववर्णिनम् । यज्ञाय वरयामास संतानार्थं कुलस्य वै ॥
data.es: Then bowing his head in respect to that brahmin who was effulgent like a celestial and having won his grace he chose him to conduct a sacrifice for a son for (the continuity of) his dynasty.
data.anv: तत: then, देववर्णिनम् effulgent like a celestial being, विप्रम् that brahmin, शिरसा bowing his head low in respect, प्रसाद्य having won his grace, कुलस्य of the dynasty, सन्तानार्थम् for preserving uninterrupted continuity, यज्ञाय to perform sacrifice, वरयामास appointed him as official priest to preside over the ceremony.
data.md: Then bowing down the head before the Vipra effulgent like a celestial, he appointed him to undertake the ceremony, for the purpose of obtaining offspring to perpetuate his line.

data.v: तथेति च स राजानमुवाच च सुसत्कृतः । संभाराः संभ्रियन्तां ते तुरगश्च विमुच्यताम् ॥
data.es: Highly pleased, they all said to king Dasaratha, "Requisite articles be collected for the sacrifice and the horse be released."
data.anv: सुसत्कृत: wellhonoured, स: that brahmin, तथेति be it so, राजानम् king, उवाच said, सम्भारा: requisite materials, सम्भ्रियन्ताम् be procured, ते your, तुरग: sacrificial horse, विमुच्यताम् च let it be released.
data.md: Then that Brāhmana said to the lord of the earth, the king, So be it! Get order the necessary provisions procured, free the horse set, and prepare a sacrificial ground on the north bank of the Sarayd.

data.v: ततो राजाब्रवीद्वाक्यं सुमन्त्रं मन्त्रिसत्तमम् । सुमन्त्रावाहय क्षिप्रमृत्विजो ब्रह्मवादिनः ॥
data.es: Thereafter the king said to Sumantra, "Summon immediately, Suyajna, Vamadeva, Jabali and Kasyapa, family priest Vasishta and other foremost and learned brahmins who are the official priests wellversed in the Vedas".
data.anv: तत: thereafter, राजा king, मन्त्रिसत्तमम् best of ministers, सुमन्त्रम् Sumantra, वाक्यम् words, अब्रवीत् spoke, सुमन्त्र: O Sumantra, क्षिप्रम् immediately, ब्रह्मवादिन: wellversed in vedas, ऋत्विज: official priests, सुयज्ञम् Suyajna, वामदेवम् च Vamadeva, जाबालिम् Jabali, अथ and, काश्यपम् Kashyapa, पुरोहितं वसिष्ठं च family priest Vasistha, अन्ये other, द्विजसत्तमा: foremost among brahmins, आवाहय summon.

data.v: ततः सुमन्त्रस्त्वरितं गत्वा त्वरितविक्रमः । समानयत्स तान्विप्रान्समस्तान्वेदपारगान् ॥
data.es: Then Sumantra, a man of smart movement went immediately and brought all those brahmins who were wellversed in the Vedas.
data.anv: तत: thereupon, त्वरितविक्रम: a man with swift movements, स: सुमन्त्र: that Sumantra, त्वरितम् immediately, गत्वा had gone, वेदपारगान् mastered fully vedas, समस्तान् gathering together, तान् विप्रान् all of those brahmins, समानयत् brought.
data.md: Thereupon, going out speeding, Sumantra of swift movements called together all the spiritual guides, as well as others versed in the Vedic ritual.

data.v: सुयज्ञं वामदेवं च जाबालिमथ काश्यपम् । पुरोहितं वसिष्ठं च ये चान्ये द्विजसत्तमाः ॥
data.es: Thereafter the king said to Sumantra, "Summon immediately, Suyajna, Vamadeva, Jabali and Kasyapa, family priest Vasishta and other foremost and learned brahmins who are the official priests wellversed in the Vedas".
data.anv: तत: thereupon, त्वरितविक्रम: a man with swift movements, स: सुमन्त्र: that Sumantra, त्वरितम् immediately,गत्वा having gone, सुयज्ञम् Suyajna, वामदेवं च Vamadeva, अथ and जाबालिम् Jabali, काश्यपम् Kasyapa, पुरोहितम् priest, वसिष्ठं च Vasistha, अन्ये other, ये व्दिजसत्तमा: excellent brahmins, वेदपारगान् who had command of trhe Vedas, समस्तान् gathering together, तान् सर्वान् all of them, समानयत् brought.
data.md: They were Suyajña, and Vămadeva, and Jabali, and Kasyapa, and Vasistha, and other principal twice-born ones. And having paid homage to them, the virtuous king Dasaratha then spoke to them these sweet words.

data.v: तान्पूजयित्वा धर्मात्मा राजा दशरथस्तदा । इदं धर्मार्थसहितं श्लक्ष्णं वचनमब्रवीत् ॥
data.es: Virtuous king Dasaratha paid homage to them (the ministers) and uttered these gracious, righteous and meaningful words.
data.anv: धर्मात्मा virtuous, दशरथ: राजा king Dasaratha, तदा then, तान् them, पूजयित्वा after paying respects, धर्मार्थसहितम् full of truth and duty, श्लक्ष्णम् gracious, (इदं) युक्तं वचनम् these words, अब्रवीत् uttered.
data.md: They were Suyajña, and Vămadeva, and Jabali, and Kasyapa, and Vasistha, and other principal twice-born ones. And having paid homage to them, the virtuous king Dasaratha then spoke to them these sweet words.

data.v: मम लालप्यमानस्य पुत्रार्थं नास्ति वै सुखम् । तदर्थं हयमेधेन यक्ष्यामीति मतिर्मम ॥
data.es: There is no happiness for one who has no son. This is the cause of my intense suffering. Therefore, I have made up my mind to perform a horsesacrifice.
data.anv: पुत्रार्थम् to have sons, लालप्यमानस्य suffering from intense sorrow, मम for me, सुखम् happiness, नास्ति वै not there, तदर्थं for that reason, (अहम् I), हयमेधेन यक्ष्यामि I shall perform HorseSacrifice, इति thus, मम my, मति: intention.
data.md: Consistent with duty and interest,-Ever pining on account of a son, I know no happiness,-therefore it is my intention that I should celebrate a horse sacrifice.

data.v: तदहं यष्टुमिच्छामि शास्त्रदृष्टेन कर्मणा । ऋषिपुत्रप्रभावेन कामान्प्राप्स्यामि चाप्यहम् ॥
data.es: Therefore, I intend to perform a horsesacrifice in accordance with the scriptures. How can I fulfil my desire in this regard? You may deliberate and find a solution".
data.anv: तत् for that reason, शास्त्रदृष्टेन कर्मणा according to scriptural procedures, यष्टुं इच्छामि desirous of performing sacrifice, ऋषिपुत्रप्रभावेन by the grace of sage Rishyashringa, अहम् I, कामान् desires, प्राप्स्यामि च will obtain.
data.md: I intend to celebrate it according to the ordinance. Do you, therefore, consider how I may attain my object.

data.v: ततः साध्विति तद्वाक्यं ब्राह्मणाः प्रत्यपूजयन् । वसिष्ठप्रमुखाः सर्वे पार्थिवस्य मुखाच्च्युतम् ॥
data.es: The brahmins along with Vasishta in the forefront extolled the king's decision, exclaiming, 'Well, Well'.
data.anv: तत: then, वसिष्ठप्रमुखा: Vasishta and others, ब्राह्मणा: brahmins, सर्वे all, पार्थिवस्य king's, मुखात् from the mouth, च्युतम् delivered, तत् वाक्यम those words, साधु इति well said, प्रत्यपूजयन् extolled.
data.md: Thereat, the Brāhmaṇas with Vasiştha at their head, exclaiming well! Well 1 approved the words that had fallen from the lips of the monarch.

data.v: ऋश्यशृङ्गपुरोगाश्च प्रत्यूचुर्नृपतिं तदा । संभाराः संभ्रियन्तां ते तुरगश्च विमुच्यताम् ॥
data.es: Highly pleased, they all said to king Dasaratha, "Requisite articles be collected for the sacrifice and the horse be released."
data.anv: ऋष्यशृङ्गपुरोगा: priests led by Rsyashringa, तदा then, नृपतिम् addressing king, प्रत्यूचु: replied, सम्भारा: sacrificial articles, सम्भ्रियन्ताम् be procured, ते your, तुरग: sacrificial horse, विमुच्यतां च be released.
data.md: The Brāhmaṇas headed by Rsyaśộnga addressed the king, saying, Do you arrange for the provisions, loose the horse, and prepare the sacrificial ground on the north bank of the Sarayū river!

data.v: सर्वथा प्राप्यसे पुत्रांश्चतुरोऽमितविक्रमान् । यस्य ते धार्मिकी बुद्धिरियं पुत्रार्थमागता ॥
data.es: 'O king, the wish that arose in your mind is just and right. You will definitely obtain sons as desired by you.'
data.anv: यस्य ते for you whose, पुत्रार्थम् for begetting children, इयम् this, धार्मिकी बुद्धि: righteous thought, आगता having come to your mind, सर्वथा surely, अमितविक्रमान् men of immense  prowess, चत्वार: four, पुत्रान् sons, प्राप्स्यसे shall you get.
data.md: Since you purpose so virtuously for obtaining offspring, you shall obtain four sons of immeasurable prowess.

data.v: ततः प्रीतोऽभवद्राजा श्रुत्वा तद्द्विजभाषितम् । अमात्यांश्चाब्रवीद्राजा हर्षेणेदं शुभाक्षरम् ॥
data.es: On hearing the words of the brahmins, the king was pleased and said to his ministers with eyes excited with delight.
data.anv: तत: thereafter, राजा king, द्विजभाषितम् brahmin's words, श्रुत्वा having heard, प्रीत: अभवत्  felt happy, राजा king, हर्षेण with delight, शुभाक्षरम् containing auspicious letters,  इदं this,  अब्रवीत् spoke.
data.md: Hearing those words of the regenerate ones, the king was exceedingly delighted. And cheerfully he spoke these auspicious words to his courtiers.

data.v: गुरूणां वचनाच्छीघ्रं संभाराः संभ्रियन्तु मे । समर्थाधिष्ठितश्चाश्वः सोपाध्यायो विमुच्यताम् ॥
data.es: "Let the articles required (for performing the sacrifice) be procured in accordance with the words of my spiritual preceptors and the horse be released under the protection of able men.
data.anv: (इह now), मे गुरूणाम् my spiritual preceptors', वचनात् words, सम्भारा: articles required for performing the sacrifice, सम्भ्रियन्तु be procured, समर्थाधिष्ठित: under the protection of warriors, सोपाध्याय: along with main priest, अश्व: horse, विमुच्यताम् be released.
data.md: In accordance with the directions of my spiritual guides, do you speedily procure these provisions, loose the horse well protected, and followed by a priest.

data.v: सरय्वाश्चोत्तरे तीरे यज्ञभूमिर्विधीयताम् । शान्तयश्चाभिवर्धन्तां यथाकल्पं यथाविधि ॥
data.es: On the northern bank of Sarayu, a sacrificial pavillion be prepared according to the methods ordained in the 'Kalpa'. Auspicious rites be performed in accordance with the ordinance for its uninterrupted completion.
data.anv: सरय्वा: of river Sarayu, उत्तरे तीरे on the northern bank, यज्ञभूमि: sacrificial pavillion, विधीयताम् be constructed, यथाकल्पम् according to prescribed ritual code, यथाविधि according to the scriptural stipulation, शान्तयश्च expiatory rites, अभिवर्धन्ताम् may be wished.
data.md: And prepare the sacrificial ground on the north bank of the Sarayu. And perform the ceremonies capable of securing the rites from disturbance.

data.v: शक्यः कर्तुमयं यज्ञः सर्वेणापि महीक्षिता । नापराधो भवेत्कष्टो यद्यस्मिन्क्रतुसत्तमे ॥
data.es: If obstructions and omissions do not occur in the conduct of this best of sacrifices, it will be possible for every king to get the results.
data.anv: अस्मिन् In this, क्रतुसत्तमे best of sacifices, कष्ट: difficulties, अपराध: omissions, न भवेत् यदि does not happen, अयं यज्ञ: this sacrifice, सर्वेणापि महीक्षिता indeed by every king, प्राप्तुम् to obtain, शक्य: possible.
data.md: Surely every king is competent to perform this sacrifice yet care must be taken that no default occurs in it.

data.v: छिद्रं हि मृगयन्तेऽत्र विद्वांसो ब्रह्मराक्षसाः । विधिहीनस्य यज्ञस्य सद्यः कर्ता विनश्यति ॥
data.es: The learned brahmarakshasas always look out for flaws in the sacrifice so that they can spoil it. If a flaw finds place, the doer of the sacrifice is immediately destroyed.
data.anv: अत्र in this sacrifice, विद्वांस: learned men, ब्रह्मराक्षसा: brahma rakshasas(celestial beings turned into demons), छिद्रम् flaw, मृगयन्ते हि will be looking out for, निहतस्य struck down, यज्ञस्य of sacrifice, कर्ता च the doer, सद्य: immediately, विनश्यति will be destroyed.
data.md: For flaws in this foremost of sacrifices are watched by learned Brahma-Rākşasas. And should it come to be celebrated in violation of the ordinance, ihe performer thereof shall meet with instant destruction.

data.v: तद्यथा विधिपूर्वं मे क्रतुरेष समाप्यते । तथाविधानं क्रियतां समर्थाः करणेष्विह ॥
data.es: Therefore let the arrangements be made in a manner this sacifice is completed in accordance with the scriptures. And in this, you are experts".
data.anv: तत् for that reason, मे my, एष: क्रतु: this sacifice, विधिपूर्वम् in accordance with scriptures, यथा समाप्यते as it could be completed, तथा in that manner, विधानम् arrangement, क्रियताम् may be done, इह(You) here, करणेषु in actions, समर्था: experts.
data.md: And do you so order that this sacrifice of mine may be completed according to the prescribed ritual.

data.v: तथेति च ततः सर्वे मन्त्रिणः प्रत्यपूजयन् । पार्थिवेन्द्रस्य तद्वाक्यं यथाज्ञप्तमकुर्वत ॥
data.es: Having heard these words of this Indra on earth (king Dasaratha) all the ministers with due respect replied: "May it be as ordered".
data.anv: तत: then, मन्त्रिण: ministers, सर्वे all, पार्थिवेन्द्रस्य of that king's, तथेति let it be so, प्रत्यपूजयन् honoured, यथाज्ञप्तम् as ordered, अकुर्वत performed.
data.md: Thereupon honouring those words of the king, the ministers did as ordered.

data.v: ततो द्विजास्ते धर्मज्ञमस्तुवन्पार्थिवर्षभम् । अनुज्ञातास्ततः सर्वे पुनर्जग्मुर्यथागतम् ॥
data.es: Bowing to this best of kings (Dasaratha), all the brahmins who were experts in austerities left all the knowledgeable brahmins as they camewith his permission.
data.anv: तत: after that, ते द्विजा: those brahmins, धर्मज्ञम् knower of righteousness, पार्थिवर्षभम् great king, अस्तुवन् praised, अनुज्ञाता: having been permitted, तत: from there, पुन: again, यथागतम् in the manner as they came, जग्मु: returned.
data.md: Then hearing those words of that best king again, as heard before, conversant with their duty, having blessed the monarch, taking permission of the king, they returned to their respective quarters.

data.v: गतानां तु द्विजातीनां मन्त्रिणस्तान्नराधिपः । विसर्जयित्वा स्वं वेश्म प्रविवेश महाद्युतिः ॥
data.es: Having thus ordered his ministers sitting nearby, sent this highly brilliant, this preeminent among kings them away and entered the inner apartment.
data.anv: अथ thereafter, द्विजाग्य्रेषु when great brahmins, गतेषु (सत्सु) had departed, महाद्युति: great and glorious, नराधिप: king, मन्त्रिण: those ministers, विसर्जयित्वा having sent them, स्वं वेश्म his palace, प्रविवेश entered.
data.md: When the Vipras had gone, the mightyminded lord of men dismissing his counsellors, entered his place. When the Vipras had gone, the mightyminded lord of men dismissing his counsellors, entered his place.

data.v: पुनः प्राप्ते वसन्ते तु पूर्णः संवत्सरोऽभवत् । अभिवाद्य वसिष्ठं च न्यायतः प्रतिपूज्य च ॥
data.es: After completion of one year when spring returned, the valiant king (Dasaratha) entered the sacrificial pavilion to worship celestial beings for begetting sons.
data.anv: पुन: again, वसन्ते in spring, प्राप्ते सति having returned, संवत्सर: one year, पूर्ण: अभवत् completed, वीर्यवान् valiant, प्रसवार्थम् for begetting sons, हयमेधेन by Horsesacrifice, यष्टुम् to worship celestial beings, गत: entered sacrificial pavilion.

data.v: अब्रवीत्प्रश्रितं वाक्यं प्रसवार्थं द्विजोत्तमम् । यज्ञो मे क्रियतां विप्र यथोक्तं मुनिपुंगव ॥
यथा न विघ्नः क्रियते यज्ञाङ्गेषु विधीयताम् । भवान्स्निग्धः सुहृन्मह्यं गुरुश्च परमो महान् ॥
वोढव्यो भवता चैव भारो यज्ञस्य चोद्यतः । तथेति च स राजानमब्रवीद्द्विजसत्तमः ॥
करिष्ये सर्वमेवैतद्भवता यत्समर्थितम् । ततोऽब्रवीद्द्विजान्वृद्धान्यज्ञकर्मसु निष्ठितान् ॥
स्थापत्ये निष्ठितांश्चैव वृद्धान्परमधार्मिकान् । कर्मान्तिकाञ्शिल्पकारान्वर्धकीन्खनकानपि ॥
गणकाञ्शिल्पिनश्चैव तथैव नटनर्तकान् । तथा शुचीञ्शास्त्रविदः पुरुषान्सुबहुश्रुतान् ॥
यज्ञकर्म समीहन्तां भवन्तो राजशासनात् । इष्टका बहुसाहस्री शीघ्रमानीयतामिति ॥
औपकार्याः क्रियन्तां च राज्ञां बहुगुणान्विताः । ब्राह्मणावसथाश्चैव कर्तव्याः शतशः शुभाः ॥
भक्ष्यान्नपानैर्बहुभिः समुपेताः सुनिष्ठिताः । तथा पौरजनस्यापि कर्तव्या बहुविस्तराः ॥
आवासा बहुभक्ष्या वै सर्वकामैरुपस्थिताः । तथा जानपदस्यापि जनस्य बहुशोभनम् ॥
दातव्यमन्नं विधिवत्सत्कृत्य न तु लीलया । सर्वे वर्णा यथा पूजां प्राप्नुवन्ति सुसत्कृताः ॥
न चावज्ञा प्रयोक्तव्या कामक्रोधवशादपि । यज्ञकर्मसु येऽव्यग्राः पुरुषाः शिल्पिनस्तथा ॥
तेषामपि विशेषेण पूजा कार्या यथाक्रमम् । यथा सर्वं सुविहितं न किंचित्परिहीयते ॥
तथा भवन्तः कुर्वन्तु प्रीतिस्निग्धेन चेतसा । ततः सर्वे समागम्य वसिष्ठमिदमब्रुवन् ॥
यथोक्तं तत्करिष्यामो न किंचित्परिहास्यते । ततः सुमन्त्रमाहूय वसिष्ठो वाक्यमब्रवीत् ॥
निमन्त्रयस्य नृपतीन्पृथिव्यां ये च धार्मिकाः । ब्राह्मणान्क्षत्रियान्वैश्याञ्शूद्रांश्चैव सहस्रशः ॥
समानयस्व सत्कृत्य सर्वदेशेषु मानवान् । मिथिलाधिपतिं शूरं जनकं सत्यविक्रमम् ॥
data.md: With proper honour yourself bring the righteous, truthful, and heroic Janaka, lord of Mithilā. And it is because he is our old friend that I first mention him.

data.v: निष्ठितं सर्वशास्त्रेषु तथा वेदेषु निष्ठितम् । तमानय महाभागं स्वयमेव सुसत्कृतम् । पूर्वसंबन्धिनं ज्ञात्वा ततः पूर्वं ब्रवीमि ते ॥
data.es: You may personally go and bring with due honour king Janaka who is the distinguished king of Mithila, a warrior whose truth is his strength proficient in all scriptures and the Vedas. Since he is an old ally, I am telling you in advance.
data.anv: मिथिलाधिपतिम् king of Mithila, शूरम् greatest of warriors, सत्यविक्रमम् a man with real heroic valour, सर्वशास्त्रेषु in all scriptures, निष्ठितम् proficient, तथा and, वेदेषु in vedas, निष्ठितम् proficient, महाभागम् distinguished, तं जनकम् that Janaka, पूर्वसम्बन्धिनम् an ancient allay, ज्ञात्वा knowing, सुसत्कृतम् with due honours, स्वयमेव personally, आनय bring him, तत: for that reason, पूर्वम् well before, ते to you, ब्रवीमि telling.
data.md: With proper honour yourself bring the righteous, truthful, and heroic Janaka, lord of Mithilā. And it is because he is our old friend that I first mention him.

data.v: तथा काशिपतिं स्निग्धं सततं प्रियवादिनम् । सद्वृत्तं देवसंकाशं स्वयमेवानयस्व ह ॥
data.es: Similarly, you may personally escort king of Kasi who is always affectionate and sweettongued. He is a friend to our king who is a lion among rulers.
data.anv: तथा thereafter, स्निग्धम् affectionate, सततम् ever, प्रियवादिनम् speaking pleasantly, राजसिंहस्य lion among kings, वयस्यम् friend, काशीपतिम् king of Kasi, स्वयमेव personally, आनयस्व ह bring him.
data.md: Then do yourself bring the amiable and ever fair-spoken lord of Kāśī, of excellent character, resembling a celestial.

data.v: तथा केकयराजानं वृद्धं परमधार्मिकम् । श्वशुरं राजसिंहस्य सपुत्रं तमिहानय ॥
data.es: Similarly, you may personally escort king of Kasi who is always affectionate and sweettongued. He is a friend to our king who is a lion among rulers.
data.anv: तथा then, परमधार्मिकम् very righteous, राजसिंहस्य our king Dasaratha's, श्वशुरम् fatherinlaw, वृद्धम् aged, केकयराजानम् king of Kekaya, सपुत्रम् along with his sons, त्वम् you, इह here, आनय bring.
data.md: Then do you bring here along with his son, the highly-pious, old king of Kekaya, who is the father-in-law of this tiger of a monarch.

data.v: अङ्गेश्वरं महाभागं लोमपादं सुसत्कृतम् । वयस्यं राजसिंहस्य तमानय यशस्विनम् ॥
data.es: Bring with honour king of Anga, Romapada, famous and prosperous. He is an intimate friend of the king (Dasaratha).
data.anv: अङ्गेश्वरम् king of Anga, महाभागम् prosperous, राजसिंहस्य lion among kings, Dasaratha's, वयस्यम् friend, यशस्विनम् famous, रोमपादम् Romapada, सुसत्कृतम् well honoured, समानय bring.
data.md: Then also bring with due honours the king of Anga, and that mighty archer, the illustrious Romapada, the friend of that lion among the kings, along with his son.

data.v: प्राचीनान्सिन्धुसौवीरान्सौराष्ठ्रेयांश्च पार्थिवान् । दाक्षिणात्यान्नरेन्द्रांश्च समस्तानानयस्व ह ॥
data.es: Bring kings from the countries of the eastern and southern regions, from Sindhu, Sauvera and Saurashtra৷৷
data.anv: प्राचीनान् kings from the countries on the eastern side, सिन्धुसौवीरान् kings from Sindhu and Sauvera countries, सैराष्ट्रेयान् पार्थिवान् kings from Saurashtra, दाक्षिणात्यान् नरेन्द्रांश्च kings from south, समस्तान् all, आनयस्व ह bring (invite) them.

data.v: सन्ति स्निग्धाश्च ये चान्ये राजानः पृथिवीतले । तानानय यथाक्षिप्रं सानुगान्सहबान्धवान् ॥
data.es: Bring all other kings of this earth, who are friendly with us. Along with their retinues, families and relatives".
data.anv: पृथिवीतले on this earth, स्निग्धा: friendly, अन्ये other, राजान: kings, तान् all of them, सानुगान् along with their retinues and families, सह बान्धवान् along with their relatives, यथाक्षिप्रम् as quickly as possible, आनय bring (invite)them.

data.v: वसिष्ठवाक्यं तच्छ्रुत्वा सुमन्त्रस्त्वरितस्तदा । व्यादिशत्पुरुषांस्तत्र राज्ञामानयने शुभान् ॥
data.es: Having heard the words of Vasishta, Sumantra speedily despatched virtuous and auspicious emissaries to bring the kings.
data.anv: तत् that, वसिष्ठवाक्यम् words of Vasishta, श्रुत्वा having heard, सुमन्त्र: Sumantra, तदा then, त्वरित: speedily, तत्र there, राज्ञाम् kings, आनयने in bringing, शुभान् virtuous, पुरुषान् emissaries, व्यादिशत् ordered.
data.md: Having heard those words of Vasistha, Sumantra speedily ordered the emissaries to bring the kings.

data.v: स्वयमेव हि धर्मात्मा प्रययौ मुनिशासनात् । सुमन्त्रस्त्वरितो भूत्वा समानेतुं महीक्षितः ॥
data.es: In accordance with the ascetic's order, righteous Sumantra himself quickly set out to escort Janaka and other kings.
data.anv: धर्मात्मा righteous, सुमन्त्र: Sumantra, मुनिशासनात् in accordance with ascetic's order, त्वरितो भूत्वा become quick, महीक्षित: kings, समानेतुम् to escort, स्वयमेव himself, प्रययौ set out.
data.md: The virtuous Sumantra, in accordance with the injunction of the ascetic, himself speedily set out for the purpose of bringing the monarchs.

data.v: ते च कर्मान्तिकाः सर्वे वसिष्ठाय च धीमते । सर्वं निवेदयन्ति स्म यज्ञे यदुपकल्पितम् ॥
data.es: All the workers reported to the wise sage, Vasishta about the tasks completed for the sacrifice.
data.anv: ते those, कर्मान्तिका: workers, सर्वे all, यज्ञे in the sacrifice, यत् which, उपकल्पितम् was well arranged, सर्वम् all that, धीमते to the wise, वसिष्ठाय Vasishta, निवेदयन्ति स्म informed.
data.md: Then the servants came and informed the intelligent Vasiştha as to the articles that had been got ready for the sacrifice.

data.v: ततः प्रीतो द्विजश्रेष्ठस्तान्सर्वान्पुनरब्रवीत् । अवज्ञया न दातव्यं कस्यचिल्लीलयापि वा । अवज्ञया कृतं हन्याद्दातारं नात्र संशयः ॥
data.es: Then, well pleased, the best among brahmins (Vasishta) said to them all "Nobody should be offered any thing with disregard. Anything given with contempt undoubtedly results in the destruction of the donor."
data.anv: तत: then, प्रीत: pleased, द्विजश्रेष्ठः best among brahmins, तान् सर्वान् addressing all of them, इदम् these words, अब्रवीत् said, कस्य चित् to any one, अवज्ञया with insult, लीलयापि वा or casually, न दातव्यम् should not be gifted, अवज्ञया with contempt, कृतम् done, दातारम् donor, हन्यात् destroys, अत्र in this aspect, संशय: न no doubt.
data.md: Then well pleased that best of twice-born ones, the ascetic Vasistha, said to them, Do not give away disrespectfully or lightly. A gift bestowed with disrespect, indubitably destroy the giver.

data.v: ततः कैश्चिदहोरात्रैरुपयाता महीक्षितः । बहूनि रत्नान्यादाय राज्ञो दशरथस्य ह ॥
data.es: Meanwhile kings from several countries to travelling nights and days arrived bringing with them various kinds of (precious) gifts.
data.anv: तत: after that, महीक्षित: kings, राज्ञ: दशरथस्य for king Dasaratha, बहूनि several, रत्नानि gifts, आदाय having brought, कैश्चित् by some, अहोरात्रै: days, उपयाता: arrived.
data.md: Then for several days, kings began to pour into Dasaratha's city daily and nightly, bringing with them various kinds of gems.

data.v: ततो वसिष्ठः सुप्रीतो राजानमिदमब्रवीत् । उपयाता नरव्याघ्र राजानस्तव शासनात् ॥
data.es: Thereupon, wellpleased, Vasishta addressing Dasaratha said "O best among men, beacuse of your command, kings from various countries have arrived. I have extended due hospitality to those noble kings according to their station."
data.anv: तत: there upon, सुप्रीत: wellpleased, वसिष्ठ: Vasishta, राजानम् addressing Dasaratha, इदम् these words, अब्रवीत् said, नरव्याघ्र O Best among men, तव your, शासनात् by the  command, राजान: kings from various countries, उपयाता: have arrived, राजसत्तमा: noble kings, सर्वे all, यथार्हम् according to their merit, मया by me, सत्कृता: अपि were honoured also.
data.md: Thereupon Vasiştha well-pleased said to the king, O tiger among men, obeying your mandate the kings have come here; and I too according to merit, have received those excellent kings with respect.

data.v: मयापि सत्कृताः सर्वे यथार्हं राजसत्तमाः । यज्ञियं च कृतं राजन्पुरुषैः सुसमाहितैः ॥
निर्यातु च भवान्यष्टुं यज्ञायतनमन्तिकात् । सर्वकामैरुपहृतैरुपेतं वै समन्ततः ॥
तथा वसिष्ठवचनादृश्यशृङ्गस्य चोभयोः । शुभे दिवस नक्षत्रे निर्यातो जगतीपतिः ॥
data.es: In response to the words of Vasishta and Rsyasringa, the Lord of the earth (Dasaratha) entered the sacrificial pavilion on a favourable day presided over by an auspicious star.
data.anv: तदा then, तथा वशिष्ठवचनात् following the words of Vasishta, ऋश्यशृङ्गस्य च also of Rsyasringa, उभयो: of both of them, जगतीपति: lord of the world, शुभे on an auspicious occasion, दिवसनक्षत्रे day and star, निर्यात: had set out to the sacrificial pavillion.
data.md: Then in accordance with the injunctions of both Vasiştha and Rşyasſga, the king came to the sacrificial spot on a day presided over by an auspicious star.

data.v: ततो वसिष्ठप्रमुखाः सर्व एव द्विजोत्तमाः । ऋश्यशृङ्गं पुरस्कृत्य यज्ञकर्मारभंस्तदा ॥
data.es: At that moment the best of brahmins led by Vasishta and headed by Rsyasringa, entered the sacrificial enclosure and began the sacrifice in accordance with traditions and scriptural stipulations. इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये बालकाण्डे त्रयोदशस्सर्ग:॥Thus ends the thirteenth sarga of Balakanda of the holy Ramayana the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.
data.anv: तत: then, वसिष्ठप्रमुखा: Vasishta, being foremost in the group, सर्व एव all, द्विजोत्तमा: brahmins, यज्ञवाटगता: entered the sacred sacrificial enclosure, यथाशास्त्रम् in accordance  with scriptural laws, यथाविधि in accordance with the tradition, तदा then, ऋश्यशृङ्गम् Rsyasringa, पुरस्कृत्य headed by, यज्ञकर्म sacrificial rites, आरभन् began.
data.md: Then, with, Rsyasrriga at their head, Vasistha and the other principal Brāhmaṇas wending to the sacrificial ground, began the ceremony, according to the ordinance; and in due form. And the auspicious king, in company with his wives, was initiated into the ceremony.

data.v: अथ संवत्सरे पूर्णे तस्मिन्प्राप्ते तुरङ्गमे । सरय्वाश्चोत्तरे तीरे राज्ञो यज्ञोऽभ्यवर्तत ॥
data.es: After completion of one year when the sacrificial horse had returned, the sacrifice by the king (Dasaratha) commenced on the northern bank of river Sarayu.
data.anv: अथ after that, संवत्सरे when one year's time, पूर्णे (सति) was completed, तस्मिन् when that, तुरङ्गमे sacrificial horse, प्राप्ते (सति) had returned, सरय्वा: of river Sarayu, उत्तरे तीरे on the northern bank, राज्ञ: यज्ञश्च sacrifice by the king, अभ्यवर्तत commenced.
data.md: After the expiry of full one year, when the sacrificial horse had returned, the sacrifice, of the king commenced on the north bank of the Sarayu.

data.v: ऋश्यशृङ्गं पुरस्कृत्य कर्म चक्रुर्द्विजर्षभाः । अश्वमेधे महायज्ञे राज्ञोऽस्य सुमहात्मनः ॥
data.es: The best of brahmins led by Rsyasringa performed the rituals of aswamedha organised by the exceedingly magnanimous king.
data.anv: सुमहात्मन: of the exceedingly magnanimous, अस्य राज्ञ: this king's, अश्वमेधे महायज्ञे Aswamedha sacrifice, द्विजर्षभा: best among brahmins, ऋष्यशृङ्गम् Rsyasringa, पुरस्कृत्य led by, कर्म चक्रु: performed the rituals.
data.md: And with Rşyasſága at their head, the principal twice-born ones began the proceedings in that mighty horse-sacrifice of that high-souled monarch.

data.v: कर्म कुर्वन्ति विधिवद्याजका वेदपारगाः । यथाविधि यथान्यायं परिक्रामन्ति शास्त्रतः ॥
data.es: The chief priests, masters of the Vedas, conducted the rituals in consonance with traditions and scriptures. They officiated in conformity with duties laid down in the Vedas and according to law.
data.anv: वेदपारगा: scholars who mastered vedas fully, याजका: chief priests, विधिवत् in consonance with tradition and scriptures, कर्म tasks, कुर्वन्ति carried out, यथाविधि in conformity with duties laid down in vedas, यथान्यायम् according to law, शास्त्रत: as laid down in scriptures, परिक्रामन्ति move about (officiated).
data.md: And the priests, each duly and according to the ordinance performing his proper part, engaged in the ceremony in consonance with the scriptures.

data.v: प्रवर्ग्यं शास्त्रतः कृत्वा तथैवोपसदं द्विजाः । चक्रुश्च विधिवत्सर्वमधिकं कर्म शास्त्रतः ॥
data.es: Brahmins performed pravargya and upasada and other ceremonies as per the scriptures and traditions.
data.anv: द्विजा: brahmins, प्रवर्ग्यम् Pravargya (a particular part of the sacrifice), शास्त्रत: according to scriptures, कृत्वा having done, तथैव and, उपसदम् Upasada (another part of the sacrifice), विधिवत् as per tradition, अधिकम् still other, सर्वं कर्म ceremonies, शास्त्रत: according to ordinance, चक्रु: performed.
data.md: And the regenerate ones, having performed the pravargya as well as the upasada according to the ordinance, duly completed the additional ceremonies. Then, worshipping the deities with glad hearts, those foremost of ascetics duly performed the morning ablutions and the other prescribed rites.

data.v: अभिपूज्य ततो हृष्टाः सर्वे चक्रुर्यथाविधि । प्रातःसवनपूर्वाणि कर्माणि मुनिपुंगवाः ॥
data.es: Thereafter the eminent ascetics, rejoicing in their hearts performed the worship (of celestial beings) and conducted the prescribed rituals starting with morning ablutions etc.
data.anv: तत: thereafter, मुनिपुङ्गवा: eminent ascetics, हृष्टा: rejoiced in their hearts, अभिपूज्य worshipping those celestial beings, प्रातस्सवनपूर्वाणि starting with Pratah savanadi (morning ablutions etc), कर्माणि rituals, यथाविधि as prescribed, चक्रु: performed.
data.md: And the regenerate ones, having performed the pravargya as well as the upasada according to the ordinance, duly completed the additional ceremonies. Then, worshipping the deities with glad hearts, those foremost of ascetics duly performed the morning ablutions and the other prescribed rites.

data.v: न चाहुतमभूत्तत्र स्खलितं वापि किंचन । दृश्यते ब्रह्मवत्सर्वं क्षेमयुक्तं हि चक्रिरे ॥
data.es: There were no omissions in the offerings nor any lappes in the performance. Everything was done through recitation of mantras and in a wholesome way.
data.anv: तत्र in that sacrifice, आहुतम् omissions in the offerings, नाभूत् did not take place, किञ्चन any thing, स्खलितम् defects or mistakes, नाभूत् did not take place, सर्वम् everything, ब्रह्मवत् with mantras (prayers), दृश्यते appeared, क्षेमयुक्तम् in a safe manner, चक्रिरे हि performed.
data.md: And no part of the ceremony was performed improperly, or left out, and every thing was satisfactorily celebrated with mantras.

data.v: न तेष्वहःसु श्रान्तो वा क्षुधितो वापि दृश्यते । नाविद्वान्ब्राह्मणस्तत्र नाशतानुचरस्तथा ॥
data.es: During the days (of sacrifice) none felt tired or hungry. There was no brahmin who was not learned or had less than a hundred followers (or disciples).
data.anv: तेषु in those, अहस्सु days, श्रान्त: a tired man, क्षुधितो वापि or hungry one, न दृश्यते was not to be seen, तत्र there, अविद्वान् not learned, ब्राह्मण: brahmin, न दृश्यते not to be seen, तथा similarly, अशतानुचर: a man followed by less than hundred people, न दृश्यते was not seen.
data.md: And on that day no Brāhmaṇa ever felt tired, or hungry and there was none that was not learned, or that was not followed by an hundred persons.

data.v: ब्राह्मणा भुञ्जते नित्यं नाथवन्तश्च भुञ्जते । तापसा भुञ्जते चापि श्रमणा भुञ्जते तथा ॥
data.es: During that period brahmanas as well as those who have masters, (the sudras), ascetics and monks had enough to eat.
data.anv: नित्यम् continually, ब्राह्मणा: brahmanas, भुञ्जते are eating, नाथवन्तश्च those who have  masters, भुञ्जते are eating, तापसाश्चापि ascetics, भुञ्जते are eating, तथा and, श्रमणा: monks, भुञ्जते are eating.
data.md: Brāhmaṇas, and Śūdras having among them ascetics, and Sramanas, and the aged, and the infirm, and women, and children, were continually fed. And although they ate their fill, yet they know no repletion.

data.v: वृद्धाश्च व्याधिताश्चैव स्त्रियो बालास्तथैव च । अनिशं भुञ्जमानानां न तृप्तिरुपलभ्यते ॥
data.es: The aged, the sick, women and also children ate there and knew no limit to their enjoyment.
data.anv: वृद्धा: aged persons, व्याधिताश्चैव sick people, स्त्रिय: women, तथैव च and also, बाला: children, अनिशम् continually, भुञ्जमानानाम् although feasting, तृप्ति: full satisfaction, न उपलभ्यते is not acheeved.
data.md: Brāhmaṇas, and Śūdras having among them ascetics, and Sramanas, and the aged, and the infirm, and women, and children, were continually fed. And although they ate their fill, yet they know no repletion.

data.v: दीयतां दीयतामन्नं वासांसि विविधानि च । इति संचोदितास्तत्र तथा चक्रुरनेकशः ॥
data.es: "Give food, give, various kinds of clothes" echoed the organisers. And they (in charge of distribution) did.
data.anv: अन्नम् food, दीयतां दीयताम् may be given, may be given, विविधानि various kinds of, वासांसि च clothes also, इति in this manner, तत्र in that sacrificial ground, सञ्चोदिता: persuaded by, अनेकश: profusely, तथा in the same manner, चक्रु: performed.
data.md: And Give food, and clothes of various kinds (was heard all around) And those employed in the task gave away profusely.

data.v: अन्नकूटाश्च बहवो दृश्यन्ते पर्वतोपमाः । दिवसे दिवसे तत्र सिद्धस्य विधिवत्तदा ॥
data.es: There, could be seen day after day heaps of nicely cooked food, looking like mountains.
data.anv: तत्र there, तदा then, विधिवत् in accordance with scriptures, सिद्धस्य kept ready, अन्नकूटा: heaps of food, बहव: many, पर्वतोपमा: looking like mountains, दिवसे दिवसे every day, दृश्यन्ते were to be seen.
data.md: And every day food dressed properly in due form was to be seen in countless heaps resembling hills.

data.v: अन्नं हि विधिवत्स्वादु प्रशंसन्ति द्विजर्षभाः । अहो तृप्ताः स्म भद्रं ते इति शुश्राव राघवः ॥
data.es: Brahmins having tasted the delicious food cooked in prescribed manner, praised saying "Ah We are fully satisfied. Prosperity to you". Such were the words heard by king Dasaratha.
data.anv: द्विजर्षभा: the twiceborns, विधिवत् cooked in prescribed manner, साधु good (delicious), अन्नम् food, प्रशंसन्ति praised, राघव: son of Raghu, Dasaratha, अहो Ah, तृप्ता: स्म fully satisfied, ते to you, भद्रम् prosperity, इति such words, शुश्राव were heard.
data.md: The foremost regenerate ones said, The viands have been prepared in the prescribed form, and they taste excellent. We have been gratified. God bless you! All this was heard by the descendant of Raghu.

data.v: स्वलंकृताश्च पुरुषा ब्राह्मणान्पर्यवेषयन् । उपासते च तानन्ये सुमृष्टमणिकुण्डलाः ॥
data.es: While brahmins were being served with food by welldressed men, some others wearing pendents studded with shining jewels assisted them.
data.anv: स्वलङ्कृता: well dressed, पुरुषा: men, ब्राह्मणान् brahmins, पर्यवेषयन् served with, सुमृष्टमणिकुण्डला: wearing pendents bedecked with shining jewels, अन्ये च some others, तान् them, उपासते assisted.
data.md: Persons adorned with ornaments distributed the victuals among the Brāhmaṇas, and they were assisted by others wearing jewelled pendants.

data.v: कर्मान्तरे तदा विप्रा हेतुवादान्बहूनपि । प्राहुः सुवाग्मिनो धीराः परस्परजिगीषया ॥
data.es: In the interval between ceremonies, eloquent and sagacious brahmins were engaged in various disputations, desirous of victory.
data.anv: तदा then, वाग्मिन: eloquent, धीरा: sagacious, विप्रा: brahmins, तदा then, कर्मान्तरे in between ceremonies, परस्परजिगीषया mutually desirous of victory, बहून् various, हेतुवादान् disputations, प्राहु: च engaged.
data.md: In the interval between the completion of one bath and the beginning of the next, mild and eloquent Vipras, desirous of victory, engaged in various disputations.

data.v: दिवसे दिवसे तत्र संस्तरे कुशला द्विजाः । सर्वकर्माणि चक्रुस्ते यथाशास्त्रं प्रचोदिताः ॥
data.es: Every day in that sacrifice brahmins, skilful in rituals, persuaded (by sage Vasishta), performed all their duties as per tradition.
data.anv: संस्तरे in the sacrifice, कुशला: skilful, द्विजा: brahmins, दिवसे दिवसे every day, तत्र there, प्रचोदिता: persuaded by sage Vasistha, सर्वकर्माणि all their duties, यथाशास्त्रम् as per tradition, चक्रु: performed.
data.md: Every day in that sacrifice, skilful Brāhmaṇas, engaged in the ceremony, did everything, according to the ritual.

data.v: नाषडङ्गविदत्रासीन्नाव्रतो नाबहुश्रुतः । सदस्यस्तस्य वै राज्ञो नावादकुशलो द्विजः ॥
data.es: Here (in this sacrificial pavillion), there was none who was not versed in six Vedangas, not true to vows, not learned in many sastras nor adept in discussions (on sastras).
data.anv: अत्र in this sacrificial pavillion, अषडङ्गवित् not versed in six vedangas, नासीत् not there, अव्रत: unfaithful to vowed observances, न not there, अबहुश्रुत: not learned in many shastras, न not there, तस्य राज्ञ: that king's, सदस्या: assistants at a sacrifice, नावादकुशला: not skilful in disputations in shastras, न वै not there.
data.md: There was no twice-born one that was not versed in the Vedas and the Vedāngas, or that did not observe vows, or that was not profoundly learned, nor did any assist at the sacrifice that could not argue ably.

data.v: प्राप्ते यूपोच्छ्रये तस्मिन्षड्बैल्वाः खादिरास्तथा । तावन्तो बिल्वसहिताः पर्णिनश्च तथापरे ॥
data.es: When the time came to erect sacrificial posts, six posts each made of bilva and khadira wood and many made of parni wood along, one of sleshmataka and two of devadaru wood, with a distance of two outstretched hands between them were erected.
data.anv: तस्मिन् in that sacrifice, यूपोच्छ्रये in erecting sacrificial posts, प्राप्ते (सति) when the time, बैल्वा: bilva wood, षट् six, तथा and, बिल्वसहिता: along with bilva posts, तावन्त: as many, खादिरा: Khadira, तथा and, पर्णिन: च having leaves, अपरे some more posts, एक: one, श्लेष्मातकमय: made of Sleshmataka, तथा and, देवदारुमय: made of trees of Devadaru, तत्र there, द्वौ two, बाहुव्यस्तपरिग्रहावेव at a distance of two outstretched hands, विहितौ were erected.
data.md: And when the time came for planting the Yüpas of bilva, as many of catechu, and as many of Palasa, and one of Sleşmätaka, and two of Devadāru well-made and measuring two outstretched arms.

data.v: श्लेष्मातकमयो दिष्टो देवदारुमयस्तथा । द्वावेव तत्र विहितौ बाहुव्यस्तपरिग्रहौ ॥
data.md: And when the time came for planting the Yüpas of bilva, as many of catechu, and as many of Palasa, and one of Sleşmätaka, and two of Devadāru well-made and measuring two outstretched arms.

data.v: कारिताः सर्व एवैते शास्त्रज्ञैर्यज्ञकोविदैः । शोभार्थं तस्य यज्ञस्य काञ्चनालंकृता भवन् ॥
data.es: All these posts were prepared by knowers of sastras and by those wellversed in the performance of sacrifices. They were decorated with gold to add elegance to the sacrifice.
data.anv: शास्त्रज्ञै: by the knowers of shastras, यज्ञकोविदै: who well versed in performance of sacrifice, कारिता: were made, एते सर्वे एव all these posts, तस्य यज्ञस्य of that sacrifice, शोभार्थम् for elegance, काञ्चनालङ्कृता: decorated with gold, अभवन् became.

data.v: विन्यस्ता विधिवत्सर्वे शिल्पिभिः सुकृता दृढाः । अष्टाश्रयः सर्व एव श्लक्ष्णरूपसमन्विताः ॥
data.es: All those posts, strong with eight sides and finely finished surfaces, wellcarved by sculptors were duly erected.
data.anv: सर्वे all of them, शिल्पिभि: by the sculptors, सुकृता: were well carved, दृढा: strong, अष्टाश्रय: having eight sides, श्लक्ष्णरूपसमन्विता: had finely finished surfaces, सर्वे all those, विधिवत् as per tradition, विन्यस्ता: were erected.

data.v: आच्छादितास्ते वासोभिः पुष्पैर्गन्धैश्च भूषिताः । सप्तर्षयो दीप्तिमन्तो विराजन्ते यथा दिवि ॥
data.es: Decorated with flowers and sandal paste and covered with cloths, stood the bright sacrificial posts shining like seven sages in the sky.
data.anv: वासोभि: with cloths, आच्छादिता: were covered, पुष्पै: with flowers, गन्धैश्च with sandalwood paste, भूषिता: decorated, ते those posts, दीप्तिमन्त: glowing, दिवि in the sky, सप्तर्षय: seven sages, यथा in a similar manner, विराजन्ते illuminated.
data.md: And being wrapped up in cloths, and worshipped with flowers, they looked like the seven Rșis appearing in the welkin.

data.v: इष्टकाश्च यथान्यायं कारिताश्च प्रमाणतः । चितोऽग्निर्ब्राह्मणैस्तत्र कुशलैः शुल्बकर्मणि ॥
data.es: The sacrificial fireplace was constructed with bricks with standard measurement by brahmins who were experts in the art of measuring land with a string or single strand.
data.anv: तत्र there, यथान्यायम् as per shastras, प्रमाणत: with standard measurement, इष्टका: bricks, कारिता were made, शुल्बकर्मणि in the science of construction using a measuring rope, कुशलै: accomplished, ब्राह्मणै: brahmins, अग्नि: sacrificial fire place, चित: gathered and laid bricks were prepared as per standard measurment mentioned in shastras.
data.md: And an adequate number of bricks was also duly made (for the ceremony.) And Brāhmaṇas accomplished in the arts constructed the sacrificial fire-place with those bricks.

data.v: स चित्यो राजसिंहस्य संचितः कुशलैर्द्विजैः । गरुडो रुक्मपक्षो वै त्रिगुणोऽष्टादशात्मकः ॥
data.es: That sacrificial altar of the lion among kings, (Dasaratha), erected by welltrained brahmins was in the shape of the golden winged 'Garuda' it had three ranges and thrice as many fireplaces i.e eighteen in number.
data.anv: कुशलै: by the skilled, द्विजै: brahmins, रुक्मपक्ष: golden winged, त्रिगुण: thrice, अष्टादशात्मक: eighteen in number, गरुड: like eagle, राजसिंहस्य of Dasaratha who was lion among kings, सचित्य: sacrificial altar, सञ्चित: was erected.

data.v: नियुक्तास्तत्र पशवस्तत्तदुद्दिश्य दैवतम् । उरगाः पक्षिणश्चैव यथाशास्त्रं प्रचोदिताः । शामित्रे तु हयस्तत्र तथा जल चराश्च ये ॥
data.es: Animals, serpents and birds were kept ready after the sastras intended (for sacrifice) for those respective deities.
data.anv: तत्र there, यथाशास्त्रम् as per tradition, प्रचोदिता: prompted, पशव: animals, उरगा: serpants, पक्षिणश्चैव birds also, तत्तत् that respective, दैवतम् deity,  उद्दिश्य intended for, नियुक्ता: were fastened.
data.md: That fire-place of that lion among kings, set by skilful Brāhmaṇas, consisting on three sides of eighteen bricks, looked like the goldenwinged Garuda. And for the purpose of sacrificing them to the respective deities were collect beasts and reptiles, and birds, and horses, and aquatic animals. And the priests sacrificed all these in proper form.

data.v: ऋत्विग्भिः सर्वमेवैतन्नियुक्तं शास्त्रतस्तदा । पशूनां त्रिशतं तत्र यूपेषु नियतं तदा । अश्वरत्नोत्तमं तस्य राज्ञो दशरथस्य ह ॥
data.es: Three hundred animals and the jewel of the horses (from the stables) belonging to king Dasaratha were bound to the sacrificial posts.
data.anv: तदा then, तत्र there, पशूनाम् of animals, त्रिशतम् three hundred, तस्य राज्ञ: that king's, अश्वरत्नोत्तमम् the excellent of the horses from the stables, यूपेषु to the sacrificial posts, नियतम् was bound.
data.md: And to these Yūpas were bound, three hundred beasts, as well as the foremost of the best horses belonging to king Dasaratha.

data.v: कौसल्या तं हयं तत्र परिचर्य समन्ततः । कृपाणैर्विशशासैनं त्रिभिः परमया मुदा ॥
data.es: Kausalya, with immense glee having gone round and worshipped that horse, severed it with three strokes of scimitar.
data.anv: तत्र there, कौशल्या Kausalya, तम् that, हयम् horse, समन्तत: from all sides, परिचर्य having worshipped worship, परमया with immense, मुदा glee, त्रिभि: by three strokes of, कृपाणै: scimitar, एनम् this, विशशास severed.
data.md: Then Kausalyā, having performed the preliminary rites, with three strokes slew that horse, experiencing great glee.

data.v: पतत्रिणा तदा सार्धं सुस्थितेन च चेतसा । अवसद्रजनीमेकां कौसल्या धर्मकाम्यया ॥
data.es: Kausalya, in her devotion to duty and with a happy state of mind, passed one night near that horse.
data.anv: तदा then, कौशल्या Kausalya, सुस्थितेन चेतसा with a stable mind, धर्मकाम्यया with devotion to duty, पतत्रिणा सार्थम् near that horse, एकाम् one, रजनीम् night, अवसत् spent.
data.md: And with the view of reaping merit, Kausalyā, with an undisturbed heart passed one night with that horse furnished with wings.

data.v: होताध्वर्युस्तथोद्गाता हयेन समयोजयन् । महिष्या परिवृक्त्याथ वावातामपरां तथा ॥
data.es: Hota, Adhvaryu and Udgata arranged Mahishi, Parivritti, Vavaata and another woman known as Palakali to touch (keep the company of) the sacrificial horse.
data.anv: होता Hota, अध्वर्यु: Adhvaryu, तथा and, उद्गाता Udgata, महिष्या with Mahishi (principal queen at the time of coronation), परिवृत्त्या च (overlooked wife) Parivritti, वावाताम् (a courtesan) Vavaata, अपराम् (attender on the king) other woman (known as Palakali), हस्तेन with hand, समयोजयन् touched.
data.md: Hotás and Adhvaryus, and the Udgatás joined the king's Vāvātā along with his Mahișī and Parivrtti.* And priests of subdued senses, wellup in sacrificial rites, began to offer oblations with the fat of the winged-horse, according to the ordinance. *The Kșatriya kings could marry wives from among Kșatriyas, Vaişyas and Śūdras. The Kșatriya wife is called Mahiși, the Vaişya wife Vávātā and the Śūdra wife Parivrtti.

data.v: पतत्रिणस्तस्य वपामुद्धृत्य नियतेन्द्रियः । ऋत्विक्परम संपन्नः श्रपयामास शास्त्रतः ॥
data.es: The official priest, highly knowledgeable in scriptures and having restrained senses, removed the marrow from the horse and cooked it according to tradition.
data.anv: नियतेन्द्रिय: a man of restrained senses, परमसम्पन्न: very rich in the knowledge of scriptures, ऋत्विक् official priest, तस्य that, पतत्रिण: horse's, वपाम् marrow, उद्धृत्य having removed, शास्त्रत: according to tradition, श्रपयामास cooked.
data.md: Hotás and Adhvaryus, and the Udgatás joined the king's Vāvātā along with his Mahișī and Parivrtti.* And priests of subdued senses, wellup in sacrificial rites, began to offer oblations with the fat of the winged-horse, according to the ordinance. *The Kșatriya kings could marry wives from among Kșatriyas, Vaişyas and Śūdras. The Kșatriya wife is called Mahiși, the Vaişya wife Vávātā and the Śūdra wife Parivrtti.

data.v: धूमगन्धं वपायास्तु जिघ्रति स्म नराधिपः । यथाकालं यथान्यायं निर्णुदन्पापमात्मनः ॥
data.es: The king at appropriate time and in agreement with the scriptures inhaled the odour of the smoke (from the burnt marrow) and absolved himself of his sins.
data.anv: नराधिप: king Dasaratha, यथाकालम् in an appropriate time, यथान्यायम् in agreement with the scriptures, आत्मन: his own, पापम् sins, निर्णुदन् while getting rid of, वपाया: of the  marrow, धूमगन्धम् good odour of the smoke, जिघ्रति स्म inhaled.
data.md: The lord of men, desirous of removing his sins, at the proper time smelt the odour of the smoke arising from the fat, agreeably to the scriptures.

data.v: हयस्य यानि चाङ्गानि तानि सर्वाणि ब्राह्मणाः । अग्नौ प्रास्यन्ति विधिवत्समस्ताः षोडशर्त्विजः ॥
