data.anv: स्वबाहुबलम् strength of your own arms, आश्रित्य employing, दुष्टचारिणीम् this one of wicked deeds, इमाम् her, जहि slay,मन्नियोगात् by my order, इमं देशम् this country, पुन: again, निष्कण्टकम् devoid of that thorn, कुरु do it (make it habitable).

data.v: न हि कश्चिदिमं देशं शक्रोत्यागन्तुमीदृशम् । यक्षिण्या घोरया राम उत्सादितमसह्यया ॥
data.es: O Rama none dare approach this country ravaged by such dreadful, intolerable yakshini.
data.anv: राम O Rama, घोरया by the dreadful, असह्यया by the intolerable, यक्षिण्या yakshini, उत्सादितम् destroyed, ईदृशम् such, इमम् देशम् this country, आगन्तुम् to approach, कश्चित् any one, न शक्नोति is not capable.

data.v: एतत्ते सर्वमाख्यातं यथैतद्दरुणं वनम् । यक्ष्या चोत्सादितं सर्वमद्यापि न निवर्तते ॥
data.es: You have been told the manner in which this fierce forest is entirely ruined by that cruel yakshini. Tell now she has not left this place".इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये बालकाण्डे चतुर्विंशतिस्सर्ग:॥Thus ends the twentyfourth sarga of Balakanda of the holy Ramayana the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.
data.anv: एतत् वनम् this forest, सर्वम् entirely, दारुणम् cruel, यक्ष्या by the yakshi,  यथा in such a  manner, उत्सादितम् ruined, अद्यापि even now, यथा in a manner, न निवर्तते does not go  back, एतत् सर्वम् all this, ते to you, आख्यातम् has been told.
data.md: O Rāma, by the dreadful and unbearable Yakşiņi. And now I have related to you all about this fearful forest. And to this day none is capable of letting that Yakşiņi from committing ravages right an left.

data.v: अथ तस्याप्रमेयस्य मुनेर्वचनमुत्तमम् । श्रुत्वा पुरुषशार्दूलः प्रत्युवाच शुभां गिरम् ॥
data.es: On hearing the excellent words of Viswamitra, a sage with unimaginable faculty. Rama, the tiger among men (Rama) replied in a, gentle voice:
data.anv: अप्रमेयस्य having super human faculty beyond comprehension, तस्य मुने: that sage's, उत्तमम् excellent, वचनम् words, श्रुत्वा having heard, पुरुषशार्दूल: greatest among men, शुभाम् auspicious, गिरम् speech, प्रत्युवाच replied.
data.md: Hearing this excellent speech of that ascetic of immeasurable energy, that foremost of men answered him in these happy words,

data.v: अल्पवीर्या यदा यक्षाः श्रूयन्ते मुनिपुंगव । कथं नागसहस्रस्य धारयत्यबला बलम् ॥
data.es: "O best of ascetics, I have heard the yakshas possess little prowess. How can a woman who is by gender weak possess the strength of a thousand elephants?
data.anv: मुनिपुङ्गव O Best of ascetics, यक्षा: yakshas, अल्पवीर्या: possess little prowess, यदा श्रूयन्ते since it is being heard, अबला a woman, नागसहस्रस्य thousand elephants', बलम् strength, कथम् how, धारयति possesses.
data.md: O best of ascetics, I have heard that the Yakşa race is endowed with but small prowess. How can then that one of the weaker sex possess the strength of a thousand elephants?

data.v: विश्वामित्रोऽब्रवीद्वाक्यं शृणु येन बलोत्तरा । वरदानकृतं वीर्यं धारयत्यबला बलम् ॥
data.es: Viswamitra said, "Listen, how she acquired the prowess and strength by virtue of a boon she received.
data.anv: विश्वामित्र: Visvamitra, वाक्यम् words, अब्रवीत् spoke, अबला a woman, येन for which ever  reason, बलोत्तरा acquired great strength, शृणु you may listen, वरदानकृतम् by virtue of a boon, वीर्यम् prowess, बलम् strength, धारयति possesses.
data.md: Hearing this speech that was uttered by Rāghava of immeasurable energy, Viśvāmitra, delighting with his amiable words that subduer of foes, Rāma, and Laksmana, said, Do you listen as to the means whereby attaining terrible strength, that one belonging to the weaker sex has come to possess strength and prowess by virtue of a boon.

data.v: पूर्वमासीन्महायक्षः सुकेतुर्नाम वीर्यवान् । अनपत्यः शुभाचारः स च तेपे महत्तपः ॥
data.es: "In the past there was a powerful and great yaksha by name Suketu. He had no children. So he performed an intense penance following virtuous practices.
data.anv: पूर्वम् in the days past, सुकेतुर्नाम named Suketu, वीर्यवान् powerful, महायक्ष: great yaksha, आसीत् existed, अनपत्य: he was without children, स: he, शुभाचार: one with pure practices,  महत्  great, तप: penance, तेपे performed.
data.md: In former times there was a mighty and exceedingly powerful Yaksa, named Suketu. And he had no issue. And he was of pure practices, and used to perform rigid austerities.

data.v: पितामहस्तु सुप्रीतस्तस्य यक्षपतेस्तदा । कन्यारत्नं ददौ राम ताटकां नाम नामतः ॥
data.es: Rama the grandsire Brahma was highly gratified and granted to the king of yakshas, the gem of a daughter by name known asTataka.
data.anv: राम O Rama, तदा then, पितामह: Brahma, सुप्रीत: highly gratified, तस्य यक्षपते: towards  that king of yakshas, नामत: by name, नाम wellknown as, ताटकां Tataka, कन्यारत्नम् gem of a daughter, ददौ granted.
data.md: And, O Rāma, the Grand-sire endowed her with that lord of Yakşas, conferred upon him a gem of a daughter, by name Tāțakā.

data.v: ददौ नागसहस्रस्य बलं चास्याः पितामहः । न त्वेव पुत्रं यक्षाय ददौ ब्रह्मा महायशाः ॥
data.es: The illustrious grandsire Brahma granted her the strength of a thousand elephants, but did not bestow a son on the yaksha.
data.anv: पितामह: lord Brahma, अस्या: for her, नागसहस्रस्य thousand elephants, बलम् strength, ददौ  granted, महायशा: that illustrious, ब्रह्मा lord Brahma, यक्षाय for that yaksha, पुत्रं तु son, न ददौ did not bestow.
data.md: And the Grand-sire endowed her with the strength of a thousand elephants; yet that illustrious one did not bestow a son on that Yaksa.

data.v: तां तु जातां विवर्धन्तीं रूपयौवनशालिनीम् । जम्भपुत्राय सुन्दाय ददौ भार्यां यशस्विनीम् ॥
data.es: As she grew up, glowing with youth and beauty she was given in marriage to Sunda, son of Jharjha.
data.anv: जाताम् born, विवर्धन्तीम् as she was growing, रूपयौवनशालिनीम् shining with youthful charm and beauty, यशस्विनीम् glorious, ताम् her, झर्झपुत्राय son of Jharjha, सुन्दाय for Sunda, भार्याम् as wife, ददौ gave.
data.md: When she had grown, and attained youth and beauty, he gave that famous damsel to Jambha's son, Sunda, for wife.

data.v: कस्यचित्त्वथ कालल्स्य यक्षी पुत्रं व्यजायत । मारीचं नाम दुर्धर्षं यः शापाद्राक्षसोऽभवत् ॥
data.es: After some time that yakshini gave birth to an unassailable son by name Maricha. Because of a curse, he became a rakshasa (though born of yaksha parentage).
data.anv: अथ thereafter, कस्यचित् कालस्य after some time, यक्षी the female yakshi,Tataka, मारीचं नाम by name Maricha, दुर्धर्षम् unassailable, पुत्रम् son, अजायत gave birth, य: he, शापात् because of the curse, राक्षस: अभवत् became rakshasa.
data.md: After a length of time, that Yakṣī gave birth to a son, named Mārīca, possessed of irrepressible energy, him who became a Rākṣasa in consequence of a curse.

data.v: सुन्दे तु निहते राम अगस्त्यमृषिसत्तमम् । ताटका सह पुत्रेण प्रधर्षयितुमिच्छति ॥
data.es: O Rama when Sunda died Tataka along with her son wanted to attack Agastya, the best of sages.
data.anv: राम: O Rama, सुन्दे when Sunda, निहते was killed, सा ताटका that Tataka, पुत्रेण सह along with her son, ऋषिसत्तमम् excellent of sages, अगस्त्यम् Agastya, प्रधर्षयितुम् to attack him, इच्छति desires(ed).
data.md: O Rāma, when Sunda had been destroyed, Tat akā along with her son, set her heart upon afflicting that excellent saint Agastya.

data.v: राक्षसत्वं भजस्वेति मारीचं व्याजहार सः । अगस्त्यः परमक्रुद्धस्ताटकामपि शप्तवान् ॥
पुरुषादी महायक्षी विरूपा विकृतानना । इदं रूपमपहाय दारुणं रूपमस्तु ते ॥
data.es: Mighty angry, Agastya cursed Tataka saying, 'Abandon this form of a great yakshini and assume the terrible figure of a rakshasi, a cannibal with distorted appearance and a hideous countenance'.
data.anv: परमक्रुद्ध: exceedingly wrathful, अगस्त्य: Agastya, ताटकामपि Tataka also, शप्तवान् cursed, इदं रूपम् this form, विहाय abandoning, अथ thereafter, विरूपा disfigured shape, विकृतानना hideous countenance, पुरुषादी becoming a cannibal, महायक्षी great yakshi, ते to you, दारुणं रूपम् अस्तु let it be a terrible form.
data.md: And, in exceeding wrath, he also cursed Tataka. And, O mighty Yaksi, since in frightful guise with a frightful face you have desired to eat up a human being, do you immediately leave this (your original) shape, and become of a terrible form!

data.v: सैषा शापकृतामर्षा ताटका क्रोधमूर्छिता । देशमुत्सादयत्येनमगस्त्यचरितं शुभम् ॥
data.es: Enraged at the curse, senseless, Tataka with anger, has been ravaging this sacred land when Agastya walked.
data.anv: शापकृतामर्षा enraged at the curse, सा एषा ताटका this same Tataka, क्रोधमूर्छिता has become senseless with anger, अगस्त्यचरितम् place tread over by Agstya, शुभम् sacred, एनं देशम् this land, उत्सादयति is destroying.
data.md: Thus cursed by Agastya, Tățakā, overwhelmed with rage, lays waste this fair region, where Agastya carry on his austerities.

data.v: एनां राघव दुर्वृत्तां यक्षीं परमदारुणाम् । गोब्राह्मणहितार्थाय जहि दुष्टपराक्रमाम् ॥
data.es: O Rama for the welfare of cows and brahmins, slay this yakshini who is wicked, extremely cruel and possessing vile prowess.
data.anv: राघव (राम) O Rama, दुर्वृत्ताम् wicked, परमदारुणाम् highly cruel, दुष्टपराक्रमाम् having vile prowess, एनां यक्षीम् this yakshi, गोब्राह्मणहितार्थाय for the welfare of brahmins and the cows, जहि you may slay her.
data.md: Do you, O descendant of Raghu, for the welfare of Brāhmaṇas and kine, slay this exceedingly terrible Yakṣī of wicked ways and vile prowess!

data.v: न ह्येनां शापसंसृष्टां कश्चिदुत्सहते पुमान् । निहन्तुं त्रिषु लोकेषु त्वामृते रघुनन्दन ॥
data.es: O son of Raghu's dynasty she is maligned by the curse, and so not a single man in the three worlds except you, is competent to slay this yakshini.
data.anv: रघुनन्दन O Rama, शापसम्स्पृष्टाम् maligned by the curse, एनाम् this yakshini, निहन्तुम् to slay, त्वां ऋते except you, कश्चित् पुमान् a single man, त्रिषु लोकेषु in three worlds, न उत्सहते हि not inclined.
data.md: Nor, O son of Raghu, does any one in the three worlds, save, you, dare to slay this Yaksi joined with a curse.

data.v: न हि ते स्त्रीवधकृते घृणा कार्या नरोत्तम । चातुर्वर्ण्यहितार्थाय कर्तव्यं राजसूनुना ॥
data.es: O best among men you need not hate killing a woman. You are a prince. You should serve the interest of the four orders of the society.
data.anv: नरोत्तम O Best among men, स्त्रीवधकृते by the act of slaying a woman, ते to you, घृणा pity न कार्या need not be shown, राजसूनुना by a prince, चातुर्वर्ण्यहितार्थाय in the interests four orders of the society, कर्तव्यम् should be done.
data.md: Nor should you, O best of men, shrink from slaying a woman; for even this should be accomplished by a prince in the interests of the four orders.

data.v: राज्यभारनियुक्तानामेष धर्मः सनातनः । अधर्म्यां जहि काकुत्स्थ धर्मो ह्यस्या न विद्यते ॥
data.es: This is the eternal law binding those who are appointed to bear the burden of a kingdom. O Kakutstha kill her. She knows no dharma.
data.anv: राज्यभारनियुक्तानाम् for those who enjoined by the burden of royalty, एष: this one, सनातन: eternal, धर्म: law, काकुत्स्थ O Kakusthsa, अधर्म्याम् unjust (Tataka ), जहि kill her, अस्या: for this Tataka, धर्म: righteousness, न विद्यते हि knows not.
data.md: Of those engaged in the onerous task of government, even this is the eternal rule of conduct. Do you, O Kākutstha, slay this impious one; for she know no righteousness!

data.v: श्रूयते हि पुरा शक्रो विरोचनसुतां नृप । पृथिवीं हन्तुमिच्छन्तीं मन्थरामभ्यसूदयत् ॥
data.es: O Prince It is heard that in the past Indra slew Manthara, Virochana's daughter who intended to destroy the earth.
data.anv: नृप O Prince, पुरा in the days of the past, पृथिवीम् this earth, हन्तुम् to destroy, इच्छन्तीम् intending, विरोचनसुताम् daughter of Virochana, मन्थराम् Manthara, शक्र: Indra, अभ्यसूदयत् slew, श्रूयते हि it is heard.
data.md: We hear, O king, that in days of yore, ſakra slew Virocana's daughter, Mantharā, who had intended to destroy the earth.

data.v: विष्णुना च पुरा राम भृगुपत्नी दृढव्रता । अनिन्द्रं लोकमिच्छन्ती काव्यमाता निषूदिता ॥
data.es: O Rama in olden times, the mother of Kavya and the wife of sage Bhrigu, determined to make this world devoid of Indra was destroyed by Visnu.
data.anv: राम O Rama, पुरा in the olden days, लोकम् this world, अनिन्द्रम् devoid of Indra, इच्छन्ती desirous, दृढव्रता determined to vow, काव्यमाता mother of Sukracharya, भृगुपत्नी अपि wife of sage Bhrigu, विष्णुनाऽपि by Visnu also, निषूदिता destroyed.
data.md: And formerly, O Rama, Visnu destroyed Kāvya's mother, the devoted wife of Bhrgu, who had set her heart upon annihilating the world, deprived of sleep (through fear of her.)

data.v: एतैश्चान्यैश्च बहुभी राजपुत्रमहात्मभिः । अधर्मनिरता नार्यो हताः पुरुषसत्तमैः ॥
data.es: O Prince by these magnanimous persons and by great men several unrighteous women were killed for the common good".इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये बालकाण्डे पञ्चविंशस्सर्ग:॥Thus ends the twentyfifth sarga of Balakanda of the holy Ramayana the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.
data.anv: राजपुत्र O Prince, महात्मभि: magnanimous, एतैश्च by them, अन्यै:च by others, पुरुषसत्तमै: by the best among men, बहुभिः by several, अधर्मसहिता: unrighteous ones, नार्य: women, हता: were killed.
data.md: By these as well as innumerable princesforemost of men have wicked women been slain. Therefore, O king, renouncing antipathy, do you, by my command, slay this one!

data.v: मुनेर्वचनमक्लीबं श्रुत्वा नरवरात्मजः । राघवः प्राञ्जलिर्भूत्वा प्रत्युवाच दृढव्रतः ॥
data.es: After listening to the manly command of ascetic Viswamitra, Rama, of the lineage of Raghu, the son of the foremost of men and firm in determination, replied with folded palms:
data.anv: दृढव्रत: a man firm in his vows, नरवरात्मज: the son of the foremost of men, राघव: Rama, अक्लीबम् determined, manly and bold, मुने: ascetic's, वचनम् words, श्रुत्वा having listened, प्राञ्जलि:भूत्वा with folded palms, प्रत्युवाच replied.
data.md: Hearing those bold words of the ascetic, the son of that foremost of men, Rāghava firm in his vows, with clasped hands answered.

data.v: पितुर्वचननिर्देशात्पितुर्वचनगौरवात् । वचनं कौशिकस्येति कर्तव्यमविशङ्कया ॥
data.anv: पितु: of my father, वचननिर्देशात् to fulfil the words of command, पितु: of my sire's, वचनगौरवात् to honour his words, कौशिकस्य Kausika's, वचनम् इति the words as such, अविशङ्कया without hesitation, कर्तव्यम् fit to be done.
data.md: In accordance with the desire of my sire, and in order to glorify it, I ought fearlessly to do even as Kusika's son says. And having been desired to that end while at Ayodhyā by that high-souled one, my father Dasaratha, in the midst of the spiritual guides, I ought not to pass by your words.

data.v: अनुशिष्टोऽस्म्ययोध्यायां गुरुमध्ये महात्मना । पित्रा दशरथेनाहं नावज्ञेयं च तद्वचः ॥
data.es: In Ayodhya in the presence of elders and spiritual masters (of Dasaratha's court), I have been ordered by my magnanimous father to act according to your instructions and his words cannot be disobeyed.
data.anv: अयोध्यायाम् in Ayodhya, गुरुमध्ये in the presence of elders, महात्मना by the magnanimous, पित्रा father, दशरथेन by Dasaratha, अहम् I, अनुशिष्ट: अस्मि have been ordered, तद्वच: his words, नावज्ञेयं हि cannot be disobeyed(turned down).
data.md: In accordance with the desire of my sire, and in order to glorify it, I ought fearlessly to do even as Kusika's son says. And having been desired to that end while at Ayodhyā by that high-souled one, my father Dasaratha, in the midst of the spiritual guides, I ought not to pass by your words.

data.v: सोऽहं पितुर्वचः श्रुत्वा शासनाद्ब्रह्म वादिनः । करिष्यामि न संदेहस्ताटकावधमुत्तमम् ॥
data.es: As per the words of my father and the command of Viswamitra, who has the knowledge of the Brahman, I shall execute the welcome act of killing Tataka.
data.anv: स: अहम्  such as I am, पितु: father's, वच: words, श्रुत्वा having heard, ब्रह्मवादिन: of the man  endowed with the knowledge of vedas, शासनात् in accordance with the command, उत्तमम् the welcoming act, ताटकावधम् slaying of Tataka, करिष्यामि I shall perform, सन्देह: न no doubt.
data.md: Therefore, commanded by that upholder of the Veda, I, agreeably to my father's mandate, will, without doubt, bring about that welcome event-the death of Tataka.

data.v: गोब्राह्मणहितार्थाय देशस्यास्य सुखाय च । तव चैवाप्रमेयस्य वचनं कर्तुमुद्यतः ॥
data.es: For the welfare of cows and brahmins and also for the good of this country, I am ready to perform such acts as commanded by you of boundless energy".
data.anv: गोब्राह्मणहितार्थाय for the welfare of cows and brahmins, अस्य देशस्य this country's, सुखाय च  for the happiness, अप्रमेयस्य of the man possessing boundless energy, तव your, वचनम् words, कर्तुम् to perform, उद्यत: I am prepared.
data.md: And in the interests of Brāhmaṇas, kine, and celestials, I am ready to act as desired by you of immeasurable energy.

data.v: एवमुक्त्वा धनुर्मध्ये बद्ध्वा मुष्टिमरिंदमः । ज्याशब्दमकरोत्तीव्रं दिशः शब्देन पूरयन् ॥
data.es: Rama, the destroyer of enemies having said so clinched the middle of the bow with his fist and filled the ten quarters with the resounding twanging of the bowstring.
data.anv: अरिन्दम: destroyer of enemies, एवम् उक्त्वा having spoken thus, धनुर्मध्ये in the middle of the bow, मुष्टिम् the fist, बद्वा clinching, शब्देन with sounds, दिश: ten cardinal directions,   नादयन् sounding, तीव्रम् severe, ज्याशब्दम् with twanging sounds of the bowstring, अकरोत्  performed.
data.md: Having said this, that repressor of foes, with clenched fist, twanged his bow-string, filling the ten cardinal points with the sounds. And at those sounds, the dwellers in Tāțakā's forest were filled with perturbation, and Tātakā also amazed at those sounds, became exceedingly wroth.

data.v: तेन शब्देन वित्रस्तास्ताटका वनवासिनः । ताटका च सुसंक्रुद्धा तेन शब्देन मोहिता ॥
data.es: The dwellers of the Tataka forest were terrified by the sound (of the bow). Tataka, was might angry and amazed.
data.anv: ताटकावनवासिन: all the beings living in that Tataka forest, तेन शब्देन with that sound, वित्रस्ता: were terrified, ताटका च Tataka also, तेन शब्देन by that sound, सुसंक्रुद्धा was furious with anger, मोहिता amazed.

data.v: तं शब्दमभिनिध्याय राक्षसी क्रोधमूर्छिता । श्रुत्वा चाभ्यद्रवद्वेगाद्यतः शब्दो विनिःसृतः ॥
data.es: Hearing that sound, the demoness thought for a while and senseless with anger rushed in the direction where the sound had come from.
data.anv: राक्षसी rakshasi, तं शब्दम् that sound, श्रत्वा having heard, क्रोधमूर्छिता infatuated with anger, अभिनिध्याय thought for a while, यत: from which direction, शब्द: sound, विनिस्सृत: originated(in that direction), वेगात् speedily, अभ्यद्रवत् rushed.
data.md: And rendered almost insensible by anger, that Räksasī furiously rushed in a main towards the spot whence had come the report.

data.v: तां दृष्ट्वा राघवः क्रुद्धां विकृतां विकृताननाम् । प्रमाणेनातिवृद्धां च लक्ष्मणं सोऽभ्यभाषत ॥
data.es: Filled with wrath Rama saw Tataka, disfigured with a distorted face and gigantic in size. Turning to Lakshmana he said :
data.anv: स:राघव: Rama, क्रुद्धाम् full of wrath, विकृताम् disfigured, विकृताननाम् with distorted face, प्रमाणेन in size, अतिवृद्धां च gigantic, तां दृष्ट्वा having seen her, लक्ष्मणम् addressing Lakshmana, अभ्यभाषत spoke.
data.md: And beholding that frightful one of hideous visage and colossal proportions, transported with rage, Raghu's descendant spoke to Laksmana,9

data.v: पश्य लक्ष्मण यक्षिण्या भैरवं दारुणं वपुः । भिद्येरन्दर्शनादस्या भीरूणां हृदयानि च ॥
data.es: "O Lakshmana, behold, the sight of the dreadful hideous body of this yakshini will break timid hearts.
data.anv: लक्ष्मण O Lakshmana, यक्षिण्या: yakshini's, भैरवम् dreadful, दारुणम् hideous, वपु: body,पश्य behold, अस्या: her, दर्शनात् from the appearance, भीरूणाम् of the timid, हृदयानि hearts, भिद्येरन् will break.
data.md: Behold, O Laksmana, the terrible and hideous body of yonder Yakṣiṇī! The sight of her strike terror into the hearts of even the brave.

data.v: एनां पश्य दुराधर्षां माया बलसमन्विताम् । विनिवृत्तां करोम्यद्य हृतकर्णाग्रनासिकाम् ॥
data.es: See, she is unassailable because of the strength gained through black magic. I shall cut off her ears and the tip of her nose and make her turn away.
data.anv: दुराधर्षाम् unassailable, मायाबलसमन्विताम endowed with strength gained through black magic, एनाम् her, हृतकर्णाग्रनासिकाम् deprive her of ears and tip of nose, विनिवृत्ताम् turned away, अद्य now, करोमि I shall do, पश्य see.
data.md: Mark! This irrepressible one, possessing all the resources of illusion, will I oppose, and deprive her of ears and nose.

data.v: न ह्येनामुत्सहे हन्तुं स्त्रीस्वभावेन रक्षिताम् । वीर्यं चास्या गतिं चापि हनिष्यामीति मे मतिः ॥
data.es: By virtue of being a woman, she is protected. I am not inclined to slay her but take away her prowess and power of motion".
data.anv: स्त्रीस्वभावेन by virtue of being a woman, रक्षिताम् is protected, एनां हन्तुम् to slay her, न उत्सहे I am not inclined, अस्याम् in her, वीर्यम् prowess, गतिं चापि power of motion, हनिष्यामीति I will destroy, thus, मे मति: this is my opinion.
data.md: But I dare not slay her, she being protected by virtue of her feminineness. I intend only to oppose her course, and deprive her of her prowess.

data.v: एवं ब्रुवाणे रामे तु ताटका क्रोधमूर्छिता । उद्यम्य बाहू गर्जन्ती राममेवाभ्यधावत ॥
data.es: While Rama was still speaking, Tataka, incensed with fury rushed with her uplifted arms towards him roaring.
data.anv: रामे when Rama, एवम् in this manner, ब्रुवाणे was speaking thus, ताटका Tataka, क्रोधमूर्छिता infatuated with anger, बाहू both her arms, उद्यम्य uplifting, राममेव towards Rama, गर्जन्ती roaring, अभ्यधावत rushed.
data.md: As Rāma was speaking thus, Tāțakā, deprived of sense through ire, uttering roars, with uplifted arms rushed against him.

data.v: तामापतन्तीं वेगेन विक्रान्तामशनीमिव । शरेणोरसि विव्याध सा पपात ममार च ॥
data.es: Her chest pierced with an arrow, she rushing menacingly towards them like a thunderbolt fell down dead.
data.anv: विक्रान्ताम् advancing powerully, अशनीमिव like to a thunderbolt, वेगेन with speed, आपतन्तीम्  approaching, ताम् her, शरेण with arrow, उरसि in the chest, विव्याथ pierced,  सा पपात she fell down, ममार च also died.
data.md: Being thus hemmed in with a network of shafts, she possessed of the powers of illusion, rushed against Kākutstha and Lakşmaņa, uttering terrible roars. And as that Yaksi, in prowess like to a thunder-bolt, was rushing on, Rāma pierced her chest with arrows, and thereat she dropped down and died.

data.v: तां हतां भीमसंकाशां दृष्ट्वा सुरपतिस्तदा । साधु साध्विति काकुत्स्थं सुराश्च समपूजयन् ॥
data.es: Having seen the slain yakshini of terrible appearance, Indra and other celestials worshipped Rama, exclaiming "well done, well done ".
data.anv: तदा then, सुरपति: Indra, सुराश्च other celestial beings, हताम् slain, भीमसङ्काशाम् of terrible appearance, तां दृष्ट्वा having seen her, साधु साधु इति" well done, well done" saying so, काकुत्स्थम् Rama, समपूजयन् worshipped.
data.md: Upon seeing that grim-visaged one slain, the lord of the celestials together with the celestials themselves honouring Kākutstha, exclaimed Well, Well!.

data.v: उवाच परमप्रीतः सहस्राक्षः पुरंदरः । सुराश्च सर्वे संहृष्टा विश्वामित्रमथाब्रुवन् ॥
data.es: Then exceedingly pleased the thousandeyed Indra and all other delighted celestials said to Viswamitra:
data.anv: अथ then, सहस्राक्ष: the thousandeyed, पुरन्दर: Devendra, परमप्रीत: was exceedingly pleased, उवाच said, सर्वे all, सुराश्च celestial beings, संहृष्टा: were delighted, विश्वामित्रम् addressing Viswamitra, अब्रुवन् spoke.
data.md: And exceedingly pleased, the thousand-eyed Purandara, together with the delighted deities, said to Viśvāmitra.

data.v: मुने कौशिके भद्रं ते सेन्द्राः सर्वे मरुद्गणाः । तोषिताः कर्मणानेन स्नेहं दर्शय राघवे ॥
data.es: "O ascetic Kausika, may prosperity be to you All devatas have been gratified by this act (of Rama) and have expressed their love for Rama.
data.anv: कौशिकमुने O Ascetic Kausika, ते to you, भद्रम् may prosperity be to you, सेन्द्रा: together   with Indra, सर्वे all, मरुद्गणा: devatas, अनेन कर्मणा by this act of Rama, तोषिता: have been gratified, राघवे towards Rama, स्नेहम् friendship, दर्शय show.
data.md: O ascetic, O Kusika's son, good betide you! all the Maruts with Indra at their head, have been gratified with this act (of Rāma's). Do you, O Brāhmaṇa, confer upon Raghu's descendant the sons of Prajāpati Kțśāśva, of true prowess, and charged with ascetic energy.

data.v: प्रजापतेर्कृशाश्वस्य पुत्रान्सत्यपराक्रमान् । तपोबलभृतान्ब्रह्मन्राघवाय निवेदय ॥
data.es: "O Brahmarshi, you may offer to Rama, the sons of Prajapati Brishasva who are the weapons bestowed with the power that comes from truth and ascetic energy".
data.anv: ब्रह्मन् O Brahmarshi, प्रजापते: Prajapati's, भृशाश्वस्य Brishaswas', पुत्रान् sons, सत्यपराक्रमान् men of truthful prowess, तपोबलभृत़ः men endowed with ascetic energy, राघवाय for Rama, निवेदय offer.

data.v: पात्रभूतश्च ते ब्रह्मंस्तवानुगमने धृतः । कर्तव्यं च महत्कर्म सुराणां राजसूनुना ॥
data.es: "O Brahmarshi following you with firmness of mind, Rama is worthy to receive the weapons. He who is a prince has to accomplish many such great tasks for the benefit of the celestials".
data.anv: ब्रह्मन् O Brahmarshi, तव अनुगमने in following you, धृत: firm, ते to you, पात्रभूत:च worthy to receive, राजसूनुना by this prince, सुराणाम् for the benefit of celestial beings, महत् many, कर्म task, कर्तव्यं च have to be accomplished.
data.md: And ever following you, he, O Brāhmaṇa, is fit to receive them of you. And this son of the king is to accomplish a mighty task in the interests of the celestials.

data.v: एवमुक्त्वा सुराः सर्वे हृष्टा जग्मुर्यथागतम् । विश्वामित्रं पूजयित्वा ततः संध्या प्रवर्तते ॥
data.es: Having said these words, the celestials were pleased. They honoured Viswamitra and returned to their abodes from where they had come. And then dusk set in.
data.anv: एवम् in this manner, उक्त्वा having said these words, सुरा: celestial beings, सर्वे all, हृष्टा: were pleased, विश्वामित्रम् Visvamitra, पुरस्कृत्य having honoured him, यथागतम् from where they had come from, जग्मु: returned, तत: then, सन्ध्या dusk, प्रवर्तते commences(ed).
data.md: Saying this, the deities, having paid homage to Viśvāmitra, joyfully entered the celestial regions.

data.v: ततो मुनिवरः प्रीतिस्ताटका वधतोषितः । मूर्ध्नि राममुपाघ्राय इदं वचनमब्रवीत् ॥
data.es: Then, the best of ascetics Viswamitra rejoiced over the death of Tataka, kissed the forehead of Rama (fondly) and spoke these words:
data.anv: तत: then, मुनिवर: best of ascetics, प्रीत: rejoiced, ताटकावधतोषित: pleased with slaying of Tataka , रामम् Rama, मूर्ध्नि on the head,  उपाघ्राय having smelt fondly , इदं वचनम् this  word, अब्रवीत् spoke.
data.md: And now came evening on, when that best of ascetics, gratified at the destruction of Tāțakā, smelt Rāma's crown and said these words,

data.v: इहाद्य रजनीं राम वसेम शुभदर्शन । श्वः प्रभाते गमिष्यामस्तदाश्रमपदं मम ॥
data.es: O auspiciouslooking Rama, we will stay here tonight at the confluence of both these sacred rivers (Sarayu and Ganga) and cross over Ganga tomorrow.
data.anv: शुभदर्शन OAuspicious looking one, राम Rama, वयम् we, अद्य today, रजनीम् this night, इह here, पुण्ययो: of both the sacred, सरितो: rivers, मध्ये in the midst, वसेम shall stay, श्व: tomorrow, तरिष्यामहे cross over.
data.md: Here, O Rāma of gracious presence, shall we pass the night; and morrow morning, went to that hermitage of mine.

data.v: अथ तां रजनीमुष्य विश्वामिरो महायशाः । प्रहस्य राघवं वाक्यमुवाच मधुराक्षरम् ॥
data.es: The night over, illustrious Viswamitra called Rama with a sweet smile.
data.anv: अथ thereafter, महायशाः illustrious, विश्वामित्रः Visvamitra, तां रजनीम् that night, उष्य having  stayed, प्रहस्य smiling, राघवम् addresseing, मधुराक्षरम् with sweet accents, वाक्यम् these words, उवाच spoke.
data.md: Having passed that night, the illustrious Viśvāmitra, smiling complacently, sweetly spoke to Rāghava, saying,

data.v: पतितुष्टोऽस्मि भद्रं ते राजपुत्र महायशः । प्रीत्या परमया युक्तो ददाम्यस्त्राणि सर्वशः ॥
data.es: "O prince of great renown, I am extremely pleased. May you prosper Out of great love and affection for you I shall make over all the weapons.
data.anv: महायशः of great renown, राजपुत्र O Prince, परितुष्टः अस्मि  I am extremely pleased, ते भद्रम् May you prosper, परमया प्रीत्या with great love and affection, युक्तः filled with, अस्त्राणि weapons, सर्वशः from all over, ददामि I shall give.
data.md: Pleased am I with you. Good betide you, O highly famous prince! With supreme pleasure, do I confer upon you all the weapons.

data.v: देवासुरगणान्वापि सगन्धर्वोरगानपि । यैरमित्रान्प्रसह्याजौ वशीकृत्य जयिष्यसि ॥
data.es: With the help of these celestial weapons, you will vanquish even gods and demons, serpents together with gandharvas if they challenge you to a battle as enemies and take them as captives. I shall confer on you all such weapons. May you prosper
data.anv: यैः by means of which, देवासुरगणान्वापि even multitude of devatas, asuras, सगन्धर्वोरगानपि nagas together with gandharvas, अमित्रान् enemies, आजौ in the battle, प्रसह्य forcibly, वशीकृत्य taking them captives, जयिष्यसि you will vanquish, तानि दिव्यानि such celestial,   अस्त्राणि weapons, सर्वशः completely, ददामि I shall give, ते भद्रम् May you prosper.
data.md: By means of which subduing such antagonists as celestials and Asuras backed on carth by Gandharvas and Uragas, you will in battle be crowned with victory.

data.v: तानि दिव्यानि भद्रं ते ददाम्यस्त्राणि सर्वशः । दण्डचक्रं महद्दिव्यं तव दास्यामि राघव ॥
data.md: All those celestial weapons, good betide you, I will confer upon you. And I will confer upon you, O Rāghava, the celestial and mighty Dandacakra,* and Dharmacakra, and also Kalacakra. And, ) foremost of men, I will confer upon you the fierce Vişnucakra, and Indracakra. *Cakra means discus. These enumerations specify different kinds of the discus.

data.v: धर्मचक्रं ततो वीर कालचक्रं तथैव च । विष्णुचक्रं तथात्युग्रमैन्द्रं चक्रं तथैव च ॥
data.md: All those celestial weapons, good betide you, I will confer upon you. And I will confer upon you, O Rāghava, the celestial and mighty Dandacakra,* and Dharmacakra, and also Kalacakra. And, ) foremost of men, I will confer upon you the fierce Vişnucakra, and Indracakra. *Cakra means discus. These enumerations specify different kinds of the discus.

data.v: वज्रमस्त्रं नरश्रेष्ठ शैवं शूलवरं तथा । अस्त्रं ब्रह्मशिरश्चैव ऐषीकमपि राघव । ददामि ते महाबाहो ब्राह्ममस्त्रमनुत्तमम् ॥
data.es: Mighty armed, heroic Rama I shall grant you the great celestial dandachakra. O best among men I shall grant you dharmachakra, kalachakra, visnuchakra, indraastra, vajraastra and the great, trident of Siva, brahmashirastra, ishika astra and highly superior brahmaastra.
data.anv: राघव Rama, महत् great, दिव्यम् celestial, दण्डचक्रम् Danda chakra, तव to you, दास्यामि I shall grant, नरश्रेष्ठ O Best among men, महाबाहो mighty armed one, वीर heroic, राघव Rama, ततः thereafter, धर्मचक्रम् Dharma chakra तथैव च also, कालचक्रम् Kala chakra, तथा  also, विष्णुचक्रम् Visnu chakra, तथैव च also,  ऐन्द्रम् अस्त्रम्  IndraAstra, वज्रम् अस्त्रम् Vajra astra, तथा thereafter, शैवम् relating to Shiva, शूलवरम् superior spear, ब्रह्मशिर known as Brahma Shira, अस्त्रम् astra, ऐषीकमपि Ishika astra, अनुत्तमम् highly superior, ब्राह्मम् अस्त्रम् Brahma astra, ते to you, ददामि I shall give.

data.v: गदे द्वे चैव काकुत्स्थ मोदकी शिखरी उभे । प्रदीप्ते नरशार्दूल प्रयच्छामि नृपात्मज ॥
data.es: Born in the race of kakutstha and a tiger among men, O Rama I shall also grant two shining maces known as modaki and shikhari.
data.anv: काकुत्स्थ born in the race of Kakutstha, नरशार्दूल best among men, नृपात्मज O Prince, Rama, प्रदीप्ते shining, द्वे two, मोदकी शिखरी Modaki and Shikhari, गदे two Maces, उभे both of them, प्रयच्छामि I shall give.

data.v: धर्मपाशमहं राम कालपाशं तथैव च । वारुणं पाशमस्त्रं च ददान्यहमनुत्तमम् ॥
data.es: Rama, I shall grant dharmapasa, kalapasa, varuna pasa, too unique weapons.
data.anv: राम O Rama, अहम् I, धर्मपाशम् Dharma Pasa, तथैव च and also, कालपाशम् Kala Pasa, वारुणम् relating to Varuna, पाशम् Pasa, अस्त्रं च and also an astra, अनुत्तमम् च highly superior,  ददामि I shall grant.

data.v: अशनी द्वे प्रयच्छामि शुष्कार्द्रे रघुनन्दन ॥
data.es: O descendant of Raghu I shall grant you two thunderbolts named shuska and ardra (dry and wet), painaka astra and narayanaastra.
data.anv: रघुनन्दन O Descendent of Raghu, Rama, शुष्कार्द्रे Shuska and Ardra, (dry and wet), द्वे two, अशनी thunderbolts, पैनाकम् अस्त्रम् Painaka astra, तथा and, नारायणम् अस्त्रम् Narayana astra, ददामि I shall grant.

data.v: ददामि चास्त्रं पैनाकमस्त्रं नारायणं तथा । आग्नेयमस्त्र दयितं शिखरं नाम नामतः ॥
data.md: O descendant of Raghu, I will bestow upon you the two Asanis, Suska and Ardra, and the Pināka weapon, and the Nārāyaṇa, and the Āgneya weapon called Sikhara, and the Vāyavya, called Prathama.

data.v: वायव्यं प्रथमं नाम ददामि तव राघव । अस्त्रं हयशिरो नाम क्रौञ्चमस्त्रं तथैव च ॥
शक्ति द्वयं च काकुत्स्थ ददामि तव चानघ । कङ्कालं मुसलं घोरं कापालमथ कङ्कणम् ॥
धारयन्त्यसुरा यानि ददाम्येतानि सर्वशः । वैद्याधरं महास्त्रं च नन्दनं नाम नामतः ॥
असिरत्नं महाबाहो ददामि नृवरात्मज । गान्धर्वमस्त्रं दयितं मानवं नाम नामतः ॥
प्रस्वापनप्रशमने दद्मि सौरं च राघव । दर्पणं शोषणं चैव संतापनविलापने ॥
मदनं चैव दुर्धर्षं कन्दर्पदयितं तथा । पैशाचमस्त्रं दयितं मोहनं नाम नामतः । प्रतीच्छ नरशार्दूल राजपुत्र महायशः ॥
data.es: O renowned prince, best among men, receive these astras known as darpana, soshana, santhapana, vilapana, madana astra, the unassailable one favoured by kamadeva and the paisacha astra known as mohana favoured by demons.
data.anv: महायशः O Highly renowned one, नरशार्दूल O Best among men, राजपुत्र O Prince, दर्पणम् darpana, शोषणं चैव soshana(the parching weapon), सन्तापनविलापने Santhapana, Vilapana (those which induce sorrow and wailing), तथा also, दुर्धर्षम् unassailable, कन्दर्पदयितम् favoured by Manmatha, मदनं च Madana, नामतः by name, मोहनं नाम known as Mohana, दयितम् favoured one, पैशाचम् अस्त्रम् Paisacha Astra, प्रतीच्छ you may receive.
data.md: O Rāghava! And, O tiger among men, do you accept Varsana, and Sosana, and Santapana, and Vilāpana, and Mādana hard to repress, beloved of Kandarpa, and that favourite Gandharva weapon, Mānava, and the favourite Piśāca weapon, O highly famous prince.

data.v: तामसं नरशार्दूल सौमनं च महाबलम् । संवर्तं चैव दुर्धर्षं मौसलं च नृपात्मज ॥
सत्यमस्त्रं महाबाहो तथा मायाधरं परम् । घोरं तेजःप्रभं नाम परतेजोऽपकर्षणम् ॥
सोमास्त्रं शिशिरं नाम त्वाष्ट्रमस्त्रं सुदामनम् । दारुणं च भगस्यापि शीतेषुमथ मानवम् ॥
एतान्नाम महाबाहो कामरूपान्महाबलान् । गृहाण परमोदारान्क्षिप्रमेव नृपात्मज ॥
data.es: O Rama mightyarmed prince, receive these mighty and highly exalted astras capable of assuming at once any form at will".
data.anv: महाबाहो O Mighty armed one, नृपात्मज O Prince, राम O Rama, कामरूपान् capable of  assuming any form at will, महाबलान् mighty, परमोदारान् highly exalted, एतान् these astras, क्षिप्रमेव immediately, गृहाण you may receive.
data.md: O long-armed king's son, Rama! receive instantly all powerful, highly exalted forms that can be modified at will.

data.v: स्थितस्तु प्राङ्मुखो भूत्वा शुचिर्निवरतस्तदा । ददौ रामाय सुप्रीतो मन्त्रग्राममनुत्तमम् ॥
data.es: Viswamitra, the greatest ascetic after the purification ritual stood with his face turned east and happily, conferred on Rama collection of the unique mantras.
data.anv: तदा thereafter, मुनिवर he exalted one among ascetics, शुचि having purified himself, प्रङ्मुखः turning his face towards east, स्थितः भूत्वा standing, सुप्रीतः wellpleased, रामाय for Rama, अनुत्तमम् preeminently best, मन्त्रग्रामम् collection of mantras, ददौ gave.
data.md: Then with his face turned towards the east, that foremost of ascetics having purified himself, gladly conferred the mantras upon Rāma.

data.v: जपतस्तु मुनेस्तस्य विश्वामित्रस्य धीमतः । उपतस्थुर्महार्हाणि सर्वाण्यस्त्राणि राघवम् ॥
data.es: While the sagacious ascetic Viswamitra was muttering the mystic terms of these venerable astras (addressing their respective deities), all these weapons (with their mystic power) attended on Rama.
data.anv: धीमतः of the sagacious, तस्य मुनेः ascetic Viswamitra, जपतः while muttering in a subdued tone, महार्हाणि venerable, अस्त्राणि astras, सर्वाणि all, राघवम् for Rama, उपतस्थुः (reached) served.

data.v: ऊचुश्च मुदिता रामं सर्वे प्राञ्जलयस्तदा । इमे स्म परमोदार किंकरास्तव राघव ॥
data.es: The munificient presiding deities of the weapons with folded palms addressed these words to Rama saying, "Here we are, at you disposal ".
data.anv: परमोदाराः highly munificient, सर्वे all presiding deities of the weapons, तदा then, प्रञ्जलयः with folded palms, ऊचुश्च uttered, राघव Rama, इमे स्म here we are, तव your, किङ्कराः servants.

data.v: प्रतिगृह्य च काकुत्स्थः समालभ्य च पाणिना । मनसा मे भविष्यध्वमिति तान्यभ्यचोदयत् ॥
data.es: Rama received the astras he felt with his hands and commanded them saying, "Live in my mind" (serve me whenever I remember you).
data.anv: काकुत्स्थ O Rama, प्रतिगृह्य haivng received them, पाणिना with hand, समालभ्य touching them, मे my, मानसाः भविष्यध्वम् इति be recorded in my mind, saying so, तान् them, अभ्यचोदयत् ordered them.
data.md: Thus addressed by those highly powerful weapons, Kākutstha Rama, with a delighted soul, accepting them, touched them with his hand, and said, Do you appear before me as I remember you!

data.v: ततः प्रीतमना रामो विश्वामित्रं महामुनिम् । अभिवाद्य महातेजा गमनायोपचक्रमे ॥
data.es: Thereafter, the cheerful Rama, bowed to the mighty ascetic Viswamitra and commenced his journey.इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये बालकाण्डे सप्तविंशस्सर्गः॥Thus ends the twentyseventh sarga of Balakanda of the holy Ramayana the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.
data.anv: ततः thereafter, महातेजाः highly splendorous, रामः Rama, प्रीतमनाः with pleased mind , विश्वामित्रं Visvamitra, महामुनिम् mighty ascetic, अभिवाद्य bowing with respect, गमनाय for  his journey, उपचक्रमे commenced.
data.md: Then the exceedingly energetic Rāma, well pleased, paying reverence to the mighty ascetic, Viśvāmitra, prepared to set out. pleased, paying reverence to the mighty ascetic, Viśvāmitra, prepared to set out.

data.v: प्रतिगृह्य ततोऽस्त्राणि प्रहृष्टवदनः शुचिः । गच्छन्नेव च काकुत्स्थो विश्वामित्रमथाब्रवीत् ॥
data.es: After performing the purificatory rites, Rama received the weapons with a cheerful face. In the way Rama said to Viswamitra.
data.anv: काकुत्स्थ: Rama, शुचि: having purified himself, अस्त्राणि astras, प्रतिगृह्य having received, तत: then, प्रहृष्टवदन: with pleasant countenance,गच्छन्नेव while proceeding onwards, अथ thereafter, विश्वामित्रम् addressing Visvamitra, अब्रवीत् spoke.
data.md: Having accepted those weapons with purity, Käkutstha while proceeding, with a complacent countenance spoke these words to sage Visvāmitra,-

data.v: गृहीतास्त्रोऽस्मि भगवन्दुराधर्षः सुरैरपि । अस्त्राणां त्वहमिच्छामि संहारं मुनिपुंगव ॥
data.es: "O venerable one, having received these weaponsI have become unassailable even by the celestials. O best of ascetics, May I know the way to withdraw these weapons".
data.anv: भगवन् O Venerable one, गृहीतास्त्र: having received these weapons, सुरैरपि even by celestials, दुराधर्ष: अस्मि I have become unassailable, मुनिपुङ्गव O Best of ascetics, अहम् I, अस्त्राणाम् of astras, संहारम् withdrawal, इच्छामि desirous of knowing.
data.md: O adorable one, I have received these weapons, incapable of being repressed even by the celestials themselves. Now, O best of ascetics, I would acquire a knowledge of with drawing them.

data.v: एवं ब्रुवति काकुत्स्थे विश्वामित्रो महामुनिः । संहारं व्याजहाराथ धृतिमान्सुव्रतः शुचिः ॥
data.es: To these words spoken by Rama, maharshi Viswamitra who was patient practitioner of vows and pure taught the withdrawl mantra.
data.anv: काकुत्स्थे when Rama, एवम् in this manner, ब्रुवति had spoken, अथ thereafter, धृतिमान् one possessed of fortitude, सुव्रत: a man of excellent vows, शुचि: pure, विश्वामित्र: महामुनि: Viswamitra maharshi, संहारम् withdrawl, व्याजहार told.
data.md: Upon Kākutstha's representing this, Viśvāmitra of high austerities, endowed with patience, of excellent vows, and pure in spirit, communicated to him the mantras for restraining the weapons.

data.v: सत्यवन्तं सत्यकीर्तिं धृष्टं रभसमेव च । प्रतिहारतरं नाम पराङ्मुखमवाङ्मुखम् ॥
लक्षाक्षविषमौ चैव दृढनाभसुनाभकौ । दशाक्षशतवक्त्रौ च दशशीर्षशतोदरौ ॥
पद्मनाभमहानाभौ दुन्दुनाभसुनाभकौ । ज्योतिषं कृशनं चैव नैराश्य विमलावुभौ ॥
यौगन्धरहरिद्रौ च दैत्यप्रमथनौ तथा । पित्र्यं सौमनसं चैव विधूतमकरावुभौ ॥
करवीरकरं चैव धनधान्यौ च राघव । कामरूपं कामरुचिं मोहमावरणं तथा ॥
जृम्भकं सर्वनाभं च सन्तानवरणौ तथा । कृशाश्वतनयान्राम भास्वरान्कामरूपिणः ॥
प्रतीच्छ मम भद्रं ते पात्रभूतोऽसि राघव । दिव्यभास्वरदेहाश्च मूर्तिमन्तः सुखप्रदाः ॥
रामं प्राञ्जलयो भूत्वाब्रुवन्मधुरभाषिणः । इमे स्म नरशार्दूल शाधि किं करवाम ते ॥
गम्यतामिति तानाह यथेष्टं रघुनन्दनः । मानसाः कार्यकालेषु साहाय्यं मे करिष्यथ ॥
data.md: Then the descendant of Raghu answered, saying, Repair whither soever you will! Recurring to my memory, do you in time of need, render me assistance!

data.v: अथ ते राममामन्त्र्य कृत्वा चापि प्रदक्षिणम् । एवमस्त्विति काकुत्स्थमुक्त्वा जग्मुर्यथागतम् ॥
data.es: Thereafter those devatas having said, "Be it so", circumambulated Rama, took leave of him and returned to their respective abodes from where they had come.
data.anv: अथ thereafter, ते those devatas, एवम् अस्तु इति saying "Be it so", काकुत्स्थम् Rama, उक्त्वा having spoken, प्रदक्षिणम् circumambulation, कृत्वा having done, रामम् Rama, आमन्त्य्र having  taken leave of him, यथागतम् from whichever place they had come, जग्मु: went.

data.v: स च तान्राघवो ज्ञात्वा विश्वामित्रं महामुनिम् । गच्छन्नेवाथ मधुरं श्लक्ष्णं वचनमब्रवीत् ॥
data.es: After having acquired the knowledge of the weapons Rama addressed maharshi Viswamitra in gentle and soft words while walking along with him.
data.anv: स: राघव: Rama, तान् ज्ञात्वा having acquired the knowledge of those weapons, अथ later, गच्छन्नेव while walking, विश्वामित्रं महामुनिम् maharshi Visvamitra, मधुरम् in gentle, श्लक्ष्णम् soft, वचनम् words, अब्रवीत् spoke.

data.v: किं न्वेतन्मेघसंकाशं पर्वतस्याविदूरतः । वृक्षषण्डमितो भाति परं कौतूहलं हि मे ॥
data.es: "From this side of the mountain, not faroff from here stand shining and goodlooking trees resembling clouds. It is replete scattered with animals, pleasing to the mind and extremely beautiful. It is adorned with various kinds of birds singing sweetly. What could be this? I am very curious to know.
data.anv: इत: from this side, पर्वतस्य mountain's, अविदूरत: in a not far off place, मेघसङ्काशम् resembling clouds, दर्शनीयम् good looking, मृगाकीर्णम् scattered with animals, अतीव extremely, मनोरमम् pleasing to the mind, वल्गुनादै with sweet sounds, नानाप्रकारै: by  various kinds, शकुनै: birds, अलङ्कृतम् adorned, वृक्षषण्डम् collection of trees, भाति is  shining, एतत् किं नु what could be this?, मे to me, परम् highly, कौतूहलं हि curiousity.

data.v: दर्शनीयं मृगाकीर्णं मनोहरमतीव च । नानाप्रकारैः शकुनैर्वल्गुभाषैरलंकृतम् ॥
data.es: "From this side of the mountain, not faroff from here stand shining and goodlooking trees resembling clouds. It is replete scattered with animals, pleasing to the mind and extremely beautiful. It is adorned with various kinds of birds singing sweetly. What could be this? I am very curious to know.
data.anv: इत: from this side, पर्वतस्य mountain's, अविदूरत: in a not far off place, मेघसङ्काशम् resembling clouds, दर्शनीयम् good looking, मृगाकीर्णम् scattered with animals, अतीव extremely, मनोरमम् pleasing to the mind, वल्गुनादै with sweet sounds, नानाप्रकारै: by  various kinds, शकुनै: birds, अलङ्कृतम् adorned, वृक्षषण्डम् collection of trees, भाति is  shining, एतत् किं नु what could be this?, मे to me, परम् highly, कौतूहलं हि curiousity.
data.md: It is pleasing to the sight, and abounds in beasts, and is exceedingly romantic, and is adorned with various birds singing sweetly.

data.v: निःसृताः स्म मुनिश्रेष्ठ कान्ताराद्रोमहर्षणात् । अनया त्ववगच्छामि देशस्य सुखवत्तया ॥
data.es: O best of acetics, I think we have come out of that awesome (horripilating) forest because of the pleasant feeling experienced in this region. Whose hermitage is this? O Revered one tell me".
data.anv: मुनिश्रेष्ठ O Best of acetics, अनया by this, देशस्य of the place, सुखवत्तया being endowed with happiness, रोमहर्षणात् awesome(creating horripulation),  कान्तारात् from the forest, निस्सृता: we came out, अवगच्छामि I am coming to know, इदम् this one, कस्य whose आश्रमपदम् hermitage, भगवन् O Revered one, सर्वम् all, मे to me , शंस tell.
data.md: Now, O foremost of ascetics, we have come out of a wilderness capable of making one's hair stand on end. And from the pleasantness attaching to this place, I have come to a conclusion.

data.v: सर्वं मे शंस भगवन्कस्याश्रमपदं त्विदम् । संप्राप्ता यत्र ते पापा ब्रह्मघ्ना दुष्टचारिणः ॥
अथ तस्याप्रमेयस्य तद्वनं परिपृच्छतः । विश्वामित्रो महातेजा व्याख्यातुमुपचक्रमे ॥
data.es: The highly lustrous Viswamitra heard the words of Rama of immeasurable prowess. On his (Rama's) query about the forest, Viswamitra explains.
data.anv: अथ thereafter, तत् वनम् about that forest, परिपृच्छत: while he was enquiring, अप्रमेयस्य of the man of immeasurable prowess, तस्य of Rama, महातेजा highly lustrous, विश्वामित्र: Visvamitra, व्याख्यातुम् to explain, उपचक्रमे commenced.
data.md: Hearing those words of Rāma of measureless prowess, who had asked the question, the highly energetic Viśvāmitra answered, saying,

data.v: एष पूर्वाश्रमो राम वामनस्य महात्मनः । सिद्धाश्रम इति ख्यातः सिद्धो ह्यत्र महातपाः ॥
data.es: "O Rama this was the hermitage of glorious Vamana. The great sage her performed his ascetic pratices here, hence it is known as siddhashrama.
data.anv: राम O Rama, एष: this place, महात्मन: of the glorious, वामनस्य Vamana's, पूर्वाश्रम: formerly  hermitage of, सिद्धाश्रम: Siddhashrama, इति thus, ख्यात: known, हि indeed, महातपा: great ascetic, अत्र here, सिद्ध: succeeded in his ascetic pratices.

data.v: एतस्मिन्नेव काले तु राजा वैरोचनिर्बलिः । निर्जित्य दैवतगणान्सेन्द्रांश्च समरुद्गणान् । कारयामास तद्राज्यं त्रिषु लोकेषु विश्रुतः ॥
data.es: "During the period Visnu (in the incarnation of Vamana) was observing austerities at this hermitage, king Bali, son of Virochana, having vanquished Indra and maruts and devatas ruled this kingdom and became famous in all the three worlds (for his prowess and generosity.)
data.anv: एतस्मिन् काले एव during this period itself, वैरोचनि: the son of Virochana, राजा king बलि: Bali, सेन्द्रान् with Indra, समरुद्गणान् together with host of Maruts, दैवतगणान् host of devatas, निर्जित्य having vanquished, त्रिषु in three, लोकेषु worlds, विश्रुत: famed, तत् राज्यम् that kingdom, कारयामास ruled.
data.md: And this famed as Siddhāśrama, in consequence of that one of potent asceticism having attained fruition there. And it came to pass that at this time Virocana's son, king Välī; having vanquished the celestials with Indra and the Maruts, established that dominion of his, famous in the three worlds.

data.v: बलेस्तु यजमानस्य देवाः साग्निपुरोगमाः । समागम्य स्वयं चैव विष्णुमूचुरिहाश्रमे ॥
data.es: "While Bali was performing the sacrifice (to confirm his position as lord of the three worlds), the devas got together with Agni in the forefront and approached Lord Visnu at this hermitage, saying:
data.anv: बले: when emperor Bali, यजमानस्य while he was performing the sacrifice, साग्निपुरोगमा: with Agni in the forefront, देवा: devas, इह in this, आश्रमे hermitage, विष्णुम् lord Vishnu, स्वयम् personally, समागम्य having got together, ऊचु: uttered these words.
data.md: And that mighty chief of the Asuras celebrated a sacrifice. And as Vāli was performing that sacrifice, the deities with Agni at their head, coming to Vişnu himself at this asylum, addressed him saying,

data.v: बलिर्वैरोचनिर्विष्णो यजते यज्ञमुत्तमम् । असमाप्ते क्रतौ तस्मिन्स्वकार्यमभिपद्यताम् ॥
data.es: 'O Visnu son of Virochana is performing a great sacrifice. Before its completion, our purpose ought to be achieved'.
data.anv: विष्णो O Visnu, वैरोचनि: son of Virochana, बलि: Bali, उत्तमम् excellent, यज्ञम् sacrifice, यजते is performing, तस्मिन् क्रतौ in that sacrifice, असमाप्ते before being completed, स्वकार्यम् our purpose, अभिपद्यताम् let it be achieved.
data.md: Virocana's son, Vali, O Visnu, is celebrating a sacrifice. Do you, before the ceremony is finished, accomplish your own end.

data.v: ये चैनमभिवर्तन्ते याचितार इतस्ततः । यच्च यत्र यथावच्च सर्वं तेभ्यः प्रयच्छति ॥
data.es: 'He is granting the seekers whatever, wherever and in whichever maner they, coming from here and there approach him for favour'.
data.anv: ये याचितार: those seekers of favours, इतस्तत: from here and there, एनम्  him, अभिवर्तन्ते  approach, यच्च whichever, यत्र wherever, यथावच्च in whatever manner, सर्वम् all that, तेभ्य: for them, प्रयच्छति is granting.
data.md: He duly confer upon such as repair to him from various quarters all those things that they ask for. And do yourself.

data.v: स त्वं सुरहितार्थाय मायायोगमुपाश्रितः । वामनत्वं गतो विष्णो कुरु कल्याणमुत्तमम् ॥
data.es: "O Visnu perform this supreme, auspicious act assuming the form of a dwarf through, the power of illusion for the welfare of the devatas'.
data.anv: विष्णो O Visnu, स: त्वम् such a god as you are, सुरहितार्थाय for the welfare of devatas, मायायोगम् by act of illusion, उपागत: have assumed, वामनत्वम् गत: assuming  dwarfness, उत्तमम् supreme, कल्याणम् auspicious act, कुरु perform.
data.md: O Visnu, aided by your power of illusion, assuming a Dwarf form, accomplish the welfare of the gods.

data.v: अयं सिद्धाश्रमो नाम प्रसादात्ते भविष्यति । सिद्धे कर्मणि देवेश उत्तिष्ठ भगवन्नितः ॥
data.es: O Lord of the celestials, with my penance accomplished (here) this place will be known as siddhaashrama by your grace. O Lord arise from here".
data.anv: देवेश O Lord of celestials, कर्मणि why my penance, सिद्धे is accomplished, अयम् this one, ते your, प्रसादात् by graciousness, सिद्धाश्रमो नाम by the name of Siddhaashrama, भविष्यति  will become, भगवन् O Worshipful one, इत: from here, उत्तिष्ठ arise.
data.md: And this place through your grace will attain the name of Siddhasrama. The work, O lord of the celestials, has been accomplished.

data.v: अथ विष्णुर्महातेजा अदित्यां समजायत । वामनं रूपमास्थाय वैरोचनिमुपागमत् ॥
data.es: Then the resplendent Visnu, born from the womb of Aditi and assuming the form of Vamana, approached, the son of Virochana (Bali).
data.anv: अथ then, महातेजा: highly resplendent one, विष्णु: Vishnu, अदित्याम् from the womb of Aditi, समजायत was born, वामनं रुपम् form of Vamana, आस्थाय assuming, वैरोचनिम्  emperor Bali,the son of Virochana, उपागमत् approached.
data.md: Do you now, O you of the six attributes, ascend from hence! And accordingly Vişnu of mighty energy took his birth in Aditi. And assuming the form of a dwarf, he presented himself before Virocana's son.

data.v: त्रीन्क्रमानथ भिक्षित्वा प्रतिगृह्य च मानतः । आक्रम्य लोकाँल्लोकात्मा सर्वभूतहिते रतः ॥
data.es: Thereafter, Visnu, soul of the universe who restores respect (for the righeous), and renders the welfare of all living beings, having begged from Bali, and been granted three places to put his footsteps on occupied the (three) worlds and by restraining Bali with his energy, gave (it) back to Mahendra. In this manner the highly lustrous Visnu, gave possession of the three worlds to Mahendra.
data.anv: अथ thereafter, मानद: giver of selfrespect, लोकात्मा the soul of the universe, सर्वभूतहिते रत: engaged in the welfare of all living beings, त्रीन् three, क्रमान् footsteps, भिक्षित्वा having solicited, प्रतिगृह्य च and having received, लोकान् the  worlds, आक्रम्य having occupied, बलिम् Bali, ओजसा with his energy, नियम्य having restrained, महेन्द्राय for Mahendra, पुन: again, प्रादात् gave, महातेजा:स: that highly lustrous Visnu, त्रैलोक्यम् three worlds, पुन: again, शक्रवशम् in the possession of Mahendra, चक्रे made.

data.v: महेन्द्राय पुनः प्रादान्नियम्य बलिमोजसा । त्रैलोक्यं स महातेजाश्चक्रे शक्रवशं पुनः ॥
data.es: Thereafter, Visnu, soul of the universe who restores respect (for the righeous), and renders the welfare of all living beings, having begged from Bali, and been granted three places to put his footsteps on occupied the (three) worlds and by restraining Bali with his energy, gave (it) back to Mahendra. In this manner the highly lustrous Visnu, gave possession of the three worlds to Mahendra.
data.anv: अथ thereafter, मानद: giver of selfrespect, लोकात्मा the soul of the universe, सर्वभूतहिते रत: engaged in the welfare of all living beings, त्रीन् three, क्रमान् footsteps, भिक्षित्वा having solicited, प्रतिगृह्य च and having received, लोकान् the  worlds, आक्रम्य having occupied, बलिम् Bali, ओजसा with his energy, नियम्य having restrained, महेन्द्राय for Mahendra, पुन: again, प्रादात् gave, महातेजा:स: that highly lustrous Visnu, त्रैलोक्यम् three worlds, पुन: again, शक्रवशम् in the possession of Mahendra, चक्रे made.
data.md: And then asking for as much earth as could be covered by three footsteps, that one ever engaged in the welfare of all creatures; with the object of compassing the good of all, stood occupying the worlds. And having by his power restrained Bali, that one of exceeding energy, again conferred the three worlds upon the mighty Indra, and made them subject to his control.

data.v: तेनैष पूर्वमाक्रान्त आश्रमः श्रमनाशनः । मयापि भक्त्या तस्यैष वामनस्योपभुज्यते ॥
data.es: "This asrama, which relieves fatigue, previously under the possession of Vamana, has come under my occoupation for my devotion to him.
data.anv: श्रमनाशन: extinguishing the fatigue, एष:आश्रम: this ashrama, तेन by Vamana, पूर्वम् formerly, आक्रान्त: occupied, तस्य वामनस्य that Vamana's, भक्तय with devotion, मयापि by me also, एष: this ashrama, उपभुज्यते is enjoyed.
data.md: Formerly he used to dwell in this asylum capable of removing fatigue. And hermitage is infested by Raksasas disturbing rites. And, O most puissant of men, here you should slay those ones of wicked ways.

data.v: एतमाश्रममायान्ति राक्षसा विघ्नकारिणः । अत्र ते पुरुषव्याघ्र हन्तव्या दुष्टचारिणः ॥
data.es: "O tiger among men, wicked rakshasas who prowl about the asram and cause obstacles ought to be killed here only.
data.anv: पुरुषव्याघ्र OBest among men, विघ्नकारिण: those causing obstacles, रक्षसा: rakshasas, एतम् आश्रमम् this ashrama, आयान्ति are coming, दुष्टचारिण: the wicked ones, अत्रैव here alone, हन्तव्या: are fit to be killed.
data.md: Formerly he used to dwell in this asylum capable of removing fatigue. And hermitage is infested by Raksasas disturbing rites. And, O most puissant of men, here you should slay those ones of wicked ways.

data.v: अद्य गच्छामहे राम सिद्धाश्रममनुत्तमम् । तदाश्रमपदं तात तवाप्येतद्यथा मम ॥
data.es: "O Rama, now let's go to the unparalleled Siddhashrama. O child this asrama is the same to you as it is to me (treat this as your own)".
data.anv: राम O Rama, अद्य now, अनुत्तमम् the excellent, सिद्धाश्रमम् Siddha ashrama, गच्छामहे shall go तात O Child, तत् that, एतत् this same one, आश्रमपदम् ahrama, मम to me, यथा as, तवापि even for you, तथा in the same way.
data.md: To-day, O Rama, will I repair to this supremely excellent Siddhāśrama. And this asylum, child, is as much your as mine.

data.v: तं दृष्ट्वा मुनयः सर्वे सिद्धाश्रमनिवासिनः । उत्पत्योत्पत्य सहसा विश्वामित्रमपूजयन् ॥
data.es: At the sight of Viswamitra all the ascetics, inmates of Siddhashrama, jumped out instantly and offered him their worship.
data.anv: सिद्धाश्रमनिवासिन: inhabitants of Siddha ashrama, मुनय: ascetics, सर्वे all, तं दृष्ट्वा having seen him, उत्पत्त्य उत्पत्त्य having jumped out, सहसा immediately, विश्वामित्रम् Visvamitra, अपूजयन् worshipped.
data.md: And beholding Viśvāmitra, the ascetics inhabiting Siddhāśrama, suddenly rising in joy, worshipped that intelligent one, and extended to the princes the rites of hospitality.

data.v: यथार्हं चक्रिरे पूजां विश्वामित्राय धीमते । तथैव राजपुत्राभ्यामकुर्वन्नतिथिक्रियाम् ॥
data.es: They extended hospitality to both the princes in the same way they offered their worship to the sagacious Viswamitra.
data.anv: धीमते to the sagacious, विश्वामित्राय Visvamitra, यथार्हम् in a fitting manner, पूजाम् honours, चक्रिरे extended, तथैव in the same manner, राजपुत्राभ्याम् for both the princes, अतिथिक्रियाम् hospitality, अकुर्वन् extended.
data.md: And beholding Viśvāmitra, the ascetics inhabiting Siddhāśrama, suddenly rising in joy, worshipped that intelligent one, and extended to the princes the rites of hospitality.

data.v: मुहूर्तमथ विश्रान्तौ राजपुत्रावरिंदमौ । प्राञ्जली मुनिशार्दूलमूचतू रघुनन्दनौ ॥
data.es: The two princes of the lineage of Raghu, destroyers of foes rested a while and then said to Viswamitra, a tiger amon sages:
data.anv: अथ thereafter, अरिन्दमौ destroyers of enemies, राजपुत्रौ two princes, रघुनन्दनौ Rama and Lakshmana bringing glory to Raghu's race, मुहूर्तम् for a while, विश्रान्तौ having taken rest, प्राञ्जली with folded palms, मुनिशार्दूलम् addressing best of asetics,Visvamitra, ऊचतु: spoke.
data.md: And then having reposed for a while, those unreproved princes, the descendants of Raghu, with clasped hands, addressed that foremost of ascetics.

data.v: अद्यैव दीक्षां प्रविश भद्रं ते मुनिपुंगव । सिद्धाश्रमोऽयं सिद्धः स्यात्सत्यमस्तु वचस्तव ॥
data.es: O foremost of ascetics Get initialed today. You will prosper and this asram will attain its fulfilment. Your words shall come true.
data.anv: मुनिपुङ्गव O Foremost of ascetics, अद्यैव today itself, दीक्षाम् initiation ceremony, प्रविश enter, ते भद्रम् May you prosper, अयं सिद्धाश्रम: this siddha ashrama, सिद्ध:स्यात् may attain  perfection, तव वच: your words, सत्यम् अस्तु shall become truthful.
data.md: Be you even to-day initiated to the ceremony. Good betide you, O best of ascetics! Let this Siddhāśrama verily attain fruition, and let your words be verified!

data.v: एवमुक्तो महातेजा विश्वामित्रो महामुनिः । प्रविवेश तदा दीक्षां नियतो नियतेन्द्रियः ॥
data.es: Saying this, Viswamitra, the great saint effulgent and self trained engaged himself in the initiation ceremony.
data.anv: एवम् in this manner, उक्त:spoken, महातेजा: the highly lustrous, विश्वामित्र: Visvamitra, महान् ऋषि: great ascetic, तदा then, नियत: engaged in the religious observance, नियतेन्द्रिय: with restrained senses, दीक्षाम् initiation ceremony, प्रविवेश entered.

data.v: कुमारावपि तां रात्रिमुषित्वा सुसमाहितौ । प्रभातकाले चोत्थाय विश्वामित्रमवन्दताम् ॥
data.es: The two princes spent the right comfortably and woke up at daybreak. They performed morning in accordance with the prescribed rule, ablutions, said their prayers and paid their respects to Viswamitra seated at the kindled firesacrifice.इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये बालकाण्डे एकोनत्रिंशस्सर्ग:॥Thus ends the twentyninth sarga of Balakanda of the holy Ramayana the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.
data.anv: कुमारौ अपि the two princes also, तां रात्रिम् during that night, सुसमाहितौ with well composed minds, उषित्वा having dwelt, प्रभातकाले at daybreak, उत्थाय having woken up, स्पृष्टोदकौ having touched water, शुची cleansed themselves, पूर्वां सन्ध्याम् morning ablutions, उपास्य having performed, नियमेन in accordance with prescribed rules, जप्यम्  reciting prayers, समाप्य having completed, हुताग्निहोत्रम् one who has kindled sacrificial fire, आसीनम् seated, विश्वामित्रम् Visvamitra, अवन्दताम् paid their homage.

data.v: अथ तौ देशकालज्ञौ राजपुत्रावरिंदमौ । देशे काले च वाक्यज्ञावब्रूतां कौशिकं वचः ॥
data.es: Thus spoke the two princes to Viswamitra. They were conscious of place and time to speak and capable of conquering enemies.
data.anv: अथ then, देशकालज्ञौ two knowledgeable persons with regard to time and place, अरिन्दमौ subduers of enemies, देशे in a particular place, काले च and time, वाक्यज्ञौ knowers of  speech, तौ both, राजपुत्रौ two princes, कौशिकम् addressing Visvamitra, वच: words, अब्रूताम् they spoke.
data.md: Then those princes, repressors of foes, cognizant of place, and time, and words, thus spoke to Kuśika's son agreeably to time and place, saying,

data.v: भगवञ्श्रोतुमिच्छावो यस्मिन्काले निशाचरौ । संरक्षणीयौ तौ ब्रह्मन्नातिवर्तेत तत्क्षणम् ॥
data.es: "O adorable Brahmarshi, we want to know around what time the rakshasas will make their appearance so that the sacrifice can be protected. Let not that moment pass".
data.anv: भगवन् O Adorable one, ब्रह्मन् O Brahmarshi, तौ निशाचरौ those two rakshasas, यस्मिन् काले in whatever time, संरक्षणीयौ to be protectd, श्रोतुम् to listen, इच्छाव: we are both desirous, तत् क्षणम् that moment, नातिवर्तेत shall not pass away.
data.md: O adorable one, do you tell us as to the time when we should oppose those rangers of the night! Let not that hour pass away!

data.v: एवं ब्रुवाणौ काकुत्स्थौ त्वरमाणौ युयुत्सया । सर्वे ते मुनयः प्रीताः प्रशशंसुर्नृपात्मजौ ॥
data.es: The sages (of the asrama) were very pleased. They extolled the princes of Kakustha dynasty, who were eager to fight the rakshasas.
data.anv: काकुत्स्थौ Rama and Lakshmana, एवम् in this manner, ब्रुवाणौ speaking thus, युयुत्सया with a desire to fight rakshasas, त्वरमाणौ with eagerness, नृपात्मजौ two princes, ते मुनय: those sages, सर्वे all, प्रीता: pleased, प्रशशंसु: extolled them.
data.md: Upon the two Kākutsthas' saying this, and finding them prompt for the encounter, those ascetics well-pleased, fell to extolling the sons of the king.

data.v: अद्य प्रभृति षड्रात्रं रक्षतं राघवौ युवाम् । दीक्षां गतो ह्येष मुनिर्मौनित्वं च गमिष्यति ॥
data.es: "O sons of Raghu's lineage protect the sacrifice for six nights from today. With the ceremoney initiated, the sage would observe silence said the inmates".
data.anv: राघवौ Rama and Lakshmana, युवाम् both of you, अद्यप्रभृति from today onwards, षड्रात्रम् six nights, रक्षतम् you may protect, एष: मुनि: this sage Visvamitra, दीक्षाम् initiation ceremony, गत: has entered, मौनित्वं च strict silence also, गमिष्यति will attain.
data.md: For six nights from to-day, you should protects us. This ascetic has been initiated into the sacrifice, and must, therefore, observe taciturnity.

data.v: तौ तु तद्वचनं श्रुत्वा राजपुत्रौ यशस्विनौ । अनिद्रौ षडहोरात्रं तपोवनमरक्षताम् ॥
data.es: At these words of the sages the illustrious princes got ready to protect the tapovana for six days and six nights without sleep.
data.anv: यशस्विनौ the two illustrious, तौ राजपुत्रौ the two princes, तत् वचनम् those words, श्रुत्वा having heard, षडहोरात्रम् six days and six nights, अनिद्रौ without sleep, तपोवनम् Tapovana,  अरक्षताम् protected.
data.md: Hearing these words of theirs, those illustrious princes, renouncing sleep, began to guard the hermitage day and night; and those heroic and mighty archers protected that best of ascetics and subduer of enemies.

data.v: उपासां चक्रतुर्वीरौ यत्तौ परमधन्विनौ । ररक्षतुर्मुनिवरं विश्वामित्रमरिंदमौ ॥
data.es: The two mighty, heroic archers (Rama and Lakshmana), destroyers of enemies attended upon the sacrifice in order to protect sage Viswamitra.
data.anv: परमधन्विनौ two mighty archers, वीरौ two heroes, यत्तौ fully equipped, उपासाञ्चक्रतु: attended upon the sacrifice, अरिन्दमौ two destroyers of enemies, विश्वामित्रम् मुनिवरम् Visvamitra maharshi, ररक्षतु: protected.
data.md: Hearing these words of theirs, those illustrious princes, renouncing sleep, began to guard the hermitage day and night; and those heroic and mighty archers protected that best of ascetics and subduer of enemies.

data.v: अथ काले गते तस्मिन्षष्ठेऽहनि समागते । सौमित्रमब्रवीद्रामो यत्तो भव समाहितः ॥
data.es: Time passed. When the sixth day arrived Rama cautioned Lakshmana to be vigilant.
data.anv: अथ then, तस्मिन् काले when that period, गते had lapsed, षष्ठे when the sixth, अहनि day, समागते had approached, राम: Rama, सौमित्रिम् addressing Lakshmana, यत्त: be ready,  समाहित: भव be vigilant, अब्रनवीत् spoke.
data.md: When time had thus gone by and the sixth day had arrived, Rāma said to Sumitrā's son. Being well equipped, be you vigilant!

data.v: रामस्यैवं ब्रुवाणस्य त्वरितस्य युयुत्सया । प्रजज्वाल ततो वेदिः सोपाध्यायपुरोहिता ॥
data.es: While he was fracing up for a fight, the fire on the sacrificial altar with the officiating priests and spiritual guides suddenly brightened.
data.anv: युयुत्सया with a keen desire to fight, त्वरितस्य eagerly awaiting, रामस्य Rama, एवम् in this manner, ब्रुवाणस्य while speaking, तत: thereafter, सोपाध्यायपुरोहिता surrounded by officiating priests and spiritual guides(reciters of the sacred hymns), वेदि: sacrificial  altar, प्रजज्वाल inflammed.
data.md: When Räma, manifesting emotion, and being eager for encounter, had said this, the priests and spiritual guides lit up the altar. And along with Viśvāmitra and the family priests, they lit up the altar furnished with Kusa, and Kasa, and ladles, and faggots, and flowers.

data.v: मन्त्रवच्च यथान्यायं यज्ञोऽसौ संप्रवर्तते । आकाशे च महाञ्शब्दः प्रादुरासीद्भयानकः ॥
data.es: While the sacrifice was being performed in accordance with mantras, a great sound causing fear emerged from the sky.
data.anv: असौ यज्ञ: this sacrifice, मन्त्रवत् in accordance with mantras, यथान्यायम् properly, सम्प्रवर्तते was being performed, आकाशे in the sky, भयानक: causing fear, महान् शब्द: great sound, प्रादुरासीत् emerged.
data.md: And as reciting mantras, they were about to duly engage in that sacrifice, there arose a mighty and dreadful uproar in the sky.

data.v: आवार्य गगनं मेघो यथा प्रावृषि निर्गतः । तथा मायां विकुर्वाणौ राक्षसावभ्यधावताम् ॥
data.es: Like the clouds in the rainy season, the two rakshasas (Maricha and Subahu), covering the sky through their power of illusion, came running (to the sacrificial place).
data.anv: प्रावृषि in the rainy season, निर्गत: originated, मेघ: clouds, यथा like, तथा similarly, गगनम् sky, आवार्य having covered, राक्षसौ two rakshasas, मायाम् illusion, विकुर्वाणौ displaying, अभ्यधावताम् came running.
data.md: And as in the rains, masses of clouds appear enveloping the firmament, the Rākşasas, displaying illusions in that wise, began to rush onward. And Mārīca and Subāhu together with their followers coming in dreadful forms, began to shower down blood upon the altar.

data.v: मारीचश्च सुबाहुश्च तयोरनुचरास्तथा । आगम्य भीमसंकाशा रुधिरौघानवासृजन् ॥
data.es: Maricha and Subahu of fearful appearance arrived with their followers and rained streams of blood (on the sacrificial altar).
data.anv: भीमसङ्काशा fearful appearance, मारीचश्च Maricha, सुबाहश्च Subahu, तयो: their, ये अनुचरा: those of the followers, आगम्य having arrived, रुधिरौघम् streams of blood, अवासृजन् rained.
data.md: And as in the rains, masses of clouds appear enveloping the firmament, the Rākşasas, displaying illusions in that wise, began to rush onward. And Mārīca and Subāhu together with their followers coming in dreadful forms, began to shower down blood upon the altar.

data.v: तावापतन्तौ सहसा दृष्ट्वा राजीवलोचनः । लक्ष्मणं त्वभिसंप्रेक्ष्य रामो वचनमब्रवीत् ॥
data.es: Having seen them (Maricha and Subahu) suddenly advancing the lotuseyed Rama gazed at Lakshmana and said:
data.anv: राजीवलोचन: the lotuseyed, राम: Rama, सहसा suddenly, आपतन्तौ advancing towards, तौ them, दृष्ट्वा having seen, लक्ष्मणम् addressing Lakshmana, अभिसम्प्रेक्ष्य fixing his sight at him, वचनम् these words, अब्रवीत् spoke.
data.md: And on seeing the altar deluged with gore, Rāma suddenly rushed forward, and behold them in the sky. And suddenly seeing them rushing in amain, the lotus-eyed Rāma fixing his gaze at Laksmana, said.

data.v: पश्य लक्ष्मण दुर्वृत्तान्राक्षसान्पिशिताशनान् । मानवास्त्रसमाधूताननिलेन यथाघनान् ॥
data.es: "O Lakshmana, behold, by manavaastra I shall chase, like clouds scattered by winds those wicked rakshasas who eat human flesh".
data.anv: लक्ष्मण O Lakshmana, दुर्वृत्तान् wicked behavioured, पिशिताशनान् human flesh eaters, राक्षसान् rakshasas, अनिलेन by wind, घनान् यथा like clouds, मानवास्त्रसमाधूतान् scattered away by Manava astra, पश्य behold.
data.md: Behold O Lakşmana, by means of a Mānava weapon, I shall, without doubt, drive away the wicked; flesh-eating Raksasas, even as the wind drive away clouds before it. Surely I cannot bring myself to slay such as these.

data.v: मानवं परमोदारमस्त्रं परमभास्वरम् । चिक्षेप परमक्रुद्धो मारीचोरसि राघवः ॥
data.es: The inflamed Rama hurled the highly powerful and effulgent Manavaastra on the chest of Maricha.
data.anv: राघव: Rama, परमोदारम् greatly powerful, परमभास्वरम् highly effulgent, मानवम् Manava,  अस्त्रम् astra, परमक्रुद्ध: exceedingly furious, मारीचोरसि in the chest of Maricha, चिक्षेप hurled.
data.md: Saying this, that descendant of Raghu, Rāma, in vehemence fixing on his bow an exceedingly mighty and gloriously-dazzling Mānava weapon, discharged it in great wrath at Mārīca's chest.

data.v: स तेन परमास्त्रेण मानवेन समाहितः । संपूर्णं योजनशतं क्षिप्तः सागरसंप्लवे ॥
data.es: Smitten by that powerful Manavaastra, Maricha was thrown to a full distance of hundred yojanas into the surging high seas.
data.anv: तेन by that, मानवेन Manava, परमास्त्रेण powerful astra, समाहित: smitten, स: he, Maricha, सम्पूर्णम् completely at a distance of, योजनशतम् hundred yojanas, सागरसम्प्लवे in the  surging high seas, क्षिप्त: was cast away.
data.md: And wounded by that foremost of Mānava weapons, Mārīca carried off a sheer hundred Yojanas, dropped in the midst of the ocean.

data.v: विचेतनं विघूर्णन्तं शीतेषुबलपीडितम् । निरस्तं दृश्य मारीचं रामो लक्ष्मणमब्रवीत् ॥
data.es: Having seen Maricha beaten by the power of that coolarrowed astra, thrown to a distance, reeling and lying unconscious, Rama spoke to Lakshmana:
data.anv: शीतेषु बलताडितम् beaten by the power of that cool astra, विचेतनम् without senses, विघूर्णन्त  म् reeling, निरस्तम् thrown at a distance, मारीचम् Maricha, दृश्य having seen, राम: Rama, लक्ष्मणम् addressing Lakshmana, अब्रवीत् spoke.
data.md: And finding Mārica senseless, and whirling, and afflicted by the might of the weapon, and overcome, Rama addressed Laksmana, saying.

data.v: पश्य लक्ष्मण शीतेषुं मानवं धर्मसंहितम् । मोहयित्वा नयत्येनं न च प्राणैर्वियुज्यते ॥
data.es: "O Lakshmana behold this Manavaastra associated with righteousness employing a cool arrow, which carries him away by making him unconscious and yet not taking his life.
data.anv: लक्ष्मण O Lakshmana, धर्मसंहितम् associated with righteousness, मानवं शीतेषुम् Manava astra employing cool arrow, पश्य behold, एनं मोहयित्वा making him unconscious, नयति is carrying away, प्राणै: with his life, न व्ययुज्यत he is not separated.
data.md: Behold, O Laksmana, this Manava weapon first used by Manu, depriving him of his senses has carried him off, and yet has not taken his life!

data.v: इमानपि वधिष्यामि निर्घृणान्दुष्टचारिणः । राक्षसान्पापकर्मस्थान्यज्ञघ्नान्रुधिराशनान् ॥
data.es: "I shall slay these merciless, wicked doors of sinful acts destroyers of sacrifices and blood rakshasas".
data.anv: निर्घृणान् merciless, दुष्टचारिण: of wicked behaviour, पापकर्मस्थान् doers of sinful acts, यज्ञघ्नान् destroyers of sacrifices, रुधिराशनान् blood-thirsty, इमान् राक्षसानपि these rakshasas also, वधिष्यामि I will slay them.
data.md: But these shameless, wicked, and blooddrinking Raksasas, delighting in wrong-doing, these disturbers of sacrifices, will I slaughter.

data.v: विगृह्य सुमहच्चास्त्रमाग्नेयं रघुनन्दनः । सुबाहुरसि चिक्षेप स विद्धः प्रापतद्भुवि ॥
data.es: Then Rama took hold of the celestial, marvellous Agneya weapon and hurled it into the chest of Subahu. Struck, Subahuhe fell down on the ground.
data.anv: तत: then, राम: Rama, दिव्यम् celestial, अद्भुतम् marvellous, आग्नेयास्त्रम् Agneya weapon, सङ्गृह्य having taken, सुबाहूरसि in the chest of Subahu, चिक्षेप hurled, स: he, विद्ध: having been struck down, भुवि on the ground, प्रापतत् fell down.

data.v: शेषान्वायव्यमादाय निजघान महायशाः । राघवः परमोदारो मुनीनां मुदमावहन् ॥
data.es: Illustrious and highly generous Rama killed the remaining rakshasas with the Vayavya weapon to the delight of the ascetics.
data.anv: महायशा: illustrious, परमोदार: highly generous, राघव: Rama, मुनीनाम् for Ascetics, मुदम् delight, आवहन् causing, वायव्यम् Vayavya weapon, आदाय seizing, शेषान् remaining, निजघान killed.

data.v: स हत्वा राक्षसान्सर्वान्यज्ञघ्नान्रघुनन्दनः । ऋषिभिः पूजितस्तत्र यथेन्द्रो विजये पुरा ॥
data.es: Having killed the rakshasas, obstructors of sacrifices, Rama was worshipped by the hermits like Indra was honoured in the past when he was victorious.
data.anv: रघुनन्दन: Rama, यज्ञघ्नान् obstructors of sacrifice, राक्षसान् rakshasas, सर्वान् all, हत्वा having killed, पुरा formerly, विजये when victorious, इन्द्र: यथा like Indra, तत्र there, ऋषिभि: by saints, पूजित: was worshipped.
data.md: Having destroyed all those Rākşasas disturbing sacrifices, Raghu's descendant was honoured by the saints, even as Indra in day of yore, after having vanquished the Asuras.

data.v: अथ यज्ञे समाप्ते तु विश्वामित्रो महामुनिः । निरीतिका दिशो दृष्ट्वा काकुत्स्थमिदमब्रवीत् ॥
data.es: Thereafter, when the sacrifice was completed, maharshi Viswamitra beholding all the directions bereft of evils, said to Rama:
data.anv: अथ thereafter, यज्ञे when the sacrifice, समाप्ते was  completed, विश्वामित्र: महामुनि: maharshi Visvamitra, निरीतिका:दिश: all the directions bereft of evils, दृष्टवा after beholding, काकुत्स्थम् addressing Rama, इदम् these words, अब्रवीत् uttered.
data.md: When the sacrifice had been completed, the mighty ascetic Viśvāmitra, beholding all sides cleared of Rākṣasas, spoke to Käkutstha, saying,

data.v: कृतार्थोऽस्मि महाबाहो कृतं गुरुवचस्त्वया । सिद्धाश्रममिदं सत्यं कृतं राम महायशः ॥
data.md: O mighty-armed one, I have obtained my desire; and you have executed your preceptor's mandate. And, O illustrious hero, you have truly made this a Siddhāśrama. Having thus extolled Rāma, he took Rāma and Lakşmaņa, to perform his evening devotions.

data.v: अथ तां रजनीं तत्र कृतार्थौ रामलक्षणौ । ऊषतुर्मुदितौ वीरौ प्रहृष्टेनान्तरात्मना ॥
data.es: There, with their purpose fulfilled the heroes, Rama and Lakshmana, full of joy in their hearts spent the night.
data.anv: अथ then, कृतार्थौ having fulfilled their purpose, मुदितौ rejoicing, वीरौ two heroes, रामलक्ष्मणौ Rama and Lakshmana, तां रजनीम् that night, प्रहृष्टेन with delighted, अन्तरात्मना hearts, तत्र there, ऊषतु: lived.
data.md: Those heroes, Rāma and Laksmana, their interest secured, with glad hearts passed that night there.

data.v: प्रभातायां तु शर्वर्यां कृतपौर्वाह्णिकक्रियौ । विश्वामित्रमृषींश्चान्यान्सहितावभिजग्मतुः ॥
data.es: As the night dawned, both the brothers performed the morning rites and approached Viswamitra and other rishis.
data.anv: शर्वर्याम् when that night (had passed away), प्रभातायाम् at dawn, कृतपौर्वाह्णिकक्रियौ performing religious rites relating to forenoon, सहितौ together, विश्वामित्रम् Visvamitra, अन्यान् other, ऋषींश्च rishis, अभिजग्मतु: approached.
data.md: And when the night had passed away and the morning come, they together appeared before the saint, Visvāmitra, and the rest.

data.v: अभिवाद्य मुनिश्रेष्ठं ज्वलन्तमिव पावकम् । ऊचतुर्मधुरोदारं वाक्यं मधुरभाषिणौ ॥
data.es: Sweettongued, they visited with folded hands the best of ascetics Viswamitra who was shining like a flaming fire and addressed him thus in sweet and generous words:
data.anv: मधुरभाषिणौ having the disposition of agreeable speech, ज्वलन्तम् flaming, पावकम् इव like fire, मुनिश्रेष्ठम् best of ascetics, अभिवाद्य saluting with folded hands, मधुरोदारम् in sweet and generous way, वाक्यम् words, ऊचतु: uttered.
data.md: And having saluted that foremost of ascetics resembling flaming fire, your addressed him in gentle and honied accents.

data.v: इमौ स्वो मुनिशार्दूल किंकरौ समुपस्थितौ । आज्ञापय यथेष्टं वै शासनं करवाव किम् ॥
data.es: "O tiger among ascetics, we two are at your service. Command whatever you want and we shall execute" it.
data.anv: मुनिशार्दूल O Best of ascetics, किङ्करौ two servants, इमौ here we are, समुपस्थितौ स्म in attendance in your presence, यथेष्टम् freely, आज्ञापय command us, किम् what, शासनम् order, करवाव shall we both do.
data.md: These servants of yours, O best of ascetics, have come before you. Do you command, O chief of anchorites, what command of your are we to execute

data.v: एवमुक्ते ततस्ताभ्यां सर्व एव महर्षयः । विश्वामित्रं पुरस्कृत्य रामं वचनमब्रुवन् ॥
data.es: Having said these words, the celestials were pleased. They honoured Viswamitra and returned to their abodes from where they had come. And then dusk set in.
data.anv: एवम् in this manner, उक्त्वा having said these words, सुरा: celestial beings, सर्वे all, हृष्टा: were pleased, विश्वामित्रम् Visvamitra, पुरस्कृत्य having honoured him, यथागतम् from where they had come from, जग्मु: returned, तत: then, सन्ध्या dusk, प्रवर्तते commences(ed).
data.md: Thus addressed by them the Maharșis with Viśvāmitra at their head spoke to Rāma, saying,

data.v: मैथिलस्य नरश्रेष्ठ जनकस्य भविष्यति । यज्ञः परमधर्मिष्ठस्तत्र यास्यामहे वयम् ॥
data.es: "O foremost of men, Janaka, king of Mithila, is performing a great religious sacrifice. We shall go there.
data.anv: नरश्रेष्ठ O Foremost of men, मैथिलस्य of the king of Mithila, जनकस्य Janaka's, परमधर्मिष्ठ: highly conforming to righteousness, यज्ञ: sacrifice, भविष्यति is going to be performed, वयम् we, तस्य of that sacrifice, यास्यामहे shall go there.
data.md: A highly meritorious sacrifice, O foremost of men, is to be celebrated by Mithila's lord, Janaka. Thither shall we repair.

data.v: त्वं चैव नरशार्दूल सहास्माभिर्गमिष्यसि । अद्भुतं च धनूरत्नं तत्र त्वं द्रष्टुमर्हसि ॥
data.es: O tiger among men, come along with us. You ought to see there the wonderful jewel of a bow.
data.anv: नरशार्दूल O Best among men, त्वम् च you also, अस्माभि: सह along with us, गमिष्यसि will go, तत्र there, अद्भुतम् wonderful, तत् धनुरत्नं च that  jewel of bow, द्रष्टुम् to see, अर्हसि you are  worthy of seeing.
data.md: And you, O tiger among men, men, must accompany us, and there behold a wonderful jewel of a bow.

data.v: तद्धि पूर्वं नरश्रेष्ठ दत्तं सदसि दैवतैः । अप्रमेयबलं घोरं मखे परमभास्वरम् ॥
data.es: O best among men, this bow of immeasurable energy. dreadful and highly lustrous was bestowed on king Janaka by devatas in a sacrificial assembly in the past.
data.anv: नरश्रेष्ठ O Best among men, अप्रमेयबलम् having  immeasurable energy, घोरम् dreadful, परमभास्वरम् highly lustrous, तत् that (bow), पूर्वम् in the ancient days, दैवतै: by devatas, मखे at the sacrifice, सदसि in the sacrificial assembly, दत्तम् was bestowed.
data.md: And formerly this bow of immeasurable energy, and dreadful, and exceedingly effulgent at the sacrifice, had been conferred in court by the celestials (on king Devarata.)8

data.v: नास्य देवा न गन्धर्वा नासुरा न च राक्षसाः । कर्तुमारोपणं शक्ता न कथंचन मानुषाः ॥
data.es: Neither devas, nor gandharvas, nor asuras nor human, are capable of stringing the bow by any means.
data.anv: अस्य of that, आरोपणम् stringing of bow, कर्तुम् to do, देवा: devas, न शक्ता: are not capable, गन्धर्वा: gandharvas ,न not capable, असुरा: asuras, न not capable, राक्षसा: च rakshasas also, न not capable, मानुषा: men, कथञ्चन in any way, न not capable.
data.md: And neither gods nor Gandharvas, neither Asuras nor Rākşasas nor men, can fix the string upon it.

data.v: धनुषस्तस्य वीर्यं हि जिज्ञासन्तो महीक्षितः । न शेकुरारोपयितुं राजपुत्रा महाबलाः ॥
data.es: Mighty princes and kings have failed to string it, in their attempt to know its strength.
data.anv: राजपुत्रा: princes, महाबला: possesing mighty strength, महीक्षित: kings, तस्य धनुष: that bow's, वीर्यम् prowess, जिज्ञासन्त: intent on knowing, आरोपयितुम् attempted to lift or string it, न शेकु: failed.
data.md: And desirous of being acquainted with the prowess of this bow, many kings and princes came; but they in spite of their mighty strength, failed in stringing it.

data.v: तद्धनुर्नरशार्दूल मैथिलस्य महात्मनः । तत्र द्रक्ष्यसि काकुत्स्थ यज्ञं चाद्भुतदर्शनम् ॥
data.es: O best of men, O descendent of Kakustha, there you will see the bow that belongs to the magnanimous king of Mithila and the wonderful sacrifice at that place.
data.anv: नरशार्दूल O Best among men, काकुत्स्थ O Descendent of Kakutstha, महात्मन: of the  magnanimous, मैथिलस्य of the king of Mithila, तद्धनु: that bow, अद्भुतदर्शनम् wonderful to look at, यज्ञं च that sacrifice, तत्र there, द्रक्ष्यसि you will see.
data.md: There, O Kākutstha, you will behold that bow belonging to the high-souled king of Mithila, as well as his exceedingly wonderful sacrifice..
