data.v: तद्धि यज्ञफलं तेन मैथिलेनोत्तमं धनुः । याचितं नरशार्दूल सुनाभं सर्वदैवतैः ॥
data.es: O best among men, that excellent bow strong in the middle was offered by king of Mithila, Devarata as well as by all devatas as fruit of the sacrifice.
data.anv: नरशार्दूल O Best among men, सुनाभम् with strong centre, तत् that, उत्तमं superior, धनु: bow, तेन मैथिलेन by the king of Mithila, Devarata, सर्वदैवतै: by all devatas, यज्ञफलम् as fruit of the sacrifice, याचितं हि solicited.
data.md: That rare bow, O foremost of men, furnished with an excellent device for griping it, had been solicited by Mithila's lord as the fruit of his sacrifice; and the celestials conferred it upon him.

data.v: एवमुक्त्वा मुनिवरः प्रस्थानमकरोत्तदा । सर्षिसंघः सकाकुत्स्थ आमन्त्र्य वनदेवताः ॥
data.es: Having spoken thus, Viswamitra, the best of ascetics commenced the onward journey along with the Kakutshas and rishis, taking leave of the deities of the forest.
data.anv: मुनिवर: the best of ascetics, एवम् in this way, उक्त्वा having spoken, सर्षिसङ्घ: in the company of rishis, सकाकुत्स्थ: along with Kakutstha, वनदेवता: sylvian deities, आमन्त्र्य taking leave of, तदा then, प्रस्थानम् journey, अकरोत् performed.
data.md: This having been said, that foremost of ascetics, in company with Kākutstha and the saints, departed.

data.v: स्वस्ति वोऽस्तु गमिष्यामि सिद्धः सिद्धाश्रमादहम् । उत्तरे जाह्नवीतीरे हिमवन्तं शिलोच्चयम् ॥
data.es: "(O ascetics of the forest) May you be safe. My purpose has been achieved in this Siddhaashrama. From here I shall go to the Himavanta mountain situated on the northern bank of Jahnavi" (said Viswamitra).
data.anv: (O Deities of the forest) व: स्वस्ति may safety be yours, सिद्ध: my purpose has been achieved, अहम् I, सिद्धाश्रमात् from Siddha ashrama, उत्तरे जाह्नवीतीरे on northern side of river Jahnavi, हिमवन्तम् named Himavanta, शिलोच्चयम् mountain, गमिष्यामि I shall go.
data.md: And on the eve of setting out, he addressed the sylvan deities, saying, Luck! I will, with my desire obtained, go from forth this Siddhāśrama to the Himavat mountain on the north of the Jahnavi.

data.v: प्रदक्षिणं ततः कृत्वा सिद्धाश्रममनुत्तमम् । उत्तरां दिशमुद्दिश्य प्रस्थातुमुपचक्रमे ॥
data.es: Thereafter, circumambulating the supreme Siddhasrama with reverence, they (Viswamitra and the princes) commenced their journey in the northern direction.
data.anv: तत: thereafter, अनुत्तमम् the supreme, सिद्धाश्रमम् Siddha asrama, प्रदक्षिणम्     circumambulation, कृत्वा having made, उत्तरां दिशमुद्दिश्य towards northern direction, प्रस्थातुम् to perform journey, उपचक्रमे commenced.
data.md: Having said this, that tiger-like ascetic, Kusika's son, along with other anchorets having asceticism for their wealth, set out in a northerly direction.

data.v: तं व्रजन्तं मुनिवरमन्वगादनुसारिणाम् । शकटी शतमात्रं तु प्रयाणे ब्रह्मवादिनाम् ॥
data.es: As Viswamitra, the best of ascetics set out on his journey, expounders of the Vedas followed him, nearly in one hundred carriages.
data.anv: प्रयान्तम् as he set out for his onward journey, तं मुनिवरम् the best of ascetics, अनुसारिणाम् who was following, ब्रह्मवादिनाम् of the expounders of vedas, प्रायेण nearly, शकटीशतमात्रम् one hundred carriages alone, अन्वयात् followed.
data.md: And as that best of ascetics proceeded, he was followed by Brāhmaṇas, unholding the Veda, carrying the sacrificial necessaries on an hundred cars.

data.v: मृगपक्षिगणाश्चैव सिद्धाश्रमनिवासिनः । अनुजग्मुर्महात्मानं विश्वामित्रं महामुनिम् ॥
data.es: Birds and beasts living in Siddhaashrama also followed the illustrious maharshi Viswamitra over a long distance until he sent them back.
data.anv: सिद्धाश्रमनिवासिन: living in Siddha asrama, मृगपक्षिगणाश्चैव hosts of birds and beasts, महात्मानम् the illustrious, विश्वामित्रं महामुनिम् maharshi Visvamitra, अनुजग्मु: followed, पक्षिसङ्गान् host of birds, मृगानपि beasts, (ततः) निवर्तयामास sent them back.
data.md: And birds and beasts dwelling in Siddhāśrama followed the high-souled Viśvāmitra having asceticism for wealth.

data.v: ते गत्वा दूरमध्वानं लम्बमाने दिवाकरे । वासं चक्रुर्मुनिगणाः शोणाकूले समाहिताः ॥
data.es: The sages travelled a long distance and halted on the bank of Sona at sunset.
data.anv: ते मुनिगणा: those groups of sages, दूरम् अध्वानम् a long way, गत्वा having gone, दिवाकरे when the Sun, लम्बमाने was hanging down, समाहिता: assembled, शोणाकूले on the bank of river Sona, वासम् halt, चक्रु: made.

data.v: तेऽस्तं गते दिनकरे स्नात्वा हुतहुताशनाः । विश्वामित्रं पुरस्कृत्य निषेदुरमितौजसः ॥
data.es: The sages who possessed great splendour bathed and offered oblations to fire at sunset and sat in front of Viswamitra.
data.anv: अमितौजस: men possessing great splendour, ते those sages, दिनकरे when the Sun, अस्तंगते was set, स्नात्वा having bathed, हुतहुताशना: having kindled fire, विश्वामित्रम् Viswamitra, पुरस्कृत्य having honoured him, निषेदु: sat down.

data.v: रामोऽपि सहसौमित्रिर्मुनींस्तानभिपूज्य च । अग्रतो निषसादाथ विश्वामित्रस्य धीमतः ॥
data.es: Rama together with Lakshmana having offered respectful salutations to the sages, sat in front of the sagacious Viswamitra.
data.anv: सहसौमित्रि: together with Lakshmana, राम: अपि Rama also, तान् मुनीन् those sages, अभिपूज्य offering respectful salutations, अथ thereafter, धीमत: of the sagacious, विश्वामित्रस्य Viswamitra, अग्रत: in front of, निषसाद sat down.

data.v: अथ रामो महातेजा विश्वामित्रं महामुनिम् । पप्रच्छ मुनिशार्दूलं कौतूहलसमन्वितः ॥
data.es: Thereafter highly lustrous Rama, the best among men, filled with curiosity enquired of the great sage Viswamitra:
data.anv: अथ thereafter, परमोदार: highly generous, राजा king Dasaratha, हृष्टमना: wellpleased, तम् महामुनिम् that great sage, विश्वामित्रम् Visvamitra, अभिपूजयन् while  worshipping, हृष्ट: with joy, उवाच spoke৷৷

data.v: भगवन्को न्वयं देशः समृद्धवनशोभितः । श्रोतुमिच्छामि भद्रं ते वक्तुमर्हसि तत्त्वतः ॥
data.es: "O worshipful one, what could be the reason for this region shining with luxuriant groves? I wish to hear from you. You can tell me all about this (region). May it be safe for you"
data.anv: भगवन् O Worshipful one, समृद्धवनशोभित: shining with affluent groves, अयम् देश: this region, क: नु what could be?, श्रोतुम् to listen, इच्छामि I am desirous, ते भद्रम् may safety be to you, तत्त्वत: truly, वक्तुम् अर्हसि you are fit to tell me.
data.md: Then Rama of exceeding energy, influenced by curiosity, asked that foremost of ascetics, Viśvāmitra, having asceticism for his wealth, saying, 'O worshipful one, what country is this, graced with luxuriant woods? I am desirous of hearing this Good betide you, it behove you to tell me this truly.

data.v: चोदितो रामवाक्येन कथयामास सुव्रतः । तस्य देशस्य निखिलमृषिमध्ये महातपाः ॥
data.es: A sage of excellent vows and rigid austerities, Viswamitra, urged by the words of Rama, described in the midst of rishis the entire story relating to that region.इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये बालकाण्डे एकत्रिंशस्सर्ग:॥Thus ends the thirtyfirst sarga of Balakanda of the holy Ramayana the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.
data.anv: सुव्रत: O Man of excellent vows, महातपा: a sage who performed rigid austerities, रामवाक्येन by the words of Rama, चोदित: urged by, ऋषिमध्ये in the midst of rishis, तस्य  देशस्य that region's, निखिलम् entire story, कथयामास described.
data.md: Thus addressed by Rāma, that one of high austerities and excellent vows began in the midst of the saints to describe the opulence of that region.

data.v: ब्रह्मयोनिर्महानासीत्कुशो नाम महातपाः । वैदर्भ्यां जनयामास चतुरः सदृशान्सुतान् । कुशाम्बं कुशनाभं च आधूर्तरजसं वसुम् ॥
data.es: That great soul, Kusa, married the princess of Vidarbha born in a noble family and a match for him. He begot four virtuous sons who resembled him. They were Kusamba, Kusanabha, Adhurtarajas and Vasu.
data.anv: स: महात्मा that eminent one, कुलीनायाम् in lady of noble descent, युक्तायाम् suitable to him, वैदर्भ्याम् in the princess of Vidarbha, कुशाम्बम् Kusamba, कुशनाभं च Kusanabha also, अधूर्तरजसम् Adhurta Rajasa, वसुम् Vasu, सुगुणोल्बणान् manifesting virtues, सदृशान् suitable ones, चतुर: four, सुतान् sons, जनयामास begot.

data.v: दीप्तियुक्तान्महोत्साहान्क्षत्रधर्मचिकीर्षया । तानुवाच कुशः पुत्रान्धर्मिष्ठान्सत्यवादिनः । क्रियतां पालनं पुत्रा धर्मं प्राप्स्यथ पुष्कलम् ॥
data.es: Kusa addressed his four brilliant sons who were highly enthusiastic, pious, truthful and were wedded to duties of the warrior race:
data.anv: कुश: Kusa, दीप्तियुक्तान् lustrous, महोत्साहान् men of great perseverance, धर्मिष्ठान् eager to observe righteousness, सत्यवादिन: men who always speak truth, तान् पुत्रान् those sons, क्षत्रधर्मचिकीर्षया with a desire to carry out duties of warrior race, उवाच spoke.

data.v: कुशस्य वचनं श्रुत्वा चत्वारो लोकसंमताः । निवेशं चक्रिरे सर्वे पुराणां नृवरास्तदा ॥
data.es: "O my sons, govern with righteousness so that you will acquire immense merit'. Hearing the words of the rishi, the four sons who were the best among men and revered in the world constructed four cities as their abodes.
data.anv: पुत्रा: O My sons, पालनम् governance, क्रियताम् may be done, पुष्कलम् immense, धर्मं merit, प्राप्स्यथ you acquire, तदा then, ऋषे: that rishi's, वचनम् words, श्रुत्वा having heard, लोकसम्मता: men revered in the world, चत्वार: four, नृवरा: best among men, सर्वे all of them, पुराणाम् of the cities, निवेशम् abodes, चक्रिरे constructed.

data.v: कुशाम्बस्तु महातेजाः कौशाम्बीमकरोत्पुरीम् । कुशनाभस्तु धर्मात्मा परं चक्रे महोदयम् ॥
data.es: The brilliant Kushamba and the righteous Kushanabha constructed the cities of Kaushanbi and Mahodaya (as their capital) respectively.
data.anv: महातेजाः man possessing heroic lustre, कुशाम्बस्तु Kushamba on his part, कौशाम्बीम् Kaushambi, पुरीम् city, अकरोत् constructed, धर्मात्मा righteous, कुशनाभस्तु Kushanabha on his part, महोदयम् Mahodaya, पुरम् city, चक्रे constructed.

data.v: आधूर्तरजसो राम धर्मारण्यं महीपतिः । चक्रे पुरवरं राजा वसुश्चक्रे गिरिव्रजम् ॥
data.es: O Rama king Adhurtarajasa constructed Dharmaranya, the best of cities and king Vasu, the city of Girivrajam.
data.anv: राम O Rama, अधूर्तरजस: Adhurtarajasa, महीपति: king, धर्मारण्यम् Dharmaranya, पुरवरम् best of cities, चक्रे constructed, राजा king, वसु: Vasu, गिरिव्रजम् city of Girivraja, चक्रे constructed.

data.v: एषा वसुमती राम वसोस्तस्य महात्मनः । एते शैलवराः पञ्च प्रकाशन्ते समन्ततः ॥
data.es: O Rama this place where we are (called Vasumati) belongs to the magnanimous king Vasu. This is surrounded by five great shining mountains.
data.anv: राम O Rama, एषा this,  महात्मन: of the magnanimous, तस्य वसो: that Vasu's, वसुमती land, समन्तत: surrounded by, पञ्च five, शैलवरा: excellent mountains, प्रकाशन्ते shining.
data.md: This city (otherwise) called Vasumatī belongs to the high-souled Vasu. And the river known by the name of Sumāgadhi flows through the Māgadhas. And in the midst of the five foremost of hills, it looks like a garland.

data.v: सुमागधी नदी रम्या मागधान्विश्रुताययौ । पञ्चानां शैलमुख्यानां मध्ये मालेव शोभते ॥
data.es: The delightful and renowned river Sumagadhi (known as Sona), flowing in the country of Magadha, looks beautiful like a garland amidst five great mountains.
data.anv: रम्या delightful, विश्रुता renowned, सुमागधी नदी river Sumagadhi, मगधान् in Magadha, आययौ is flowing, पञ्चानाम् of the five, शैलमुख्यानाम् best of mountains, मध्ये amidst, माला इव like a  garland, शोभते is shining.
data.md: This city (otherwise) called Vasumatī belongs to the high-souled Vasu. And the river known by the name of Sumāgadhi flows through the Māgadhas. And in the midst of the five foremost of hills, it looks like a garland.

data.v: सैषा हि मागधी राम वसोस्तस्य महात्मनः । पूर्वाभिचरिता राम सुक्षेत्रा सस्यमालिनी ॥
data.es: Rama, this Magadhi river, of great Vasu flows from the east surrounded by fertile crops fields like a garland.
data.anv: राम Rama, सा एषा मागधी the same Magadhi river, महात्मन: of the magnanimous, तस्य वसो: pertains to Vasu, पूर्वाभिचरिता flowing from east, सुक्षेत्रा with fertile fields, सस्यमालिनी surrounded by crops as a garland.
data.md: And this Mägadhi, O Råma, belongs to the high-souled Vasu, taking, O Rāma, an easterly course, and flowing through fertile fields furnished with corn.

data.v: कुशनाभस्तु राजर्षिः कन्याशतमनुत्तमम् । जनयामास धर्मात्मा घृताच्यां रघुनन्दन ॥
data.es: O scion of the Raghu family, the virtuous rajarshi Kusanabha begot one hundred beautiful daughters through a nymph named Ghritachi.
data.anv: रघुनन्दन O Prince Raghu, धर्मात्मा the virtuous one, राजर्षि: rajarshi (a kshtriya who governs kingdom in saintly detached way), कुशनाभ: तु Kusanabha, घृताच्याम् in a nymph named Ghritachi, अनुत्तमम् extremely beautiful, कन्याशतम् one hundred daughters, जनयामास begot.
data.md: O descendant of Raghu, the Rājarși Kusanābha beget an hundred godly daughters on Ghrtaci.

data.v: तास्तु यौवनशालिन्यो रूपवत्यः स्वलंकृताः । उद्यानभूमिमागम्य प्रावृषीव शतह्रदाः ॥
data.es: Those welladorned, beautiful, young maidens in the pleasuregarden looked like lightnings in the rainy season. Bedecked with fine ornaments they were singing, dancing, playing on instruments and moving in all directions in great delight.
data.anv: यौवनशालिन्य: resplendent with youth, रूपवत्य: beautiful, ता: they, स्वलङ्कृता: well adorned, उद्यानभूमिम् pleasuregarden, आगम्य having reached, प्रावृषि in the rainy season, शतह्रदा: इव like lightenings, गायन्त्य: singing, नृत्यमानाश्च dancing, वादयन्त्य: playing on instruments, वराभरणभूषिता: decked with all ornaments, सर्वश: moving in all directions, परमम् great, आमोदम् delight, जग्मु: obtained.

data.v: गायन्त्यो नृत्यमानाश्च वादयन्त्यश्च राघव । आमोदं परमं जग्मुर्वराभरणभूषिताः ॥
data.es: Those welladorned, beautiful, young maidens in the pleasuregarden looked like lightnings in the rainy season. Bedecked with fine ornaments they were singing, dancing, playing on instruments and moving in all directions in great delight.
data.anv: यौवनशालिन्य: resplendent with youth, रूपवत्य: beautiful, ता: they, स्वलङ्कृता: well adorned, उद्यानभूमिम् pleasuregarden, आगम्य having reached, प्रावृषि in the rainy season, शतह्रदा: इव like lightenings, गायन्त्य: singing, नृत्यमानाश्च dancing, वादयन्त्य: playing on instruments, वराभरणभूषिता: decked with all ornaments, सर्वश: moving in all directions, परमम् great, आमोदम् delight, जग्मु: obtained.

data.v: अथ ताश्चारुसर्वाङ्ग्यो रूपेणाप्रतिमा भुवि । उद्यानभूमिमागम्य तारा इव घनान्तरे ॥
data.es: With beautiful limbs of unparalleled beauty on earth, they shone in the pleasuregarden like stars in the midst of clouds.
data.anv: अथ there after, चारुसर्वाङ्ग्य: having all beautiful limbs, रूपेण in beauty, भुवि on earth, अप्रतिमा: unparalleled, ता: those maidens, उद्यानभूमिम् pleasuregarden, आगम्य having reached, घनान्तरे in the midst of clouds, तारा: इव like stars (appeared).

data.v: ताः सर्वगुणसंपन्ना रूपयौवनसंयुताः । दृष्ट्वा सर्वात्मको वायुरिदं वचनमब्रवीत् ॥
data.es: At the sight of the maidens embellished with all virtues and youth and beauty, the allpervading Windgod addressed them these words:
data.anv: सर्वात्मक: the all pervading one, वायु: windgod, सर्वगुणसम्पन्ना: those women endowed with all virtues, रूपयौवनसंयुता: blessed with youth and beauty, ता: them, दृष्ट्वा having seen, इदम् these, वचनम् words, अब्रवीत् spoke.

data.v: अहं वः कामये सर्वा भार्या मम भविष्यथ । मानुषस्त्यज्यतां भावो दीर्घमायुरवाप्स्यथ ॥
data.es: I request you all to be my wives. You will leave this feeling of mortality and attain a long life.
data.anv: अहम् I, व: सर्वा: all of you, कामये I am loving, मम my, भार्या: wives, भविष्यथ you may agree to become, मानुष: mortal, भाव: feeling, त्यज्यताम् may be abandoned, दीर्घम् long duration, आयु: of life, अवाप्स्यथ you may attain.
data.md: I seek for you: do you become my wives. Do you renounce this human guise, and attain long lives.

data.v: तस्य तद्वचनं श्रुत्वा वायोरक्लिष्टकर्मणः । अपहास्य ततो वाक्यं कन्याशतमथाब्रवीत् ॥
data.es: At the works of the untiringly blowing Windgod the lunged maidens laughed and said:
data.anv: तत: thereafter, अक्लिष्टकर्मण: of him who accompanies pious and wise acts, तस्य वायो: that windgod's, तत् वचनम् those words, श्रुत्वा having heard, अपहास्य ridiculing him, कन्याशतम् hundred maidens, अथ thereafter, वाक्यम् these words, अब्रवीत् spoke.
data.md: Hearing this speech of the Air of ever fresh energy, the damsels ridiculing it, said.

data.v: अन्तश्चरसि भूतानां सर्वेषां त्वं सुरोत्तम । प्रभावज्ञाश्च ते सर्वाः किमस्मानवमन्यसे ॥
data.es: "O best among devatas you move within all living beings, we feel your impact. Why do you insult us?
data.anv: सुरोत्तम O Best among devatas, त्वम् you, सर्वेषाम् of everyone, भूतानाम् living beings, अन्त: within, चरसि you move, सर्वा: all of us, ते your, प्रभावज्ञा: स्म knowers of your valour, अस्मान् us, किम् अवमन्यसे why are you insulting.
data.md: You range the hearts of all creatures, O foremost of celestials, and we also know your influence. Wherefore, then, do you dishonour us?

data.v: कुशनाभसुताः सर्वाः समर्थास्त्वां सुरोत्तम । स्थानाच्च्यावयितुं देवं रक्षामस्तु तपो वयम् ॥
data.es: "O best among devatas we are daughters of Kusanabha, We are capable of pulling you down from your position. We are safeguarding our ascetic merit as virgins (we could curse you to save our ascetic merit)" of Kusnabha.
data.anv: सुरोत्तम O Best among devatas, सर्वा: वयं all of us, कुशनाभसुता: daughters of Kusanabha, देवम् the divine one, त्वाम् you, स्थानात् from your authority, च्यावयितुम् to pull down, समर्था: तु are capable, but, तप: ascetic merit of a virgin, रक्षाम: we are protecting.
data.md: O foremost of celestials, we are the daughters of Kušanābha O divine one. And god as you are, we can dislodge you from your place; but we refrain from doing so, lest thereby we lose our ascetic merit.

data.v: मा भूत्स कालो दुर्मेधः पितरं सत्यवादिनम् । नावमन्यस्व धर्मेण स्वयं वरमुपास्महे ॥
data.es: O wicked one, do not dishonour our father who always speaks the truth. He will choose the bridegrooms righteously. Do not invite death (father may be the cause of your death).
data.anv: दुर्मेध: O Foolish one, सत्यवादिनम् always speaking truth, पितरम् our sire, न अवमन्यस्व you may not dishonour, धर्मेण by ones own duty, स्वयम् personally, वरम् bridegroom, उपास्महे will serve, स: that, काल: time, माभूत् let not come.
data.md: May, O foolish one, that time never come, when disregarding our truthful sire, we following our inclination, shall resort to self choice.

data.v: पिता हि प्रभुरस्माकं दैवतं परमं हि सः । यस्य नो दास्यति पिता स नो भर्ता भविष्यति ॥
data.es: Our father is our lord. Our father is god to us. Whomsoever our father offers us shall become our husband".
data.anv: अस्माकम् for us, पिता our father, प्रभु: हि is lord indeed, स: he, परमम् great, दैवतम् god, पिता father, न: for us, यस्य to whom so ever, दास्यति gives, स: he, न: for us, भर्ता husband, भविष्यति will become.
data.md: Our father verily is our lord an prime god. Of him even shall we become the wives to whom our father give us away.

data.v: तासां तद्वचनं श्रुत्वा वायुः परमकोपनः । प्रविश्य सर्वगात्राणि बभञ्ज भगवान्प्रभुः ॥
data.es: Having heard the words of those maidens, the most powerful and venerable Windgod became furious. He entered all the limbs of their bodies, twisted and distorted them.
data.anv: तासाम् those maidens', तत् वचनम् those words, श्रुत्वा having heard, प्रभु: lord, the powerful one, भगवान् the venerable one, वायु: windgod, परमकोपन: exceedingly enraged, सर्वगात्राणि all the limbs of their body, प्रविश्य having entered, बभञ्ज twisted.

data.v: ताः कन्या वायुना भग्ना विविशुर्नृपतेर्गृहम् । दृष्ट्वा भग्नास्तदा राजा संभ्रान्त इदमब्रवीत् ॥
data.es: Their bodies disfigured and shattered by the Windgod, the maidens with tears flowing from their eyes entered the palace and fell down on the ground, agitated and overtaken by shame.
data.anv: वायुना by windgod, भग्ना: shattered, ता: कन्या: those maidens, नृपते: king's, गृहम् residence, विविशु: entered, संभ्रान्ता: agitated, सलज्जा: overtaken by shame, सास्रलोचना: with tears filling their eyes, भुवि on the ground, प्रापतन् fell down.
data.md: And finding his supremely beautiful and favourite daughters with their limbs broken, and woebegone, the king bewildered, spoke.

data.v: किमिदं कथ्यतां पुत्र्यः को धर्ममवमन्यते । कुब्जाः केन कृताः सर्वा वेष्टन्त्यो नाभिभाषथ ॥
data.es: "O daughters What has happened? Who has dishonoured virtue? Say it at once. Who has made you hunchbacked? Standing roud me, why are you dumb?" The king heaved a sigh and entered into a state of samadhi. इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये बालकाण्डे द्वात्रिंशस्सर्ग:॥Thus ends the thirtysecond sarga of Balakanda of the holy Ramayana the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.
data.anv: पुत्र्य: O Daughters, इदम् this, किम् what?, क: who?, धर्मम् virtue, अवमन्यते is disregarding, कथ्यताम् let it be told, सर्वा: all of you, कुब्जा: hump backed ones, केन कृता: by whom are you disfigured, वेष्टन्त्यः encircling, नाभिभाषथ you are not speaking, राजा king, एवम् in this way, विनिश्वस्य heaved a sigh, तत: then, समाधिम् concentration of mind, सन्दधे attained.
data.md: You daughters, what is this? Who is it that thus disregards virtue? By whom have you all come by this crooked form? And why demonstrating your grief, do you not answer me?' Having said this, the king heaved a deep sigh and became eager to hear all about it.

data.v: तस्य तद्वचनं श्रुत्वा कुशनाभस्य धीमतः । शिरोभिश्चरणौ स्पृष्ट्वा कन्याशतमभाषत ॥
data.es: At the works of the untiringly blowing Windgod the lunged maidens laughed and said:
data.anv: तत: thereafter, अक्लिष्टकर्मण: of him who accompanies pious and wise acts, तस्य वायो: that windgod's, तत् वचनम् those words, श्रुत्वा having heard, अपहास्य ridiculing him, कन्याशतम् hundred maidens, अथ thereafter, वाक्यम् these words, अब्रवीत् spoke.
data.md: Hearing those words of the intelligent Kusanābha, his hundred daughters touching his feet with their heads, said,

data.v: वायुः सर्वात्मको राजन्प्रधर्षयितुमिच्छति । अशुभं मार्गमास्थाय न धर्मं प्रत्यवेक्षते ॥
data.es: "O king, the allpervading Windgod, having taken recourse to foul means intended to outrage our modesty without and moral compunction.
data.anv: राजन् O King, सर्वात्मक: all pervading, वायु: windgod, अशुभम् foul, मार्गम् way, आस्थाय having taken recourse, प्रधर्षयितुम् to outrage, इच्छति is desiring, धर्मम् the law of morality, न प्रत्यवेक्षते does not consider.
data.md: O king, that life of all, the Air, was desirous of overcoming us, having recourse to an improper way; nor did he regard morality.

data.v: पितृमत्यः स्म भद्रं ते स्वच्छन्दे न वयं स्थिताः । पितरं नो वृणीष्व त्वं यदि नो दास्यते तव ॥
data.es: We have our father who is dear to us. Hence we do not have freedom to choose. You may ask our father if he is willing to give us (in marriage).
data.anv: वयम् we, पितृमत्य: स्म: have our father, ते भद्रम् may prosperity be to you, स्वच्छन्दे freely, न स्थिता: (we are) not situated, न: us, तव to you, दास्यते यदि whether he gives, त्वम् you, न: our, पितरम् father, वृणीष्व request.
data.md: We have a father, good betide you; and we live at ease. Do you ask our father about it, if he consent conferring us on you.

data.v: तेन पापानुबन्धेन वचनं न प्रतीच्छता । एवं ब्रुवन्त्यः सर्वाः स्म वायुना निहता भृषम् ॥
data.es: As all of us were speaking thus, the sinful Windgod, disregarding our words repeatedly assaulted us.
data.anv: एवम् in this way, ब्रुवन्त्य: while we were speaking, सर्वा: all of us, पापानुबन्धेन by the sinful one, वचनम् our words, न प्रतीच्छता without accepting, तेन वायुना by that windgod, भृशम् greatly, निहता: we are smitten.
data.md: But that wicked wight did not listen to our words; and as we were saying this, were we roughly handled by him.'

data.v: तासां तद्वचनं श्रुत्वा राजा परमधार्मिकः । प्रत्युवाच महातेजाः कन्याशतमनुत्तमम् ॥
data.es: The deeply religious and highly powerful king, having heard those words of his one hundred exceptional daughters, replied:
data.anv: परमधार्मिक: the highly virtuous one, महातेजा: highly powerful, राजा the king, तासाम् theirs, तत् वचनम् those words, श्रुत्वा having heard, अनुत्तमम् excellent, कन्याशतम् hundred daughters, प्रत्युवाच replied.
data.md: Hearing those words of theirs, the highly pious and puissant king addressed his hundred beautiful daughters, saying

data.v: क्षान्तं क्षमावतां पुत्र्यः कर्तव्यं सुमहत्कृतम् । ऐकमत्यमुपागम्य कुलं चावेक्षितं मम ॥
data.es: "O daughters you have done a great act of forgiveness of which only the tolerant are capable. By taking a united stand, you have protected the honour of my dynasty.
data.anv: पुत्र्य: you, Daughters, क्षमावताम् of those having forberance, कर्तव्यम् fit to be done, क्षान्तम् forbearance, कृतम् has been done, सुमहत् great, ऐकमत्यम् unanimity, उपागम्य taking recourse to, मम my, कुलं च dynasty, अवेक्षितम् is taken into consideration.
data.md: You have displayed a signal example of that forgiveness which is fit to be followed by the forbearing; and that you have unanimously regarded the honour of my house, also conduces to your praise.

data.v: अलंकारो हि नारीणां क्षमा तु पुरुषस्य वा । दुष्करं तच्च वः क्षान्तं त्रिदशेषु विशेषतः ॥
data.es: Whether for women or men forgiveness is an ornament. It is difficult even for gods. For you, daughters, to show it without any difference of opinion is especially hard.
data.anv: नारीणाम् for women, पुरुषस्य वा or for men, क्षमा forbearance, अलङ्कारो हि is an ornament, क्षान्तम् इति यत् which act of  forgiving, तत् दुष्करम् that one is difficult, त्रिदशेषु even for gods, विशेषत: especially difficult, पुत्र्य: Daughters, व: all of you, सर्वासाम् for the rest, अविशेषत: without difference, यादृशी similar to that.
data.md: Alike to men and women, forbearance is an ornament. And difficult it is for one to exercise that forbearance, specially in respect of the celestials. And may every descendant of mine possess forbearance like to yours!

data.v: यादृशीर्वः क्षमा पुत्र्यः सर्वासामविशेषतः । क्षमा दानं क्षमा यज्ञः क्षमा सत्यं च पुत्रिकाः ॥
क्षमा यशः क्षमा धर्मः क्षमायां विष्ठितं जगत् । विसृज्य कन्याः काकुत्स्थ राजा त्रिदशविक्रमः ॥
मन्त्रज्ञो मन्त्रयामास प्रदानं सह मन्त्रिभिः । देशे काले प्रदानस्य सदृशे प्रतिपादनम् ॥
data.es: "O Rama after sending away his daughters, the king endowed with the power of the celestials and wellversed in the art of counselling, consulted his ministers about a suitable person for marriage of his daughters at proper time and place.
data.anv: काकुत्स्थ O Rama, त्रिदशविक्रम: a man endowed with the prowess of celestials, मन्त्रज्ञ: one who is wellversed in counselling, राजा the king, कन्या: daughters, विसृज्य leaving, मन्त्रिभि: सह along with ministers, प्रदानम् bestowing of maidens, मन्त्रयामास consulted, प्रदानस्य for bestowing, देशकालौ proper time and place, सदृशे for a suitable person, प्रतिपादनम् about giving in marriage (consulted).
data.md: Then dismissing his daughters, the king endowed with the prowess of celestials, and versed in counsel, began to consult with his counsellors about the bestowal of his daughters, in respect of time and place and person and equability of lineage.

data.v: एतस्मिन्नेव काले तु चूली नाम महामुनिः । ऊर्ध्वरेताः शुभाचारो ब्राह्मं तप उपागमत् ॥
data.es: At that time a great and virtuous ascetic named Chuli living in celebacy was performing austerities in pursuit of the knowledge of Brahman.
data.anv: एतस्मिन् काले एव during the same time, महातपा: a great ascetic, ऊर्ध्वरेता: living in celebacy, शुभाचार: having clean and auspicious behaviour, चूली नाम named Chuli, ब्राह्मम् in pursuit of knowledge of Brahman, तप: austerities, उपागमत् obtained.
data.md: It came to pass that at this time, an ascetic named Culi, highly effulgent, with his vital fluid under control, and of pure practices, was performing Brāhma austerities.

data.v: तप्यन्तं तमृषिं तत्र गन्धर्वी पर्युपासते । सोमदा नाम भद्रं ते ऊर्मिला तनया तदा ॥
data.es: When he was performing austerities, a nymph named Somada, daughter of Urmila, used to serve him. Prosperity to you
data.anv: तदा then, तत्र there, तप्यन्तम् him who was performing austerities, तम् ऋषिम् that Rishi, ऊर्मिला तनया daughter of Urmila, सोमदा नाम nymph named Somada, गन्धर्वी Gandharva maiden, पर्युपासते doing service, ते भद्रम् prosperity to you.
data.md: And as the saint was engaged in austerities, good betide you, Urmila's daughter named Somada-a Gandharvi-ministered to him.

data.v: सा च तं प्रणता भूत्वा शुश्रूषणपरायणा । उवास काले धर्मिष्ठा तस्यास्तुष्टोऽभवद्गुरुः ॥
data.es: Somada rendered her services with devotion and humility. There she lived a religious life. In the might time her spiritual guide was satisfied with her services.
data.anv: सा च she, तम् that Chuli, प्रणता भूत्वा bowing down, शुश्रूषणपरायणा devoted to his service, धर्मिष्ठा adhering to virtue, उवास lived, काले in a proper time, गुरु: the spiritual guide, तस्या: in her, तुष्ट: अभवत् was gratified.
data.md: And in all humility that virtuous one for a definite period was engaged in ministering to him. And thereat, her spiritual guide was gratified with her.

data.v: स च तां कालयोगेन प्रोवाच रघुनन्दन । परितुष्टोऽस्मि भद्रं ते किं करोमि तव प्रियम् ॥
data.es: When her services came to a fruition with the passage of time, maharshi Chuli, spoke to her: 'I am pleased with you. What favour shall I do for you? May you be prosperous'
data.anv: स: च that maharshi Chuli, कालयोगेन when her services have come to fruition with the passage of time, ताम् addressing her, प्रोवाच said, परितुष्ट: अस्मि I am pleased, ते भद्रम् posperity to you, तव to you, किम् what, प्रियम् favour, करोमि shall I do?
data.md: And, O descendant of Raghu, once he said to her, I am gratified, good betide you! What good shall I render you?

data.v: परितुष्टं मुनिं ज्ञात्वा गन्धर्वी मधुरस्वरम् । उवाच परमप्रीता वाक्यज्ञा वाक्यकोविदम् ॥
data.es: Having perceived that the sage was satisfied, the gandharva who was skilled in speech said exceedingly delighted to the sage in a sweet voice.
data.anv: मुनिम् sage, परितुष्टम् gratified, ज्ञात्वा having known, मधुरस्वरा in sweet tone, वाक्यज्ञा knower of words, गन्धर्वी gandharvi, परमप्रीता who was exceedingly delighted, वाक्यकोविदम् proficient speech, उवाच said.
data.md: Thereupon, concluding that the ascetic was gratified, the Gandharvi, cognizant of words, exceedingly delighted, sweetly addressed that one versed in speech.

data.v: लक्ष्म्या समुदितो ब्राह्म्या ब्रह्मभूतो महातपाः । ब्राह्मेण तपसा युक्तं पुत्रमिच्छामि धार्मिकम् ॥
data.es: Bestowed with the great asceticism and brilliance of a brahmin, you look like Brahma. O righteous one, I desire a son endowed with the ascetic virtues of a brahmin.
data.anv: महातपा: possessing great ascetism, ब्राह्म्या relating to Brahmana, लक्ष्म्या lustre, समुदित: endowed with, ब्रह्मभूत: like Brahma, धार्मिक O Righteous one, ब्राह्मेण relating to Brahma, तपसा युक्तम् endowed with ascestic virtues, पुत्रम् son, इच्छामि I am desiring.
data.md: You are furnished with the Brāhma marks, art sprung from Brahmă, and art of mighty austerities. I desire of you a righteous son endowed with the Brāhma ascetic virtues.

data.v: अपतिश्चास्मि भद्रं ते भार्या चास्मि न कस्यचित् । ब्राह्मेणोपगतायाश्च दातुमर्हसि मे सुतम् ॥
data.es: I am without a husband, my sire. I am not a wife to any one. Since I have taken refuge in you, you are competent to bestow on me a son with the power of your penance".
data.anv: अपति: च अस्मि I am without husband, ते भद्रम् prosperity to you, कस्य चित् to any one,  भार्या wife, नास्मि I am not, उपगताया: having taken refuge in you, मे to me, ब्राह्मेण with the power of penance, सुतम् son, दातुम् अर्हसि it behoves of you to bestow.
data.md: I am without a husband, good betide you, and I am no one's wife. Upon me who is your servant you should confer such a son by help of Brāhma means.

data.v: तस्याः प्रसन्नो ब्रह्मर्षिर्ददौ पुत्रमनुत्तमम् । ब्रह्मदत्त इति ख्यातं मानसं चूलिनः सुतम् ॥
data.es: Pleased with her, brahmarshi Chuli gave her an excellent son to be wellknown as Brahmadatta born through the will of his mind.
data.anv: तस्या: to her, प्रसन्न: pleased, ब्रह्मर्षि: Brahmarshi, चूलिन: of Chuli, मानसम् born through the will of his mind, सुतम् son, ब्रह्मदत्त इति Brahmadatta, ख्यातम् wellknown, अनुत्तमम् excellent, पुत्रम् son, ददौ gave.
data.md: Thereupon, well pleased with her, Cūlina conferred upon her an excellent Brāhma mindbegotten son, named Brahmadatta,

data.v: स राजा ब्रह्मदत्तस्तु पुरीमध्यवसत्तदा । काम्पिल्यां परया लक्ष्म्या देवराजो यथा दिवम् ॥
data.es: Then king Brahmadatta, son of Somada, lived in the city of Kampilya with great prosperity like Indra in heaven.
data.anv: सौमदेय: the son of Somada, स: राजा that king Brahmadatta, तदा then, देवराज: Devendra, दिवं यथा like heaven, कांपिल्याम् Kampilya, पुरीम् city, परया with great, लक्ष्म्या prosperity, अध्यवसत् lived.
data.md: And that king, Brahmadatta, founded the flourishing city of Kampilya, even as the sovereign of the celestials founded the celestial regions.

data.v: स बुद्धिं कृतवान्राजा कुशनाभः सुधार्मिकः । ब्रह्मदत्ताय काकुत्स्थ दातुं कन्याशतं तदा ॥
data.es: O Rama, then the highly righteous king Kusanabha decided to give his hundred daughters to Brahmadatta".
data.anv: काकुत्स्थ O Rama, तदा then, सुधार्मिक: highly righteous, राजा king, स: कुशनाभ: Kusanabha, कन्याशतम् hundred daughters, ब्रह्मदत्ताय to Brahmadatta, दातुम् to give, बुद्धिं thinking, कृतवान् decided.
data.md: And, O Kākutstha, the righteous king Kusanābha finally decided on conferring his hundred daughters upon Brahmadatta.

data.v: तमाहूय महातेजा ब्रह्मदत्तं महीपतिः । ददौ कन्याशतं राजा सुप्रीतेनान्तरात्मना ॥
data.es: The lord of the earth, highly powerful king Kusanabha invited Brahmadatta, and gave his hundred daughters in marriage to him with a heart highly pleased.
data.anv: महातेजा: highly powerful, महीपति: lord of the earth, राजा king, तम् ब्रह्मदत्तम् that Brahmadatta, आहूय having invited, सुप्रीतेन with highly pleased, अन्तरात्मना heart, कन्याशतम् a hundred daughters, ददौ gave.
data.md: And inviting Brahmadatta, that highly energetic lord of earth, with a glad heart conferred his hundred daughters upon him.

data.v: यथाक्रमं ततः पाणिं जग्राह रघुनन्दन । ब्रह्मदत्तो मही पालस्तासां देवपतिर्यथा ॥
data.es: O son of Raghu's dynasty that king Brahmadatta resembling Indra received the hands of those maidens' in due order.
data.anv: रघुनन्दन O Rama, देवपतिर्यथा resembling devendra, ब्रह्मदत्त: महीपाल: king Brahmadatta, तत: then, यथाक्रमम् in due order, तासाम् those maidens', पाणीन् hand, जग्राह received.
data.md: And O descendant of Raghu, king Brahmadatta resembling the lord himself of the celestials, by turns received their hands in marriage.

data.v: स्पृष्टमात्रे ततः पाणौ विकुब्जा विगतज्वराः । युक्ताः परमया लक्ष्म्या बभुः कन्याशतं तदा ॥
data.es: Thereafter, with the mere touch of his hand, the hundred daughters were cured of their hump back and freed from anguish. They assumed great beauty.
data.anv: तत: thereafter, पाणौ hand, स्पृष्टमात्रे with mere touch, तदा then, कन्याशतम् hundred daughters, विकुब्जा: were devoid of hump back, विगतज्वरा: free from anguish, परमया great, लक्ष्म्या splendour, युक्ता: endowed with, बभु: shone.
data.md: And as soon as he touched them, the hundred daughters were cured of their crookedness, and became free from anguish, and were endowed with pre-eminent beauty.

data.v: स दृष्ट्वा वायुना मुक्ताः कुशनाभो महीपतिः । बभूव परमप्रीतो हर्षं लेभे पुनः पुनः ॥
data.es: King Kusanabha, having seen his daughters released from disfigurement caused by the Windgod was immensely pleased. He experienced waves of delight.
data.anv: महीपति: king, स: कुशनाभ: Kusanabha, वायुना by windgod, मुक्ता: released, दृष्ट्वा having seen, परमप्रीत: immensely pleased, बभूव became, पुन: पुन: again and again, हर्षम् delight, लेभे obtained.
data.md: And upon beholding them delivered from (the tyranny of) the Air, the monarch Kušanābha became exceedingly delighted, and rejoiced again and again.

data.v: कृतोद्वाहं तु राजानं ब्रह्मदत्तं महीपतिः । सदारं प्रेषयामास सोपाध्याय गणं तदा ॥
data.es: Then the king along with his queens performed the marriage of his daughters in the assembly of priests and sent them with Brahmadatta (to his kingdom).
data.anv: तदा then, महीपति: king, कृतोद्वाहम् having performed marriage, सदारम् together with his wives, सोपाध्यायगणम् in the assembly of priests, राजानम् king, ब्रह्मदत्तम् Brahmadatta, प्रेषयामास sent him to his kingdom.
data.md: And he dismissed that lord of earth, king Brahmadatta, in company with his consorts and the priests.

data.v: सोमदापि सुसंहृष्टा पुत्रस्य सदृशीं क्रियाम् । यथान्यायं च गन्धर्वी स्नुषास्ताः प्रत्यनन्दत ॥
data.es: Somada the gandharvi was exeedingly delighted with her daughtersinlaw and praised her son for his right action.इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये बालकाण्डेण्डे त्रयस्त्रिंशस्सर्ग:॥Thus ends the thirtythird sarga of Balakanda of the holy Ramayana the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.
data.anv: गन्धर्वी gandharva woman, सोमदापि Somada also,सुसंहृष्टा well pleased, पुत्रस्य son's, सदृशीम् fit and proper, क्रियाम् acts, ता: स्नुषा: those daughtersinlaw, यथान्यायं properly, प्रत्यनन्दत praised.
data.md: And the Gandharvī Somadā rejoiced exceedingly at the completion of the nuptials of her son; and embracing her daughters-in-law again and again, and extolling her son, she expressed the fullness of her joy.

data.v: कृतोद्वाहे गते तस्मिन्ब्रह्मदत्ते च राघव । अपुत्रः पुत्रलाभाय पौत्रीमिष्टिमकल्पयत् ॥
data.es: "O son of Raghu's dynasty (Rama) Brahmadatta got married and left for his kingdom. Now a putreshti was performed by king Kusanabha in order to beget a son.
data.anv: राघव O Rama, तस्मिन् ब्रह्मदत्ते when that Brahmadatta, कृतोद्वाहे got married, गते had gone, अपुत्र: king without sons, पुत्रलाभाय in order to obtain a son, पौत्रीम् इष्टिम् Putreshti, अकल्पयत् performed.
data.md: And, O Raghava, when Brahmadatta was married, that sonless one, (Kušanābha), with the intention of obtaining male offspring, took in hand a son-conferring sacrifice.

data.v: इष्ट्यां तु वर्तमानायां कुशनाभं महीपतिम् । उवाच परमप्रीतः कुशो ब्रह्मसुतस्तदा ॥
data.es: Then, while putreshti was on Kusa the highly generous son of Brahma, said to king Kusanabha :
data.anv: तदा then, इष्ट्याम् when Putreshti, वर्तमानायाम् was being performed, परमोदार: highly generous, ब्रह्मसुत: son of Brahma, कुश: Kusa, कुशनाभमहीपतिम् king Kusanabha, उवाच spoke.
data.md: And when the sacrifice had commenced, that son of Brahmā, the exceedingly noble Kusa, spoke to king Kusanābha, saying,

data.v: पुत्रस्ते सदृशः पुत्र भविष्यति सुधार्मिकः । गाधिं प्राप्स्यसि तेन त्वं कीर्तिं लोके च शाश्वतीम् ॥
data.es: "O son, a highly virtuous son named Gadhi, similar to you will be born. Because of him you will obtain everlasting fame throughtout this world".
data.anv: पुत्र O My son, ते सदृश: similar to yourself, सुधार्मिक: highly virtuous, पुत्र: son, भविष्यति will be born, गाधिम् named Gadhi, प्राप्स्यसि you will obtain, तेन by him, त्वम् you, शाश्वतीम्  everlasting, लोके in this world, कीर्तिं च fame also (will obtain).
data.md: O son, there will be born to you a virtuous son like to thyself: you will obtain even Gādhi, and through him enduring fame in this world.

data.v: एवमुक्त्वा कुशो राम कुशनाभं महीपतिम् । जगामाकाशमाविश्य ब्रह्मलोकं सनातनम् ॥
data.es: "O Rama so saying to king Kusanabha, Kusa left through space for the eternal Brahmaloka".
data.anv: राम O Rama, कुश: Kusa, महीपतिम् king, कुशनाभम् Kusanabha, एवम् in this way, उक्त्वा having spoken, आकाशम् the sky, आविश्य having entered, सनातनम् eternal, ब्रह्मलोकम् Brahmaloka, जगाम had gone.
data.md: Having said this to king Kusanabha, Kusa, O Rāma, entering the welkin, went to the eternal regions of Brahmā.

data.v: कस्यचित्त्वथ कालस्य कुशनाभस्य धीमतः । जज्ञे परमधर्मिष्ठो गाधिरित्येव नामतः ॥
data.es: After some time, a supremely righteous son by name Gadhi was born to the sagacious Kusanabha.
data.anv: अथ thereafter, कस्यचित्कालस्य after sometime, धीमत: of the sagacious, कुशनाभस्य Kusanabha's, परमधर्मिष्ठ: supremely righteous one, नामत: by name, गाधि: इत्येव known as Gadhi, जज्ञे was born.
data.md: Then after sometime, an eminently virtuous son, named Gadhi, was born to the intelligent Kusanabha.

data.v: स पिता मम काकुत्स्थ गाधिः परमधार्मिकः । कुशवंशप्रसूतोऽस्मि कौशिको रघुनन्दन ॥
data.es: O son of Raghu's dynasty the highly virtuous Gadhi is my father. I am known as Kausika being born in the family of Kusa.
data.anv: काकुत्स्थ O Rama, परमधार्मिक: highly virtuous, स: गाधि: Gadhi, मम पिता my father, रघुनन्दन O Rama, कुशवंशप्रसूत: born in the family of Kusa, कौशिक: अस्मि I am known as Kausika.
data.md: O Kākutstha, even that highly pious Gadhi is my sire. And, O descendant of Raghu, I, called Kausika, am sprung from Kusa's line.

data.v: पूर्वजा भगिनी चापि मम राघव सुव्रता । नाम्ना सत्यवती नाम ऋचीके प्रतिपादिता ॥
data.es: O Raghava adherent of best religious practices, is my elder sister well known by name Satyavati. She was bestowed in marriage to Richika.
data.anv: राघव O Rama, सुव्रता adherent of best religious practices, नाम्ना by name, सत्यवती नाम as Satyavati, मम my, पूर्वजा भगिनी elder sister, ऋचीके for Richika, प्रतिपादिता was bestowed.
data.md: O Rāghava, I had a sister of noble vows born before me. And her name was Satyavatī; and she was bestowed upon Rcīkā.

data.v: सशरीरा गता स्वर्गं भर्तारमनुवर्तिनी । कौशिकी परमोदारा सा प्रवृत्ता महानदी ॥
data.es: Following her husband my highly generous sister reached heaven with her human body and down assuming the form of a sacred river, flowed Kausiki.
data.anv: भर्तारम् her husband, अनुवर्तिनी following, सशरीरा with human body, स्वर्गम् heaven, गता had gone, परमोदारा highly generous, कौशिकी named Kausiki, महानदी sacred river, प्रवृत्ता च flowed.
data.md: And following her lord, she ascended heaven in her own proper person. And my highly generous sister, Kausikī, has finally assumed the form of a mighty river.

data.v: दिव्या पुण्योदका रम्या हिमवन्तमुपाश्रिता । लोकस्य हितकामार्थं प्रवृत्ता भगिनी मम ॥
data.es: Conferring the benefit of the other world and worldly pleasures on men my sister Kausiki who is divine and beautiful having sacred waters took resort in Himavat mountain and started flowing from there.
data.anv: लोकस्य for the world, हितकामार्थम् for the welfare and pleasure, प्रवृत्ता flowed, दिव्या divine, पुण्योदका sacred waters, रम्या beautiful, मम my, भगिनी sister, हिमवन्तम् Himavat mountain, उपाश्रिता took asylum.
data.md: And in order to compass the welfare of all creatures, my sister is now a noble and charming river of sacred waters, issuing from the Himavat mountains.

data.v: ततोऽहं हिमवत्पार्श्वे वसामि नियतः सुखम् । भगिन्याः स्नेहसंयुक्तः कौशिक्या रघुनन्दन ॥
data.es: O son of the Raghus', from then onwards with affection towards my sister Kausiki, I am living happily in the vicinity of Himavat mountains.
data.anv: रघुनन्दन O Rama, तत: then onwards, भगिन्याम् in my sister, कौशिक्याम् in Kausiki, स्नेहसंयुक्त: possessed of affection, अहम् I, निरत: enjoying, हिमवत्पार्श्वे on the side of Himavat mountain, सुखम् happily, वसामि I am living.
data.md: And thenceforth, out of affection for my sister, Kausiki, I ever dwell happily in the vicinity of the Himavat, O Raghava.

data.v: सा तु सत्यवती पुण्या सत्ये धर्मे प्रतिष्ठिता । पतिव्रता महाभागा कौशिकी सरितां वरा ॥
data.es: Satyavati is sacred, firmly established in truth and righteousness. She is chaste holy and best among rivers. She is known as river Kausiki.
data.anv: सा सत्यवती that Satyavati, पुण्या sacred, सत्ये in truth, धर्मे in righteousness, प्रतिष्ठिता established, पतिव्रता chaste, महाभागा holy, सरितां वरा best among rivers, कौशिकी Kausiki.
data.md: And that virtuous Kausiki, Satyavati, as well established in religion as truth, and chaste, and eminently pious, is now the foremost of streams.

data.v: अहं हि नियमाद्राम हित्वा तां समुपागतः । सिद्धाश्रममनुप्राप्य सिद्धोऽस्मि तव तेजसा ॥
data.es: Rama, for the sake of observance of austerity I have come to Siddhaashrama leaving her behind. Having reached here, I have fulfilled my desire through your valour.
data.anv: राम Rama, अहम् हि I indeed, नियमात् for religious observance, तां हित्वा leaving her, समुपागत: have come, सिद्धाश्रमम् Siddha ashrama, अनुप्राप्य having reached, तव by your, तेजसा valour, सिद्ध: अस्मि I have fulfilled my desire.
data.md: And, O Rama, it is only for the purpose of completing my sacrifice that leaving her behind, I have come to Siddhāśrama. And now by virtue of your energy, have I attained fruition.

data.v: एषा राम ममोत्पत्तिः स्वस्य वंशस्य कीर्तिता । देशस्य च महाबाहो यन्मां त्वं परिपृच्छसि ॥
data.es: O mightyarmed Rama since you asked me I narrated this, my origin, the history of my family and the history of this place.
data.anv: महाबाहो O Mighty armed one, राम O Rama, एषा मम this is my, स्वस्य वंशस्य my family's,  देशस्य च of the place also, उत्पत्ति: origin, कीर्तिता narrated, यत् which, त्वम् you, माम् me, परिपृच्छसि are asking for.
data.md: Now, O Rāma, I have narrated to you the circumstances connected with the history of my line and myself, as also of this place, O mightyarmed one, which you had asked me to relate.

data.v: गतोऽर्धरात्रः काकुत्स्थ कथाः कथयतो मम । निद्रामभ्येहि भद्रं ते मा भूद्विघ्नोऽध्वनीह नः ॥
data.es: O son of the Kakusthas while telling my stories, midnight has passed by. Go to sleep now. Prosperity to you. Let there be no obstacles on our way.
data.anv: काकुत्स्थ O Rama, मम for me, कथा: stories, कथयत: while narrating, अर्धरात्र: midnight, गत: has passed by, निद्राम् sleep, अभ्येहि acquire, ते भद्रम् prosperity to you, इह here, न: for us, अध्वनि on the way, विघ्न: obstacles, माभूत् let not take place.
data.md: But, O Kākutstha, while I was speaking, half the night has been spent. Do you now sleep, good betide you, so that you may not feel any difficulty while on the journey.

data.v: निष्पन्दास्तरवः सर्वे निलीना मृगपक्षिणः । नैशेन तमसा व्याप्ता दिशश्च रघुनन्दन ॥
data.es: O son of the Raghus' the trees stand motionless, with the beasts and birds calm, all directions are pervaded with darkness.
data.anv: रघुनन्दन O Rama, सर्वे तरव: all trees, निष्पन्दा: are motionless, निलीन मृगपक्षिण: with beasts and birds resting calmed, दिशश्च all directions, नैशेन relating to night, तमसा with the darkness, व्याप्ता: pervaded.
data.md: The trees stand motionless, and the beasts and birds are silent, and, O descendant of Raghu, all sides have become enveloped in nocturnal gloom.

data.v: शनैर्वियुज्यते संध्या नभो नेत्रैरिवावृतम् । नक्षत्रतारागहनं ज्योतिर्भिरवभासते ॥
data.es: Evening has gradually disappeared. The sky is littered with stars and planets gleaming points of light as though they are the eyes of the skies.
data.anv: सन्ध्या evening time, शनै: gradually, वियुज्यते is separated, नक्षत्रतारागहनम् filled with stars and planets, नभ: sky, ज्योतिर्भि: इव as if with shining stars, नेत्रै: eyes, आवृतम् इव like covered, भासते is shining.
data.md: The noon of night is gradually passing away; and the firmament thick-studded with stars resembling eyes, is illumined up with their light.

data.v: उत्तिष्ठति च शीतांशुः शशी लोकतमोनुदः । ह्लादयन्प्राणिनां लोके मनांसि प्रभया विभो ॥
data.es: O Lord the Moon with his cool rays, dispelling the darkness of the earth and delighting the minds of all living beings in this world, is rising higher and higher.
data.anv: विभो O Rama, शीतांशु: having cool rays, शशि moon, लोकतमोनुद: dispelling the darkness of world, प्रभया with moon light, लोके in this world, प्राणिनाम् of the living beings, मनांसि minds, ह्लादयन् delighting, उत्तिष्ठति is rising higher and higher.
data.md: And that dispeller of darkness, the mildbeaming moon is rising, gladdening the hearts of all creatures with his splendour.

data.v: नैशानि सर्वभूतानि प्रचरन्ति ततस्ततः । यक्षराक्षससंघाश्च रौद्राश्च पिशिताशनाः ॥
data.es: All nocturnal creatures groups of yakshas and rakshasas and dreadful eaters of human flesh are moving here and there".
data.anv: नैशानि nocturnal, सर्वभूतानि all living beings, यक्षराक्षससङ्घाश्च groups of yakshas and rakshasas, रौद्रा: dreadful, पिशिताशनाश्च eaters of human flesh, ततस्तत: here and there, प्रचरन्ति are moving.
data.md: And night-ranging being terrible carnivorous Yaksas and Rākşasas—walk here and there,

data.v: एवमुक्त्वा महातेजा विरराम महामुनिः । साधु साध्विति तं सर्वे मुनयो ह्यभ्यपूजयन् ॥
data.es: Having spoken thus the highly lustrous, great ascetic rested. All sages praised him, saying, "wellsaid wellsaid"
data.anv: महातेजा: highly lustrous, महामुनि: great ascetic, एवम् उक्त्वा having spoken in this way, विरराम rested, सर्वे मुनय: all sages, साधु साधु इति well said, well said, thus, तम् him, अभ्यपूजयन् praised.
data.md: Having said this the mighty ascetic of exceeding energy paused. And those ascetics honouring him, said, Excellent! Excellent!

data.v: रामोऽपि सह सौमित्रिः किंचिदागतविस्मयः । प्रशस्य मुनिशार्दूलं निद्रां समुपसेवते ॥
data.es: Rama as well as Lakshmana, with a sense of wonder went to sleep full of admiration for the great ascetic.इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये बालकाण्डेण्डे चतुस्त्रिंशस्सर्ग:॥Thus ends the thirtyfourth sarga of Balakanda of the holy Ramayana the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.
data.anv: सह सौमित्रि: along with Lakshmana, रामोऽपि Rama also, किञ्चित् little, आगतविस्मय: with  surprise, मुनिशार्दूलम् to the best of ascetics, प्रशस्य praising, निद्राम् sleep, समुपसेवते enjoyed.
data.md: Rāma too along with Sumitrā's son having in admiration praised that tiger among ascetics, enjoyed the luxury of slumber.

data.v: उपास्य रात्रिशेषं तु शोणाकूले महर्षिभिः । निशायां सुप्रभातायां विश्वामित्रोऽभ्यभाषत ॥
data.es: Viswamitra lay on the bank of Sona with the ascetics, for the rest of the night. (Getting up) at daybreak he said:
data.anv: विश्वामित्र: Visvamitra, रात्रिशेषम् rest of the night, महर्षिभि: with ascetics, शोणाकूले on the bank of river Sona, उपास्य waiting, निशायाम् in the night, सुप्रभातायाम् at dawn, अभ्यभाषत said.
data.md: HAVING in company with the ascetics passed the remainder of the night on the banks of the Sona, Visvāmitra, when the day broke, spoke,

data.v: सुप्रभाता निशा राम पूर्वा संध्या प्रवर्तते । उत्तिष्ठोत्तिष्ठ भद्रं ते गमनायाभिरोचय ॥
data.es: "O beloved son of Kausalya, O Rama the day dawns. O best among men, awake, oblations to gods and other sacred rites are required to be performed".
data.anv: कैसल्या सुप्रजा: OBeloved son of Kausalya, (a son by whom Kausalya became a blessed mother), राम ORama, पूर्वा सन्ध्या the daybreak, प्रवर्तते is commencing ,नरशार्दूल OBest among men, उत्तिष्ठ awake (fromsleep), दैवम् oblations to gods, आह्निकम् religious rite  to be performed every day at a fixed hour, कर्तव्यम् are required to be done.
data.md: O Rāma, the night has passed away, and the morn has come. The hour for performing the prior devotions has arrived. Arise! arise! good betide you! Do you prepare for going.

data.v: तच्छ्रुत्वा वचनं तस्य कृत्वा पौर्वाह्णिकीं क्रियाम् । गमनं रोचयामास वाक्यं चेदमुवाच ह ॥
data.es: Out of affection towards his son, his (king Dasaratha's) plea to Viswamitra was full of contradiction. And on hearing the king, enraged Viswamitra replied:
data.anv: तस्य his, तद्वचनम् those words, श्रुत्वा having heard, पौर्वाह्णिकीम् relating to forenoon, क्रियाम् oblations, कृत्वा having made, गमनम् to undertake journey, रोचयामास inclined, इदम् this,   वाक्यं च word also, उवाच ह spoke.
data.md: Hearing these words of his, Rāma, having finished his morning devotions and rites, and ready for departure, said,

data.v: अयं शोणः शुभजलो गाधः पुलिनमण्डितः । कतरेण पथा ब्रह्मन्संतरिष्यामहे वयम् ॥
data.es: "O knower of Brahman Clean waters of this river are adorned with sandbanks. This Sona is deep. Which way shall we cross this river?
data.anv: ब्रह्मन् O Knower of god, शुभजल: having auspicious waters, पुलिनमण्डित: adorned with sandbanks, अयम् this, शोण: Sona river, अगाध: is deep, वयम् we, कतरेण by which, पथा way, सन्तरिष्यामहे traverse.
data.md: This is the Sona, of excellent waters, fathomless, and studded with islets. O Brāhmaṇa, by which way shall we repair

data.v: एवमुक्तस्तु रामेण विश्वामित्रोऽब्रवीदिदम् । एष पन्था मयोद्दिष्टो येन यान्ति महर्षयः ॥
data.es: Having been addressed by Rama thus Viswamitra said, "We shall take the way the ascetics have gone before".
data.anv: रामेण By Rama, एवम् thus, उक्त: having been addressed, विश्वामित्र: Visvamitra, इदम् these words, अब्रवीत् spoke, महर्षय: ascetics, येन by which way, यान्ति are going, एष: this, पन्था: way, मया by me, उद्दिष्ट: determined.
data.md: Thus addressed by Rāma, Viśvāmitra replied. Even this path has been fixed upon by men, that, namely, by which the Maharșis go.

data.v: ते गत्वा दूरमध्वानं गतेऽर्धदिवसे तदा । जाह्नवीं सरितां श्रेष्ठां ददृशुर्मुनिसेविताम् ॥
data.es: After travelling a long distance for half a day, they saw Jahnavi, the best among rivers haunted or worshipped by ascetics.
data.anv: ते they, दूरम् distant, अध्वानम् way, गत्वा having gone, तदा then, अर्धदिवसे in a halfday, गते having passed, मुनिसेविताम् worshipped by ascetics, सरिताम् among rivers, श्रेष्ठाम् the best, जाह्नवीम् river Jahnavi, ददृशु: saw.
data.md: Having proceeded far, when the day had been half spent, they beheld that foremost of streams, the Jahnavi, worshipped by ascetics.

data.v: तां दृष्ट्वा पुण्यसलिलां हंससारससेविताम् । बभूवुर्मुदिताः सर्वे मुनयः सहराघवाः । तस्यास्तीरे ततश्चक्रुस्ते आवासपरिग्रहम् ॥
data.es: On seeing the river Ganga with swans and cranes floating on the surface of the sacred waters, all the sages including the sons of the Raghus (Rama and Lakshmana) were delighted.
data.anv: पुण्यसलिलाम् having sacred waters, हंससारससेविताम् attended by swans and cranes, ताम् दृष्ट्वा having seen that (river Ganga), सहराघवा: along with Rama and Lakshmana, सर्वे मुनय: all the sages, मुदिता: बभूवु: were delighted.
data.md: Having beheld that river furnished with sacred waters, and frequented by swans and cranes, the ascetics who accompanied Rāghava were exceedingly delighted.

data.v: ततः स्नात्वा यथान्यायं संतर्प्य पितृदेवताः । हुत्वा चैवाग्निहोत्राणि प्राश्य चामृतवद्धविः ॥
data.es: The birds had made the bank of the river their home. They (Rama and Lakshmana) took a dip and offered traditional oblations to ancestors. Thereafter they lighted the sacrificial fire and made customary offerings to the fire and partook of the nectarlike remains. With cheerful hearts they stood round the illustrious Viswamitra and entered the sacred bank of Jahnavi.
data.anv: तत: then, ते they, तस्या: river's, तीरे on the bank, आवासपरिग्रहम् adopting as habitation, चक्रु: made, तत: then, स्नात्वा having bathed, यथान्यायम् as  per tradition, पितृदेवता: the ancestors, सन्तर्प्य having satisfied by offering waters, अग्निहोत्राणि हुत्वा after lighting their sacrificial fires, अमृतवत् like nectar, हवि: having oblations (offerings), प्राश्य partaking, मुदितमानसा: with joyful hearts, महात्मानम् the illustrious, विश्वामित्रम् Viswamitra, समन्तत: on all sides, परिवार्य surrounding, शुचौ in a sacred, जाह्नवीतीरे bank of river Jahnavi, विविशु: entered.

data.v: विविशुर्जाह्नवीतीरे शुचौ मुदितमानसाः । विश्वामित्रं महात्मानं परिवार्य समन्ततः ॥
data.es: Thereafter, with Brahma in the forefront, the gods spoke to Viswamitra in pleasing words:
data.anv: तत: thereafter, पितामहपुरोगमा: with Brahma in the forefront, सर्वे सुरगणा: hosts of devatas,  महात्मानम् magnanimous, विश्वामित्रम् Visvamitra, मधुरम् sweet, वाक्यम् words, अब्रुवन् spoke.

data.v: संप्रहृष्टमना रामो विश्वामित्रमथाब्रवीत् । भगवञ्श्रोतुमिच्छामि गङ्गां त्रिपथगां नदीम् । त्रैलोक्यं कथमाक्रम्य गता नदनदीपतिम् ॥
data.es: Then Rama said to Viswamitra "O venerable one I wish to know why Ganga flowing in three directions, occupy (purified) the three worlds before entering the sea, the lord of rivers?"
data.anv: अथ then, राम: Rama, तदा then, तत्र there, विश्वामित्रम् addressing Visvamitra, अब्रवीत्  spoke, भगवन् O Venerable one, त्रिपथगाम् flowing in three directions, गङ्गां नदीम् about  river Ganga, श्रोतुम् to listen, इच्छामि I am desirous,त्रैलोक्यम् three worlds, आक्रम्य occupying, नदनदीपतिम् the sea, the lord of all the rivers, कथम् how, गता reached.
data.md: O adorable one, I desire to hear how the Gangă flowing in three directions and embracing the three worlds, falls into the lord of streams and rivers.

data.v: चोदितो राम वाक्येन विश्वामित्रो महामुनिः । वृद्धिं जन्म च गङ्गाया वक्तुमेवोपचक्रमे ॥
data.es: Thereafter, the cheerful Rama, bowed to the mighty ascetic Viswamitra and commenced his journey.इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये बालकाण्डे सप्तविंशस्सर्गः॥Thus ends the twentyseventh sarga of Balakanda of the holy Ramayana the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.
data.anv: ततः thereafter, महातेजाः highly splendorous, रामः Rama, प्रीतमनाः with pleased mind , विश्वामित्रं Visvamitra, महामुनिम् mighty ascetic, अभिवाद्य bowing with respect, गमनाय for  his journey, उपचक्रमे commenced.
data.md: Influenced by Rama's speech, the mighty ascetic Viśvāmitra entered upon the history of the Gangā's origin and progress.

data.v: शैलेन्द्रो हिमवान्नाम धातूनामाकरो महान् । तस्य कन्या द्वयं राम रूपेणाप्रतिमं भुवि ॥
data.es: "O Rama the great mountain named Himavan is a treasuretrove of ores. He is the king of mountains. He had two daughters, unrivalled in beauty in this world.
data.anv: राम Rama, धातूनाम् for ores, महान् great, आकर: treasuretrove, हिमवन्नाम named Himavn, शैलेन्द्र: king of mountains, तस्य for him, रूपेण in loveliness, भुवि in this earth, अप्रतिमम् unrivalled, कन्याद्वयम् two daughters.
data.md: O Rāma, that great mine of ore, Himavat is the foremost of mountains. To him were born two daughters, unparalleled on earth in loveliness.

data.v: या मेरुदुहिता राम तयोर्माता सुमध्यमा । नाम्ना मेना मनोज्ञा वै पत्नी हिमवतः प्रिया ॥
data.es: O Rama Himavan's beloved of beautiful waist, wellknown by the name of Manorama is the daughter of Mount Meru. She is the mother to both the daughters.
data.anv: राम O Rama, नाम्ना by name, मनोरमा नाम well known as Manorama, या सुमध्यमा she of beautiful waist, मेरुदुहिता daughter of mount Meru, हिमवत: Himavat's, प्रिया beloved, पत्नी wife, तयो: for both them, माता mother.
data.md: O Rāma, their mother of dainty waist, the amiable daughter of Meru, named Menā, was the beloved wife of Himavat.

data.v: तस्यां गङ्गेयमभवज्ज्येष्ठा हिमवतः सुता । उमा नाम द्वितीयाभूत्कन्या तस्यैव राघव ॥
data.es: O son of the Raghus this Ganga was born to Manorama as Himavan's eldest daughter. A second one born to him was wellknown by the name of Uma.
data.anv: राघव Rama, इयम् गङ्गा this Ganga, हिमवत: Himavat's, ज्येष्ठा eldest, सुता daughter, तस्याम् अभवत् born to her, तस्यैव for him only, नाम्ना by name, उमा नाम wellknown as Uma, द्वितीया अभूत् a second daughter was born.
data.md: She of whom was born Gangā the elder daughter of Himavat; and , O Raghava, a second daughter was also born to him, named Uma.

data.v: अथ ज्येष्ठां सुराः सर्वे देवतार्थचिकीर्षया । शैलेन्द्रं वरयामासुर्गङ्गां त्रिपथगां नदीम् ॥
data.es: Thereupon all the devatas desirous of deriving some advantage proposed that the eldest daughter of the king of mountains, Ganga, flowing in three directions be given to them.
data.anv: अथ thereafter, सर्वे सुरा: all devatas, देवतार्थचिकीर्षया desirous of fulfilling some purpose of  devatas, त्रिपथगाम् flowing in three directions, नदीम् river, ज्येष्ठाम् eldest daughter, गङ्गां Ganga, शैलेन्द्रम् king of mountains, वरयामासु: proposed.

data.v: ददौ धर्मेण हिमवांस्तनयां लोकपावनीम् । स्वच्छन्दपथगां गङ्गां त्रैलोक्यहितकाम्यया ॥
data.es: In order to do good to the three worlds Himavan, rooted in dharma gifted his eldest daughter Ganga who sanctifies the whole world by flowing at her free will৷৷
data.anv: हिमवान् Himavan, धर्मेण having followed his duty, त्रैलोक्यहितकाम्यया intent on doing welfare  for three worlds, लोकपावनीम् sanctifying whole world, स्वच्छन्दपथगाम् flowing at her free will, तनयाम् daughter, गङ्गाम् Ganga, ददौ gave.

data.v: प्रतिगृह्य त्रिलोकार्थं त्रिलोकहितकारिणः । गङ्गामादाय तेऽगच्छन्कृतार्थेनान्तरात्मना ॥
data.es: The devatas having received Ganga committed to the welfare of the three worlds went back to their abodes with a sense of fulfilment in their mind.
data.anv: तत: then, ते देवा: those devatas, त्रिलोकहितकारिण: doing good for the three worlds, गङ्गाम् Ganga, प्रतिगृह्य having received, आदाय taking her, कृतार्थेन with a sense of fulfillment, अन्तरात्मना with the mind, अगच्छन् had gone.

data.v: या चान्या शैलदुहिता कन्यासीद्रघुनन्दन । उग्रं सा व्रतमास्थाय तपस्तेपे तपोधना ॥
data.es: O Delight of the Raghus The other daughter of the mountain Himavan was a maiden whose wealth was tapas. She pursued a vow and observed severe austerities.
data.anv: रघुनन्दन O Delight of Raghus, Rama,  अन्या the other, शैलदुहिता daughter of the  mountain (Himavan), या कन्या आसीत् that maiden lived,  सा तपोधना that maiden with asceticism as her wealth, उग्रम् severe, व्रतम् vow, आस्थाय adopting, तप: austerities, तेपे observed.
data.md: The other daughter of the mountain, O descendant of Raghu, adopting a stern vow, began to carry on austerities, having asceticism for her wealth.

data.v: उग्रेण तपसा युक्तां ददौ शैलवरः सुताम् । रुद्रायाप्रतिरूपाय उमां लोकनमस्कृताम् ॥
data.es: Himavan the best of mountains gave his daughter Uma associated with severe austerities and venerated by the whole world in marriage to the unrivalled Rudra.
data.anv: शैलवर: the best of Mountains, (Himavan), उग्रेण with severe, तपसा austerities, युक्ताम्  endowed with, लोकनमस्कृताम् venerated by the whole world, सुताम् daughter, उमाम् Uma, अप्रतिरूपाय unrivalled, रुद्राय for Rudra, ददौ gave.
data.md: And that best of mountains bestowed upon Rudra of unequalled form his daughter Uma, furnished with fiery asceticism and worshipped of the worlds.

data.v: एते ते शैल राजस्य सुते लोकनमस्कृते । गङ्गा च सरितां श्रेष्ठा उमा देवी च राघव ॥
data.es: O son of the Raghus Ganga, the holiest of rivers and Uma devi are two daughters of the king of the mountains, (Himavan). They are worshipped by the entire world.
data.anv: राघव O Rama, सरिताम् among rivers, श्रेष्ठा excellent, गङ्गा Ganga, उमादेवी च Uma devi, एते both of them, शैलराजस्य king of Mountains, Himavan's, लोकनमस्कृते worshipped by the world, ते both, सुते daughters.
data.md: And these, O Rāghava, are the daughters of that king of mountains, worshipped of all, viz, Gangā, the foremost of streams, and the divine Uma.

data.v: एतत्ते धर्ममाख्यातं यथा त्रिपथगा नदी । खं गता प्रथमं तात गतिं गतिमतां वर ॥
data.es: O child with a marvellous gait I have related to you about Ganga flowing across the three worlds, Ganga who reached the heaven first and all that.
data.anv: गतिमताम् among those having marvellous gait, वर best, तात O Child, त्रिपथगा नदी  threeway flowing river, प्रथमम् firstly, यथा as, खम् गता reached the sky, एतत् सर्वम् all this, आख्यातम् is communicated to you.
data.md: Now, O best of those endowed with motion, have I related to you how that sin-destroying one flowing with her waters in three diverse directions, first, O child, went to the firmament and then ascended the celestial regions.

data.v: उक्त वाक्ये मुनौ तस्मिन्नुभौ राघवलक्ष्मणौ । प्रतिनन्द्य कथां वीरावूचतुर्मुनिपुंगवम् ॥
data.es: While Viswamitra preeminent ascetic among the sages was telling the story (of Ganga) to the heroic Rama and Lakshmana, they extolled it and enquired:
data.anv: तस्मिन् मुनौ when that ascetic, उक्तवाक्ये had spoken the words, वीरौ two heroes, राघवलक्ष्मणौ Rama and Lakshmana, उभौ both, कथाम् story, प्रतिनन्द्य enjoying, मुनिपुङ्गवम् preeminent ascetic, ऊचतु: uttered.
data.md: When the ascetic had spoken thus, both the heroes, Rāma and Lakşmaņa, saluting that first of anchorites, said,

data.v: धर्मयुक्तमिदं ब्रह्मन्कथितं परमं त्वया । दुहितुः शैलराजस्य ज्येष्ठाय वक्तुमर्हसि ॥
data.es: "O Brahman sage, this excellent story set in righteousness has been narrated by you. Since you are conversant with the details, you can befittingly tell the story in detail, pertaining to the eldest daughter of king of the mountains and the events that happened in the celestial and mortal worlds
data.anv: ब्रह्मन् O Divine sage, धर्मयुक्तम् endowed with righteousness, परमम् supreme, इदम् this story, त्वया by you, कथितम् has been narrated, शैलराजस्य king of mountains Himavan's, ज्येष्ठाया: of the eldest, दुहितु: daughter's, दिव्यमानुषसम्भवम् happened in the celestial and  mortal world, विस्तरम् detailed story, वक्तुम् to tell, अर्हसि it is worthy of you, विस्तरज्ञ: असि  you are conversant with the details.
data.md: O Brāhmaṇa, you have delivered this noble narration fraught with morality. Now it behoves you to speak about the elder daughter of the mountain-king. You are extensively conversant with everything relative to men or gods.

data.v: विस्तरं विस्तरज्ञोऽसि दिव्यमानुषसंभवम् । त्रीन्पथो हेतुना केन पावयेल्लोकपावनी ॥
कथं गङ्गां त्रिपथगा विश्रुता सरिदुत्तमा । त्रिषु लोकेषु धर्मज्ञ कर्मभिः कैः समन्विता ॥
data.es: Why does Ganga, the purifier of the worlds overflow the three paths (worlds)? O knower of dharma what deed made, Tripathaga (flowing in three directions) Ganga wellknown in the three worlds as the best (holiest) of all rivers"?
data.anv: लोकपावनी purifying the worlds, केन हेतुना for what reason, त्रीन् three, पथ: paths, प्लावयेत् should be overflowing with waters? धर्मज्ञ O Knower of righteousness, त्रिपथगा Tripathaga (threeway flowing), गङ्गा Ganga, कै: by which,  कर्मभि: actions, अन्विता endowed with, त्रिषु लोकेषु in three worlds, सरिदुत्तमा excellent among rivers, विश्रुता well known.

data.v: तथा ब्रुवति काकुत्स्थे विश्वामित्रस्तपोधनः । निखिलेन कथां सर्वामृषिमध्ये न्यवेदयत् ॥
data.es: To these words spoken by Rama, maharshi Viswamitra who was patient practitioner of vows and pure taught the withdrawl mantra.
data.anv: काकुत्स्थे when Rama, एवम् in this manner, ब्रुवति had spoken, अथ thereafter, धृतिमान् one possessed of fortitude, सुव्रत: a man of excellent vows, शुचि: pure, विश्वामित्र: महामुनि: Viswamitra maharshi, संहारम् withdrawl, व्याजहार told.

data.v: पुरा राम कृतोद्वाहः शितिकण्ठो महातपाः । दृष्ट्वा च स्पृहया देवीं मैथुनायोपचक्रमे ॥
data.es: "O Rama, in ancient times, great ascetic the blueneck Lord Siva got married to goddess Uma charmed with her beauty he indulged in sexual enjoyment with intense passion.
data.anv: राम O Rama, पुरा in ancient times, कृतोद्वाह: got married, महातपा: mighty ascetic, नीलकण्ठ: lord Siva, देवीम् goddess, Uma, दृष्ट्वा having seen, स्पृहया with intense desire, मैथुनाय for enjoying marital bliss, उपचक्रमे commenced.

data.v: शितिकण्ठस्य देवस्य दिव्यं वर्षशतं गतम् । न चापि तनयो राम तस्यामासीत्परंतप ॥
data.es: O Rama, tormentor of enemies, while Lord Siva was thus absorbed in sexual enjoyment, a hundred (celestial) years passed but no son was born to them.
data.anv: परन्तप O Tormentor of enemies, राम O Rama, देवस्य of the lord, शितिकण्ठस्य Siva's, दिव्यम् celestial, वर्षशतम् hundred years, गतम् was over, अपि च even then, तस्याम् in her  (the womb of goddess Parvati), तनय: son, न आसीत् was not born.

data.v: ततो देवाः समुद्विग्नाः पितामहपुरोगमाः । यदिहोत्पद्यते भूतं कस्तत्प्रतिसहिष्यते ॥
data.es: "Then the devatas led by Brahma were exceedingly alarmed. 'Who will be able to bear the power of the offspring if it is born here and now', they reflected.
data.anv: तत: then, पितामहपुरोगमा: with Brahma in the forefront, देवा: devatas, इह here, now in this goddess, यत् which, भूतम् offspring, उत्पद्यते will be born, तत् that, क: who, प्रतिसहिष्यते will be able to bear, समुद्विग्ना: were exceedingly alarmed.

data.v: अभिगम्य सुराः सर्वे प्रणिपत्येदमब्रुवन् । देवदेव महादेव लोकस्यास्य हिते रत । सुराणां प्रणिपातेन प्रसादं कर्तुमर्हसि ॥
data.es: All devatas approached Siva and paying their obeisance said, "O God of the gods engaged in the welfare of all O Mahadeva accept our salutations Be king which you can be (if you will)".
data.anv: सुरा: devatas, सर्वे all, अभिगम्य approaching Siva, प्रणिपत्य paying obeisance, इदम् these words, अब्रुवन् spoke, देवदेव O God of devatas, अस्य लोकस्य for this world, हिते रत engaged in doing welfare of all, महादेव O Mahadeva, सुराणाम् for celestials, प्रणिपातेन with salutations, प्रसादम् mercy, कर्तुम् अर्हसि capable of doing it.
data.md: O god of gods! O mighty deity! ever engaged in the welfare of all, it behove you to be propitious at the humble salutations of the celestials.

data.v: न लोका धारयिष्यन्ति तव तेजः सुरोत्तम । ब्राह्मेण तपसा युक्तो देव्या सह तपश्चर ॥
data.es: "O best among the gods, the worlds cannot contain your energy (the son born of your energy) You may engage yourself in penance in the company of Uma in conformity with the Vedas. Retain your energy in your body for the welfare of the three worlds."
data.anv: सुरोत्तम O Best among gods, तव your, तेज: energy, लोका: worlds, न धारयिष्यन्ति cannot contain, ब्राह्मेण in conformity vedas, तपसा by yogic penance, युक्त: endowed with, देव्या सह in the company with Parvati, तप: austerities, चर engage yourself,  त्रैलोक्यहितकामार्थम् with the intention of doing welfare for three worlds, तेज: energy, तेजसि in your energy, धारय retain.
data.md: The worlds, O foremost of celestials, are incapable of bearing your energy. Therefore, for the welfare of the three worlds, do you, being furnished with Brahmā asceticism, in company with the goddess practise austerities, and rein in your energy by your native indomitableness.

data.v: त्रैलोक्यहितकामार्थं तेजस्तेजसि धारय । रक्ष सर्वानिमाँल्लोकान्नालोकं कर्तुमर्हसि ॥
data.md: Do you preserve these worlds; for it become you not to destroy all.'

data.v: देवतानां वचः श्रुत्वा सर्वलोकमहेश्वरः । बाढमित्यब्रवीत्सर्वान्पुनश्चेदमुवाच ह ॥
data.es: Mahadeva, ruler of the all the worlds, having heard the words of devatas, said "Be it so" Further:
data.anv: सर्वलोकमहेश्वर: ruler of all the worlds, देवतानाम् devata's, वच: words, श्रुत्वा having heard, बाढम् "Be it so", इति thus, अब्रवीत् said, पुनश्च again, एवम् these words, उवाच ह spoke.
data.md: Hearing the words of the deities, the great god of the worlds said to them, 'So be it!' And addressing them again he said,

data.v: धारयिष्याम्यहं तेजस्तेजस्येव सहोमया । त्रिदशाः पृथिवी चैव निर्वाणमधिगच्छतु ॥
data.es: ""Together with Uma I will preserve the semen in my body thereby the devatas and also the earth will have peace.
data.anv: उमया सह together with Uma, अहम् I, तेज: vital fluid, तेजस्येव in my energy (body), धारयिष्यामि I shall preserve, त्रिदशा: devatas, पृथिवी चैव earth also, निर्वाणम् peace, अधिगच्छतु obtain.
data.md: You gods, by my own energy I will assisted by Uma bear my virile vigour, therefore let the creation find rest!

data.v: यदिदं क्षुभितं स्थानान्मम तेजो ह्यनुत्तमम् । धारयिष्यति कस्तन्मे ब्रुवन्तु सुरसत्तमाः ॥
data.es: "Who will contain this exceptional vital fluid of mine if shaken from its own place? O best of devatas tell me".
data.anv: मम my , अनुत्तमम् excellent, यत् इदम् तेज: if this vital fluid, स्थानात् from its own place, क्षुभितम् is shaken, तत् then, क: who, धारयिष्यति will contain? सुरसत्तमा: best of devatas, मे to me, ब्रुवन्तु tell.
data.md: But tell me, you foremost of celestials, who will sustain my potent virility rushing out from its receptacle?'

data.v: एवमुक्तास्ततो देवाः प्रत्यूचुर्वृषभध्वजम् । यत्तेजः क्षुभितं ह्येतत्तद्धरा धारयिष्यति ॥
data.es: Thus questioned, all the devatas replied to the bearer of the flag with bull as its symbol (Siva), saying, "The earth will contain the disturbed vital fluid".
data.anv: एवम् उक्ता: having been addressed in this way by Iswara, सुरा: सर्वे all devatas, वृषभध्वजम् having flagstaff with bull as his symbol (Iswara), प्रत्यूचु: replied, यत् तेज: that vital fluid, क्षुभितम् disturbed, एतत् thist one, धरा earth, धारयिष्यति will contain.
data.md: Being thus addressed, the gods answered him having the bull for his mark, ‘The earth will today bear your vital flow.'

data.v: एवमुक्तः सुरपतिः प्रमुमोच महीतले । तेजसा पृथिवी येन व्याप्ता सगिरिकानना ॥
data.es: Thus replied by the devatas, the god of the gods released his vital fluid on earth. It pervaded the entire earth including mountains and forests.
data.anv: एवम् उक्त: having been spoken in this way by devatas, सुरपति: lord of devatas, येन तेजसा by which vital fluid, सगिरिकानना including mountains, forests, पृथिवी earth, व्याप्ता was pervaded, महीतले on the earth, प्रमुमोच released.
data.md: Thus assured, the mighty lord of the celestials let go his vital fluid; and thereat the earth containing mountains and forests was overspread with the energy.

data.v: ततो देवाः पुनरिदमूचुश्चाथ हुताशनम् । प्रविश त्वं महातेजो रौद्रं वायुसमन्वितः ॥
data.es: Then, the devatas said to the firegod, "Enter this energy (creative power) related to Rudra followed by the windgod".
data.anv: तत: then, अथ thereafter, देवा: devatas, पुन: again, हुताशनम् fire deity, इदम् these words, ऊचु: spoke, त्वम् you, वायुसमन्वित: followed by wind god, रौद्रम् relating to Rudra, महातेज: mighty energy (creative power), प्रविश enter.
data.md: Then the gods spoke to the Fire, saying, 'Do you in company with the Wind entrain to this fierce an mighty energy!'

data.v: तदग्निना पुनर्व्याप्तं संजातः श्वेतपर्वतः । दिव्यं शरवणं चैव पावकादित्यसंनिभम् । यत्र जातो महातेजाः कार्तिकेयोऽग्निसंभवः ॥
data.es: That energy pervaded by fire was transformed into the White Mountain. It turned the forest of reeds (Saravana) (blazing) like the fire or the Sun. From that fire was born the glorious Kartikeya.
data.anv: अग्निना by fire, व्याप्तम् pervaded, तत् that energy, पुन: again, श्वेतपर्वत: celestial white mountain, सञ्जात: became, पावकादित्यसन्निभम् resplendent as fire or Sun, दिव्यम् celestial, शरवणं चैव became forest of reeds, यत्र in which, महातेजा: glorious, अग्निसम्भव: born from fire, कार्तिकेय: son of Krittika, Kartikeya, जात: was born.
data.md: When the Wind had entered into it, it was developed into a white hill, and a forest of glossy reeds, resembling fire or the Sun.

data.v: अथोमां च शिवं चैव देवाः सर्षि गणास्तदा । पूजयामासुरत्यर्थं सुप्रीतमनसस्ततः ॥
data.es: Thereafter highly pleased with the event the devatas along with the saints worshipped Siva and goddess Uma with deep devotion.
data.anv: अथ thereafter, सर्षिगणा: with multitude of saints, देवा: devatas, तत: for that event, सुप्रीतमनस: with highly pleased minds, तदा then, उमां च goddess Uma, शिवं चैव Shiva, अत्यर्थम् with great desire, पूजयामासु: worshipped.
data.md: Here sprang from Fire Kārtikeya of mighty energy. And thereupon the celestials and the saints, with gratified hearts, began to pay enthusiastic adorations to Uma and Siva.

data.v: अथ शैल सुता राम त्रिदशानिदमब्रवीत् । समन्युरशपत्सर्वान्क्रोधसंरक्तलोचना ॥
data.es: "Rama thereafter Uma, daughter of the mountain (Himavan) with her eyes red with anger cursed all of them:
data.anv: राम Rama, अथ thereafter, शैलसुता daughter of mountain Himavan, समन्यु: with anger, त्रिदशान् addressing devatas, इदम् these words, अब्रवीत् spoke, क्रोधसंरक्तलोचना with reddened eyes because of anger, सर्वान् all of them, अशपत् cursed.
data.md: Then the Mountain's daughter, O Rama, addressed the celestials, cursing them with eyes reddened in wrath.

data.v: यस्मान्निवारिता चैव संगता पुत्रकाम्यया । अपत्यं स्वेषु दारेषु नोत्पादयितुमर्हथ । अद्य प्रभृति युष्माकमप्रजाः सन्तु पत्नयः ॥
data.anv: यस्मात् for the reason, पुत्रकाम्यया with a desire to bear son, सङ्गति: union with Mahadeva, निवारिता is prevented, तस्मात् for that reason, स्वेषु in your, दारेषु wives, अपत्यम् progeny, नोत्पादयिष्यथ you will not produce.
data.md: While in association with Mahadeva for obtaining sons, I was broken in upon by you, for this, you shall not be able yourselves to beget offspring on your wives. And from this day forth, your wives shall remain without issue.'

data.v: एवमुक्त्वा सुरान्सर्वाञ्शशाप पृथिवीमपि । अवने नैकरूपा त्वं बहुभार्या भविष्यसि ॥
data.md: Having thus spoke to the celestials, she cursed the Earth also, saying, 'O Earth, you will have multiform surface and many husbands.'

data.v: न च पुत्रकृतां प्रीतिं मत्क्रोधकलुषी कृता । प्राप्स्यसि त्वं सुदुर्मेधे मम पुत्रमनिच्छती ॥
data.es: "O Earth you will assume many forms and become wife of many masters. O evilminded one, you did not want me to bear a son. Having been fouled as a result of my anger, you will not have the pleasure of having a son, cursed Uma.
data.anv: अवने O Earth, त्वम् you, नैकरूपा do not assume one single form, बहुभार्या as wife of many masters, भविष्यसि you will become, सुदुर्मेधे O evil minded one, मम for me, पुत्रम् son, अनिच्छती is not to your liking, त्वम् you, मत्क्रोधकलुषीकृता fouled as as result of my anger,  पुत्रकृताम् on account of a son, प्रीतिं च pleasure also, न प्राप्स्यसि you will not obtain.
data.md: Nor, stained because of my ire, shall you experience the pleasure that is felt on obtaining a son, O you of wicked understanding, O you that do not wish me a son!

data.v: तान्सर्वान्व्रीडितान्दृष्ट्वा सुरान्सुरपतिस्तदा । गमनायोपचक्राम दिशं वरुणपालिताम् ॥
data.es: "The god of the gods (Mahesvara), seeing all the devatas humiliated began to depart in the westerly direction presided over by Varuna.
data.anv: सुरपति: Mahesvara, तदा then, व्रीडितान् filled with humility, तान् सर्वान् all those, सुरान् devatas, दृष्ट्वा having seen, वरुणपालिताम् presided over by Varuna (Western direction), दिशम् direction, गमनाय to depart, उपचक्राम commenced.
data.md: Witnessing the gods, thus distressed, the lord of the celestials set out in the direction presided over by Varuna (The West).

data.v: स गत्वा तप आतिष्ठत्पार्श्वे तस्योत्तरे गिरेः । हिमवत्प्रभवे शृङ्गे सह देव्या महेश्वरः ॥
data.es: "Mahesvara along with goddess Uma, went north of the Himavat mountain and performed penance on a peak.
data.anv: महेश्वर: Mahesvara, गिरौ गत्वा having gone to the (himavat) mountain, तस्य (गिरेः) of that Himavat mountain's, उत्तरे in the  northern, पार्श्वे side, हिमवत्प्रभवे born in the Himavat mountain, शृङ्गे on a peak, देव्या सह along with goddess Uma, तप: yogic practices, अतिष्ठत् performed.
data.md: And having repaired to the north side of that mountain, Mahesvara along with the goddess became engaged in austerities on the peak Himavatprabhava.

data.v: एष ते विस्तरो राम शैलपुत्र्या निवेदितः । गङ्गायाः प्रभवं चैव शृणु मे सहलक्ष्मणः ॥
data.es: "O Rama this story of the daughter of the mountain has been narrated to you. Now listen with Lakshmana the tale of the birth of Ganga":इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये बालकाण्डे षट्त्रिंशस्सर्ग:॥Thus ends the thirtysixth sarga of Balakanda of the holy Ramayana the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.
data.anv: राम O Rama, शैलपुत्र्या: relating to the daughter of Himavat mountain, Uma, एष: विस्तर: this extensive story, ते to you, (कथित: has been narrated), गङ्गाया: च relating to Ganga,  प्रभवम् her birth, निवेदित: described, सह लक्ष्मण: together with Lakshmana, श्रुणु listen.
data.md: I have now related to you, O Rāma, the spread of the Mountain's daughter, (Gangā). Do you now together with Lakşmaņa listen to the narration of Bhāgīrathi's potency.

data.v: तप्यमाने तपो देवे देवाः सर्षिगणाः पुरा । सेनापतिमभीप्सन्तः पितामहमुपागमन् ॥
data.es: In olden days when Iswara was engaged in austerities, the devatas together with the ascetics, approached Lord Brahma for an army general.
data.anv: पुरा in the olden days, देवे when Iswara, तप: तप्यमाने engaged in austerities, सर्षिगणा: together with ascetics, देवा: devatas, सेनापतिम् army general, अभीप्सन्त: desirous of obtaining, पितामहम् lord Brahma, उपागमन् approached.
data.md: On that celestial being engaged in austerities, the deities with Indra and Agni at their head, desirous of gaining over the generalissimo, Appeared before the Grand-sire.

data.v: ततोऽब्रुवन्सुराः सर्वे भगवन्तं पितामहम् । प्रणिपत्य शुभं वाक्यं सेन्द्राः साग्निपुरोगमाः ॥
data.es: Then led by Indra and the Firegod all devatas approached Lord Brahma, the grandsire saluted him (with folded hands) and spoke.
data.anv: तत: then, सेन्द्रा: along with Indra, अग्निपुरोगमा: fire god in their forefront, सुरा: devatas, सर्वे all, भगवन्तम् revered, पितामहम् lord Brahma, प्रणिपत्य saluting with folded hands, अब्रुवन् spoke.
data.md: And, O Rāma, the gods with Agni at their head, bowing to him, addressed that possessor of the six attributes, the Grand-sir, saying,

data.v: यो नः सेनापतिर्देव दत्तो भगवता पुरा । स तपः परमास्थाय तप्यते स्म सहोमया ॥
data.es: "O Lord in ancient times your lordship gave us an army general (at the time of creation). He is engrossed in great penance along with Uma .
