data.anv: देव O lord, भगवता by the venerable one (you), पुरा formerly (at the time of creation), न: for us, य: सेनापति: that army general, दत्त: was given, उमया सह with Uma, परमम् great, तप: religious observance, आस्थाय having adopted, तप्यते is practising austerities.
data.md: 'O God, that adorable one who had formerly consigned to us the generalissimo, resorting to high asceticism, is practising austerities with Uma.

data.v: यदत्रानन्तरं कार्यं लोकानां हितकाम्यया । संविधत्स्व विधानज्ञ त्वं हि नः परमा गतिः ॥
data.es: "O Knower of law and order O Grandsire verily you are our supreme refuge committed to the welfare of the worlds. Tell us what we should do in this matter (now that we cannot procreate a general on account of Uma's curse)".
data.anv: विधानज्ञ knower of the law and order, O Grandsire, लोकानाम् for the worlds, हितकाम्यया desiring welfare, अत्र in this matter, अनन्तरम् after this, यत् कार्यम् whichever act, संविधत्स्व you prescribe, त्वम् you, न: for us, परमा supreme, गति: हि verily our refuge.
data.md: Do you now, O you conversant with resources, so order as is advisable in the interests of the worlds! Verily you are our prime way.'

data.v: देवतानां वचः श्रुत्वा सर्वलोकपितामहः । सान्त्वयन्मधुरैर्वाक्यैस्त्रिदशानिदमब्रवीत् ॥
data.es: Hearing the words of the devatas, Brahma, the Grandsire of all the worlds consoled the devatas with sweet words, saying:
data.anv: सर्वलोकपितामह: grandsire of all the worlds, देवतानाम् devatas, वच: words, श्रुत्वा having heard, मधुरै: with sweet, वाक्यै: words, त्रिदशान् devatas, सान्त्वयन् consoling, इदम् these words, अब्रवीत् spoke.
data.md: Hearing the words of the deities, the Grandsire of all creatures, 'consoling them with soft words, spoke to them saying

data.v: शैलपुत्र्या यदुक्तं तन्न प्रजास्यथ पत्निषु । तस्या वचनमक्लिष्टं सत्यमेव न संशयः ॥
data.anv: यत् whatever, शैलपुत्र्या by Uma devi, उक्तम् has been said, तत् that, पत्निषु among your  wives, प्रजास्यथ you will not bear progeny, तस्या: her, वचनम् words, अक्लिष्टम् infalliable, एतत् this one, सत्यम् certain,संशय: न no doubt.
data.md: 'Even as the Mountain's daughter has said, sons will not be born to you of your own wives. Her words is infallible of a certainty: there is no doubt about it.

data.v: इयमाकाशगा गङ्गा यस्यां पुत्रं हुताशनः । जनयिष्यति देवानां सेनापतिमरिंदमम् ॥
data.es: "Ganga keeps flowing in the celestial regions. Through Ganga the Firegod will beget a son who will be capable of destroying enemies. He will become the army general of the gods".
data.anv: यस्याम् in this, हुताशन: fire god, अरिन्दमम् destroyer of enemies,, देवानाम् for devatas, सेनापतिम् army general, पुत्रम् son, जनयिष्यति will beget, इयम् such, आकाशगा flowing in the celestial regions, गङ्गा Ganga (exists).
data.md: This is the celestial Gangă she on whom Hutaśana will beget a son-the foe-subduing generalissimo of the celestials.

data.v: ज्येष्ठा शैलेन्द्रदुहिता मानयिष्यति तं सुतम् । उमायास्तद्बहुमतं भविष्यति न संशयः ॥
data.es: "Ganga, the eldest daughter of the king of the mountains, will tend that son of Agni. This will be totally acceptable to Uma. No doubt".
data.anv: ज्येष्ठा eldest, शैलेन्द्रदुहिता daughter of king of mountains, तत्सुतम् that son of Agni, मानयिष्यति will accept, तत् that one, उमाया: for Uma devi, बहुमतं भविष्यति will be acceptable, संशय: न no doubt.
data.md: And the elder daughter of the Mountain will consider that son as brought forth by Uma; and Uma also will, without doubt, look upon him with regard.'

data.v: तच्छ्रुत्वा वचनं तस्य कृतार्था रघुनन्दन । प्रणिपत्य सुराः सर्वे पितामहमपूजयन् ॥
data.es: "O son of the Raghus having heard Brahma's words all the devatas considered themselves successful in their mission. They saluted him with folded hands and offered their worship.
data.anv: रघुनन्दन O Rama, सुरा: सर्वे all devatas, तस्य Brahma's, तत् that, वचनम् words, श्रुत्वा having heard, कृतार्था: successful in their mission, पितामहम् grandsire, प्रणिपत्य saluting with folded hands, अपूजयन् worshipped.
data.md: Hearing these words of him o descendant of Raghu, the gods bowing to the Grand-sire, paid him homage.

data.v: ते गत्वा पर्वतं राम कैलासं धातुमण्डितम् । अग्निं नियोजयामासुः पुत्रार्थं सर्वदेवताः ॥
data.es: All the devatas, went to mount Kailasa, adorned with minerals, and urged the Firegod for a son.
data.anv: ते सर्वदेवता: all those devatas, धातुमण्डितम् adorned with minerals, कैलासं पर्वतम् mount Kailasa, गत्वा having gone, पुत्रार्थम् for begetting a son, अग्निम् firegod, नियोजयामासु: appointed.
data.md: Then, O Rama, repairing to the Kailasa mountain teeming with metals, the deities commissioned Agni with the view of having a son (born to him.)10

data.v: देवकार्यमिदं देव समाधत्स्व हुताशन । शैलपुत्र्यां महातेजो गङ्गायां तेज उत्सृज ॥
data.es: 'O lustrous Firegod, accomplish this divine work. O god, possessed of mighty energy, release the vital fluid of Iswara in Ganga, daughter of the king of mountains.
data.anv: देव O Lustrous, हुतशन O fire deity, इदम् this, देवकार्यम् divine wish, संविधत्स्व accomplish, महातेज: O god of mighty energy, तेज: vital fluid of Ishwara, शैलपुत्र्याम् in that mountain king's daughter, गङ्गायाम् Ganga, उत्सृज release.
data.md: ‘Do you, O god, accomplish this work of the oddities! O you of mighty energy, do you discharge your energy into that daughter of the Mountain, Ganga.

data.v: देवतानां प्रतिज्ञाय गङ्गामभ्येत्य पावकः । गर्भं धारय वै देवि देवतानामिदं प्रियम् ॥
data.es: "The Firegod gave his consent. The devatas approached Ganga and said, 'O goddess bear the energy of Siva (inyour world) since this cause is dear to the gods'.
data.anv: पावक: fire deity, देवतानाम् for devatas, प्रतिज्ञाय promised, गङ्गाम् Ganga, अभ्येत्य having approached, देवि O devi, गर्भम् pregnancy, धारय वै bear, इदम् this, देवतानाम् devatas', प्रियम् desire.
data.md: Thereupon giving his promise to the gods, Pavaka* (Fire) approached Ganga, saying, Do you, O Goddess, bear an embryo; for even this is the desire of the deities.

data.v: इत्येतद्वचनं श्रुत्वा दिव्यं रूपमधारयत् । स तस्या महिमां दृष्ट्वा समन्तादवकीर्यत ॥
data.es: "Hearing the words of the Firegod, Ganga assumed a divine form. Beholding her glory, the god of fire pervaded her from all sides.
data.anv: तस्य that firegod's, तद्वचनम् those words, श्रुत्वा having heard, दिव्यम् divine, रूपम् form, अधारयत् assumed, स: that firedeity, तन्महिमानम् her greatness, दृष्ट्वा beholding, समन्तात् on all sides, अवकीर्यत split over.
data.md: Hearing this speech, she assumed a divine appearance. And beholding her mightiness, Agni was shrunk up on all sides.

data.v: समन्ततस्तदा देवीमभ्यषिञ्चत पावकः । सर्वस्रोतांसि पूर्णानि गङ्गाया रघुनन्दन ॥
data.es: O Rama then, the Firegod discharged the vital fluid of Iswara, preserved in his body, which pervaded all sides of Ganga and all her streams were filled with (the fluid).
data.anv: रघुनन्दन O Rama, तदा then, पावक: firegod, देवीम् Ganga devi, समन्तत: on all sides, अभ्यषिञ्चत discharged (sprinkled) the vital fluid of Ishwara preserved in his body, गङ्गाया: Ganga's, सर्वस्रोतांसि all her streams, पूर्णानि were filled.
data.md: And then Pavaka from all sides discharged his energy into her, and thereat all her streams became surcharged with it,

data.v: तमुवाच ततो गङ्गा सर्वदेवपुरोहितम् । अशक्ता धारणे देव तव तेजः समुद्धतम् । दह्यमानाग्निना तेन संप्रव्यथितचेतना ॥
data.es: Ganga addressing the Firegod standing ahead of all the devatas said 'O god of fire, I am incapable of holding your everincreasing splendour. The fiery fluid is burning me. My consciousness is overwhelmed'.
data.anv: तत: then, गङ्गा Ganga, सर्वदेवपुरोहितम् (Fire) who was standing ahead of all devatas, तम् addressing the firedeity, उवाच spoke, देव O God of fire, समुद्धतम् everincreasing, तव your, तेज: splendour, धारणे to hold, अशक्ता incapable, तेन अग्निना by firedeity (by that vital fluid), दह्यमाना being burnt, सम्प्रव्यथितचेतना I have greatly distressed consciousness.
data.md: O descendant of Raghu. And to him staying at the head of all the deities, Gangā spoke, saying, "O god, I am incapable of sustaining this new sprung energy of yours: I am burning with that fire, and my consciousness fails me.

data.v: अथाब्रवीदिदं गङ्गां सर्वदेवहुताशनः । इह हैमवते पादे गर्भोऽयं संनिवेश्यताम् ॥
data.es: Thereafter the Firegod who is the partaker of oblations offered to all deities said to Ganga 'Place this embryo on this slope of Mountain Himavan'.
data.anv: अथ thereafter, सर्वदेवहुताशन: partaker of oblations offered to all gods, गङ्गाम् Ganga, इदम् these words, अब्रवीत् spoke, अयम् this, गर्भ: embryo, इह here, हैमवती mountain Himavat, पादे slopes, सन्निवेश्यताम् may be placed.
data.md: Thereupon that partaker of the oblations offered to the gods, said to Ganga, 'Do you bring forth your embryo on the side of this Himavat!'

data.v: श्रुत्वा त्वग्निवचो गङ्गा तं गर्भमतिभास्वरम् । उत्ससर्ज महातेजाः स्रोतोभ्यो हि तदानघ ॥
data.es: "O glorious, sinless one, (Rama) hearing the words of the Firegod, Ganga then expelled that resplendent embryo from her streams.
data.anv: महातेज: O Highly glorious, अनघ O Sinless one, अग्निवच: words of firegod, श्रुत्वा having heard, गङ्गा Ganga, तदा then, अतिभास्वरम् highly resplendent, तम् गर्भम् that embryo, स्रोतोभ्य: towards streams of the river, उत्ससर्ज released.
data.md: Hearing Agni's words, Gangă of mighty energy cast her exceedingly effulgent embryo on her streams, O sinless one.

data.v: यदस्या निर्गतं तस्मात्तप्तजाम्बूनदप्रभम् । काञ्चनं धरणीं प्राप्तं हिरण्यममलं शुभम् ॥
data.es: The embryo that emerged from Ganga reached the earth. It resembled the lustre of molten gold. It furned into gold auspicious, bright and pure.
data.anv: अस्या: from this river Ganaga, तप्तजाम्बूनदप्रभम् resembling the lustre of the molten gold, यत् that embryo, निर्गतम् emerging out of her, धरणीम् earth, प्राप्तम् having reached, तस्मात् from it, शुभम् auspicious, काञ्चनम् bright, अमलम् pure, हिरण्यम् gold (was produced).
data.md: And as it came out of her, it wore the splendour of molten gold; and in consequence of its fiery virtue, objects near and objects far were converted into gold and silver of unsurpassed sheen, while those that were more distant were turned into copper and iron.

data.v: ताम्रं कार्ष्णायसं चैव तैक्ष्ण्यादेवाभिजायत । मलं तस्याभवत्तत्र त्रपुसीसकमेव च ॥
data.es: There copper and iron were produced from its acidity, zinc and lead from its residue. Various minerals were formed when that embryo reached the earth.
data.anv: तत्र there, तैक्ष्ण्यात् from  its severity, ताम्रम् copper, कार्ष्णायसम् चैव iron also, अभ्यजायत were produced, तस्य from that embryo, मलम् dirt, त्रपु zinc, सीसकमेव lead, अभवत् born, तत् एतत् that vital fluid, धरणीम् earth, प्राप्य having reached, नानाधातु: various minerals, अवर्धत developed.

data.v: तदेतद्धरणीं प्राप्य नानाधातुरवर्धत ॥
data.md: Her excreta were turned into lead. In this wise, various metals began to increase on earth.

data.v: निक्षिप्तमात्रे गर्भे तु तेजोभिरभिरञ्जितम् । सर्वं पर्वतसंनद्धं सौवर्णमभवद्वनम् ॥
data.es: When the embryo was placed (in Ganga) it spread on all sides of the forest on the mountain. Irradiated with lustre the forest appeared golden.
data.anv: गर्भे when that embryo, निक्षिप्तमात्रे had  been just placed, सर्वम् all, पर्वतसन्नद्धम् sprouted on the mountain, वनम् forest, तेजोभि: with lustre, अभिरञ्जितम् reddened, सौवर्णम् अभवत् rendered golden.
data.md: As soon as the embryo was brought forth, the woods adjoining the mountain, being overspread with that energy, were turned into gold.

data.v: जातरूपमिति ख्यातं तदा प्रभृति राघव । सुवर्णं पुरुषव्याघ्र हुताशनसमप्रभम् ॥
data.es: O tiger among men, O scion of the Raghus Then onwards gold which is effulgent like fire, became wellknown as Jatarupa (pure form). The grass, shrubs, creepers and trees of that forest looked golden.
data.anv: पुरुषव्याघ्र O Best among men, राघव Rama, तदा प्रभृति then onwards, हुताशनसमप्रभम् effulgent like fire, सुवर्णम् gold, जातरूपम् Jatarupa (born with a form), (इति) ख्यातम् wellknown as, सर्वम् all, तृणवृक्षलतागुल्मम् with grass, shrubs, creepers and trees, काञ्चनं भवति became gold.
data.md: And from that day, O descendant of Raghu, gold of effulgence like to that of fire, became known as Jātarūpa, O foremost of men!

data.v: तं कुमारं ततो जातं सेन्द्राः सहमरुद्गणाः । क्षीरसंभावनार्थाय कृत्तिकाः समयोजयन् ॥
data.es: Thereafter Kumara was born (out of Ganga's womb). The gods together with Indra arranged six nymphs (stars) to act as nurses to suckle Kumara as their own offspring.
data.anv: तत: thereafter, जातम् born, तं कुमारम् that Kumara, सेन्द्रा: together with Indra, मरुद्गणा: groups of deities, सह together, क्षीरसंभावनार्थाय with a view to suckle him as their own offspring, कृत्तिका: six nymphs (stars) to act as nurses, समयोजन् arranged.
data.md: And when the son was born, the deities with Indra and the Maruts enjoined upon the Křttikā stars to suckle him.

data.v: ताः क्षीरं जातमात्रस्य कृत्वा समयमुत्तमम् । ददुः पुत्रोऽयमस्माकं सर्वासामिति निश्चिताः ॥
data.es: Those krittikas, having decided among themselves and having made an agreement with the gods saying 'This boy shall become a son to all of us' fed the newborn with their milk (breast milk).
data.anv: ता: those Krittikas, निश्चिता: regarded within themselves, अयम् this boy, अस्माकम् सर्वासाम् for all of us, पुत्र: son, उत्तमम् great, समयम् an agreement, कृत्वा having made, जातमात्रस्य just then born boy, क्षीरम् breast milk, ददु: gave.
data.md: 'Surely he shall be son to us all’-concluding thus, they as soon as he was born, by turns began to dispense milk to him.

data.v: ततस्तु देवताः सर्वाः कार्तिकेय इति ब्रुवन् । पुत्रस्त्रैलोक्य विख्यातो भविष्यति न संशयः ॥
data.es: Thereafter, all the gods said, 'This son shall become renowned in the three worlds as Karttikeya, (son of krittikas). There is no doubt '.
data.anv: तत: thereafter, सर्वा: all, देवता: devatas, पुत्र: son, कार्तिकेय: इति as Karthikeya, son of Krittikas, त्रैलोक्यविख्यात: renowned in three worlds, भविष्यति shall become, संशय: न no doubt, इति ब्रुवन् thus spoke.
data.md: Then the celestials called him Kārtikeya, saying, “Without doubt, this son shall become famed over the three worlds.'

data.v: तेषां तद्वचनं श्रुत्वा स्कन्नं गर्भपरिस्रवे । स्नापयन्परया लक्ष्म्या दीप्यमानमिवानलम् ॥
data.es: Hearing the words of the gods, the krittikas bathed the baby that descended from the womb of Ganga resembling flaming fire and shining with great beauty.
data.anv: तेषाम् of those devatas', तत् वचनम् those words, श्रुत्वा having heard, गर्भपरिस्रवे when the embryo was flowing from womb, स्कन्नम् descended, अनलम् यथा like fire, परया with great, लक्ष्म्या beauty, दीप्यमानम् shining, स्नापयन् bathed.
data.md: And hearing those words of theirs, the Kșttikās bathed the offspring that had issued from her womb, flaming like fire, and with auspicious marks.

data.v: स्कन्द इत्यब्रुवन्देवाः स्कन्नं गर्भपरिस्रवात् । कार्तिकेयं महाभागं काकुत्स्थज्वलनोपमम् ॥
data.es: O scion of the Kakusthas, Karttikeya lustrous like flaming fire, was very fortunate Descended from the womb of the Ganga, he is named Skanda by the gods.
data.anv: काकुत्स्थ O Rama, ज्वलनोपमम् equal to flaming fire, महाभागम् very fortunate, गर्भपरिस्रवात् embryo from womb, स्कन्नम् descended, कार्तिकेयम् Karthikeya, स्कन्द: इति will be known as Skanda, देवा: devatas, अब्रुवन् spoke.
data.md: And, O Kākutstha, since Kārtikeya had issued from (Gangā's) womb the celestials called that effulgent and mighty-armed one, Skanda.

data.v: प्रादुर्भूतं ततः क्षीरं कृत्तिकानामनुत्तमम् । षण्णां षडाननो भूत्वा जग्राह स्तनजं पयः ॥
data.es: Then excellent milk surged in the breasts of krittikas. Assuming six mouths, he sucked the milk.
data.anv: तत: then, कृत्तिकानाम् of Krittikas, अनुत्तमम् very best, क्षीरम् milk, प्रादुर्भूतम् formed, षण्णाम् of  six of them, स्तनजम् coming from their breasts, पय: milk, षडानन: six faces Skanda, भूत्वा having assumed, जग्राह received.
data.md: And then the teats of the Křttikās were filled with milk; and thereupon assuming six mouths, he began to suck milk from the teats of those six.

data.v: गृहीत्वा क्षीरमेकाह्ना सुकुमार वपुस्तदा । अजयत्स्वेन वीर्येण दैत्यसैन्यगणान्विभुः ॥
data.es: Drinking milk just for a day and with a body still tender he could vanquish hosts of demons by his inborn prowess so capable be was
data.anv: विभु: the capable boy, एकाह्ना for one day only, क्षीरम् milk, गृहीत्वा having received, तदा then, सुकुमारवपु: with tender body, स्वेन वीर्येण by his inborn prowess, दैत्यसेनागणान् hosts of demons, अजयत् vanquished.
data.md: Having drunk the milk, that lord although then possessed of a tender frame, by virtue of his inbom prowess in one day vanquished the Dänava forces.

data.v: सुरसेनागणपतिं ततस्तममलद्युतिम् । अभ्यषिञ्चन्सुरगणाः समेत्याग्निपुरोगमाः ॥
data.es: With the Firegod in the forefront, all the gods assembled and installed Karttikeya, shining on unsurpassed brilliant, as commander of the gods forces.
data.anv: तत: then, अग्निपुरोगमा: with firegod in the forefront, सुरगणा: devatas, समेत्य having  assembled, अतुलद्युतिम् a hero of unsurpassed effulgence, तम् him, सुरसेनागणपतिम् commander of devata forces, अभ्यषिञ्चन् installed.
data.md: And him possessed of mighty effulgence, the celestials assembled with Agni as their leader sprinkled with water, by way of installing him as their generalissimo.

data.v: एष ते राम गङ्गाया विस्तरोऽभिहितो मया । कुमारसंभवश्चैव धन्यः पुण्यस्तथैव च ॥
data.es: "O Rama this story of Ganga and that of the birth of Kumara, who was fortunate and auspicious, has been related to you in detail.
data.anv: राम O Rama, मया by me, ते to you,गङ्गाया: Ganga's, एष: this story, विस्तर: in detail, तथैव and, धन्य: a fortunate being, पुण्य: auspiciousness, कुमारसम्भवश्चैव birth of Kumara, अभिहित: has been told.

data.v: तां कथां कौशिको रामे निवेद्य मधुराक्षरम् । पुनरेवापरं वाक्यं काकुत्स्थमिदमब्रवीत् ॥
data.es: Viswamitra, an offspring of Kusika having related the story (of Karthikeya) to the son of the Kakusthas (Rama) said again.
data.anv: कुशिकात्मज: the offspring of Kausika, कौशिक: Visvamitra, तां कथाम् that story, रामे to Rama, निवेद्य having related, पुनरेव again, इदम् this, (अपरं) वाक्यम् words, काकुत्स्थम् addressing Rama, अब्रवीत् had spoken.
data.md: Having said those words to Rāma, composed of melodious letters, Kausika again spoke to Kākutstha, saying,

data.v: अयोध्याधिपतिः शूरः पूर्वमासीन्नराधिपः । सगरो नाम धर्मात्मा प्रजाकामः स चाप्रजः ॥
data.es: "In olden days there lived a brave and righteous king named Sagara who was ruler of Ayodhya. He was childless and desired to have children,
data.anv: पूर्वम् in ancient times, अयोध्याधिपति: ruler of Ayodhya, शूर: brave, धर्मात्मा righteous one, सगरो नाम named Sagara, नराधिप: आसीत् was king, स: he, अप्रज: was childless, प्रजाकाम: desiring children,
data.md: Formerly there was a king-lord of Ayodhyā-named Sagara. And it came to pass that righteous one, though eagerly wishing for children was without issue.

data.v: वैदर्भदुहिता राम केशिनी नाम नामतः । ज्येष्ठा सगरपत्नी सा धर्मिष्ठा सत्यवादिनी ॥
data.es: O Rama the daughter of the king of Vidarbha by name Kesini was Sagara's eldest wife who was righteous and truthful.
data.anv: राम O Rama, वैदर्भदुहिता daughter of king of Vidarbha, नामत: by name, केशिनी नाम  wellknown as Kesini, ज्येष्ठा eldest, सगरपत्नी wife of Sagara, सा she, धर्मिष्ठा righteous, सत्यवादिनी truthful.
data.md: O Räma, Vidarbha's daughter, named Kesinī, was the elder wife of Sagara. And she was virtuous and truthful.

data.v: अरिष्टनेमिदुहिता रूपेणाप्रतिमा भुवि । द्वितीया सगरस्यासीत्पत्नी सुमतिसंज्ञिता ॥
data.es: The daughter of Arishtanemi named Sumati was the second wife of Sagara and none surpassed her in charm on earth.
data.anv: अरिष्टनेमे: Arishtanemi's, दुहिता daughter, रूपेण in charm, भुवि on this earth, अप्रतिमा unsurpassed, सुमतिसंज्ञिता named Sumati, सगरस्य Sagara's, द्वितीया second, पत्नी आसीत् was his wife.
data.md: The second wife of Sagara was called Sumati, who was the daughter of Aristanemi and the sister of Suparna (Garuda).

data.v: ताभ्यां सह तदा राजा पत्नीभ्यां तप्तवांस्तपः । हिमवन्तं समासाद्य भृगुप्रस्रवणे गिरौ ॥
data.es: The king (Sagara) accompanied by his wives reached Himavat mountain and engaged himself in severe austerities on a peak called Bhriguprasravana.
data.anv: तदा then, महाराजः king Sagara, ताभ्याम् पत्नीभ्याम् with those wives, सह accompanied by, हिमवन्तम् Himavat mountain, समासाद्य having reached, भृगुप्रस्रवणे on a peak called Bhriguprasravana, गिरौ mountain, तप: तप्तवान् engaged in austerities.
data.md: And with those wives of his, that mighty king, coming to the Himavat, began to practice austerities on the mountain Bhrguprasravaņa.

data.v: अथ वर्ष शते पूर्णे तपसाराधितो मुनिः । सगराय वरं प्रादाद्भृगुः सत्यवतां वरः ॥
data.es: When Sagara completed a hundred years in austerities, highly pleased by his performance, ascetic Bhrugu, the best among the truthful granted him a boon.
data.anv: अथ then, वर्षशते when hundred years, पूर्णे had completed, तपसा by austerites, आराधित: pleased, सत्यवतां वर: best among truthful persons, भृगु: मुनि: the ascestic Bhrugu, सगराय for Sagara, वरम् boon, प्रादात् granted.
data.md: When a full hundred years had been numbered, the ascetic that had been adored by means of these austerities, Bright, best of those endowed with truth, conferred a boon upon Sagara, saying.

data.v: अपत्यलाभः सुमहान्भविष्यति तवानघ । कीर्तिं चाप्रतिमां लोके प्राप्स्यसे पुरुषर्षभ ॥
data.es: O sinless one, you will get a very great progeny, O best among men you will acquire unparalleled fame in this world.
data.anv: अनघ O Blemishless one, तव to you, सुमहान् very great, अपत्यलाभ: gain of progeny, भविष्यति will take place, पुरुषर्षभ O Best among men, लोके in this world, अप्रतिमाम् unparalleled, कीर्तिं च fame, प्राप्स्यसे you will acquire.
data.md: O sinless one, you shall obtain glorious offspring; and, O foremost of men, you shall attain unparalleled renown among Man.

data.v: एका जनयिता तात पुत्रं वंशकरं तव । षष्टिं पुत्रसहस्राणि अपरा जनयिष्यति ॥
data.es: O child, one wife will beget a son who will perpetuate your race and the other, sixty thousand sons, said Bhrugu.
data.anv: तात O Child, एका one wife, तव your, वंशकरम् perpetuating race, पुत्रम् one son, जनयिता will beget, अपरा the other wife, षष्ठिं sixty, पुत्रसहस्राणि thousands of sons, जनयिष्यति will beget.
data.md: O child, one of your con sorts shall bring forth a son who will perpetuate your race; and the other give birth to sixty thousand sons.'

data.v: भाषमाणं नरव्याघ्रं राजपत्न्यौ प्रसाद्य तम् । ऊचतुः परमप्रीते कृताञ्जलिपुटे तदा ॥
data.es: Thereafter, both the daughters of the king were exceedingly delighted. Having propitiated that magnanimous asectic both of them with folded hands in supplication, said:
data.anv: तदा after that, परमप्रीते exceedingly delighted, राजपुत्र्यौ daughters of kings, कृताञ्जलिपुटे  folding hands in supplication, भाषमाणम् speaking in this way, महात्मानम् magnanimous, प्रसाद्य propitiating, तम् addresseing him, ऊचतु: said.
data.md: As that best of men was saying this, those daughters of kings, exceedingly delighted, propitiating him, addressed him with clasped hands.

data.v: एकः कस्याः सुतो ब्रह्मन्का बहूञ्जनयिष्यति । श्रोतुमिच्छावहे ब्रह्मन्सत्यमस्तु वचस्तव ॥
data.es: O knower of Brahman which of us will beget one, and who many sons? O Brahmarshi we wish to hear. Let your words come true".
data.anv: ब्रह्मन् O Knower of Brahman, कस्या: which of us, एक: one, सुत: son will beget, का who is she, बहून् many sons, जनयिष्यति will beget, ब्रह्मन् O Brahmarshi, श्रोतुम् to listen, इच्छावहे both of us are interested in knowing, तव your, वच: words, सत्यम् अस्तु let this be true.
data.md: Who of us, O Brahmana, shall produce a single son, and who many? This, O Brāhmaṇa, we wish to hear. May your word prove true!

data.v: तयोस्तद्वचनं श्रुत्वा भृगुः परम धार्मिकः । उवाच परमां वाणीं स्वच्छन्दोऽत्र विधीयताम् ॥
data.es: The deeply religious and highly powerful king, having heard those words of his one hundred exceptional daughters, replied:
data.anv: परमधार्मिक: the highly virtuous one, महातेजा: highly powerful, राजा the king, तासाम् theirs, तत् वचनम् those words, श्रुत्वा having heard, अनुत्तमम् excellent, कन्याशतम् hundred daughters, प्रत्युवाच replied.
data.md: Hearing this, the highly pious Bhỉgu said these pregnant words, 'Do you unfold your minds. Who wishes for what boon, between a single perpetuator of the line, and innumerable sons, possessed of mighty strength, and furnished with fame, and endowed with high spirits?'

data.v: एको वंशकरो वास्तु बहवो वा महाबलाः । कीर्तिमन्तो महोत्साहाः का वा कं वरमिच्छति ॥
data.es: 'What would you wish? One son who perpetuates the race or many possessed of mighty strength endowed with fame and perseverance?' (asked Bhrugu).
data.anv: वंशकर: perpetuating the race, एक: one, अस्तु वा shall beget, महाबला: possessed of mighty strength, कीर्तिमन्त: endowed with fame, महोत्साहा: great perseverance, बहवो वा many, का वा who among you, कं वरम् which boon, इच्छति is desiring?
data.md: Hearing this, the highly pious Bhỉgu said these pregnant words, 'Do you unfold your minds. Who wishes for what boon, between a single perpetuator of the line, and innumerable sons, possessed of mighty strength, and furnished with fame, and endowed with high spirits?'

data.v: मुनेस्तु वचनं श्रुत्वा केशिनी रघुनन्दन । पुत्रं वंशकरं राम जग्राह नृपसंनिधौ ॥
data.es: "O Rama, delight of the descendants of Raghus, on hearing the words of the ascetic in the presence of king Sagara, Kesini chose the boon to have a son who perpetuates the race.
data.anv: रघुनन्दन O One causing delight to the descendents of Raghu, राम Rama , मुने: ascetic's, वचनम् words, श्रुत्वा having heard, केशिनी Kesini, वंशकरम् perpetuating the race, पुत्रम् son, नृपसन्निधौ in the presence of king, जग्राह accepted.
data.md: Hearing the ascetic's words, O descendant of Raghu, Kesinī in the presence of the monarch chose, O Rāma, a single son to perpetuate the line.

data.v: षष्टिं पुत्रसहस्राणि सुपर्णभगिनी तदा । महोत्साहान्कीर्तिमतो जग्राह सुमतिः सुतान् ॥
data.es: Then, Sumati (the other wife) sister of Suparna (Garuda) obtained the boon of sixty thousand sons endowed with fame and great perseverance.
data.anv: तदा then, सुपर्णभगिनी sister of (Garuda) Suparna, सुमति: Sumati, महोत्साहान् possessing great perseverance, कीर्तिमत: endowed with fame, षष्ठिम् sixty, पुत्रसहस्राणि thosands of sons, सुतान् as her sons, जग्राह accepted.
data.md: And Suparna's sister, Sumati, sixty thousand sons, high-spirited and furnished with fame.

data.v: प्रदक्षिणमृषिं कृत्वा शिरसाभिप्रणम्य च । जगाम स्वपुरं राजा सभार्या रघुनन्दन ॥
data.es: O son of the Raghus the king along with his wives, having circumambulated saint Bhrugu, bowed his head in reverence, saluted him with folded hands and returned to his capital.
data.anv: रघुनन्दन O Rama, सभार्य: along with wives, राजा king, ऋषिम् saint Bhrigu, प्रदक्षिणं कृत्वा having circumambulated, शिरसा bowing down the head, अभिप्रणम्य saluting with folded hands, स्वपुरम् his own capital, जगाम went.
data.md: Then, O son of Raghu, having gone round the saint and bowed down the head, the king went to his own capital, accompanied by his consorts.

data.v: अथ काले गते तस्मिञ्ज्येष्ठा पुत्रं व्यजायत । असमञ्ज इति ख्यातं केशिनी सगरात्मजम् ॥
data.es: After lapse of some time, the eldest wife Kesini gave birth to a son wellknown by name Asamanjasa.
data.anv: अथ thereafter, तस्मिन् काले गते after lapse of some time, ज्येष्ठा eldest wife, केशिनी Kesini, सगरात्मजम् son of Sagara, असमञ्ज इति by name Asamanjasa, ख्यातम् well known, पुत्रम् son, व्यजायत gave birth.
data.md: And after a length of time, the elder, Kesini, bore a son to Sagara, known by the name of Asamanja.

data.v: सुमतिस्तु नरव्याघ्र गर्भतुम्बं व्यजायत । षष्टिः पुत्रसहस्राणि तुम्बभेदाद्विनिःसृताः ॥
data.es: O best among men, Sumati gave birth to a gourdlike foetus and when it burst open, sixty thousand sons emerged.
data.anv: नरव्याघ्र O Best among men, सुमतिस्तु Sumati, गर्भतुम्बम् gourd like foetus, व्यजायत gave birth, तुम्बभेदात् when that guard like foetus was burst open, षष्ठि: sixty, पुत्रसहस्राणि thousands of sons, विनिस्सृता: emerged.
data.md: And Sumati, O foremost of men, brought forth a gourd. And when it burst open, out came from it sixty thousand sons.

data.v: घृतपूर्णेषु कुम्भेषु धात्र्यस्तान्समवर्धयन् । कालेन महता सर्वे यौवनं प्रतिपेदिरे ॥
data.es: Nurses placed all of them in pots filled with clarified butter and fostered them. They attained adolescence after a long time.
data.anv: धात्र्य: nurses, तान् them, घृतपूर्णेषु filled with clarified butter, कुम्भेषु in pots, समवर्धयन् fostered them, सर्वे all of them, महता कालेन after a long time, यौवनम् state of adolescence, प्रतिपेदिरे attained.
data.md: And the nurses fostered them by keeping them in jars filled with clarified butter. And after a great length of time, they attained to youth.

data.v: अथ दीर्घेण कालेन रूपयौवनशालिनः । षष्टिः पुत्रसहस्राणि सगरस्याभवंस्तदा ॥
data.es: Then, after a long time Sagara's sixty thousand sons attained beauty and youth.
data.anv: अथ then, दीर्घेण कालेन after a lapse of long time, सगरस्य Sagara's, षष्ठि: पुत्रसहस्राणि sixty thousand sons, तदा then, रूपयौवनशालिन: अभवन् became resplendent with beauty and manhood.
data.md: And after a long lapse of time, Sagara's sixty thousand sons attained to youth and beauty.

data.v: स च ज्येष्ठो नरश्रेष्ठ सगरस्यात्मसंभवः । बालान्गृहीत्वा तु जले सरय्वा रघुनन्दन । प्रक्षिप्य प्रहसन्नित्यं मज्जतस्तान्निरीक्ष्य वै ॥
data.es: O best among men, delight of the Raghus (in the mean time) sagara's eldest son Asamanjasa, used to seize hold of children and throw them into the waters of river Sarayu. And while they were drowning, he was laughing.
data.anv: नरश्रेष्ठ O Best among men,  रघुनन्दन O Rama, ज्येष्ठ: eldest son,  स: सगरस्य आत्मसम्भव: that Sagara's son Asamanjasa, नित्यम् every day, बालान् children, गृहीत्वा seizing hold of, सरय्वा: river Sarayu's, जले waters, प्रक्षिप्य throwing them, निमज्जत: while they were drowning, तान् them, समीक्ष्य beholding, प्रहसन् while laughing (rejoiced).
data.md: O foremost of men,* the eldest son of Sagara, taking those children, would, O descendant of Raghu, often cast them into the Sarayū, and in mirth behold them sinking in the waters. *The text has Narasresthas, put for Asamanja. Evidently this is an error. I make it a vocative.

data.v: पौराणामहिते युक्तः पित्रा निर्वासितः पुरात् ॥
data.es: Thus this son inclined towards evil and formenting the good citizens was banished (of the king) from the capital for his indulgence in malevolent acts.
data.anv: एवम् In this manner, पापसमाचार: evilinclined, सज्जनप्रतिबाधक: tormenting the good citizens, पौराणाम् for citizens, अहिते inimical acts, युक्तः (रत:) delighted, पुत्र: son, पुरात् from capital, निर्वासित: was banished.
data.md: Being thus evil-disposed, and injuring honest folks, and engaged in doing wrong to the citizens, he was banished by this father from the city.

data.v: तस्य पुत्रोंऽशुमान्नाम असमञ्जस्य वीर्यवान् । संमतः सर्वलोकस्य सर्वस्यापि प्रियंवदः ॥
data.es: Asamanjasa's son was Anshuman. He was valiant, beloved and courteous to every one in the world.
data.anv: तस्य असमञ्जस्य for that Asamanjasa, पुत्र: son, वीर्यवान् valiant, अंशुमान् नाम named Anshuman, सर्वलोकस्य for the entire world, सम्मत: beloved, सर्वस्यापि for every one also, प्रियंवद: courteous in speech.
data.md: Asamañja had a son possessed of prowess, named Anšumān. And he was beloved of all men and fair-spoken towards everyone.

data.v: ततः कालेन महता मतिः समभिजायत । सगरस्य नरश्रेष्ठ यजेयमिति निश्चिता ॥
data.es: O best among men after a long time, a thought came to the mind of Sagara to definitely perform a sacrifice.
data.anv: नरश्रेष्ठ O Best among men, तत: afterwards, महता कालेन after a long time, सगरस्य Sagara's, यजेयम् I shall perform sacrifice, इति thus, निश्चिता firm, मति: decision, समभिजायत arose (in him).
data.md: O foremost of men, it came to pass that after a long time had gone by, that lord of earth Sagara made up his mind, saying, 'I will sacrifice.'

data.v: स कृत्वा निश्चयं राजा सोपाध्यायगणस्तदा । यज्ञकर्मणि वेदज्ञो यष्टुं समुपचक्रमे ॥
data.es: O Rama having determined to perform a sacrifice, he (Sagara) versed in the Vedas, started the initiatory rites for the sacrifice in the company of high priests".इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये बालकाण्डे अष्टात्रिंशस्सर्ग: 2Thus ends the thirtyeighth sarga of Balakanda of the holy Ramayana the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.
data.anv: राम O Rama, तदा then, वेदज्ञ: wellversed in vedas, स: he, सोपाध्यायगण: in the company of high priests, यज्ञकर्मणि initiatory rites relating to sacrifice, निश्चयम् determination, कृत्वा having made, यष्टुम् to perform sacrifice, समुपचक्रमे commenced.
data.md: Having determined upon it, that one versed in the Vedas set about it, in company with his priests.

data.v: विश्वामित्रवचः श्रुत्वा कथान्ते रघुनन्दन । उवाच परमप्रीतो मुनिं दीप्तमिवानलम् ॥
data.es: Immensely pleased with the words of Viswamitra, to the ascetic flaming bright like fire, Rama spoke towards the end of the narration:
data.anv: रघुनन्दन: Rama, विश्वामित्रवच: Visvamitra's words, श्रुत्वा having heard, परमप्रीत: immensely pleased, कथान्ते at the end of the narration of the tale, दीप्तम् flaming, अनलमिव fire like, मुनिम् addressing the ascetic, उवाच spoke.
data.md: When Viśvāmitra had ended, hearing his words, Rāma exceedingly pleased, spoke to that ascetic resembling flaming fire, saying,

data.v: श्रोतुमिछामि भद्रं ते विस्तरेण कथामिमाम् । पूर्वको मे कथं ब्रह्मन्यज्ञं वै समुपाहरत् ॥
data.es: "O Brahman I wish to listen in detail as to how my ancestors made preparations for the sacrifice? Prosperity to you".
data.anv: ब्रह्मन् O Brahmana, इमां कथाम् this tale, विस्तरेण in detail, श्रोतुम् to listen, इच्छामि I am desirous, ते भद्रम् prosperity to you, मे my, पूर्वक: ancestor, यज्ञम् sacrifice, कथम् how, समुपाहरत् arranged.
data.md: I am anxious to hear in detail, good betide you, how, O Brāhmaṇa, my ancestor arranged for the sacrifice.

data.v: विश्वामित्रस्तु काकुत्स्थमुवाच प्रहसन्निव । श्रूयतां विस्तरो राम सगरस्य महात्मनः ॥
data.es: Viswamitra addressing the son of the Kakusthas (Rama) with a smile said, "O Rama hear in detail the story of the magnanimous king Sagara".
data.anv: विश्वामित्रस्तु Visvamitra on his part, प्रहसन्निव (as though) smilingly, काकुत्स्थम् addressing Rama, उवाच spoke, महात्मन: of the magnanimous, सगरस्य Sagara's, विस्तर: in detail, श्रूयताम् may be heard.

data.v: शंकरश्वशुरो नाम हिमवानचलोत्तमः । विन्ध्यपर्वतमासाद्य निरीक्षेते परस्परम् ॥
data.es: "Sankara's fatherinlaw named Himavan is the greatest mountain. Himavan and Vindhya came close and began looking at one another. (because both are of extreme height and in between them there was no obstruction).
data.anv: शङ्करश्वशुर: Sankara's fatherinlaw, हिमवान्नाम named Himavt, अचलोत्तम: excellent mountain, विन्ध्यपर्वतम् Vindhya mountain, आसाद्य approaching, परस्परम् each other, निरीक्षेते beholding.

data.v: तयोर्मध्ये प्रवृत्तोऽभूद्यज्ञः स पुरुषोत्तम । स हि देशो नरव्याघ्र प्रशस्तो यज्ञकर्मणि ॥
data.es: "O best of men, the sacrifice took place in the region in between these two mountains. O tiger among men the region was appropriate for conducting sacrificial acts.
data.anv: पुरुषोत्तम O Best among men, स: यज्ञ: that sacrifice, तयो: मध्ये in the region in between  these two mountains, प्रवृत्त: अभूत् happened, नरव्याघ्र O Tiger among men, स: देश: that country, यज्ञकर्मणि for acts of sacrifices, प्रशस्तो हि is commendable.

data.v: तस्याश्वचर्यां काकुत्स्थ दृढधन्वा महारथः । अंशुमानकरोत्तात सगरस्य मते स्थितः ॥
data.es: "O child, O son of the Kakutsthas, the great charioteer Anshuman (who can fight with eleven thousand charioteers), wielding a strong bow followed the sacrificial horse (in order to protect it) in compliance with Sagara's wish.
data.anv: तात O Child, काकुत्स्थ O Kakutstha, दृढधन्वा possessing strong bow, महारथ: great charioteer, अंशुमान् Anshuman,सगरस्य Sagara's, मते on the wish, स्थित: abiding by, तस्य relating to that sacrifice, अश्वचर्याम् following the horse, अकरोत् carried out.
data.md: And that country, O best of men, is excellent as a sacrificial ground. And, O Kākutstha, equipped with a powerful bow, that mighty carwarrior, living under Sagara's sway, Ansumat, O child, followed the horse, for the purpose of protecting it.

data.v: तस्य पर्वणि तं यज्ञं यजमानस्य वासवः । राक्षसीं तनुमास्थाय यज्ञियाश्वमपाहरत् ॥
data.es: On the concluding day of the fortnight (full moon day) while the sacrifice was being performed, Vasava (Indra) assuming the form of rakshasa, had stolen away Sagara's sacrificial horse.
data.anv: वासव: Vasava (Indra), राक्षसीम् pertaining to rakshasa, तनुम् body, आस्थाय assuming, पर्वणि on the concluding day of the fornight (fullnew moon), तं यज्ञं यजमानस्य while the sacrificer  was performing sacrifice, तस्य Sagara's, यज्ञीयाश्वम् horse relating to sacrifice, अपाहरत् had stolen.
data.md: It came to pass that with the intention of disturbing the sacrifice of that monarch, on a certain day Vasava, assuming the, form of a Raksasi, stole away the sacrificial horse. us

data.v: ह्रियमाणे तु काकुत्स्थ तस्मिन्नश्वे महात्मनः । उपाध्याय गणाः सर्वे यजमानमथाब्रुवन् ॥
data.es: O son of the Kakutsthas, when the magnanimous king Sagara's sacrificial horse was stolen away, all the high priests addressing the performer of the sacrifice said:
data.anv: काकुत्स्थ O Kakutstha, महात्मन: magnanimous Sagara's, तस्मिन् अश्वे when that horse, ह्रियमाणे was being stolen away, अथ afterwards, सर्वे all, उपाध्यायगणा: the priests, यजमानम् performer of the sacrifice, अब्रुवन् spoke.

data.v: अयं पर्वणि वेगेन यज्ञियाश्वोऽपनीयते । हर्तारं जहि काकुत्स्थ हयश्चैवोपनीयताम् ॥
data.es: 'O Kakutstha on this auspicious (fullmoon) day the sacrificial horse has been stolen away suddenly and forcibly. Slay the thief and bring back the horse'.
data.anv: काकुत्स्थ O Kakutstha, king Sagara, पर्वणि on this auspicious Parvan day, अयं यज्ञियाश्व: this sacrificial horse, वेगेन quickly, अपनीयते forcibly is being taken away, हर्तारम् the thief, जहि slay him, हयश्च horse, उपनीयताम्  be brought back.

data.v: यज्ञच्छिद्रं भवत्येतत्सर्वेषामशिवाय नः । तत्तथा क्रियतां राजन्यथाछिद्रः क्रतुर्भवेत् ॥
data.es: 'This flaw in sacrifice will be inauspicious for all of us. Hence O king do everything which will ensure flawlessness to this sacrifice'.
data.anv: एतत् यज्ञच्छिद्रम् this is a flaw (hole) to sacrifice, न: सर्वेषाम् for all of us, अशिवाय भवेत् will be inauspicious, तत् for that reason, राजन् O king, क्रतु: this sacrifice, अच्छिद्र: without flaw (hole for leakage ), यथा in whichever manner, भवेत् be, तथा in that manner, क्रियताम् let it be done.

data.v: उपाध्याय वचः श्रुत्वा तस्मिन्सदसि पार्थिवः । षष्टिं पुत्रसहस्राणि वाक्यमेतदुवाच ह ॥
data.es: Having heard the words of the officiating priests, the king (Sagara) addressed his sixty thousand sons in the sacrificial assembly, saying:
data.anv: पार्थिव: that king, उपाध्यायवच: words of officiating priests, श्रुत्वा having heard, तस्मिन् सदसि in that sacrificial assembly, षष्टिं sixty, पुत्रसहस्राणि thousand sons, एतत् वाक्यम् these words, उवाच ह spoke.
data.md: Hearing the words of the priests, the king addressed his sixty thousand sons in the midst of his court, saying, 'l'eing, as this great sacrifice is, presided over by eminently pious Brāhmaṇas sanctified by mantras, I do not, you foremost of men, you sons, see how Raksasas may find entrance into it.'

data.v: गतिं पुत्रा न पश्यामि रक्षसां पुरुषर्षभाः । मन्त्रपूतैर्महाभागैरास्थितो हि महाक्रतुः ॥
data.es: 'O Best among men, O sons I do not the hand of rakshasas in this as this great sacrifice is consecrated by mantras (to prevent any interruption) and is presided over by eminent priests.
data.anv: परुषर्षभा: O Best among men, पुत्रा: O Sons, रक्षसाम् for rakshsas, गतिम् access, न पश्यामि   हि I do not see indeed, महाक्रतु: this great sacrifice, मन्त्रपूतै: consecrated by mantras, महाभागै: by eminent and pious priests, आस्थित: is presided.

data.v: तद्गच्छत विचिन्वध्वं पुत्रका भद्रमस्तु वः । समुद्रमालिनीं सर्वां पृथिवीमनुगच्छत ॥
data.es: 'Therefore my sons, go and search this entire earth surrounded by oceans. May you be safe'.
data.anv: पुत्रका: O Sons, तत् for that reason, गच्छत you may go, व: for you, भद्रम् auspiciousness, अस्तु happen, समुद्रमालिनीम् garlanded by oceans, सर्वाम् entire, पृथिवीम् earth, अनुगच्छत search for.

data.v: एकैकं योजनं पुत्रा विस्तारमभिगच्छत ॥
यावत्तुरगसंदर्शस्तावत्खनत मेदिनीम् । तमेव हयहर्तारं मार्गमाणा ममाज्ञया ॥
data.es: 'O sons, acquiring yojana by yojana the length and breadth of the earth, search for the thief of the horse. Excavate the earth till the time the horse is found. This is my command'.
data.anv: पुत्रा: O Sons, एकैकयोजनम् yojana by yojana, विस्तारम् length and breadth of earth, अधिगच्छत you may acquire, मम my, आज्ञया by command, तं हयहर्तारम् that thief of horse, मार्गमाणा: while search for, तुरगसन्दर्श: finding the horse, यावत् तावत् till such time, मेदिनीम् earth, खनत excavate.

data.v: दीक्षितः पौत्रसहितः सोपाध्यायगणो ह्यहम् । इह स्थास्यामि भद्रं वो यावत्तुरगदर्शनम् ॥
data.es: 'Having been initiated into the sacrifice, I, along with my grandson, Anshuman and other spiritual preceptors will stay here till such time the horse is found. May you be safe'
data.anv: दीक्षित: having been initiated into the sacrifice, अहम् I, पौत्रसहित: with my grandson, Anshuman, सोपाध्यायगण: together with spiritual preceptors, यावत्तुरगदर्शनम् till such time the horse is found, इह here, स्थास्यामि I will stay here, व: to you, भद्रम् safety be.
data.md: I have been initiated into this sacrifice with my grand-sons and priests.' I will stay here till you light upon the horse.

data.v: इत्युक्त्वा हृष्टमनसो राजपुत्रा महाबलाः । जग्मुर्महीतलं राम पितुर्वचनयन्त्रिताः ॥
data.es: "O Rama thus commanded by Sagara, the highly powerful princes with cheeful hearts departed in obedience to their father's command in quest of the horse on earth.
data.anv: राम O Rama, इति उक्ता: thus spoken, महाबला: highly powerful, राजपुत्रा: princes, हृष्टमनस: with joyful hearts, पितु: their father's, वचनयन्त्रिता: commanded by the words, महीतलम् about earth, जग्मु: departed.
data.md: And thereat the mighty princes, enjoined by their father, breathing high spirits, began to range the earth.

data.v: योजनायामविस्तारमेकैको धरणीतलम् । बिभिदुः पुरुषव्याघ्र वज्रस्पर्शसमैर्भुजैः ॥
data.es: O Tiger among men each one of them occupying one yojana in length and breadth of ground, dug up the earth with their nails that were sharp as diamonds.
data.anv: परुषव्याघ्र O Tiger among men, एकैक: each one of them, योजनायामविस्तारम् one yojana of length and width, धरणीतलम् ground, वज्रस्पर्शसमै: resembling the touch (sharpness) of diamonds, नखै: with their nails, बिभिदु: broke (dug up).
data.md: O Rāma. Then, they each fell to delving the bowels of the earth for the space of a Yojana in length and breadth, with their hands resembling thunder-bolts in feel, and with darts like to thunder-bolts, and with gigantic ploughshares. And being thus rived, the earth, O descendant of Raghu, began to send forth loud cries.

data.v: शूलैरशनिकल्पैश्च हलैश्चापि सुदारुणैः । भिद्यमाना वसुमती ननाद रघुनन्दन ॥
data.es: O Son of the Raghus (Rama) dreadful sounds emanated while the earth was being broken open by ploughs and lances similar to thunderbolt.
data.anv: रघुनन्दन O Rama, अशनिकल्पै: similar to thunderbolt, शूलै: with lances, सुदारुणै: which were dreadful, हलैश्च with plough, भिद्यमाना being broken, वसुमती earth, ननाद emanated sounds.
data.md: O Rāma. Then, they each fell to delving the bowels of the earth for the space of a Yojana in length and breadth, with their hands resembling thunder-bolts in feel, and with darts like to thunder-bolts, and with gigantic ploughshares. And being thus rived, the earth, O descendant of Raghu, began to send forth loud cries.

data.v: नागानां वध्यमानानामसुराणां च राघव । राक्षसानां च दुर्धर्षः सत्त्वानां निनदोऽभवत् ॥
data.es: O descendant of Raghu when the earth was being churned, an irrepressible sound of serpents, demons and rakshasas --of all creatures emerged.
data.anv: राघव O Rama, मथ्यमानानाम् being churned, नागानाम् of serpents, असुराणां च of demons, राक्षसानां च of rakshasas, सत्त्वानाम् of all the creatures, दुर्धर्ष: intolerable, निनद: अभवत् sound emerged.
data.md: O Rāghava, O you hard to repress, there arose an uproar from serpents, and Asuras, and Rāks asas, and other creatures, that were being slaughtered.

data.v: योजनानां सहस्राणि षष्टिं तु रघुनन्दन । बिभिदुर्धरणीं वीरा रसातलमनुत्तमम् ॥
data.es: O Descendant of the Raghus the heroic sons of Sagara excavated sixty thousand yojanas of earth reaching the nether world (one of the several regions below the earth).
data.anv: रघुनन्दन O Rama, वीरा: heroes, योजनानाम् of yojanas, षष्टिं सहस्राणि sixty thousand, धरणीम् earth, अनुत्तमम् great, रसातलम् nether world, बिभिदु: excavated.
data.md: O descendant of Raghu, they excavated the earth, O Rāma, for sixty thousand Yojanas, you, as if they had intended to reach the lowest depths underground.

data.v: एवं पर्वतसंबाधं जम्बूद्वीपं नृपात्मजाः । खनन्तो नृपशार्दूल सर्वतः परिचक्रमुः ॥
data.es: O Foremost among men (Rama) the princes while thus excavating Jambu dweepa, in this way filled with mountains, moved around everywhere.
data.anv: नरशार्दूल O Foremost of men, नृपात्मजा: sons of Sagara, पर्वतसम्बाधम् filled with mountains, जम्बूद्वीपम् Jambudweepa, एवम् in this way, खनन्त: while excavating, सर्वत: everywhere, परिचक्रमु: moved around.
data.md: Thus, O foremost of kings, those sons of the monarch dug all around Jambūdvīpa, filled with mountains.

data.v: ततो देवाः सगन्धर्वाः सासुराः सहपन्नगाः । संभ्रान्तमनसः सर्वे पितामहमुपागमन् ॥
data.es: Then the gods together with the gandharvas, asuras and serpents in bewildered minds approached Lord Brahma.
data.anv: तत: afterwards, सगन्धर्वा: together with gandharvas, सासुरा: with asuras, सपन्नगा: with serpents, देवा: gods, सर्वे all, सम्भ्रान्तमनस: with bewildered minds, पितामहम् lord Brahma, उपागमन् approached.
data.md: Thereat, the gods together with the Gandharvas, and Asuras, and Pannagas, in trepidation appeared before the Grand-sire.

data.v: ते प्रसाद्य महात्मानं विषण्णवदनास्तदा । ऊचुः परमसंत्रस्ताः पितामहमिदं वचः ॥
data.es: With highly agitated minds and meloncholic faces, all of them approached magnanimous Brahma and having propitiated him said:
data.anv: परमसन्त्रस्ता: highly agitated, विषण्णवदना: with meloncholic faces, ते they, महात्मानम् magnanimous, पितामहम् Brahma, प्रसाद्य having propitiated him, इदं वचः these words, ऊचु: spoke.
data.md: And propitiating that high-souled one, they with melancholy countenances and in exceeding agitation, spoke these words to the Grand-sire,

data.v: भगवन्पृथिवी सर्वा खन्यते सगरात्मजैः । बहवश्च महात्मानो वध्यन्ते जलचारिणः ॥
data.es: O Venerable one the entire earth is being excavated by the sons of Sagara. Many great beings living in the lower worlds are being killed.
data.anv: भगवन् O Venerable one, सर्वा entire, पृथिवी earth, सगरात्मजै: by sons of Sagara, खन्यते is being excavated, तलवासिन: those living in the lower worlds, बहव: many, महात्मान: great  beings, हन्यन्ते are being killed.
data.md: O adorable one, the entire earth is being excavated by the sons of Sagara; and many are the high-souled ones as well as the aquatic animals that are being slain in consequence.

data.v: अयं यज्ञहनोऽस्माकमनेनाश्वोऽपनीयते । इति ते सर्वभूतानि निघ्नन्ति सगरात्मजः ॥
data.es: 'This one is the destroyer of our sacrifice. He has stolen away our horse' saying so the sons of Sagara are slaying all living beings".इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये बालकाण्डे एकोनचत्वारिंशस्सर्ग: ॥Thus ends the thirtyninth sarga of Balakanda of the holy Ramayana the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.
data.anv: अयम् this one, अस्माकं our, यज्ञहर: destroyer of our sacrifice, अनेन by him, अश्व: horse, अपनीयते is being stolen away, इति saying so, ते सगरात्मजा: those sons of Sagara, सर्वभूतानि all beings, निघ्नन्ति are slaying.
data.md: This one is the disturber of our sacrifice, and by him has the sacrificial horse been stolen, saying this Sagara's sons are committing havoc upon all creatures.

data.v: देवतानां वचः श्रुत्वा भगवान्वै पितामहः । प्रत्युवाच सुसंत्रस्तान्कृतान्तबलमोहितान् ॥
data.es: Having heard the devatas, extremely frightened, and deprived of their sensual perception by the prowess of fate. The adorable grandsire (Brahma) replied:
data.anv: भगवान् the adorable one, पितामह: grandsire, Brahma, देवतानाम् devatas', वच: words, श्रुत्वा having heard, कृतान्तबलमोहितान् deprived of the activity of their senses by the prowess of fate, सुसन्त्रस्तान् exceedingly frightened, प्रत्युवाच replied back.
data.md: Hearing the speech of the celestials, that possessor of the six attributes, the Grand-sire, spoke to them exceedingly frightened and deprived of their senses on beholding the prowess of Sagara's sons like to the Destroyer himself.

data.v: यस्येयं वसुधा कृत्स्ना वासुदेवस्य धीमतः । कापिलं रूपमास्थाय धारयत्यनिशं धराम् ॥
data.es: 'This whole earth belongs to sagacious Vasudeva. He always supports the earth assuming the form of Kapila. The princes will be burnt by the fire of his wrath.
data.anv: कृत्स्ना whole, इयं वसुधा this earth, यस्य whose, धीमत: sagacious, वासुदेवस्य Vasudeva's, कापिलं रूपम् the form of Kapila, आस्थाय assuming, अनिशम् always, धराम् earth, धारयति supports, नृपात्मजा: sons of Sagara, तस्य his, कोपाग्निना by the fire of wrath, दग्धा: भविष्यन्ति  will be burnt.
data.md: This entire Earth belong to the intelligent Vasudeva, she being his consort. And that adorable one is indeed her lord. And assuming the form of Kapila, he unceasingly sustain the Earth. And the sons of king Sagara will be consumed by the fire of his wrath.

data.v: पृथिव्याश्चापि निर्भेदो दृष्ट एव सनातनः । सगरस्य च पुत्राणां विनाशोऽदीर्घजीविनाम् ॥
data.es: The excavation of this earth and the destruction of the short lived sons of Sagara is predestined since eternity'.
data.anv: पृथिव्या this earth, निर्भेद: excavation, अदीर्घजीविनाम् of the short lived men, सगरस्य पुत्राणाम्  of the sons of Sagara, विनाशश्च destruction, सनातन: in ancient times, दृष्ट एव is     predestined.
data.md: The pre-ordained excavation of the Earth, as well as the testruction of Sagara's sons, had been foreseen by the farsighted.

data.v: पितामहवचः श्रुत्वा त्रयस्त्रिंशदरिंदमः । देवाः परमसंहृष्टाः पुनर्जग्मुर्यथागतम् ॥
data.es: "O Destroyer of enemies (Rama) On hearing the words of the grandsire (Brahma), the thirtythree gods, exceedingly delighted returned the way they had come.
data.anv: अरिन्दम O Destroyer of enemies, पितामहवच: words of grandsire, Brahma, श्रुत्वा having heard, त्रयस्त्रिंशत् देवा: thirty three devatas, परमसंहृष्टा: exceedingly delighted, यथागतम् in the way they had come, पुन: again, जग्मु: returned.
data.md: Hearing the words of the Grand-sire. those repressors of their foes, the three and thirty* celestials, being exceedingly rejoiced, went back to their respective quarters. *The eight Vasus, eleven Rudras, twelve Adityas and two Asvins.

data.v: सगरस्य च पुत्राणां प्रादुरासीन्महात्मनाम् । पृथिव्यां भिद्यमानायां निर्घातसमनिस्वनः ॥
data.es: A sound like the resembling of thunder emanated while the earth was being riven by the noble sons of Sagara.
data.anv: महात्मनाम् of the noble, सगरस्य Sagara's, पुत्राणाम् sons, पृथिव्याम् when the earth, भिद्यमानायाम् when the earth was being riven, निर्घातसमनिस्वन: resembling the crash of thunder, प्रादुरासीत् emanated.
data.md: And as the sons of Sagara were riving the Earth, there arose a mighty noise, like to the bursting of thunder.

data.v: ततो भित्त्वा महीं सर्वां कृत्वा चापि प्रदक्षिणम् । सहिताः सगराः सर्वे पितरं वाक्यमब्रुवन् ॥
data.es: Afterwards, all the sons of Sagara, having riven the earth approached their father and circumamulating him said:
data.anv: तत: afterwards, सर्वे all of them, महीम् earth, भित्वा having riven, अभिप्रदक्षिणम् circumabulation, कृत्वा having made, सर्वे सगरा: all the sons of Sagara, सहिता together,  पितरम् addrerssing their father, वाक्यम् words, अब्रुवन् spoke.
data.md: Then, having rived the entire Earth and ranged it all around, the sons, of Sagara together (returned to their father) and spoke to him.

data.v: परिक्रान्ता मही सर्वा सत्त्ववन्तश्च सूदिताः । देवदानवरक्षांसि पिशाचोरगकिंनराः ॥
data.es: 'The entire earth was ransacked. Mighty devatas, demons, rakshasas, pisachas, uragas and kinnaras were killed. (Yet) we could neither see the horse nor the thief of the horse. Reflect over this matter and direct us. Prosperity to you'
data.anv: सर्वा entire, मही earth, परिक्रान्ता roamed about, सत्त्ववन्त: च mighty,  देवदानवरक्षांसि devatas, demons, rakshasas, पिशाचोरगकिन्नरा: pisachas, uragas, kinnaras, सूदिता: were killed, अश्वम् horse, तं अश्वहर्तारमेव च or the thief of the horse, न पश्यामहे च we could not see, किं करिष्याम what should we do?, ते भद्रम् prosperity to you, अत्र in this matter, बुध्दि: विचार्यताम् reflect over this matter.
data.md: By us has the Earth been extensively surveyed, and have powerful deities and Dānavas. Rākşasas, Piśācas, Uragas and Pannagas been slain; and yet do we find neither the horse nor the stealer thereof. What are we to do now? Good betide you, do you consider it well.

data.v: न च पश्यामहेऽश्वं तमश्वहर्तारमेव च । किं करिष्याम भद्रं ते बुद्धिरत्र विचार्यताम् ॥
data.es: 'The entire earth was ransacked. Mighty devatas, demons, rakshasas, pisachas, uragas and kinnaras were killed. (Yet) we could neither see the horse nor the thief of the horse. Reflect over this matter and direct us. Prosperity to you'
data.anv: सर्वा entire, मही earth, परिक्रान्ता roamed about, सत्त्ववन्त: च mighty,  देवदानवरक्षांसि devatas, demons, rakshasas, पिशाचोरगकिन्नरा: pisachas, uragas, kinnaras, सूदिता: were killed, अश्वम् horse, तं अश्वहर्तारमेव च or the thief of the horse, न पश्यामहे च we could not see, किं करिष्याम what should we do?, ते भद्रम् prosperity to you, अत्र in this matter, बुध्दि: विचार्यताम् reflect over this matter.
data.md: By us has the Earth been extensively surveyed, and have powerful deities and Dānavas. Rākşasas, Piśācas, Uragas and Pannagas been slain; and yet do we find neither the horse nor the stealer thereof. What are we to do now? Good betide you, do you consider it well.

data.v: तेषां तद्वचनं श्रुत्वा पुत्राणां राजसत्तमः । समन्युरब्रवीद्वाक्यं सगरो रघुनन्दन ॥
data.es: "O Rama incensed to fury at the words of his sons, magnanimous king Sagara replied":
data.anv: रघुनन्दन O Rama, तेषां पुत्राणाम् of those sons', तद्वचनम् those words, श्रुत्वा having heard, राजसत्तम: magnanimous king, सगर: Sagara, समन्यु: incensed, वाक्यम् words, अब्रवीत् said.
data.md: Hearing those words of his sons, that foremost of kings, getting into a wrath, said, O descendant of Raghu.

data.v: भूयः खनत भद्रं वो निर्भिद्य वसुधातलम् । अश्वहर्तारमासाद्य कृतार्थाश्च निवर्तथ ॥
data.es: Rive the earth again and excavate, capture the one who has stolen the horse and return after having accomplished the purpose. Safety to you
data.anv: वसुधातलम् the surface of the earth, निर्भिद्य after haing riven, भूय: again, खनत: for them who were excavating, अश्वहर्तारम् the thief of the horse, आसाद्य having traced, कृतार्था: having accomplished the purpose, निवर्तथ return, व:भद्रम् safety to you.
data.md: 'Do you yet again, good betide you, delve the earth, and having got at the stealer of the horse, cease.'

data.v: पितुर्वचनमास्थाय सगरस्य महात्मनः । षष्टिः पुत्रसहस्राणि रसातलमभिद्रवन् ॥
data.es: Receiving the command of their father, the magnanimous Sagara, his sixty thousand sons ran towards Rasatala (nether world).
data.anv: पितु: of the royal sire, महात्मन: magnanimous, सगरस्य Sagara's, वचनम् words, आसाद्य having received, षष्टि: पुत्रसहस्राणि sixsty thousand sons, रसातलम् Rasatala(nether world), अभिद्रवन् ran towards.
data.md: Receiving this mandate of their sire, the sixty thousand sons of the high-souled Sagara rushed towards the depths of the earth.

data.v: खन्यमाने ततस्तस्मिन्ददृशुः पर्वतोपमम् । दिशागजं विरूपाक्षं धारयन्तं महीतलम् ॥
data.es: Then while they were excavating the region they beheld the elephant of the quarter named Virupaksha equal in size to a mountain, supporting the earth.
data.anv: तत: Subsequently, तस्मिन् when that region, खन्यमाने was being excavated, पर्वतोपमम् in size equal to mountain, महीतलम् earth, धारयन्तम् supporting, विरूपाक्षम् named Virupaksha, दिशागजम् elephant of the quarter, ददृशु: beheld.
data.md: And as they were engaged in excavating, they beheld the elephant of the quarter resembling a hill, named Virūpākṣa, holding the earth.

data.v: सपर्वतवनां कृत्स्नां पृथिवीं रघुनन्दन । शिरसा धारयामास विरूपाक्षो महागजः ॥
data.es: O descendant of Raghu the mighty elephant Virupaksha was holding on its head the entire earth with its mountains and forests.
data.anv: रघुनन्दन O Rama, विरूपाक्ष: Virupaksha, महागज: mighty elephant, सपर्वतवनाम् together with mountains and forests, कृत्स्नाम् entire, महीम् earth, शिरसा on its head, धारयामास was holding.
data.md: O son of Raghu, that mighty elephant, Virūpākşa, held on his head the entire earth with its mountains and forests.

data.v: यदा पर्वणि काकुत्स्थ विश्रमार्थं महागजः । खेदाच्चालयते शीर्षं भूमिकम्पस्तधा भवेत् ॥
data.es: O descendant of Kakustha when that mighty elephant shakes its head for rest from weariness on certain sacred days earthquake occurs.
data.anv: काकुत्स्थ O Rama, महागज: that mighty elephant, पर्वणि on certain sacred days, यदा when, विश्रमार्थम् for refreshing, खेदात् from weariness, शीर्षम् head, चालयते shakes, तदा then, भूमिकम्प: earthquake, भवेत् takes place.
data.md: And, O Kākutstha, when on sacred days the mighty elephant, from fatigue, shake his head, then takes place the earthquake.

data.v: तं ते प्रदक्षिणं कृत्वा दिशापालं महागजम् । मानयन्तो हि ते राम जग्मुर्भित्त्वा रसातलम् ॥
data.es: O Rama having circumabulated and honoured that mighty elephant, the protector of the quarter they reached the Rasatala by riving the earth.
data.anv: राम O Rama, ते they, दिशापालं protector of the quarter, तम् महागजम् that  mighty elephant, प्रदक्षिणं कृत्वा having circumabulated, मानयन्त: honouring it,  भित्त्वा riving the earth, रसातलम् Rasatala, जग्मु: had gone.
data.md: Thereupon, O Rāma, going round that mighty elephant, and honouring him duly, they went on piercing the under earth.

data.v: ततः पूर्वां दिशं भित्त्वा दक्षिणां बिभिदुः पुनः । दक्षिणस्यामपि दिशि ददृशुस्ते महागजम् ॥
data.es: Subsequently, having dug the eastern region, they went on to southern and dug it too. In the southern region, they beheld a mighty elephant, magnanimous Mahapadma, resembling a great mountain. To their astonishment, they saw that elephant holding the earth on its head.
data.anv: तत: Subsequently, पूर्वाम् eastern, दिशम् region, भित्त्वा having dug, पुन: again, दक्षिणाम् southern region, बिभिदु: broken, ते they, दक्षिणस्याम् in the southern region also, सुमहत्पर्वतोपमम् resembling a great mountain, शिरसा with head, धारयन्तम् holding, महापद्मम् Mahapadma, महात्मानम् magnanimous, महागजम् mighty elephant, ददृशु: beheld, ते they, विस्मयम् astonishment, उत्तमम् great, जग्मु: obtained.
data.md: And having pierced the East, they pierced the South, and in the Southern quarter also they beheld a mighty elephant, the high-souled Mahāpadma, resembling a huge hill, holding the earth on his head. And thereat they marvelled greatly.

data.v: महापद्मं महात्मानं सुमहापर्वतोपमम् । शिरसा धारयन्तं ते विस्मयं जग्मुरुत्तमम् ॥
data.es: Subsequently, having dug the eastern region, they went on to southern and dug it too. In the southern region, they beheld a mighty elephant, magnanimous Mahapadma, resembling a great mountain. To their astonishment, they saw that elephant holding the earth on its head.
data.anv: तत: Subsequently, पूर्वाम् eastern, दिशम् region, भित्त्वा having dug, पुन: again, दक्षिणाम् southern region, बिभिदु: broken, ते they, दक्षिणस्याम् in the southern region also, सुमहत्पर्वतोपमम् resembling a great mountain, शिरसा with head, धारयन्तम् holding, महापद्मम् Mahapadma, महात्मानम् magnanimous, महागजम् mighty elephant, ददृशु: beheld, ते they, विस्मयम् astonishment, उत्तमम् great, जग्मु: obtained.

data.v: ततः प्रदक्षिणं कृत्वा सगरस्य महात्मनः । षष्टिः पुत्रसहस्राणि पश्चिमां बिभिदुर्दिशम् ॥
data.es: Receiving the command of their father, the magnanimous Sagara, his sixty thousand sons ran towards Rasatala (nether world).
data.anv: पितु: of the royal sire, महात्मन: magnanimous, सगरस्य Sagara's, वचनम् words, आसाद्य having received, षष्टि: पुत्रसहस्राणि sixsty thousand sons, रसातलम् Rasatala(nether world), अभिद्रवन् ran towards.
data.md: Receiving this mandate of their sire, the sixty thousand sons of the high-souled Sagara rushed towards the depths of the earth.

data.v: पश्चिमायामपि दिशि महान्तमचलोपमम् । दिशागजं सौमनसं ददृशुस्ते महाबलाः ॥
data.es: Possessed of great strength, they beheld also in the western quarter a great elephant of the quarter named Saumanasa resembling a mountain.
data.anv: महाबला: possessed of great strength, ते they, पश्चिमायां दिश्यपि in the western quarter also, महान्तम् great, अचलोपमम् resembling mountain, सौमनसम् named Saumanasa, दिशागजम् elephant of the quarter, ददृशु: beheld.
data.md: And in the western quarter also those highly powerful ones beheld the elephant of that quarter named Saumanas, resembling a mighty mountain.

data.v: तं ते प्रदक्षिणं कृत्वा पृष्ट्वा चापि निरामयम् । खनन्तः समुपक्रान्ता दिशं सोमवतीं तदा ॥
data.es: Having paid homage and enquiring as to his wellbeing, they arrived at the northern region by digging the earth.
data.anv: ते they, तं प्रदक्षिणं कृत्वा having circumambulated, निरामयम् as to its wellbeing, पृष्ट्वा having enquired, खनन्त: digging, तत: from there, हैमवतीम् northern, दिशम् region, समुपक्रान्ता: arrived.
data.md: And having gone round him and asked him as to his welfare, they delving on, arrived at the Northern region.

data.v: उत्तरस्यां रघुश्रेष्ठ ददृशुर्हिमपाण्डुरम् । भद्रं भद्रेण वपुषा धारयन्तं महीमिमाम् ॥
data.es: O Rama in the northern region, they beheld an auspicious elephant named Bhadra, who was white like snow, was holding that quater.
data.anv: रघुश्रेष्ठ O Rama, उत्तरस्याम् northern region, हिमपाण्डुरम् white like snow, भद्रेण वपुषा with auspicious body, इमाम् महीम् this earth, धारयन्तम् holding, भद्रम् elephant named as Bhadra, ददृशु: beheld.
data.md: And on the North like wise, O foremost of the Raghus, they beheld Bhadra, white as snow, holding this earth on his goodly person.

data.v: समालभ्य ततः सर्वे कृत्वा चैनं प्रदक्षिणम् । षष्टिः पुत्रसहस्राणि बिभिदुर्वसुधातलम् ॥
data.es: Thereafter, illustrious Sagara's sixty thousand sons, having circumabulated the elephant of the western region dug up that region.
data.anv: तत: thereafter, महात्मन: of the illustrious, सगरस्य Sagara's, षष्टि: पुत्रसहस्राणि sixty thousand sons, प्रदक्षिणं circumabulation, कृत्वा having made, पश्चिमम् western, दिशम् region, बिभिदु: dug up.
data.md: Having felt as well as gone round him, those sixty thousand sons of Sagara went on penetrating the depths of the earth.

data.v: ततः प्रागुत्तरां गत्वा सागराः प्रथितां दिशम् । रोषादभ्यखनन्सर्वे पृथिवीं सगरात्मजाः ॥
data.es: Subsequently, the sons of Sagara, having gone towards the celebrated northeastern region began to dig with wrath.
data.anv: तत: Subsequently, सागरा: sons of Sagara, प्रथिताम् celebrated, प्रागुत्तरां दिशम् towards northeastern region, गत्वा having gone, सर्वे all, सगरात्मजा: sons of Sagara, रोषात् with wrath, पृथिवीम् earth, अभ्यखनन् began to dig.
data.md: Then repairing to the famous North eastern region, Sagara's sons becoming enraged, began to dig the earth.

data.v: ददृशुः कपिलं तत्र वासुदेवं सनातनम् । हयं च तस्य देवस्य चरन्तमविदूरतः ॥
data.es: Great sons of Sagara terribly swiftfooted and exceedingly powerful beheld the eternal Visnu in (sage) Kapila and not far away from him the horse grazing. O descendant of Raghu they all experienced unparalleled joy.
data.anv: महात्मान: magnanimous, भीमवेगा: those having dreadful speed, महाबला: exceedingly powerful, ते they, सर्वे all, तत्र there, कपिलम् of Kapila, सनातनम् eternal, वासुदेवम् Vasudeva, तस्य देवस्य that god's, अविदूरत: not far away, चरन्तम् grazing, हयं च horse, ददृशु: beheld,  रघुनन्दन O Rama, ते सर्वे all of them, अतुलम् unparalleled, प्रहर्षम् joy, प्राप्ता: experienced.

data.v: ते तं यज्ञहनं ज्ञात्वा क्रोधपर्याकुलेक्षणाः । अभ्यधावन्त संक्रुद्धास्तिष्ठ तिष्ठेति चाब्रुवन् ॥
data.es: They recognised that best of horses. Their eyes were red with anger. Armed with spades, ploughshares and every kind of tree and stone and furious with wrath, they rushed towards Kapila shouting, wait, wait
data.anv: ते they, तं हयवरम् that best of horses, ज्ञात्वा knowing, क्रोधपर्याकुलेक्षणा: with eyes reddened  with anger, खनित्रलाङ्गलधरा: armed with spades, ploughshares, नानावृक्षशिलाधरा: with every kind of trees, stones, सङ्क्रुद्धा: furious with anger, अभ्यधावन्त rushed towards him, तिष्ठ stay, तिष्ठ stay, इति अब्रुवन् च also said.

data.v: अस्माकं त्वं हि तुरगं यज्ञियं हृतवानसि । दुर्मेधस्त्वं हि संप्राप्तान्विद्धि नः सगरात्मजान् ॥
data.es: 'O Wickedminded one you have stolen our sacrificial horse. Know that those of us who have come here are the sons of Sagara'.
data.anv: दुर्मेध: O Wicked minded one, त्वम् you, अस्माकम् our, यज्ञीयम् relating to sacrifice, तुरगम् horse, हृतवान् असि you have stolen, सम्प्राप्तान् those who have come here, न: us, सगरात्मजान् sons of Sagara, विद्धि you may know.

data.v: श्रुत्वा तद्वचनं तेषां कपिलो रघुनन्दन । रोषेण महताविष्टो हुंकारमकरोत्तदा ॥
data.es: "O descendant of Raghu Kapila, having heard their words, overwhelmed with great wrath, uttered the sound "H'm".
data.anv: रघुनन्दन O Rama, कपिल: Kapila, तेषाम् their, वचनम् words, श्रुत्वा having heard, तदा then, महता great, रोषेण wrath, आविष्ट: overwhelmed, हुङ्कारम् the sound "H'm", अकरोत् uttered.
data.md: Hearing this speech of theirs, Kapila, O descendant of Raghu, overwhelmed with rage uttered a tremendous roar.

data.v: ततस्तेनाप्रमेयेन कपिलेन महात्मना । भस्मराशीकृताः सर्वे काकुत्स्थ सगरात्मजाः ॥
data.md: And then, O Kākutstha, the sons of Sagara were reduced to ashes by the high-souled and incomparable Kapila.

data.v: पुत्रांश्चिरगताञ्ज्ञात्वा सगरो रघुनन्दन । नप्तारमब्रवीद्राजा दीप्यमानं स्वतेजसा ॥
data.es: "O Delight of the Raghus, king Sagara, realising that his sons had left long ago said to his grandson Anshuman resplendent with his own lustre:
data.anv: रघुनन्दन O Rama, सगरो राजा king Sagara, पुत्रान् sons, चिरगतान् having gone for a long time, ज्ञात्वा realising, स्वतेजसा by his own lusture, दीप्यमानम् resplendent, नप्तारम् addressing grand son, अब्रवीत् said:
data.md: Being the delay on the part of his sons, King Sagara, O son of Raghu, addressed his grandson, flaming in his native energy, saying,

data.v: शूरश्च कृतविद्यश्च पूर्वैस्तुल्योऽसि तेजसा । पितॄणां गतिमन्विच्छ येन चाश्वोऽपहारितः ॥
data.es: 'You are valiant. You have acquired knowledge (in various fields). You are illustrious like your ancestors. Pursue the track taken by your uncles and by the thief who ran away with the horse'.
data.anv: शूरश्च valiant, कृतविद्यश्च acquired knowledge in various fields, तेजसा by lustre, पूर्वै: with your ancestors, तुल्य: असि you are equal, पितृ़णाम् your ancestors, गतिम् path, अन्विच्छ search, अश्व: horse, येन by whom, अपवाहित: is carried away.
data.md: You are heroic and accomplished and like to your uncles. Do you enquire into the circumstances that have befallen your uncles, as also about the way by which the horse has escaped.

data.v: अन्तर्भौमानि सत्त्वानि वीर्यवन्ति महान्ति च । तेषां त्वं प्रतिघातार्थं सासिं गृह्णीष्व कार्मुकम् ॥
data.es: 'Creatures in the depths of the earth are powerful and mighty. Carry with you a bow and weapons to counter their attack'.
data.anv: अन्तर्भौमानि in the depths of earth, सत्त्वानि beings, वीर्यवन्ति possess prowess, महान्ति च are also mighty, त्वम् you, तेषाम् theirs, प्रतिघातार्थम् to destroy, सास्त्रम् with weapons, कार्मुकम् bow, गृह्णीष्व hold.
data.md: And as there are strong and mighty creatures inhabiting the Earth's interior, with the view of resisting them, do you take your how along with your scimitar.

data.v: अभिवाद्याभिवाद्यांस्त्वं हत्वा विघ्नकरानपि । सिद्धार्थः संनिवर्तस्व मम यज्ञस्य पारगः ॥
data.es: 'Honour those who deserve it. Kill those who cause obstacles to sacrifice. Come back with your mission accomplishing. And ensure the (successful) completion of my sacrifice'.
data.anv: त्वम् you, अभिवाद्यान् men who deserve to be honoured, अभिवाद्य after honouring, विघ्नकरान् those causing obstacles to sacrifice, हत्वा by killing, सिद्धार्थ: सन् having accomplished  the purpose, मम my, यज्ञस्य sacrifice's, पारग: you ensure completion of my sacrifice, निवर्तस्व come back.
data.md: And honouring those that deserve to be honoured and slaying such as disturb you, do you, having attained your end, come back, becoming the instrument for the completion of my sacrifice.'

data.v: एवमुक्तोंऽशुमान्सम्यक्सगरेण महात्मना । धनुरादाय खड्गं च जगाम लघुविक्रमः ॥
data.es: "Having been throughly instructed by the highsouled Sagara in this way, Anshuman left with rapid strides carrying a scimitar and a bow.
data.anv: अंशुमान् Anshuman, महात्मना by the magnanimous, सगरेण Sagara, एवम् in this way, सम्यक् thoroughly, उक्त: spoken, धनु: bow, खड्गं च scimitar, आदाय taking, लघुविक्रम: rapid strides, जगाम had set out.
data.md: Thus duly enjoined by the high-souled Sagara, Anśumān endowed with fleet vigour, taking his bow as well as his scimitar, set out.

data.v: स खातं पितृभिर्मार्गमन्तर्भौमं महात्मभिः । प्रापद्यत नरश्रेष्ठ तेन राज्ञाभिचोदितः ॥
data.es: O Best among men directed by the king (Sagara), Anshuman followed the path taken by his noble uncles into the depths of the earth.
data.anv: नरश्रेष्ठ O Best among men, स: he, राज्ञा by king, अभिचोदित: directed, महात्मभि: by the noble, पितृभि: uncles, अन्तर्भौमम् in the depths of earth, खातम् dug, मार्गम् path, प्रापद्यत followed.
data.md: An commanded by the monarch, he found the underground way that had been carved out by those high-souled ones.

data.v: दैत्यदानवरक्षोभिः पिशाचपतगोरगैः । पूज्यमानं महातेजा दिशागजमपश्यत ॥
data.es: Exceedingly valiant Ashuman beheld the elephant of the quarter worshipped by daityas, danavas, rakshasas, pisachas, birds and serpents.
data.anv: महातेजा: exceedingly valiant, दैत्यदानवरक्षोभि: daityas, danavas, rakshasas, पिशाचपतगोरगै: pisachas, birds and serpents, पूज्यमानम् worshipped by, दिशागजम् elephant of the quarter, अपश्यत beheld.
data.md: He found an exceedingly powerful elephant belonging to the cardinal point, worshipped by deities, and Dānavas, and Rākşasas, and goblins, and birds, and Uragas.

data.v: स तं प्रदक्षिणं कृत्वा पृष्ट्वा चैव निरामयम् । पितॄन्स परिपप्रच्छ वाजिहर्तारमेव च ॥
data.es: Having paid homage and enquiring as to his wellbeing, they arrived at the northern region by digging the earth.
data.anv: ते they, तं प्रदक्षिणं कृत्वा having circumambulated, निरामयम् as to its wellbeing, पृष्ट्वा having enquired, खनन्त: digging, तत: from there, हैमवतीम् northern, दिशम् region, समुपक्रान्ता: arrived.
data.md: And having gone round him and asked him as to his welfare, they delving on, arrived at the Northern region.

data.v: दिशागजस्तु तच्छ्रुत्वा प्रीत्याहांशुमतो वचः । आसमञ्जकृतार्थस्त्वं सहाश्वः शीघ्रमेष्यसि ॥
data.es: Having listened to the words of Anshuman the elephant of the quarter replied, 'O Anshuman, son of Asamanjasa having fulfilled your objective, you will go back soon with the horse'.
data.anv: दिशागजस्तु elephant of the quarter, अंशुमत: Anshman's, तत् वचः those words, श्रुत्वा having listened to, प्रत्याह replied, आसमञ्ज O Son of Asamanjasa, Anshuman, त्वं you,  कृतार्थ: having gained the object, सहाश्व: with horse, श्रीघ्रम् soon, एष्यसि will go (back).
data.md: Hearing this, the mighty-minded elephant of that quarter answered, 'O son of Asamañja, having attained your object, you will speedily return with the horse.'

data.v: तस्य तद्वचनं श्रुत्वा सर्वानेव दिशागजान् । यथाक्रमं यथान्यायं प्रष्टुं समुपचक्रमे ॥
data.es: Having listened to the words of the elephant, Anshuman started enquring the well being of each of the guardians (elephants) of the quarters successively with due respect:
data.anv: तस्य his (elephant's), तत् वचनम् those words, श्रुत्वा having listened to, सर्वानेव all of them,  दिशागजान् elephants of the quarters, यथाक्रमम् successively, यथान्यायम् with due respect, प्रष्टुम् to enquire, उपचक्रमे commenced.
data.md: And hearing those words of his, Ansumat by turns duly asked the same question of all the elephants belonging to the cardinal points.

data.v: तैश्च सर्वैर्दिशापालैर्वाक्यज्ञैर्वाक्यकोविदैः । पूजितः सहयश्चैव गन्तासीत्यभिचोदितः ॥
data.es: All those elephants of the quarters were knowers of the essence of words and proficient in the right use of words. Treating him kindly the elephants encouraged him saying, 'You will go back with the horse'.
data.anv: वाक्यज्ञै: knowers of essence of words, वाक्यकोविदै: proficient in the application of words, सर्वै: by all, तै: दिशापालै: by those mighty elephants, पूजित: honoured, सहय: with the horse, गन्तासि इति you will go back, अभिचोदित: was directed.
data.md: And being honoured by those guardians of the cardinal points, knowing words as well as their application in regard to time, place, and person, he was asked by them saying, 'Did you come with the horse?'

data.v: तेषां तद्वचनं श्रुत्वा जगाम लघुविक्रमः । भस्मराशीकृता यत्र पितरस्तस्य सागराः ॥
data.es: Hearing their words with a quick pace where he reached the place his uncles, sons of Sagara were reduced to heaps of ashes.
data.anv: तेषाम् their, तद्वचनम् those words, श्रुत्वा having heard, लघुविक्रम: with quick paces, तस्य his, पितर: younger brothers of his father, सागरा: sons of Sagara, यत्र where, भस्मराशीकृता: were reduced  into heaps of ashes, जगाम had gone.
data.md: Hearing those words of theirs, that one of fleet vigour repaired to the spot where the sons of Sagara, his uncles, had been reduced to a heap of ashes.

data.v: स दुःखवशमापन्नस्त्वसमञ्जसुतस्तदा । चुक्रोश परमार्तस्तु वधात्तेषां सुदुःखितः ॥
data.es: Then the son of Asamanjasa, overwhelmed with sorrow and deeply distressed at their destruction, bewailed with great grief.
data.anv: तदा then, स: he, असमञ्जसुत: son of Asamanjasa, दु:खवशम् possessed by grief, आपन्न: having reached, परमार्त: greatly distressed, तेषाम् their, वधात् by destruction, सुदु:खित: greatly grieved, चुक्रोश cried out.
data.md: And (arriving there), Asamañja's son, smitten with grief, and being exceedingly afflicted at their destruction, bewailed in heaviness of heart.

data.v: यज्ञियं च हयं तत्र चरन्तमविदूरतः । ददर्श पुरुषव्याघ्रो दुःखशोकसमन्वितः ॥
data.es: Possessed by grief and tears, Anshuman, that tiger among men, beheld the sacrificial horse grazing nearby.
data.anv: दु:खशोकसमन्वित: possessed by grief and sorrow, पुरुषव्याघ्र: that tiger like brave one among men, अविदूरत: nearby, चरन्तम् grazing, यज्ञीयम् sacrificial, हयम् horse, ददर्श beheld.
data.md: And exercised by grief and sorrow, at foremost of men espied there the sacrificial horse straying near.

data.v: ददर्श पुरुषव्याघ्रो कर्तुकामो जलक्रियाम् । सलिलार्थी महातेजा न चापश्यज्जलाशयम् ॥
data.es: With the intention of performing traditional funeral rites with water for the deceased princes, highly lustrous Anshuman looked around for water but could not see any reservoir of water (in the neighbourhood).
data.anv: महातेजा: highly lustrous, स: he, तेषाम् for those, राजपुत्राणाम् princes, जलक्रियाम् presenting  libations of waters (to the manes of the deceased), कर्तुकाम: with intention of doing, सलिलार्थी seeking water, जलाशयम् reservoir of water, न च अपश्यत् could not see.
data.md: And desirous of offering oblations of water to those princes, that highly powerful one, in need of water, did not find any watery expanse in the neighbourhood.

data.v: विसार्य निपुणां दृष्टिं ततोऽपश्यत्खगाधिपम् । पितॄणां मातुलं राम सुपर्णमनिलोपमम् ॥
data.es: O Rama with his keen eyes, he (Anshuman) marked Suparna, the maternal uncle of his uncles, lord of the eagles (Garuda) bestowed with the swiftness of the wind.
data.anv: राम O Rama, तत: afterwards, निपुणाम् intelligent, दृष्टिम् glances, विसार्य extending, पितृ़णाम्  uncles', मातुलम् maternal uncle, खगाधिपम् lord of the eagles, अनिलोपमम् resembling wind in swiftness, सुपर्णम् Garuda (brother of Suparna, the mother of princes), अपश्यत् beheld.
data.md: And it came to pass, O Rāma, that surveying wide, he descried the maternal uncle to the princes, Suparna, resembling the Wind.

data.v: स चैनमब्रवीद्वाक्यं वैनतेयो महाबलः । मा शुचः पुरुषव्याघ्र वधोऽयं लोकसंमतः ॥
data.es: Highly powerful Garuda, son of Vinata, addressing Anshuman said 'O Tiger among men do not grieve. This act of assasination is meant for the welfare of the three worlds'.
data.anv: महाबल: highly powerful, स: वैनतेय: Garuda, son of Vinata, (एनम् addressing him), वाक्यम् words, एवं thus, अब्रवीत् said, पुरुषव्याघ्र O Tiger among men, मा शुच: do not grieve, अयं वध: this act of assasination, लोकसम्मत: is aimed for the welfare of the three worlds.
data.md: And thereupon Vinata's son possessed of mighty strength spoke to him, saying, 'Do not lament, O foremost of men. The destruction of these was for the welfare of all.'

data.v: कपिलेनाप्रमेयेन दग्धा हीमे महाबलाः । सलिलं नार्हसि प्राज्ञ दातुमेषां हि लौकिकम् ॥
data.es: 'Your valiant uncles have been burnt by Kapila of boundless power. O Sagcious one performing traditional rites with ordinary water is not proper'.
data.anv: महाबला: highly valiant, इमे these, अप्रमेयेन by one who has boundless power, कपिलेन by Kapila, दग्धा: हि have been burnt indeed, प्राज्ञ O Sagacious one, लौकिकम् worldly (ordinary), सलिलम् water, दातुम् to offer, नार्हसि is not proper on your part.
data.md: These highly powerful ones had been consumed by the peerless Kapila, therefore, you ought not to offer water to them in consonance with social usage.

data.v: गङ्गा हिमवतो ज्येष्ठा दुहिता पुरुषर्षभ । भस्मराशीकृतानेतान्पावयेल्लोकपावनी ॥
तया क्लिन्नमिदं भस्म गङ्गया लोककान्तया । षष्टिं पुत्रसहस्राणि स्वर्गलोकं नयिष्यति ॥
data.es: Ganga, the purifier of the three worlds, will sanctify your uncles reduced to heaps of ashes. These heaps when inundated by waters of Ganga, beloved of the worlds, will take all the sixty thousand sons to heaven.
data.anv: लोकपावनी purifier of the three worlds, that Ganga, भस्मराशीकृतान् reduced to heaps of ash, एतान् these, प्लावयेत् will sanctify, लोककान्तया by the beloved one of the world, तया गङ्गया by that Ganga, क्लिन्नम् inundated, इदं भस्म these heaps of ash, षष्टिं पुत्रसहस्राणि sixty thousand sons, स्वर्गलोकम् heavens च नेष्यति will take also.
data.md: O mighty-armed one: let that purifier of the worlds lave these reduced to a heap of ashes. And on these ashes being watered by Gangā, dear to all, the sixty thousand sons of Sagara will repair to the celestial regions.

data.v: गच्छ चाश्वं महाभाग संगृह्य पुरुषर्षभ । यज्ञं पैतामहं वीर निर्वर्तयितुमर्हसि ॥
data.es: 'O Highly fortunate one O Best among men go back with that horse. O Hero It behoves of you to complete the sacrifice undertaken by your grandfather'.
data.anv: महाभाग O Highly fortunate one, पुरुषर्षभ O Best among men, तम् अश्वम् that horse, गृह्य taking, गच्छ go back, वीर O hero, पैतामहम् grand father's, यज्ञम् sacrifice, संवर्तयितुम् to  complete, अर्हसि it behoves of you.
data.md: Do you, O highly pious one, go back, taking this horse, O foremost of men; and do you complete the sacrifice of your grand-father,

data.v: सुपर्णवचनं श्रुत्वा सोंऽशुमानतिवीर्यवान् । त्वरितं हयमादाय पुनरायान्महायशाः ॥
data.es: Exceedingly powerful and highly renowned Anshuman, on hearing the words of Garuda returned quickly to the capital with the horse৷৷
data.anv: अतिवीर्यवान् exceedingly powerful, महायशा: highly renowned, अंशुमान् Anshuman, सुपर्णवचनम् words of Suparna, श्रुत्वा having heard, त्वरितम् quickly, हयम् horse, आदाय taking hold of, पुन: again, आयात् returned.
data.md: O hero, Hearing Suparna's speech, the exceedingly powerful Ansumat of mighty asceticism speedily taking the horse, retraced his steps.

data.v: ततो राजानमासाद्य दीक्षितं रघुनन्दन । न्यवेदयद्यथावृत्तं सुपर्णवचनं तथा ॥
