data.es: O Descendant of the Raghus (Rama), having reached the king who had been initiated into the ceremony, Anshuman communicated faithfully to him all that had happened. He also reported the words Suparna had said.
data.anv: रघुनन्दन O Rama, दीक्षितम् one who is initiated into ceremony, राजानम् king, आसाद्य having reached, यथावृत्तम् in conformity with what had happened, तथा faithfully, सुपर्णवचनम् words of Suparna, न्यवेदयत् communicated.
data.md: Then coming to the king who had been initiated into the ceremony, he, O descendant of Raghu, faithfully communicated to him the words of Suparna.

data.v: तच्छ्रुत्वा घोरसंकाशं वाक्यमंशुमतो नृपः । यज्ञं निर्वर्तयामास यथाकल्पं यथाविधि ॥
data.es: The king heard (was stunned to hear) the awful words of Anshuman, (yet) he performed the sacrifice in accordance with traditional scriptures and Kalpa, the Vedanga.
data.anv: नृप: king, अंशुमत: Anshuman's, घोरसङ्काशम् aweful, वाक्यम् words, श्रुत्वा having heard, यथाकल्पम् in accordance with rules of Kalpa, the vedanga, यथाविधि in accordance with the scriptures and tradition, यज्ञम् sacrifice ,निवर्तयामास performed.
data.md: Hearing this sorrowful intelligence, the king duly finished the sacrifice agreeably to the scriptures.

data.v: स्वपुरं चागमच्छ्रीमानिष्टयज्ञो महीपतिः । गङ्गायाश्चागमे राजा निश्चयं नाध्यगच्छत ॥
data.es: The great lord of the earth (king Sagara) after performing the sacrifice reached his capital. (But) He could not devise any means to bring Ganga down to the earth.
data.anv: श्रीमान् auspicious, महीपति: lord of earth, king Sagara, इष्टयज्ञ: had completed the performance of the sacrifice, स्वपुरम् to his own capital, आगमत् reached, राजा king, गङ्गाया: Ganga, आगमे in the matter of descent, निश्चयम् decision, नाध्यगच्छत did not arrive (at any).
data.md: And having seen the completion of the sacrifice, that lord of earth entered his capital; but the king could not see how to bring Gangā on earth.

data.v: अगत्वा निश्चयं राजा कालेन महता महान् । त्रिंशद्वर्षसहस्राणि राज्यं कृत्वा दिवं गतः ॥
data.es: The mighty king (Sagara), over a long period of time without being able to devise means (to bring Ganga down to the earth), ruled the kingdom for thirty thousand years and ascended to heaven". इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये बालकाण्डे एकचत्वारिंशस्सर्ग:॥Thus ends the fortyfirst sarga of Balakanda of the holy Ramayana the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.
data.anv: महान् mighty, राजा king, महता कालेन for a long time, निश्चयं अकृत्वा without arriving at any decision (in the matter of bringing Ganga down to earth), त्रिंशद्वर्षसहस्राणि thirty thousand years, राज्यम् kingdom, कृत्वा having ruled, दिवं गत: ascended heaven.
data.md: And without being able to ascertain it, the mighty monarch after a long course of time, and having reigned for thirty thousand years, ascended heaven.

data.v: कालधर्मं गते राम सगरे प्रकृतीजनाः । राजानं रोचयामासुरंशुमन्तं सुधार्मिकम् ॥
data.es: "O Rama when Sagara died, the subjects installed the highly virtuous Anshuman as king.
data.anv: राम O Rama, सगरे when king Sagara, कालधर्मम् duty of nature, death, गते obtained, प्रकृतीजना: ministers and subjects, सुधार्मिकम् highly virtuous, अंशुमन्तम् Anshuman, राजानम् as king, रोचयामासु: accepted.
data.md: When Sagara had bowed to the influence of Time, the subjects selected the righteous Ansumat for their king.

data.v: स राजा सुमहानासीदंशुमान्रघुनन्दन । तस्य पुत्रो महानासीद्दिलीप इति विश्रुतः ॥
data.es: O descendnt of the Raghus that Anshuman became a very great monarch. He had a great son, Dilipa who became famous.
data.anv: रघुनन्दन O Descendent of Raghu, Rama, स: अंशुमान् that Anshuman, सुमहान् very great, राजा आसीत् was a monarch, तस्य for him, दिलीप इति by name Dilipa, विश्रुत: celebrated, महान् great, पुत्र: आसीत् a son was born.
data.md: O descendant of Raghu, Ansumat proved a great ruler. And his son, the celebrated Dilīpa, was also a great king.

data.v: तस्मिन्राज्यं समावेश्य दिलीपे रघुनन्दन । हिमवच्छिखरे रम्ये तपस्तेपे सुदारुणम् ॥
data.es: O Delight of the Raghus having vested the kingdom with Dilipa, Anshuman performed rigid penance on the sacred peak of the Himavat mountain.
data.anv: रघुनन्दन O Rama, तस्मिन् दिलीपे in that Dilipa, राज्यम् kingdom, समावेश्य vesting, पुण्ये pious, हिमवच्छिखरे on the peak of Himavat mountain, सुदारुणम् rigid, तप: penance, तेपे he  performed.
data.md: O Raghu's son, consigning to Dilipa his kingdom, Ansumat entered upon rigid austerities on the romantic summit of the Himavat.

data.v: द्वात्रिंशच्च सहस्राणि वर्षाणि सुमहायशाः । तपोवनगतो राजा स्वर्गं लेभे तपोधनः ॥
data.es: O Rama highly renowned Anshuman, having lived for thirtytwo thousand years in the tapovana, turned an ascetic and attained heaven (without accomplishing his objective).

data.md: Having for the space of thirty-two you sand years carried on austerities in the woods, that highly famous one, crowned with the wealth of asceticism, attained the celestial regions.

data.es: When exceedingly brilliant Dilipa heard about the death of his grandfathers, he was overtaken by grief but could not arrive at any conclusion with his intellect (regarding means of bringing down the sacred river).

data.md: The exceedingly powerful Dilīpa, hearing of the destruction of his grand-fathers, was stricken with grief; yet he could not ascertain his grandfathers, was stricken with grief; yet he could not ascertain his course about it.

data.md: He constantly thought as to how Gangă could be brought down, how to perform their watery rites, and how to deliver them.

data.es: As Dilipa known for his knowledge of the soul constantly reflected righteously on (this matter of Ganga), a highly virtuous son named Bhagiratha was born to him.

data.md: As that pious one furnished with selfknowledge was always meditating upon this, an eminently virtuous son was born to him named Bhagiratha.

data.v: दिलीपस्तु महातेजा यज्ञैर्बहुभिरिष्टवान् । त्रिंशद्वर्षसहस्राणि राजा राज्यमकारयत् ॥
data.es: Most brilliant king Dilipa ruled the kingdom for thirty thousand years performing many sacrifices.

data.md: Performing numerous sacrifices, the mighty king Dilīpa reigned for thirty thousand years.

data.v: अगत्वा निश्चयं राजा तेषामुद्धरणं प्रति । व्याधिना नरशार्दूल कालधर्ममुपेयिवान् ॥
data.es: O Tiger among men king Dilipa was unable to arrive at a conclusion regarding the salvation of his ancestors.He was affected by illness and died.

data.md: And without having arrived at any definite decision in regard to their deliverance, the king, O puissant one, being attacked with an ailment, breathed his last.

data.v: इन्द्रलोकं गतो राजा स्वार्जितेनैव कर्मणा । राज्ये भगीरथं पुत्रमभिषिच्य नरर्षभः ॥
data.es: The king (Dilipa) performed the coronation of his son Bhagiratha and reached the region of Indra as a reward for virtuous acts done by him.
data.anv: नरर्षभ: the best among men, राजा king Dilipa, पुत्रम् son, भगीरथम् Bhagiratha, राज्ये in the kingdom, अभिषिच्य having conducted coronation, स्वार्जितेनैव with selfearned, कर्मणा एव  acts only, इन्द्रलोकम् towards the region of Indra, गत: had gone.
data.md: Having sprinkled his son Bhagiratha in the way of installing him in the kingdom, that prime of men, the king, by virtue of his own acts, repaired to the region of Indra.

data.v: भगीरथस्तु राजर्षिर्धार्मिको रघुनन्दन । अनपत्यो महातेजाः प्रजाकामः स चाप्रजः ॥
data.es: O delight of the Raghus righteous Bhagiratha who was highly lustrous rajarshi was without sons. He was desirous of progeny but did not beget children.
data.anv: रघुनन्दन O Rama, धार्मिक: righteous one, महातेजा: highly lustrous, राजर्षि: royal sage, भगीरथस्तु Bhagiratha, अनपत्य: without sons, स: he, प्रजाकाम: desirous of progeny, अप्रजा: did not beget children.

data.v: स तपो दीर्घमातिष्ठद्गोकर्णे रघुनन्दन । ऊर्ध्वबाहुः पञ्चतपा मासाहारो जितेन्द्रियः ॥
data.es: O son of the Raghus (Rama), Bhagiratha, with a determination to bring down Ganga entrusted the kingdom to his ministers and went to a sacred place known as Gokarna. There with arms uplifted surrounded by four fires, partaking food once a month, with his senses controlled, carried out panchatapa for a number of years.
data.anv: रघुनन्दन O Rama, स: he, गङ्गावतरणे for the descent of Ganga, रत: keenly desiring, तद्राज्यम् that kingdom, मन्त्रिषु in his ministers, आधाय after entrusting, ऊर्ध्वबाहु: with arms held upwards, पञ्चतपा: surrounded by four fires in the hot season and standing under the sun, the fifth fire, मासाहार: partaking food once a month, जितेन्द्रिय: with his senses controlled, गोकर्णे at the sacred spot, Gokarna, दीर्घम् for long years, तप: yogic penance, आतिष्ठत् practised.

data.v: तस्य वर्षसहस्राणि घोरे तपसि तिष्ठतः । सुप्रीतो भगवान्ब्रह्मा प्रजानां पतिरीश्वरः ॥
data.es: O mightyarmed, (Rama) Bhagiratha continued in that state for a thousand years amidst rigid austerities. Lord of all creatures, Brahma was highly pleased with that illustrious king.

data.v: ततः सुरगणैः सार्धमुपागम्य पितामहः । भगीरथं महात्मानं तप्यमानमथाब्रवीत् ॥

data.md: And thereat that possessor of the six attributes and lord of all creatures, Brahmā, was well pleased with that high-souled monarch. And presenting himself together with the celestials, the Grand-sire thus spoke to the high-souled Bhagiratha engaged in austerities.

data.v: भगीरथ महाभाग प्रीतस्तेऽहं जनेश्वर । तपसा च सुतप्तेन वरं वरय सुव्रत ॥
data.es: 'O distinguished one O mighty monarch O Bhagiratha of excellent vows I am pleased with your welldisciplined austerities. Ask for a boon'.

data.md: O Bhagiratha, O mighty monarch, pleased am I with you. O lord' of men, on account of your ardent austerities: do you, O you of excellent vows, ask for the boon you would have.

data.v: यदि मे भगवान्प्रीतो यद्यस्ति तपसः फलम् । सगरस्यात्मजाः सर्वे मत्तः सलिलमाप्नुयुः ॥
data.es: 'O Lord if you are pleased with my austerities and if they are worthy of a reward, grant me the boon whereby all the sons of Sagara will receive from me funeral rites with the waters (of Ganga)'.
data.anv: भगवन् O Adorable one, मे with me, प्रीत: यदि if you are pleased, तपस: of austerities, फलम् अस्ति यदि if worthy reward is possible, सगरस्य king Sagara's, आत्मजा: sons, सर्वे all, मत्त: from me, सलिलम् funeral rites with water, आप्नुयु: may receive.
data.md: If, adorable one, you are pleased with me, if you would grant me the fruit of my asceticism, may Sagara's sons receive water at my hands; and on the ashes of those high-souled ones being laved by the waters of Gangā, may my greatgrand-father without fail repair to heaven!

data.v: गङ्गायाः सलिलक्लिन्ने भस्मन्येषां महात्मनाम् । स्वर्गं गच्छेयुरत्यन्तं सर्वे मे प्रपितामहाः ॥
data.es: 'The ashes of these eminent uncles of my grandfather, immersed by the waters of Ganga may ultimately go to heaven'.
data.anv: एषाम् these, महात्मनाम् eminent ones, भस्मनि in ashes, गङ्गाया: Ganga's, सलिलक्लिन्ने immersed by the waters, मे my, सर्वे all, प्रपितामहा: uncles of my grand father, अत्यन्तम् ultimately, स्वर्गम् towards heaven, गच्छेयु: may go.
data.md: If, adorable one, you are pleased with me, if you would grant me the fruit of my asceticism, may Sagara's sons receive water at my hands; and on the ashes of those high-souled ones being laved by the waters of Gangā, may my greatgrand-father without fail repair to heaven!

data.v: देया च संततिर्देव नावसीदेत्कुलं च नः । इक्ष्वाकूणां कुले देव एष मेऽस्तु वरः परः ॥
data.es: 'O Lord let the progeny be perpuated in our race of the Ikshvakus. Let not that dynasty be terminated with me. This is another boon I seek'.
data.anv: देव O Divine lord, इक्ष्वाकूणाम् for Ikshvakus, कुले in the dynasty, सन्तति: progeny, देया should be bestowed, न: our, कुलम् race, नावसीदेत् let it not be terminated, एष: this, मे  my, पर: another, वर: अस्तु let it be a boon.
data.md: And, O divine one, I beseech you, may our line never languish for want of offspring. May, O God, this prime boon light upon Iksvāku's race!

data.v: उक्तवाक्यं तु राजानं सर्वलोकपितामहः । प्रत्युवाच शुभां वाणीं मधुरां मधुराक्षराम् ॥
data.es: To this the Grandsire of all the worlds replied with a sweet voice full of good wishes and sweet words.

data.md: When the king had said this, the Grand-sire addressed him these sweet and auspicious words composed of melting letters.

data.v: मनोरथो महानेष भगीरथ महारथ । एवं भवतु भद्रं ते इक्ष्वाकुकुलवर्धन ॥
data.es: 'O Great charioteer Bhagiratha, your desire is great. O Perpetuator of dynasty of the Ikshvakus, let your wish be fulfilled. Prosperity to you'.
data.anv: महारथ O Great charioteer, भगीरथ Bhagiratha, एष: this, मनोरथ desire, महान् great, इक्ष्वाकु कुलवर्धन perpetuator of dynasty of Ikshvaku, एवम् in this way, भवतु may happen, ते भद्रम् prosperity to you.
data.md: O mighty car-warrior Bhagiratha, high is this your aim. Be it so, good betide you, you enhancer of the Ikşvāku line.

data.v: इयं हैमवती गङ्गा ज्येष्ठा हिमवतः सुता । तां वै धारयितुं राजन्हरस्तत्र नियुज्यताम् ॥
data.es: 'This Hymavati (Ganga) is Himavat's eldest daughter and only lord Siva is capable to hold (the force of her descent to earth). Therefore let Siva be entreated'.
data.anv: हैमवती Haimavati, the daughter of Himavat, इयम् this, गङ्गा Ganga, हिमवत: Himavat's, ज्येष्ठा सुता eldest daughter, ताम् her, धारयितुम् to hold, शक्त: capable, हर: lord Shiva, तत्र there, नियुज्यताम् may be entreated.
data.md: This Haimavati Ganga, Himavat's elder daughter, even her to hold, Oking do you employ Hara.

data.v: गङ्गायाः पतनं राजन्पृथिवी न सहिष्यते । तां वै धारयितुं वीर नान्यं पश्यामि शूलिनः ॥
data.es: 'O King Ganga's descent cannot be sustained by earth. O Hero I do not see any other person to hold her than the wielder of the trident (Siva)'.
data.anv: राजन् O King, गङ्गाया: Ganga's, पतनम् descent, पृथिवी earth, न सहिष्यति cannot sustain, वीर O Hero, ताम् her, धारयितुम् to hold, शूलिन: other than Siva, the wielder of trident, अन्यम् any other person, न पश्यामि I do not see.
data.md: For Gangā's fall, O king, Earth will not be able to sustain. And to hold her, O king find I none save the wielder of the Trident.'

data.v: तमेवमुक्त्वा राजानं गङ्गां चाभाष्य लोककृत् । जगाम त्रिदिवं देवः सह सर्वैर्मरुद्गणैः ॥
data.es: The Creator of the worlds having thus addressed the king and conversing with Ganga went towards heaven along with devatas and maruts". इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये बालकाण्डे द्विचत्वारिंशस्सर्ग:॥Thus ends the fortysecond sarga of Balakanda of the holy Ramayana the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.
data.anv: लोककृत् (देवः) the creator of the worlds, तं राजानम् addressing that king, एवम् in this way, उक्त्वा having spoken, गङ्गां च Ganga also, आभाष्य after conversing, सह देवै: along with  devatas, मरुद्गणै: with groups of maruts, त्रिदिवम् towards heaven, जगाम had gone.
data.md: Having thus addressed the monarch, and greeted Gangā, the creator of the worlds repaired to heaven with the celestials.

data.v: देवदेवे गते तस्मिन्सोऽङ्गुष्ठाग्रनिपीडिताम् । कृत्वा वसुमतीं राम संवत्सरमुपासत ॥
data.es: "O Rama when that God of the gods (Brahma) departed, Bhagiratha, pressing the earth with the tip of his big toe (standing supported by the big toe) penanced (meditated upon Siva) for one year.
data.anv: राम O Rama, तस्मिन् देवदेवे when that god of gods, Brahma, गते had departed, स: he, वसुमतीम् earth, अङ्गुष्ठाग्रनिपीडिताम् pressing with the tip of his great toe, कृत्वा having made, संवत्सरम् for one year, उपासत meditated upon.
data.md: When that god of gods had gone away, Bhagiratha, O Rāma, pressing the earth with his thumb, spent a year in adoring Siva.

data.v: अथ संवत्सरे पूर्णे सर्वलोकनमस्कृतः । उमापतिः पशुपती राजानमिदमब्रवीत् ॥
data.es: After one full year was completed, Iswara who is worshipped by all in all the worlds said to king Bhagiratha:

data.v: प्रीतस्तेऽहं नरश्रेष्ठ करिष्यामि तव प्रियम् । शिरसा धारयिष्यामि शैलराजसुतामहम् ॥
data.es: "O Best of men I am pleased with your devotion. I will hold Ganga on my head, the daughter of the king of mountains (to reduce the force of her descent). I shall do your wish.
data.anv: नरश्रेष्ठ O Best among men, अहम् I, ते with you, प्रीत: pleased, तव to you, प्रियम् dear,  करिष्यामि I shall do, अहम् I, शैलराजसुताम् daughter of the king of mountains, शिरसा with my head, धारयिष्यामि will hold.
data.md: O foremost of men, I am well pleased with you: I will do what will before your welfare. I will hold the Mountain's daughter on my head.

data.v: ततो हैमवती ज्येष्ठा सर्वलोकनमस्कृता । तदा सातिमहद्रूपं कृत्वा वेगं च दुःसहम् । आकाशादपतद्राम शिवे शिवशिरस्युत ॥
data.es: Then Ganga, the eldest daughter of Himavat who is adored by all the worlds, assuming the form of a mighty river descended from the sky with unbearable speed on the auspicious head of Siva.
data.anv: राम O Rama, तत: thereafter, हैमवती daughter of Himvat, सर्वलोकनमस्कृता adored by all worlds, ज्येष्ठा  eldest (गङ्गा Ganga), तदा then, अति महत् mighty, रूपं form, दस्सहम् unbearable, वेगं speed, कृत्वा having assumed, आकाशात् from the sky, शिवे on the auspicious, शिवशिरसि on the head of Siva, अपतत् उत fell down.
data.md: Then, O Rāma. that one bowed to by all creatures, the elder daughter of Himavat, assuming an exceedingly mighty shape, with irresistible impetus precipitated herself from the welkin upon Siva's gracious head.

data.v: नैव सा निर्गमं लेभे जटामण्डलमोहिता । तत्रैवाबभ्रमद्देवी संवत्सरगणान्बहून् ॥
अनेन तोषितश्चासीदत्यर्थं रघुनन्दन । विससर्ज ततो गङ्गां हरो बिन्दुसरः प्रति ॥
data.es: O Son of the Raghus (Rama) Siva was immensely pleased with the penace and thereafter released Ganga (drop by drop) forming Bindusara.
data.anv: रघुनन्दन O Rama, अनेन by this penance, हर: Iswara, अत्यर्थम् immensely, तोषित: अभूत् was gratified, तत: afterwards, गङ्गाम् Ganga, बिन्दुसर: प्रति forming Bindusara, विससर्ज released (drop by drop).

data.v: गगनाच्छंकरशिरस्ततो धरणिमागता । व्यसर्पत जलं तत्र तीव्रशब्दपुरस्कृतम् ॥
data.es: From the sky on to the head of Shankara and thence Ganga resorted to the earth. There it flowed forward with a roaring sound.
data.anv: गगनात् from sky, शङ्करशिर: on the head of Shankara, तत: from there, धरणिम् earth, आश्रिता resorted, तत्र there, जलम् waters, तीव्रशब्दपुरस्कृतम् culminating in intense sounds, व्यसर्पत had flown.

data.v: ततो देवर्षिगन्धर्वा यक्षाः सिद्धगणास्तथा । व्यलोकयन्त ते तत्र गगनाद्गां गतां तदा ॥
data.es: Then devarshis, gandharvas, yakshas and hosts of siddhas looked on with astonishment at Ganga falling from the sky and descending on the earth.
data.anv: तत: then, देवर्षिगन्धर्वा: devarshis, gandharvas, यक्ष: yakshas, ते सिद्धगणा: those hosts of siddhas, तदा then, तथा in that way, गगनात् from the sky, गाम् the earth, गताम् reached, व्यलोकयन्त looked on with astonishment.
data.md: Then celestials and saints and Gandharvas and Yakşas and Siddhas mounted on excellent elephants and horses and cars resembling cities, looked on Gangă descending upon earth.

data.v: विमानैर्नगराकारैर्हयैर्गजवरैस्तथा । पारिप्लवगताश्चापि देवतास्तत्र विष्ठिताः ॥
data.es: Then, gods in a state of excitement in their aerial chariots as large as cities, on horses and on big elephants were stationed there (in the sky).
data.anv: तदा then, देवता: devatas, नगराकारै: as large as cities, विमानै: aerial chariots, पारिप्लवगतै: in restless movements, हयै: by horses, गजवरै: by excellent elephants, तत्र there, विष्ठिता: were stationed.

data.v: तदद्भुततमं लोके गङ्गापतनमुत्तमम् । दिदृक्षवो देवगणाः समेयुरमितौजसः ॥
data.es: Gods with great lustre arrived to witness the most wonderful, grand descent of Ganga.
data.anv: लोके In this world, अद्भुततमं most wonderful, उत्तमम् great, गङ्गापतनम् descent of Ganga, दिदृक्षव: desirous of witnessing, अमितौजस: beings with great lustre, देवगणा: hosts of devatas, समीयु: arrived.
data.md: And the celestials stationed on cars were struck with surprise; and all creatures marvelled at the excellent descent of Gangā.

data.v: संपतद्भिः सुरगणैस्तेषां चाभरणौजसा । शतादित्यमिवाभाति गगनं गततोयदम् ॥
data.es: The cloudless sky shone with the radiance of the ornaments of the gods alighting speedily to witness Ganga. It appeared as though the sky was filled with a hundred Suns.
data.anv: गततोयदम् devoid of clouds, गगनम् sky, सम्पतद्भि: by those arriving with speed, सुरगणै: by  multitudes of devatas, तेषाम् आभरणौजसा with the effulgence of their ornaments, शतादित्यमिव hundred suns, आभाति shines (at that moment).
data.md: And eager to witness the spectacle, celestial hosts of immeasurable energy thither and the effulgence of their ornaments, the firmament free from clouds, shone as if with an hundred suns.

data.v: शिंशुमारोरगगणैर्मीनैरपि च चञ्चलैः । विद्युद्भिरिव विक्षिप्तैराकाशमभवत्तदा ॥
data.es: The sky strewn with lightnings appeared as if it was inhabited by seaanimals, serpents and fishes fickle.
data.anv: तदा then, शिंशुमारोरगगणै: by multitudes of sea animals and serpents, चञ्चलै: which had fickle movements, मीनैरपि च with the fish also, आकाशम् the sky, विद्युद्भिः with flashes of lightening, विक्षिप्तमिव as if scattered, अभवत् became.

data.v: पाण्डुरैः सलिलोत्पीडैः कीर्यमाणैः सहस्रधा । शारदाभ्रैरिवाकीर्णं गगनं हंससंप्लवैः ॥
data.es: White foams of water were scattered in a thousand ways. It appeared as if the sky was spread over with autumnal clouds flocks of swans.
data.anv: सहस्रधा in thousand ways, कीर्यमाणै: scattered, पाण्डरै: by the white, सलिलोत्पीडै: foams of water, गगनम् sky, हंससम्प्लवै: with flocks of swans, शारदाभ्रै: by autumnal clouds, अकीर्णमिव  as if spread over.
data.md: And the sky was graced with fast-fleeting porpoises and serpents and fishes resembling playing lightning; and the welkin scattered with pale foam-flakes by thousands, appeared as if it was scattered with autumnal clouds swarming with cranes.

data.v: क्वचिद्द्रुततरं याति कुटिलं क्वचिदायतम् । विनतं क्वचिदुद्धूतं क्वचिद्याति शनैः शनैः ॥
data.es: Ganga was flowing now rapid, now slow, now wide, now meandering, now low, now high.
data.anv: क्वचित् at some places, द्रुततरम् very rapidly, याति it was flowing, क्वचित् at some other  places, कुटिलम् याति flowing in curved ways, क्वचित् at some other places, आयतम् it was wide, क्वचित् at some places, विनतम् inclined, क्वचित् at some places, उध्दूतम् was rising  high, क्वचित् at some places, शनै: शनै: very slowly, याति flowing.
data.md: And the river proceeded sometimes rapidly, and sometimes awry, and sometimes in volumes and sometimes sloping, and sometimes ascending and sometimes languidly; and sometimes water clashed with water.

data.v: सलिलेनैव सलिलं क्वचिदभ्याहतं पुनः । मुहुरूर्ध्वपथं गत्वा पपात वसुधां पुनः ॥
data.es: Sometimes waves dashed against waves. They rose repeatedly upwards and fell down on the ground.
data.anv: क्वचित् at some places, सलिलम् water, सलिलेनैव with waters alone, अभ्याहतम् was dashing  against, मुहु: repeatedly, ऊर्ध्वमुखम् upwards, गत्वा having gone, पुन: again, वसुधातलम् on the ground, पपात fell down.

data.v: तच्छंकरशिरोभ्रष्टं भ्रष्टं भूमितले पुनः । व्यरोचत तदा तोयं निर्मलं गतकल्मषम् ॥
data.es: The waters of Ganga descended on Shankara's head and from there to the earth. Freed from all impurities, the waters looked pure and clean.
data.anv: शङ्करशिरोभ्रष्टम् descended on the Shankara's head, पुन: again, भूमितले on the earth, भ्रष्टम्  fallen, गतकल्मषम् freed from impurities, निर्मलम् pure, तत् तोयम् those waters, तदा then, व्यरोचत looked splendid.
data.md: Sometimes ascending an upland, it descended it no a dell. And the pellucid and pure water first descending upon Śankara's head, and thence on to the earth, appeared exceedingly beautiful.

data.v: तत्रर्षिगणगन्धर्वा वसुधातलवासिनः । भवाङ्गपतितं तोयं पवित्रमिति पस्पृशुः ॥
data.es: Considering the waters fallen from the head of Siva sacred, devatas, rishis and gandharvas and those living on earth touched it (with reverence).
data.anv: तत्र there, देवर्षिगन्धर्वा: devatas, rishis and gandharvas, वसुधातलवसिन: those living on the earth, भवाङ्गपतितम् fallen from the body of Siva, तोयम् waters, पवित्रमिति sacred, पस्पृशु: touched.
data.md: And there the saints and the Gandharvas, as well as the inhabitants of the earth, touched the sacred water flowing from Bhava's body.

data.v: शापात्प्रपतिता ये च गगनाद्वसुधातलम् । कृत्वा तत्राभिषेकं ते बभूवुर्गतकल्मषाः ॥
data.es: Those cursed to fall from heaven to earth were absolved of their sins after bathing there (in the waters of Ganga).
data.anv: ये च those, शापात् due to the curse, गगनात् from the sky,  वसुधातलम् earth, प्रपतिता: had fallen, ते they, तत्र there, अभिषेकम् bath, कृत्वा having taken, गतकल्मषा: बभूवु: were absolved  of their sins.
data.md: And those that had fallen from the sky to the earth in consequence of some curse of other, having bathed there, and thereby having their sins washed an removed by that sanctifying water, again ascended the sky and entered the celestial regions.

data.v: धूपपापाः पुनस्तेन तोयेनाथ सुभास्वता । पुनराकाशमाविश्य स्वाँल्लोकान्प्रतिपेदिरे ॥
data.es: Cleansed of their sins by the sparkling waters, they ascended through the sky once again to their own (celestial) worlds.
data.anv: तेन by that, सुभास्वता excellently shining, तोयेन waters, धूतपापा: cleansed of their sins, पुन: again, आकाशम् sky, आविश्य having entered, अथ thereafter, पुन: again, स्वान् their own, लोकान् celestial worlds, प्रतिपेदिरे attained.
data.md: And those that had fallen from the sky to the earth in consequence of some curse of other, having bathed there, and thereby having their sins washed an removed by that sanctifying water, again ascended the sky and entered the celestial regions.

data.v: मुमुदे मुदितो लोकस्तेन तोयेन भास्वता । कृताभिषेको गङ्गायां बभूव विगतक्लमः ॥
data.es: People rejoiced at the sight of those shining waters. They were happy to have a dip in Ganga and their fatigue was gone.
data.anv: लोक: people, भास्वता by the shining, तेन that, तोयेन by waters, मुमुदे rejoiced, मुदित: pleased, गङ्गायाम् in that Ganga, कृताभिषेक: having performed bath, विगतक्लम: बभूव were  removed of fatigue.
data.md: And through the agency of that shining water, all beings, feeling delight, rejoiced, and having bathed in Gangā, became cleansed from sin.

data.v: भगीरथोऽपि राजर्षिर्दिव्यं स्यन्दनमास्थितः । प्रायादग्रे महातेजास्तं गङ्गा पृष्ठतोऽन्वगात् ॥
data.es: The seventh stream among them followed Bhagiratha. The most brilliant rajarshi Bhagiratha also mounting on divine chariot raced forward and Ganga followed him.
data.anv: अथः downwards, तासाम् among them, सप्तमी seventh, भगीरथम् Bhagiratha, नृपम् king, अन्वगात् followed, महातेजाः most brilliant, राजर्षि: royal sage, भगीरथोऽपि Bhagiratha also,  दिव्यम् divine, स्यन्दनम् chariot, आस्थित: mounting, अग्रे प्रायात् marched forward, गङ्गा च Ganga, अनुव्रजत् followed.
data.md: And stationed on an excellent car that mighty king, the royal saint Bhagiratha, went first, and Gangā went at his back.

data.v: देवाः सर्षिगणाः सर्वे दैत्यदानवराक्षसाः । गन्धर्वयक्षप्रवराः सकिंनरमहोरगाः ॥
data.es: No gods nor sages nor asuras in rakshasas nor kinnaras nor mighty serpents nor gandharvas nor the best of yakshas (will be able to know)
data.anv: देवा: devatas, न(वेत्स्यन्ति) will not be able to know how to use weapons, ऋषय: rishis, केचित् न none knows, असुरा: nor asuras, राक्षसा: न nor rakshasas, सकिन्नरमहोरगा: along with kinnaras or mighty serpants, गन्धर्वयक्षप्रवरा: nor gandharvas nor best of yakshas.
data.md: The gods, and the saints, and the Daityas, and the Dānavas, and the Rākşasas, and the foremost of Gandharvas and Yaksas, and the Kinnaras, and the mighty Uragas, and the Serpents, and the Apsaras, O Rāma, and the acquatic animals in a body following Bhagirahta's car, with glad hearts went in the wake of Gangā.

data.v: सर्वाश्चाप्सरसो राम भगीरथरथानुगाः । गङ्गामन्वगमन्प्रीताः सर्वे जलचराश्च ये ॥
data.es: O Rama besides acquatic beings, rishis, devatas, daityas, danavas, rakshasas along with kinnaras, serpents, foremost of gandharvas, yakshas and apsaras all followed the chariot of Bhagiratha. They were happy to follow Ganga.
data.anv: राम O Rama, सर्षिगणा: with hosts of Saints, देवा: devatas, सर्वे all, दैत्यदानवराक्षसा: daityas, danavas, rakshasas, सकिन्नरमहोरगा: with kinnaras, serpents, गन्धर्वयक्षप्रवरा: foremost of gandharvas, yakshas, सर्वा: all, अप्सरस: apsaras, भगीरथरथानुगाम् following the chariot of Bhagiratha, गङ्गाम् Ganga, अन्वगमन् followed, ये जलचराश्च those acquatic creatures, सर्वे all (followed ).
data.md: The gods, and the saints, and the Daityas, and the Dānavas, and the Rākşasas, and the foremost of Gandharvas and Yaksas, and the Kinnaras, and the mighty Uragas, and the Serpents, and the Apsaras, O Rāma, and the acquatic animals in a body following Bhagirahta's car, with glad hearts went in the wake of Gangā.

data.v: यतो भगीरथो राजा ततो गङ्गा यशस्विनी । जगाम सरितां श्रेष्ठा सर्वपापविनाशिनी ॥
data.es: Ganga, famous and foremost of rivers, destroyer of all sins, flowed in the direction king Bhagiratha moved.
data.anv: राजा king, भगीरथ: Bhagiratha, यत: wherever, यशस्विनी renowned, सरितां श्रेष्ठा foremost of rivers, सर्वपापप्रणाशिनी destroyer of all sins, गङ्गा Ganga, तत: in the same direction, जगाम  flowed.
data.md: Whither soever king Bhagiratha went, the famous Gangā, foremost of streams, capable of destroying all sins, went.

data.v: स गत्वा सागरं राजा गङ्गयानुगतस्तदा । प्रविवेश तलं भूमेर्यत्र ते भस्मसात्कृताः ॥
data.es: Thereupon that king followed by Ganga reached the ocean and entered the lower regions of the earth where the sons of Sagara were found reduced to ashes.
data.anv: स: राजा that king, तदा then, गङ्गया by Ganga, अनुगत: followed by, सागरम् ocean, गत्वा having gone, यत्र where, ते they (sons of Sagara), भस्मसात् into ashes, कृता: had been made, भूमे: earth's, तलम् lower regions, प्रविवेश entered.
data.md: Then having arrived at the Ocean, the king wending in Ganga's wake, entered underneath the Earth, at that spot where those (sons of Sagara) had been reduced to ashes. And, O Rāma, on the ashes being washed by the waters of Gangā, Brahmā, the lord of all creatures thus spoke to the monarch.

data.v: भस्मन्यथाप्लुते राम गङ्गायाः सलिलेन वै । सर्व लोकप्रभुर्ब्रह्मा राजानमिदमब्रवीत् ॥
data.es: After the ashes were inundated by the waters of Ganga, Brahma, lord of the world, appeared before king Bhagiratha and said:
data.anv: अथ then, भस्मनि when the ashes, गङ्गाया: Ganga's, सलिलेन with waters, आप्लुते were  inundated, सर्वलोकप्रभु: lord of the world, ब्रह्मा Brahma, राजानम् addressing the king, इदम् अब्रवीत् spoke these words.
data.md: Then having arrived at the Ocean, the king wending in Ganga's wake, entered underneath the Earth, at that spot where those (sons of Sagara) had been reduced to ashes. And, O Rāma, on the ashes being washed by the waters of Gangā, Brahmā, the lord of all creatures thus spoke to the monarch.

data.v: तारिता नरशार्दूल दिवं याताश्च देववत् । षष्टिः पुत्रसहस्राणि सगरस्य महात्मनः ॥
data.es: "O Tiger among men sixty thousand sons of illustrious Sagara having been liberated, had gone towards heaven like devatas.
data.anv: नरशार्दूल O Best among men, महात्मन: of the illustrious, सगरस्य Sagara's, षष्टि: sixty पुत्रसहस्राणि thousand sons, तारिता: were liberated, देववत् like devatas, दिवम् towards heaven, याता: had gone.
data.md: O most puissant of men, the sixty thousand sons of the high-souled Sagara have been delivered and they have ascended heaven like to celestials themselves.

data.v: सागरस्य जलं लोके यावत्स्थास्यति पार्थिव । सगरस्यात्मजास्तावत्स्वर्गे स्थास्यन्ति देववत् ॥
data.es: O King as long as the waters in the ocean exist in this world, shall the sons of Sagara, live in heavens like gods.
data.anv: पार्थिव O King, सागरस्य ocean's, जलम् waters, लोके in this world, यावत् as long as, स्थास्यति remain, तावत् till such time, सगरस्य आत्मजा: sons of Sagara, देववत् like devatas, स्वर्गे in heavens, स्थास्यन्ति will stay.
data.md: O lord of earth, as long as the waters of the ocean shall endure in the world. Sagara's sons shall reside in heaven like to celestials.

data.v: इयं च दुहिता ज्येष्ठा तव गङ्गा भविष्यति । त्वत्कृतेन च नाम्ना वै लोके स्थास्यति विश्रुता ॥
data.es: This Ganga will become your eldest daughter and from now on she will be wellknown in this world (as Bhagirathi) after your name.
data.anv: इयम् this, गङ्गा Ganga, तव your, ज्येष्ठा eldest, दुहिता daughter, भविष्यति will become, अथ from now onwards, त्वत्कृतेन formed out of your, नाम्ना name, लोके in this world, विश्रुता wellknown, स्थास्यति will stay on.
data.md: This Gangā shall become your eldest daughter; and she shall attain celebrity among all, being called after your name.

data.v: गङ्गा त्रिपथगा नाम दिव्या भागीरथीति च । त्रिपथो भावयन्तीति ततस्त्रिपथगा स्मृता ॥
data.es: O King divine Ganga will be called Tripathaga as well as Bhagirathi. Since she flows in the three worlds (heaven, earth and the lower world: Patala), she will be known as Tripathaga.
data.anv: राजन् O King, दिव्या divine, गङ्गा Ganga, त्रिपथगा known as Tripathaga, भागीरथीति च also as Bhagirathi, त्रीन् in three, पथ: paths, भावयन्ती इति since she covers by flowing and  purifying, तत: therefore, त्रिपथगा Tripathaga, स्मृता has been known as.
data.md: And Gangā is called both Tripathagã and Bhăgirathi. And she is know as Tripathagā, is consequence of her proceeding in three directions.

data.v: पितामहानां सर्वेषां त्वमत्र मनुजाधिप । कुरुष्व सलिलं राजन्प्रतिज्ञामपवर्जय ॥
data.es: O Lord of men O King you may offer the waters of Ganga here to all your ancestors and thereby fulfil your vow.
data.anv: मनुजाधिप O Lord of men, राजन् O King, त्वम् you, अत्र here, सर्वेषाम् for all, पितामहानाम्  ancestors, सलिलं offerings with waters, कुरुष्व perform, प्रतिज्ञाम् your vow, अपवर्जय fulfil.
data.md: Do you now, O lord of men, her offer oblations of water to your grand-sires, and thereby, O king, make good your promise.

data.v: पूर्वकेण हि ते राजंस्तेनातियशसा तदा । धर्मिणां प्रवरेणाथ नैष प्राप्तो मनोरथः ॥
data.es: O King by the highly renowned ancestors of yours, the foremost among righteous ones (even Sagara) this desire has not been fulfilled.
data.anv: राजन् O King, ते your, पूर्वकेण ancestor, अतियशसा by the highly renowned, धर्मिणाम् among righteous ones, प्रवरेणा foremost, तेनापि even by him, तदा then, एष: this, मनोरथ: desire, न प्राप्त: was not obtained.
data.md: O king, that foremost of righteous ones, your ancestor of exceeding renown, had failed to attain his desire.

data.v: तथैवांशुमता तात लोकेऽप्रतिमतेजसा । गङ्गां प्रार्थयता नेतुं प्रतिज्ञा नापवर्जिता ॥
data.es: O Child similarly though Anshuman possessed unparalleled prowess in this world his prayer to Ganga, his vow could not be fulfilled.
data.anv: तात O Child, तथैव similarly, लोके in this world, अप्रतिमतेजसा by the one possessing unparalleled prowess, गङ्गाम् Ganga, आनेतुम् for bringing, प्रार्थयता cherished, अंशुमता by Anshuman's, प्रतिज्ञा vow, नापवर्जिता could not be completed.
data.md: O child Ansumat likewise unparalleled in the worlds in energy, had failed in realising his cherished promise of bringing down Gangā.

data.v: राजर्षिणा गुणवता महर्षिसमतेजसा । मत्तुल्यतपसा चैव क्षत्रधर्मस्थितेन च ॥
data.es: O Sinless one (Bhagiratha) O Distinguished one on the part of Dilipa brilliant your father who had the virtuous of a rajarshi, who was equal to a maharshi in splendour, and to me in austerities and abiding to the duties of a kshatriya it was even not possible to bring Ganga through prayer.
data.anv: अनघ O Sinless one, महाभाग O Blessed one, राजार्षिणा by the royal saint, गुणवता virtuous, महर्षिसमतेजसा possessing the splendour of a maharshi, मत्तुल्यतपसा equal to me in austerities, क्षत्रधर्मस्थितेन abiding in the duties of a Kshatriya, अतितेजसा by the highly lustrous, गङ्गाम् Ganga, प्रार्थयता beseeching, तव your, पित्रा by father, दिलीपेन by Dilipa, महाभाग O Distinguished one, आनेतुं पुन: for bringing, न शङ्किता it was not made possible.
data.md: O child Ansumat likewise unparalleled in the worlds in energy, had failed in realising his cherished promise of bringing down Gangā.

data.v: दिलीपेन महाभाग तव पित्रातितेजसा । पुनर्न शङ्किता नेतुं गङ्गां प्रार्थयतानघ ॥
data.es: O Sinless one (Bhagiratha) O Distinguished one on the part of Dilipa brilliant your father who had the virtuous of a rajarshi, who was equal to a maharshi in splendour, and to me in austerities and abiding to the duties of a kshatriya it was even not possible to bring Ganga through prayer.
data.anv: अनघ O Sinless one, महाभाग O Blessed one, राजार्षिणा by the royal saint, गुणवता virtuous, महर्षिसमतेजसा possessing the splendour of a maharshi, मत्तुल्यतपसा equal to me in austerities, क्षत्रधर्मस्थितेन abiding in the duties of a Kshatriya, अतितेजसा by the highly lustrous, गङ्गाम् Ganga, प्रार्थयता beseeching, तव your, पित्रा by father, दिलीपेन by Dilipa, महाभाग O Distinguished one, आनेतुं पुन: for bringing, न शङ्किता it was not made possible.
data.md: Then again that royal saint, crowned with qualities; of austerities like to mine, ever abiding by his Ksatriya duties, even Dilipa's self, your exceedingly puissant sire.

data.v: सा त्वया समतिक्रान्ता प्रतिज्ञा पुरुषर्षभ । प्राप्तोऽसि परमं लोके यशः परमसंमतम् ॥
data.es: O Best among men you have fulfilled that vow. You have achieved supreme renown and reverence in this world.
data.anv: पुरुषर्षभ O Best among men, सा प्रतिज्ञा that vow, त्वया by you, समनुक्रान्ता has been kept up, लोके in this world, परमसम्मतम् highly acceptable, परमम् supreme, यश: fame, प्राप्त: असि  you have obtained.
data.md: O eminently righteous one, had failed in bringing down Gangā according to his cherished resolve, O sinless one. And now, O foremost of men, that promise having been fulfilled by you, you shall attain signal glory in the world by the common consent of all.

data.v: यच्च गङ्गावतरणं त्वया कृतमरिंदम । अनेन च भवान्प्राप्तो धर्मस्यायतनं महत् ॥
data.es: O Destroyer of enemies by bringing about the descent of Ganga, you have secured a great abode in dharma.
data.anv: अरिन्दम O Destroyer of  enemies, त्वया by you, यत् since, गङ्गावतरणम् descent of Ganga, कृतम् has been materialised, अनेन by this, भवान् you, धर्मस्य of dharma, महत् great, आयतनम् sacred place, प्राप्त: have obtained.
data.md: And, O vanquisher of your foes, having brought about Ganga's dissension, you shall from this act of your also attain the regions of Brahma.

data.v: प्लावयस्व त्वमात्मानं नरोत्तम सदोचिते । सलिले पुरुषव्याघ्र शुचिः पुण्यफलो भव ॥
data.es: O Best among men O Tiger among men take a dip in the eternally sacred waters, purify yourself and acquire holiness.
data.anv: नरोत्तम O Best among men, पुरुषव्याघ्र O Tiger among men, उचिते in a befitting, सलिले waters, सदा always, त्वम् you, आत्मानम् yourself, प्लावयस्व take bath by dipping and floating later, शुचि: purifying yourself, पुण्यफल: भव acquire holiness.
data.md: Do you, O best of me, lave thyself in these waters worthy of the pious, O prime of men, and thereby become purified, and attain sanctity.

data.v: पितामहानां सर्वेषां कुरुष्व सलिलक्रियाम् । स्वस्ति तेऽस्तु गमिष्यामि स्वं लोकं गम्यतां नृप ॥
data.es: O King perform the rites of all your forefathers with the waters (of Ganga), farewell. I shall return to my world (now). Go back, O King" (said Grandsire)
data.anv: सर्वेषां for all, पितामहानाम् forefathers, सलिलक्रियाम् rites with waters, कुरुष्व perform, ते to you, स्वस्ति safety, गमिष्यामि I shall go, नृप O King, स्वं लोकम् towards your region, गम्यताम् you shall go.
data.md: Do you perform the watery rites of your grand-sires. May luck be your, I shall now repair to my own regions: do you depart, O king.

data.v: इत्येवमुक्त्वा देवेशः सर्वलोकपितामहः । यथागतं तथागच्छद्देवलोकं महायशाः ॥
data.anv: सर्वलोकपितामह: Grandsire of all the worlds, महायशा: highly renowned, देवेश: lord of the gods, इत्येवम् in this manner, उक्त्वा having spoken, यथाऽऽगतं तथा the way he came, देवलोकम् to heaven, अगच्छत् returned.
data.md: Having said this, the illustrious lord of the celestials the Grand-sire of all creatures, went to the celestial regions.

data.v: भगीरथोऽपि राजर्षिः कृत्वा सलिलमुत्तमम् । यथाक्रमं यथान्यायं सागराणां महायशाः । कृतोदकः शुची राजा स्वपुरं प्रविवेश ह ॥
data.es: The illustrious rajarshi Bhagiratha, performed the rites of offering the sacred water of Ganga, in accordance with proper order and tradition for the sons of Sagara. Purified with the ablutions entered his own city." O Best of the Raghus his desire thus fulfilled he continued to rule the kingdom thereafter".
data.anv: राजर्षि: royal saint, महायशा: highly famous, राजा king, भगीरथोऽपि Bhagiratha also, यथाक्रमम् following proper order, यथान्यायम् following the tradition, सागराणाम् for the sons of Sagara, उत्तमम् highest, सलिलम् rites with sacred water, कृत्वा having performed, कृतोदक: having performed ablutions, शुचि: a purified man, स्वपुरम् his own city, प्रविवेश ह entered, रघुश्रेष्ठ O Rama, समृद्धार्थ: having fulfilled his desire, स्वराज्यम् his kingdom, प्रशशास ह ruled.
data.md: The royal saint king Bhagiratha also of high fame having performed his ablutions and purified himself, and duly and in proper order offered oblations of water to the sons of Sagara, entered his capital. And attaining exceeding prosperity, that foremost of men ruled his kingdom.

data.v: समृद्धार्थो नरश्रेष्ठ स्वराज्यं प्रशशास ह । प्रमुमोद च लोकस्तं नृपमासाद्य राघव । नष्टशोकः समृद्धार्थो बभूव विगतज्वरः ॥
data.es: "O Best of the Raghus the world rejoiced having Bhagiratha as king. With his purpose achieved, he was freed from all mental afflictions and sorrows and thereafter lived happily.
data.anv: राघव O Rama, तम् him, नृपम् as king, आसाद्य having obtained, लोक: the world, प्रमुमोद rejoiced, समृद्धार्थ: having achieved his desire, विगतज्वर: freed from mental afflictions, नष्टशोक: with his sorrows mitigated, बभूव became.

data.v: एष ते राम गङ्गाया विस्तरोऽभिहितो मया । स्वस्ति प्राप्नुहि भद्रं ते संध्याकालोऽतिवर्तते ॥
data.es: "O Rama this story of Ganga and that of the birth of Kumara, who was fortunate and auspicious, has been related to you in detail.
data.anv: राम O Rama, गङ्गाया: Ganga's, एष: this, विस्तर: detailed story, मया by me, ते to you, अभिहित: has been mentioned, स्वस्ति wellbeing to you, प्राप्नुहि you may receive, ते to you, भद्रम् prosperity, संध्याकाल: evening time (proper for doing ablutions ), अतिवर्तते is passing by.
data.md: Thus, O Rama, have I defailed to you the history of Gangā. Auspiciousness may you obtain! Good betide you, the evening draw nigh.

data.v: धन्यं यशस्यमायुष्यं स्वर्ग्यं पुत्र्यमथापि च । इदमाख्यानमाख्यातं गङ्गावतरणं मया ॥
विश्वामित्रवचः श्रुत्वा राघवः सहलक्ष्मणः । विस्मयं परमं गत्वा विश्वामित्रमथाब्रवीत् ॥
data.es: On hearing the words of Viswamitra, Rama along with Lakshmana, filled with astonishment said to him:
data.anv: सहलक्ष्मण: together with Lakshmana, राघव: Rama, विश्वामित्रवच: words of Visvamitra, श्रुत्वा having listened, परमम् great, विस्मयम् astonishment, गत्वा having obtained, अथ thereafter, विश्वामित्रम् addressing Visvamitra, अब्रवीत् spoke.
data.md: Hearing the words of Viśvāmitra, Rāghava, together with Laksmana, was struck with amazement, and spoke to Viśvāmitra, saying,

data.v: अत्यद्भुतमिदं ब्रह्मन्कथितं परमं त्वया । गङ्गावतरणं पुण्यं सागरस्य च पूरणम् ॥
data.es: "O Knower of the Brahman this story narrated by you relating to the descent of the sacred Ganga and the fullness of the ocean (due to Ganga's fall) is very wonderful".
data.anv: ब्रह्मन् O Knower of Brahma, त्वया by you, कथितम् is narrated, परमम् great, इदम् this, गङ्गावतरणम् descent of Ganga, पुण्यम् sacred, सागरस्य ocean's, पूरणम् replenishment, अत्यद्भुतम् exceedingly wonderful.
data.md: O Brāhmaṇa, wonderful is the story that you have recited to us, viz; that of Ganga's sacred dissension and the replenishing of the Ocean.

data.v: तस्य सा शर्वरी सर्वा सह सौमित्रिणा तदा । जगाम चिन्तयानस्य विश्वामित्रकथां शुभाम् ॥
data.es: Then Rama along with Lakshmana spent the whole night reflecting on the auspicious story narrated by Viswamitra.
data.anv: तदा then, तस्य Rama, सौमित्रिणा सह together with Lakshmana, शुभाम् holy, विश्वामित्रकथाम् the story narrated by Visvamitra, चिन्तयानस्य while thinking, सा that, सर्वा completely, शर्वरी night, जगाम passed away.
data.md: And the live-long night has passed away as I in company with Sumitrā's son, was pondering over Viśvāmitra's auspicious speech.'

data.v: ततः प्रभाते विमले विश्वामित्रं महामुनिम् । उवाच राघवो वाक्यं कृताह्निकमरिंदमः ॥
data.es: Thereafter, the progeny of the Raghus, the destroyer of enemies (Rama) addressed Viswamitra in the clear early morning after Viswamitra had completed his routine rites:
data.anv: तत: afterwards, अरिन्दम: the destroyer of enemies, राघव: Rama, विमले clear, प्रभाते early morning, कृताह्निकम् after completing daily religious and spiritual rites, महामुनिम् great ascetic, विश्वामित्रम् addressing Visvamitra, वाक्यम् words, उवाच said.
data.md: Then in the morning which happened to be bright, that subduer of his foes, Raghu's descendant, addressed the ascetic Viśvāmitra, who had finished his devotion.

data.v: गता भगवती रात्रिः श्रोतव्यं परमं श्रुतम् । क्षणभूतेव सा रात्रिः संवृत्तेयं महातपः । इमां चिन्तयतः सर्वां निखिलेन कथां तव ॥
data.es: "O Noble ascetic we have heard this great story worthy to be listened. As we both lay pondering over the entire story (narrated by you), the glorious night passed off just like a moment.
data.anv: महातप: O Great performer of austerities, परमम् supreme, श्रोतव्यम् fit to be listened, श्रुतम् has been heard, भगवती glorious, रात्रि: night, गता has passed, तव your, इमाम् this, सर्वाम् complete, कथाम् story, चिन्तयत: pondering over, नौ for both of us, इयम् this, रात्रि: night, क्षणभूतेव like a moment, सम्वृत्ता has turned out to be.
data.md: And, O afflicter of foes, as we had been reflecting upon all this at length, the night has passed away as if it were as moment.

data.v: तराम सरितां श्रेष्ठां पुण्यां त्रिपथगां नदीम् । नौरेषा हि सुखास्तीर्णा ऋषीणां पुण्यकर्मणाम् । भगवन्तमिह प्राप्तं ज्ञात्वा त्वरितमागता ॥
data.es: We will cross over Ganga, the best of rivers, the sacred river that flows in three directions.This boat of pious saints which is well laidout has come here swiftly, having come to know that you, O Venerable one have arrived".
data.anv: सरिताम् among rivers, श्रेष्ठाम् excellent, पुण्याम् holy, त्रिपथगाम् flowing in three directions, नदीम् river Ganga, तराम let us cross over, सुखास्तीर्णा spread comfortably, पुण्यकर्मणाम् of men of pious acts, ऋषीणाम् saints, एषा this, नौ: boat, भगवन्तम् you venerable, इह here, प्राप्तम् had arrived, ज्ञत्वा knowing, त्वरितम् speedily, आगता हि has come.
data.md: And learning that you have arrived at this place, the pious ascetics have speedily come hither, and have also brought this barque with a spacious carpet.

data.v: तस्य तद्वचनं श्रुत्वा राघवस्य महात्मनः । संतारं कारयामास सर्षिसंघः सराघवः ॥
data.es: Such a majestic, righteous, and magnaninous king had no son to perpetuate the race even though he performed austerities for one.
data.anv: एवंप्रभावस्य of such majestic one,  धर्मज्ञस्य of the knower of righteousness, महात्मन: of the greatful soul,  सुतार्थम् for begetting sons, तप्यमानस्य performing rigourous austerities, तस्य for king Dasaratha, वंशकर: perpetuating the race,  सुत: son, नासीत् did not beget.

data.v: उत्तरं तीरमासाद्य संपूज्यर्षिगणं तथ । गङ्गाकूले निविष्टास्ते विशालां ददृशुः पुरीम् ॥
data.es: Having reached the northern bank, they paid homage to the sages encamped on the bank of Ganga and beheld the city of Vishala.
data.anv: उत्तरं तीरम् northern bank, आसाद्य having reached, तदा then, ऋषिगणम् groups of sages, सम्पूज्य having paid homage, गङ्गाकूले on the bank of river Ganga, निविष्टा: encamped, ते they, विशालां पुरीम् city of Vishala, ददृशु: beheld.
data.md: Hearing those words of the high-souled Rāghava, Kausika crossed over the crowds of ascetics; and on reaching the north bank, he paid homage to the saints. And when they had landed on the banks of the Gangā, they beheld a city named Viśālā.

data.v: ततो मुनिवरस्तूर्णं जगाम सहराघवः । विशालां नगरीं रम्यां दिव्यां स्वर्गोपमां तदा ॥
data.es: Thereupon Viswamitra, the best of ascetics, accompanied by Rama and Lakshmana soon proceeded towards the enchanting and splendid city of Vishala comparable to heaven.
data.anv: तत: subsequently, मुनिवर: best among ascetics, Visvamitra, सह राघव: together with Rama and Lakshmana, तदा then, रम्याम् enchanting, दिव्याम् splendid, स्वर्गोपमाम् like unto heaven, विशालाम् towards Vishala, नगरीम् city, तूर्णम् speedily, जगाम went.
data.md: And thereupon speedily that that foremost of ascetics in company with Rāghava, went towards Viśālā, beautiful and elegant like to the celestial regions.

data.v: अथ रामो महाप्राज्ञो विश्वामित्रं महामुनिम् । पप्रच्छ प्राञ्जलिर्भूत्वा विशालामुत्तमां पुरीम् ॥
data.es: Thereafter highly lustrous Rama, the best among men, filled with curiosity enquired of the great sage Viswamitra:
data.anv: अथ thereafter, महातेजा: highly lustrous, नरशार्दूल: best among men, राम: Rama, कौतूहलसमन्वित: filled with curiosity, महामुनिम् great sage, विश्वामित्रम् Viswamitra, पप्रच्छ enquired.
data.md: Then the highly wise Rāma, with folded hands, asked that mighty ascetic Viśvāmitra concerning the excellent city of Viśālā.

data.v: कतरो राजवंशोऽयं विशालायां महामुने । श्रोतुमिच्छामि भद्रं ते परं कौतूहलं हि मे ॥
data.es: "O Distinguished ascetic, which royal dynasty is ruling this city of Vishala? Could you tell me? Great is my curiosity. May you prosper"
data.anv: महामुने O Distinguished ascetic, विशालायाम् in this city of Vishala, अयम् this, राजवंश: royal lineage, कतर: whose, श्रोतुम् to listen, इच्छामि I am desirous, ते भद्रम् may you prosper, मे to me, परम् great, कौतूहलं हि is my curiosity.
data.md: O mighty ascetic, what royal line reside in yonder large city? I desire to hear this, good betide you; and great is my curiosity.

data.v: तस्य तद्वचनं श्रुत्वा रामस्य मुनिपुंगवः । आख्यातुं तत्समारेभे विशालस्य पुरातनम् ॥
data.es: Viswamitra, preeminent among ascetics, hearing the words of Rama commenced to relate the history of the ancient city of Vishala.
data.anv: मुनिपुङ्गव: preeminent among ascetics, तस्य रामस्य Rama's, तत् वचनम् those words, श्रुत्वा having listened, विशालस्य city of Vishala's, पुरातनम् ancient, तत् that, आख्यातुम् to relate, समारेभे commenced.
data.md: Hearing those words of Rāma, that foremost of ascetics began to relate the history of Viśālā, saying,

data.v: श्रूयतां राम शक्रस्य कथां कथयतः शुभाम् । अस्मिन्देशे हि यद्वृत्तं शृणु तत्त्वेन राघव ॥
data.es: "O Rama hear the auspicious legend of Indra. Listen, too, what had happened to this country.
data.anv: राम O Rama, शक्रस्य Indra's, शुभाम् auspicious, कथाम् legendary story, कथयत: being related by me, श्रूयताम् may be heard, अस्मिन् देशे in this country, यत् what, वृत्तम् had happened, तदपि that also, शृणु you may listen.
data.md: Do you listen, O Rāma to what I had heard from Sakra relating this history; and, O descendant of Raghu, do you listen to all that befell in this city.

data.v: पूर्वं कृतयुगे राम दितेः पुत्रा महाबलाः । अदितेश्च महाभागा वीर्यवन्तः सुधार्मिकाः ॥
data.es: O Blessed Rama in kritayuga, the sons of Diti were very strong and those of Aditi were spirited and righteous.
data.anv: महाभाग राम O Blessed Rama, पूर्वम् formerly, कृतयुगे in Krita yuga, दिते: पुत्रा: sons of Diti, अदितेश्च sons of Aditi, महाबला: highly powerful, वीर्यवन्त: possessed of valour, सुधार्मिका: highly virtuous (used to live).
data.md: Formerly in the Krita age, O Rāma, Diti's highly powerful sons, as well as those of Aditi, possessed of prowess, and virtuous and pious, high-souled ones both.

data.v: ततस्तेषां नरश्रेष्ठ बुद्धिरासीन्महात्मनाम् । अमरा निर्जराश्चैव कथं स्याम निरामयाः ॥
data.es: O Best among men a thought came to those illustrious ones, 'how can we be free from old age, death and disease'?
data.anv: तत: then, नरश्रेष्ठ O Best among men, महात्मनाम् of the illustrious, तेषाम् for them, अजरा: free from old age, अमराश्चैव free from death, निरामया: free from disease, कथम् how, स्याम we will be, बुद्धि: आसीत् a thought came.
data.md: O foremost of men, fell to reflecting, 'How can we become exempt from decrepitude and disease, and immortal.'

data.v: तेषां चिन्तयतां राम बुद्धिरासीद्विपश्चिताम् । क्षीरोदमथनं कृत्वा रसं प्राप्स्याम तत्र वै ॥
data.es: "O Rama While the noble sons were reflecting over this matter an idea flashed across their minds to get nectar by churning the ocean of milk.
data.anv: राम O Rama, चिन्तयताम् while they were reflecting over this matter, तेषाम् for them, महात्मनाम् noble ones, बुद्धि: a thought, आसीत् came, क्षीरोदमथनम् churning the ocean of milk, कृत्वा having made, तत्र from there, रसम् nectar of immortality, प्राप्स्याम we will obtain.
data.md: And as they reflected, it struck them, 'By churning the ocean of milk, we must obtain ambrosia.'

data.v: ततो निश्चित्य मथनं योक्त्रं कृत्वा च वासुकिम् । मन्थानं मन्दरं कृत्वा ममन्थुरमितौजसः ॥
data.es: Thereupon, having decided to churn (the ocean mind) those very powerful ones, made Vasuki, (the great snake), as a rope and Mandara mountain as the churning rod.And started churning it.
data.anv: तत: there upon, अमितौजस: those men who were very powerful, मथनम् to churn, निश्चित्य having decided, वासुकिम् Vasuki, योक्त्रम् as rope of the churning rod, कृत्वा having made, मन्दरम् Mandara mountain, मन्थानम् as churning rod, कृत्वा having made, ममन्थु: churned.
data.md: Then deciding upon churning (the ocean), those ones of immeasurable energy making Vasuki the cord, and the Mandara (hill), the stick, began to churn the deep.

data.v: अथ धन्वन्तरिर्नाम अप्सराश्च सुवर्चसः । अप्सु निर्मथनादेव रसात्तस्माद्वरस्त्रियः । उत्पेतुर्मनुजश्रेष्ठ तस्मादप्सरसोऽभवन् ॥
data.es: O Best among men excellent women emerged out of the essence produced by churning of waters. Therefore they are known as apsarasas.
data.anv: मनुजश्रेष्ठ O Best among men, अप्सु waters, निर्मथनात् churning, तस्मात् रसात् from that essence, वरस्त्रिय: excellent women, उत्पेतु: emerged, तस्मात् for that reason, अप्सरस: apsaras, अभवन् became.
data.md: After a thousand years, had rolled on, arose a male being impregnated with the Āyurveda, of exceedingly righteous soul, called Dhanvantari, bearing in his hands a stick, and a Kamandalu. And there arose also, from the cream of the churning waters, those magnificent dames the shining Apsaras. And, O foremost of men, as they had emerged from water, they are called Apsaras.

data.v: षष्टिः कोट्योऽभवंस्तासामप्सराणां सुवर्चसाम् । असंख्येयास्तु काकुत्स्थ यास्तासां परिचारिकाः ॥
data.md: There sprang sixty koțis of shining Apsaras. And, O Kākutstha, the female attendants of those are numberless.

data.v: न ताः स्म प्रतिगृह्णन्ति सर्वे ते देवदानवाः । अप्रतिग्रहणाच्चैव तेन साधारणाः स्मृताः ॥
data.md: And neither the deities nor the Dānavas would accept them, and in consequence of this nonacceptance, they are known as women belonging to all.

data.v: वरुणस्य ततः कन्या वारुणी रघुनन्दन । उत्पपात महाभागा मार्गमाणा परिग्रहम् ॥
data.md: And then, O Raghu's descendant, arose the eminently pious daughter of Varuna, Varuni, who fell to looking for acceptance.

data.v: दितेः पुत्रा न तां राम जगृहुर्वरुणात्मजाम् । अदितेस्तु सुता वीर जगृहुस्तामनिन्दिताम् ॥
data.md: And Diti's sons, O Rāma, did not accept the daughter of Varuna and Aditi's sons, O hero, accepted that one of blameless limbs.

data.v: असुरास्तेन दैतेयाः सुरास्तेनादितेः सुताः । हृष्टाः प्रमुदिताश्चासन्वारुणी ग्रहणात्सुराः ॥
data.md: Hence Diti's son go by the name of Asuras; and Aditi's by that of Suras. And the celestials became exceeding glad, on having accepted Vāruņi.

data.v: उच्चैःश्रवा हयश्रेष्ठो मणिरत्नं च कौस्तुभम् । उदतिष्ठन्नरश्रेष्ठ तथैवामृतमुत्तमम् ॥
data.md: O foremost of men, next arose ucchaiśravā best of horses, and also Kaustubha; and next, the excellent ambrosia.

data.v: अथ तस्य कृते राम महानासीत्कुलक्षयः । अदितेस्तु ततः पुत्रा दितेः पुत्राण सूदयन् ॥
data.md: O Rāma, tremendous was the carnage for the possession thereof (ambrosia); and Aditi's and Diti's sons fought together.

data.v: अदितेरात्मजा वीरा दितेः पुत्रान्निजघ्निरे । तस्मिन्घोरे महायुद्धे दैतेयादित्ययोर्भृशम् ॥
data.md: And in that exceedingly dreadful battle between the sons of Diti and Aditi, those heroic ones viz., Aditi's heroic sons slaughtered those of Diti.

data.v: निहत्य दितिपुत्रांस्तु राज्यं प्राप्य पुरंदरः । शशास मुदितो लोकान्सर्षिसंघान्सचारणान् ॥
data.md: Having slaughtered the sons of Diti's and regained his kingdom, he happily began to rule the worlds, containing saints and Caranas.

data.v: हतेषु तेषु पुत्रेषु दितिः परमदुःखिता । मारीचं काश्यपं राम भर्तारमिदमब्रवीत् ॥
data.es: "O Rama Diti was afflicted with great grief when her sons were killed. She addressed her husband Kasyapa, son of Maricha", saying:
data.anv: राम O Rama, तेषु पुत्रेषु when those sons, हतेषु were killed, दिति: Diti, परमदु:खिता afflicted with great grief, भर्तारम् husband, मारीचम् Maricha, काश्यपम् Kasyapas's son, इदम् अब्रवीत् spoke these words.
data.md: On those sons of her being slain, Diti afflicted with great grief, thus addressed her husband, Marici's son, Kasyapa.

data.v: हतपुत्रास्मि भगवंस्तव पुत्रैर्महाबलैः । शक्रहन्तारमिच्छामि पुत्रं दीर्घतपोऽर्जितम् ॥
data.es: "O adorable one, your highly powerful sons, (devatas) have killed mine through extensive austerities. I am desirous of obtaining a (mighty) son capable of killing Indra.
data.anv: भगवन् O Adorable one, महाबलै: by the highly powerful, पुत्रै: by your sons, devatas, हतपुत्रा  अस्मि my sons have been killed, शक्रहन्तारम् capable of slaying Indra, दीर्घतपोऽर्जितम् acquire through long austerities, पुत्रम् mighty son, इच्छामि I desire.
data.md: O adorable one, your high-souled sons have slain mine. I now wish for a son, who, obtained through long austerities, will be able to slay Sakra.

data.v: साहं तपश्चरिष्यामि गर्भं मे दातुमर्हसि । ईदृशं शक्रहन्तारं त्वमनुज्ञातुमर्हसि ॥
data.es: I shall practise austerities. You ought to grant me a son who would be the supreme ruler of the world and capable of killing Indra. You can say yes (if you will)".
data.anv: सा अहम् I, तप: austerities, चरिष्यामि I shall practise, त्वम् you, ईश्वरम् a supreme ruler of the world, शुक्रहंतारम् capable of slaying Indra, गर्भम् embryo (son), मे to me, दातुम् to give, अर्हसि behoves of you, अनुज्ञातुम् to give consent, अर्हसि behoves.
data.md: I will engage in austerities: it behoves you to grant me such an embryo, such a slayer of Sakra it behoves you to promise me.

data.v: तस्यास्तद्वचनं श्रुत्वा मारीचः काश्यपस्तदा । प्रत्युवाच महातेजा दितिं परमदुःखिताम् ॥
data.es: The deeply religious and highly powerful king, having heard those words of his one hundred exceptional daughters, replied:
data.anv: वाक्यविदाम् among the knowledgeable men in words, श्रेष्ठः (वर:) excellent, नराधिप: king, तस्य his, तत् वचनम् those words, श्रुत्वा having heard, ऋषिमध्ये amidst sages, महीपतिम् addressing the king, वाक्यम् words, प्रत्युवाच replied.
data.md: Hearing those words of hers, Marici's son, Kaśyapa of exceeding energy answered the deeply aggrieved Diti, saying.

data.v: एवं भवतु भद्रं ते शुचिर्भव तपोधने । जनयिष्यसि पुत्रं त्वं शक्र हन्तारमाहवे ॥
data.es: "O one vested with the wealth of austerities be it so. Prosperity to you Remain chaste, you will deliver a son who will kill Indra in the battle.
data.anv: तपोधने O One having austerities as wealth, एवं भवतु 'Be it so', ते भद्रम् prosperity to you, शुचि: भव become pure, त्वम् you, आहवे in the battle, शक्रहन्तारम् slayer of Indra, पुत्रम् son, जनयिष्यसि will give birth.
data.md: Be it so. Good betide you, do you become pure, O ascetic. If you remain pure, when a full thousand years shall be complete, you will give birth to a son who will slay ſakra in battle.

data.v: पूर्णे वर्षसहस्रे तु शुचिर्यदि भविष्यसि । पुत्रं त्रैलोक्य हन्तारं मत्तस्त्वं जनयिष्यसि ॥
data.es: "If you remain pure and clean, on completion of a thousand years you will give birth to a son through me who will be the lord of the three worlds".
data.anv: त्वम् you, शुचि: भविष्यसि यदि if you remain pure and clean, वर्षसहस्रे thousand years, पूर्णे after completion, मत्त: through me, त्रैलोक्यभर्तारम् lord of three worlds, पुत्रम् son, जनयिष्यसि will give birth.
data.md: Be it so. Good betide you, do you become pure, O ascetic. If you remain pure, when a full thousand years shall be complete, you will give birth to a son who will slay ſakra in battle.

data.v: एवमुक्त्वा महातेजाः पाणिना स ममार्ज ताम् । समालभ्य ततः स्वस्तीत्युक्त्वा स तपसे ययौ ॥
data.es: Highly brilliant Kasyapa, having thus spoken, touched her gently with his palm, stroked her body and said, "May good betide thee". Having said this, Kasyapa went away to perform austerities.
data.anv: महातेजा: highly energetic, स: Kasyapa, एवम् in this way, उक्त्वा having spoken, ताम् her, पाणिना with his palm, ममार्ज touched her body gently stroking, समालभ्य having touched her, तत: then, स्वस्ति इति "May good be with thee", उक्त्वा having spoken, स: Kashyapa, तपसे to perform austerities, ययौ had gone.
data.md: And through me, you will give birth to a son that will destroy the three worlds. Having said this, that highly energetic one rubbed her person with his palm. And having rubbed her, he said, 'Luck!' and then went away to carry on austerities.

data.v: गते तस्मिन्नरश्रेष्ठ दितिः परमहर्षिता । कुशप्लवनमासाद्य तपस्तेपे सुदारुणम् ॥
data.es: "O foremost among men after Kasyapa had left, Diti exceedingly delighted (at the prospect of having sons) reached Kushaplavana, and practised intense mortifications.
data.anv: नरश्श्रेष्ठ O Foremost of men, तस्मिन् when that Kasyapa, गते (सति) had gone, दिति: Diti, परमहर्षिता was exceedingly delighted, कुशप्लवनम् sacred spot named Kushaplavana, आसाद्य having reached, सुदारुणम् intense, तप: mortifications, तेपे practised.
data.md: When he had gone, Diti, O foremost of men, becoming exceedingly delighted, went to, Kuśaplava and began to practise rigid mortifications.

data.v: तपस्तस्यां हि कुर्वत्यां परिचर्यां चकार ह । सहस्राक्षो नरश्रेष्ठ परया गुणसंपदा ॥
data.es: O foremost of men great treasure of virtues while she was practising austerities, the thousandeyed Indra began to serve her.
data.anv: नरश्श्रेष्ठ O Foremost of men, Rama, तस्याम् when she, तप: austerities, कुर्वन्त्याम् while doing, सहस्राक्ष: thousandeyed Indra, परया with great, गुणसम्पदा treasure of virtues, परिचर्याम् service, चकार had made.
data.md: O foremost of men, as she was practising austerities, the thousand-eyed deity most dutifully ministered to her.

data.v: अग्निं कुशान्काष्ठमपः फलं मूलं तथैव च । न्यवेदयत्सहस्राक्षो यच्चान्यदपि काङ्क्षितम् ॥
data.es: The thousandeyed Indra served her by providing fire, Kusha grass, sticks for burning, water, fruits, roots and all other things desired by her.
data.anv: सहस्राक्ष: Devendra, अग्निम् fire, कुशान् Kusha grass, काष्ठम् sticks for burning, अप: water, फलम् fruits, तथैव च and, मूलम् roots, काङ्क्षितम् desired, अन्यत् all other things, यच्च whichever, न्यवेदयत् provided her.
data.md: The thousand-eyed one provided for her fire, and Kusa, and faggots, and water, and fruits, and roots, and other things that she wanted.

data.v: गात्रसंवाहनैश्चैव श्रमापनयनैस्तथा । शक्रः सर्वेषु कालेषु दितिं परिचचार ह ॥
data.es: Indra attended on Diti, stroking her limbs gently from time to time to help her regain their suppleness and alleviate her fatigue.
data.anv: शक्र: Devendra, गात्रसंवहनै: च एव stroking her limbs gently to regain their suppleness, तथा and, श्रमापनयनै: alleviating her fatigue, सर्वेषु कालेषु at all times, दितिम् Diti, परिचचार ह attended on her.
data.md: And at all times, Sakra served Diti by rubbing her person, and removing her fatigue.

data.v: अथ वर्षसहस्रेतु दशोने रघु नन्दन । दितिः परमसंप्रीता सहस्राक्षमथाब्रवीत् ॥
data.es: O son of the Raghus ten years before completion of a thousand years. Diti, highly pleased with the services rendered by Indra, addressed him", saying:
data.anv: रघुनन्दन O Joy of Raghus, Rama, अथ thereafter, वर्षसहस्रे when thousand years, दशोने short of ten, दिति: Diti, परमसम्प्रीता highly pleased, सहस्राक्षम् addressing Indra, अब्रवीत् spoke.
data.md: When ten years only were wanting to complete the thousand years, Diti, O descendant of Raghu, being exceedingly delighted, thus spoke to the thousand-eyed one.

data.v: तपश्चरन्त्या वर्षाणि दश वीर्यवतां वर । अवशिष्टानि भद्रं ते भ्रातरं द्रक्ष्यसे ततः ॥
data.es: O the best of the brave ten years is yet to go (for completion of austerities). You will have a brother. May you prosper
data.anv: वीर्यवताम् among those having prowess, वर excellent, तप: austerities, चरन्त्या: performing, दश ten, वर्षाणि years, अवशिष्टानि remaining, तत: afterwards, भ्रातरम् brother, द्रक्ष्यसे you will see, ते भद्रम् may prosperity to you.
data.md: O best of those endowed with prowess, of me engaged in austerities, ten years only remain (to complete the period.) And after that time, good betide you, you will behold your brother.

data.v: तमहं त्वत्कृते पुत्र समाधास्ये जयोत्सुकम् । त्रैलोक्यविजयं पुत्र सह भोक्ष्यसि विज्वरः ॥
data.es: O Child I'll create in him eagerness victory. Together with him you will gain victory over the three worlds. Relieved of sorrows, enjoy you'll with him".
data.anv: पुत्र O Son, तम् him, त्वत्कृते for you, जयोत्सुकम् having fortitude for victory, (अहं) समाधास्ये I shall unite him, पुत्र O Son, विज्वर: relieved of grief, त्रैलोक्यविजयम् victory over three worlds, सह भोक्ष्यसि you will enjoy together with him.
data.md: I will, O son, bind him to you in affection, whom I had besought for to compass your destruction, so that, the fever of your heart removed, you will with him enjoy the victory of the three worlds.

data.v: एवमुक्त्वा दितिः शक्रं प्राप्ते मध्यं दिवाकरे । निद्रयापहृता देवी पादौ कृत्वाथ शीर्षतः ॥
data.es: After speaking thus to Indra, goddess Diti overpowered with sleep around midsday dropped off, her feet towards her head.
data.anv: दिति: देवी Diti devi,  शक्रम् to Indra, एवम् in this way, उक्त्वा having spoken, दिवाकरे when  Sun, मध्यम् midday, प्राप्ते having reached, अथ thereafter, पादौ feet, शीर्षत: head side, कृत्वा having placed, निद्रया by sleep, अपहृता has been overcome.
data.md: And it came to pass that having said this, the sun being in his meridian, the worshipful Diti with her feet placed at that part of the bed which should contain her head, was overpowered by sleep.

data.v: दृष्ट्वा तामशुचिं शक्रः पादतः कृतमूर्धजाम् । शिरःस्थाने कृतौ पादौ जहास च मुमोद च ॥
data.es: Indra laughed. He rejoiced at the sight of her ominous posture of sleeping with her feet towards her head and her hair falling on her feet.
data.anv: शक्र: Indra, पादत: towards her feet, कृतमूर्धजाम् with the hairs falling, अशुचिम् impure posture, तां दृष्ट्वा having seen her, शिरस्स्थाने in the place where she should place her head, कृतै placed, पादौ feet (having  seen), जहास laughed, मुमोद च was pleased.
data.md: And thereupon seeing her resting her feet at the place where she should place her head, and consequently unclean, Śakra was exceedingly delighted, and smiled.

data.v: तस्याः शरीरविवरं विवेश च पुरंदरः । गर्भं च सप्तधा राम बिभेद परमात्मवान् ॥
data.es: O Rama with great courage Indra entered her womb and severed her embryo into seven pieces.
data.anv: राम O Rama, पुरन्दर: Indra, तस्या: her, शरीरविवरं womb, विवेश च entered, परम् great, आत्मवान् courageous one, गर्भम् embryo, सप्तधा seven pieces, बिभेद severed it.
data.md: O Rāma, Purandara entered into her womb, and that highly self-controlled one served the embryo in seven parts.

data.v: बिध्यमानस्ततो गर्भो वज्रेण शतपर्वणा । रुरोद सुस्वरं राम ततो दितिरबुध्यत ॥
data.es: O Rama that embryo, being severed by Vajra having a hundred edges, cried at high pitch which awakened Diti".
data.anv: राम O Rama, तत: then, शतपर्वणा by the hundred edged, वज्रेण by Vajra, भिद्यमान: being severed, गर्भ: embryo, सुस्वरम् at high pitch, रुरोद cried, तत: then, दिति: Diti, अबुध्यत woke up.
data.md: And the embryo being pierced by the thunderbold of an hundred knots, cried at the top of its voice, and thereat Diti awoke.

data.v: मा रुदो मा रुदश्चेति गर्भं शक्रोऽभ्यभाषत । बिभेद च महातेजा रुदन्तमपि वासवः ॥
data.es: Highly powerful Indra, even while saying to the crying embryo "Do not weep, Do not weep" severed it.
data.anv: मा रुद: "Do not weep", मा रुद: "Do not weep", इति शक्र: Indra, गर्भम् addressing embryo, अभ्यभाषत spoke, महातेजा: highly powerful, वासव: Indra, रुदन्तमपि even though crying, बिभेद severed it.
data.md: 'Do not cry, do not cry,' exclaimed Sakra: and even while it was crying, the mighty-minded Vāsava continued piercing it.

data.v: न हन्तव्यो न हन्तव्य इत्येवं दितिरब्रवीत् । निष्पपात ततः शक्रो मातुर्वचनगौरवात् ॥
data.es: "Do not kill", "Do not kill", said Diti. Subsequently Indra, in deference to the words of his mother, emerged out of the womb.
data.anv: दिति Diti, न हन्तव्य: "Sould not be killed", न हन्तव्य:" should not be killed ", इत्येवम् in this way, अब्रवीत् said, तत: subsequently, शक्र: Indra, मातु: वचनगौरवात् in deference to the words of his mother, निष्पपात came out.
data.md: 'Do not slay it; do not slay it' said Diti. Thereupon, in consideration of the honour of his mother, Sakra went out.

data.v: प्राञ्जलिर्वज्रसहितो दितिं शक्रोऽभ्यभाषत । अशुचिर्देवि सुप्तासि पादयोः कृतमूर्धजा ॥
data.es: Armed with Vajra, Indra addressed Diti with folded palms, saying, "O Devi you have slept, with your head towards your feet and your hair falling on your feet".
data.anv: वज्रसहित: armed with Vajra, शक्र: Indra, प्राञ्जलि: with folded palms, दितिम् Diti, अभ्यभाषत spoke, देवि O Devi, पादयो: feet, कृतमूर्धजा hairs falling( on her feet ), अशुचि: becoming impure, सुप्ता असि slept.
data.md: Then he with clasped palms accosted Diti, saying, 'O worshipful one, you did sleep with they feet placed where your head should have lain, and hast therefore become impure. And finding this opportunity, I severed in seven pieces that would-be slayer of mine in battle. Do you, O worshipful one, excuse me.'

data.v: तदन्तरमहं लब्ध्वा शक्रहन्तारमाहवे । अभिन्दं सप्तधा देवि तन्मे त्वं क्षन्तुमर्हसि ॥
data.es: "I have seized the opportunity and severed into seven pieces the foetus who would have been a slayer of Indra. O Devi shoudn't you forgive me"?इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये बालकाण्डे षट्चत्वारिंशस्सर्ग:॥Thus ends the fortysixth sarga of Balakanda of the holy Ramayana the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.
data.anv: अहम् I, तत् that, अन्तरम् opportunity, लब्ध्वा having seized, आहवे in war, शक्रहन्तारम् that one who was to be slayer of Indra, सप्तधा into seven parts, अभिदम् severed, देवि O Devi, त्वम् you, क्षंतुम् to forgive, अर्हसि it is proper.
data.md: Then he with clasped palms accosted Diti, saying, 'O worshipful one, you did sleep with they feet placed where your head should have lain, and hast therefore become impure. And finding this opportunity, I severed in seven pieces that would-be slayer of mine in battle. Do you, O worshipful one, excuse me.'

data.v: सप्तधा तु कृते गर्भे दितिः परमदुःखिता । सहस्राक्षं दुराधर्षं वाक्यं सानुनयाब्रवीत् ॥
data.es: Deeply distressed Diti, having come to know that the embryo had been severed into seven pieces, humbly spoke to the unassailable Indra.
data.anv: गर्भे when the embryo, सप्तधा into seven pieces,  कृते having been cut, दिति: Diti, परमदु:खिता highly distressed, दुराधर्षम् unassailable, सहस्राक्षम् Indra, सानुनया affectionate, वाक्यम् words, अब्रवीत् spoke.
data.md: When the embryo had been sundered is seven, Díti exceedingly aggrieved humbly spoke to the irrepressible thousand-eyed deity, saying, as

data.v: ममापराधाद्गर्भोऽयं सप्तधा विफलीकृतः । नापराधोऽस्ति देवेश तवात्र बलसूदन ॥
data.es: "O Indra, Slayer of Balasura, because of my fault this embryo has been made into seven pieces and rendered useless. In this matter you have not committed any fault.
data.anv: बलसूदन O Slayer of Balasura, देवेश Devendra, मम my, अपराधात् by the fault, अयम् this,  गर्भ: embryo, सप्तधा into seven pieces, विफलीकृत: rendered useless, अत्र in this matter, तव your, अपराध: fault, नास्ति was not there.
data.md: By my fault it is that the embryo has been sundered in seven. O chief of the celestials, herein you are guilty of no transgression, o destroyer of Bala.

data.v: प्रियं तु कृतमिच्छामि मम गर्भविपर्यये । मरुतां सप्तं सप्तानां स्थानपाला भवन्त्विमे ॥
data.es: This disaster to the embryo has happened contrary to expectations. Hence, I seek a favour from you. Let these seven pieces become seven guardians of marut regions (regions of the wind).
data.anv: गर्भविपर्यये this misfortune to embryo, मम for me, प्रियम् favour, कर्तुम् to do, इच्छामि I am desiring, इमे this, सप्त seven pieces, सप्तानां seven, मरुताम् maruts, स्थानपाला guardians of regions, भवन्तु become.
data.md: And since calamity has befallen the embryo, I wish to do you a good turn. Let the seven parts become the guardians of the seven Maruts.

data.v: वातस्कन्धा इमे सप्त चरन्तु दिवि पुत्रकाः । मारुता इति विख्याता दिव्यरूपा ममात्मजाः ॥
data.es: O Son, all these seven are my sons of celestial beauty.They will become pesiding deities for Vata Skandha (divisions of wind) and let them be wellknown as maruts wandering in the universe.
data.anv: पुत्रक O Son, सप्त seven, इमे these, मम my, आत्मजा: sons, दिव्यरूपा: having celestial beauty, वातस्कन्धा: presiding deities for Vata Skandha (divisions of wind), मारुता: इति named Maruts, विख्याता: wellknown, दिवि in the sky (intermediate regions), चरन्तु let them wander.
data.md: O son, let my sons having noble forms, becoming famous Marutas range the Vātaskandha regions in heaven.

data.v: ब्रह्मलोकं चरत्वेक इन्द्रलोकं तथापरः । दिवि वायुरिति ख्यातस्तृतीयोऽपि महायशाः ॥
data.es: Among them, one will move about in Brahmaloka, another in Indraloka, and the third, well known as vayu will move around in the sky.
data.anv: एक: one, ब्रह्मलोकम् in Brahma loka, चरतु may move about, तथा similarly, अपर: another, इन्द्रलोकम् Indra loka, महायशा: highly renowned, तृतीयोऽपि third one, वायुरिति known as Vayu, ख्यात: wellknown, दिवि in this universe, move about.
data.md: Let one range Brahmā's regions, and another Indra's, and the highly illustrious third also range around, being known as Divya Vāyu. (Ether).

data.v: चत्वारस्तु सुरश्रेष्ठ दिशो वै तव शासनात् । संचरिष्यन्ति भद्रं ते देवभूता ममात्मजाः । त्वत्कृतेनैव नाम्ना च मारुता इति विश्रुताः ॥
data.es: O best of devatas by your command the other four sons will remain celestial, and will range about in four directions.
data.anv: सुरश्रेष्ठ O Best of devatas, चत्वार: four, मम आत्मजा: my  sons, तव your, शासनात् by command, देवभूता: becoming celestial beings, दिश: directions, सञ्चरिष्यन्तु may range about.
data.md: O best of celestials, by they command, let the four remaining sons of mine, known by the name which you have mentioned, range about in appointed periods.'

data.v: तस्यास्तद्वचनं श्रुत्वा सहस्राक्षः पुरंदरः । उवाच प्राञ्जलिर्वाक्यं दितिं बलनिषूदनः ॥
data.es: Then, Maricha's son, exceedingly bright Kasyapa on hearing the words of Diti who was deeply grieved replied:
data.anv: तदा then, राजा king, दशरथ Dasaratha, तस्य his, तत् that, वचनम् words, श्रुत्वा having heard,  विषण्णवदन: with dejected face, दीन: full of sorrow, प्राञ्जलि: with joined hands, वाक्यम् words, अब्रवीत् spoke.
data.md: Hearing her words, that destroyer of Vala; the thousand-eyed Purandara, with clasped palms said.

data.v: सर्वमेतद्यथोक्तं ते भविष्यति न संशयः । विचरिष्यन्ति भद्रं ते देवभूतास्तवात्मजाः ॥
data.es: "Everything will, no doubt, happen the way you said. Your sons will wander about as celestial beings. Prosperity to you."
data.anv: ते to you, यथा as, उक्तम् said, एतत् सर्वम् all this, भविष्यति will take place, संशय: doubt, न not there, तव your, आत्मजा: sons, देवभूता: like celestial beings, विचरिष्यन्ति shall wander about, भद्रम् ते prosperity to you.
data.md: All this that you have said must come to pass; there is no doubt about it. Good betide you, your sons endowed with celestial forms, shall range about.

data.v: एवं तौ निश्चयं कृत्वा मातापुत्रौ तपोवने । जग्मतुस्त्रिदिवं राम कृतार्थाविति नः श्रुतम् ॥
data.es: "O Rama mother and sons having arrived at this conclusion in the tapovana ascended to heaven with their desire fulfilled. This is what we have heard."
data.anv: राम O Rama, तौ मातापुत्रौ those mother and sons, एवम् in this way, निश्चयम् conclusion, कृत्वा having arrived, कृतार्थौ having fulfilled their desire, त्रिदिवम् towords heaven, जग्मतु: had gone, इति श्रुतम् thus heard.
data.md: And it has been heard by us that having thus ascertained in that hermitage, the mother and the son, O Rama, went to heaven, their desire obtained.

data.v: एष देशः स काकुत्स्थ महेन्द्राध्युषितः पुरा । दितिं यत्र तपः सिद्धामेवं परिचचार सः ॥
data.es: "O Descendant of Kakustha (Rama) this is that country which was formerly inhabited by Indra. Here Indra attended on Diti who achieved the fruit of her austerities.
data.anv: काकुत्स्थ O Rama, एष: this one, पुरा formerly, महेन्द्राध्युषित: inhabited by Indra, स: that, देश: country, यत्र where, स: he, तप: in austerities, सिद्धाम् succeded, दितिम् Diti, एवम् this way, परिचचार attended on.
data.md: Even this O Kākutstha, is the place where formerly the mighty Indra sojourned, and where he attended upon Diti of accomplished ascetic success.

data.v: इक्ष्वाकोस्तु नरव्याघ्र पुत्रः परमधार्मिकः । अलम्बुषायामुत्पन्नो विशाल इति विश्रुतः ॥
data.es: "O Tiger among men (Rama) this highly virtuous and wellknown son named Vishala was born to Ikshvakus in Alambusa. Where, a city named Vishala was built.
data.anv: नरव्याघ्र O Tiger among men, Rama, इक्ष्वाको: for Ikshvaku, अलम्बुषायाम् in Alambusa, परमधार्मिक: highly virtuous, विशाल इति named Vishala, विश्रुत: wellknown, पुत्र: son, उत्पन्न: was norn, तेन by him, इह here, स्थाने in this place, विशालेति named as Vishala, पुरी city, कृता आसीत् was built.
data.md: O most powerful of men, Ikşvāku had an exceedingly righteous son born to him of Alambusa, known by the name of Viśāla. And here stood a palace, built by him, called Viśālā.

data.v: तेन चासीदिह स्थाने विशालेति पुरी कृता ॥
विशालस्य सुतो राम हेमचन्द्रो महाबलः । सुचन्द्र इति विख्यातो हेमचन्द्रादनन्तरः ॥
data.es: O Rama mighty Hemachandra was Vishala's son. Hemachandra's successor was the celebrated Suchandra.
data.anv: राम O Rama, महाबल: mighty, हेमचन्द्र: Hemachandra, विशालस्य Vishala's, सुत: son, हेमचन्द्रात् from Hemachandra, अनन्तर: his successor, सुचन्द्र इति as Suchandra, विख्यात: celebrated one.
data.md: Viśāla's son, O Rāma, was the mighty Hemacandra. And after Hemacandra comes the celebrated Sucandra.

data.v: सुचन्द्रतनयो राम धूम्राश्व इति विश्रुतः । धूम्राश्वतनयश्चापि सृञ्जयः समपद्यत ॥
data.es: O Rama son of Suchandra was Dhumraswa, wellknown Sanjaya was the son of Dhumraswa.
data.anv: राम O Rama, सुचन्द्रतनय: son of Suchandra, धूम्राश्व इति as Dhumraswa, विश्रुत: wellknown, सञ्जय: Sanjaya, धूम्राश्वतनय: son of Dhumraswa, समपद्यत was born.
data.md: O Rāma, the son of Sucandra was Dhumrāśva, and then was born Sšñjaya son to Dhumrāśva.

data.v: सृञ्जयस्य सुतः श्रीमान्सहदेवः प्रतापवान् । कुशाश्वः सहदेवस्य पुत्रः परमधार्मिकः ॥
data.es: Prosperous and powerful Sahadeva was Sanjaya's son. Highly virtuous Kusaswa was Sahadeva's son.
data.anv: श्रीमान् prosperous, प्रतापवान् powerful, सहदेव: Sahadeva, सञ्जयस्य Sanjaya's, सुत: son, परमधार्मिक: highly virtuous, कुशाश्व: Kusaswa, सहदेवस्य Sahadeva's, पुत्र: son.
data.md: Srinjaya's son was the powerful Sahadeva, And Sahadeva's son was the pre-eminently pious Kuśāśva.

data.v: कुशाश्वस्य महातेजाः सोमदत्तः प्रतापवान् । सोमदत्तस्य पुत्रस्तु काकुत्स्थ इति विश्रुतः ॥
data.es: Brilliant and powerful Somadatta was Kusaswa's son. That Somadatta's son was Kakutstha is wellknown.
data.anv: महातेजा: highly lustrous, प्रतापवान् powerful, सोमदत्त: Somadatta, कुशाश्वस्य Kusaswa's (son), सोमदत्तस्य Somadatta's, पुत्र: son, काकुत्स्थ: Kakutstha, इति विश्रुत: is wellknown.
data.md: Kuśāśva's son was the puissant Somadatta. And now, O Kākutstha, Somadatta's son, the effulgent and invincible and renowned Sumati reside in this mansion.

data.v: तस्य पुत्रो महातेजाः संप्रत्येष पुरीमिमाम् । आवसत्यमरप्रख्यः सुमतिर्नाम दुर्जयः ॥
data.es: Son of Ikshvakus, Sumati comparable to devatas, invincible and exceedingly energetic is still ruling this city.
data.anv: सम्प्रति now, इमां पुरीम् in this city, तस्य पुत्र: son of Ikshvaku, महातेजा: heroic, अमरप्रख्य: equal to devatas, दुर्जय: invincible, सुमतिर्नाम named Sumati, आवसति is living.
