data.v: इक्ष्वाकोस्तु प्रसादेन सर्वे वैशालिका नृपाः । दीर्घायुषो महात्मानो वीर्यवन्तः सुधार्मिकाः ॥
data.es: By the grace of the Ikshvakus, all the kings of Vishala have been long lived and exalted, valiant and deeply religious.
data.anv: इक्ष्वाको: Ikshwaku's, प्रसादेन by his graciousness, वैशालिका: relating to Vishala, नृपा: kings, सर्वे all, दीर्घायुष: possessing longlife, महात्मान: exalted, वीर्यवन्त: valourous, सुधार्मिका: are virtuous.
data.md: And by the grace of Ikşvāku, all the sovereigns of Viśālā are long-loved, and highsouled, and puissant, and pious.

data.v: इहाद्य रजनीं राम सुखं वत्स्यामहे वयम् । श्वः प्रभाते नरश्रेष्ठ जनकं द्रष्टुमर्हसि ॥
data.es: O Rama we shall spend the right happily here. O Best among men On the tomorrow we see Janaka".
data.anv: राम O Rama, अद्य today, रजनीम् night, वयम् we, इह here, सुखम् happily, वत्स्यामहे will stay on, नरश्रेष्ठ O Best among men, श्व: tomorrow, प्रभाते early morning, जनकम् Janaka, द्रष्टुम् to see, अर्हसि fit and proper.
data.md: And here will we happily spend a night; an on the morning of the morrow you will, O foremost of men, behold Janaka.'

data.v: सुमतिस्तु महातेजा विश्वामित्रमुपागतम् । श्रुत्वा नरवरश्रेष्ठः प्रत्युद्गच्छन्महायशाः ॥
data.es: Having heard of the arrival of Viswamitra the celebrated Sumati, most brilliant chief of kings proceeded (to receive him).
data.anv: महातेजा: most brilliant, महायशा: man of immense renown, नरवरश्रेष्ठ: chief of men, सुमतिस्तु king Sumati, विश्वामित्रम् Visvamitra, उपागतम् arrived, श्रुत्वा having heard, प्रत्युद्गच्छत् went forward (to receive him).
data.md: And having heard that the illustrious Viśvāmitra had come, that best of kings, the effulgent Sumati, appeared before him.

data.v: पूजां च परमां कृत्वा सोपाध्यायः सबान्धवः । प्राञ्जलिः कुशलं पृष्ट्वा विश्वामित्रमथाब्रवीत् ॥
data.es: Along with his spiritual preceptors and relatives he paid Viswamitra great respect, enquired his wellbeing and said:
data.anv: सोपाध्याय: with spiritual preceptors, सबान्धव: together with  his relatives, परमाम् supreme, पूजाम् honours, कृत्वा having performed, प्राञ्जलि: with folded palms, कुशलम् welfare, पृष्ट्वा having enquired, अथ thereafter, विश्वामित्रम् addressing Visvamitra, अब्रवीत् spoke.
data.md: And having paid Viśvāmitra high homage together with his priests and friends, and with clasped hands enquired after the former's welfare, he addressed Viśvāmitra, saying.

data.v: धन्योऽस्म्यनुगृहीतोऽस्मि यस्य मे विषयं मुने । संप्राप्तो दर्शनं चैव नास्ति धन्यतरो मम ॥
data.es: "O Sage no one is more blessed than me since you have favoured me with your arrival in my country."इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये बालकाण्डे सप्तचत्वारिंशस्सर्ग:॥Thus ends the fortyseventh sarga of Balakanda of the holy Ramayana the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.
data.anv: यस्य मे my, विषयम् country, मुनि: Muni (you), सम्प्राप्त: has visited, दर्शनम् चैव having graced all of us, धन्य: अस्मि blessed am I, अनुगृहीत: अस्मि I am ( highly )favoured, मम for me, न अस्ति धन्यतर: there is none more blessed than me.
data.md: Blessed are we, and obliged are we, whose domains, O ascetic, have been graced with your presence. Surely none is more blessed than I am.

data.v: पृष्ट्वा तु कुशलं तत्र परस्परसमागमे । कथान्ते सुमतिर्वाक्यं व्याजहार महामुनिम् ॥
data.es: Getting together they enquired one another's health. And then Sumati spoke to the great ascetic (Viswamitra).
data.anv: तत्र there, परस्परसमागमे by mutual gettogether (each of them), सुमति: Sumati, कुशलम् welfare, पृष्ट्वा having enquired, कथान्ते at the end of conversation, महामुनिम् addressing  great ascetic Visvamitra, वाक्यम् these words, व्याजहार spoke.
data.md: Having met together they enquired after each other's welfare. And then Sumati spoke to the mighty ascetic, saying.

data.v: इमौ कुमारौ भद्रं ते देवतुल्यपराक्रमौ । गजसिंहगती वीरौ शार्दूलवृषभोपमौ ॥
पद्मपत्रविशालाक्षौ खड्गतूणीधनुर्धरौ । अश्विनाविव रूपेण समुपस्थितयौवनौ ॥
यदृच्छयैव गां प्राप्तौ देवलोकादिवामरौ । कथं पद्भ्यामिह प्राप्तौ किमर्थं कस्य वा मुने ॥
भूषयन्ताविमं देशं चन्द्रसूर्याविवाम्बरम् । परस्परस्य सदृशौ प्रमाणेङ्गितचेष्टितैः ॥
data.es: O Great ascetic they resemble each other in personality, expression and gestures. They adorn this land like Sun and moon in the sky holding excellent weapons. These heroes have trodden paths difficult to traverse. For what purpose have they come? I want to hear clearly".
data.anv: मुनिश्रेष्ठ O Great ascetic, प्रमाणेङ्गितचेष्टितै: in personality, in expressions and gestures,  परस्परस्य each other, सदृशौ resemble, चन्द्रसूर्यौ Moon and Sun, अम्बरमिव in the sky, इमम् this, देशम् country, भूषयन्तौ adorning, वरायुधधरौ holding excellent weapons, वीरौ heroes, दुर्गमे difficult to traverse, पथि paths, किमर्थम् for what purpose, सम्प्राप्तौ have come, तत्त्वत: truly, श्रोतुम् to listen, इच्छामि I am desirous.
data.md: And adorning all directions, like to the Sun or Moon adorning the firmament, and resembling each other. in personal proportions, and expressions, and gestures, and equipped with excellent weapons, and war-like, how have these paragons of men, into this impracticable way? I Wish to hear all this related truly.

data.v: किमर्थं च नरश्रेष्ठौ संप्राप्तौ दुर्गमे पथि । वरायुधधरौ वीरौ श्रोतुमिच्छामि तत्त्वतः ॥
data.es: O Great ascetic they resemble each other in personality, expression and gestures. They adorn this land like Sun and moon in the sky holding excellent weapons. These heroes have trodden paths difficult to traverse. For what purpose have they come? I want to hear clearly".
data.anv: मुनिश्रेष्ठ O Great ascetic, प्रमाणेङ्गितचेष्टितै: in personality, in expressions and gestures,  परस्परस्य each other, सदृशौ resemble, चन्द्रसूर्यौ Moon and Sun, अम्बरमिव in the sky, इमम् this, देशम् country, भूषयन्तौ adorning, वरायुधधरौ holding excellent weapons, वीरौ heroes, दुर्गमे difficult to traverse, पथि paths, किमर्थम् for what purpose, सम्प्राप्तौ have come, तत्त्वत: truly, श्रोतुम् to listen, इच्छामि I am desirous.
data.md: And adorning all directions, like to the Sun or Moon adorning the firmament, and resembling each other. in personal proportions, and expressions, and gestures, and equipped with excellent weapons, and war-like, how have these paragons of men, into this impracticable way? I Wish to hear all this related truly.

data.v: तस्य तद्वचनं श्रुत्वा यथावृत्तं न्यवेदयत् । सिद्धाश्रमनिवासं च राक्षसानां वधं तथा ॥
data.es: On hearing his words, he (Viswamitra) related all about their stay at Siddhashrama and the slaying of rakshasas.
data.anv: तस्य his, तत् वचनम् those words, श्रुत्वा having listened, सिद्धाश्रमनिवासम् च their stay at Siddha ashrama, तथा and, राक्षसानाम् rakshasas, वधम् slaying, यथावृत्तम् all that had actually happened, न्यवेदयत् related.

data.v: विश्वामित्रवचः श्रुत्वा राजा परमहर्षितः । अतिथी परमौ प्राप्तौ पुत्रौ दशरथस्य तौ । पूजयामास विधिवत्सत्कारार्हौ महाबलौ ॥
data.es: After hearing Viswamitra, the king (Sumati) got exceedingly delighted and extended hospitality in accordance with tradition to the highly valiant sons of Dasaratha, the distinguished guests worthy of honour.
data.anv: राजा king Sumati, विश्वामित्रवच: words of Visvamitra, श्रुत्वा having listened, परमहर्षित: exceedingly delighted, परमौ distinguished, अतिथी two guests, प्राप्तौ having arrived, सत्कारार्हौ worthy of honours, महाबलौ highly valiant, तौ दशरथस्य पुत्रौ those two sons of Dasaratha, विथिवत् in accordance with tradition, पूजयामास extended hospitality.
data.md: Having heard his words, Viśvāmitra faithfully related all about it. Hearing Viśvāmitra's words, the king was extremely surprised; and having those sons of Daśaratha as his all-worthy guests, received with becoming respect those highly powerful ones deserving of hospitality.

data.v: ततः परमसत्कारं सुमतेः प्राप्य राघवौ । उष्य तत्र निशामेकां जग्मतुर्मिथिलां ततः ॥
data.es: The descendants of Raghu (Rama and Lakshmana) having received great honour from Sumati, stayed there one night and thereafter set out for Mithila.
data.anv: राघवौ Rama and Lakshmana, तत: from that, सुमते: king Sumati, परमसत्कारम् great honours, प्राप्य having obtained, तत्र there, एकाम् one, निशाम् night, उष्य having stayed, तत: thereafter, मिथिलाम् towards Mithila, जग्मतु: set out.
data.md: Meeting with such splendid reception from Sumati, those descendants of Raghu spent there a night, and the next day set out for Mithila.

data.v: तां दृष्ट्वा मुनयः सर्वे जनकस्य पुरीं शुभाम् । साधु साध्विति शंसन्तो मिथिलां समपूजयन् ॥
data.es: All the ascetics, having seen that auspicious city of Janaka worshipfully admired Mithila saying, 'Excellent, Excellent'
data.anv: सर्वे all, मुनय: ascetics, जनकस्य Janaka's, ताम् that, शुभाम् auspicious, पुरीम् city, दृष्ट्वा having seen, साधु साधु इति excellent, excellent, शंसन्त: admiring, मिथिलाम् Mithila, समपूजयन् worshipped.
data.md: Beholding Janaka's beauteous city, the ascetics exclaiming, 'Excellent' fell to admiring Mithila.

data.v: मिथिलोपवने तत्र आश्रमं दृश्य राघवः । पुराणं निर्जनं रम्यं पप्रच्छ मुनिपुंगवम् ॥
data.es: At the sight of an old uninhabited, beautiful and desolate hermitage in a grove near Mithila, the descendant of the Raghus enquired of the foremost among the ascetics (Viswamitra):
data.anv: राघव: Rama, मिथिलोपवने in a grove near Mithila, पुराणम् oldest, निर्जनम् uninhabited, रम्यम् beautiful, शून्यम् deserted, आश्रमम् hermitage, दृश्य having seen, मुनिपुङ्गवम् foremost of ascetics, पप्रच्छ enquired.
data.md: And in a grove at Mithilā, Rāghava saw an ancient, lonely, and romantic asylum, and asked that foremost of ascetics, saying.

data.v: श्रीमदाश्रमसंकाशं किं न्विदं मुनिवर्जितम् । श्रोतुमिच्छामि भगवन्कस्यायं पूर्व आश्रमः ॥
data.es: "O Venerable one I wish to know why this auspicios looking hermitage was deserted by ascetics? To whom did this belong in the past."
data.anv: भगवन् O Venerable one, श्रीमत् propitious, आश्रमसङ्काशम् looking like a hermitage, मुनिवर्जितम् deserted by ascetics, इदम् this, किं नु what could be? पूर्वम् formerly, अयम् this, आश्रम: hermitage, कस्य whose?, ज्ञातुम् to know, इच्छामि I am desirous.
data.md: What is this that look like an asylum, though without any ascetics? I wish to hear, O worshipful one, to whom this asylum belonged in time past.

data.v: तच्छ्रुता राघवेणोक्तं वाक्यं वाक्यविशारदः । प्रत्युवाच महातेजा विश्वमित्रो महामुनिः ॥
data.es: Eloquent and brilliant Viswamitra, replied to the descendant of the Raghus saying:
data.anv: धर्मात्मा virtuous, महातेजा: resplendent, महामुनि: great sage, विश्वामित्र: Visvamitra, इत्येवम् in this manner, धर्मार्थसहितम् meaing containing religious merit, वच: words, उक्त्वा having spoken, विरराम became silent.
data.md: Hearing this speech addressed by Raghu's descendant that one versed in speech, the highly energetic and mighty saint, Viśvāmitra, answered.

data.v: हन्त ते कथयिष्यामि शृणु तत्त्वेन राघव । यस्यैतदाश्रमपदं शप्तं कोपान्महात्मना ॥
data.es: "O Descendant of the Raghus I shall tell all you about this hermitage cursed by the wrath of a great man.
data.anv: राघव O Rama, महात्मना magnanimous (by whom), कोपात् out of wrath, शप्तम् cursed, इदम् this, आश्रमपदम् hermitage, यस्य whose, तत्त्वेन truthfully, ते to you, कथयिष्यामि I shall tell,  श्रृणु you may listen, हन्त oh
data.md: Ah! Do you listen. I will tell you through the wrath of what high-souled one this hermitage came to he cursed.

data.v: गौतमस्य नरश्रेष्ठ पूर्वमासीन्महात्मनः । आश्रमो दिव्यसंकाशः सुरैरपि सुपूजितः ॥
data.es: O Best among men this hermitage resembling a celestial retreat and wellhonoured even by devatas once belonged to illustrious Gautama.
data.anv: नरश्रेष्ठ O Best among men, Rama, दिव्यसङ्काश: resembling celestial hermitage, सुरैरपि even by devatas, सुपूजित: well honoured, आश्रम: hermitage, पूर्वम् formerly, महात्मन: of the illustrious, गौतमस्य आसीत् belonged to Gautama.
data.md: O foremost of men, this excellent asylum honoured by the celestials themselves, formerly belonged to the high-souled Gautama.

data.v: स चेह तप आतिष्ठदहल्यासहितः पुरा । वर्षपूगान्यनेकानि राजपुत्र महायशः ॥
data.es: O Highly renowned prince it was here in ancient times that Gautama in the company of Ahalya practised austerities for several years.
data.anv: महायश: highly renowned, राजपुत्र prince, पुरा in ancient times, स: he, अहल्यासहित: in the  company of Ahalya, अनेकान् several, वर्षपूगान् series of years, इह here, तप: austerities, अतिष्ठत् practised.
data.md: Here, O illustrious prince, in days of yore Gautama in company with Ahalyā carried on austerities for a long series of years.

data.v: तस्यान्तरं विदित्वा तु सहस्राक्षः शचीपतिः । मुनिवेषधरोऽहल्यामिदं वचनमब्रवीत् ॥
data.es: The thousandeyed Indra, consort of Sachi, having found an opportunity (during the absence of the ascetic), assumed the guise of the ascetic (Gautama) and said to Ahalya:
data.anv: शचीपति: consort of Sachi, सहस्राक्ष: Indra, तस्य his, अन्तरम् opportunity, विदित्वा having found, मुनिवेषधर: assuming the disguise of ascetic, अहल्याम् addressing Ahalya, इदम् वचनम् these words, अब्रवीत् said.
data.md: And perceiving occasion Saci's lord, the thousand-eyed deity assuming the form of that ascetic thus addressed Ahalyā.

data.v: ऋतुकालं प्रतीक्षन्ते नार्थिनः सुसमाहिते । संगमं त्वहमिच्छामि त्वया सह सुमध्यमे ॥
data.es: 'O most beautiful one those overtaken by passion would not await the completion of the menstrual period (favourable for copulation). O woman of fine waist I desire union with you.'
data.anv: सुसमाहिते O Highly beautiful one (with symmetrical limbs), अर्थिन: passionate seekers, ऋतुकालम् a period when women become fresh after menstruation, न प्रतीक्षन्ते would not await, सुमध्यमे O Woman beautiful waist, अहम् I, त्वया सह with you, सङ्गमम् union, इच्छामि am desiring.
data.md: O exceedingly beautiful one, those bent upon sport, do not stay for the menstrual season. And, O graceful one, I desire to enjoy your company (on the instant).

data.v: मुनिवेषं सहस्राक्षं विज्ञाय रघुनन्दन । मतिं चकार दुर्मेधा देवराजकुतूहलात् ॥
data.es: O Delight of the Raghus the evilintentioned Ahalya, inclined towards the king of the celestials and knowing him to be the thousandeyed Indra in the guise of the ascetic, consented for the union.
data.anv: रघुनन्दन O Rama, दुर्मेधा: evilintentioned, मुनिवेषम् in the guise of ascetic, सहस्राक्षम् Indra, विज्ञाय knowing, देवराजकुतूहलात् out of inclination towards the king of celestials, मतिं चकार consented.
data.md: Thereupon, out of curiosity, that one of perverse understanding consented to the proposals of the chief of the celestials.

data.v: अथाब्रवीत्सुरश्रेष्ठं कृतार्थेनान्तरात्मना । कृतार्थोऽसि सुरश्रेष्ठ गच्छ शीघ्रमितः प्रभो । आत्मानं मां च देवेश सर्वदा रक्ष मानदः ॥
data.es: O Foremost of men with her heart's desire fulfilled, Ahalya said: "O Chief of the celestials I'm satisfied. O Lord, quit this place: O Lord of cthe gods, protect yourself and also me from Gautama in all respects."
data.anv: नरश्रेष्ठ O Foremost of men, अथ afterwards, कृतार्थेन having achieved the purpose, अन्तरात्मना whole heartedly, अब्रवीत् spoke, सुरश्रेष्ठ O Chief of celestials, कृतार्था अस्मि I have  succeeded in my desire, प्रभो O Lord, इत: from here, शीघ्रम् quickly, गच्छ go, देवेश O Lord of celestials, आत्मानं च yourself, मां च also me, सर्वदा in all respects, गौतमात् from Gautama, रक्ष protect.
data.md: Then, having attained her object, she spoke to that foremost of the celestials, saying, 'O best of the immortals, I have obtained my desire, do you speedily go from this place, O lord. Do you, O lord of the celestials, from a sense of respectability preserve yourself and me also.'

data.v: इन्द्रस्तु प्रहसन्वाक्यमहल्यामिदमब्रवीत् । सुश्रोणि परितुष्टोऽस्मि गमिष्यामि यथागतम् ॥
data.es: Indra smilingly said to Ahalya, 'O One with lovely hips, I am gratified. I shall go away the way I have come'.
data.anv: इन्द्रस्तु Indra, प्रहसन् smilingly, अहल्याम् addressing Ahalya, इदम् वाक्यम् these words, अब्रवीत् spoke, सुश्रोणि one with lovely hips, परितुष्ट: अस्मि I am gratified, यथागतम् in the way I have come, गमिष्यामि I shall go.
data.md: Indra too said to Ahalyā, 'O you of shapely hips, pleased am I. Now I repair to my own place.'

data.v: एवं संगम्य तु तया निश्चक्रामोटजात्ततः । स संभ्रमात्त्वरन्राम शङ्कितो गौतमं प्रति ॥
data.es: O Rama he (Indra) came out of the leafhut quickly after his union with her, apprehensive of Gautama.
data.anv: राम O Rama, एवम् in this way, तया with her, सङ्गम्य having united, स: he, सम्भ्रमात् out of fear, त्वरन् quickly, गौतमं प्रति about Gautama, शङ्कित: having apprehension, उटजात्    (ततः) from leafy hut, निश्चक्राम came out.
data.md: Having known her thus, Indra, O Rama, exceedingly apprehensive of Gautama, then hurriedly sallied out of the thatched cottage.

data.v: गौतमं स ददर्शाथ प्रविशन्तं महामुनिम् । देवदानवदुर्धर्षं तपोबलसमन्वितम् । तीर्थोदकपरिक्लिन्नं दीप्यमानमिवानलम् । गृहीतसमिधं तत्र सकुशं मुनिपुङ्गवम् ॥
data.es: Subsequently, Indra beheld the great ascetic Gautama, unassailable by devatas and danavas, endowed with the power of ascetism, drenched with sacrifical waters, shining like flaming fire, carrying sacrificial firewood and Kusha grass and preeminent among sages, entering that leaf hut.
data.anv: अथ subsequently, देवदानवदुर्धर्षम् unassilable by devatas and danavas, तपोबलसमन्वितम् endowed with power of ascetism, तीर्थेंदकपरिक्लिन्नम् drenched with by sacrifical waters, अनलमिव like flaming fire, दीप्यमानम् shining, गृहीतसमिधम् carrying sacrificial fuel sticks,  सकुशम् along with Kusha grass, मुनिपुङ्गवम् preeminent among sages, गौतमं महामुनिम् great ascetic Gautama, तत्र there, प्रविशन्तम् entering, ददर्श beheld.
data.md: Just at this time, Indra saw that mighty ascetic Gautama entering, that foremost of anchorets, incapable of being repressed by the deities and the Dānavas, and equipped with ascetic energy, having based in the waters of holy spots, and flaming like fire, carrying faggots and Kuća grass.

data.v: दृष्ट्वा सुरपतिस्त्रस्तो विषण्णवदनोऽभवत् ॥
अथ दृष्ट्वा सहस्राक्षं मुनिवेषधरं मुनिः । दुर्वृत्तं वृत्तसंपन्नो रोषाद्वचनमब्रवीत् ॥
data.es: On seeing him, the face of the Lord of the gods (Indra) turned pale with fear. Having seen the wicked Indra with a thousandeyed in the guise of an ascetic the gentle sage Gautama got enraged and said:
data.anv: सुरपति: Devendra, दृष्ट्वा having seen, त्रस्त: afraid of, विवर्णवदन: pale faced, अभवत् became, अथ thereafter, वृत्तसम्पन्न: wellbehaved, मुनि: sage, मुनिवेषधरम् in the guise of an ascetic, दुर्वुत्तम् illbehaved, सहस्राक्षम् Indra, दृष्ट्वा having seen, रोषात् with  enrangement, वचनम् words, अब्रवीत् spoke.
data.md: And seeing him, the countenance of the lord of the celestials turned pale. And seeing the wicked thousand-eyed deity in the guise of an ascetic, the well-behaved anchorite fired with rage said.

data.v: मम रूपं समास्थाय कृतवानसि दुर्मते । अकर्तव्यमिदं यस्माद्विफलस्त्वं भविष्यति ॥
data.es: "O Wicked natured one assuming my form you have done a forbidden act. For that reason you shall be devoid of scrotum.
data.anv: दुर्मते O Wicked natured one, मम my, रूपम् form, समास्थाय assuming, इदम् this, अकर्तव्यम्  an act which should not be done, कृतवान् असि have done, तस्मात् for that reason, त्वम् you, विफल: devoid of scrotum, भविष्यसि will become.
data.md: 'And since, O you of wicked understanding, assuming my form, you have done this foul. deed, you shall lose your scrotum.'

data.v: गौतमेनैवमुक्तस्य सरोषेण महात्मना । पेततुर्वृषणौ भूमौ सहस्राक्षस्य तत्क्षणात् ॥
data.es: Cursed thus out of anger by eminent Gautama the testicles of Indra immediately dropped down on the earth.
data.anv: सरोषेण with wrath, महात्मना by the eminent, गौतमेन by Gautama, एवम् in  this way, उक्तस्य have been uttered, सहस्राक्षस्य Indra, वृषणौ testacles, तत्क्षणात् immediately, भूमौ on earth, पेततु: dropped.
data.md: And soon as the high-souled Gautama had said this in ire, the scrotum of the thousand-eyed one dropped to the earth.

data.v: तथा शप्त्वा स वै शक्रं भार्यामपि च शप्तवान् । इह वर्षसहस्राणि बहूनि त्वं निवत्स्यसि ॥
data.es: Having thus cursed Indra, he also cursed Ahalya: 'You will be staying here for thousands of years without food and subsisting on air, lying down in ashes, doing penance, without being seen by any living beings in this ashrama'.
data.anv: स: he (the sage), शक्रम् that Indra, तथा in that manner, शप्त्वा having cursed, अहल्यामपि Ahalya also, शप्तवान् had cursed, त्वम् you, इह here, बहूनि many, वर्षसहस्राणि thousands of years, निवत्स्यसि you will live here, वायुभक्षा subsisting on air, निराहारा without food, भस्मशायिनी lying on ashes, तप्यन्ती doing penance, सर्वभूतानाम् to all being, अदृश्या invisible,  अस्मिन् in this, आश्रमे Ashrama, निवत्स्यति you will stay on.

data.v: वायुभक्षा निराहारा तप्यन्ती भस्मशायिनी । अदृश्या सर्वभूतानामाश्रमेऽस्मिन्निवत्स्यसि ॥
data.es: Having thus cursed Indra, he also cursed Ahalya: 'You will be staying here for thousands of years without food and subsisting on air, lying down in ashes, doing penance, without being seen by any living beings in this ashrama'.
data.anv: स: he (the sage), शक्रम् that Indra, तथा in that manner, शप्त्वा having cursed, अहल्यामपि Ahalya also, शप्तवान् had cursed, त्वम् you, इह here, बहूनि many, वर्षसहस्राणि thousands of years, निवत्स्यसि you will live here, वायुभक्षा subsisting on air, निराहारा without food, भस्मशायिनी lying on ashes, तप्यन्ती doing penance, सर्वभूतानाम् to all being, अदृश्या invisible,  अस्मिन् in this, आश्रमे Ashrama, निवत्स्यति you will stay on.

data.v: यदा चैतद्वनं घोरं रामो दशरथात्मजः । आगमिष्यति दुर्धर्षस्तदा पूता भविष्यसि ॥
data.es: 'When the son of Dasaratha, the unassailable Rama enters this dreadful forest, you will be cleansed (of this sin)'.
data.anv: दशरथात्मज: son of Dasaratha, दुर्धर्ष: unassailable, राम: Rama, यदा when, घोरम् dreadful,  एतत् वनम् this forest, आगमिष्यति will come, तदा then, पूता भविष्यसि you will be purified.

data.v: तस्यातिथ्येन दुर्वृत्ते लोभमोहविवर्जिता । मत्सकाशे मुदा युक्ता स्वं वपुर्धारयिष्यसि ॥
data.es: 'O Wickednatured one by offering hospitality to Rama, without covetousness and passion, you will happily live with me by regaining your present form'.
data.anv: दुर्वुत्ते O Wicked natured one, तस्य forhim (Rama), आतिथ्येन by offering hospitality, लोभमोह      विवर्जिता without covetousness and passion, मुदा with joy, युक्ता endowed, मत्सकाशे in my proximity, स्वम् your present, वपु: body, धारयिष्यसि you will regain (assume).

data.v: एवमुक्त्वा महातेजा गौतमो दुष्टचारिणीम् । इममाश्रममुत्सृज्य सिद्धचारणसेविते । हिमवच्छिखरे रम्ये तपस्तेपे महातपाः ॥
data.es: "Highly powerful Gautama who had performed rigid austerities thus cursed the wicked Ahalya and left this hermitage, for the peaks of Himavat mountain served by siddhas and charanas. Here he performed austerities"(said Viswamitra).इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये बालकाण्डे अष्टचत्वारिंशस्सर्ग:॥Thus ends the fortyeighth sarga of Balakanda of the holy Ramayana the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.
data.anv: महातेजा: highly powerful, महातपा: sage having rigid austerities, गौतम: Gautama, दुष्टचारिणीम् possessing bad character, एवम् in this way, उक्त्वा having spoken, इमम् this, आश्रमम् hermitage, उत्सृज्य abandoning, सिद्धचारणसेविते served by Siddhas and Charins, पुण्ये holy, हिमवच्छिखरे peaks of Himavat mountain, तप: austerities, तेपे performed.
data.md: Having said this the highly energetic Gautama of rigid austerities, forsaking this hermitage, began to carry on penances on the romantic summit of the Himavat, inhabited by Siddhas and Caranas.

data.v: अफलस्तु ततः शक्रो देवानग्निपुरोगमान् । अब्रवीत्त्रस्तवदनः सर्षिसंघान्सचारणान् ॥
data.es: Deprived of testicles, Indra with a frightened face addressed hordes of rishis and charanas with agni in the forefront.
data.anv: तत: thereafter, अफल: having been deprived of his testacles, शक्र: Indra, त्रस्तवदन: with freightened face, सर्षिस्सङ्घान् with groups of rishis, सचारणान् with charanas, अग्निपुरोगमान् with Agni in the forefront, देवान् addressing devatas, अब्रवीत् spoke.
data.md: And having been deprived of his scrotum, Śakra with eyes tremulous with fear, addressed the celestials with Agni at their head, as well as he Siddhas and the Gandharvas and the Cāraņas, saying,

data.v: कुर्वता तपसो विघ्नं गौतमस्य महात्मनः । क्रोधमुत्पाद्य हि मया सुरकार्यमिदं कृतम् ॥
data.es: 'I have accomplished the objective of the devatas by creating obstacles to Gautama's austerities, evoking in consequence the wrath of the magnanimous sage'.
data.anv: महात्मन: magnanimous, गौतमस्य Gautama's, क्रोधम् wrath, उत्पाद्य evoking, तपस: austerities, विघ्नम् obstacles, कुर्वता while creating, मया by me, इदम् this, सुरकार्यम् the work of celestials, कृतम् has been done.
data.md: I have accomplished the work of the celestials by stirring the ire of the high-souled Gautama, and thereby disturbing his austerities.

data.v: अफलोऽस्मि कृतस्तेन क्रोधात्सा च निराकृता । शापमोक्षेण महता तपोऽस्यापहृतं मया ॥
data.es: 'By his (Gautama's) wrath I have been deprived of my testicles. She (Ahalya) has been deserted by him. He has lost his ascetic energy through the pronouncement of this great curse'.
data.anv: तेन by his, क्रोधात् wrath, अफल: deprived of testacles, कृत: अस्मि I been made, सा च also she, निराकृता was rejected, महता great, शापमोक्षेण by conferring curse, अस्य his, तप: ascetic energy, मया by me, अपहृतम् has been stolen.
data.md: And in doing so, I have been deprived of my scrotum; and Ahalyā also has been put down. And I have deprived him of his ascetic energy by causing him to utter a mighty curse.

data.v: तन्मां सुरवराः सर्वे सर्षिसंघाः सचारणाः । सुरसाह्यकरं सर्वे सफलं कर्तुमर्हथ ॥
data.es: 'For that reason, O rishis, charanas and great devatas it is your duty to restore my testicles for the benefit I have given you'.
data.anv: तस्मात् for that reason, सर्षिसङ्घा: with hosts of rishis, सचारणा: with charanas, सर्वे all, सुरवरा: excellent devatas, सुरसाह्यकरम् for the benefit of devatas, सफलम् restoration of my testicles, कर्तुम् to do, अर्हथ it is your duty.
data.md: And, therefore, you celestials, and saints, and Cāraņas, you should restore my scrotum to me who have served the gods.'

data.v: शतक्रतोर्वचः श्रुत्वा देवाः साग्निपुरोगमाः । पितृदेवानुपेत्याहुः सह सर्वैर्मरुद्गणैः ॥
data.es: 'Hearing Indra, all the devatas accompanied by maruts. Lead by the Firegod devatas approached and said':
data.anv: साग्निपुरोगमा: with Agni in the forefront, देवा: devtas, शतक्रतो: Indra's (performer of one hundred sacrifices), वच: words, श्रुत्वा having heard, सर्वे all, मरुद्गणै: सह accompanied by hosts of maruts, पितृदेवान् pitrudevatas, उपेत्य having approached, आहु: said.
data.md: Hearing Satakratu's (performer of an hundred sacrifices, one of the appellations of Indra). The manes of ancestors. words, the deities along with the Maruts led by Agni, presented themselves before the divine Pitrs. And then Agni addressed the latter, saying.

data.v: अयं मेषः सवृषणः शक्रो ह्यवृषणः कृतः । मेषस्य वृषणौ गृह्य शक्रायाशु प्रयच्छत ॥
data.es: 'This ram (which has received the share of your sacrificial offerings) has testicles. As Indra has been deprived of his own take these testicles immediately and graft them on to Indra'.
data.anv: अयम् this, मेष: the ram, सवृषण: has testicles, शक्र: Indra, अवृषण: is without testicles, कृत: हि has been rendered, मेषस्य ram's, वृषणौ testicles, गृह्य taking, आशु immediately, शक्राय for Indra, प्रयच्छथ furnish.
data.md: This ram is possessed of a scrotum; while Śakra has been deprived of his. Do you taking the scrotum of the ram furnish Sakra with it.

data.v: अफलस्तु कृतो मेषः परां तुष्टिं प्रदास्यति । भवतां हर्षणार्थाय ये च दास्यन्ति मानवाः ॥
data.anv: अफल: without testicles, कृत: made, मेष: the ram, भवताम् for you, पराम् great, तुष्टिम् joy, प्रदास्यति will give, ये मानवा: those men, दास्यन्ति will give, हर्षणार्थाय for causing delight.
data.md: And although deprived of the scrotum, the will be able to grant consummate satisfaction to you. And on those that will offer such a ram for your entertainment, you will bestow undying and profuse merit.'

data.v: अग्नेस्तु वचनं श्रुत्वा पितृदेवाः समागताः । उत्पाट्य मेषवृषणौ सहस्राक्षे न्यवेदयन् ॥
data.es: Hearing the words of the Firegod the pitrudevatas assembled, uprooted the testicles of the ram and grafted them on to Indra.
data.anv: समागता: assembled, पितृदेवा: pitrudevatas, अग्ने: Agni's, वचनम् words, श्रुत्वा having heard, मेषवृषणौ testicles of ram, उत्पाट्य extracting, सहस्राक्षे for Indra, न्यवेशयन् grafted.
data.md: ram Hearing Agni's speech, the assembled Pitrs, rooting up the scrotum of the ram, joined it to the person of the thousand-eyed deity.

data.v: तदा प्रभृति काकुत्स्थ पितृदेवाः समागताः । अफलान्भुञ्जते मेषान्फलैस्तेषामयोजयन् ॥
data.es: "O Son of the Kakutsthas from then on the pitrudevatas have been accepting rams without testicles as offerings in a sacrifice, with ram's testicles fitted on to Indra.
data.anv: काकुत्स्थ O Kakutstha, समागता: assembled, पितृदेवा: pitrudevatas, तदा प्रभृति then onwards, अफलान् without genitals, मेषान् rams, भुञ्जते accepted as offerings, तेषाम् their, फलै: their testicles, अयोजयन् having fitted.
data.md: Thence forth, O Kākutstha, the divine Pitrs together feast upon scrotumless rams, for their scrotum had been joined to the person of Indra.

data.v: इन्द्रस्तु मेषवृषणस्तदा प्रभृति राघव । गौतमस्य प्रभावेन तपसश्च महात्मनः ॥
data.es: O Son of the Raghus illustrious Gautama's power of ascetism was such that thenceforth Indra possessed the testicles of a ram.
data.anv: राघव O Rama, महात्मन: illustrious, गौतमस्य Gautama's, तपस: ascetism, प्रभावेन with the power of, इन्द्र: तु Indra, तदाप्रभृति thenceforth, मेषवृषण: च testicles of ram.
data.md: Thenceforth, O Rāghava, Indra also through the high-souled Gautama's ascetic energy, has been bearing the scrotum of a ram.

data.v: तदागच्छ महातेज आश्रमं पुण्यकर्मणः । तारयैनां महाभागामहल्यां देवरूपिणीम् ॥
data.es: "Most brilliant Rama therefore enter the hermitage of the pious (Gautama) and liberate this fortunate Ahalya of divine appearance (from the curse)."
data.anv: महातेज: O Highly lustrous Rama, तत् therefore, पुण्यकर्मण: of the pious one, आश्रमम् hermitage of Gautama, आगच्छ enter, महाभागाम् fortunate, देवरूपिणीम् woman of divine appearance, एनाम् this, अहल्यां Ahalya, तारय liberate.
data.md: Therefore, O highly powerful one, do you enter into the hermitage of that pious one, and deliver the dignified and divinely fair Ahalyā.

data.v: विश्वामित्रवचः श्रुत्वा राघवः सहलक्ष्मणः । विश्वामित्रं पुरस्कृत्य आश्रमं प्रविवेश ह ॥
data.es: On hearing the words of Viswamitra, Rama along with Lakshmana, filled with astonishment said to him:
data.anv: सहलक्ष्मण: together with Lakshmana, राघव: Rama, विश्वामित्रवच: words of Visvamitra, श्रुत्वा having listened, परमम् great, विस्मयम् astonishment, गत्वा having obtained, अथ thereafter, विश्वामित्रम् addressing Visvamitra, अब्रवीत् spoke.
data.md: On hearing Viśvāmitra's words, Rāghava in company with Lakşmaņa, placing Viśvāmitra in their front, entered the asylum.

data.v: ददर्श च महाभागां तपसा द्योतितप्रभाम् । लोकैरपि समागम्य दुर्निरीक्ष्यां सुरासुरैः ॥
प्रयत्नान्निर्मितां धात्रा दिव्यां मायामयीमिव । धूमेनाभिपरीताङ्गीं पूर्णचन्द्रप्रभामिव ॥
सतुषारावृतां साभ्रां पूर्णचन्द्रप्रभामिव । मध्येऽम्भसो दुराधर्षां दीप्तां सूर्यप्रभामिव ॥
data.es: Rama beheld the highly fortunate Ahalya, shining brilliantly with the power of her asceticism. She could not be seen even by men, suras or asuras joined together. She looked divine and illusory as if created with special efforts by Brahma. Though not clearly visible, she was shining bright like the light of the full Moon muffled by mists in the sky and like the inviolable light of the Sun reflected in the water.
data.anv: महाभागाम् highly fortunate, तपसा with the power of ascetism, द्योतितप्रभाम् shining brilliantly, लोकैरपि by men, सुरासुरै: by suras or asuras, समागम्य joined together, दुर्निरीक्ष्याम् incapable of being seen, धात्रा by lord Brahma, प्रयत्नात् with special efforts, निर्मिताम् created, दिव्याम् divine, मायामयीमिव looking like illusory image, तुषारावृताम् covered by mist, साभ्राम् with clouds, पूर्णचन्द्रप्रभामिव looking like brightness of full moon, अम्भस: in the sky, मध्ये in the midst, दुराधर्षाम् inviolable, दीप्ताम् shining, सूर्यप्रभामिव like brightness of sun, स: Rama, ददर्श beheld.

data.v: स हि गौतमवाक्येन दुर्निरीक्ष्या बभूव ह । त्रयाणामपि लोकानां यावद्रामस्य दर्शनम् ॥
data.es: By the words of Gautama, she became invisible to the three worlds till the appearance of Rama.
data.anv: सा she, गौतमवाक्येन with the words of Gautama, रामस्य Rama's, दर्शनम्यावत् till the appearance of Rama, त्रयाणामपि लोकानाम् even for three worlds, दुर्निरीक्ष्या incapable of being seen by any, बभूव ह became.
data.md: And by virtue of Gautama's word, she had been incapable of being seen by any in the three worlds, till the sight of Rāma. And now the curse having come to an end, she could be perceived by them.

data.v: राघवौ तु ततस्तस्याः पादौ जगृहतुस्तदा । स्मरन्ती गौतमवचः प्रतिजग्राह सा च तौ ॥
पाद्यमर्घ्यं तथातिथ्यं चकार सुसमाहिता । प्रतिजग्राह काकुत्स्थो विधिदृष्टेन कर्मणा ॥
data.es: Recalling the words of Gautama, she received them with water to wash their feet and offerings made with due devotion Rama accepted her hospitality extended in accordance tradition.
data.anv: सा च she also, गौतमवच: words of Gautama, स्मरन्ती recalling, तौ them, प्रतिजग्राह received with due honours, सुसमाहिता with concentration of mind and attention, पाद्यम् water for washing feet, अर्घ्यम् offerings of reverence, तथा and, आतिथ्यम् hospitality, विधिदृष्टेन according to tradition, कर्मणा by acts, चकार performed, काकुत्स्थः Kakusthsa, प्रतिजग्राह received.

data.v: पुष्पवृष्टिर्महत्यासीद्देवदुन्दुभिनिस्वनैः । गन्धर्वाप्सरसां चापि महानासीत्समागमः ॥
data.es: The departure of glorious Viswamitra was greeted with incessant showers of flowers, the beating of celestial drums and the blowing of conches.
data.anv: महात्मनि glorious Visvamitra, प्रयाते तु when he had departed, महती incessant, पुष्पवृष्टि: showers of flowers, देवदुन्दुभिनिस्वनै: with the sounds of celestial drums, शङ्खदुन्दुभिनिर्घोष: आसीत् sounds of blowing conches and beating drums arose.
data.md: And the Kākutstha accepted the homage thus rendered according to the ordinance. And blossoms began to shower copiously to the sounds of kettledrums; and the Gandharvas and the Apsaras began to rejoice greatly.

data.v: साधु साध्विति देवास्तामहल्यां समपूजयन् । तपोबलविशुद्धाङ्गीं गौतमस्य वशानुगाम् ॥
data.es: On seeing Ahalya, her body purified by the power of penance at Gautama's command, the devatas worshipfully exclaimed, 'Excellent, Excellent'
data.anv: गौतमस्य Gautama's, वशानुगाम् in the possession of, तपोबलविशुद्धाङ्गीम् her body purified by the power of penance, ताम् that, अहल्याम् Ahalya, देवा: devatas, साधु साधु इति 'Excellent', 'Excellent', समपूजयन् exclaimed.
data.md: And exclaiming, 'Excellent, excellent,' the celestials honoured Ahalyā, as with as person purified by penance, she again come under Gautama's governance.

data.v: गौतमोऽपि महातेजा अहल्यासहितः सुखी । रामं संपूज्य विधिवत्तपस्तेपे महातपाः ॥
data.es: Brilliant Gautam, the great ascetic, along with Ahalya, worshipped Rama according to tradition, with delight and continued with his austerities.
data.anv: महातपा: possessed of great ascetism, महातेजा: highly glorious, गौतमोऽपि Gautama also, अहल्यासहित: accompanied by Ahalya, सुखी full of joy, रामम् Rama, विधिवत् according to tradition, सम्पूज्य having worshipped, तप: austerities, तेपे performed.
data.md: And the highly energetic Gautama also happy on his union with Ahalyā, honoured Rāma highly, and that one of mighty mortifications then became engaged in austerities.

data.v: रामोऽपि परमां पूजां गौतमस्य महामुनेः । सकाशाद्विधिवत्प्राप्य जगाम मिथिलां ततः ॥
data.es: Having received due hospitality from the great ascetic Gautama Rama also set out towards Mithila.इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये बालकाण्डे एकोनपञ्चाशस्सर्गः॥Thus ends the fortyninth sarga of Balakanda of the holy Ramayana the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.
data.anv: रामोऽपि Rama also, गौतमस्य महामुने: of the great ascetic Gautama, सकाशात् from him, परमाम् great, पूजाम् hospitality, विधिवत् according to tradition, प्राप्य having received, मिथिलाम् towards Mithila, जगाम had gone.
data.md: And having duly received signal honours from the great ascetic Gautama, Rāma set out for Mithila.

data.v: ततः प्रागुत्तरां गत्वा रामः सौमित्रिणा सह । विश्वामित्रं पुरस्कृत्य यज्ञवाटमुपागमत् ॥
data.es: Thereafter the destroyers of foes, Rama and Lakshmana offering their morning oblations on that bright dawn arrived at the bank of the river (Ganga) with Viswamitra ahead of them.
data.anv: तत: thereafter, अरिन्दमौ two destroyers of enemies, विमले on a pure, प्रभाते daybreak, कृताह्निकम् by observing daily oblations, विश्वामित्रम् Viswamitra, पुरस्कृत्य ahead of them नद्या: river's, तीरम्  bank, उपागतौ arrived.
data.md: Then proceeding north-east Rāma is company with Sumitrā's son, placing Viśvāmitra at their head, appeared before the sacrificial ground.

data.v: रामस्तु मुनिशार्दूलमुवाच सहलक्ष्मणः । साध्वी यज्ञसमृद्धिर्हि जनकस्य महात्मनः ॥
data.es: Rama with Lakshmana told the tiger among ascetics Viswamitra that the preparations or the sacrifice by the illustrious king Janaka were excellent.
data.anv: सहलक्ष्मण: along with Lakshmana, रामस्तु Rama, मुनिशार्दूलं addressing tiger among ascetics, Visvamitra, उवाच said, महात्मन: illustrious, जनकस्य Janaka's, यज्ञसमृद्धि:  extensive preparations for sacrifice, साध्वी are excellent.
data.md: And Rāma and Lakşmaņa said to that puissant ascetic, Great is the pomp and splendour of the high-souled Janaka's sacrifice. And, o pious one, many thousand of Brāhmaṇas inhabiting various regions, and well-read in the Vedas (have come to this sacrifice);2-3

data.v: बहूनीह सहस्राणि नानादेशनिवासिनाम् । ब्राह्मणानां महाभाग वेदाध्ययनशालिनाम् ॥
data.es: O Illustrious sage thousands of brahmins living in different countries and versed in the study of the vedas have assembled here. The shelters for ascetics are thronged with hundreds of carts. O Great ascetic let us choose a place where we can stay.
data.anv: महाभाग O Illustrious one, इह here, नानादेशनिवासिनाम् living in different countries,  वेदाध्ययन शालिनाम् of those who studied the vedas, ब्राह्मणानां of Brahmins, बहूनि सहस्राणि in many thousands, शकटीशतसङ्कुला: thronged with hundreds of carts, ऋषिवाटाश्च shelters for ascetics, दृश्यन्ते are seen, ब्रह्मन् O Great ascetic, वयम् we, यत्र where, वत्स्यामहे can rest, देश: place, विधीयताम् be determined.
data.md: And Rāma and Lakşmaņa said to that puissant ascetic, Great is the pomp and splendour of the high-souled Janaka's sacrifice. And, o pious one, many thousand of Brāhmaṇas inhabiting various regions, and well-read in the Vedas (have come to this sacrifice);2-3

data.v: ऋषिवाटाश्च दृश्यन्ते शकटीशतसंकुलाः । देशो विधीयतां ब्रह्मन्यत्र वत्स्यामहे वयम् ॥
data.es: O Illustrious sage thousands of brahmins living in different countries and versed in the study of the vedas have assembled here. The shelters for ascetics are thronged with hundreds of carts. O Great ascetic let us choose a place where we can stay.
data.anv: महाभाग O Illustrious one, इह here, नानादेशनिवासिनाम् living in different countries,  वेदाध्ययन शालिनाम् of those who studied the vedas, ब्राह्मणानां of Brahmins, बहूनि सहस्राणि in many thousands, शकटीशतसङ्कुला: thronged with hundreds of carts, ऋषिवाटाश्च shelters for ascetics, दृश्यन्ते are seen, ब्रह्मन् O Great ascetic, वयम् we, यत्र where, वत्स्यामहे can rest, देश: place, विधीयताम् be determined.
data.md: And the abodes of ascetics are thronged with hundreds of cars. Do you, O Brahmana, arrange for some place were we may put up.

data.v: रामस्य वचनं श्रुत्वा विश्वामित्रो महामुनिः । निवेशमकरोद्देशे विविक्ते सलिलायुते ॥
data.es: Great ascetic Viswamitra, hearing Rama's words, chose a nottoocrowded place near a watersource for encampment.
data.anv: महामुनि: great ascetic, विश्वामित्र: Visvamitra, रामस्य Rama's, वचनम् words, श्रुत्वा having listened, सलिलायुते provided with water, विविक्ते in a peaceful, देशे place, निवेशम् encampment, अकरोत् chosen.
data.md: Hearing Rāma's words, the mighty ascetic Viśvāmitra selected for their abode a wellwatered spot free from bustle and tumult.

data.v: विश्वामित्रं मुनिश्रेष्ठं श्रुत्वा स नृपतिस्तदा । शतानन्दं पुरस्कृत्य पुरोहितमनिन्दितम् ॥
data.es: When the king heard of the arrival of Viswamitra he went forward with Satananda, the blemishless family priest walking ahead in order to welcome him with humility.
data.anv: स: नृपति: that king, तदा then, विश्वामित्रम् Viswamitra, अनुप्राप्तम् arrived, श्रुत्वा having heard, अनिन्दितम् free from blemish, पुरोहितम् family priest, शतानन्दम् Satananda, पुरस्कृत्य in front of him, विनयेन with due respect, समन्वित: followed by, सहसा quickly, प्रत्युज्जगाम went forward to welcome him.

data.v: ऋत्विजोऽपि महात्मानस्त्वर्घ्यमादाय सत्वरम् । विश्वामित्राय धर्मेण ददुर्मन्त्रपुरस्कृतम् ॥
data.es: Eminent officiating priests speedily brought the offerings of worship and paid obeisance to Viswamitra with prayers.
data.anv: महात्मान: eminent, ऋत्विजोऽपि officiating priests also, सत्वरम् quickly, अर्घ्यम् offerings of worship, आदाय having brought, मन्त्रपुरस्कृतम् with prayers, विश्वामित्राय for Viswamitra, ददु: offered.

data.v: प्रतिगृह्य तु तां पूजां जनकस्य महात्मनः । पप्रच्छ कुशलं राज्ञो यज्ञस्य च निरामयम् ॥
data.es: Viswamitra received illustrious king Janaka's worship and enquired about the welfare of the king and the conduct of the sacrifice.
data.anv: महात्मन: of the Illustrious, जनकस्य Janaka's, तां पूजाम् that homage, प्रतिगृह्य having received, राज्ञ: about king,  कुशलम् welfare, यज्ञस्य about sacrifice, निरामयम् च welfare, पप्रच्छ enquired.
data.md: Having accepted that homage of the highsouled Janaka, the ascetic enquired after the king's welfare, and the uninterrupted performance of his sacrifice. And the king together with his priests, having enquired of the ascetics as to their welfare, cheerfully embraced them all in a proper way.

data.v: स तांश्चापि मुनीन्पृष्ट्वा सोपाध्याय पुरोधसः । यथान्यायं ततः सर्वैः समागच्छत्प्रहृष्टवान् ॥
data.es: Viswamitra duly enquired the wellbeing of the sages and the spiritual teachers, priests in right order. And thereafter the rest joined them in great delight.
data.anv: स: Visvamitra, सोपाध्यायपुरोधस: together with spiritual teachers, priests, तान् मुनीन् sages, यथान्यायम् in accordance with tradition, पृष्ट्वा having enquired, तत: afterwards, प्रहृष्टवत् like an immesely delighted person, सर्वै: all, समागच्छत् joined them.

data.v: अथ राजा मुनिश्रेष्ठं कृताञ्जलिरभाषत । आसने भगवानास्तां सहैभिर्मुनिसत्तमैः ॥
data.es: The king then folded his hands in supplication to the foremost of ascetics, Viswamitra, saying "O Venerable one please be seated along with the eminent ascetics."
data.anv: अथ thereafter, राजा the king, कृताञ्जलि: folding the hands in supplication, मुनिश्रेष्ठम् formost of ascetics, अभाषत uttered, भगवान् O Venerable one, एभि: मुनिपुङ्गवै: सह along with these eminent ascetics, आसने seat, आस्ताम् you may be seated.
data.md: Then he with clasped hands, spoke to that foremost of anchorets, saying, O worshipful one, do you along with these eminent ascetics take your seat.

data.v: जनकस्य वचः श्रुत्वा निषसाद महामुनिः । पुरोधा ऋत्विजश्चैव राजा च सह मन्त्रिभिः ॥
data.es: In response to Janaka's words, great sage Viswamitra occupied his seat. Thereafter the family priests, officiationg priests of the sacrifice, counsellors and also the king occupied their seats according to their rank.
data.anv: जनकस्य Janaka's, वच: words, श्रुत्वा having listened, महामुनि: great sage, निषसाद sat down, पुरोधा: family priest, ऋत्विजश्चैव and also officiating priests of the sacrifice, मन्त्रिभि: सह along with counsellors, राजा च and also the king (sat down).
data.md: Hearing Janaka's words, the mighty ascetic sat him down. And the king also, in company with his priests and counsellors sat down around in order of rank.

data.v: आसनेषु यथान्यायमुपविष्टान्समन्ततः । दृष्ट्वा स नृपतिस्तत्र विश्वामित्रमथाब्रवीत् ॥
data.es: Thereafter the king looked on all sides and saw all of them seated according to their rank and addressed Viswamitra saying:
data.anv: अथ afterwards, स: नृपति: that king, तत्र there, समन्तत: on all sides, यथान्यायम् in accordance with their rank, आसनेषु in their seats, उपविष्टान् seated persons, दृष्ट्वा having seen, विश्वामित्रम् addressing, अब्रवीत् spoke.

data.v: अद्य यज्ञसमृद्धिर्मे सफला दैवतैः कृता । अद्य यज्ञफलं प्राप्तं भगवद्दर्शनान्मया ॥
data.es: "Today my sacrifice has been rendered fruitful by the devatas. I have reaped the fruit of my sacrifice today by your venerable presence.
data.anv: अद्य today, मे my, यज्ञसमृध्दि: prosperity of my sacrifice, सफला is fruitful, दैवतै: by devatas, कृता has been rendered, अद्य today, भगवद्दर्शनात् by your venerable presence, मया by me, यज्ञफलम् fruit of my sacrifice, प्राप्तम् has been obtained.

data.v: धन्योऽस्म्यनुगृहीतोऽस्मि यस्य मे मुनिपुंगव । यज्ञोपसदनं ब्रह्मन्प्राप्तोऽसि मुनिभिः सह ॥
data.es: "O Sage no one is more blessed than me since you have favoured me with your arrival in my country."इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये बालकाण्डे सप्तचत्वारिंशस्सर्ग:॥Thus ends the fortyseventh sarga of Balakanda of the holy Ramayana the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.
data.anv: यस्य मे my, विषयम् country, मुनि: Muni (you), सम्प्राप्त: has visited, दर्शनम् चैव having graced all of us, धन्य: अस्मि blessed am I, अनुगृहीत: अस्मि I am ( highly )favoured, मम for me, न अस्ति धन्यतर: there is none more blessed than me.

data.v: द्वादशाहं तु ब्रह्मर्षे शेषमाहुर्मनीषिणः । ततो भागार्थिनो देवान्द्रष्टुमर्हसि कौशिक ॥
data.es: O Brahmarshi learned men say, only twelve days remain for completion of this acrifice. Thereafter O Viswamitra you should see devatas claiming their shares".
data.anv: ब्रह्मर्षे O Brahmarshi, मनीषिण: learned men, द्वादशाहन्तु twelve days only, शेषम् remain, आहु: are saying, कौशिक Visvamitra, तत: thereafter, भागार्थिन: claiming their share, देवान् devatas, द्रष्टुम् to see, अर्हसि behoves of you.
data.md: Twelve days, O Brahmarși, have been fixed for the period of initiation by the sages. On the expiry of that term, you will, O Kausika, behold the celestials come to the sacrifice for claiming their respective shares.

data.v: इत्युक्त्वा मुनिशार्दूलं प्रहृष्टवदनस्तदा । पुनस्तं परिपप्रच्छ प्राञ्जलिः प्रयतो नृपः ॥
data.es: Having said this, the king (Janaka) with a cheerful countenance and saluting with folded palms again asked that tiger among ascetics (Viswamitra):
data.anv: नृप: king, मुनिशार्दूलम् addressing tiger among ascetics, इति in this way, उक्त्वा having said, तदा then, प्रहृष्टवदन: with cheerful countenance, प्राञ्जलि: with folded palms, प्रणत: saluting in reverence, पुन: again, तम् him, परिपप्रच्छ asked.
data.md: Having said this, the king with a cheerful countenance, with folded hands, again intently asked that foremost of ascetics.

data.v: इमौ कुमारौ भद्रं ते देवतुल्यपराक्रमौ । गजसिंहगती वीरौ शार्दूलवृषभोपमौ ॥
पद्मपत्रविशालाक्षौ खड्गतूणीधनुर्धरौ । अश्विनाविव रूपेण समुपस्थितयौवनौ ॥
यदृच्छयैव गां प्राप्तौ देवलोकादिवामरौ । कथं पद्भ्यामिह प्राप्तौ किमर्थं कस्य वा मुने ॥
वरायुधधरौ वीरौ कस्य पुत्रौ महामुने । भूषयन्ताविमं देशं चन्द्रसूर्याविवाम्बरम् ॥
data.es: Great ascetic, these two young men with hair falling on their temples like the wings of a crow, each of them resemble the other in personality, expressions and gestures. Wielding excellent weapons they adorn this land like the Moon and the Sun deck the sky. Whose sons are they? I wish truly to hear about these heroes".
data.anv: महामुने O Great ascetic, वरायुधधरौ holding excellent weapons, वीरौ these heros, कस्य whose, पुत्रौ sons, चन्द्रसूर्यौ Moon and Sun, अम्बरमिव like the sky, इमम् this, देशम् land, भूषयन्तौ adorning, प्रमाणेङ्गितचेष्टितै: in personality, expressions and gestures, परस्परस्य each other, सदृशौ resemble, काकपक्षधरौ mesh of hair falling on their temples, वीरौ about these heroes, तत्त्वत: truely, श्रोतुम् to listen, इच्छामि desiring.

data.v: परस्परस्य सदृशौ प्रमाणेङ्गितचेष्टितैः । काकपक्षधरौ वीरौ श्रोतुमिच्छामि तत्त्वतः ॥
data.es: O Great ascetic they resemble each other in personality, expression and gestures. They adorn this land like Sun and moon in the sky holding excellent weapons. These heroes have trodden paths difficult to traverse. For what purpose have they come? I want to hear clearly".
data.anv: मुनिश्रेष्ठ O Great ascetic, प्रमाणेङ्गितचेष्टितै: in personality, in expressions and gestures,  परस्परस्य each other, सदृशौ resemble, चन्द्रसूर्यौ Moon and Sun, अम्बरमिव in the sky, इमम् this, देशम् country, भूषयन्तौ adorning, वरायुधधरौ holding excellent weapons, वीरौ heroes, दुर्गमे difficult to traverse, पथि paths, किमर्थम् for what purpose, सम्प्राप्तौ have come, तत्त्वत: truly, श्रोतुम् to listen, इच्छामि I am desirous.

data.v: तस्य तद्वचनं श्रुत्वा जनकस्य महात्मनः । न्यवेदयन्महात्मानौ पुत्रौ दशरथस्य तौ ॥
data.es: "Hearing the words of the Firegod, Ganga assumed a divine form. Beholding her glory, the god of fire pervaded her from all sides.
data.anv: तस्य that firegod's, तद्वचनम् those words, श्रुत्वा having heard, दिव्यम् divine, रूपम् form, अधारयत् assumed, स: that firedeity, तन्महिमानम् her greatness, दृष्ट्वा beholding, समन्तात् on all sides, अवकीर्यत split over.
data.md: Hearing this speech of the high-souled Janaka, that ascetic of immeasurable soul related all about Dasaratha's sons.

data.v: सिद्धाश्रमनिवासं च राक्षसानां वधं तथा । तच्चागमनमव्यग्रं विशालायाश्च दर्शनम् ॥
data.md: Their sojourn in Siddhāśrama, and the slaughter there of the Raksasas, their undaunted journey, the sight of Viśālā, the encounter with Ahalyā and Gautama, Rāma's curiosity about the mighty bow, and visit there for beholding the same.

data.v: अहल्यादर्शनं चैव गौतमेन समागमम् । महाधनुषि जिज्ञासां कर्तुमागमनं तथा ॥
data.md: Their sojourn in Siddhāśrama, and the slaughter there of the Raksasas, their undaunted journey, the sight of Viśālā, the encounter with Ahalyā and Gautama, Rāma's curiosity about the mighty bow, and visit there for beholding the same.

data.v: एतत्सर्वं महातेजा जनकाय महात्मने । निवेद्य विररामाथ विश्वामित्रो महामुनिः ॥
data.md: Having related all this to the high-souled Janaka, that one endowed with exceeding energy, the mighty ascetic Viśvāmitra, paused.

data.v: तस्य तद्वचनं श्रुत्वा विश्वामित्रस्य धीमतः । हृष्टरोमा महातेजाः शतानन्दो महातपाः ॥
data.es: On hearing the words of sagacious Kusanabha, his hundred daughters touched his feet with their heads and said:
data.anv: धीमत: of sagacious, तस्य कुशनाभस्य of that Kusanabha's, तद्वचनम् those words, श्रुत्वा having heard, कन्याशतम् the hundred maidens, शिरोभि: with their heads, चरणौ his feet, स्पृष्ट्वा having touched, अभाषत said.
data.md: Hearing the narration of the intelligent Viśvāmitra, Gautama's eldest son, the exceedingly energetic Śatänanda of rigid austerities, highly effulgent by virtue of his asceticism, with his down standing on end wondered greatly at the sight of Rāma.

data.v: गौतमस्य सुतो ज्येष्ठस्तपसा द्योतितप्रभः । रामसंदर्शनादेव परं विस्मयमागतः ॥
data.es: Satananda the eldest son of Gautama, a great sage who looked brilliant with the power of austerities was thrilled to hear the words of Viswamitra the intellectual and experienced great astonishment on beholding Rama.
data.anv: धीमत: intellectual, तस्य विश्वामित्रस्य this Visvamitra's, तत् वचनम् that word, श्रुत्वा having heard, महातेजा: possessing great splendour, महातपा: great austerities, गौतमस्य Gautama's, ज्येष्ठ: eldest, सुत: son, तपसा with ascetism, द्योतितप्रभ: effulgent, शतानन्द: Satananda, हृष्टरोमा: thrilled, रामसन्दर्शनादेव on beholding Rama, परम् great, विस्मयम् astonishment, आगत: obtained.
data.md: Hearing the narration of the intelligent Viśvāmitra, Gautama's eldest son, the exceedingly energetic Śatänanda of rigid austerities, highly effulgent by virtue of his asceticism, with his down standing on end wondered greatly at the sight of Rāma.

data.v: स तौ निषण्णौ संप्रेक्ष्य सुखासीनौ नृपात्मजौ । शतानन्दो मुनिश्रेष्ठं विश्वामित्रमथाब्रवीत् ॥
data.es: Satananda saw the two princes comfortably seated nearby and said to Viswamitra, the foremost of the ascetics:
data.anv: अथ afterwards, स: शतानन्द: Satananda, निषण्णौ sitting nearby, सुखासीनौ comfortably seated, तौ नृपात्मजौ the two princes, सम्प्रेक्ष्य having seen, मुनिश्रेष्ठम् foremost of ascetics, विश्वामित्रम् addressing Visvamitra, अब्रवीत् said.
data.md: And seeing the king's sons seated at their ease, he said to that foremost of ascetics. Visvamitra.

data.v: अपि ते मुनिशार्दूल मम माता यशस्विनी । दर्शिता राजपुत्राय तपो दीर्घमुपागता ॥
data.es: "O Tiger among ascetics, was my renowned mother who had been practising intense austerities for long shown to the prince (Rama)?
data.anv: मुनिशार्दूल O Tiger (great) among ascetics, दीर्घम् for long period, तप: austerities, उपागता having acquired, यशस्विनी renowned, मम my, माता mother, ते by you, राजपुत्राय to the prince, अपि दर्शिता has been show?
data.md: O most powerful of anchorets, by you was my illustrious mother, grown old in asceticism, shown to the king's son.

data.v: अपि रामे महातेजो मम माता यशस्विनी । वन्यैरुपाहरत्पूजां पूजार्हे सर्वदेहिनाम् ॥
data.es: Did my highly lustrous and celebrated mother offer homage to Rama, worthy of reverence by all living beings, with things available in the forest?
data.anv: महातेजा: highly lustrous, यशस्विनी celebrated, मम माता my mother, सर्वदेहिनाम् for all living beings, पूजार्हे worthy of reverence, रामे to Rama, वन्यै: with things available in forest, पूजाम् homage, अपि उपाहरत् did she offer?
data.md: Did my famous and exalted mother entertain with the produce of the woods this one worthy of every one's homage?

data.v: अपि रामाय कथितं यथावृत्तं पुरातनम् । मम मातुर्महातेजो देवेन दुरनुष्ठितम् ॥
data.es: O highly powerful sage, was Rama told the old story about the misdeed of god (Indra) to my mother?
data.anv: महातेज: O Highly powerful one, मम to my, मातु: mother, दैवेन by god, दुरनुष्ठितम् badly  done, पुरातनम् formerly, यथावृत्तम् as happened, रामाय to Rama, अपि कथितम् was told?
data.md: O highly energetic one, has that old story relative to my mother having been wronged by that celestial, been communicated to Rāma?

data.v: अपि कौशिक भद्रं ते गुरुणा मम संगता । माता मम मुनिश्रेष्ठ रामसंदर्शनादितः ॥
data.es: O Son of Kushika (Viswamitra) be blessed. O the best among the ascetics, as a result of beholding Rama, was my mother united with my father?
data.anv: कौशिक O Visvamitra, ते भद्रम् prosperity to you, मुनिश्रेष्ठ O best among ascetics, मम माता my mother, रामसन्दर्शनात् इत: in consequence of beholding Rama here, मम my, गुरुणा   with father, अपि सङ्गता has been united?
data.md: O Kausika good betide you, has my mother, in consequence of beholding Rāma, been united with my revered sire?

data.v: अपि मे गुरुणा रामः पूजितः कुशिकात्मज । इहागतो महातेजाः पूजां प्राप्य महात्मनः ॥
data.es: O Son of Kushika was Rama honoured by my father? Was my most brilliant father honoured by illustrious Rama when he arrived?
data.anv: कुशिकात्मज O Son of Kusika, राम: Rama, गुरुणा by my father, अपि पूजित: was honoured, इह here, आगत: having arrived, महातेजा: most brilliant, महात्मन: of the illustrious (Rama), पूजाम् honours, अपि प्राप्त: has obtained.
data.md: And, O son of Kusika, has the highly energetic Rāma come hither, after having been rendered homage by my high-souled revered sire?

data.v: अपि शान्तेन मनसा गुरुर्मे कुशिकात्मज । इहागतेन रामेण प्रयतेनाभिवादितः ॥
data.es: O Kushika's son did pious Rama welcome my father with a tranquil mind when he arrived?"
data.anv: कुशिकात्मज O Kusika's son, इह here, आगतेन came, प्रयतेन piously disposed, रामेण by Rama, मे गुरु: my father, शान्तेन with tranquil, मनसा mind, अपि अभिवादित: saluted respectfully?
data.md: And, O Kusika's son, was my revered sire of quiescent soul, saluted by Rāma when he arrived there?

data.v: तच्छ्रुत्वा वचनं तस्य विश्वामित्रो महामुनिः । प्रत्युवाच शतानन्दं वाक्यज्ञो वाक्यकोविदम् ॥
data.es: Great sage Viswamitra equipped with the knowledge of words heard Satananda who was proficient in speech. And replied:
data.anv: महामुनि: great sage, विश्वामित्र: Viswamitra, तत् वचनम् that word, श्रुत्वा having heard, वाक्यज्ञ: knowledgeable in words, वाक्यकोविदम् proficient in words, शतानन्दम् addressing Satananda, प्रत्युवाच replied.
data.md: Hearing those words of his, the mighty ascetic Viśvāmitra, skilled in speech, replied to Śatānanda, cognizant of words, saying.

data.v: नातिक्रान्तं मुनिश्रेष्ठ यत्कर्तव्यं कृतं मया । संगता मुनिना पत्नी भार्गवेणेव रेणुका ॥
data.es: O Best of ascetics (Satananda) All that is required to be done has been done and nothing was omitted. Ahalya was united with sage Gautama like Renuka with Jamadagni.
data.anv: मुनिश्रेष्ठ O Best of ascetics, न अतिक्रान्तम् (nothing) was omitted, मया by me, यत् which, कर्तव्यम् required to be done, कृतम् has been done, रेणुका Renuka, भार्गवेण इव like with Bhrugu's son, Jamadagni, पत्नी wife Ahalya, मुनिना with the sage, Gautama, सङ्गता was united.
data.md: O best of ascetics, nothing necessary was omitted by me, but everything has been done. And the ascetic's wife has been united with him, even as Renuka with Bhrgu's son. (Jamadagni, father of Paruśurāma).

data.v: तच्छ्रुत्वा वचनं तस्य विश्वामित्रस्य धीमतः । शतानन्दो महातेजा रामं वचनमब्रवीत् ॥
data.es: Great sage Viswamitra equipped with the knowledge of words heard Satananda who was proficient in speech. And replied:
data.anv: महामुनि: great sage, विश्वामित्र: Viswamitra, तत् वचनम् that word, श्रुत्वा having heard, वाक्यज्ञ: knowledgeable in words, वाक्यकोविदम् proficient in words, शतानन्दम् addressing Satananda, प्रत्युवाच replied.
data.md: Hearing the speech of the intelligent Viśvāmitra, the exceedingly energetic Satānanda said to Rāma.

data.v: स्वागतं ते नरश्रेष्ठ दिष्ट्या प्राप्तोऽसि राघव । विश्वामित्रं पुरस्कृत्य महर्षिमपराजितम् ॥
data.es: "O Best of men O Son of the Raghus you are fortunate to have come here following the invincible maharshi Viswamitra. Welcome to you.
data.anv: नरश्रेष्ठ O Chief of men, राघव Rama, अपराजितम् invincible, महर्षिम् maharshi, विश्वामित्रम् Viswamitra, पुरस्कृत्य keeping him in front, दिष्ट्या fortunately, प्राप्त: असि you have come, ते स्वागतम् welcome to you.
data.md: Art you well come, O chief of men? It is by our luck that, O descendant of Raghu, you have come to us, headed by the respected Maharși Visvamitra.

data.v: अचिन्त्यकर्मा तपसा ब्रह्मर्षिरमितप्रभः । विश्वामित्रो महातेजा वेत्स्येनं परमां गतिम् ॥
data.es: Highly lustrous Viswamitra has performed deeds which defy all imagination. By his austerities, he became Brahmarshi and possesses unparalleled radiance. Know him to be the supreme resort.
data.anv: महातेजा: possessing high lustre, विश्वामित्र: Viswamitra, अचिन्त्यकर्मा performed deeds defying imagination, तपसा by his austerities, ब्रह्मर्षि: Brahmarshi, अतुलप्रभ: possessing unsurpassed radiance, एनम् him, परमाम् supreme, गतिम् resort, वेत्सि you knew.
data.md: This highly energetic. Viśvāmitra, Brahmarşi is of prowess measureless; and deeds inconceivable, by virtue of his asceticism. Him you know as the prime way.

data.v: नास्ति धन्यतरो राम त्वत्तोऽन्यो भुवि कश्चन । गोप्ता कुशिकपुत्रस्ते येन तप्तं महत्तपः ॥
data.es: Rama Son of Kushika (Viswamitra) who has performed great austerities is your protector. Therefore, there is none on this earth more fortunate than you.
data.anv: राम Rama, भुवि on this earth, त्वत्त: more than you, धन्यतर: more fortunate, अन्य: other, कश्चन none, नास्ति does not exist, येन by whom, महत् great, तप: austerities, तप्तम् having been performed, कुशिक पुत्र: son of Kusika, ते to you, गोप्ता protector.
data.md: O Rāma, there exist of this earth not one that is more fortunate than thyself. Your protector is even Kusika's descendant, by whom mighty austerities have been performed.

data.v: श्रूयतां चाभिदास्यामि कौशिकस्य महात्मनः । यथाबलं यथावृत्तं तन्मे निगदतः शृणु ॥
data.es: I shall tell you about the power and achievement of the magnanimous son of Kushika Viswamitra. Listen
data.anv: महात्मन: magnanimous, कौशिकस्य Visvamitra's, बलम् power, यथा as to how, वृत्तम् history, यथा as to how, अभिधास्यामि I shall tell, तत् that, निगदत: being described, मे from me, शृणु listen.
data.md: Do you listen as I faithfully describe to you the ascetic power of the high-souled Kausika.

data.v: राजाभूदेष धर्मात्मा दीर्घ कालमरिंदमः । धर्मज्ञः कृतविद्यश्च प्रजानां च हिते रतः ॥
data.es: This righteousminded sage, subduer of enemies, knower of dharma knowledgeable in all branches of learning, devoted to the welfare of his subjects ruled as a king for long.
data.anv: एष: this Viswamitra, धर्मात्मा righteous minded, अरिन्दम: subduer of enemies, धर्मज्ञ: knower of righteousness, कृतविद्य: acquired knowledge in all branches of learning, प्रजानां  of the subjects, हिते welfare, रत: delighted, राजा as king, दीर्घकालम् अभूत् ruled for long time.
data.md: Do you listen to me relating this. This righteous one was for a long time a king, subduing his enemies, cognizant of morality, accomplished, and intent upon the welfare of his subjects.

data.v: प्रजापतिसुतस्त्वासीत्कुशो नाम महीपतिः । कुशस्य पुत्रो बलवान्कुशनाभः सुधार्मिकः ॥
data.es: There was a king named Kusa who was the son of Brahma. His son was Kusanabha who was supremely righteous and strong.
data.anv: प्रजापतिसुत: son of Prajapati, कुशो नाम named Kusa, महीपति: आसीत् there was a king, बलवान् strong, सुधार्मिक: supremely righteous, कुशनाभ: Kusanabha, कुशस्य पुत्र: son of Kusa.
data.md: And there was a king named Kuša, the son of Prajāpati. And Kuśa's son was the powerful and pious Kušanābha.

data.v: कुशनाभसुतस्त्वासीद्गाधिरित्येव विश्रुतः । गाधेः पुत्रो महातेजा विश्वामित्रो महामुनिः ॥
data.es: Wellknown Gadhi was the son of Kusanabha. Highly lustrous and mighty ascetic Viswamitra is the son of Gadhi.
data.anv: गाधि: इत्येव known as Gadhi, विश्रृत: wellknown, कुशनाभसुत: आसीत् was the son of Kusnabha, महातेजा: highly lustrous, महामुनि: mighty ascetic, विश्वामित्र: Visvamitra, गाधे: Gadhi's, पुत्र: son.
data.md: And Kušanābha's son was Gadhi. And Gādhi's son is the highly energetic and mighty ascetic Viśvāmitra.

data.v: विश्वमित्रो महातेजाः पालयामास मेदिनीम् । बहुवर्षसहस्राणि राजा राज्यमकारयत् ॥
data.es: Most brilliant king Dilipa ruled the kingdom for thirty thousand years performing many sacrifices.
data.anv: महातेजा: most brilliant, दिलीपस्तु Dilipa on his part, बहुभि: by any, यज्ञै: sacrifices, इष्टवान्  performed, राजा king, त्रिंशद्वर्षसहस्राणि thirty thousand years, राज्यम् kingdom, अकारयत् ruled.
data.md: And that king reigned for thousands of years.

data.v: कदाचित्तु महातेजा योजयित्वा वरूथिनीम् । अक्षौहिणीपरिवृतः परिचक्राम मेदिनीम् ॥
data.es: Once that highly lustrous Viswamitra having assembled his army of the magnitude of akshauhini went round the earth.
data.anv: महातेजा: highly lustrous that Visvamitra, कदाचित् once, वरूथिनीम् his army, योजयित्वा having assembled, अक्षौहीणीपरिवृत: surrounded by army of the magnitude of Akshauhini, मेदिनीम् the earth, परिचक्राम gone round.
data.md: And it came to pass that once with his four fold forces marshalled, he set out for ranging the earth.

data.v: नगराणि च राष्ट्राणि सरितश्च तथा गिरीन् । आश्रमान्क्रमशो राजा विचरन्नाजगामह ॥
वसिष्ठस्याश्रमपदं नानापुष्पफलद्रुमम् । नानामृगगणाकीर्णं सिद्धचारणसेवितम् ॥
देवदानवगन्धर्वैः किंनरैरुपशोभितम् । प्रशान्तहरिणाकीर्णं द्विजसंघनिषेवितम् ॥
ब्रह्मर्षिगणसंकीर्णं देवर्षिगणसेवितम् । तपश्चरणसंसिद्धैरग्निकल्पैर्महात्मभिः ॥
सततं संकुलं श्रीमद्ब्रह्मकल्पैर्महात्मभिः । अब्भक्षैर्वायुभक्षैश्च शीर्णपर्णाशनैस्तथा ॥
फलमूलाशनैर्दान्तैर्जितरोषैर्जितेन्द्रियैः । ऋषिभिर्वालखिल्यैश्च जपहोमपरायणैः ॥
वसिष्ठस्याश्रमपदं ब्रह्मलोकमिवापरम् । ददर्श जयतां श्रेष्ठ विश्वामित्रो महाबलः ॥
data.es: Highly powerful Viswamitra, foremost among the conquerors, (thus) saw the hermitage of Vasishta which looked like another Brahmaloka.इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये बालकाण्डे एकपञ्चाशस्सर्ग:।Thus ends the fiftyfirst sarga of Balakanda of the holy Ramayana the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.
data.anv: जयताम् of the conquerors, श्रेष्ठ: foremost, महाबल: highly powerful, विश्वामित्र: Visvamitra, अपरम् a second, ब्रह्मलोकमिव like Brahmaloka, वसिष्ठस्य sage Vasishta's, आश्रमपदम् hermitage, ददर्श saw.

data.v: स दृष्ट्वा परमप्रीतो विश्वामित्रो महाबलः । प्रणतो विनयाद्वीरो वसिष्ठं जपतां वरम् ॥
data.es: Overwhelmed with joy the mighty, heroic Viswamitra upon seeing Vasishta, the greatest among ascetics, was and offered respectful salutations.
data.anv: महाबल: very mighty, वीर: heroic, स: विश्वामित्र: that Visvamitra, जपताम् वरम् greatest among those performing religious prayers, वसिष्ठम् Vasishta, दृष्ट्वा having seen, परमप्रीत: exceedingly happy, विनयात् out of respect, प्रणत: offered respectful salutations.
data.md: Upon seeing that foremost of these reciting mantras, the highly powerful and heroic Viśvāmitra, exceedingly delighted, bowed to him in humility.

data.v: स्वागतं तव चेत्युक्तो वसिष्ठेन महात्मना । आसनं चास्य भगवान्वसिष्ठो व्यादिदेश ह ॥
data.es: Adorable Vasishta received Viswamitra with words of welcome and ordered a seat for him.
data.anv: तव to you, स्वागतम् इति welcome (saying so), महात्मना by the magnanimous, वसिष्ठेन by Vasishta, उक्तश्च spoken also, भगवान् adorable, वसिष्ठ: Vasishta, अस्य for him, आसनं च  seat also, व्यादिदेश ह ordered.
data.md: Having enquired as to the pleasantness of Viśvāmitra's journey, the high-souled and adorable Vasiştha ordered a seat for the former.

data.v: उपविष्टाय च तदा विश्वामित्राय धीमते । यथान्यायं मुनिवरः फलमूलमुपाहरत् ॥
data.es: With the sagacious Viswamitra seated the great ascetic, duly offered him fruits and roots.
data.anv: तदा then, मुनिवर: excellent  of ascetics, उपविष्टाय having seated, धीमते sagacious, विश्वामित्राय for Visvamitra, यथान्यायम् in accordance with tradition, फलमूलम् fruits and roots, उपाहरत् offered.
data.md: And on the intelligent Viśvāmitra having been seated, that best of ascetics properly entertained him with fruits and roots.

data.v: प्रतिगृह्य च तां पूजां वसिष्ठाद्राजसत्तमः । तपोऽग्निहोत्रशिष्येषु कुशलं पर्यपृच्छत ॥
data.es: Foremost among kings, the brilliant Viswamitra, having received hospitality from Vasishta, enquired about his welbeing his austerities, his firesacrifices, his disciples and trees (in his hermitage). Vasishta, too, informed him of the welfare of all.
data.anv: राजसत्तम: foremost among kings, महातेजा: highly splendrous, विश्वामित्र: Visvamitra, वसिष्ठात् from Vasishta, ताम् पूजाम् that hospitality, प्रतिगृह्य having received, तपोग्निहोत्रशिष्येषु with regard to his austerities, his firesacrifices and his disciples, तथा and, वनस्पतिगणे trees (in his hermitage), कुशलम् welfare, पर्यपृच्छत enquired, वसिष्ठ: च Vasishta also, सर्वत्र in all of them, कुशलम् welfare, राजसत्तमम् for the best of kings, आह informed.
data.md: And having accepted Vasiştha's hospitality, that foremost of monarchs, the exceedingly energetic Viśvāmitra then enquired of Vasiştha as to the welfare of his asceticism, his Agnihotras, and his disciples, and his trees. Thereupon Vasiştha of fierce austerities communicated the welfare of all to that best of king, Viśvāmitra, seated at his ease.

data.v: विश्वामित्रो महातेजा वनस्पतिगणे तथा । सर्वत्र कुशलं चाह वसिष्ठो राजसत्तमम् ॥
data.es: Foremost among kings, the brilliant Viswamitra, having received hospitality from Vasishta, enquired about his welbeing his austerities, his firesacrifices, his disciples and trees (in his hermitage). Vasishta, too, informed him of the welfare of all.
data.anv: राजसत्तम: foremost among kings, महातेजा: highly splendrous, विश्वामित्र: Visvamitra, वसिष्ठात् from Vasishta, ताम् पूजाम् that hospitality, प्रतिगृह्य having received, तपोग्निहोत्रशिष्येषु with regard to his austerities, his firesacrifices and his disciples, तथा and, वनस्पतिगणे trees (in his hermitage), कुशलम् welfare, पर्यपृच्छत enquired, वसिष्ठ: च Vasishta also, सर्वत्र in all of them, कुशलम् welfare, राजसत्तमम् for the best of kings, आह informed.

data.v: सुखोपविष्टं राजानं विश्वामित्रं महातपाः । पप्रच्छ जपतां श्रेष्ठो वसिष्ठो ब्रह्मणः सुतः ॥
data.es: Vasishta, son of Brahma, the greatest among those who recite prayers and possess rich asceticism enquired of king Viswamitra comfortably seated (before him):
data.anv: जपताम् among those performing religious prayers, श्रेष्ठ: greatest, महातपा: possessing great asceticism, ब्रह्मण: Brahma's, सुत: son, वसिष्ठ: Vasishta, सुखोपविष्टम् sitting at ease, राजानम् king, विश्वामित्रम् Visvamitra,पप्रच्छ enquired.
data.md: Then Brahma's son, Vasistha, the best of those reciting mantras, asked Visvāmitra, saying.

data.v: कच्चित्ते कुशलं राजन्कच्चिद्धर्मेण रञ्जयन् । प्रजाः पालयसे राजन्राजवृत्तेन धार्मिक ॥
data.es: "O King, is it all well with you? O righteous one O heroic one are you ruling (your subjects) in accordance with the duties enjoined upon the king? Do you rule them in conformity with the code of moralit in order to make them happy.
data.anv: राजन् O King, ते कुशलम् कच्चित् is it well with you?, धार्मिक O Righteous one, वीर O Heroic one, प्रजा: subjects, धर्मेण conforming to morality, रञ्जयन् delighting, राजवृत्तेन in accordance with the duties enjoined upon the king, पालयसे कच्चित् are you ruling?
data.md: O king, is it well with you? And, O king, do you rule your subjects pleasing them consistently with morality?

data.v: कच्चित्ते सुभृता भृत्याः कच्चित्तिष्ठन्ति शासने । कच्चित्ते विजिताः सर्वे रिपवो रिपुसूदन ॥
data.es: Are your servants provided well with their requirements? Do they abide by your command? O Destroyer of foes have all your enemies been conquered ?
data.anv: कच्चित् whether, ते your, भृत्या: servants, सम्भृता: are well provided? शासने in your commands, तिष्ठन्ति abide?, रिपुसूदन O Destroyer of foes, ते your, रिपव: foes, सर्वे all, विजिता: have been conquered.
data.md: O virtuous one, are your retainers maintained on salaries from the kingdom? Do they abode by your mandates? And, O destroyer of foes, hast you vanquished your enemies?

data.v: कच्चिद्बले च कोशे च मित्रेषु च परंतप । कुशलं ते नरव्याघ्र पुत्रपौत्रे तथानघ ॥
data.es: O Tormentor of enemies O Sinless one O Tiger among men is it all well with your army, treasury, friends, sons and grandsons?
data.anv: कच्चित् whether, परन्तप O Tormentor of enemies, अनघ O Sinless one, नरव्याघ्र O Tiger (best) among men, बलेषु in your army, कोशेषु in your treasury, मित्रेषु in your friends, तव your, पुत्रपौत्रे sons and grandsons, ते कुशलम् is it well with you?
data.md: And O repressor of foes, is it well with you as to, O most powerful of men, your forces; exchequer, and friends, and, O sinless one, sons and grandsons?'

data.v: सर्वत्र कुशलं राजा वसिष्ठं प्रत्युदाहरत् । विश्वामित्रो महातेजा वसिष्ठं विनयान्वितः ॥
data.es: Highly brilliant king Viswamitra, humbly informed Vasishta that all was well.
data.anv: महातेजा: highly lustrous, राजा king, विश्वामित्र: Visvamitra, वसिष्ठम् Vasishta, विनयान्वित: with great discipline, वसिष्ठम् प्रति addressing Vasishta, सर्वत्र all that, कुशलम् welfare, उदाहरत् conveyed.
data.md: Thereupon the highly powerful king, Viśvāmitra, with humility communicated to Vasiștha his complete welfare.

data.v: कृत्वोभौ सुचिरं कालं धर्मिष्ठौ ताः कथाः शुभाः । मुदा परमया युक्तौ प्रीयेतां तौ परस्परम् ॥
data.es: Both the righteous personalities dwelt at length on various matters and interesting anecdotes with great delight and derived mutual pleasure.
data.anv: धर्मिष्ठौ virtuous, तौ उभौ both of them, परमया with great, मुदा delight, युक्तौ abosrbed, सुचिरम् कालम् for a long time, शुभा: auspicious, ता: कथा: anecedotes relating to various matters, कृत्वा having made, परस्परम् each other, प्रीयेताम् were pleased.
data.md: Having conversed for a long time, those virtuous ones, experiencing exceeding joy, ministered to each other's delight.

data.v: ततो वसिष्ठो भगवान्कथान्ते रघुनन्दन । विश्वामित्रमिदं वाक्यमुवाच प्रहसन्निव ॥
data.es: O Descendent of Raghu at the end of the conversation, venerable Vasishta, smiling as it were said to Viswamitra
data.anv: रघुनन्दन O Descendent of Raghu, तत: then, भगवान् venerable, वसिष्ठ: Vasishta, कथाऽन्ते after the conversation had ended, प्रहसन्निव smiling as it were, विश्वामित्रम् addressing Viswamitra,  इदं this, वाक्यम् word, उवाच spoke.
data.md: Then, O descendant of Raghu, after the conversation had ended, the adorable Vasiştha, smiling, addressed Viśvāmitra, saying.

data.v: आतिथ्यं कर्तुमिच्छामि बलस्यास्य महाबल । तव चैवाप्रमेयस्य यथार्हं संप्रतीच्छ मे ॥
data.es: O Highy powerful Viswamitra I wish to offer appropriate hospitality to you and to your incomparable army. Be pleased to accept it.
data.anv: महाबल O Highly powerful, अस्य of this, बलस्य for army, अप्रमेयस्य incomparable, तव चैव to you as well, यथार्हम् in an appropriate manner, आतिथ्यम् hospitality, कर्तुम् to offer, इच्छामि I am desirous, मे from me, सम्प्रतीच्छ you may accept.
data.md: O highly powerful one, I desire to properly entertain you of immeasurable power, as well as your forces, do you, therefore, accept my hospitality.

data.v: सत्क्रियां तु भवानेतां प्रतीच्छतु मयोद्यताम् । राजंस्त्वमतिथिश्रेष्ठः पूजनीयः प्रयत्नतः ॥
data.es: Please accept the honour I extend. Being a king, you are a distinguished guest. you deserve to be treated respectfully in all possible ways".
data.anv: भवान् you, मया by me, उद्यताम् extended, सत्क्रियाम् honours, प्रतीच्छतु accept, राजा king, त्वम् you, प्रयत्नत: through every effort, पूजनीय: worthy of, अतिथिश्रेष्ठ: distinguished guest.
data.md: Do you receive the hospitality which I extend to you. O king, you are the foremost of guests, and art worthy of assiduous homage.'

data.v: एवमुक्तो वसिष्ठेन विश्वामित्रो महामतिः । कृतमित्यब्रवीद्राजा पूजावाक्येन मे त्वया ॥
data.es: To these words of Vasishta, the great intellectual Viswamitra said, "you have spoken pleasing words. This in itself is hospitality for me".
data.anv: वसिष्ठेन by Vasishta, एवम् in this manner, उक्त: spoken, महामति: greatminded, राजा king, विश्वामित्र: Visvamitra, त्वया by you, प्रियवाक्येन with pleasing words, कृतम् इति  hospitality has been extended, मे to me, अब्रवीत् spoke.
data.md: Being thus addressed by Vasiştha, that mighty ascetic, king Viśvāmitra; said, 'Even by this word of your relative to receiving me, hast you in fact done so.'

data.v: फलमूलेन भगवन्विद्यते यत्तवाश्रमे । पाद्येनाचमनीयेन भगवद्दर्शनेन च ॥
data.es: "O Worshipful one O Profoundly wise one you are worthy of homage. You have excellently honoured me in all possible ways with whatever fruits and roots available in your hermitage, with water for washing feet and for sipping. You have permitted me darshan with your revered self. I shall leave (now). My regards Look upon me with eyes of friendship".
data.anv: भगवन् O Worshipful one, यत् which, तव your, आश्रमे in the hermitage, विद्यते is available, फलमूलेन with fruits and roots, पाद्येन with the water for washing feet, आचमनीयेन च with water for sipping, भगवद्दर्शनेन by meeting  your revered self, पूजार्हेण worthy of homage, सर्वथा in all ways, सुपूजित: excellently honoured, महाप्राज्ञ O Profoundly wise one, गमिष्यामि   I shall go, ते नम: अस्तु reverence to you, मैत्रेण filled with friendship, चक्षुषा with eyes, ईक्षस्व look upon me.
data.md: And, O worshipful one, even with the fruits and roots that are in your asylum, with the water for washing my feet, and for sipping, you, with the sight of your revered self, have I been.

data.v: सर्वथा च महाप्राज्ञ पूजार्हेण सुपूजितः । गमिष्यामि नमस्तेऽस्तु मैत्रेणेक्षस्व चक्षुषा ॥
data.es: "O Worshipful one O Profoundly wise one you are worthy of homage. You have excellently honoured me in all possible ways with whatever fruits and roots available in your hermitage, with water for washing feet and for sipping. You have permitted me darshan with your revered self. I shall leave (now). My regards Look upon me with eyes of friendship".
data.anv: भगवन् O Worshipful one, यत् which, तव your, आश्रमे in the hermitage, विद्यते is available, फलमूलेन with fruits and roots, पाद्येन with the water for washing feet, आचमनीयेन च with water for sipping, भगवद्दर्शनेन by meeting  your revered self, पूजार्हेण worthy of homage, सर्वथा in all ways, सुपूजित: excellently honoured, महाप्राज्ञ O Profoundly wise one, गमिष्यामि   I shall go, ते नम: अस्तु reverence to you, मैत्रेण filled with friendship, चक्षुषा with eyes, ईक्षस्व look upon me.
data.md: O profoundly wise one, excellently entertained by you, who art yourself worthy of homage. I how to you. I will go now. Do you regard me with a friendly eye.'

data.v: एवं ब्रुवन्तं राजानं वसिष्ठः पुनरेव हि । न्यमन्त्रयत धर्मात्मा पुनः पुनरुदारधीः ॥
data.es: As the king was addressing thus the righteous and generous Vasishta, repeatedly requested him to accept his hospitality.
data.anv: एवम् in this way, ब्रुवन्तम् speaking, राजानम् king, धर्मात्मा righteous minded, उदारधी: sagacious, वसिष्ठ: Vasishta, पुनरेव in return, पुन: पुन: again and again, न्यमन्त्रयत implored.
data.md: As the king was speaking thus, the righteous souled and generous Vasiştha again and again pressed him to accept his hospitality.

data.v: बाढमित्येव गाधेयो वसिष्ठं प्रत्युवाच ह । यथा प्रियं भगवतस्तथास्तु मुनिसत्तम ॥
data.es: The son of Gadhi said to Vasishta, "O Preeminent among sages, be it so, O venerable one they will be done".
data.anv: गाधेय: the son of Gadhi, वसिष्ठम् addressing Vashishta, मुनिपुङ्गव O Preeminent among sages, बाढम् be it so, भगवत: venerable, यथा in whatever way,  प्रियं (अभिमतम्) desire, तथा अस्तु let it be done in that way.
data.md: Then Gadhi's son answered Vasistha, Very well. O potent ascetic, let that be which find favour in your sight.'

data.v: एवमुक्तो महातेजा वसिष्ठो जपतां वरः । आजुहाव ततः प्रीतः कल्माषीं धूतकल्मषः ॥
data.es: Vasishta who was highly brilliant the greatest among those who meditate (on Brahman) and free from sins was pleased. Thereafter he called the speckled cow (Kamadhenu):
data.anv: महातेजा: highly splendrous, जपतां वर: greatest among those who perform religious meditation, धूतकल्मष: free from sins, वसिष्ठ: Vasishta, प्रीत: pleased, तत: thereafter, कल्माषीम् the speckled cow, आजुहाव called.
data.md: This having been said by him, Vasistha, the best of those reciting mantras, joyfully called his sacrificial dappled cow, capable of purging away sins.

data.v: एह्येहि शबले क्षिप्रं शृणु चापि वचो मम । सबलस्यास्य राजर्षेः कर्तुं व्यवसितोऽस्म्यहम् । भोजनेन महार्हेण सत्कारं संविधत्स्व मे ॥
data.es: "O Sabala, come on quick Listen to my words. I have decided to honour this royal saint and his army with excellent food. Make necessary arrangemets.
data.anv: शबले O Sabala, क्षिप्रम् quickly, एहि (एहि) come on, मम my,  वच: words, श्रृणु च अपि also listen, अहम् I, महार्हेण in a befitting manner, भोजनेन with food, अस्य राजर्षे: for this royal saint, सबलस्य together with his army, सत्कारम् honour, कर्तुम् to extend, व्यवसित: अस्मि I have decided, मे to me, संविधत्स्व make arrangemets.
data.md: O Śabala! do you come soon; and hear my words. I intend to entertain this royal saint together with his forces. Do you enable me to entertain him, by yielding excellent viands.

data.v: यस्य यस्य यथाकामं षड्रसेष्वभिपूजितम् । तत्सर्वं कामधुग्दिव्ये अभिवर्षकृते मम ॥
data.es: O Kamadhenu quickly entertain them for my sake with the food of six kinds of tastes (varieties of rich dishes) as desired by each.
data.anv: कामधुक् O Kamadhenu, यस्य यस्य  to whom so ever, षड्रसेषु among six kinds of tastes, अभिपूजितम् which is desired, तत्सर्वम् all that, यथाकामम् in a manner desired, मम कृते for my sake, क्षिप्रम् quickly, अभिवर्ष rained (grant).
data.md: And, O divine one, O you that confer everything that is desired, do you grant everyone whatever be ask among edibles impregnated with the six tastes.

data.v: रसेनान्नेन पानेन लेह्यचोष्येण संयुतम् । अन्नानां निचयं सर्वं सृजस्व शबले त्वर ॥
data.es: O Sabala create at once all food items consisting of liquids and solids for drinking, tasting and siping."इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये बालकाण्डे द्विपञ्चाशस्सर्ग:।Thus ends the fiftysecond sarga of Balakanda of the holy Ramayana the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.
