data.anv: शबले O Sabala, in the form of liquid, अन्नेन with solid food, रसेन पानेन with liquids  which can be drunk, लेह्यचोष्येण which can be licked and sipped, संयुतम् endowed with, सर्वम् all that, अन्नानां of the food items, निचयम् in collecion, सृजस्व create, त्वर hasten.
data.md: And do you, O Śabala, speedily create sapid viands to be chewed, sucked, licked, or drunk.

data.v: एवमुक्ता वसिष्ठेन शबला शत्रुसूदन । विदधे कामधुक्कामान्यस्य यस्य यथेप्सितम् ॥
data.es: "O Destroyer of foes (Rama)" addressed thus by Vasishta the wishfulfilling Sabala satisfied each one's desires.
data.anv: शत्रुसूदन O Destroyer of foes, Rama, वसिष्ठेन by Vasishta, एवम् in this manner, उक्ता spoken, कामधुक् wishfulfilling (cow), शबला Sabala, यस्य यस्य to whomsoever, यथा in whatever manner, ईप्सितम् desired, कामान् desires, विदधे arranged (fulfilled).
data.md: Thus addressed by Vasiştha, that bestower of all that was desired, Sabala, O destroyer of your foes, brought forth everything that was desired by everyone.

data.v: इक्षून्मधूंस्तथा लाजान्मैरेयांश्च वरासवान् । पानानि च महार्हाणि भक्ष्यांश्चोच्चावचांस्तथा ॥
data.es: Sugarcane, honey and fried grain, invigorating liquors in good containers, excellent drinks and varieties of food (were served).
data.anv: इक्षून् sugarcane, मधून् honey, तथा and, लाजान् fried grain, (वरासवान् quality liquor,)         वरासनान् in good containers, मैरेयान् invigorating liquors, महार्हाणि excellent, पानानि च syrups, उच्चावचान् with different kinds of, भक्ष्यांश्च of food.

data.v: उष्णाढ्यस्यौदनस्यापि राशयः पर्वतोपमाः । मृष्टान्नानि च सूपाश्च दधिकुल्यास्तथैव च ॥
data.es: Heaps of hot rice as high as mountains, savoury food, condiments and on abundance of curd, various kinds of soups, containers in their thousands completely filled with edibles with all six tastes and preparations made of jaggery (were distributed).
data.anv: अत्र here, उष्णाढ्यस्य hot, ओदनस्य of rice, पर्वतोपमा: resembling mountains, राशय: heaps, मृष्टान्नानि च savoury (delicious) foods, सूपाश्च pulses, तथैव and, दधिकुल्या: rivers of milkcurds, नानास्वादुरसानाम् of various kinds of tastes, षाडबानाम् edibles with all six  tastes, सुपूर्णानि completely filled, भाजनानि containers, गौडानि च preparations made of Jaggery, सहस्रश: in thousands, (distributed).

data.v: नानास्वादुरसानां च षाडवानां तथैव च । भाजनानि सुपूर्णानि गौडानि च सहस्रशः ॥
data.es: Heaps of hot rice as high as mountains, savoury food, condiments and on abundance of curd, various kinds of soups, containers in their thousands completely filled with edibles with all six tastes and preparations made of jaggery (were distributed).
data.anv: अत्र here, उष्णाढ्यस्य hot, ओदनस्य of rice, पर्वतोपमा: resembling mountains, राशय: heaps, मृष्टान्नानि च savoury (delicious) foods, सूपाश्च pulses, तथैव and, दधिकुल्या: rivers of milkcurds, नानास्वादुरसानाम् of various kinds of tastes, षाडबानाम् edibles with all six  tastes, सुपूर्णानि completely filled, भाजनानि containers, गौडानि च preparations made of Jaggery, सहस्रश: in thousands, (distributed).

data.v: सर्वमासीत्सुसंतुष्टं हृष्टपुष्टजनाकुलम् । विश्वामित्रबलं राम वसिष्ठेनाभितर्पितम् ॥
data.es: "O Rama, Vasistha entertained everybody in Viswamitra's army to their full satisfaction. They were all wellfed and happy.
data.anv: राम O Rama, विश्वामित्रबलम् army of Visvamitra, सर्वम् (एव) whole of it, वसिष्ठेन by Vasishta, अभितर्पितम् having been satisfied, सुसन्तुष्ठम् highly pleased, हृष्टपुष्टजनायुतं आसीत् was filled with wellfed and rejoiced people.
data.md: And, O Rāma, the tarry of Viśvāmitra being superbly entertained by Vasiştha, heartily filled, became exceedingly gratified.

data.v: विश्वामित्रोऽपि राजर्षिर्हृष्टपुष्टस्तदाभवत् । सान्तः पुरवरो राजा सब्राह्मणपुरोहितः ॥
data.es: King Viswamitra along with ladies, priests and brahmins including the royal sage were fully satisfied and delighted.
data.anv: तदा then, सान्त:पुरवर: with excellent from female apartments, सब्राह्मणपुरोहित: together with priests and brahmins, राजर्षि: royal sage, विश्वामित्र: राजापि  king Viswamitra also, हृष्ट: delighted, पुष्ट: अभवत् became satisfied.
data.md: And the royal saint, Viśvāmitra himself, together with the priests and Brāhmaṇas and the inmates of the inner apartment, was also heartily filled.

data.v: सामात्यो मन्त्रिसहितः सभृत्यः पूजितस्तदा । युक्तः परेण हर्षेण वसिष्ठमिदमब्रवीत् ॥
data.es: Having received the hospitality along with his counsellors, ministers and attendants, Viswamitra, filled with great delight, said to Vasishta":
data.anv: तदा then, पूजित: honoured, सामात्य: with counsellors, मन्त्रिसहित: together with ministers,  सभृत्य: with attendants, परमहर्षेण with great delight, युक्त: filled with, वसिष्ठम् addressing Vasishta, इदम् this word, अब्रवीत् spoke.
data.md: And being hospitably entertained with his courtiers and counsellors and retainers, he, exceedingly de-lighted, spoke to Vasistha, saying.

data.v: पूजितोऽहं त्वया ब्रह्मन्पूजार्हेण सुसत्कृतः । श्रूयतामभिधास्यामि वाक्यं वाक्यविशारद ॥
data.es: "O Brahman you are worthy of worship. I was received with reverence and wellentertained by you. O Sage conversant with speech listen.
data.anv: ब्रह्मन् O Brahman, पूजार्हेण by (one) worthy of being worshipped, त्वया by you, अहम् I, पूजित: was received with warmth and respect, सुसत्कृत: well honoured, वाक्यविशारद O One conversant with speech, वाक्यम् these words, अभिधास्यामि I shall tell you, श्रूयताम् let it be heard.
data.md: Received and excellently entertained have I been by you, O Brāhmaṇa, who thyself art worthy of being honoured. Do you, O you conversant with speech, listen to me. I will tell you a word.

data.v: गवां शतसहस्रेण दीयतां शबला मम । रत्नं हि भगवन्नेतद्रत्नहारी च पार्थिवः । तस्मान्मे शबलां देहि ममैषा धर्मतो द्विज ॥
data.es: "I shall give you a hundred thousand cows in exchange for Sabala. O Respectable one this cow is a gem. A king (along) has a right on jewels, O Brahmin, for that reason, Sabala rightfully belongs to me. Therefore, give this cow".
data.anv: गवाम् of cows, शतसहस्रेण one hundred thousands, शबला Sabala, मम to me, दीयताम् let it be given, भगवन्,O Respectable one, एतत् this, रत्नं हि indeed gem, पार्थिव: king, रत्नहारी acquirer of jewels, द्विज O Brahmin, तस्मात् for that reason, शबलाम् Sabala, मे to me, देहि give, एषा this, धर्मत: by right, मम is mine.
data.md: Do you bestow on me Śabala for an hundred thousand kine. O worshipful one, verily this one is a jewel; and as it is the function of kings to acquire jewels, do you confer on me Śabala; for, O twice-born one, this one by right belongs to me.

data.v: एवमुक्तस्तु भगवान्वसिष्ठो मुनिसत्तमः । विश्वामित्रेण धर्मात्मा प्रत्युवाच महीपतिम् ॥
data.es: Addressed the by Viswamitra venerable and righteous Vasishta who was of the earth ascetic replied:
data.anv: विश्वामित्रेण by Visvamitra, एवम् in this manner, उक्त: addressed, भगवान् the revered one, धर्मात्मा virtuous, मुनिसत्तम: eminent among ascetics, वसिष्ठ: Vasishta, महीपतिम् addressing the king, प्रत्युवाच replied.
data.md: Thus addressed by Viśvāmitra, the righteous and adorable Vasiştha best of ascetics, replied to that lord of earth.

data.v: नाहं शतसहस्रेण नापि कोटिशतैर्गवाम् । राजन्दास्यामि शबलां राशिभी रजतस्य वा ॥
data.es: "O King I shall not exchange Sabala for a hundred thousand for even or a hundred crore cows or heaps of silver.
data.anv: राजन् O King, अहम् I, गवाम् of cows, शतसहस्रेण in  hundreds of thousands, शबलाम् Sabala, न दास्यामि shall not give, कोटि शतै: अपि by hundreds of crores also, न shall not, रजतस्य of silver, राशिभि: च heaps of (shall not give).
data.md: O king, neither for an hundred thousand nor for an hundred Koți of kine, nor yet for heaps of silver, will I part with Sabala. O subduer of enemies, this one deserves not to be separated from my side.

data.v: न परित्यागमर्हेयं मत्सकाशादरिंदम । शाश्वती शबला मह्यं कीर्तिरात्मवतो यथा ॥
data.es: O Suppressor of enemies Viswamitra it is not proper to separate this cow from me. The relationship between Sabala and me is permanent like the relationship between a righteous man and his fame.
data.anv: अरिन्दम O Tormentor of enemies, Visvamitra, इयम् this cow, मत्सकाशात् from my proximity, परित्यागम् separation, न अर्हा not proper, आत्मवत: for righteous man, कीर्तिः यथा like fame, शबला Sabala, मह्यम् for me, शाश्वती is permanent.

data.v: अस्यां हव्यं च कव्यं च प्राणयात्रा तथैव च । आयत्तमग्निहोत्रं च बलिर्होमस्तथैव च ॥
data.es: For havyam (oblations to gods) and kavyam (oblations to ancestors), for fulfilling the necessities of life, maintenance of the sacred fire and offering oblations to all spirits of created beings, and for offerings made to the Firegod I depend on this cow.
data.anv: हव्यं च Havyam (oblations to be given to gods), कव्यं च Kavyam ( to be given to pitris), तथैव च and, प्राणयात्रा carrying out necessities of life, अग्निहोत्रं च maintenance of the sacred fire and offering oblations, बलि: offerings to spirits of all created beings, तथैव च and also, होम: offerings, अस्याम् in this cow, आयत्तम् are dependant.

data.v: स्वाहाकारवषट्कारौ विद्याश्च विविधास्तथा । आयत्तमत्र राजर्षे सर्वमेतन्न संशयः ॥
data.es: O Royal saint swaha and vashat and various branches of learning are all dependent on this cow. No doubt about it.
data.anv: राजर्षे O Royal saint, स्वाहाकारवषट्कारौ Swaha and Vashat, तथा and, विविधा: various branches of, विद्या: learning, एतत् सर्वम् all these things, अत्र in this cow, आयत्तम् are dependant, संशय: न no doubt.

data.v: सर्व स्वमेतत्सत्येन मम तुष्टिकरी सदा । कारणैर्बहुभी राजन्न दास्ये शबलां तव ॥
data.es: This one is truly my whole possession, it always gives me contentment. O King for various reasons, I will not give Sabala to you".
data.anv: एतत् this one, सत्येन truly, मम my, सर्वस्वम् whole possession, सदा always, तुष्टिकरी causes contentment, राजन् O King,  बहुभि: by various, कारणै: reasons, शबलाम् Sabala, तव to you, न दास्ये will not give.
data.md: All this is so: there is no doubt about it. Verily she is my all; and in her do I find my delight. And many are the reasons, O king, why I cannot give to you Sabala.'

data.v: वसिष्ठेनैवमुक्तस्तु विश्वामित्रोऽब्रवीत्ततः । संरब्धतरमत्यर्थं वाक्यं वाक्यविशारदः ॥
data.es: To there words of Vasishta, Viswamitra who is skilful in conversation reacted with extreme excitement:
data.anv: वाक्यविशारद: (the king) skilled in conversation, विश्वामित्र: Visvamitra, वसिष्ठेन through Vasishta, एवम् in this manner, उक्त: spoken, अत्यर्थम् extreme, संरब्धतरम् more excited, वाक्यम् words, अब्रवीत् spoke.
data.md: Thus addressed by Vasiștha, that one versed in speech, Viśvāmitra, eagerly rejoined.

data.v: हैरण्यकक्ष्याग्रैवेयान्सुवर्णाङ्कुशभूषितान् । ददामि कुञ्जराणां ते सहस्राणि चतुर्दश ॥
data.es: "I shall give fourteen thousand elephants with gold trappings around the neck and girth, and with goads made of gold.
data.anv: हैरण्यकक्ष्याग्रैवेयान् with gold trappings around the neck and girth (of an elephant), सुवर्णाङ्कुशभूषितान् adorned with (elephant) goads made of gold, कुञ्जरान् elephants, तेषाम् such elephants, चतुर्दशसहस्राणि fourteen thousands, ददामि I shall give.
data.md: I shall confer upon you fourteen thousand elephants decked in gold chains and gold neckornaments and hooks.

data.v: हैरण्यानां रथानां च श्वेताश्वानां चतुर्युजाम् । ददामि ते शतान्यष्टौ किङ्किणीकविभूषितान् ॥
data.es: I shall give you eight hundred chariots made of gold and decorated with small tinkling bells, each chariot yoked with four white horses.
data.anv: श्वेताश्वानाम of white horses, चतुर्युजाम् capable of being yoked with four (horses), हैरण्यानाम् made of gold, रथानाम् chariots, किङ्किणीकविभूषितान् decorated with small tinkling bells, अष्टौ शतान् eight hundred, ते to you, ददामि shall give.

data.v: हयानां देशजातानां कुलजानां महौजसाम् । सहस्रमेकं दश च ददामि तव सुव्रत ॥
data.es: O Maharshi of auspicious vows I shall give you eleven thousand mighty horses of good breed born in good countries.
data.anv: सुव्रत O Maharshi of auspicious vows (religious practices ), देशजातानाम् born in good country, कुलजानाम् born of noble (good) breeds, महौजसाम् mighty, हयानाम् horses, एकं दश च eleven, सहस्रम् thousands, तव to you, ददामि shall give.

data.v: नानावर्णविभक्तानां वयःस्थानां तथैव च । ददाम्येकां गवां कोटिं शबला दीयतां मम ॥
data.es: I shall give one crore young cows of various colours. Give me Sabala.
data.anv: नानावर्णविभक्तानाम् distinctly separated by colours, तथैव and, वयस्स्थानाम् of youthful, गवाम् cows, एकाम् one, कोटिम् crore, ददामि I shall give, मम for me, शबला Sabala, दीयताम् be given.

data.v: एवमुक्तस्तु भगवान्विश्वामित्रेण धीमता । न दास्यामीति शबलां प्राह राजन्कथंचन ॥
data.es: With these words of the wise Viswamitra the ascetics moved forward surveying various forests.
data.anv: धीमता by the wise, विश्वामित्रेण by Visvamitra, एवम् thus, उक्ता: spoken, ते महर्षय: those ascetics, विविधानि various, वनानि woods, पश्यन्त: seeing, प्रयाता: journeyed onwards.
data.md: Thus besought by the intelligent Viśvāmitra, that adorable one replied, saying, 'Oking, Śabala I will not by any means give.'

data.v: एतदेव हि मे रत्नमेतदेव हि मे धनम् । एतदेव हि सर्वस्वमेतदेव हि जीवितम् ॥
data.es: "This is verily my jewel, my wealth my very life. This is allinall for me.
data.anv: एतदेव this is verily, मे my, रत्नं हि jewel indeed, एतदेव this is verily, मे my, धनम् wealth, एतदेव हि this is verily, सर्वस्वं allinall, एतदेव this is verily, जीवितम् my very life.
data.md: This is verily my jewel: this is verily my riches: this is verily my all: this is verily my subsistence. And this is my Darsa,* Gifts to Brāhmaṇas on occasions of sacrifice. and this my Paurnamäsa, and this my various sacrifices with dakşiņās; and, O king, this my various rites. *Bi-monthly sacrifice, performed at change of the moon by persons maintaining a perpetual fire. A ceremony performed at the full moon by persons maintaining a perpetual fire.

data.v: दर्शश्च पूर्णमासश्च यज्ञाश्चैवाप्तदक्षिणाः । एतदेव हि मे राजन्विविधाश्च क्रियास्तथा ॥
data.es: O King verily this Sabala is useful for my darsa and purnamasa sacrifices, for appropriate gifts and various rites.
data.anv: राजन् O King, मे for me, दर्शश्च Darsa sacrifice, पूर्णमासश्च Purnamasa sacrifice, आप्तदक्षिणा: with appropriate gifts, यज्ञाश्च sacrifices, तथा and, विविधा: various, क्रियाश्च rites, एतदेव हि verily is this(cow).
data.md: This is verily my jewel: this is verily my riches: this is verily my all: this is verily my subsistence. And this is my Darsa,* Gifts to Brāhmaṇas on occasions of sacrifice. and this my Paurnamäsa, and this my various sacrifices with dakşiņās; and, O king, this my various rites. *Bi-monthly sacrifice, performed at change of the moon by persons maintaining a perpetual fire. A ceremony performed at the full moon by persons maintaining a perpetual fire.

data.v: अदोमूलाः क्रियाः सर्वा मम राजन्न संशयः । बहूनां किं प्रलापेन न दास्ये कामदोहिनीम् ॥
data.es: O King this (cow) is undoubtedly the source of all my actions. Why these useless words? I will never give this wishfulfilling cow".इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये बालकाण्डे त्रिपञ्चाशस्सर्ग:॥Thus ends the fiftythird sarga of Balakanda of the holy Ramayana the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.
data.anv: राजन् O King, मम my, सर्वा: all, क्रिया: actions, अदोमूला: are rooted here (in her), संशय: न no doubt, बहुना with many, प्रलापेन useless words, किम् what is the use, कामदोहिनीम्  desire fulfilling cow, न दास्ये I shall not give.
data.md: This, O king, is without doubt, the root of all my rites. And what need of dilating? This one bestowing everything that is desired will I not part with.

data.v: कामधेनुं वसिष्ठोऽपि यदा न त्यजते मुनिः । तदास्य शबलां राम विश्वामित्रोऽन्वकर्षत ॥
data.es: "O Rama when sage Vasishta did not consent to part with the wishfulfilling cow, Viswamitra dragged Sabala by force.
data.anv: राम O Rama, वसिष्ठ: मुनि: अपि sage Vasishta also, कामधेनुम् wishfulfilling cow, यदा when, न त्यज्यते did not leave, तदा then, विश्वामित्र: Visvamitra, शबलां Sabala, अन्वकर्षत pulled.
data.md: When the ascetic Vasiștha would not part with the cow of plenty then Viśvāmitra, O Rāma, forced Śabala away.

data.v: नीयमाना तु शबला राम राज्ञा महात्मना । दुःखिता चिन्तयामास रुदन्ती शोककर्शिता ॥
data.es: O Rama when she was being taken away by the powerful king the distressed Sabala thus reflected choked with sorrow":
data.anv: राम O Rama, महात्मना by the magnanimous, राज्ञा (by) king, नीयमाना being carried away, शबला Sabala, दु:खिता distressed, शोककर्शिता emaciated by sorrow, रुदन्ती weeping, चिन्तयामास reflected.
data.md: And, O Rāma, carried away by that highsouled king, ſabala, stricken with grief and afflicted with sorrow, bethought herself, weeping.

data.v: परित्यक्ता वसिष्ठेन किमहं सुमहात्मना । याहं राजभृतैर्दीना ह्रियेयं भृशदुःखिता ॥
data.es: "I am being carried away by attendants of the king in this greatly distressed and pitiable condition. Have I been abandoned by the magnanimous Vasishta?
data.anv: दीना evoking pity, भृश दु:खिता greatly distressed, या अहम् I, राजभटै: by the attendants of king, ह्रियेय carried away, अहम् I, महात्मना magnanimous, वसिष्ठेन by Vasishta, परित्यक्ता  किम् have been abndoned?.
data.md: Have I been forsaken by the high-souled Vasiştha that the royal retainers carry me off thus aggrieved?

data.v: किं मयापकृतं तस्य महर्षेर्भावितात्मनः । यन्मामनागसं भक्तामिष्टां त्यजति धार्मिकः ॥
data.es: What harm have I done to the pious maharshi, a compassionate soul? Why does he forsake me, his auspicious one, despite my innocence and devotion"?
data.anv: धार्मिक: pious, अनागसम् innocent, भक्ताम् devoted, इष्टाम् beloved, माम् me, यत् त्यजति is forsaking, भावितात्मन: having purified soul, तस्य महर्षे: for that maharshi, मया by me, किम् what, अपकृतम् harm has been done?
data.md: What wrong have I done to that mighty ascetic of concentrated spirit, that, knowing me to be faultless, that righteous one leave her that was devoted to his service?'

data.v: इति सा चिन्तयित्वा तु निःश्वस्य च पुनः पुनः । जगाम वेगेन तदा वसिष्ठं परमौजसं ॥

data.v: शबला सा रुदन्ती च क्रोशन्ती चेदमब्रवीत् । वसिष्ठस्याग्रतः स्थित्वा मेघदुन्दुभिराविणी ॥
data.es: Lowing and moaning, standing before Vasishta, roaring like thunder and of kettledrum, Sabala said:
data.anv: सा शबला that Sabala, रुदन्ती च weeping, क्रोशन्ती च moaning, वसिष्ठस्य Vasishta's, अग्रत: in front of, स्थित्वा standing, मेघदुन्दुभिराविणी roaring like the thunder and kettle drum, इदम् this, अब्रवीत् said.
data.md: She with the speed of the wind, appeared at the feet of that high-souled one. And weeping, she spoke in distressful accents.

data.v: भगवन्किं परित्यक्ता त्वयाहं ब्रह्मणः सुत । यस्माद्राजभृता मां हि नयन्ते त्वत्सकाशतः ॥
data.es: "O Brahma's son O Venerable one you have abandoned me? For what reason the servants of the king are taking me away from you"?
data.anv: ब्रह्मण: Brahma's, सुत son, भगवन् O Venerable one, अहम् I, त्वया by you, परित्यक्ता किम् abandoned?, यस्मात् for what reason, राजभृता: servants of king, त्वत्सकाशत: from your presence, माम् me, नयन्ते हि carrying me.
data.md: O Brahma's son, wherefore have I been forsaken by you, that the servants of the king were carrying me from off your presence?

data.v: एवमुक्तस्तु ब्रह्मर्षिरिदं वचनमब्रवीत् । शोकसंतप्तहृदयां स्वसारमिव दुःखिताम् ॥
data.es: Addressed thus, Bramharshi said to Sabala, like to a sister whose heart is afflicted with sorrow:
data.anv: एवम् in this manner, उक्त: having been spoken by (Sabala), ब्रह्मर्षि: Brahmarshi, शोकसन्तप्तहृदयां (addressing Sabala whose) heart is afflicted with sorrow, दु:खिताम् distressed, स्वसारमिव like to a sister, इदम् this, वचनम् word, अब्रवीत् spoke.
data.md: Thus addressed the Brahmarși said these words to that one aggrieved, and of heart afflicted with sorrow, and like to a sister.

data.v: न त्वां त्यजामि शबले नापि मेऽपकृतं त्वया । एष त्वां नयते राजा बलान्मत्तो महाबलः ॥
data.es: "O Sabala I am not forsaking you. You have done me no harm. This highly powerful king is forcibly carrying you away from me.
data.anv: शबले O Sabala, त्वाम् you, न त्यजामि not forsaking, त्वया by you, न अपकृतमपि no harm has been done, महाबल: highly powerful, एष: राजा king, मत्त: from me, बलात् forcibly, त्वाम् you, नयते is carrying.
data.md: O Śabala, not that I forsake you; nor hast you done me any wrong. But this mighty king proud of his prowess has been carrying you away.

data.v: न हि तुल्यं बलं मह्यं राजा त्वद्य विशेषतः । बली राजा क्षत्रियश्च पृथिव्याः पतिरेव च ॥
data.es: I am no match for his strength, especially he is a king. Being king, he is a warrior, powerful and lord of the earth.
data.anv: मह्यम् for me, बलम् power, तुल्यम् equal to him, न हि not, अद्य today, विशेषत: especially, राजा तु is king, राजा being king, बली powerful, क्षत्रियश्च also warrior, पृथिव्या: for the earth, पतिरेव च is also the lord.
data.md: Surely, my strength is not equal to his. More specially, he is a king, a powerful king, more particularly, this day he should not be slain by me (inasmuch as he is my guest): he is a Ks atriya and lord of earth.

data.v: इयमक्षौहिणीपूर्णा सवाजिरथसंकुला । हस्तिध्वजसमाकीर्णा तेनासौ बलवत्तरः ॥
data.es: He has an entire akshauhini composed of horses, chariots, elephants and banners. Hence he is stonger".
data.anv: सवाजिरथसङ्कुला crowded with horses yoked to chariots, हस्तिध्वजसमाकीर्णा surrounded by elephants and banners, इयम् this, अक्षौहिणी Akshauhini, पूर्णा is filled, तेन for that reason, असौ this (king ), बलवत्तर: is mighty.
data.md: And he is foremost in might by virtue of possessing this entire Akşohiņi abounding in elephants and horses and cars and standards.'

data.v: एवमुक्ता वसिष्ठेन प्रत्युवाच विनीतवत् । वचनं वचनज्ञा सा ब्रह्मर्षिममितप्रभम् ॥
data.es: To these words of brahmarshi Vasishta armed with immeasurable power, Sabala, who knew the use of words, replied with humility:
data.anv: वसिष्ठेन by Vasishta, एवम् in this way, उक्ता spoken, वचनज्ञा knowledgeable in words, सा that cow, अमितप्रभम् immeasurable power, ब्रह्मर्षिम् addressing brahmarshi, वचनम् words, विनीतवत् with humility, प्रत्युवाच replied.
data.md: Thus addressed by Vasistha, that cognizant of words humbly said in reply to that Brahmarși of incomparable power.

data.v: न बलं क्षत्रियस्याहुर्ब्राह्मणो बलवत्तरः । ब्रह्मन्ब्रह्मबलं दिव्यं क्षत्रात्तु बलवत्तरम् ॥
data.es: "O Best of brahmins it is held that the strength of a kshatriya is no greater than a brahmin's. A brahmin possesses great strength his strength is divine. It is greater than that of a kshatriya.
data.anv: क्षत्रियस्य the strength of a Kshatriya, बलम् strength, न आहु: do not speak (in high    esteem), ब्राह्मण: Brahmin, बलवत्तर: possesses greater strength, ब्रह्मन् O Best of Brahmins, क्षत्रात् greater than the strength of a Kshatriya, ब्रह्मबलम् the strength of a Brahmin, दिव्यम् is divine, बलवत्तरम् greater.
data.md: The might of the Kșatriyas is not great, the Brāhmaṇas are more mighty than they. O Brāhmaṇa, super-human is the power of the Brāhmaṇas, excelling that of the Kşatriyas.

data.v: अप्रमेयबलं तुभ्यं न त्वया बलवत्तरः । विश्वामित्रो महावीर्यस्तेजस्तव दुरासदम् ॥
data.es: Your power is immeasurable. Even though highly valiant, Viswamitra is not greater than you in strength. Your power is unequalled.
data.anv: तुभ्यम् for you, अप्रमेयबलम् immeasurable power, महावीर्य: highly valourous, विश्वामित्र: Visvamitra, त्वया more than you, बलवत्तर: न is not great in strength, तव your, तेज: splendour, दुरासदम् cannot be reached.
data.md: Your power is immeasurable; and the exceedingly energetic Viśvāmitra is not more one powerful than thyself. Your energy is unequalled.

data.v: नियुङ्क्ष्व मां महातेजस्त्वद्ब्रह्मबलसंभृताम् । तस्य दर्पं बलं यत्तन्नाशयामि दुरात्मनः ॥
data.es: O Highly fortunate one I am possessed of your brahminic power. Command me. I will destroy the insolent and power of that wickedminded one.
data.anv: महाभाग O Highly fortunate one, त्वद्ब्रह्मबलसम्भृताम् possessed of your brahminic power, माम् me, नियुङ्क्ष्व command, दुरात्मन: of the wickedminded, तस्य his, यत् which, दर्पबलम् insolent power, तत् that one, नाशयामि I will destroy.
data.md: O highly energetic one, do you command me bursting with Brahmā forces: the pride, power and endeavours of that wicked one will I bring down.

data.v: इत्युक्तस्तु तया राम वसिष्ठः सुमहायशाः । सृजस्वेति तदोवाच बलं परबलारुजम् ॥
data.es: O Rama to this, glorious Vasishta replied: "Create an army capable of crushing the enemy power.
data.anv: राम O Rama, तया by her, इति thus, उक्त: spoken, महायशा: highly glorious, वसिष्ठ: Vasishta, तदा then, परबलार्दनम् tormenting the power of enemies, बलम् army, सृजस्व create, इति thus, उवाच said.
data.md: Thus accosted by her, the highly famous Vasistha, O Rama, said, 'Create you forces capable of crushing the forces of the enemy.'

data.v: तस्या हुम्भारवोत्सृष्टाः पह्लवाः शतशो नृप । नाशयन्ति बलं सर्वं विश्वामित्रस्य पश्यतः ॥
data.es: Hearing his words Kamadhenu created an army. O Rama her lowing brought into being Paplavas in hundreds who destroyed the entire army of Viswamitra, while he looked on helplessly.
data.anv: तस्य his, तत् वचनम् this word, श्रुत्वा having heard, सा that, सुरभि: Kamadhenu, तदा then, असृजत् created (army), नृप O Rama, तस्या: that Kamadhenu's, हुम्भारवोत्सृष्टा: from the sound of 'Humbha' uttered by her, पप्लवा: paplavas, शतश: in hundreds, विश्वामित्रस्य  Viswamitra, पश्यत: while seeing, सर्वम् entire, बलम् army, नाशयन्ति destroyed.

data.v: स राजा परमक्रुद्धः क्रोधविस्फारितेक्षणः । पह्लवान्नाशयामास शस्त्रैरुच्चावचैरपि ॥
data.es: Thereafter the king (Viswamitra), having seen his army thus routed, flew into a fury. Wideeyed with anger, he sat in his chariot and destoyed the Paplavas with various kinds of weapons.
data.anv: तत: thereafter, स: राजा that king, कौशिक: Visvamitra, भग्नम् destroyed, बलम् army, दृष्ट्वा having seen, परमक्रुद्ध: exceedingly enraged, रोषविस्फारितेक्षण: his eyes expanded with anger, रथेन with chariot, आक्रम्य having occupied, उच्चावचै: अपि which were also of various kinds, शस्त्रै: with weapons, पप्लवान् Paplavas, नाशयामास destroyed.

data.v: विश्वामित्रार्दितान्दृष्ट्वा पह्लवाञ्शतशस्तदा । भूय एवासृजद्घोराञ्शकान्यवनमिश्रितान् ॥
data.es: Having seen hundreds of Paplavas crushed by Viswamitra, once again she created out of anger. Sakas mixed with Yavanas.
data.anv: विश्वामित्रार्दितान् afflicted by Visvamitra, शतश: hundreds of, पप्लवान् Papalavas, दृष्ट्वा having seen, तदा then, कोपात् out of anger, भूय एव again, यवनमिश्रितान् mixed with Yavanas, शकान् Sakas, असृजत् created.

data.v: तैरासीत्संवृता भूमिः शकैर्यवनमिश्रितैः । प्रभावद्भिर्महावीर्यैर्हेमकिञ्जल्कसंनिभैः ॥
data.es: Sakas mixed with Yavanas, resembling golden filaments possessing brilliance and supreme bravery, covered the earth.
data.anv: प्रभावद्भि: by those possessing splendour, महावीर्यै: supreme valour, हेमकिञ्चल्कसन्निभै: resembling golden filaments, यवनमिश्रितै: mixed with Yavanas, शकै: Sakas, भूमि: earth, संवृता आसीत् covered with.

data.v: दीर्घासिपट्टिशधरैर्हेमवर्णाम्बरावृतैः । निर्दग्धं तद्बलं सर्वं प्रदीप्तैरिव पावकैः ॥
data.es: Sakas and Yavanas, armed with swords and lances, clad in yellow apparel, looking like flaming fire destroyed the entire army.
data.anv: दीर्घासिपट्टिशधरै: armed with long swords and lances, हेमवर्णाम्बरावृतै: by those clad in yellow apparel (by Sakas and Yavanass), प्रदीप्तै: flaming, पावकैरिव like fire, तत् that, सर्वम् entire, बलम् army, निर्दग्धम् was consumed.

data.es: Thereafter, most brilliant Viswamitra released weapons. With these weapons, the Yavanas, Kambhojas and Paplavas were scattered".इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये बालकाण्डे चतुष्पञ्चाशस्सर्ग:॥Thus ends the fiftyfourth sarga of Balakanda of the holy Ramayana the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.
data.anv: तत: thereafter, महातेजा: most brilliant, विश्वामित्र: Visvamitra, अस्त्राणि weapons, मुमोच ह released, तैस्तै: with those weapons, यवनकाम्भोजा: Yavana, Kambhojas, पप्लवाश्च Paplavas, अकुलीकृता: were tormented.

data.v: ततस्तानाकुलान्दृष्ट्वा विश्वामित्रास्त्रमोहितान् । वसिष्ठश्चोदयामास कामधुक्सृज योगतः ॥
data.es: Thereafter, Vasishta having seen the forces tortured and overpowered by the weapons of Viswamitra said, "O Kamadhenu create additional forces through your yogic power."
data.anv: तत: thereafter, वसिष्ठ: Vasishta, विश्वामित्रास्त्रमोहितान् stupefied by weapons of Visvamitra, आकुलान् agitated, तान् them, दृष्ट्वा having seen, कामधुक् O Kamadhenu, योगत: through yogic power, सृज create, चोदयामास thus he directed.
data.md: And beholding them sore harassed, and overwhelmed by Visvāmitra's weapons, Vasistha directed (Sabala) saying, 'o cow of plenty, do you create (fresh troops), through your Yoga power.'

data.es: "From her lowing Kambhojas bright like the Sun, from the udder Paplavas, weapons in hand, from the vagina Yavanas, from the anus Sakas, from the roots of the hair Mlecchas along with Kiratas and Haritas were born.
data.anv: तस्या: her, हुम्भारवात् from the sound of 'Humba", रविसन्निभा: equal to Sun (in brightness), काम्भोजा: Kambhojas, जाता: were born, अथ and, ऊधस: from udder, शस्त्रपाणय: with  weapons in their hands, पप्लवा: Paplavas, सञ्जाता: were born, योनिदेशात् च from womb, यवना: Yavanas, तथा and, शकृद्देशात् from anus, शका: Sakas, रोमकूपेषु from roots of hair , म्लेच्छा: mlecchas, सकिराता: alomg with kiratas, हारीता: Haritas, were born.

data.v: योनिदेशाच्च यवनः शकृद्देशाच्छकास्तथा । रोमकूपेषु मेच्छाश्च हरीताः सकिरातकाः ॥
data.es: "From her lowing Kambhojas bright like the Sun, from the udder Paplavas, weapons in hand, from the vagina Yavanas, from the anus Sakas, from the roots of the hair Mlecchas along with Kiratas and Haritas were born.
data.anv: तस्या: her, हुम्भारवात् from the sound of 'Humba", रविसन्निभा: equal to Sun (in brightness), काम्भोजा: Kambhojas, जाता: were born, अथ and, ऊधस: from udder, शस्त्रपाणय: with  weapons in their hands, पप्लवा: Paplavas, सञ्जाता: were born, योनिदेशात् च from womb, यवना: Yavanas, तथा and, शकृद्देशात् from anus, शका: Sakas, रोमकूपेषु from roots of hair , म्लेच्छा: mlecchas, सकिराता: alomg with kiratas, हारीता: Haritas, were born.
data.md: And from her roar, there came into being Kamvojas, resembling the Sun. And from her udders sprang Barbaras, arms in hand; and from her mysterious parts, Yavanas; from her anus, Sakas; and from the pores of her skin, those barbarians, Hārītas and Kirātas.

data.v: तैस्तन्निषूदितं सैन्यं विश्वमित्रस्य तत्क्षणात् । सपदातिगजं साश्वं सरथं रघुनन्दन ॥
data.es: O descendant of the Raghus, Viswamitra's army consisting of infantry, elephants, horses, chariots has been entirely destroyed by them instantly.
data.anv: रघुनन्दन O Descendent of Raghu's, तैस्तै: those and those, तत्क्षणात् instantly, विश्वामित्रस्य Visvamitra's, सपदातिगजम् with infantry and elephants, साश्वम् with horses, सरथम् with chariots, सर्वम् entire(army), निषूदितम् has been destroyed.
data.md: And, (descendant of Raghu, Viśvāmitra's entire host consisting of foot, and elephant, and horse, and car, was exterminated by them.

data.v: दृष्ट्वा निषूदितं सैन्यं वसिष्ठेन महात्मना । विश्वामित्रसुतानां तु शतं नानाविधायुधम् ॥
data.es: Having seen the army destroyed by the powerful Vasishta, one hundred sons of Viswamitra became extremely furious and armed with various kinds of weapons rushed towards Vasishta, the best among ascetics. Adorable sage Vasishta, reduced them to ashes with just a 'humkara' (the loud 'hum' sound produced with the mouth)
data.anv: महात्मना by the magnanimous, वसिष्ठेन by Vasishta, निषूदितम् destroyed, सैन्यम् army, दृष्ट्वा having seen, विश्वामित्रसुतानाम् sons of Visvamitra, शतम् one hundred, नानाविधायुधम् armed with various kinds of weapons, सुसङ्कृद्धम् extremely furious, जपतां वरम् best among ascetics practising Japa, वसिष्ठम् towards Vasishta, अभ्यधावत् rushed towards him, भगवान् adorable, ऋषि: sage Vasishta, तान् सर्वान् all of them, हुंकारेणैव with 'Humkara" alone, ददाह burnt.
data.md: Seeing the army annihilated by the highsouled Vasiştha, the hundred sons of Viśvāmitra, equipped with various weapons, rushed in high ire against that best of mantra-reciting ones. Thereupon, uttering a roar, that mighty ascetic consumed them quite.

data.v: अभ्यधावत्सुसंक्रुद्धं वसिष्ठं जपतां वरम् । हुंकारेणैव तान्सर्वान्निर्ददाह महानृषिः ॥
data.md: Seeing the army annihilated by the highsouled Vasiştha, the hundred sons of Viśvāmitra, equipped with various weapons, rushed in high ire against that best of mantra-reciting ones. Thereupon, uttering a roar, that mighty ascetic consumed them quite.

data.v: ते साश्वरथपादाता वसिष्ठेन महात्मना । भस्मीकृता मुहूर्तेन विश्वामित्रसुतास्तदा ॥
data.es: Then one hundred sons of Viswamitra together with their horses, chariots and foot soldiers were reduced to ashes in a moment by the powerful Vasishta.
data.anv: तदा then, साश्वरथपादाता: together with horses, chariots and footsoldiers, ते विश्वामित्रसुता: those sons of Visvamitra, महात्मना by the magnanimous, वसिष्ठेन by Vasishta, मुहूर्तेन in a moment, भस्मीकृता: were reduced to ashes.
data.md: In a moment, Viśvāmitra's sons together with horse and car and foot were reduced to ashes by the high-souled Vasistha.

data.v: दृष्ट्वा विनाशितान्पुत्रान्बलं च सुमहायशाः । सव्रीडश्चिन्तयाविष्टो विश्वामित्रोऽभवत्तदा ॥
data.es: Seeing his sons and army destroyed the illustrious Viswamitra was filled with shame and anxiety.
data.anv: तदा then, सुमहायशा: possessing high fame, विश्वामित्र: Visvamitra, विनाशितान् destroyed, पुत्रान् sons, बलं च army, दृष्ट्वा having seen, सव्रीड: was filled with shame, चिन्तया in thought, आविष्ट: अभवत् pondered over.
data.md: And witnessing them all destroyed, together with the army, the illustrious Viśvāmitra, covered with shame, became plunged in thought.

data.v: संदुर इव निर्वेगो भग्नदंष्ट्र इवोरगः । उपरक्त इवादित्यः सद्यो निष्प्रभतां गतः ॥
data.es: Like the ocean without waves or the snake bereft of fangs or the Sun eclipsed by Rahu, suddenly (Viswamitra) looked cheerless and dull.
data.anv: निर्वेग: without speed (waves), समुद्र: इव like ocean, भग्नदंष्ट्र: bereft of fangs, उरग: इव like snake, उपरक्त: eclipsed by Rahu, आदित्य: इव like Sun, सद्य: suddenly, निष्प्रभताम् devoid of his effulgence, गत: obtained.
data.md: And like to a tideless ocean or a fangless snake, he instantly became shorn of his effulgence, like to the sun overwhelmed by Rahu.* *A Daitya with the tail of a dragon, whose head was served from his body by Vişnu; but being immortal, the head and tail retained their separate existence, and being transferred to the stellar sphere, became the author of eclipses.

data.v: हतपुत्रबलो दीनो लूनपक्ष इव द्विजः । हतदर्पो हतोत्साहो निर्वेदं समपद्यत ॥
data.es: Having lost his sons and the army, like a bird with wings clipped, wretched, with pride vanished and confidence shattered Viswamitra fell into despondency.
data.anv: हतपुत्रबल: with sons and army having been killed, लूनपक्ष: with wings cut off, द्विज: इव  like the bird, दीन: wretched, हतदर्प: with vanished pride, हतोत्साह: with shattered confidence, निर्वेदम् despondency, समपद्यत obtained.
data.md: And deprived of his forces and sons, he appeared like a bird bereft of its wings; and losing his entire army and with it the high spirits that it had inspired him with, his heart died within him.

data.v: स पुत्रमेकं राज्याय पालयेति नियुज्य च । पृथिवीं क्षत्रधर्मेण वनमेवान्वपद्यत ॥
data.es: Viswamitra, having entrusted one of his remaining sons to rule the kingdom in accordance with the kshatriya tradition reached the forest.
data.anv: स: he, पृथिवीम् the earth, क्षत्रधर्मेण in accordance with the tradition of Kshatriya, पालय  rule, इति thus, एकम् one, पुत्रम् son, राज्याय for the kingdom, नियुज्य having appointed, वनमेव forest, अन्वपद्यत reached.
data.md: Then entrusting one of his (remaining) sons with the sovereignty, with, 'Do you rule the earth agree ably to the duties of the Kșatriya,' he went into the forest.

data.v: स गत्वा हिमवत्पार्श्वं किंनरोरगसेवितम् । महादेवप्रसादार्थं तपस्तेपे महातपाः ॥
data.es: Mighty ascetic Viswamitra, reached the slopes of the Himavat mountain inhabited by kinnaras and uragas (serpents) and performed austerities in order to propitiate lord Mahadeva.
data.anv: महातपा: mighty ascetic, स: he, किन्नरोरगसेवितम् inhabited by kinnaras and urgas, हिमवत्पार्श्वं on the slopes of Himavat mountain, गत्वा having gone, महादेवप्रसादार्थम् with a view to propitiate lord Mahadeva, तप: austerities, तेपे performed.
data.md: And repairing to the side of the Himavat inhabited by Kinnaras and Serpents that one of mighty asceticism began to perform austerities with the view of propitiating Mahādeva.

data.v: केनचित्त्वथ कालेन देवेशो वृषभध्वजः । दर्शयामास वरदो विश्वामित्रं महामुनिम् ॥
data.es: After some time, lord of the gods, bestower of boons, Maheswara with the symbol of the bull on the banner appeared before mighty Viswamitra.
data.anv: अथ thereafter, केनचित्कालेन after some time, देवेश: lord of devatas, वृषभध्वज: with bull as his symbol (banner), वरद: bestower of boons, महाबलम् possessing great strength, विश्वामित्रम् Visvamitra, दर्शयामास showed himself.
data.md: On a certain occasion the lord of the celestials, Vrsadhvaja,* intending to confer a boon, appeared before a mighty ascetic Viśvāmitra. *An appellation of Śiva: meaning who has the bull for his vehicle.

data.v: किमर्थं तप्यसे राजन्ब्रूहि यत्ते विवक्षितम् । वरदोऽस्मि वरो यस्ते काङ्क्षितः सोऽभिधीयताम् ॥
data.es: O King what are you performing the penance for? Tell me what you want? I am bestower of boons. Speak out you desire (said Lord Siva).
data.anv: राजन् O King, किमर्थं what for, तप्यसे are you performing penance? ते to you, यत् which, विवक्षितम् intended to be conveyed, (तत् that one), ब्रूहि tell, वरद: अस्मि I am bestower of boons, य: वर: which boon, ते by you, काङ्क्षित: desired, स: that, अभिधीयताम् let it be spoken.
data.md: What for, O king, art you performing penance?. Do you unfold what you have to say. I am for conferring a boon: do you express what boon you would obtain.

data.v: एवमुक्तस्तु देवेन विश्वामित्रो महातपाः । प्रणिपत्य महादेवमिदं वचनमब्रवीत् ॥
data.es: Addressed, thus by both of them, Viswamitra ahead of all the sages, spoke to Rama.
data.anv: ताभ्याम् by both of them, एवम् in this way, उक्ता: having been addressed, महर्षय: maharshis, सर्वे एव all of them, विश्वामित्रम् Viswamitra, पुरस्कृत्य placing in the forefront, रामम् addressing Rama, वचनम् words, अब्रुवन् spoke.
data.md: Thus addressed by that god, that performer of mighty austerities, Viśvāmitra, bowing down to him, addressed him, saying.

data.v: यदि तुष्टो महादेव धनुर्वेदो ममानघ । साङ्गोपाङ्गोपनिषदः सरहस्यः प्रदीयताम् ॥
data.es: O Irreproachable one O Mahadeva if you are pleased with me, make me an expert in Dhanurveda, the science of archery with all it secrets, angas (branches), upangas (subdivisions) and Upanishads.
data.anv: अनघ O Irreproachable one, महादेव Mahadeva, तुष्ट: यदि if pleased, साङ्गोपाङ्गोपनिषद: with angas (branches), upangas (subdivisions), upanishads, सरहस्य: with secrets, धनुर्वेद: Dhanurveda, the science of archery, मम to me, प्रदीयताम् let it be given.
data.md: If, O mighty god, you are pleased (with me), do you confer upon me the science of archery with all its mysteries and mantras, as well as its virtues of helping from far and near.

data.v: यानि देवेषु चास्त्राणि दानवेषु महर्षिषु । गन्धर्वयक्षरक्षःसु प्रतिभान्तु ममानघ ॥
data.es: O Irreproachable one whatever weapons are known to devatas, danavas, maharshis, gandharvas, yakshas, rakshasas, be revealed to me.
data.anv: अनघ O Irreproachable one, देवेषु in devatas, दानवेषु in danavas, महर्षिषु in maharshis, गन्धर्वयक्षरक्षस्सु In gandharvas, yakshas, rakashas, यानि अस्त्राणि whatever weapons are known, मम प्रतिभान्तु let them be present in my mind (let them flash in my mind).
data.md: O sinless one, may all those weapons that are with the celestials and the Dānavas and the Maharșis and the Gandharvas and the Yakşas and the Rākşasa, shine on me ! May this my desire be granted me through your grace, O god of gods!

data.v: तव प्रसादाद्भवतु देवदेव ममेप्सितम् । एवमस्त्विति देवेशो वाक्यमुक्त्वा दिवं गतः ॥
data.es: O Lord of the gods by your favour let my desire be fulfilled. Lord Mahadeva having said: 'Be it so' vanished.
data.anv: देवदेव O Lord of gods, तव by your, प्रसादात् favour, मम my, ईप्सितम् desire, भवतु be fulfilled, एवम् अस्तु "Be it so", इति thus, देवेश: lord of devatas, Mahadeva, (वाक्यं )उक्त्वा having spoken, तदा then, गत: returned (to bis abode).

data.v: प्राप्य चास्त्राणि राजर्षिर्विश्वामित्रो महाबलः । दर्पेण महता युक्तो दर्पपूर्णोऽभवत्तदा ॥
data.es: Rajarshi Viswamitra endowed with supreme power became very haughty. Having obtained the weapons, his insolence was greatly accentuated.
data.anv: महाबल: endowed with supreme power, राजर्षि: rajarshi, महता by great, दर्पेण pride, युक्त: endowed with, विश्वामित्र: Visvamitra, तदा then, अस्त्राणि weapons, प्राप्य having obtained, दर्पपूर्ण: अभवत् filled with insolence.
data.md: Thereupon, saying, 'Be it so' the lord of the celestials vanished. And obtaining the arms from the lord of the celestials, the mighty Viśvāmitra, naturally haughty, became swelled with insolence.

data.v: विवर्धमानो वीर्येण समुद्र इव पर्वणि । हतमेव तदा मेने वसिष्ठमृषिसत्तमम् ॥
data.es: Like the sea during the full moon, with his increased power (blessed with the invincible strength of the weapons) Viswamitra thought the foremost of ascetics Vasishta was (already) slain. (It shows the height of the king's ignorance and arrogance).
data.anv: पर्वणि on the day of the full Moon and new Moon, समुद्र इव like sea, वीर्येण with energy, विवर्धमान: growing, ऋषिसत्तमम् foremost of ascetics, वसिष्ठम् Vasishta, तदा then, हतमेव slain only, मेने thought over.
data.md: Surcharged with energy, like to the sea during the equinox, he considered, O Rāma, as if that foremost of saints, Vasistha, was already slain.

data.v: ततो गत्वाश्रमपदं मुमोचास्त्राणि पार्थिवः । यैस्तत्तपोवनं सर्वं निर्दग्धं चास्त्रतेजसा ॥
data.es: Thereafter king Viswamitra having proceeded towards the hermitage (of Vasishta) and released the weapons by the energy of which the entire forest of the ascetics was burnt down.
data.anv: तत: there after, पार्थिव: king, आश्रमपदम् towards hermitage (of Vasishta), गत्वा having gone, अस्त्राणि weapons, मुमोच released, यै: by their energy, तत् सर्वम् all that, तपोवनम् forest of ascetics (for carrying austerities ), अस्त्रतेजसा by the power of those weapons, निर्दग्धम् was burnt.
data.md: And repairing to Vasistha's asylum, the king began to discharge weapons; and by their energy the hermitage began to burn.

data.v: उदीर्यमाणमस्त्रं तद्विश्वामित्रस्य धीमतः । दृष्ट्वा विप्रद्रुता भीता मुनयः शतशो दिशः ॥
data.es: On seeing the weapons discharged by the intelligent Viswamitra saints in hundreds fled in all directions.
data.anv: धीमत: by the sagacious, विश्वामित्रस्य Visvamitra's, तत् that, उदीर्यमाणम् being roused, अस्त्रम् weapons, दृष्ट्वा having seen, शतश: in hundreds, मुनय: saints, सर्वे all, दिश: in all directions, विप्रद्रुता: fled.
data.md: Beholding those weapons discharged by the intelligent Viśvāmitra, the ascetics, overtaken by fear, by hundreds began to fly.

data.v: वसिष्ठस्य च ये शिष्यास्तथैव मृगपक्षिणः । विद्रवन्ति भयाद्भीता नानादिग्भ्यः सहस्रशः ॥
data.es: The disciples of Vasishta as well as animals and birds got terrified by the fear and fled in their thousands in all directions.
data.anv: वसिष्ठस्य Vasishta's, ये those, शिष्या: disciples, तथैव as well as, मृगपक्षिण: animals and birds, भयात् for the reason of fear, भीता: terrified, सहस्रश: in thousands, नानादिग्भ्य: in all directions, विद्रवन्ति fled.
data.md: Vasiştha's disciples as well as the animals and birds inhabiting there, fled in all direction by thousands.

data.v: वसिष्ठस्याश्रमपदं शून्यमासीन्महात्मनः । मुहूर्तमिव निःशब्दमासीदीरिणसंनिभम् ॥
data.es: The greatsoul Vasishta's hermitage became deserted and silent in an instant like a barren field.
data.anv: महात्मन: of the magnanimous, वसिष्ठस्य Vasishta's, आश्रमपदम् hermitage, शून्यम् आसीत् has become deserted, मुहूर्तमिव in an instant as though, इरिणसन्निभम् like barren field, निश्शब्दम्  आसीत् became silent.
data.md: For a time the hermitage of the high souled Vasiştha was bare of living beings, and still like to a wilderness.

data.v: वदतो वै वसिष्ठस्य मा भैष्टेति मुहुर्मुहुः । नाशयाम्यद्य गाधेयं नीहारमिव भास्करः ॥
data.es: Even while Vasistha was repeatedly assuring the saints saying "Do not fear, I will now destroy Viswamitra, son of Gadhi just as the Sun dispels the morning mist (they fled)".
data.anv: भास्कर: Sun, नीहारमिव like mist, गाधेयम् son of Gadhi, अद्य now, नाशयामि I will destroy, माभै: fear not, इति thus, वसिष्ठस्य Vasishta, मुहुर्मुहु: repeatedly, वदत: while saying (they fled), not withstanding his assurance.
data.md: And Vasistha cried momentarily, 'Do not fear. To day will I slay Gadhi's son, even as the sun (destroys) mist.'

data.v: एवमुक्त्वा महातेजा वसिष्ठो जपतां वरः । विश्वामित्रं तदा वाक्यं सरोषमिदमब्रवीत् ॥
data.es: Vasishta who was highly brilliant the greatest among those who meditate (on Brahman) and free from sins was pleased. Thereafter he called the speckled cow (Kamadhenu):
data.anv: महातेजा: highly splendrous, जपतां वर: greatest among those who perform religious meditation, धूतकल्मष: free from sins, वसिष्ठ: Vasishta, प्रीत: pleased, तत: thereafter, कल्माषीम् the speckled cow, आजुहाव called.
data.md: Having said this, that best of mantra reciting ones, Vasistha, in high wrath, addressed Viśvāmitra, saying.

data.v: आश्रमं चिरसंवृद्धं यद्विनाशितवानसि । दुराचारोऽसि यन्मूढ तस्मात्त्वं न भविष्यसि ॥
data.es: "O Fool this hermitage has been developed over a long time. Why did you destroy it? On account of your wickedness you will not live long."
data.anv: मूढ O Fool, चिरसम्वृद्धम् developed over long time, आश्रमम् hermitage, यत् for what reason, विनाशितवान् असि you have destroyed, तत् for that reason, दुराचार: असि you are illbehaved, तस्मात् for that reason, त्वम् you, न भविष्यसि will not live.
data.md: Since, O fool, you have destroyed this hermitage that had been prospering for a long time, you of execrable ways shall not live long.

data.v: इत्युक्त्वा परमक्रुद्धो दण्डमुद्यम्य सत्वरः । विधूम इव कालाग्निर्यमदण्डमिवापरम् ॥

data.md: Saying this, he, transported with wrath, and like the smoking flame at at universal dissolution, speedily upraised a staff resembling another mace of Yama itself.' to

data.v: एवमुक्तो वसिष्ठेन विश्वामित्रो महाबलः । आग्नेयमस्त्रमुत्क्षिप्य तिष्ठ तिष्ठेति चाब्रवीत् ॥
data.es: To these words of Vasishta, the great intellectual Viswamitra said, "you have spoken pleasing words. This in itself is hospitality for me".
data.anv: देवेन by that god, एवम् thus, उक्त: spoken, महातपा: performer of mighty austerities, विश्वामित्र: Visvamitra, महादेवम् to Mahadeva, प्रणिपत्य having prostrated,  इदम् this, वचनम् word, अब्रवीत् spoke.
data.md: Thus addressed by Vasiştha, the mighty Viśvāmitra, aiming a fiery weapon, said, 'Stay! Stay!'

data.v: वसिष्ठो भगवान्क्रोधादिदं वचनमब्रवीत् ॥
data.es: Venerable Vasishta, in fury lifted the Brahmadanda which was like another rod of death. And spoke these words:
data.anv: भगवान् revered, वसिष्ठ: Vasishta, परम् another, कालदण्डमिव looking like unto the rod of death, ब्रह्मदण्डम् rod of Brahma, समुत्क्षिप्य having lifted, क्रोधात् in anger, इदम् this, वचनम् word, अब्रवीत् spoke.
data.md: The worshipful Vasiştha also on his part, raising a Brahmā staff resembling another staff of Kala, exclaimed in wrath.

data.v: क्षत्रबन्धो स्थितोऽस्म्येष यद्बलं तद्विदर्शय । नाशयाम्येष ते दर्पं शस्त्रस्य तव गाधिज ॥
data.es: "O wicked kshatriya O son of Gadhi here I stand. Show me your strength and the pride of your arms. I will destroy them now.
data.anv: क्षत्रबन्धो O Wicked kshatriya, एष: स्थित: अस्मि I am standing here, यत् बलम् which strength (you have), तत् that one, विदर्शय show it, गाधिज O Son of Gadhi, अद्य now, ते your, दर्पम् pride, तव your, शस्त्रस्य arms', नाशयामि I will destroy.
data.md: Wretch of a Kșatriya! here am I, do you display the might you are master of. To-day, O Gādhi's son, will I humble your pride of arms.

data.v: क्व च ते क्षत्रियबलं क्व च ब्रह्मबलं महत् । पश्य ब्रह्मबलं दिव्यं मम क्षत्रियपांसन ॥
data.es: "O Best of brahmins it is held that the strength of a kshatriya is no greater than a brahmin's. A brahmin possesses great strength his strength is divine. It is greater than that of a kshatriya.
data.anv: क्षत्रियस्य the strength of a Kshatriya, बलम् strength, न आहु: do not speak (in high    esteem), ब्राह्मण: Brahmin, बलवत्तर: possesses greater strength, ब्रह्मन् O Best of Brahmins, क्षत्रात् greater than the strength of a Kshatriya, ब्रह्मबलम् the strength of a Brahmin, दिव्यम् is divine, बलवत्तरम् greater.
data.md: You disgrace of the race, where is your Kș atriya might, and where my high Brahmä energy? Do you behold my superhuman Brahmā energy.

data.v: तस्यास्त्रं गाधिपुत्रस्य घोरमाग्नेयमुत्तमम् । ब्रह्मदण्डेन तच्छान्तमग्नेर्वेग इवाम्भसा ॥
data.es: The Brahmadanda (released by Vasishta) put down the dreadful agneya astra released by Gadhi's son just like the force of fire is extinguished by water.
data.anv: तस्य गाधिपुत्रस्य that Gadhi's son's, उद्यतम् discharged, तत् that, आग्नेयम् Agneya, अस्त्रम् weapon, अम्भसा by water, अग्ने: fire's, वेग: इव like speed, ब्रह्मदण्डेन by the rod of Brahma, शान्तम् calmed.
data.md: And even as water ally the fierceness of a flame, the Brahmā staff quenched the energy of the powerful fiery weapon discharged by Gadhi's Son.

data.v: वारुणं चैव रौद्रं च ऐन्द्रं पाशुपतं तथा । ऐषीकं चापि चिक्षेप रुषितो गाधिनन्दनः ॥
data.es: The incensed son of Gadhi employed varuna, raudra, aindra, pasupata and aishika weapons.
data.anv: कुपित: incensed, गाधिनन्दन: son of Gadhi, वारुणं चैव Varuna weapon, रौद्रं च Raudra, ऐन्द्रं च Aindra, तथा and, पाशुपतम् Pasupata, ऐषीकं चापि Aishika, चिक्षेप employed or discharged.
data.md: Then Gādhi's son, waxing wroth, discharged Vāruņa and Raudra and Aindra and Pāśupata and Aișika weapons.

data.v: मानवं मोहनं चैव गान्धर्वं स्वापनं तथा । जृम्भणं मोहनं चैव संतापनविलापने ॥
शोषणं दारणं चैव वज्रमस्त्रं सुदुर्जयम् । ब्रह्मपाशं कालपाशं वारुणं पाशमेव च ॥
पिनाकास्त्रं च दयितं शुष्कार्द्रे अशनी तथा । दण्डास्त्रमथ पैशाचं क्रौञ्चमस्त्रं तथैव च ॥
धर्मचक्रं कालचक्रं विष्णुचक्रं तथैव च । वायव्यं मथनं चैव अस्त्रं हयशिरस्तथा ॥
शक्तिद्वयं च चिक्षेप कङ्कालं मुसलं तथा । वैद्याधरं महास्त्रं च कालास्त्रमथ दारुणम् ॥
त्रिशूलमस्त्रं घोरं च कापालमथ कङ्कणम् । एतान्यस्त्राणि चिक्षेप सर्वाणि रघुनन्दन ॥
वसिष्ठे जपतां श्रेष्ठे तदद्भुतमिवाभवत् । तानि सर्वाणि दण्डेन ग्रसते ब्रह्मणः सुतः ॥
तेषु शान्तेषु ब्रह्मास्त्रं क्षिप्तवान्गाधिनन्दनः । तदस्त्रमुद्यतं दृष्ट्वा देवाः साग्निपुरोगमाः ॥
data.md: And on those (weapons) being resisted, the son of Gadhi hurled a Brahm, weapon. And on that weapon being discharged the deities with Agni at their head, and the Devarsis, and the Gandharvas, and the mighty Serpents, became afflicted with fear. And on that Brahm, weapon being discharged, all the three worlds became exceedingly alarmed.

data.v: देवर्षयश्च संभ्रान्ता गन्धर्वाः समहोरगाः । त्रैलोक्यमासीत्संत्रस्तं ब्रह्मास्त्रे समुदीरिते ॥
data.es: All the devatas, with Agni in the forefront, divine rishis, great uragas and gandharvas were agitated seeing the Brahmastra raised. When Brahmastra was discharged, the three worlds became distressed.
