data.md: And on those (weapons) being resisted, the son of Gadhi hurled a Brahm, weapon. And on that weapon being discharged the deities with Agni at their head, and the Devarsis, and the Gandharvas, and the mighty Serpents, became afflicted with fear. And on that Brahm, weapon being discharged, all the three worlds became exceedingly alarmed.

data.v: तदप्यस्त्रं महाघोरं ब्राह्मं ब्राह्मेण तेजसा । वसिष्ठो ग्रसते सर्वं ब्रह्मदण्डेन राघव ॥
data.es: O Descendant of Raghu Vasishta who possessed the energy of Brahma swallowed that very dreadful Brahmastra entirely with the help of Brahmadanda.
data.anv: राघव O Rama, वसिष्ठ: Vasishta, ब्रह्मेण तेजसा possessing the energy of Brahma, ब्रह्मदण्डेन with the danda of Brahma, महाघोरम् highly dreadful, तत् that, ब्रह्मं अस्त्रमपि Brahma astra also, सर्वम् entirely, ग्रसते swallowed.
data.md: O Raghu's descendant, Vasistha by virtue of his Brahmā energy completely baffled that terrible Brahmā weapon.

data.v: ब्रह्मास्त्रं ग्रसमानस्य वसिष्ठस्य महात्मनः । त्रैलोक्यमोहनं रौद्रं रूपमासीत्सुदारुणम् ॥
data.es: While swallowing Brahmastra the great Vasishta looked fierce and terrible causing the three worlds to faint.
data.anv: ब्रह्मास्त्रम् Brahma astra, ग्रसमानस्य while swallowing, महात्मन: of the magnanimous, वसिष्ठस्य Vasishta's, रूपम् form, त्रैलोक्यमोहनम् causing the three worlds to faint, रौद्रम् fierce, सुदारुणम् आसीत् became terrible.
data.md: When the high-souled Vasiştha had baffled the Brahmă weapon, his form the three worlds.

data.v: रोमकूपेषु सर्वेषु वसिष्ठस्य महात्मनः । मरीच्य इव निष्पेतुरग्नेर्धूमाकुलार्चिषः ॥
data.es: From every pore of the great Vasishta's body flames resembling rays of light with smoke emerged.
data.anv: महात्मन: Illustrious, वसिष्ठस्य Vasishta's, सर्वेषु completely, रोमकूपेषु in pores of his body,  धूमाकुलार्चिष: flames with smoke, अग्ने: fire's, मरीच्य: rays of light, निष्पेतुरिव looked like coming out.
data.md: And from the pores of his body, resembling a smoking flame, darted out scintillation's of fire.

data.v: प्राज्वलद्ब्रह्मदण्डश्च वसिष्ठस्य करोद्यतः । विधूम इव कालाग्निर्यमदण्ड इवापरः ॥
data.es: The staff of Brahma in Vasishta's hand, resembling smokeless fire at the end of the dissolution of the worlds inflamed like another rod of death.
data.anv: वसिष्ठस्य Vasishta's, करोद्यत: lifted in his hand, ब्रह्मदण्डश्च staff of Brahma, विधूम: smokeless, कालाग्निरिव fire at the end of dissolution of the worlds, अपर: another, यमदण्ड: इव rod of death, प्राज्वलत् inflammed (was burning ).
data.md: And resembling another staff of Yama, the Brahmā staff raised by Vasiştha's arm flamed like to the fire at the universal dissolution.

data.v: ततोऽस्तुवन्मुनिगणा वसिष्ठं जपतां वरम् । अमोघं ते बलं ब्रह्मंस्तेजो धारय तेजसा ॥
data.es: Then hosts of saints praised Vasishta, the best among sages, saying "O Brahmin, your energy is infallible, hold your energy by your enegy".
data.anv: तत: then, मुनिगणा: hosts of sages, जपतां वरम् best among sages, वसिष्ठम् Vasishta, अस्तुवन् praised, ब्रह्मन् O Brahmin, ते your, बलम् energy, अमोघम् infallible, तेज: your energy, तेजसा by your enegy, धारय hold.
data.md: Then the ascetics in a body fell to eulogizing that best of mantra-reciting ones, Vasistha, saying, “Your might, O Brāhmaṇa, is infallible. Do you rein in the (Brahmā) energy, by your own.'

data.v: निगृहीतस्त्वया ब्रह्मन्विश्वामित्रो महातपाः । प्रसीद जपतां श्रेष्ठ लोकाः सन्तु गतव्यथाः ॥
data.es: 'O Brahman great ascetic Viswamitra was controlled by you. O Best of ascetics be pleased and let the worlds be delivered from distress'.
data.anv: ब्रह्मन् O Brahman, त्वया by you, महातपा: great ascetic, विश्वामित्र: Visvamitra, निगृहीत: was controlled, जपतां श्रेष्ठ O Best of ascetics, प्रसीद be pleased, लोका: worlds, गतव्यथा: सन्तु be delivered from distress.
data.md: O Brāhmaṇa, Viśvāmitra of mighty strength has been subdued by you. Infallible is your extraordinary mighty. Let the creatures now be relieved from their distress.'

data.v: एवमुक्तो महातेजाः शमं चक्रे महातपाः । विश्वामित्रोऽपि निकृतो विनिःश्वस्येदमब्रवीत् ॥
data.es: The infuriated Vasishta who was highly brilliant, foremost among those who meditate said to Viswamitra:
data.anv: महातेजा: highly lustrous, जपतां वर: foremost among those who utter prayers, वसिष्ठ: Vasishta, एवम् thus, उक्त्वा having said, तदा then, विश्वामित्रम् Visvamitra, सरोषम् with anger, इदम् this, वाक्यम् word, अब्रवीत् spoke.
data.md: Thus addressed, that highly energetic one of rigid austerities, became pacified.

data.v: धिग्बलं क्षत्रियबलं ब्रह्मतेजोबलं बलम् । एकेन ब्रह्मदण्डेन सर्वास्त्राणि हतानि मे ॥
data.es: Shame Where is the might of a kshatriya? The energy of a brahmin is the real energy. The staff of Brahma has singly destroyed all my weapons".
data.anv: क्षत्रियबलम् the energy of Kshatriya, धिक् fie upon, ब्रह्मतेजोबलम् the strength of Brahma energy, बलम् energy, एकेन by one, ब्रह्मदण्डेन staff of Brahma, मे my, सर्वास्त्राणि all weapons, हतानि were beaten.
data.md: And Viśvāmitra, being put down, heaving a sigh said, 'Fie upon the Ksatriya might: the strength begot of Brahma energy, is might indeed. By one Brahmā staff has all my weapons been put to the rout.

data.v: तदेतत्समवेक्ष्याहं प्रसन्नेन्द्रियमानसः । तपो महत्समास्थास्ये यद्वै ब्रह्मत्वकारकम् ॥
data.es: "Now I have realised the reason. With clear mind and senses, I shall undertake intense penance which will earn me brahminhood".इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये बालकाण्डे षट्पञ्चाशस्सर्ग:॥Thus ends the fiftysixth sarga of Balakanda of the holy Ramayana the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.
data.anv: तत् for that reason, एतत् this affair, समवेक्ष्य having seen, प्रसन्नेन्द्रियमानस: with pellucid mind and senses, यत् which one, ब्रह्मत्वकारणम् is the reason for brahminhood, महत्  great, तप: penance, समास्थास्ये undertake.
data.md: Beholding this, I with a placid mind and senses will engage in mighty austerities, which shall earn for me Brāhmaṇa-hood.

data.v: ततः संतप्तहृदयः स्मरन्निग्रहमात्मनः । विनिःश्वस्य विनिःश्वस्य कृतवैरो महात्मना ॥
data.md: Then with his heart burning, in consequence of the remembrance of his humiliation, and having made enemies with that high-souled one, Viśvāmitra of mighty asceticism sighing and sighing, went towards the south, in company with his queen, and became engaged in dreadful austerities.

data.v: स दक्षिणां दिशं गत्वा महिष्या सह राघव । तताप परमं घोरं विश्वामित्रो महातपाः । फलमूलाशनो दान्तश्चचार परमं तपः ॥
अथास्य जज्ञिरे पुत्राः सत्यधर्मपरायणाः । हविष्पन्दो मधुष्पन्दो दृढनेत्रो महारथः ॥
data.es: After some time, four sons, Havishyanda, Madhushyanda, Drudhanetra and Maharatha, who (later) wer wedded to truth and duty, were born."
data.anv: अथ after some time, अस्य for him, हविष्यन्द: Havishyanda, मधुष्यन्द: Madhushyanda, दृढनेत्र: Dridhanetra, महारथ: Maharatha, सत्यधर्मपरायणा: practising truth and duty, पुत्रा: sons, जज्ञिरे were born.
data.md: O Rāghava. And subsisting on fruits and roots, and restraining his senses, he performed the most rigid austerities. And four sons engaged in observing truth and duty, Havișpanda, Madhuspanda, Dhrdhanetra, and Maharatha, were born to him.

data.v: पूर्णे वर्षसहस्रे तु ब्रह्मा लोकपितामहः । अब्रवीन्मधुरं वाक्यं विश्वामित्रं तपोधनम् ॥
data.es: A thousand years passed. The Grandsire of the worlds, Brahma, appeared. He spoke to Viswamitra, the great ascetic, these pleasant words:
data.anv: वर्षसहस्रे thousand years, पूर्णे when completed, पितामह: grandsire of the worlds, ब्रह्मा Brahma, तपोधनम् the great ascetic, विश्वामित्रम् addressing Visvamitra, मधुरम् pleasant, वाक्यम् words, अब्रवीत् spoke.
data.md: And when a thousand years had been completed, the Grand-sire of all, Brahma, addressed the ascetic, Viśvāmitra in sweet words, saying, 'O son of Kusika, the regions of the Rājarșis have been won by you through your austerities. And account of this your asceticism, we recognise you as a Rājarși.'

data.v: जिता राजर्षिलोकास्ते तपसा कुशिकात्मज । अनेन तपसा त्वां हि राजर्षिरिति विद्महे ॥
data.es: "O Son of Kushika with your austerities you have won the worlds of the rajarshis. On account of your austerities, you are acknowledged a rajarshi".
data.anv: कुशिकात्मज O Son of Kausika, ते your, तपसा with  austerities, राजार्षिलोका: the worlds of rajarshis, चिता: have been won, अनेन on account of this, तपसा austerities, त्वाम् you, राजार्षि:(इति) rajarshi, विद्महे is acknowledged.
data.md: And when a thousand years had been completed, the Grand-sire of all, Brahma, addressed the ascetic, Viśvāmitra in sweet words, saying, 'O son of Kusika, the regions of the Rājarșis have been won by you through your austerities. And account of this your asceticism, we recognise you as a Rājarși.'

data.v: एवमुक्त्वा महातेजा जगाम सह दैवतैः । त्रिविष्टपं ब्रह्मलोकं लोकानां परमेश्वरः ॥
data.es: Having said this the glorious (Brahma), supreme lord of the worlds, left for his abode in Brahmaloka, in heaven accompanied by the gods.
data.anv: महातेजा: highly illustrious, लोकानाम् for worlds, परमेश्वर: supreme lord, एवम् thus, उक्त्वा having spoken, दैवतै: along with devatas, ब्रह्मलोकम् Brahma loka, त्रिविष्टपम् heavens, जगाम went.
data.md: Having said this, the highly energetic prime Lord of all creatures went to the celestial regions in company with the celestials.

data.v: विश्वामित्रोऽपि तच्छ्रुत्वा ह्रिया किंचिदवाङ्मुखः । दुःखेन महताविष्टः समन्युरिदमब्रवीत् ॥
data.es: On hearing this Viswamitra hanging down his face a little with shame and anger and grief said:
data.anv: विश्वामित्रोऽपि Visvamitra also, तत् श्रुत्वा hearing this word, ह्रिया with shame, किञ्चित्          a little, अवाङ्मुख: hanging down his face, महता with great, दु:खेन distreess, आविष्ट: possessed by, समन्यु: with anger, इदम् this word, अब्रवीत् spoke.
data.md: Hearing this, Viśvāmitra hanging down his head from shame and possessed by a mighty sorrow, said, in piteous accents, I have performed rigid austerities, yet the deities and the saints recognise me only as a Rājarși. I do not consider the fruit of my asceticism as gained.' on

data.v: तपश्च सुमहत्तप्तं राजर्षिरिति मां विदुः । देवाः सर्षिगणाः सर्वे नास्ति मन्ये तपःफलम् ॥
data.es: "I have performed intense austerities. Yet rishis and devatas have recognised me only as a rajarshi. I think my penance has yielded fruit.
data.anv: सुमहत् exceedingly great, तप: austerities, तप्तम् performed, माम् me, राजर्षिरिति as rajarshi, सर्षिगणा: hosts of rishis, सर्वे देवा: all devatas, विदु: recognising, तप: फलम् fruit of penance, नास्ति is not, मन्ये thinking.
data.md: Hearing this, Viśvāmitra hanging down his head from shame and possessed by a mighty sorrow, said, in piteous accents, I have performed rigid austerities, yet the deities and the saints recognise me only as a Rājarși. I do not consider the fruit of my asceticism as gained.' on

data.v: एवं निश्चित्य मनसा भूय एव महातपाः । तपश्चचार काकुत्स्थ परमं परमात्मवान् ॥
data.es: "O Descendant of Kakustha (Rama) this celebrated intellectual having decided in his mind once again performed greater austerities.
data.anv: काकुत्स्थ O Rama, महातपाः (महायशा:) highly famous, परमात्मवान् great intellectual, इति thus, मनसा with his mind, निश्चित्य having decided, भूय: एव once again, परमम् greater, तप: austerities, चकार performed.
data.md: Ascertaining this in his mind, that righteous one of high austerities, O Kākutstha, again engaged in penances with a composed self.

data.v: एतस्मिन्नेव काले तु सत्यवादी जितेन्द्रियः । त्रिशङ्कुरिति विख्यात इक्ष्वाकु कुलनन्दनः ॥
data.es: At this time there lived a celebrated king, renowned in the Ikshvakus race, named Trisanku, who was truthful and self restrained.
data.anv: एतस्मिन्नेव काले at this time, सत्यवादी truthful, जितेन्द्रिय: with subdued senses,  इक्ष्वाकुकुलवर्धन: one who renowned in Ikshwaku race, त्रिशङ्कुरिति named Trishanku,  विख्यात: celebrated (there was a king).
data.md: O Rāghava, it came to pass that at this time, that enhance of Ikşvāku's line, the celebrated and truthful Trisanku of subdued senses made up his mind, saying, 'I will perform a sacrifice, and in body win the prime way of the celestials.'

data.v: तस्य बुद्धिः समुत्पन्ना यजेयमिति राघव । गच्छेयं स्वशरीरेण देवानां परमां गतिम् ॥
data.es: "O Son of the Raghus (Rama) a thought arose in his mind to enter heaven with his physical body by performing a sacrifice.
data.anv: राघव O Rama, स्वशरीरेण with his physical body, देवानाम् of devatas, गतिम् obtaining heaven, गच्छेयम् will obtain, यजेयम् I shall perform sacrifice, तस्य his, बुद्धि: thought, समुत्पन्ना arose in this way.
data.md: O Rāghava, it came to pass that at this time, that enhance of Ikşvāku's line, the celebrated and truthful Trisanku of subdued senses made up his mind, saying, 'I will perform a sacrifice, and in body win the prime way of the celestials.'

data.v: स वसिष्ठं समाहूय कथयामास चिन्तितम् । अशक्यमिति चाप्युक्तो वसिष्ठेन महात्मना ॥
data.es: Summoning Vasishta he (Trisahnku) communicated his intention, but the great Vasishta said it was not possible.
data.anv: स: he, वसिष्ठम् Vasishta, समाहूय summoning, चिन्तितम् his intention, कथयामास narrated, महात्मना by the magnanimous, वसिष्ठेन by Vasishta, अशक्यमिति not capable so, उक्त: अपि spoken also.
data.md: And summoning Vasiştha, he unfolded his mind to him. And on the high-souled Vasiştha saying, 'I am incapable of doing this,'

data.v: प्रत्याख्यातो वसिष्ठेन स ययौ दक्षिणां दिशम् । वसिष्ठा दीर्घ तपसस्तपो यत्र हि तेपिरे ॥
data.es: Refused by Vasishta, the king went south in order to fulfil his purpose and approached Vasishta's sons.
data.anv: वसिष्ठेन by Vasishta, प्रत्याख्यात: refused, दक्षिणाम् दिशम् towards southern direction, ययौ went, तत: afterwards, नृप: king, तत्कर्मसिद्ध्यर्थम् to fulfill his purpose, तस्य his(Vasishta's), पुत्रान् sons, गत: went.

data.v: त्रिशङ्कुः सुमहातेजाः शतं परमभास्वरम् । वसिष्ठपुत्रान्ददृशे तप्यमानान्यशस्विनः ॥
data.es: Most brilliant Trisanku approached the sons of Vasishta in the place where they had been performing austerities for a long time. There he saw the famous, exceedingly effulgent sons of Vasishta one hundred in number practising penance.
data.anv: दीर्घतपस: performing asceticism for a long time, वासिष्ठा: Vasistha's sons, यत्र where, तप: penance, तेपिरे performed, सुमहातेजा: most brilliant, त्रिशंङ्कु: Trishanku, परमभास्वरम् exceedingly effulgent, शतम् hundred, यशस्विन: possessing fame, तप्यमानान् performing austerities, वसिष्ठपुत्रान् sons of Vasistha, ददृशे beheld.

data.v: सोऽभिगम्य महात्मानः सर्वानेव गुरोः सुतान् । अभिवाद्यानुपूर्व्येण ह्रिया किंचिदवाङ्मुखः । अब्रवीत्सुमहातेजाः सर्वानेव कृताञ्जलिः ॥
data.es: The king, having approached all the illustrious sons of his spiritual guide, paid obeisance to them in order of seniority. Bowing down his face in humility and with folded palms, he addressed all those distinguished sons of Vasishta saying:
data.anv: स: he (the king), महात्मन: illustrious, सर्वानेव all, गुरो: सुतान् sons of spiritual guide, अभिगम्य having approached, आनुपूर्व्येण in the order of the age, अभिवाद्य having paid obeisance, ह्रिया in humility, किञ्चित् a little, अवाङ्मुख: bowing down his face, कृताञ्जलि: with folded palms, सर्वानेव all those, (सु)महाभागान् distinguished ones, अब्रवीत् spoke.
data.md: And the highly energetic Trisanku saw the hundred exceedingly effulgent sons of Vasistha engaged in austerities with fixed faculties. And approaching all those high-souled sons of his spiritual guide, and paying them reverence he, hanging down his head from shame, with clasped hands, addressed those mighty spirits, saying.

data.v: शरणं वः प्रपद्येऽहं शरण्याञ्शरणागतः । प्रत्याख्यातोऽस्मि भद्रं वो वसिष्ठेन महात्मना ॥
data.es: O protectors of those who seek refuge in you, protect me. Wish you well. I have been refused by the great Vasishta.
data.anv: शरणागत: seeking refuge, अहम् I, शरण्यान् protectors, व: you, शरणं प्रपद्ये seeking refuge, व: to you, भद्रम् prosperity, महात्मना by the magnanimous, वसिष्ठेन by Vasishta, प्रत्याख्यात: अस्मि I have been refused.
data.md: I seek protection of you; and I take refuge in you capable of conferring it. Disregarded have I been, good betide you, by the high-souled Vasiştha. I have set my heart upon celebrating a mighty sacrifice: it behove you to command me.

data.v: यष्टुकामो महायज्ञं तदनुज्ञातुमर्थथ । गुरुपुत्रानहं सर्वान्नमस्कृत्य प्रसादये ॥
data.es: 'I wish to perform a great sacrifice. You are worthy enough to tender your consent. I pay homage to all the sons of my spiritual guide oblige.
data.anv: महायज्ञम् great sacrifice, यष्टुकाम: desire to perform, तत् for that reason, अनुज्ञातुम् to give consent, अर्हथ fit and proper, अहम् I, गुरुपुत्रान् sons of spiritual guide, सर्वान् all of you,  नमस्कृत्य having paid my homage, प्रसादये I will please you.

data.v: शिरसा प्रणतो याचे ब्राह्मणांस्तपसि स्थितान् । ते मां भवन्तः सिद्ध्यर्थं याजयन्तु समाहिताः । सशरीरो यथाहं हि देवलोकमवाप्नुयाम् ॥
data.es: You, brahmins are established in austerity. I bow to you. I beg all of you to direct me with composed minds to direct me in order to attain heaven in physical form'.
data.anv: शिरसा with my head,  प्रणत: saluting by bowing down, तपसि स्थितान् you established in austerity, ब्राह्मणान् you, Brahmins, याचे beg, ते such, भवन्त: all of you, समाहिता: with composed minds, माम् me, सिद्ध्यर्थम् for achieving the purpose, याजयन्तु direct me in performing the sacrifice, अहम् I, सशरीर: in physical form, यथा in such manner, देवलोकम् heaven, अवाप्नुयाम् will reach.
data.md: And with the view of propitiating you, I, lowly bowing down my head, beseech the sons of my spiritual guide, Brāhmaṇas ever staying by asceticism, do you with collected minds officiate in this sacrifice, so that success may be secured to me; and that in body I may attain the regions of the celestials.

data.v: प्रत्याख्यातो वसिष्ठेन गतिमन्यां तपोधनाः । गुरुपुत्रानृते सर्वान्नाहं पश्यामि कांचन ॥
data.es: O Ascetocs after having been rejected by Vasishta. I do not see any way other than the sons of my spiritual guide to help me achieve my purpose.
data.anv: तपोधना: O Men having asceticism for your wealth, वसिष्ठेन by Vasishta, प्रत्याख्यात: refused, अहम् I, सर्वान् all, गुरुपुत्रानृते other than sons of spiritual guide, अन्यान् others, गतिम् way, काञ्चन anything, न पश्यामि do not see.
data.md: Disregarded by the ascetic Vasiştha, other way find I none, you anchorets, except the sons of my spiritual guide.

data.v: इक्ष्वाकूणां हि सर्वेषां पुरोधाः परमा गतिः । तस्मादनन्तरं सर्वे भवन्तो दैवतं मम ॥
data.es: For all the descendants of Ikshvakus the spiritual preceptor is the supreme resort for salvation. Learned spiritual preceptors have always liberated kings. Hence you are all gods to me only next to Vasishta".इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये बालकाण्डे सप्तपञ्चाशस्सर्ग:॥Thus ends the fiftyseventh sarga of Balakanda of the holy Ramayana the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.
data.anv: सर्वेषाम् for all, इक्ष्वाकूणाम् descendants of Ikshvaku, पुरोधा: spiritual preceptor, परमा गति: हि is indeed supreme salvation, विद्वांस: learned, पुरोधस: spiritual preceptors, सदा always, नृपान् kings, तारयन्ति liberated, तस्मात् for that reason, अनन्तरम् after him, भवन्त: you, सर्वे all, मम to me, दैवतम् gods.
data.md: To the Ikşvākus, their preceptor is their prime way. Therefore after him (Vasistha), even you are the objects of my adoration.

data.v: ततस्त्रिशङ्कोर्वचनं श्रुत्वा क्रोधसमन्वितम् । ऋषिपुत्रशतं राम राजानमिदमब्रवीत् ॥
data.es: "O Rama to these words of king Trisanku, the hundred sons of the sage angrily reacted:
data.anv: राम O Sri Rama, त्रिशङ्को: Trishanku's, वचनम् words, श्रुत्वा having heard, तत: afterwards, ऋषिपुत्रशतम् hundred sons of Vasishta, क्रोधसमन्वितम् filled with wrath, राजानम् addressing king, इदम् this word, अब्रवीत् spoke.
data.md: Hearing Trišanku's speech, the hundred sons of the saint, O Rāma, excited by wrath, said these words to the king, ‘Disregarded hast you been, O you of perverse understanding, by our truth-telling sire, why then, having passed him by, do you seek for others' help?

data.v: प्रत्याख्यातोऽसि दुर्बुद्धे गुरुणा सत्यवादिना । तं कथं समतिक्रम्य शाखान्तरमुपेयिवान् ॥
data.es: 'O Evilminded one having been refused by the Guru true to his word, how could you bypass him and approach us who are mere off shoots (of the main).
data.anv: दुर्बुद्धे O Evil minded one, सत्यवादिना by the truth speaking, गुरुणा by spiritual preceptor, प्रत्याख्यात: refused, तम् him, अतिक्रम्य having by passed, शाखान्तरम् other branch, कथम् how, उपेयिवान् you have reached.
data.md: Hearing Trišanku's speech, the hundred sons of the saint, O Rāma, excited by wrath, said these words to the king, ‘Disregarded hast you been, O you of perverse understanding, by our truth-telling sire, why then, having passed him by, do you seek for others' help?

data.v: इक्ष्वाकूणां हि सर्वेषां पुरोधाः परमा गतिः । न चातिक्रमितुं शक्यं वचनं सत्यवादिनः ॥
data.es: For all the kings of the Ikshvakus race, their chief priest is their Guru. It is not possible to bypass the spiritual preceptor who is true to his word preceptor.
data.anv: सर्वेषाम् for all, इक्ष्वाकूणाम् kings of Ikshwaku race, पुरोधा: their spiritual preceptor, परम: is highly, गुरु: venerable one, सत्यवादिन: truthspeaking one, वचनम् word, अतिक्रमितुम् to by pass, न शक्यम् not capable of being done.
data.md: To the Ikşvākus, their spiritual guide is their prime way; nor art you capable of setting at naught the words of that truth-telling one.

data.v: अशक्यमिति चोवाच वसिष्ठो भगवानृषिः । तं वयं वै समाहर्तुं क्रतुं शक्ताः कथं तव ॥
data.es: When an adorable sage like Vasishta has already said, it is not possible, how can we help you conduct such a sacrifice?
data.anv: भगवान् adorable, वसिष्ठ: ऋषि: sage Vasistha, अशक्यमिति incapable(of being accompished) to, उवाच said, तम् such, क्रतुम् sacrifice, तव to you, समाहर्तुम् to perform, वयम् we, कथम् how, शक्ता: are capable.
data.md: That worshipful saint said, that he was incapable (of accomplishing this), how can we then undertake that sacrifice?

data.v: बालिशस्त्वं नरश्रेष्ठ गम्यतां स्वपुरं पुनः । याजने भगवाञ्शक्तस्त्रैलोक्यस्यापि पार्थिव ॥
data.es: O Best one among men you are childish. Return to your capital. O Monarch the most venerable Vasishta is capable of conducting sacrifices performed by anybody in the three worlds. How can we dishonour him'?
data.anv: नरश्रेष्ठ O Best among men, त्वम् you, बालिश: childish, पुन: again, स्वपुरम् your capital, गम्यताम् return, पार्थिव O Monarch, भगवान् venerable, त्रैलोक्यस्य of the three worlds, याजनेऽपि to perform sacrifices, शक्त: is capble, तत् for that reason, तस्य his, अवमानम् dishonour, कर्तुम् to do, कथम् how, शक्ष्यामहे can we be capable of.
data.md: You are ignorant, O foremost of men. Do you speedily retrace your steps. And, O king, that adorable one is competent to officiate at the sacrifice itself of the three worlds, how can we then contribute to his dishonour?'

data.v: तेषां तद्वचनं श्रुत्वा क्रोधपर्याकुलाक्षरम् । स राजा पुनरेवैतानिदं वचनमब्रवीत् ॥
data.es: Having heard the confused words uttered by the sages in a state of anger, the king said again:
data.anv: स: राजा that king, क्रोधपर्याकुलाक्षरम् confused speech due to anger, तत् that, वचनम् word, श्रुत्वा having listened, पुनरेव again, इदम् this, वचनम् word, अब्रवीत् spoke.
data.md: Hearing those words of theirs, that king, with accents tremulous with passion, again addressed them, saying, 'Disregarded by that worshipful one as well as by the sons of my spiritual guide, I will go after another way, so peace he to you, ascetics.'

data.v: प्रत्याख्यातोऽस्मि गुरुणा गुरुपुत्रैस्तथैव च । अन्यां गतिं गमिष्यामि स्वस्ति वोऽस्तु तपोधनाः ॥
data.es: "O Men endowed with the wealth of asceticism I was rejected by my guru and now by his sons. I shall seek another way. Farewell to you".
data.anv: तपोधना: O Men having asceticism as wealth, गुरुणा by spiritual preceptor, तथैव च as also, गुरुपुत्रैश्च by the sons of spiritual preceptor, प्रत्याख्यात: अस्मि I am disregarded, अन्याम् another, गतिम् way, गमिष्यामि shall seek, व: to you, स्वस्ति अस्तु farewell to you.
data.md: Hearing those words of theirs, that king, with accents tremulous with passion, again addressed them, saying, 'Disregarded by that worshipful one as well as by the sons of my spiritual guide, I will go after another way, so peace he to you, ascetics.'

data.v: ऋषिपुत्रास्तु तच्छ्रुत्वा वाक्यं घोराभिसंहितम् । शेपुः परमसंक्रुद्धाश्चण्डालत्वं गमिष्यसि । एवमुक्त्वा महात्मानो विविशुस्ते स्वमाश्रमम् ॥
data.es: Having seen his fierce intent, the saint's sons were infuriated. They cursed him saying, "Be a Chandala"
data.anv: ऋषिपुत्रास्तु saint's sons, घोराभिसंहितम् with fierce intent, तत् that, वाक्यम् word, श्रुत्वा having listened, परमसङ्कृद्धा: highly furious, चण्डालत्वम् chandalahood, गमिष्यसि will obtain, शेपु: cursed.
data.md: The saint's sons, on their part, hearing that speech couching a fierce intent, cursed him in exceeding wrath, saying, 'You shall come by Candāla-hood.' Having said this, those highsouled ones entered each into his dwelling.'

data.v: अथ रात्र्यां व्यतीतायां राजा चण्डालतां गतः । नीलवस्त्रधरो नीलः परुषो ध्वस्तमूर्धजः । चित्यमाल्यानुलेपश्च आयसाभरणोऽभवत् ॥
data.es: The king was tranformed into a darkcomplexioned dirty man with dishevelled hair. His body was besmeared with ashes and on his robes lay wreath collected from the cemetery. He had on him dark (soiled) clothes, and ornaments made of iron.
data.anv: नीलवस्त्रधरो wearing black garment, नील: dark complexioned, परुष: dirty, ध्वस्तमूर्धज: dishevelled hair, चित्यमाल्यानुलेपश्च besmeared with ashes and wearing wreaths from the cemetery, आयसाभरण: wearing ornaments made of iron, अभवत् became.
data.md: And vhen the „ight had gone by the king came by Chandala-hood. And clad in a blue garb, blue and rough of person, having a short head of hair, wearing a garland composed of materials culled from a cemetery, his body bedaubed with ashes from the same quarter, he was decked out with iron ornaments.

data.v: तं दृष्ट्वा मन्त्रिणः सर्वे त्यक्त्वा चण्डालरूपिणम् । प्राद्रवन्सहिता राम पौरा येऽस्यानुगामिनः ॥
data.es: "O Rama seeing him in the form of a chandala, all his counsellors, inhabitants of the city including his followers fled away.
data.anv: राम O Rama, चण्डालरूपिणम् in the form of Chadala, तम् him, दृष्टवा having seen, सर्वे all, मन्त्रिण: counsellors, पौरा: inhabitants of city, ये who, अस्य his, अनुगामिन: सहिता: including followers, प्राद्रवन् fled away.
data.md: And, O Rāma, beholding him in the guise of a Chandala, his counsellors as well as followers, renouncing him, fled in a body. And, O Kākutstha, maintaining himself in patience, the monarch burning day and night, all alone went to the ascetic Viśvāmitra.

data.v: एको हि राजा काकुत्स्थ जगाम परमात्मवान् । दह्यमानो दिवारात्रं विश्वामित्रं तपोधनम् ॥
data.es: O Descendant of Kakustha wandering alone burning with distress night and day the king went to Viswamitra who was rich in asceticism.
data.anv: काकुत्स्थ O Rama, परम् great, आत्मवान् courageous, राजा king, एक: moving alone, दिवारात्रम्  day and night, दह्यमान: burning, तपोनिधिम् rich in asceticism, विश्वामित्रम् towards Visvamitra, जगाम went.

data.v: विश्वामित्रस्तु तं दृष्ट्वा राजानं विफलीकृतम् । चण्डालरूपिणं राम मुनिः कारुण्यमागतः ॥
data.es: O Rama on seeing the king reduced to a useless a chandala, sage Viswamitra was touched with pity".
data.anv: राम O Rama, मुनि: sage, विश्वामित्रस्तु Visvamitra, विफलीकृतम् made worthless, चण्डालरूपिणम् found in the form of Chandala, तम् that, राजानम् king, दृष्ट्वा having seen, कारुण्यम् pity, आगत: obtained.

data.v: कारुण्यात्स महातेजा वाक्यं परम धार्मिकः । इदं जगाद भद्रं ते राजानं घोरदर्शनम् ॥
data.es: Exceedingly energetic and deeply pious, he looked at the king who was frightful in appearance and addressed him with compassion saying, "welfare to you".
data.anv: महातेजा: exceedingly energetic, परमधार्मिक: highly pious, स: he, कारुण्यात् out of compassion, घोररूपिणम् frightful to look, राजानम् king, ते भद्रम् welfare to you, इदम् this word, जगाद spoke.

data.v: किमागमनकार्यं ते राजपुत्र महाबल । अयोध्याधिपते वीर शापाच्चण्डालतां गतः ॥
data.es: "O Mighty prince what brings your here, for you are the heroic lord of Ayodhya? Whose curse turned you into a chandala"?
data.anv: महाबल mighty, राजपुत्र O Prince, ते your, आगमनकार्यम् purpose of coming, किम् what,  अयोध्याधिपते O Lord of Ayodhya, वीर hero, शापात् from the curse, चण्डालताम् chandalahood, गत: you have obtained.

data.v: अथ तद्वाक्यमाकर्ण्य राजा चण्डालतां गतः । अब्रवीत्प्राञ्जलिर्वाक्यं वाक्यज्ञो वाक्यकोविदम् ॥
data.es: In response to his words the king, who had fallen into the state of a chandala yet proficient in expression, spoke to one (Viswamitra) expert in speech, with folded hands.
data.anv: अथ thereafter, चंण्डालताम् chandala hood, गत: obtained, वाक्यज्ञ: knower of words, राजा king, तद्वाक्यम् that word, आज्ञाय having come to know, प्राञ्जलि: with folded hands in supplication, वाक्यकोविदम् proficient in speech, वाक्यम् word, अब्रवीत् spoke.
data.md: Hearing him, the king conversant with words, fallen into Candāla-hood, with folded hands, said to that one versed in speech.

data.v: प्रत्याख्यातोऽस्मि गुरुणा गुरुपुत्रैस्तथैव च । अनवाप्यैव तं कामं मया प्राप्तो विपर्ययः ॥
data.es: "O Men endowed with the wealth of asceticism I was rejected by my guru and now by his sons. I shall seek another way. Farewell to you".
data.anv: तपोधना: O Men having asceticism as wealth, गुरुणा by spiritual preceptor, तथैव च as also, गुरुपुत्रैश्च by the sons of spiritual preceptor, प्रत्याख्यात: अस्मि I am disregarded, अन्याम् another, गतिम् way, गमिष्यामि shall seek, व: to you, स्वस्ति अस्तु farewell to you.
data.md: Disregarded had I been by my spiritual guide as well as his sons. And far from attaining my desire, I came by this calamity.

data.v: सशरीरो दिवं यायामिति मे सौम्यदर्शनम् । मया चेष्टं क्रतुशतं तच्च नावाप्यते फलम् ॥
data.es: O Gentle sage it is my intention to enter heaven with my physical body. I performed a hundred sacrifices but did not reap its fruit.
data.anv: सौम्य O Gentle sage, सशरीर: with my physical body, दिवम् heaven, यायाम् I may enter, इति thus, मे my, दर्शनम् intention, मया by me, क्रतुशतम् a hundred sacrifices, इष्टम् performed,   तत् that, फलम् fruit of it, नावाप्यते च was not obtained.
data.md: O you of placid presence, I had desired to repair to heaven in body. By me have an hundred sacrifices been performed, but yet do I not obtain the fruit thereof.

data.v: अनृतं नोक्त पूर्वं मे न च वक्ष्ये कदाचन । कृच्छ्रेष्वपि गतः सौम्य क्षत्रधर्मेण ते शपे ॥
data.es: O Gentle sage I have never told a lie in spite of troubled circumstances, I shall never dabble in falsehood. I swear upon it by kshatriya morality .
data.anv: सौम्य O Gentle sage, मे by me, अनृतम् untruth, न उक्तपूर्वम् was not uttered earlier, कदाचन never, कृच्छ्रेषु गत: अपि inspite of troubled circumstances, न वक्ष्ये I shall not speak, क्षत्रधर्मेण by kshatriya morality, ते to you, शपे I swear.
data.md: I have never before told an untruth; and I swear by my Ksatriya morality, that albeit fallen on evil days, I will never do so in future, O gentle one.

data.v: यज्ञैर्बहुविधैरिष्टं प्रजा धर्मेण पालिताः । गुरवश्च महात्मानः शीलवृत्तेन तोषिताः ॥
data.es: I have performed various sacirifices and ruled over my people guided by the law of righteousness. I have pleased eminent elders with my conduct and character.
data.anv: बहुविधै: by various kinds of, यज्ञै: with sacrifices, इष्टम् favourite gods were worshipped, प्रजा: my people, धर्मेण with law of righteousness, पालिता: are ruled, महात्मान: eminent, गुरवश्च elders, शीलवृत्तेन by my character and conduct, तोषिता: were pleased.

data.v: धर्मे प्रयतमानस्य यज्ञं चाहर्तुमिच्छतः । परितोषं न गच्छन्ति गुरवो मुनिपुंगव ॥
data.es: O Preeminent among sages I endeavour to do my duty. I intend to perform a sacrifice. My gurus do not appreciate this.
data.anv: मुनिपुङ्गव O Preeminent among sages, धर्मे in my duty, प्रयतमानस्य endeavouring, यज्ञम् sacrifice, आहर्तुम् to perform, इच्छतश्च intending, गुरव: spiritual preceptors, परितोषम् pleasure, न गच्छन्ति do not get.

data.v: दैवमेव परं मन्ये पौरुषं तु निरर्थकम् । दैवेनाक्रम्यते सर्वं दैवं हि परमा गतिः ॥
data.es: I consider destiny to be allpowerful. The effort of a man goes in vain. Everything is controlled by destiny. It is the supreme resort.
data.anv: दैवमेव destiny alone, परम् is allpowerful, मन्ये I am thinking, पौरुषम् तु the effort of a man, निरर्थकम् is invain, सर्वम् everything, दैवेन by destiny, आक्रम्यते is occupied, दैवम् destiny, परमा supreme, गति: हि way indeed.

data.v: तस्य मे परमार्तस्य प्रसादमभिकाङ्क्षतः । कर्तुमर्हसि भद्रं ते दैवोपहतकर्मणः ॥
data.es: My merits have been destroyed by destiny. Deeply afflicted, I crave a favour from you. You are fit to grant it. Wish you well
data.anv: परमार्तस्य highly afflicted, ते your, प्रसादम् favour, अभिकाङ्क्षत: desiring, दैवोपहतकर्मण: with my actions hit by destiny, तस्य such, मे to me, कर्तुम् to do, अर्हसि fit and proper, भद्रम् prosperity to you.
data.md: Density overtake all: Destiny is the prime way. Therefore it behove you to grant your favour to me extremely distressed, who crave your favour, and, good betide you, whole endeavours have been baffled by Density.

data.v: नान्यां गतिं गमिष्यामि नान्यः शरणमस्ति मे । दैवं पुरुषकारेण निवर्तयितुमर्हसि ॥
data.es: I will not take refuge in anybody. There is no other protector for me. You are capable of averting my reverses in fate with human effort". इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये बालकाण्डे अष्टपञ्चाशस्सर्ग:॥Thus ends the fiftyeighth sarga of Balakanda of the holy Ramayana the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.
data.anv: अन्याम् other, गतिम् refuge, न गमिष्यामि I will not obtain, मे to me, अन्य: other person, शरणम् protector, नास्ति does not exist, दैवम् destiny, पुरुषकारेण with human effort, निवर्तयितुम् to avert, अर्हसि you are capable.
data.md: Other way will I wend none; nor is there any other refuge for me. It behove you to meet Density with exertion.

data.v: उक्तवाक्यं तु राजानं कृपया कुशिकात्मजः । अब्रवीन्मधुरं वाक्यं साक्षाच्चण्डालरूपिणम् ॥
data.es: What the king said was proved by his chandala form which the son of Kushika (Viswamitra) heard and out of compassion spoke these sweet words:
data.anv: उक्तवाक्यम् having the words spoken, साक्षात् evident to the senses, चण्डालरूपिणम् chandala form, राजानम् king, कृपया out of pity, कुशिकात्मज: Visvamitra, मधुरम् sweet, वाक्यम् words, अब्रवीत् spoken.
data.md: When the king had spoken thus, Kausika's son, moved with pity, said these sweet words to the king who had undergone Candāla-hood.

data.v: इक्ष्वाको स्वागतं वत्स जानामि त्वां सुधार्मिकम् । शरणं ते भविष्यामि मा भैषीर्नृपपुंगव ॥
data.es: "O Descendant of Ikshvakus, O child, welcome. I know you as highly righteous. O eminent among kings fear not. I offer you refuge.
data.anv: ऐक्ष्वाक O Descendant of Ikshvakus, वत्स child, स्वागतम् welcome, त्वाम् you, सुधार्मिकम् as highly righteous one, जानामि I know you, नृपपुङ्गव O Eminent among kings, माभैषी: fear not, ते to you, शरणम् refuge, भविष्यामि I shall become.
data.md: O descendant of Ikşvāku, have you had a pleasant journey? I know you well, O highly virtuous one. Refuge will I grant you, so fear not, O best of monarchs.

data.v: अहमामन्त्रये सर्वान्महर्षीन्पुण्यकर्मणः । यज्ञसाह्यकरान्राजंस्ततो यक्ष्यसि निर्वृतः ॥
data.es: O king I shall invite pious maharshis to assist you in the sacrifice which you will be able to perform with great relief.
data.anv: अहम् I, पुण्यकर्मण: men of pious deeds, यज्ञसाह्यकरान् to assist in the sacrifice, सर्वान् all, महर्षीन् maharshis, आमन्त्रये I shall invite, निर्वृत: with relief, यक्ष्यसि you will perform the sacrifice.

data.v: गुरुशापकृतं रूपं यदिदं त्वयि वर्तते । अनेन सह रूपेण सशरीरो गमिष्यसि ॥
data.es: With the present physical body disfigured by the curse of your spiritual preceptor, you shall go to heaven.
data.anv: गुरुशापकृतम् as a result of the curse of spiritual preceptor, यत् which, रूपम् form, त्वयि in you, वर्तते existing, अनेन by  this, रूपेण सह with form, सशरीर: with the physical body, गमिष्यसि you shall go.

data.v: हस्तप्राप्तमहं मन्ये स्वर्गं तव नरेश्वर । यस्त्वं कौशिकमागम्य शरण्यं शरणं गतः ॥
data.es: O King since you have taken refuge in Viswamitra who is the protector of those who resort to him, I think heaven is already within your reach".
data.anv: नराधिप O King, य: such that, त्वम् you, शरण्यम् fit to take refuge in, कौशिकम् Visvamitra, आगम्य having reached, शरणागतः have taken refuge, तव for you, स्वर्गम् heaven, हस्तप्राप्तम्  already in your hand, मन्ये I consider.

data.v: एवमुक्त्वा महातेजाः पुत्रान्परमधार्मिकान् । व्यादिदेश महाप्राज्ञान्यज्ञसंभारकारणात् ॥
data.es: Most brilliant Viswamitra having thus spoken, ordered his deeply religious and highly learned sons to make preparations for the sacrifice.
data.anv: महातेजा: most brilliant, एवम् thus, उक्त्वा having spoken, परमधार्मिकान् highly virtuous, महाप्राज्ञान् great intellectuals, पुत्रान् sons, यज्ञसम्भारकारणात् to make preparations for sacrifice, व्यादिदेश ordered.
data.md: Having said this, that exceedingly energetic one ordered his highly virtuous and profoundly wise sons to provide the sacrificial necessaries.

data.v: सर्वाञ्शिष्यान्समाहूय वाक्यमेतदुवाच ह ॥
सर्वानृषिवरान्वत्सा आनयध्वं ममाज्ञया । सशिष्यान्सुहृदश्चैव सर्त्विजः सुबहुश्रुतान् ॥
data.es: He summoned all his disciples, and said, "Children bring here hosts of rishis along with their disciples and friends, officiating priests and persons wellversed in the Srutis. This is my order.
data.anv: सर्वान् all, शिष्यान् disciples, समाहूय having summoned, एतत् this, वाक्यम् word, उवाच च said, वत्सा: O Children, मम my, आज्ञया with the order, सशिष्यसुहृदश्चैव with their disciples and friends, सर्त्विज: with the officiating priests, सुबहुश्रुतान् welllearned persons, सर्वानृषिगणान् hosts of rishis, आनयध्वम् you may bring them.

data.v: यदन्यो वचनं ब्रूयान्मद्वाक्यबलचोदितः । तत्सर्वमखिलेनोक्तं ममाख्येयमनादृतम् ॥
data.es: If any one should speak with disrespect in response to my order, you may report the matter to me in full".
data.anv: अन्य: any other one, मद्वाक्यबलचोदित: incited by the strength of my words, यत् which , वचनम् word, ब्रूयातथ may speak, अखिलेन entirely, उक्तम् spoken, अनादृतम् with disrespect, तत् सर्वम् all that, मम to me, अख्येयम् should be reported.

data.v: तस्य तद्वचनं श्रुत्वा दिशो जग्मुस्तदाज्ञया । आजग्मुरथ देशेभ्यः सर्वेभ्यो ब्रह्मवादिनः ॥
data.es: At his command the disciples set out in different directions. And as a result, expounders of the vedas began arriving from various countries.
data.anv: तस्य his, तत् वचनम् that word, श्रुत्वा having listened, तदाज्ञया by his order, दिश: in different directions, जग्मु: went, अथ thereafter, सर्वेभ्य: from all, देशेभ्य: countries, ब्रह्मवादिन: expounders of veda, आजग्मु: arrived.

data.v: ते च शिष्याः समागम्य मुनिं ज्वलिततेजसम् । ऊचुश्च वचनं सर्वे सर्वेषां ब्रह्मवादिनाम् ॥
data.es: All the disciples on their return, communicated to the sage shining in splendour what the expounders of the vedas had said.
data.anv: ते शिष्या: those disciples, सर्वे all, समागम्य having returned, ज्वलिततेजसम् shining with splendour, मुनिम् sage visvamitra, सर्वेषाम् of all, ब्रह्मवादिनाम् of the expounders of veda, वचनम् words, ऊचुश्च told.

data.v: श्रुत्वा ते वचनं सर्वे समायान्ति द्विजातयः । सर्वदेशेषु चागच्छन्वर्जयित्वा महोदयम् ॥
data.es: Having heard your words, all brahmins except Mahodaya have arrived from all countries.
data.anv: ते your, वचनम् words, श्रुत्वा having heard, सर्वे all, द्विजातय: brahmins, समायान्ति are coming, महोदयं वर्जयित्वा except mahodaya, सर्वदेशेषु from all countries, आगच्छन् have arrived.

data.v: वासिष्ठं तच्छतं सर्वं क्रोधपर्याकुलाक्षरम् । यदाह वचनं सर्वं शृणु त्वं मुनिपुंगव ॥

data.anv: मुनिपुङ्गव O Preeminent among ascetics, सर्वम् all, तत् शतम् वासिष्ठम् that hundred sons of Vasishta, क्रोधपर्याकुलाक्षरम् speech confused with anger, यत् which, वचनम् word, आह have spoken, सर्वम् all that, त्वम् you, शृणु listen.

data.v: क्षत्रियो याजको यस्य चण्डालस्य विशेषतः । कथं सदसि भोक्तारो हविस्तस्य सुरर्षयः ॥

data.anv: यस्य for whom, क्षत्रिय: kshatriya, याजक: priest of the sacrifice, विशेषत: particularly, चण्डालस्य of a chandala, तस्य for him, सदसि in the sacrifice, सुरर्षय: devatas and sages, हवि: offerings, कथम् how, भोक्तार: will partake.

data.v: ब्राह्मणा वा महात्मानो भुक्त्वा चण्डालभोजनम् । कथं स्वर्गं गमिष्यन्ति विश्वामित्रेण पालिताः ॥
data.es: Joining Viswamitra, (in chanting the mantras during the yaga) how will the great brahmins attain heaven after partaking the food offered by of Chandala?
data.anv: विश्वामित्रेण by Visvamitra, पालिता: ruled, महात्मान: magnanimous, ब्राह्मणा: वा brahmins, चाण्डालभोजनम् food offered by a chandala, भुक्त्वा having partaken, स्वर्गम् heaven, कथम् how, गमिष्यन्ति will attain.

data.v: एतद्वचनं नैष्ठुर्यमूचुः संरक्तलोचनाः । वासिष्ठा मुनिशार्दूल सर्वे ते समहोदयाः ॥
data.es: O Best among ascetics all the sons of Vasishta along with Mahodaya with their eyes reddened in anger spoke these harsh words":

data.v: तेषां तद्वचनं श्रुत्वा सर्वेषां मुनिपुंगवः । क्रोधसंरक्तनयनः सरोषमिदमब्रवीत् ॥

data.md: Hearing this speech of his sons, that best of anchorets, with eyes reddened with anger, said.

data.v: यद्दूषयन्त्यदुष्टं मां तप उग्रं समास्थितम् । भस्मीभूता दुरात्मानो भविष्यन्ति न संशयः ॥
data.es: "I am blameless. I have practised rigorous penance. These wicked ones who have abused (a sage like me) will be reduced to ashes.
data.anv: उग्रम् rigorous, तप: penance, आस्थितम् adopted, अदुष्टम् free from blemish, माम् me, ये who, दूषयन्ति abused, दुरात्मान: wickedminded ones, भस्मीभूता: reduced to ashes, भविष्यन्ति will become, संशय: न no doubt.

data.v: अद्य ते कालपाशेन नीता वैवस्वतक्षयम् । सप्तजातिशतान्येव मृतपाः सन्तु सर्वशः ॥
data.es: Caught by the noose of death this day, they shall be brought to the abode of Yama and for seven hundred births, feed on corpses.
data.anv: ते they, अद्य today itself, कालपाशेन by noose of death, वैवस्वतक्षयम् to the abode of Yama, नीता: having been brought, सप्तजातिशतान्येव seven hundred births, सर्वश: in all ways, मृतपा: feeding on corpses, सन्तु shall become.

data.v: श्वमांसनियताहारा मुष्टिका नाम निर्घृणाः । विकृताश्च विरूपाश्च लोकाननुचरन्त्विमान् ॥
data.es: Reborn as the merciless race of mushtikas, feeding on the flesh of dogs, hideous and deformed, they shall wander in these worlds.
data.anv: निर्घृणा: merciless, मुष्टिका नाम born in the race of mushtikas, श्वमांसनियताहारा feeding on the flesh of dogs, विकृताश्च hideous, विरूपाश्च deformed, इमान् लोकान् in these worlds, अनुचरन्तु shall wander.

data.v: महोदयश्च दुर्बुद्धिर्मामदूष्यं ह्यदूषयत् । दूषिटः सर्वलोकेषु निषादत्वं गमिष्यति ॥
data.es: The wicked Mahodaya, who blamed a sage like me so faultless shall be reborn in the race of the nishadas vulnerable to abuse by all.
data.anv: दुर्बुद्धि: wickedminded, महोदयस्तु as for Mahodaya, अदूष्यम् not fit to be blamed, माम् me, अदूषयत् हि blamed me, सर्वलोकेषु in all the worlds, दूषित: having been blamed, निषादत्वम् nishadahood, गमिष्यति will attain.

data.v: प्राणातिपातनिरतो निरनुक्रोशतां गतः । दीर्घकालं मम क्रोधाद्दुर्गतिं वर्तयिष्यति ॥
data.es: As a consequence of my anger that Mahodaya, devoid of mercy and taking pleasure in depriving others of their life, will pursue a wretched life for a long time".
data.anv: मम my, क्रोधात् because of anger, प्राणातिपातनिरतो depriving others of their life regularly, निरनुक्रोशताम् devoid of mercy, गत: attaining, दीर्घकालम् for a long time, दुर्गतिम् wretched life, वर्तयिष्यति will pursue.

data.v: एतावदुक्त्वा वचनं विश्वामित्रो महातपाः । विरराम महातेजा ऋषिमध्ये महामुनिः ॥
data.es: The most powerful sage Viswamitra of fierce asceticism fell silent after after uttering this curse in the assembly of rishis.इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये बालकाण्डे एकोनषष्टितमस्सर्ग:॥Thus ends the fiftyninth sarga of Balakanda of the holy Ramayana the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.
data.anv: महातपा: possessing fierce asceticism, महातेजा: highly powerful, महामुनि: mighty ascetic, विश्वामित्र: Visvamitra, ऋषिमध्ये in the assembly of rishis, एतावत् to this extent, वचनम् words, उक्त्वा having spoken, विरराम became silent.

data.v: तपोबलहतान्कृत्वा वासिष्ठान्समहोदयान् । ऋषिमध्ये महातेजा विश्वामित्रोऽभ्यभाषत ॥
data.es: The most brilliant Viswamitra, having destroyed the sons of Vasishta including Mahodaya by his ascetic power, said this in the midst of saints:
data.anv: महातेजा: most brilliant, विश्वामित्र: Visvamitra, समहोदयान् together with Mahodaya, वासिष्ठान् sons of Vasishta, तपोबलहतान् having destroyed by his power of asceticism, कृत्वा made, ऋषिमध्ये seated in the midst of saints, अभ्यभाषत said.

data.v: अयमिक्ष्वाकुदायादस्त्रिशङ्कुरिति विश्रुतः । धर्मिष्ठश्च वदान्यश्च मां चैव शरणं गतः । स्वेनानेन शरीरेण देवलोकजिगीषया ॥
data.es: "This religious and generous king born in the Ikshvaku race, wellknown as Trisanku sought my refuge to gain heaven with his physical body,
data.anv: इक्ष्वाकुदायाद: born in the Ikshavaku race, त्रिशङ्कुरिति as Trishanku by name, विश्रुत: wellknown, धर्मिष्ठ: virtuous, वदान्यश्च munificient, अयम् this person, तेन such, अनेन  शरीरेण with this physical body, देवलोकजिगीषया with the intention of conquering deva loka, माम् me, शरणं गत: sought refuge.

data.v: यथायं स्वशरीरेण देवलोकं गमिष्यति । तथा प्रवर्त्यतां यज्ञो भवद्भिश्च मया सह ॥
data.es: Join me in the performance of this sacrifice in a manner by which he (Trisanku) attains heaven with his physical body".
data.anv: अयम् this (king), स्वशरीरेण with his physical body, स्वर्गलोकम् to heaven, यथा in whichever manner, गमिष्यति will go, तथा in that manner, भवद्भि: by you, मया सह along with me, यज्ञ: sacrifice, प्रवर्त्यताम् be performed.

data.v: विश्वामित्रवचः श्रुत्वा सर्व एव महर्षयः । ऊचुः समेत्य सहिता धर्मज्ञा धर्मसंहितम् ॥
data.es: Agreeing to these words of Viswamitra all the rishis, knowers of spiritual order and endowed with righteousness assembled there said:
data.anv: धर्मज्ञा: knowers of spiritual law, सहिता: assembled there, सर्व एव all, महर्षय: rishis, विश्वामित्रवच: words of Visvamitra, श्रुत्वा having listened, समेत्य in harmony, धर्मसंहितम् endowed with righteousness, ऊचु: said.

data.v: अयं कुशिकदायादो मुनिः परमकोपनः । यदाह वचनं सम्यगेतत्कार्यं न संशयः ॥
data.es: "Born in the line of Kusika, this sage is extremely cholerictempered. Whatever he says must be properly carried out. There should be no resitation on this score. The venerable sage is like fire. He will curse us if angered.
data.anv: कुशिकदायाद: born in the line of Kusika, परमकोपन: is one extremely angry, अयम् this man,  मुनि: ascestic, यत् वचनम् whichever word, आह speaks, एतत् all that, सम्यक् properly, कार्यम् should be performed, न संशय: no doubt, अग्निकल्प: he is like fire, भगवान् venerable, रोषित: if angered, शापम् curse, दास्यति will give.

data.v: अग्निकल्पो हि भगवाञ्शापं दास्यति रोषितः । तस्मात्प्रवर्त्यतां यज्ञः सशरीरो यथा दिवम् । गच्छेदिक्ष्वाकुदायादो विश्वामित्रस्य तेजसा ॥
data.es: Hence let the sacrifice be performed in such a manner that the descendant of the Ikshvakus would attain heaven with his physical body through the spiritual power of Viswamitra. All of you commence the sacrifice".
data.anv: तस्मात् for that reason, यज्ञ: sacrifice, प्रवर्त्यताम् be performed, इक्ष्वाकुदायाद: descendent of Ikshvaku, विश्वामित्रस्य Visvamitra's, तेजसा by spiritual power, सशरीर: with his physical frame, यथा in whatever manner, दिवम् heaven, गच्छेत् may attain, तथा in that manner, यज्ञ: sacrifice, प्रवर्त्यताम् may be performed, सर्वे all, समधितिष्ठत commence.

data.v: ततः प्रवर्त्यतां यज्ञः सर्वे समधितिष्ठते ॥
एवमुक्त्वा महर्षयः संजह्रुस्ताः क्रियास्तदा । याजकाश्च महातेजा विश्वामित्रोऽभवत्क्रतौ ॥
data.es: The maharshis having resolved performed their respective activities relating to the sacrifice. The brilliant Viswamitra acted as the chief officiating priest.
data.anv: महर्षय: mahasrhis, एवम् thus, उक्त्वा having spoken, तदा then, तास्ता: different, क्रिया: activities, चक्रु: performed, क्रतौ in that sacrifice, महातेजा: highly lustrous, विश्वामित्र: Visvamitra, याजक: अभवत् became the chief officiating priest.

data.v: ऋत्विजश्चानुपूर्व्येण मन्त्रवन्मन्त्रकोविदाः । चक्रुः सर्वाणि कर्माणि यथाकल्पं यथाविधि ॥
data.es: The officiating priests proficient in chanting mantras performed in order of their respective ranks all the rites in accordance with the Yojanakalpa adhering to codes and traditions.
data.anv: मन्त्रकोविदा: proficient in sacred prayers, ऋत्विजश्च officiating priests, मन्त्रवत् in accordance with mantras, यथाकल्पम् according to prescribed kalpa, यथाविधि according to rules and tradition, सर्वाणि all, कर्माणि rites, आनुपूर्व्येण in accordance with their respective ranks, चक्रु: performed.

data.v: ततः कालेन महता विश्वामित्रो महातपाः । चकारावाहनं तत्र भागार्थं सर्वदेवताः ॥
data.es: Long after, the mighty ascetic Viswamitra invoked all the gods to partake their share of offerings.
data.anv: तत: thereafter, महातपा: mighty ascetic, विश्वामित्र: Visvamitra, महताकालेन after a long time,  तत्र there, सर्वदेवता: all devatas, भागार्थम् to partake their share, आवाहनं चकार invoked.

data.v: नाह्यागमंस्तदाहूता भागार्थं सर्वदेवताः । ततः क्रोधसमाविष्टो विश्वमित्रो महामुनिः ॥
data.es: When, the gods invited by him did not come to receive their share of offerings, the great ascetic Viswamitra seized with anger lifted the sacrificial ladle and said to Trisanku:
data.anv: तदा then, आहूता: invited by him, सर्वदेवता: all devatas, भागार्थम् for their share of offerings, नाभ्यागमन् did not come, तत: thereafter, क्रोधसमाविष्ट: seized of anger, विश्वामित्र: Visvamitra, महामुनि: great ascetic, स्रुवम् sacrificial ladle, उद्यम्य having lifted, सक्रोध: with anger, त्रिशङ्कुम् addressing Trishanku, इदम् this word, अब्रवीत् spoke.

data.v: स्रुवमुद्यम्य सक्रोधस्त्रिशङ्कुमिदमब्रवीत् । पश्य मे तपसो वीर्यं स्वार्जितस्य नरेश्वर ॥
एष त्वां स्वशरीरेण नयामि स्वर्गमोजसा । दुष्प्रापं स्वशरीरेण दिवं गच्छ नराधिप ॥
data.es: "O King behold the prowess of my selfearned asceticism. With my spiritual might, I shall send you to heaven with your physical body O King go to heaven with physical body which is not possible for anybody to accomplish.
data.anv: नरेश्वर O King, स्वार्जितस्य selfearned, मे my, तपस: asceticism's, वीर्यम् prowess, पश्य behold, एष: ओजसा (तेजसा) with my might, त्वाम् you, सशरीरेण with your physical body, स्वर्गम् heaven, नयामि I shall send, नराधिप O king, दुष्प्रापम् difficult to achieve, दिवम् heaven, सशरीरेण with physical body, गच्छ go.

data.v: स्वार्जितं किंचिदप्यस्ति मया हि तपसः फलम् । राजंस्त्वं तेजसा तस्य सशरीरो दिवं व्रज ॥
data.es: By the power of what little fruit of austerities I have earned, I shall send to heaven with your body".
data.anv: राजन् O King, मया by me, स्वार्जितम् selfearned, तपस: फलम् fruit of austerities, किञ्चिदपि even little, अस्ति हि is remaining, तस्य its, स्वतेजसा by its power, सशरीर: with physical body, दिवम् heaven, व्रज you may go.

data.v: उक्तवाक्ये मुनौ तस्मिन्सशरीरो नरेश्वरः । दिवं जगाम काकुत्स्थ मुनीनां पश्यतां तदा ॥
data.es: "O Descendant of Kakustha (Rama) when the sage had said these words, the king with his physical body ascended to heaven in the presence of the sages.
data.anv: काकुत्स्थ O Rama, तस्मिन् मुनौ when that ascetic, उक्तवाक्ये had spoken these words,  नरेश्वर: king, सशरीर: with his physical body, तदा then, मुनीनाम् saints, पश्यताम् while seeing, दिवम् towards heaven, जगाम went.

data.v: देवलोकगतं दृष्ट्वा त्रिशङ्कुं पाकशासनः । सह सर्वैः सुरगणैरिदं वचनमब्रवीत् ॥
data.es: On ascending to heaven Trisanku saw Indra (destroyer of Paka) along with hosts of gods. Indra said to him:
data.anv: देवलोकगतम् ascending to heaven, त्रिशङ्कुम् Trishanku, दृष्ट्वा having seen, सर्वै: all, सुरगणै:  (सह) with hosts of devatas, पाकशासन: devendra who destroyed the demon Paka,  इदम् वचनम् this word, अब्रवीत् spoke.

data.v: त्रिशङ्को गच्छ भूयस्त्वं नासि स्वर्गकृतालयः । गुरुशापहतो मूढ पत भूमिमवाक्शिराः ॥
data.es: "O Trisanku you are not fit to inhabit heaven. Go back, you fool Doomed by the curse of your spiritual preceptor, fall on earth, head down.
data.anv: त्रिशङ्को O Trishanku, स्वर्गकृतालय: inhabitant of heaven, न असि you are not fit, त्वम् you, भूय: again, गच्छ go back, गुरुशापहतः doomed by the curse of your spiritual preceptor, मूढ O Fool, अवाक्छिरा: with head downwards, भूमिम् to earth, पत fall down.

data.v: एवमुक्तो महेन्द्रेण त्रिशङ्कुरपतत्पुनः । विक्रोशमानस्त्राहीति विश्वामित्रं तपोधनम् ॥
data.es: Thus spoken to by Indra, Trisanku crying, "O Viswamitra, Protect me, Protect me" started falling down.
data.anv: महेन्द्रेण by Indra, एवम् thus, उक्त: spoken, त्रिशङ्कु: Trishanku, त्राहि protect me, इति so, तपोधनम् one having asceticism as wealth, विश्वामित्रम् Viswamitra, विक्रोशमान: wailing, पुन: again, अपतत् fell down.

data.v: तच्छ्रुत्वा वचनं तस्य क्रोशमानस्य कौशिकः । रोषमाहारयत्तीव्रं तिष्ठ तिष्ठेति चाब्रवीत् ॥
data.es: Having heard the wailing Trisanku, the enraged Viswamitra shouted, "Stay, Stay".

data.v: सृष्ट्वा नक्षत्रवंशं च क्रोधेन कलुषीकृतः । अन्यमिन्द्रं करिष्यामि लोको वा स्यादनिन्द्रकः । दैवतान्यपि स क्रोधात्स्रष्टुं समुपचक्रमे ॥

data.es: "I wish you well Having promised king Trisanku ascent to heaven with his physical form, I do not wish to go back on my word.

data.v: एवमुक्ताः सुराः सर्वे प्रत्यूचुर्मुनिपुंगवम् ॥
एवं भवतु भद्रं ते तिष्ठन्त्वेतानि सर्वशः । गगने तान्यनेकानि वैश्वानरपथाद्बहिः ॥
नक्षत्राणि मुनिश्रेष्ठ तेषु ज्योतिःषु जाज्वलन् । अवाक्शिरास्त्रिशङ्कुश्च तिष्ठत्वमरसंनिभः ॥
विश्वामित्रस्तु धर्मात्मा सर्वदेवैरभिष्टुतः । ऋषिभिश्च महातेजा बाढमित्याह देवताः ॥
data.es: In this manner extolled by all devatas and rishis, mighty and righteous Viswamitra said, 'well let it be so'.
data.anv: सर्वदेवै: by all devatas, ऋषिभिश्च by rishis also, अभिष्टुत: extolled, महातेजा: exceedingly energetic, धर्मात्मा virtuous, विश्वामित्रस्तु Visvamitra, देवता: to devatas, बाढम् इत्येव so be it, आह said.

data.v: ततो देवा महात्मानो मुनयश्च तपोधनाः । जग्मुर्यथागतं सर्वे यज्ञस्यान्ते नरोत्तम ॥
data.es: "O Best among men (Rama) then at the conclusion of the sacrifice the great gods and saints went the way they had come".इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये बालकाण्डे षष्टितमस्सर्ग:॥Thus ends the sixtieth sarga of Balakanda of the holy Ramayana the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.

data.v: प्रायश्चित्तं महद्ध्येतन्नरं वा पुरुषर्षभ । आनयस्व पशुं शीघ्रं यावत्कर्म प्रवर्तते ॥
