data.v: एवमुक्ता तु कैकेयी क्रोधेन ज्वलितानना । दीर्घमुष्णं विनिःश्वस्य मन्थरामिदमब्रवीत् ॥
data.es: Having heard Kaikeyi's words Manthara was extremely unhappy. Heaving deep, hot sighs she said to Kaikeyi.
data.anv: एवम् thus, उक्ता spoken to (by Manthara), कैकेयी Kaikeyi, क्रोधेन (कोपेन) in anger, ज्वलितानना face burning (with anger), दीर्घम् deep, उष्णम् hot, विनिश्वस्य having breathed, मन्थराम् to Manthara, इदम् these words, अब्रवीत् said

data.v: अद्य राममितः क्षिप्रं वनं प्रस्थापयाम्यहम् । यौवराज्येन भरतं क्षिप्रमेवाभिषेचये ॥
data.es: Today I shall at once banish Rama from here into the forest and get Bharata coronated as heirapparent without delay.
data.anv: अद्य today, अहम् I, रामम् to Rama, इत: from here itself, क्षिप्रम् quickly, वनम् to the forest,  प्रस्थापयामि shall send forth, भरतं च to Bharata also, क्षिप्रमेव without delay, यौवराज्ये as prince regent, अभिषेचये I shall consecrate (him).

data.v: इदं त्विदानीं संपश्य केनोपायेन मन्थरे । भरतः प्राप्नुयाद्राज्यं न तु रामः कथंचन ॥
data.es: O Manthara now see, for sure, Bharata and not Rama will get the kingdom by any means.
data.anv: मन्थरे O Manthara केन उपायेन, कथञ्चन by any means, राज्यम् kingdom, प्राप्नुयात् will get, राम: तु for sure, न shall not (obtain), इदम् this one, इदानीम् now, सम्पश्य do see.

data.v: एवमुक्ता तया देव्या मन्थरा पापदर्शिनी । रामार्थमुपहिंसन्ती कैकेयीमिदमब्रवीत् ॥
data.es: The malevolent Manthara on fire with fury reached Kaikeyi lying upon her couch and said:
data.anv: तया देव्या by that queen, एवम् thus, उक्ता having been addressed, पापदर्शिनी evilminded  रामार्थम् Rama's interests, उपहिंसन्ती destroying, कैकेयीम् to Kaikeyi, इदम् this, अब्रवीत् said.

data.v: हन्तेदानीं प्रवक्ष्यामि कैकेयि श्रूयतां च मे । यथा ते भरतो राज्यं पुत्रः प्राप्स्यति केवलम् ॥
data.es: O Kaikeyi, what a joy I shall now tell you how your son Bharata alone will secure the kingdom. Listen to me:
data.anv: हन्त what joy, कैकेयि O Kaikeyi, केवलम् alone, ते पुत्र: your son, भरत: Bharata, यथा as, राज्यम् kingdom, प्राप्स्यति will get, प्रवक्ष्यामि I shall tell, मे my (word), श्रूयतां च listen.

data.v: श्रुत्वैवं वचनं तस्या मन्थरायास्तु कैकयी । किंचिदुत्थाय शयनात्स्वास्तीर्णादिदमब्रवीत् ॥
data.es: After hearing Manthara's words, Kaikeyi got up a little from her wellspread bed and said this:
data.anv: कैकेयी Kaikeyi, तस्या: मन्थराया: that  Manthara's, एवम् in this way, वचनम् words, श्रुत्वा (एव)  after hearing, स्वास्तीर्णात् from the wellspread, शयनात् from the bed, किञ्चित् a little, उत्थाय got up, इदम् this, अब्रवीत् said.

data.v: कथय त्वं ममोपायं केनोपायेन मन्थरे । भरतः प्राप्नुयाद्राज्यं न तु रामः कथंचन ॥
data.es: O Manthara now see, for sure, Bharata and not Rama will get the kingdom by any means.
data.anv: मन्थरे O Manthara केन by what, उपायेन means, भरत: Bharata, राज्यम् kingdom, प्राप्नुयात् will secure, राम: तु as for Rama, कथञ्चन anyhow, न will not get, उपायम् means,  त्वम् you, मम to me, कथय speak.

data.v: एवमुक्ता तया देव्या मन्थरा पापदर्शिनी । रामार्थमुपहिंसन्ती कुब्जा वचनमब्रवीत् ॥
data.es: The malevolent Manthara on fire with fury reached Kaikeyi lying upon her couch and said:
data.anv: तया देव्या by that queen, एवम् in this way, उक्ता having been spoken to, पापदर्शिनी evileyed, मन्थरा Manthara, रामार्थम् Rama's interest, उपहिंसन्ती ruining, कुब्जा hunchback, अब्रवीत् said.

data.v: तव देवासुरे युद्धे सह राजर्षिभिः पतिः । अगच्छत्त्वामुपादाय देवराजस्य साह्यकृत् ॥
data.es: O queen during the war between gods and asuras, your husband went with royal saints intending to render assistance to Indra, king of the gods, taking you along with him. He set off in the southern direction of Dandaka forest to a renowned city called Vaijayanta where asura Timidhvaja lived.
data.anv: देवि O queen तव your, पति: husband, दैवासुरे between gods and asuras, युद्धे in the war, देवराजस्य of the king of the gods (Indra's), साह्यकृत् one who rendered assistance, त्वाम् you, उपादाय having taken, दक्षिणां दिशम् the southern direction, आस्थाय having reached, दण्डकान् प्रति towards Dandaka, वैजयन्तम् इति known as Vaijayanta, ख्यातम् renowned, यत्र where, तिमिध्वज: Timidhvaja, पुरम् to the city, राजर्षिभि: सह along with royal saints, अगच्छत् went.

data.v: दिशमास्थाय कैकेयि दक्षिणां दण्डकान्प्रति । वैजयन्तमिति ख्यातं पुरं यत्र तिमिध्वजः ॥
data.es: O queen during the war between gods and asuras, your husband went with royal saints intending to render assistance to Indra, king of the gods, taking you along with him. He set off in the southern direction of Dandaka forest to a renowned city called Vaijayanta where asura Timidhvaja lived.
data.anv: देवि O queen तव your, पति: husband, दैवासुरे between gods and asuras, युद्धे in the war, देवराजस्य of the king of the gods (Indra's), साह्यकृत् one who rendered assistance, त्वाम् you, उपादाय having taken, दक्षिणां दिशम् the southern direction, आस्थाय having reached, दण्डकान् प्रति towards Dandaka, वैजयन्तम् इति known as Vaijayanta, ख्यातम् renowned, यत्र where, तिमिध्वज: Timidhvaja, पुरम् to the city, राजर्षिभि: सह along with royal saints, अगच्छत् went.

data.v: स शम्बर इति ख्यातः शतमायो महासुरः । ददौ शक्रस्य संग्रामं देवसंघैरनिर्जितः ॥
data.es: That mighty asura wellknown as Sambara, capable of a hundred deceitful forms, challenged Indra to a battle which could not be conquered by hosts of gods.
data.anv: शम्बर: इति as Sambara, ख्यात: wellknown, शतमाय: possessing a hundred deceitful forms, स: महासुर: that mighty asura, देवसङ्घै: by hosts of gods, अनिर्जित: could not be conquered, शक्रस्य for Indra, सङ्ग्रामम् battle, ददौ gave.

data.v: तस्मिन्महति संग्रामे राजा दशरथस्तदा । अपवाह्य त्वया देवि संग्रामान्नष्टचेतनः ॥
तत्रापि विक्षतः शस्त्रैः पतिस्ते रक्षितस्त्वया । तुष्टेन तेन दत्तौ ते द्वौ वरौ शुभदर्शने ॥
स त्वयोक्तः पतिर्देवि यदेच्छेयं तदा वरौ । गृह्णीयामिति तत्तेन तथेत्युक्तं महात्मना । अनभिज्ञा ह्यहं देवि त्वयैव कथितं पुरा ॥
data.es: O auspiciouslooking one out of gratitude he had granted two boons to you (for saving him on two occasions). O queen then you told your husband that whenever you desire, you will ask for those boons. The magnanimous king said, 'So be it'.
data.anv: शुभदर्शने O auspiciouslooking one, तुष्टेन by the gratified, तेन by him, ते to you, द्वौ two, वरौ boons, दत्तौ were given, देवि O queen त्वया by you, स: पति: that husband, Dasaratha, यदा whenever, इच्छेयम् I desire, तदा then, वरौ the boons, गृह्णीयाम् इति shall receive, उक्त: thus told, तत् that one, तथा इति 'So be it' saying so, तेन महात्मना by that magnanimous (king), उक्तम् has been told.

data.v: तौ वरौ याच भर्तारं भरतस्याभिषेचनम् । प्रव्राजनं च रामस्य त्वं वर्षाणि चतुर्दश ॥
data.es: Ask your husband for those two boons namely consecration of Bharata and banishment of Rama for fourteen years.
data.anv: भरतस्य Bharata's, अभिषेचनम् installation, चतुर्दश fourteen, वर्षाणि years, रामस्य Rama's, प्रव्राजनम् banishment, तौ those, वरौ two  boons, त्वम् you, भर्तारम् your husband, याच beg.

data.v: क्रोधागारं प्रविश्याद्य क्रुद्धेवाश्वपतेः सुते । शेष्वानन्तर्हितायां त्वं भूमौ मलिनवासिनी । मा स्मैनं प्रत्युदीक्षेथा मा चैनमभिभाषथाः ॥
data.es: O Kaikeyi ,daughter of Ashwapati enter now the chamber of wrath like one in angry mood, wearing soiled garments and lie down on the bare ground.
data.anv: अश्वपते: Ashwapati's, सुते daughter (Kaikeyi ), अद्य now, क्रुद्धेव like a person in angry mood, क्रोधागारम् chamber of wrath, प्रविश्य having entered, मलिनवासिनी wearing soiled garments, अनन्तर्हितायाम् not covered (with clothes, etc), भूमौ on the ground, शेष्व lie down.

data.v: दयिता त्वं सदा भर्तुरत्र मे नास्ति संशयः । त्वत्कृते च महाराजो विशेदपि हुताशनम् ॥
data.es: No doubt, you have always been a beloved wife to your husband. For your sake the great king will even enter into the burning fire.
data.anv: त्वम् you, सदा always, भर्तु: for your husband, दयिता  a beloved one, अत्र in this matter, मे to me, संशय: doubt, नास्ति not there, त्वत्कृते for your sake, स: महाराज: that great king, हुताशनम् in the burning fire, विशेदपि will enter.

data.v: न त्वां क्रोधयितुं शक्तो न क्रुद्धां प्रत्युदीक्षितुम् । तव प्रियार्थं राजा हि प्राणानपि परित्यजेत् ॥
data.es: The king is afraid of inciting your ire. When you are angry, he dare not look at your indignant countenance. Indeed he will forsake even his life for your pleasure.
data.anv: राजा king, त्वाम् you, क्रोधयितुम् to make angry, न शक्त: is not capable, क्रुद्धाम् at (your) angry face, प्रत्युदीक्षितुम् to look at, न is not possible, तव your, प्रियार्थम् for pleasure, प्राणानपि even his life, परित्यजेत् हि will forsake indeed.

data.v: न ह्यतिक्रमितुं शक्तस्तव वाक्यं महीपतिः । मन्दस्वभावे बुध्यस्व सौभाग्यबलमात्मनः ॥
data.es: The king would not dare transgress your words. O wicked woman, recognise the power of your beauty.
data.anv: महीपति: lord of the earth (king), तव your, वाक्यम् words, अतिक्रमितुम् to transgress, न शक्त: हि is not able, मन्दस्वभावे evilnatured, आत्मन: your own, सौभाग्यबलम् power of your beauty, बुध्यस्व recognise.

data.v: मणिमुक्तासुवर्णानि रत्नानि विविधानि च । दद्याद्दशरथो राजा मा स्म तेषु मनः कृथाः ॥
data.es: King Dasaratha may give you gems, pearls, gold and different kinds of precious stones. Do not pay them any attention.
data.anv: दशरथ: राजा king Dasaratha, मणिमुक्तासुवर्णानि gems, pearls and gold, विविधानि of different kinds, रत्नानि च precious stones also, दद्यात् may give, तेषु in them, मन: mind, मा कृथा: do not pay attention

data.v: यौ तौ देवासुरे युद्धे वरौ दशरथोऽददात् । तौ स्मारय महाभागे सोऽर्थो मा त्वामतिक्रमेत् ॥
data.es: O fortunate Kaikeyi, make him recollect the two boons he had granted you in the war between gods and demons. You should not ignore your objective.
data.anv: महाभागे O highly fortunate one, दशरथ: of Dasaratha, दैवासुरे युद्धे in the war between gods and demons, यौ which, तौ two, वरौ boons, अददात् had given, तौ those two, स्मारय remind, अर्थ: the objective, त्वाम् you, अतिक्रमेत् may not transgress.

data.v: यदा तु ते वरं दद्यात्स्वयमुत्थाप्य राघवः । व्यवस्थाप्य महाराजं त्वमिमं वृणुया वरम् ॥
data.es: When Dasaratha personally lifts you from the floor and asks you what you want you may make him settle down and ask him for these boons:
data.anv: राघव: the descendant of the Raghus (Dasaratha), स्वयम् personally, उत्थाप्य lifting you up from the floor, ते to you, वरम् boon, यदा when, दद्यात् gives then, त्वम् you, तं महाराजम् to that monarch, व्यवस्थाप्य making him settle down, इमम् वरम् this boon, वृणुया: you may  seek.

data.v: रामं प्रव्राजयारण्ये नव वर्षाणि पञ्च च । भरतः क्रियतां राजा पृथिव्यां पार्थिवर्षभः ॥
data.es: 'O best of kings exile Rama into the forest for fourteen years and make Bharata king of the land'.
data.anv: पार्थिवर्षभ: best of kings, रामम् to Rama, नव पञ्च वर्षाणि for fourteen years, अरण्ये in the forest, प्रव्राजय exile, भरत: Bharata, पृथिव्या: of this earth, राजा as king, क्रियताम् be made.

data.v: एवं प्रव्राजितश्चैव रामोऽरामो भविष्यति । भरतश्च हतामित्रस्तव राजा भविष्यति ॥
data.es: Thus, if Rama is exiled he will no longer be Rama (be able to cause delight to the people). Bharata will become king with his enemy subdued.
data.anv: एवम् thus, प्रव्राजित: exiled, राम: Rama, अराम: will no longer cause any delight to people, भविष्यति will become, भरतश्च Bharata also, राजा as king, हतामित्रश्च with  enemies destroyed, भविष्यति will become.

data.v: येन कालेन रामश्च वनात्प्रत्यागमिष्यति । तेन कालेन पुत्रस्ते कृतमूलो भविष्यति । संगृहीतमनुष्यश्च सुहृद्भिः सार्धमात्मवान् ॥
data.es: By the time Rama returns from the forest, your son (now) confident, would have become deep rooted by gaining the company of friends and the acceptability of the people.
data.anv: येन कालेन by the time, राम: च Rama also, वनात् from the forest, प्रत्यागमिष्यति returns, तेन कालेन by then, ते your, आत्मवान् confident, पुत्र: son, सुगृहीतमनुष्य: people whose affection has been gained, सुहृद्भि: सार्धम् in the company of friends, कृतमूल: deeprooted, भविष्यति will become.

data.v: प्राप्तकालं तु ते मन्ये राजानं वीतसाध्वसा । रामाभिषेकसंकल्पान्निगृह्य विनिवर्तय ॥
data.es: I think the proper time has come (to ask for the boons). Without fear refrain the king forcibly from his intention of installing Rama.
data.anv: राजानम् the king, प्राप्तकालं नु proper time has come, मन्ये I consider, वीतसाध्वसा devoid of fear, निगृह्य forcibly, रामाभिषेकसङ्कल्पात् from the intention of installing Rama, विनिवर्तय refrain.

data.v: अनर्थमर्थरूपेण ग्राहिता सा ततस्तया । हृष्टा प्रतीता कैकेयी मन्थरामिदमब्रवीत् ॥
data.es: Thus, having been made to accept the evil design as a beneficial objective, Kaikeyi understood (the entire matter) and in delight spoke to Manthara.
data.anv: तया by her, अनर्थम् evil design, अर्थरूपेण as a beneficial objective, ग्राहिता having been made to accept, सा कैकेयी that Kaikeyi, तत: after that, प्रतीता having believed, हृष्टा with delight, मन्थराम् addressing Manthara, इदम् this word, अब्रवीत् said.

data.v: कुब्जे त्वां नाभिजानामि श्रेष्ठां श्रेष्ठाभिधायिनीम् । पृथिव्यामसि कुब्जानामुत्तमा बुद्धिनिश्चये ॥
data.es: (She said) O hunchback, I never knew that you can speak such excellent words or decide things intelligently. You are the best among the hunchbacks of this world.
data.anv: कुब्जे O hunchback श्रेष्ठाभिधायिनीम् speaking excellent words, त्वाम् you, श्रेष्ठाम् as the best, नाभिजानामि I did not recognise, बुद्धिनिश्चये in ascertaining intelligence, पृथिव्याम् in this world, कुब्जानाम् among the hunchbacks, उत्तमा असि you are the best one.

data.v: त्वमेव तु ममार्थेषु नित्ययुक्ता हितैषिणी । नाहं समवबुध्येयं कुब्जे राज्ञश्चिकीर्षितम् ॥
data.es: O hunchback you alone always show interest in my affairs and seek my welfare. I might not have known the intended (deceptive) action of the king (without you).
data.anv: कुब्जे O hunchback, त्वमेव you alone, मम my, अर्थेषु in (my) affairs, नित्ययुक्ता always showing  interest, हितैषिणी seeking welfare, अहम् I, राज्ञ: king's, चिकीर्षितम् the intended action, न समवबुध्येयम् I might not have known.

data.v: सन्ति दुःसंस्थिताः कुब्जा वक्राः परमपापिकाः । त्वं पद्ममिव वातेन संनता प्रियदर्शना ॥
data.es: There are many hunchbacks in this world, terribly ugly with their bodies misshaped and crooked. But you look beautiful like a lotus bent by the breeze.
data.anv: कुब्जा: hunchbacks, दुस्संस्थिता: women physically retarded, वक्रा: crooked, परमदारुणा: terrible in appearance, सन्ति are, सन्नता bent, त्वम् you, वातेन by breeze, पद्ममिव like a lotus, प्रियदर्शना one with good looks.

data.v: उरस्तेऽभिनिविष्टं वै यावत्स्कन्धात्समुन्नतम् । अधस्ताच्चोदरं शान्तं सुनाभमिव लज्जितम् ॥
data.es: Your breasts are thick and are as high as your shoulders. Beneath them lies your belly with its beautiful navel (waist) looking slender as if out of bashfulness.
data.anv: ते उर: your breasts, अभिनिविष्टम् are thick, यावत्स्कन्धात् up to the shoulders, समुन्नतम् is high, अधस्तात् beneath it, सुनाभम् beautiful naval, उदरं च belly also, लज्जितं इव as if bashful , शातम् is slender.

data.v: जघनं तव निर्घुष्टं रशनादामशोभितम् । जङ्घे भृशमुपन्यस्ते पादौ चाप्यायतावुभौ ॥
data.es: Your hips, glitter with the jingling girdle. Strong are the calfs of your legs and long are your feet.
data.anv: तव your, रशनादामशोभितम् glittering with girdle, जघनम् hips, निर्घुष्टम् jingling, जङ्घे the calfs of the legs, भृशम् exceedingly, उपन्यस्ते are set strong, उभौ both, पादौ च your feet also, आयतौ are long.

data.v: त्वमायताभ्यां सक्थिभ्यां मन्थरे क्षौमवासिनि । अग्रतो मम गच्छन्ती राजहंसीव राजसे ॥
data.es: O Manthara when clad in silk garment you walk in front of me with your heavy thighs, you look like a female royal swan.
data.anv: मन्थरे O Manthara, आयताभ्याम् heavy, सक्थिभ्याम् with both thighs, त्वम् you, क्षौमवासिनी clad in silk garment, मम my, अग्रत: in front of, गच्छन्ती walking, राजहंसीव like female royal swan, राजसे shine.

data.v: तवेदं स्थगु यद्दीर्घं रथघोणमिवायतम् । मतयः क्षत्रविद्याश्च मायाश्चात्र वसन्ति ते ॥
data.es: Your clever thoughts, magic powers and also the skills of kshatriyas are stored in your huge hump which is as wide as the hub of a chariot wheel.
data.anv: आयतम् wide, रथघोणमिव like the hub of a chariot, दीर्घम् long, तव your, यत् which, इदम् this, स्थगु hump, अत्र here, ते your, मतय: thoughts, क्षत्रविद्या: skills of a kshatriya,  माया: च  also magic powers, वसन्ति are residing.

data.v: अत्र ते प्रतिमोक्ष्यामि मालां कुब्जे हिरण्मयीम् । अभिषिक्ते च भरते राघवे च वनं गते ॥
data.es: O hunchback, with Rama gone to the forest and Bharata consecrated, I shall drape this hump with a golden garland.
data.anv: कुब्जे O hunchback राघवे of the descendant of the Raghus (Rama), वनम् to the forest, गते having gone, भरते च Bharata also, अभिषिक्ते having been consecrated, अत्र here (on this hump), हिरण्मयीम् golden, मालाम् garland, प्रतिमोक्ष्यामि I shall deliver.

data.v: जात्येन च सुवर्णेन सुनिष्टप्तेन सुन्दरि । लब्धार्था च प्रतीता च लेपयिष्यामि ते स्थगु ॥
data.es: O Manthara, when my objective is accomplished and I am fully satisfied, I will smear your hump with the best of refined liquid gold.
data.anv: मन्थरे O Manthara, लब्धार्था च after accomplishsing the objective, प्रतीता च also satisfied, जात्येन belonging to the best , सुनिष्टप्तेन highly refined, सुवर्णेन with gold, ते स्थगु your hump, लेपयिष्यामि will smear.

data.v: मुखे च तिलकं चित्रं जातरूपमयं शुभम् । कारयिष्यामि ते कुब्जे शुभान्याभरणानि च ॥
data.es: O Manthara, I shall get a tilaka made of gold for your auspicious, lovely face and shall also order exquisite ornaments (for you).
data.anv: कुब्जे O Manthara ते मुखे on  your face, जातरूपमयम् fully made of gold, चित्रम् wonderful, शुभम् auspicious, तिलकम् tilaka (a mark on the forehead), शुभानि beautiful, आभरणानि च ornaments also, कारयिष्यामि shall get them made.

data.v: परिधाय शुभे वस्त्रे देवतेव चरिष्यसि । चन्द्रमाह्वयमानेन मुखेनाप्रतिमानना । गमिष्यसि गतिं मुख्यां गर्वयन्ती द्विषज्जनम् ॥
data.es: You shall move about wearing lovely garments like a goddess. With a peerless countenance, as if challenging the Moon and feeling proud, you will attain a state of eminence amidst your enemies.
data.anv: शुभे auspicious, वस्त्रे garments, परिधाय wearing, देवतेव like a goddess, चरिष्यसि you shall move about, चन्द्रम् of moon, आह्वयमानेन challenging, मुखेन with countenance, अप्रतिमानना with a peerless, द्विषज्जनम् amidst your enemies, गर्वयन्ती feeling proud, मुख्याम् eminent, गतिम् state, गमिष्यसि you will attain.

data.v: तवापि कुब्जाः कुब्जायाः सर्वाभरणभूषिताः । पादौ परिचरिष्यन्ति यथैव त्वं सदा मम ॥
data.es: Other hunchbacks adorned with all sorts of ornament shall also serve you in the same manner as you are serving me.
data.anv: त्वम् you, मम to me, यथैव in that manner, कुब्जाया: other hunchbacks, तव पादौ अपि your feet also, कुब्जा: other humpbacks, सर्वाभरणभूषिता: adorned with all ornaments, सदा परिचरिष्यन्ति will always serve you.

data.v: इति प्रशस्यमाना सा कैकेयीमिदमब्रवीत् । शयानां शयने शुभ्रे वेद्यामग्निशिखामिव ॥
data.es: Flattered in this manner, Manthara addressed Kaikeyi who was lying on a white couch and looking like a flaming fire on the sacrificial altar:
data.anv: इति thus, प्रशस्यमाना being praised, सा that(Manthara), वेद्याम् on a sacrificial altar, अग्निशिखामिव like a flaming fire, शुभ्रे white, शयने in the couch, शयानाम् lying down, कैकेयीम् addressing Kaikeyi, इदम् this, अब्रवीत् said.

data.v: गतोदके सेतुबन्धो न कल्याणि विधीयते । उत्तिष्ठ कुरु कल्याणं राजानमनुदर्शय ॥
data.es: O fortunate one construction of a dike is not undertaken after the water has flowed down. Act before the king to the best of your interest.
data.anv: कल्याणि O fortunate one, गतोदके after the water has flowed out, सेतुबन्ध: construction of a dam, न विधीयते not undertaken, उत्तिष्ठ you may arise, कल्याणम् auspicious act, कुरु perform, राजानम् (to the) king, अनुदर्शय show(such act).

data.v: तथा प्रोत्साहिता देवी गत्वा मन्थरया सह । क्रोधागारं विशालाक्षी सौभाग्यमदगर्विता ॥
अनेकशतसाहस्रं मुक्ताहारं वराङ्गना । अवमुच्य वरार्हाणि शुभान्याभरणानि च ॥
ततो हेमोपमा तत्र कुब्जा वाक्यं वशं गता । संविश्य भूमौ कैकेयी मन्थरामिदमब्रवीत् ॥
इह वा मां मृतां कुब्जे नृपायावेदयिष्यसि । वनं तु राघवे प्राप्ते भरतः प्राप्स्यति क्षितिम् ॥
data.es: O hunchback, tell the king, either Bharata shall secure the kingdom on Rama's departure to the forest or else I will die here.
data.anv: कुब्जे O hunchback, राघवे to the scion of the Raghus (Rama), वनं तु to the forest, प्राप्ते having gone, भरत: Bharata, क्षितिम् earth, प्राप्स्यति secures, वा or, इह here, माम् me, मृताम् as if dead, नृपाय for  king Dasaratha, आवेदयिष्यसि you will inform.

data.v: अथैतदुक्त्वा वचनं सुदारुणं; निधाय सर्वाभरणानि भामिनी । असंवृतामास्तरणेन मेदिनीं; तदाधिशिश्ये पतितेव किन्नरी ॥
data.es: Saying these ruthless words, that lovely Kaikeyi cast off all her ornaments like a fallen 'kinnara' woman, and lay down on the floor with the carpet removed.
data.anv: भामिनी that beautiful one (Kaikeyi), सुदारुणम् dreadful, एतत् वचनम् this word, उक्त्वा having said, अथ after that, सर्वाभरणानि all ornaments, निधाय having removed, पतिता fallen, किन्नरी इव like a 'kinnar', तदा then, आस्तरणेन by a carpet, असंवृताम् uncovered, मेदिनीम् the earth, अधिशिश्ये lay down.

data.v: उदीर्णसंरम्भतमोवृतानना; तथावमुक्तोत्तममाल्यभूषणा । नरेन्द्रपत्नी विमना बभूव सा; तमोवृता द्यौरिव मग्नतारका ॥
data.es: Thus queen Kaikeyi's face enveloped by the darkness of violent anger and her body stripped of all valuable ornaments, she lay restless, looking like the dark sky without stars. इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये अयोध्याकाण्डे नवमस्सर्गः॥Thus ends of the ninth sarga of Ayodhyakanda of the holy Ramayana, the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.
data.anv: तथा thus, उदीर्णसंरम्भतमोवृतानना her face enveloped in the darkness of violent anger, अवमुक्तोत्तममाल्यभूषणा all valuable ornaments having been stripped off, विमना: mind restless, नरेन्द्रपत्नी king's wife, सा that Kaikeyi, तमोवृता filled with darkness, मग्नतारकाः bereft of stars, द्यौरिव like sky, बभूव became.

data.v: आज्ञाप्य तु महाराजो राघवस्याभिषेचनम् । प्रियार्हां प्रियमाख्यातुं विवेशान्तःपुरं वशी ॥
data.es: The king issued orders for Rama's installation ceremony, and taking leave of his close associates entered the palace. .
data.anv: महाराज: तु as regards the king, राघवस्य Rama's, अभिषेचनम् installation ceremony, आज्ञाप्य having issued orders, उपस्थानम् very close associates, अनुज्ञाप्य having taken leave, निवेशनम् the palace, प्रविवेश entered.

data.v: तां तत्र पतितां भूमौ शयानामतथोचिताम् । प्रतप्त इव दुःखेन सोऽपश्यज्जगतीपतिः ॥
data.es: The lord of the earth (Dasaratha) saw her (Kaikeyi) lying down on the floor of the chamber of wrath in an unbecoming manner and felt as if consumed by grief.
data.anv: जगतीपति: lord of the earth, स: he, तत्र there (in that chamber of wrath), पतिताम् fallen down, भूमौ on the floor, शयानाम् lying down, अतथोचिताम् unbecoming manner, ताम् her, अपश्यत् saw,  दु:खेन with grief, प्रतप्त: इव as if consumed.

data.v: स वृद्धस्तरुणीं भार्यां प्राणेभ्योऽपि गरीयसीम् । अपापः पापसंकल्पां ददर्श धरणीतले ॥
data.es: The guileless, old king beheld his youthful wife who was dearer to him than his own life, filled with deceitful intentions. She looked like a severed creeper, like a goddess fallen down, like a 'Kinnari' thrown down on earth, like an 'apsarasa' slipped from heaven, like an illusion torn, like a female deer tied down.
data.anv: वृद्ध: aged, अपाप: guileless, स: he, तरुणीम् youthful lady, प्राणेभ्योऽपि more than his life, गरीयसीम् dearer, पापसङ्कल्पाम् a lady of sinful intentions, विनिष्कृत्ताम् severed, लतामिव like a creeper, पतिताम् fallen down, देवतामिव like a goddess, निर्धूताम् thrown down on earth, किन्नरीमिव like a 'kinnari', च्युताम् slipped (from heaven), अप्सरसं यथा like apsarasas, परिभ्रष्टाम् fallen down, मायामिव like illusion, संयताम् tied down, हरिणीमिव like a female deer, भार्याम् to wife, ददर्श saw.

data.v: करेणुमिव दिग्धेन विद्धां मृगयुणा वने । महागज इवारण्ये स्नेहात्परिममर्श ताम् ॥
data.es: Like a mighty sheelephant caressing her cow wounded with a poisoned arrow in the forest, he caressed her lovingly.
data.anv: वने in the forest, दिग्धेन by a poisoned arrow, विद्धाम् struck down, करेणुमिव like a sheelephant, ताम् her, अरण्ये in the forest, महागज: इव like a mighty elephant, स्नेहात् lovingly, परिममर्श caressed.

data.v: परिमृश्य च पाणिभ्यामभिसंत्रस्तचेतनः । कामी कमलपत्राक्षीमुवाच वनितामिदम् ॥
data.es: With a mind extremely terrified yet passionate, he caressed his lotuseyed wife with his hands, and said:
data.anv: कामी passionate, अभिसन्त्रस्तचेतन: mind extremely terrified, कमलपत्राक्षीम् to one with eyes resembling lotuspetals, वनिताम् that woman, पाणिभ्याम् with both hands, परिमृश्य after caressing, इदम् this word, उवाच said.

data.v: न तेऽहमभिजानामि क्रोधमात्मनि संश्रितम् । देवि केनाभियुक्तासि केन वासि विमानिता ॥
data.es: O auspicious queen, I do not know whether your anger is directed at me. I do not know the cause of your anger. By whom have you been offended or disrespected? Why are you lying in the dust? This is causing me great sorrow.
data.anv: देवि O queen आत्मनि in me, संश्रितम् taken refuge in (you), ते your, क्रोधम् about anger, अहम् I, न अभिजानामि am not able to know, केन by whom, अभिशप्ता असि are you cursed, केन वा or by whom, विमानिता असि are you disrespected, कल्याणि O auspicious one, पांसुषु in the dust, यत् शेषे since you lie, इदम् this, मम my, दु:खाय is the source of my sorrow.

data.v: यदिदं मम दुःखाय शेषे कल्याणि पांसुषु । भूमौ शेषे किमर्थं त्वं मयि कल्याण चेतसि । भूतोपहतचित्तेव मम चित्तप्रमाथिनी ॥
data.es: While I am here favourably disposed towards you, why are you lying down on the floor like one possessed by an evil spirit? Why are you afflicting my mind?
data.anv: मयि in me, कल्याणचेतसि in a mind favourably disposed, त्वम् you, भूतोपहतचित्तेव like one possessed by evil spirits, मम my, चित्तप्रमाथिनी afflicting my mind, किमर्थम् why, भूमौ on the floor, शेषे are you lying down?

data.v: सन्ति मे कुशला वैद्या अभितुष्टाश्च सर्वशः । सुखितां त्वां करिष्यन्ति व्याधिमाचक्ष्व भामिनि ॥
data.es: O lovely one there are, to my best satisfaction, expert physicians in all branches (of medical science). They will restore your health. Tell me your ailment.
data.anv: भामिनि O lovely one कुशला: experts, सर्वश: in every way, अभितुष्टा: च completely satisfied too, मे my, वैद्या: सन्ति physicians are available, त्वाम् you, सुखिताम् करिष्यन्ति will restore your health, व्याधिम् ailment, आचक्ष्व you may tell.

data.v: कस्य वा ते प्रियं कार्यं केन वा विप्रियं कृतम् । कः प्रियं लभतामद्य को वा सुमहदप्रियम् ॥
data.es: On whom do you wish to bestow favour? Who has caused you displeasure? To whom should I grant favour now? To whom should I cause great displeasure?
data.anv: कस्य वा to whom, प्रियम् favour, ते by you, कार्यम् is to be done, केन वा by whom, विप्रियम् displeasure, कृतम् was done, क: who, अद्य now, प्रियम् favour, लभताम् let him obtain, को वा who, सुमहत् exceedingly great, अप्रियम् displeasure (shall obtain).

data.v: अवध्यो वध्यतां को वा वध्यः को वा विमुच्यताम् । दरिद्रः को भवत्वाढ्यो द्रव्यवान्वाप्यकिंचनः ॥
data.es: O queen shed no tears. Drain not your health. Ask me, and I shall slay one who should not be slain or release one who should be slain. I shall make a poor man rich and a wealthy man poor. (Tell me who are such people).
data.anv: देवि O queen मा रोदी: do not weep, त्वम् you, संपरिशोषणम् emaciation of body, मा च कार्षी: do not cause, अवध्य: who should not be slain, को वा or who, वध्यताम् shall be slain, वध्य: worthy of being slain, को वा or who, विमुच्यताम् shall be released, दरिद्र: is poor, को वा or who, आढ्य: should be made rich, भवतु shall become, द्रव्यवान्वापि whosoever is wealthy, अकिञ्चन: shall be rendered poor.

data.v: अहं चैव मदीयाश्च सर्वे तव वशानुगाः । न ते कंचिदभिप्रायं व्याहन्तुमहमुत्सहे ॥
data.es: My kins and I are under your control. I will make no effort to go even a little against your wishes.
data.anv: अहं चैव I am also, मदीया: my relatives, सर्वे च all people, तव your, वशानुगा: under control, ते your, अभिप्रायम् opinion, किञ्चित् a little, व्याहन्तुम् to spoil, अहम् I, न उत्सहे will not make efforts.

data.v: आत्मनो जीवितेनापि ब्रूहि यन्मनसेच्छसि । यावदावर्तते चक्रं तावती मे वसुंधरा ॥
तथोक्ता सा समाश्वस्ता वक्तुकामा तदप्रियम् । परिपीडयितुं भूयो भर्तारमुपचक्रमे ॥
data.es: Thus spoken to, she (Kaikeyi) breathed a sigh of relief. Intending to tell him the unpleasant thing (which was in her mind), she began tormenting her husband all the more.इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये अयोध्याकाण्डे दशमस्सर्गः॥Thus ends the tenth sarga of Ayodhyakanda of the holy Ramayana, the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.
data.anv: तथा thus, उक्ता spoken to, सा she, समाश्वस्ता breathing a sigh of relief, तत् that, अप्रियम् unpleasant thing, वक्तुकामा intending to tell, भर्तारम् to her husband, भूयः still more,     परिपीडयितुम् for tormenting, उपचक्रमे started.

data.v: नास्मि विप्रकृता देव केनचिन्न विमानिता । अभिप्रायस्तु मे कश्चित्तमिच्छामि त्वया कृतम् ॥
data.es: O king I have neither been offended nor disregarded by any one, but I have a purpose which you should fulfil.
data.anv: देव O king, केनचित् by any one, विप्रकृता offended, नास्मि I am not, न अवमानिता nor disregarded, तु but, मे my, कश्चित् certain, अभिप्रायः purpose, तम् that one, त्वया by you, कृतं इच्छामि you should fulfil.

data.v: प्रतिज्ञां प्रतिजानीष्व यदि त्वं कर्तुमिच्छसि । अथ तद्व्याहरिष्यामि यदभिप्रार्थितं मया ॥
data.es: If you are inclined to accomplish my desire, then promise me that you will fulfil them. Thereafter I shall reveal it to you.
data.anv: त्वम् you, कर्तुम् to accomplish, इच्छसि यदि if you are inclined, प्रतिज्ञां प्रतिजानीष्व promise to fulfil, अथ thereafter, मया by me, यत् whatever, अभिप्रार्थितम् sought for, तत् that one, व्याहरिष्यामि I will tell you.

data.v: एवमुक्तस्तया राजा प्रियया स्त्रीवशं गतः । तामुवाच महातेजाः कैकेयीमीषदुत्स्मितः ॥
अवलिप्ते न जानासि त्वत्तः प्रियतरो मम । मनुजो मनुजव्याघ्राद्रामादन्यो न विद्यते ॥
data.es: O proud lady, don't you know there exists for me no woman dearer than you and no man other than Rama who is the best among men.
data.anv: आवलिप्ते  woman swollen with pride, न जानासि do you not know?, मम to me, त्वत्तः more than you, प्रियतरः dearer, मनुजव्याघ्रात् other than the tiger (best) among men, रामात् than Rama, अन्यः other, मनुजः man, न विद्यते does not exist.

data.v: भद्रे हृदयमप्येतदनुमृश्योद्धरस्व मे । एतत्समीक्ष्य कैकेयि ब्रूहि यत्साधु मन्यसे ॥
data.es: O gentle lady my heart is sinking. Touch my heart and deliver me from distress. O Kaikeyi considering all this, tell me what you think is good.
data.anv: भद्रे O gentle lady मे my, एतत् this, हृदयम् heart, अनुमृश्य having touched, उद्धरस्व save, कैकेयि O Kaikeyi, एतत् this, समीक्ष्य after considering, यत् which, साधु as good, मन्यसे you may consider, ब्रूहि you may tell.

data.v: बलमात्मनि पश्यन्ती न मां शङ्कितुमर्हसि । करिष्यामि तव प्रीतिं सुकृतेनापि ते शपे ॥
data.es: If you want to do anything even if it means sacrificing my life, I shall do it. Since you know my strength, it does not behove you to doubt me. I swear on my merits. I will do whatever pleases you.
data.anv: आत्मनि  in yourself, बलम् power, जानन्ती you know fully, माम् me, शङ्कितुम् to doubt, न अर्हसि it does not behove you, सुकृतेनापि on my merits, ते to you, शपे I swear, तव your, प्रीतिम् pleasure, करिष्ये I shall do.

data.v: तेन वाक्येन संहृष्टा तमभिप्रायमात्मनः । व्याजहार महाघोरमभ्यागतमिवान्तकम् ॥
data.es: Delighted by the words (of the king), Kaikeyi disclosed him her highly dreadful wish which entered her mind like a sudden visitation of death:
data.anv: तेन वाक्येन by those  words, संहृष्टा delighted, अभ्यागतम् suddenly struck, अन्तकमिव like death, महाघोरम् highly dreadful, आगतम् that has come to her mind, तम् अभिप्रायम् her wish, व्याजहार spoke.

data.v: यथाक्रमेण शपसि वरं मम ददासि च । तच्छृण्वन्तु त्रयस्त्रिंशद्देवाः सेन्द्रपुरोगमाः ॥
data.es: You are repeatedly swearing to grant me boons. Let the thirtythree crore gods headed by the firegod, listen.
data.anv: साग्निपुरोगमाः with firegod in the forefront, त्रयस्त्रिंशद्देवाः thirtythree (crore) gods, क्रमेण successively, यथा like, शपसि your are swearing, मम my, वरम् boon, ददासि च are giving, तत् that, शृण्वन्तु listen.

data.v: चन्द्रादित्यौ नभश्चैव ग्रहा रात्र्यहनी दिशः । जगच्च पृथिवी चैव सगन्धर्वा सराक्षसा ॥
data.es: Let the Moon and the Sun, the sky, the planets, night and day, the (ten) quarters the world, gandharvas, rakshasas, this earth, the nocturnal spirits all beings, family deities of every house and all other beings listen to your words of promise.
data.anv: चन्द्रादित्यौ Moon and Sun, नभः च एव and the sky also, ग्रहाः the planets, रात्र्यहनी night and day, दिशः the (ten) quarters, जगच्च the world, सगन्धर्वा with all gandharvas, सराक्षसा with all rakshasas, इयम् this, पृथिवी earth, निशाचराणि nightrangers, भूतानि all beings, गृहेषु in the houses, गृहदेवताः family deities, अन्यानि all other, यानि whosoever, भूतानि beings, तव your, भाषितम्  words of promise, जानीयुः let them know.

data.v: निशाचराणि भूतानि गृहेषु गृहदेवताः । यानि चान्यानि भूतानि जानीयुर्भाषितं तव ॥
data.es: Let the Moon and the Sun, the sky, the planets, night and day, the (ten) quarters the world, gandharvas, rakshasas, this earth, the nocturnal spirits all beings, family deities of every house and all other beings listen to your words of promise.
data.anv: चन्द्रादित्यौ Moon and Sun, नभः च एव and the sky also, ग्रहाः the planets, रात्र्यहनी night and day, दिशः the (ten) quarters, जगच्च the world, सगन्धर्वा with all gandharvas, सराक्षसा with all rakshasas, इयम् this, पृथिवी earth, निशाचराणि nightrangers, भूतानि all beings, गृहेषु in the houses, गृहदेवताः family deities, अन्यानि all other, यानि whosoever, भूतानि beings, तव your, भाषितम्  words of promise, जानीयुः let them know.

data.v: सत्यसंधो महातेजा धर्मज्ञः सुसमाहितः । वरं मम ददात्येष तन्मे शृण्वन्तु देवताः ॥
data.es: King Dasaratha who is true to his vows, heroic and knows the ways of righteousness is granting me boons with a wellcomposed mind. Let all the gods stand witness to this (declared Kaikeyi).
data.anv: सत्यसन्ध: true to his vows, महातेजाः heroic, धर्मज्ञः knows the ways of righteousness, सुसमाहितः wellcomposed, एषः this (Dasaratha), मम my, वरम् boon, ददाति is giving, दैवताः gods, तत् that one, मे for my sake, शृण्वन्तु hear.

data.v: इति देवी महेष्वासं परिगृह्याभिशस्य च । ततः परमुवाचेदं वरदं काममोहितम् ॥
data.es: Clasping the great archer, the infatuated king, conferer of boons and flattering him (to the top of her bent), the queen said:
data.anv: देवी queen, महेष्वासम् great archer, परिगृह्य having seized, अभिशस्य च having flattered, ततः परम् च afterwards, वरदम् conferer of boons, काममोहितम् infatuated, इदम् this word, उवाच said.

data.v: वरौ यौ मे त्वया देव तदा दत्तौ महीपते । तौ तावदहमद्यैव वक्ष्यामि शृणु मे वचः ॥
data.es: Thereafter, she said to the infatuated king who had promised to confer her boons, O lord of the earth, O king, right now I shall speak to you about the two boons granted by you. Listen to my words.
data.anv: ततः परम् thereafter, काममोहितम् overcome by passion, वरदम् conferer of boons, इदम् this word, उवाच said, महीपते O lord of earth, देव my lord, तदा then, मे to me, त्वया by yourself, यौ वरौ those two boons, दत्तौ were given, तौ about them, अद्यैव तावत् right now, वक्ष्यामि I shall speak out , मे वचः my words, शृणु listen.

data.v: अभिषेकसमारम्भो राघवस्योपकल्पितः । अनेनैवाभिषेकेण भरतो मेऽभिषिच्यताम् ॥
data.es: Preparations for Rama's consecration have been made. With these very materials for installation, my son Bharata should be consecrated.
data.anv: राघवस्य Rama's, अभिषेकसमारम्भः preparations for consecration, उपकल्पितः have been  made, अनेन अभिषेकेणैव with these materials for installation, मे my, भरतः Bharata, अभिषिच्यताम् shall be crowned.

data.v: नव पञ्च च वर्षाणि दण्डकारण्यमाश्रितः । चीराजिनजटाधारी रामो भवतु तापसः ॥
data.es: Consigned to the Dandaka forest for fourteen years, clad in bark and deer skin and wearing matted hair, Rama shall live like an ascetic.
data.anv: रामः Rama, नव पञ्च च वर्षाणि for fourteen (nine and five) years, दण्डकारण्यम् Dandaka forest, आश्रितः resorted to, चीराजिनजटाधारी clad in tattered (bark) and deer skin and wearing matted locks, तापसः like an ascetic, भवतु shall remain (in the forest.)

data.v: भरतो भजतामद्य यौवराज्यमकण्टकम् । अद्य चैव हि पश्येयं प्रयान्तं राघवं वने ॥
data.es: Let Bharata be princeregent without any rivals. This is my great desire. I am asking for an already granted boon. Let me see Rama's departure to the forest today itself.
data.anv: अद्य now, भरतः Bharata, अकण्टकम् without any thorns(rivals), यौवराज्यम् as princeregent, भजताम् let him enjoy, एषः this, मे my, परमः great, कामः desire, दत्तं वरमेव already granted boon, वृणे I am asking for, अद्य चैव now itself, वनम् to the forest, प्रयान्तं departing to the forest, राघवम् to the scion of the Raghus (Rama), पश्येयम् I shall see.

data.v: ततः श्रुत्वा महाराजः कैकेय्या दारुणं वचः । व्यथितो विक्लवश्चैव व्याघ्रीं दृष्ट्वा यथा मृगः ॥
असंवृतायामासीनो जगत्यां दीर्घमुच्छ्वसन् । अहो धिगिति सामर्षो वाचमुक्त्वा नराधिपः । मोहमापेदिवान्भूयः शोकोपहतचेतनः ॥
चिरेण तु नृपः संज्ञां प्रतिलभ्य सुदुःखितः । कैकेयीमब्रवीत्क्रुद्धः प्रदहन्निव चक्षुषा ॥
data.es: Regaining his consciousness after a long time, the king in deep grief and with eyes as though burning in anger looked at Kaikeyi and said:
data.anv: नृपः  the king, चिरेण after a long time, संज्ञाम् consciousness, प्रतिलभ्य having regained, सुदुःखितः  distressed, क्रुद्धः angry, चक्षुषा with eyes, कैकेयीम् Kaikeyi, प्रदहन्निव as if burning, अब्रवीत् spoke.

data.v: नृशंसे दुष्टचारित्रे कुलस्यास्य विनाशिनि । किं कृतं तव रामेण पापे पापं मयापि वा ॥
data.es: O woman of cruel and sinful nature, you are bent on destroying this family. What harm has been done to you by Rama or by me?
data.anv: नृशंसे O cruel woman, दुष्टचारित्रे  of wicked character, अस्य कुलस्य of this family, विनाशिनि destroyer, पापे sinful woman, रामेण by Rama, मयापि वा or by me, तव your, किं पापं कृतम् what harm has been done?

data.v: सदा ते जननी तुल्यां वृत्तिं वहति राघवः । तस्यैव त्वमनर्थाय किंनिमित्तमिहोद्यता ॥
data.es: Then Rama was conducting himself in relation to you as his own mother, for what purpose are you seeking injustice to such a person?
data.anv: राघवः Rama, यदा when  ते in relation to you, जननीतुल्याम् like his own mother, वृत्तिम् conduct, वहति was carrying out, तस्यैव to such a person, अनर्थाय for injustice, त्वम् you, किं निमित्तम् for what purpose, इह here, उद्यता are you attempting?

data.v: त्वं मयात्मविनाशाय भवनं स्वं प्रवेशिता । अविज्ञानान्नृपसुता व्याली तीक्ष्णविषा यथा ॥
data.es: In my ignorance I brought home for my selfdestruction a king's daughter who was like a venomous female serpent.
data.anv: त्वम् you, नृपसुता king's daughter, मया by me, तीक्ष्णविषा  venomous, व्याली यथा like a female serpent, अविज्ञानात् by ignorance, स्वं भवनम् my home, आत्म विनाशार्थम् for  selfdestruction, प्रवेशिता  ushered in.

data.v: जीवलोको यदा सर्वो रामस्येह गुणस्तवम् । अपराधं कमुद्दिश्य त्यक्ष्यामीष्टमहं सुतम् ॥
data.es: When all living beings of this world are extoling the virtues of Rama, for what crime should I abandon my beloved son?
data.anv: यदा when, सर्वः all, जीवलोकः living beings of the world, रामस्य Rama's, गुणस्तवम् extoling  virtues, आह is telling, (then), कम् what, अपराधम् crime, उद्धिश्य showing, अहम् I, इष्टं सुतम् beloved son, त्यक्ष्यामि I shall abandon.

data.v: कौसल्यां वा सुमित्रां वा त्यजेयमपि वा श्रियम् । जीवितं वात्मनो रामं न त्वेव पितृवत्सलम् ॥
data.es: I shall give up Kausalya or Sumitra or all my wealth or even my own life but I cannot leave Rama who is devoted to his father.
data.anv: कौशल्यां वा even Kausalya, सुमित्रां वा or even Sumitra, श्रियमपि वा wealth, आत्मनः my own , जीवितं वा life also, त्यजेयम् shall give up, पितृवत्सलम् who is devoted to  his father, रामं तु Rama, न will not leave.

data.v: परा भवति मे प्रीतिर्दृष्ट्वा तनयमग्रजम् । अपश्यतस्तु मे रामं नष्टा भवति चेतना ॥
data.es: When I see my firstborn , I experience supreme delight. But if I do not see him, my life loses its meaning.
data.anv: अग्रजम् firstborn, तनयम् son, दृष्ट्वा having seen, मे my, परा supreme, प्रीतिः भवति will be my delight, रामम् Rama, अपश्यतस्तु but if I do not see him, मे my, चेतना life, नष्टा भवति is destroyed.

data.v: तिष्ठेल्लोको विना सूर्यं सस्यं वा सलिलं विना । न तु रामं विना देहे तिष्ठेत्तु मम जीवितम् ॥
data.es: This world can exist without the Sun or crops (can be grown) without water but without Rama, life would not exist in my body.
data.anv: लोकः world, सूर्यं विना without the Sun, तिष्ठेत् can exist, सस्यम् crops, सलिलं विना वा without water, तु but, रामं विना without Rama, मम देहे my body, जीवितम् life, न तिष्ठेत् shall not exist.

data.v: तदलं त्यज्यतामेष निश्चयः पापनिश्चये । अपि ते चरणौ मूर्ध्ना स्पृशाम्येष प्रसीद मे ॥
data.es: O lady of evil intentions, enough of this. Give up your resolve. Here I touch your feet with my head. Be pleased with me.
data.anv: पापनिश्चये O lady of evil intentions, तत् for that reason, अलम् enough, एषः such, निश्चयः intention, त्यज्यताम्  give up, एषः here I, ते चरणौ your feet, मूर्ध्ना with my head, स्पृशाम्यपि will touch, मे my (to me), प्रसीद you may be pleased.

data.v: स भूमिपालो विलपन्ननाथव;त्स्त्रिया गृहीतो हृदयेऽतिमात्रता । पपात देव्याश्चरणौ प्रसारिता;वुभावसंस्पृश्य यथातुरस्तथा ॥
data.es: The king, with his heart in the grip of a woman, wailing like an orphan tried to reach her feet, exceeding the limit of selfrespect but, unable to touch them as she pulled them apart, he collapsed like a sick man.इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये अयोध्याकाण्डे द्वादशस्सर्गः॥Thus ends the twelfth sarga of Ayodhyakanda of the holy Ramayana, the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.
data.anv: अतिमात्रया exceeding the limit of respect, स्त्रिया by a woman, हृदये in the heart, गृहीतः having grasped, सः that, भूमिपालः king, अनाथवत् like an orphan, विलपन् wailing, प्रसारितौ stretched apart, देव्याः the queens, चरणौ both feet, असम्स्पृश्य (असम्प्राप्य) without touching (without reaching), आतुरः sick, यथा as, तथा so, पपात fell down.
data.md: As bewailing thus like one forlorn the ruler of earth whose heart was captivated by Kaikeyi on account of her supreme beauty proceeded to take hold of her feet, who having banished all self respect, sat with her legs stretched, he, without being able to come at them, fell down in a swoon, like one enfeebled with disease.

data.v: अतदर्हं महाराजं शयानमतथोचितम् । ययातिमिव पुण्यान्ते देवलोकात्परिच्युतम् ॥
data.es: The maharaja lying on the floor resembled (king) Yayati fallen from heaven after his merits (earned earlier) were exhausted. He neither deserved nor was accustomed to such (humiliating) treatment. Fearless Kaikeyi ,the incarnate of misfortune having accomplished her purpose, displyaing feigned fear, urged the king again (without inhibition), about the boons:
data.anv: अनर्थरूपा misfortune incarnate, सिद्धार्था with her purpose fulfilled, अङ्गना that woman, अतदर्हम् who did not merit such treatment, अतथोचितम् who was not accustomed to that (treatment), पुण्यान्ते after exhausting the merits (earned), देवलोकात् from the heaven, परिच्युतम् fallen, ययातिमिव like Yayati, शयानम् lying, महाराजम्  to the maharaja (Dasaratha), अभीता fearless, भयदर्शिनी displaying fear, पुनः again, तमेव वरम् those very boons, आकारयामास urged.
data.md: Then as the mighty king was lying down in this unbeseeming and improper guise, like Yayāti dropped from the celestial, that lady, personating the ruin of the race, not fearing public odium, who had discerned danger from Rāma to Bharata, not having attained her wish, again addressed the monarch, concerning the boon he had promised to her.

data.v: अनर्थरूपा सिद्धार्था अभीता भयदर्शिनी । पुनराकारयामास तमेव वरमङ्गना ॥
data.es: The maharaja lying on the floor resembled (king) Yayati fallen from heaven after his merits (earned earlier) were exhausted. He neither deserved nor was accustomed to such (humiliating) treatment. Fearless Kaikeyi ,the incarnate of misfortune having accomplished her purpose, displyaing feigned fear, urged the king again (without inhibition), about the boons:
data.anv: अनर्थरूपा misfortune incarnate, सिद्धार्था with her purpose fulfilled, अङ्गना that woman, अतदर्हम् who did not merit such treatment, अतथोचितम् who was not accustomed to that (treatment), पुण्यान्ते after exhausting the merits (earned), देवलोकात् from the heaven, परिच्युतम् fallen, ययातिमिव like Yayati, शयानम् lying, महाराजम्  to the maharaja (Dasaratha), अभीता fearless, भयदर्शिनी displaying fear, पुनः again, तमेव वरम् those very boons, आकारयामास urged.
data.md: Then as the mighty king was lying down in this unbeseeming and improper guise, like Yayāti dropped from the celestial, that lady, personating the ruin of the race, not fearing public odium, who had discerned danger from Rāma to Bharata, not having attained her wish, again addressed the monarch, concerning the boon he had promised to her.

data.v: त्वं कत्थसे महाराज सत्यवादी दृढव्रतः । मम चेमं वरं कस्माद्विधारयितुमिच्छसि ॥
data.es: O great king you used to boast that you always speak the truth and are steadfast in your vows. Why are you now seeking to avoid granting me this boon?
data.anv: महाराज O maharaja, सत्यवादी truthful, दृढव्रतः steadfast in your vows, त्वम् you, कत्थसे used to boast of, मम my, इमं वरम् this boon, कस्मात् why, विधारयितुम् to avoid, इच्छसि are seeking?
data.md: You describe yourself, O mighty monarch, as speaking the truth and firm in vow. Why then do you hesitate to confer this boon on me?

data.v: एवमुक्तस्तु कैकेय्या राजा दशरथस्तदा । प्रत्युवाच ततः क्रुद्धो मुहूर्तं विह्वलन्निव ॥
data.es: Thus addressed by Kaikeyi, king Dasaratha flew into a temper for a while, and then as if in a state of delirium, replied:
data.anv: तदा then, कैकेय्या by Kaikeyi, एवम् in this way, उक्तः having said, राजा दशरथः king Dasaratha, क्रुद्धः in indignation, मुहूर्तम् for a while, विह्वलन्निव as if in a state of delirium, ततः afterwards, प्रत्युवाच replied.
data.md: Thus addressed by Kaikeyi king Dasaratha, remaining stupefied for a while thus answered her in wrath.

data.v: मृते मयि गते रामे वनं मनुजपुंगवे । हन्तानार्ये ममामित्रे रामः प्रव्राजितो वनम् ॥
data.es: With me dead and Rama, the best among men, banished, what harmful acts are you contemplating against my wellwishers?
data.anv: मनुजपुङ्गवे foremost among men, रामे Rama, वनंगते exiled, मयि me, मृते being dead, अनार्ये O ignoble woman मम अमित्रे my enemy, सकामा having satisfied your desire, सुखिनी भव be happy, हन्त alas.
data.md: O ignoble one! O enemy of mine! On my being dead and that chief of men, Rāma, repairing to the woods, do you, yours wish attained, become happy.

data.v: यदि सत्यं ब्रवीम्येतत्तदसत्यं भविष्यति । अकीर्तिरतुला लोके ध्रुवं परिभवश्च मे ॥
data.es: O cruel, malevolent Kaikeyi, why do you propose such a harmful act against Rama who has truth as his prowess and who is so dear to me? Certainly, you will get unparalleled infamy and disgrace in this world.
data.anv: नृशंसे O cruel one पापसङ्कल्पे O woman of evil intentions कैकेयि Kaikeyi, मम my, प्रियम् dear, सत्यपराक्रमम् truth as prowess, रामम् to Rama, विप्रियेण harmful, किम् why, योजयसे arranging, लोके in this world, मे to me, अतुला unequalled, अकीर्तिः infamy, परिभवश्च disgrace, ध्रुवं this is inevitable.

data.v: तथा विलपतस्तस्य परिभ्रमितचेतसः । अस्तमभ्यगमत्सूर्यो रजनी चाभ्यवर्तत ॥
data.es: While Dasaratha was thus lamenting with a distracted mind, the Sun set and night fell.
data.anv: परिभ्रमितचेतसः with a whirling mind, तस्य of that Dasaratha, तथा in that way, विलपतः lamenting सूर्यः the Sun, अस्तमभ्यगमत् set, रजनी च night also, अभ्यवर्तत च fell.
data.md: As king Dasaratha was bewailing thus with a heart wrought up with grief, the sun set and night came on.

data.v: स त्रियामा तथार्तस्य चन्द्रमण्डलमण्डिता । राज्ञो विलपमानस्य न व्यभासत शर्वरी ॥
data.es: For the king who was in deep anguish and in tears the night appeared dark even though it was adorned with the lunar orb.
data.anv: तथा in that way, आर्त्तस्य of the anguished, विलपमानस्य while he was lamenting, राज्ञः of the  king, त्रियामा with three yamas, सा that, शर्वरी night, चन्द्रमण्डलमण्डिता adorned with the lunar orb, न व्यभासत did not shine.
data.md: But although crested with the lunar disc, the night failed to bring comfort to the king, distressed, and indulging in grief.

data.v: तथैवोष्णं विनिःश्वस्य वृद्धो दशरथो नृपः । विललापार्तवद्दुःखं गगनासक्तलोचनः ॥
data.es: The old king Dasaratha, heaving hot sighs, started lamenting pitiably fixing his gaze at the sky like the sick:
data.anv: वृद्धः aged, दशरथः नृपः king Dasaratha, तथैव in that way only, उष्णम् hot, विनिश्श्वस्य heaving sighs, आर्तवत् like a sick man, गगनासक्तलोचनः looked at the sky with a fixed gaze, दुःखम् pitiably, विललाप lamented.
data.md: Then the old king Dasaratha, with his eyes fixed at the sky, sighing hot, lamented in this strain.

data.v: न प्रभातं त्वयेच्छामि मयायं रचितोऽञ्जलिः । अथ वा गम्यतां शीघ्रं नाहमिच्छामि निर्घृणाम् । नृशंसां कैकेयीं द्रष्टुं यत्कृते व्यसनं महत् ॥
data.es: 'Or, pass off quickly. I do not want to see this merciless, malicious Kaikeyi who is the cause of this great misfortune'.
data.anv: अथवा or, शीघ्रम् quickly, गम्यताम् let it go, यत्कृते for whose sake, महत् great, व्यसनम् misfortune, निर्घृणाम् merciless, नृशंसाम् malicious, कैकयीम् Kaikeyi, द्रष्टुम् to look at, अहम् I, नेच्छामि do not desire.
data.md: Or do you speedily repair for I do not wish to see the hated and relentless Kaikeyi, who has brought this calamity upon me.

data.v: एवमुक्त्वा ततो राजा कैकेयीं संयताञ्जलिः । प्रसादयामास पुनः कैकेयीं चेदमब्रवीत् ॥
data.es: Having said this, the king spoke again with folded hands to Kaikeyi in order to appease her:
data.anv: राजा king, एवम् thus, उक्त्वा having said, ततः then, संयताञ्जलिः with folded hands,  कैकेयीम् to  Kaikeyi, प्रसादयामास appeased, पुनः again, कैकेयीम् to Kaikeyi, इदं च this word also, अब्रवीत् spoke.
data.md: Having spoken thus, the kind conversant with the duties of Sovereigns again endeavoured to propitiate Kaikeyī, saying.

data.v: साधुवृत्तस्य दीनस्य त्वद्गतस्य गतायुषः । प्रसादः क्रियतां देवि भद्रे राज्ञो विशेषतः ॥
data.anv: भद्रे O gentle lady, देवि O queen, साधुवृत्तस्य having good conduct, दीनस्य of this wretch, त्वद्गतस्य devoted to you, गतायुषः of a man whose life is almost over, विशेषतः especially, राज्ञः as a king, प्रसादः favour, क्रियताम् let it be done.
data.md: O noble dame, do you show favour to me, who am of honest ways, who am distressed, who have made myself yours, who have finished his life, and who, in especial, am your king.

data.v: शून्येन खलु सुश्रोणि मयेदं समुदाहृतम् । कुरु साधु प्रसादं मे बाले सहृदया ह्यसि ॥
data.es: O lady with fair hips, I hope whatever I have said has not been a cry in the (empty) sky. O young lady show me this favour. Surely you are kindhearted.
data.anv: सुश्रोणि fairhipped lady, मया by me, इदम् all this, शून्ये in the sky, न खलु समुदाहृतम् indeed has not been told, बाले O young lady, मे to me, साधु very well, प्रसादम् favour, कुरु do, सहृदया असि हि surely you are kindhearted.
data.md: That I have spoken you thus was because, O you of shapely hips, I had been deprived of my senses (through grief). O girl, do you show your favour to me, be generous, be propitious.

data.v: विशुद्धभावस्य हि दुष्टभावा; ताम्रेक्षणस्याश्रुकलस्य राज्ञः । श्रुत्वा विचित्रं करुणं विलापं; भर्तुर्नृशंसा न चकार वाक्यम् ॥
data.es: The king with a clean heart, whose eyes had been rendered red with weeping wailed piteously. Even after hearing it, that malicious woman full of wicked thoughts did not act upon his word.
data.anv: सुदुष्टभावा a lady with wicked thoughts, नृशंसा heartless, विशुद्धभावस्य of pure (kind) feeling, ताम्रेक्षणस्य of one with eyes rendered red, अश्रुकलस्य filled with tears, भर्तुः husband, राज्ञः king's, विचित्रम् in various ways, करुणं विलापम् piteous wailing, श्रुत्वा having heard, वाक्यं that word, न चकार did not obey.
data.md: Having heard the exceedingly piteous words of her husband, the king of pure sentiment, who was distressed, with his eye rendered coppery and flowing with tears, that wicked minded and merciless woman spoke not.

data.v: ततः स राजा पुनरेव मूर्छितः; प्रियामतुष्टां प्रतिकूलभाषिणीम् । समीक्ष्य पुत्रस्य विवासनं प्रति; क्षितौ विसंज्ञो निपपात दुःखितः ॥
data.es: Seeing his dear wife not pleased (despite his pleadings) and urging him, to the contrary, for the banishment of his son, the king overcome with grief fell down unconscious on the floor.
data.anv: पुत्रस्य son's, विवासनं प्रति about banishment, प्रतिकूलभाषिणीम् speaking the opposite, अतुष्टाम् not satisfied, प्रियाम् beloved wife, समीक्ष्य having seen, दुःखितः struck with grief, ततः thereafter, सः राजा that king, पुनरेव again, मूर्छितः having fainted, विसंज्ञः losing consciousness, क्षितौ on the ground (floor), निपपात fell down.
data.md: Thereat seeing that his favourite dissatisfied wife persisted in urging the banishment of his son, the king struck with grief, again fell down to the earth, senseless.

data.v: पुत्रशोकार्दितं पापा विसंज्ञं पतितं भुवि । विवेष्टमानमुदीक्ष्य सैक्ष्वाकमिदमब्रवीत् ॥
data.es: The evil woman (Kaikeyi) said to the king of the Ikshvaku race who lay unconscious on the floor writhing and tormented with grief on account of his son.
data.anv: सा पापा that evil woman, पुत्रशोकार्दितम् tortured with grief on account of his son, विसंज्ञम् having lost senses, भुवि on the floor, पतितम् had fallen, विवेष्टमानम् writhing, ऐक्ष्वाकम्  (Dasaratha) born in the Ikshvaku race, इदम् this word, अब्रवीत् said.
data.md: Then that sinful woman, seeing the descendant of Ikşvāku distressed on account of his son, and deprived of consciousness, and lying inert on the ground, spoke to him, saying.

data.v: पापं कृत्वेव किमिदं मम संश्रुत्य संश्रवम् । शेषे क्षितितले सन्नः स्थित्यां स्थातुं त्वमर्हसि ॥
data.es: (Kaikeyi said) What is this? After hearing my response to the promised boon, why are you lying down on the floor dejected as if you had committed a sin? It behoves you to maintain your status.
data.anv: मम me (what you have done for me), संश्रवम् the promise, संश्रुत्य having promised, पापं कृत्वा इव as if you have committed a sin done a sinful act, सन्नः a dejected man, क्षितितले on the ground (floor), शेषे lying down, इदम् this, किम् what, त्वम् you, स्थित्याम् status, स्थातुम् to remain,  अर्हसि you are worthy of.
data.md: Having promised to grant me the boon, how distressed do you lie on the ground, as if you did commit some sin? It behove you to keep untainted your dignity by performing what you have promised.

data.v: आहुः सत्यं हि परमं धर्मं धर्मविदो जनाः । सत्यमाश्रित्य हि मया त्वं च धर्मं प्रचोदितः ॥
data.es: Those conversant with righteousness say that truth is a great virtue. By following the truth, I have enlightened you about your duty.
data.anv: धर्मविदः conversant with righteousness, जनाः people, सत्यम् truth, परमं धर्मम् is a great virtue, आहुः हि are saying, मया च by me also, सत्यम् truth, आश्रित्य by following, त्वम् you, धर्मम् about your duty, प्रबोधितः enlightened with.
data.md: Truth, say persons cognizant of it, is the prime virtue. And it is in the interests of virtue, that I have been exhorting you.

data.v: संश्रुत्य शैब्यः श्येनाय स्वां तनुं जगतीपतिः । प्रदाय पक्षिणो राजञ्जगाम गतिमुत्तमाम् ॥
data.es: (King) Saibya gave his own flesh to the hawk in the conflict between the hawk and the pigeon. (King) Alarka gave his eyes (to a blind man) and attained the highest state.
data.anv: राजन् O king, जगतीपतिः lord of the earth, शैब्यः Saibya, श्येनाय पक्षिणे to a hawk, a bird, स्वाम् his own, तनुम् body, संश्रुत्य having promised, उत्तमाम् highest, गतिम् state, जगाम attained.
data.md: Having promised his own person to the hawk, that lord of earth, Saivya, having granted the same to the bird, went the excellent way.

data.v: तथ ह्यलर्कस्तेजस्वी ब्राह्मणे वेदपारगे । याचमाने स्वके नेत्रे उद्धृत्याविमना ददौ ॥
data.es: In the same way the lustrous king Alarka, on being solicited by a brahmin who was an adept in the Vedas, plucked his own eyes and gave them to him without hesitation.
data.anv: तथा In the same way, तेजस्वी lustrous, अलर्कः (king) Alarka, वेदपारगे to an adept in the Vedas, याचमाने soliciting, ब्राह्मणे (to) the brahmin, स्वके his own, नेत्रे eyes, उद्धृत्य havng plucked, अविमनाः without hesitation, ददौ हि gave it indeed.
data.md: In the same manner, Alarka, being asked, plucked out his eyes readily and bestowed them on a certain Brāhmana versed in the Vedas.

data.v: सरितां तु पतिः स्वल्पां मर्यादां सत्यमन्वितः । सत्यानुरोधात्समये वेलां खां नातिवर्तते ॥
data.es: The ocean, lord of rivers, even when (tidal) time comes does not cross the shore in obedience to truth.
data.anv: सरितां पतिः तु as regards the lord of rivers (ocean), सत्यम् अन्वित: who follows the truth, स्वल्पाम् very little, मर्यादाम् as boundary, स्वाम् his own, वेलाम् shore, समये when time comes, सत्यानुरोधात् in obedience to truth, नातिवर्तते does not trangress.
data.md: And the lord of rivers, having promised, even on occasions of Parvas, does not pass over his bounds for the sake of truth.

data.v: समयं च ममार्येमं यदि त्वं न करिष्यसि । अग्रतस्ते परित्यक्ता परित्यक्ष्यामि जीवितम् ॥
data.es: O noble one, if you do not fulfil the agreement, it will mean I have been abandoned by you. (Therefore) I will give up my life in your presence.
data.anv: आर्य O noble one, त्वम् you, मम my, इमम् this, समयम् agreement, न करिष्यसि यदि if you do  not fulfil, परित्यक्ता abandoned (by you), ते अग्रतः in your presence, जीवितम् my life, परित्यक्ष्यामि will discard.
data.md: If you did not fulfil this noble vow, O worshipful Lord, you have made to me, forsaken by you will I even in your very presence renounce my life.

data.v: एवं प्रचोदितो राजा कैकेय्या निर्विशङ्कया । नाशकत्पाशमुन्मोक्तुं बलिरिन्द्रकृतं यथा ॥
data.es: In this way urged by Kaikeyi without fear or hesitation, he (Dasaratha), like Bali unable to release himself from the noose cast by Indra (through Vamana), could not get out of the noose of promise.
data.anv: निर्विशङ्कया without fear or hesitation, कैकेय्या by Kaikeyi, एवम् in this way, प्रचोदितः having been urged, राजा king, बलिः emperor Bali, इन्द्रकृतं यथा like the one employed by Indra (through Vamana), पाशम् noose (promise), मोक्तुम् to release, नाशकत् was not able.
data.md: Thus fearlessly urged by Kaikeyſ the king could not take off from himself the noose (of promise), even as Bali could not take off the noose that had been fixed upon him (by Upendra) at the instance of Indra.

data.v: उद्भ्रान्तहृदयश्चापि विवर्णवनदोऽभवत् । स धुर्यो वै परिस्पन्दन्युगचक्रान्तरं यथा ॥
data.es: Like a bullock, restlessly moving between the wheels and the yoke, Dasaratha's heart started beating wildly and his face turned pale.
data.anv: सः Dasaratha, युगचक्रान्तरम् between the wheels and the yoke, परिस्पन्दन् restlessly moving, धुर्यः यथा like a beast of burden (bullock), उद्भ्रान्तहृदयः with heart beating wildly, विवर्णवदनः चापि  with a pale face too, अभवत् remained.
data.md: Thereupon, the king looked blank, and his heart became agitated, like to a beast of burden moving tortuously when placed within the yoke and wheels.

data.v: विह्वलाभ्यां च नेत्राभ्यामपश्यन्निव भूमिपः । कृच्छ्राद्धैर्येण संस्तभ्य कैकेयीमिदमब्रवीत् ॥
data.es: The king was unable to see with his eyes overwhelmed (with tears). Gaining with great difficulty a firm footing and courage he addressed Kaikeyi:
data.anv: भूपतिः king, विह्वलाभ्याम् नेत्राभ्याम् eyes overwhelmed (with fears), अपश्यन्निव as if unable to see, कृच्छ्रात् with great difficulty, धैर्येण with courage, संस्तभ्य gaining a firm footing, कैकेयीम् to Kaikeyi, इदम् this, अब्रवीत् said.
data.md: Then calming himself with a great effort, the king, as if not seeing Kaikeyi, with his haggard eyes, addressed her, saying.

data.v: यस्ते मन्त्रकृतः पाणिरग्नौ पापे मया धृतः । तं त्यजामि स्वजं चैव तव पुत्रं सह त्वया ॥
data.es: O wicked woman, I held your hand amid chantings of mantras with the sacred fire (as witness). I now disown that hand, you and your son begotten by me.
data.anv: पापे O wicked woman, अग्नौ at the sacred fire, मन्त्रकृतः amid chantings of mantras, ते your, यः पाणिः which hand, मया by me, धृतः was held, तम् that one, स्वजम् begotten by me, तव पुत्रं चैव your son also, त्वया सह along with you, त्यजामि disown.
data.md: "I do here, O wicked wretch, renounce that hand of yours which I had held with mantras before the sacrificial fire, and I do also renounce along with you own-begotten* your son Bharata. * This is a new coinage rendered necessary for the exigencies of translation. If 'first-born' is justifiable, 'own-begotten,' is also such.

data.v: ततः पापसमाचारा कैकेयी पार्थिवं पुनः । उवाच परुषं वाक्यं वाक्यज्ञा रोषमूर्छिता ॥
data.es: Thereafter, Kaikeyi of sinful conduct and skilful in the use of words, rendered senseless by wrath, again addressing the king in harsh words said:
data.anv: ततः after that, पापसमाचारा of sinful conduct, वाक्यज्ञा skilful in words, कैकेयी Kaikeyi, रोषमूर्छिता rendered senseless by wrath, पुनः again, पार्थिवम् to the king, परुषम् in harsh, वाक्यम् words, उवाच said.
data.md: Then Kaikeyi of vile ways versed in speech, rendered senseless by wrath, again addressed the monarch in harsh language, saying.

data.v: किमिदं भाषसे राजन्वाक्यं गररुजोपमम् । आनाययितुमक्लिष्टं पुत्रं राममिहार्हसि ॥
data.es: O king, why are you speaking these painful, poisonous words? What is this? It behoves you to summon your son Rama who does not expearience this pain.
data.anv: राजन् O king, गररुजोपमम् comparable to the pain of venom, वाक्यम् words, भाषसे are you  speaking?, इदं किम् what is this?, अक्लिष्टम् one who is not pained, पुत्रम् son, रामम् Rama, इह here, आनाययितुम् to bring, अर्हसि behoves you.
data.md: What words, O king, do you say, comparable to poison or painful indisposition's. It behove you to summon hither your son, the energetic Rāma. Having established my son in the kingdom, and rendered Rāma a ranger of the woods and made myself rid of rivals, I shall attain my end.

data.v: स्थाप्य राज्ये मम सुतं कृत्वा रामं वनेचरम् । निःसपत्नां च मां कृत्वा कृतकृत्यो भविष्यसि ॥
data.es: Only after you have installed my son in the kingdom and sent Rama to the forest and made me free from rivals, you shall have your duty fulfiled.
data.anv: मम सुतम् my son, राज्ये in the kingdom, स्थाप्य having installed, रामम् Rama, वनेचरम् a forestor, कृत्वा having made, माम् me, निःसपत्नाम् devoid of rivals, कृत्वा having made, कृतकृत्यः भविष्यसि you will have fulfilled your duty.
data.md: What words, O king, do you say, comparable to poison or painful indisposition's. It behove you to summon hither your son, the energetic Rāma. Having established my son in the kingdom, and rendered Rāma a ranger of the woods and made myself rid of rivals, I shall attain my end.

data.v: स नुन्न इव तीक्षेण प्रतोदेन हयोत्तमः । राजा प्रदोचितोऽभीक्ष्णं कैकेयीमिदमब्रवीत् ॥
data.es: The king who was very much incited by her words, like a horse of the best breed whipped by the lash, replied to Kaikeyi:
data.anv: सः राजा that king (Dasaratha), तीक्ष्णेन with a sharp, प्रतोदेन by the lash, नुन्नः beaten up, हयोत्तमः इव like a horses of the best breed, अभीक्ष्णम् exceedingly, प्रचोदितः incited, कैकेयीम् to Kaikeyi, इदम् this word, अब्रवीत् said.
data.md: Thus urged by Kaikeyī, the king like to an excellent steed stung by a sharp goad, again spoke to her.

data.v: धर्मबन्धेन बद्धोऽस्मि नष्टा च मम चेतना । ज्येष्ठं पुत्रं प्रियं रामं द्रष्टुमिच्छामि धार्मिकम् ॥
data.es: I am bound by bond of righteousness. My intellect is destroyed. I wish to see my beloved, virtuous firstborn, Rama.
data.anv: धर्मबन्धेन by bond of righteousness, बद्धः अस्मि I am bound, मम चेतना च my intellect, नष्टा  is destroyed, धार्मिकम् virtuous, ज्येष्ठम् eldest, प्रियम् beloved, पुत्रम् son, रामम् Rama, द्रष्टुम् to see, इच्छामि wish.
data.md: I have been bound fast by the ties of virtue, therefore have I lost my senses. I now only wish to behold my beloved eldest son, the righteous Rama.

data.v: इति राज्ञो वचः श्रुत्वा कैकेयी तदनन्तरम् । स्वयमेवाब्रवीत्सूतं गच्छ त्वं राममानय ॥
ततः स राजा तं सूतं सन्नहर्षः सुतं प्रति । शोकारक्तेक्षणः श्रीमानुद्वीक्ष्योवाच धार्मिकः ॥
data.es: The virtuous and glorious king thinking of his son without cheer looked upward with eyes red with tears and said to the charioteer, You are causing my heart excruciating pain with your words.
data.anv: धार्मिकः virtuous, श्रीमान् glorious, सः राजा that king, सुतं प्रति about his son, सन्नहर्षः  cheerless, शोकरक्तेक्षणः eyes red with tears, उद्वीक्ष्य looking upwards, तं सूतम् to that charioteer, उवाच said, वाक्यैः with words, मम my, मर्माणि vital parts of body, भूयः (एव) still more, निकृन्तसि are piercing (causing excessive pain).
data.md: Then the graceful and virtuous king, waxing disconsolate, on account of his son, and with his eyes reddened with the effect of grief, seeing the charioteer, said, “This eulogy of your pains me the more."

data.v: सुमन्त्रः करुणं श्रुत्वा दृष्ट्वा दीनं च पार्थिवम् । प्रगृहीताञ्जलिः किंचित्तस्माद्देशादपाक्रमन् ॥
data.es: Having heard the sorrowful words of the king and having seen his wretched state Sumantra with palms folded moved away a little from the place.
data.anv: सुमन्त्रः Sumantra, करुणम् sorrowful words, श्रुत्वा having heard, दीनम् wretched, पार्थिवम् king, दृष्ट्वा च having seen, प्रगृहीताञ्जलिः with palms folded, तस्मात् देशात् from that place, किञ्चित् a little distance, अपाक्रमत् moved away.
data.md: Hearing those sorrowful words and finding the lord of earth aggrieved thus, Sumantra with clasped hands went off a little.

data.v: यदा वक्तुं स्वयं दैन्यान्न शशाक महीपतिः । तदा सुमन्त्रं मन्त्रज्ञा कैकेयी प्रत्युवाच ह ॥
data.es: When the king himself in that wretched state was not able to speak to Sumantra, crafty Kaikeyi said to him in reply:
data.anv: महीपतिः lord of the earth (the king), दैन्यात् due to the wretched conditon, स्वयम् personally, वक्तुम् to speak out, यदा when, न शशाक was not able, तदा then, मन्त्रज्ञा कैकेयी Kaikeyi, सुमन्त्रम् to Sumantra, प्रत्युवाच ह said in reply.
data.md: Seeing the king utterly incapable of speaking any thing personally owing to his heavy sorrow, Kaikeyī, the best counsellor in matters like these, addressed Sumantra with the following words.

data.v: सुमन्त्र रामं द्रक्ष्यामि शीघ्रमानय सुन्दरम् । स मन्यमानः कल्याणं हृदयेन ननन्द च ॥
data.md: Sumantra, Bring the beautiful Răma here, I want to see him. Thinking that some good would accrue to Rāma, he was pleased at heart and away he went speedily delighted at the royal mandate. Being asked again by Kaikeyi to hurry on at the time of departure Sumantra thought within himself.

data.v: सुमन्त्रश्चिन्तयामास त्वरितं चोदितस्तया । व्यक्तं रामोऽभिषेकार्थमिहायास्यति धर्मवित् ॥
data.es: Urged by Kaikeyi, Sumantra thought 'Righteous Rama will definitely come here for the purpose of installation'.
data.anv: तया by her, चोदितः urged, सुमन्त्रः Sumantra, चिन्तयामास thought over, धर्मवित् a knower of righteousness, रामः Rama, व्यक्तम् definitely, अभिषेकार्थम् for installation, इह here, आयास्यति  he will come.

data.v: इति सूतो मतिं कृत्वा हर्षेण महता पुनः । निर्जगाम महातेजा राघवस्य दिदृक्षया ॥
data.es: So thought the charioteer and filled with great delight left (the inner apartment), eager to see the mightyarmed Rama.
data.anv: सूतः the charioteer, इति in this way, मतिं कृत्वा having thought, महता हर्षेण with great delight, वृतः filled, महाबाहोः one with mighty arms, राघवस्य Rama's, दिदृक्षया  with an  intention to see Rama, निर्जगाम came out.

data.v: ततः पुरस्तात्सहसा विनिर्गतो; महीपतीन्द्वारगतान्विलोकयन् । ददर्श पौरान्विविधान्महाधना;नुपस्थितान्द्वारमुपेत्य विष्ठितान् ॥
data.es: Then Sumantra hastened towards the gate where he saw kings, wealthy people and citizens who had already arrived and waiting there. इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये अयोध्याकाण्डे चतुर्दशस्सर्गः॥Thus ends the fourteenth sarga of Ayodhyakanda of the holy Ramayana, the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.
data.anv: ततः then, सहसा immediately, पुरस्तात् forward, विनिर्गतः moving, द्वारगतः having reached  the gate, विलोकयन् seeing, द्वारम् gate, उपेत्य having approached, विष्ठितान् waiting, महीपतीन् kings, उपस्थितान् having arrived, महाधनान् wealthy people, (विविधान्) पौरान् citizens, ददर्श beheld.
data.md: Having come out of the presence of the king suddenly, he saw the warders, various citizens and great personages sitting at the gate.

data.v: ते तु तां रजनीमुष्य ब्राह्मणा वेदपारगाः । उपतस्थुरुपस्थानं सहराजपुरोहिताः ॥
data.es: The brahmins wellversed in the Vedas stayed waiting all night and assembled at the pavilion (for the consecration ceremony) along with royal priests.
data.anv: वेदपारगा: wellversed in the Vedas, ते those, ब्राम्हणा: brahmins, तां रजनीम् that night, उष्य after staying, सहराजपुरोहिता: along with royal priests, उपस्थानम् to the pavilion (for consecration ceremony), उपतस्थु: assembled.
data.md: The Brahmana, versed in in Veda, the counsellors, the commanders of military forces and the leading merchants, together with the royal priest, all brimming with joy on account of Rāma's installation, were waiting at the royal gate all night long

data.v: अमात्या बलमुख्याश्च मुख्या ये निगमस्य च । राघवस्याभिषेकार्थे प्रीयमाणास्तु संगताः ॥
data.es: For the consecration of the scion of the Raghu race (Rama), ministers, army chiefs and chiefs of merchants' associations assembled, brimming with joy.
data.anv: अमात्या: ministers, बलमुख्याश्च army chiefs, ये निगमस्य मुख्याः chiefs of the merchants' associations, राघवस्य of Rama, अभिषेकार्थे for the consecration, प्रियमाणा: brimming with joy, संगता: assembled.
data.md: The Brahmana, versed in in Veda, the counsellors, the commanders of military forces and the leading merchants, together with the royal priest, all brimming with joy on account of Rāma's installation, were waiting at the royal gate all night long

data.v: उदिते विमले सूर्ये पुष्ये चाभ्यागतेऽहनि । अभिषेकाय रामस्य द्विजेन्द्रैरुपकल्पितम् ॥
data.es: The best of brahmins had decided to perform the consecration ceremony after the bright Sun appeared in the sky when the Pushya star approached the karkataka lagna, which was the constellation at the time of Rama's birth.
data.anv: विमले bright, सूर्ये Sun, उदिते having arisen, अहनि during day , पुष्ये च when Pushya star, अभ्यागते was ascendent, रामस्य Rama's, जन्म स्थिते constellation at the time of birth, कर्कटकलग्ने ascension of karkataka lagna, प्राप्ते had come, रामस्य Rama's, अभिषेकाय for the consecration, द्विजेन्द्रै: by the best of brahmins, उपकल्पितम् was decided.

data.v: काञ्चना जलकुम्भाश्च भद्रपीठं स्वलंकृतम् । रामश्च सम्यगास्तीर्णो भास्वरा व्याघ्रचर्मणा ॥
data.anv: काञ्चना: golden, जलकुम्भाश्च jars filled with water, स्वलंकृतम् welldecorated, भद्रपीठम् throne, भास्वता by a bright, व्याघ्रचर्मणा by the tiger skin, सम्यक् properly, आस्तीर्ण:  spread, रथः च chariot also, (भान्ति are shining.)

data.v: गङ्गायमुनयोः पुण्यात्संगमादाहृतं जलम् । याश्चान्याः सरितः पुण्या ह्रदाः कूपाः सरांसि च ॥
data.es: Water had been fetched from the sacred confluence of Ganga and Yamuna, from other holy streams, wells, ponds and lakes, from rivers flowing eastward, westward, and zigzag, from rivers from all directions joined together. And from all the seas.
data.anv: पुण्यात् from sacred, गङ्गायमुनयो: सङ्गमात् from the confluence of Ganga and Yamuna, पुण्या: holy, अन्या: other, या:सरित: streams, ह्रदा: ponds, कूपा: wells, सरांसि च lakes as well, आहृतम्  brought, जलम् water, प्राग्वाहा: flowing eastwards, ऊर्ध्ववाहा: flowing upwards, तिर्यग्वाहा: flowing zigzag, समाहिता: joined together, ताभ्य: च from them also, सर्वश: from all directions, समुद्रेभ्य: from all seas, आहृतम् has been collected, तोयम् water.

data.v: प्राग्वाहाश्चोर्ध्ववाहाश्च तिर्यग्वाहाः समाहिताः । ताभ्यश्चैवाहृतं तोयं समुद्रेभ्यश्च सर्वशः ॥
data.es: Water had been fetched from the sacred confluence of Ganga and Yamuna, from other holy streams, wells, ponds and lakes, from rivers flowing eastward, westward, and zigzag, from rivers from all directions joined together. And from all the seas.
data.anv: पुण्यात् from sacred, गङ्गायमुनयो: सङ्गमात् from the confluence of Ganga and Yamuna, पुण्या: holy, अन्या: other, या:सरित: streams, ह्रदा: ponds, कूपा: wells, सरांसि च lakes as well, आहृतम्  brought, जलम् water, प्राग्वाहा: flowing eastwards, ऊर्ध्ववाहा: flowing upwards, तिर्यग्वाहा: flowing zigzag, समाहिता: joined together, ताभ्य: च from them also, सर्वश: from all directions, समुद्रेभ्य: from all seas, आहृतम् has been collected, तोयम् water.

data.v: क्षौद्रं दधि घृतं लाजा दर्भाः सुमनसः पयः । सलाजाः क्षीरिभिश्छन्ना घटाः काञ्चनराजताः । पद्मोत्पलयुता भान्ति पूर्णाः परमवारिणा ॥
data.es: Gold and silver vessels filled with holy water and puffed corn, adorned with lotuses, water lilies and leaves from trees rich in sap shone.
data.anv: सलाजा: with puffed corn, क्षीरिभि: leaves from trees rich in sap, छन्ना: covered, पद्मोत्पलयुता:  with lotuses and waterlilies, परमवारिणा holy water, पूर्णा: filled with, काञ्चनराजता: made of gold and silver, घटा: vessels, भान्ति are shining.

data.v: चन्द्रांशुविकचप्रख्यं पाण्डुरं रत्नभूषितम् । सज्जं तिष्ठति रामस्य वालव्यजनमुत्तमम् ॥
data.es: An excellent fan of yak's tail with a staff of gold studded with gems looking like diffused moonbeams was kept ready.
data.anv: चन्द्रांशुविकचप्रख्यम् resembling diffused rays of the moon, काञ्चनम् made of gold, रत्नभूषितम् adorned with gems, रामस्य for Rama, उत्तमम् excellent, वालव्यजनम् a fan made of yak's tail, सज्जं तिष्ठति is held in readiness.

data.v: चन्द्रमण्डलसंकाशमातपत्रं च पाण्डुरम् । सज्जं द्युतिकरं श्रीमदभिषेकपुरस्कृतम् ॥
data.es: A lustrous pale white umbrella resembling the Moon's orb or the pole star was kept in front of the coronation pavilion.
data.anv: चन्द्रमण्डलसंकाशम् resembling the Moon's orb, पाण्डुरम् pale white, द्युतिकरम् lustrous like the pole star अभिषेकपुरस्कृतम् to be placed in front of the coronation pavilion, श्रीमत् majestic, आतपत्रं umbrella, सज्जम् is arranged.

data.v: पाण्डुरश्च वृषः सज्जः पाण्डुराश्वश्च सुस्थितः । प्रस्रुतश्च गजः श्रीमानौपवाह्यः प्रतीक्षते ॥
data.es: A bull and a horse both pale white and a majestic elephant in rut worthy of royal ride stood waiting.
data.anv: पाण्डुर: pale white, वृष: bull, सज्ज: is kept ready, अश्व:च horse also, सुस्थित: in state, प्रसृत: flowing ichor (from its temples), श्रीमान् majestic, औपवाह्य: worthy of ride by a king, गज: च elephant also, प्रतीक्षते is awaiting.

data.v: अष्टौ कन्याश्च मङ्गल्याः सर्वाभरणभूषिताः । वादित्राणि च सर्वाणि बन्दिनश्च तथापरे ॥
data.es: Eight auspicious maidens adorned with all types of ornaments, all sorts of musical instruments, panegyrists and others (were in waiting).
data.anv: सर्वाभरणभूषिता: adorned with all kinds of ornament, माङ्गल्या: auspicious, अष्टौ eight, कन्या:unmarried girls, सर्वाणि all sorts of, वादित्राणि musical instruments, वन्दिन: च also panegyrists, तथा and, परे others (stood waiting).

data.v: इक्ष्वाकूणां यथा राज्ये संभ्रियेताभिषेचनम् । तथा जातीयामादाय राजपुत्राभिषेचनम् ॥
data.md: And all musical instruments, bringing these and all other things necessary for the installation of the descendants of Ikşvāku, in accordance with the king's permission, the panegyrists and other persons were assembled there.

data.v: ते राजवचनात्तत्र समवेता महीपतिम् । अपश्यन्तोऽब्रुवन्को नु राज्ञो नः प्रतिवेदयेत् ॥
न पश्यामश्च राजानमुदितश्च दिवाकरः । यौवराज्याभिषेकश्च सज्जो रामस्य धीमतः ॥
data.md: Not finding the king present there, they began to speak amongst themselves;, “Who will intimate the king of our arrival? The Sun is up and we do not see the king amongst us as yet. All articles necessary for the installation of the intelligent Rāma are ready."

data.v: इति तेषु ब्रुवाणेषु सार्वभौमान्महीपतीन् । अब्रवीत्तानिदं सर्वान्सुमन्त्रो राजसत्कृतः ॥
data.es: While the sovereign monarchs who hailed from different parts of the earth were thus talking Sumantra the king's confidant said:
data.anv: तेषु while they, इति thus, ब्रुवाणेषु were speaking, राजसत्कृत: the king's confidant, सुमन्त्र: Sumantra, तान् them, सर्वान् all, सार्वभौमान् sovereigns, महीपतीन् kings, इदम् this word, अब्रवीत् said.
data.md: While they were thus conversing, the charioteer Sumantra, well respected by the king, reached there and spoke to all those persons and the kings the following words.

data.v: अयं पृच्छामि वचनात्सुखमायुष्मतामहम् । राज्ञः संप्रतिबुद्धस्य यच्चागमनकारणम् ॥
data.es: On your behalf I shall enquire from the king who is awake now about his welfare and the reason for calling me here.
data.anv: अयम् अहम् such I am, आयुष्मताम् longlived, वचनात् by your words, संप्रति बुद्धस्य to him now awake, राज्ञ: king's, सुखम् welfare, आगमनकारणं the reason for his coming, पृच्छामि I shall ask.

data.v: इत्युक्त्वान्तःपुरद्वारमाजगाम पुराणवित् । आशीर्भिर्गुणयुक्ताभिरभितुष्टाव राघवम् ॥
data.es: Having said so, Sumantra who was versed in history and tradition approached the inner apartment which always remains closed.
data.anv: पुराणवित् one who is wellversed in history and tradition, सुमन्त्र: Sumantra, इति thus, उक्त्वा having spoken, अन्त:पुरद्वारम् entrance to the inner apartment, आजगाम approached, सदा always, सक्तम् remains closed, तत् that, वेश्म palace, प्रविवेश ह entered.

data.v: गता भगवती रात्रिरहः शिवमुपस्थितम् । बुध्यस्व नृपशार्दूल कुरु कार्यमनन्तरम् ॥
data.es: O best among kings the holy night has passed. Having been acquainted with the acts accomplished so far, perform whatever is further necessary for the installation ceremony. All preparations for Rama's coronation ceremony have since been complete.
data.anv: भगवती holy, रात्रि: night, गता has passed, शिवम् auspicious, अह: day, उपस्थितम् has arrived, नृपशार्दुल O tiger among kings, बुद्ध्यस्व may wake up, अनन्तरम् later, कार्यम् acts, कुरु perform.
data.md: The worshipful night is gone and blessed morn has arrived; arise, Oh! you great king, and perform morning ablutions.

data.v: ब्राह्मणा बलमुख्याश्च नैगमाश्चागता नृप । दर्शनं प्रतिकाङ्क्षन्ते प्रतिबुध्यस्व राघव ॥
data.es: O scion of the Raghu dynasty brahmins, army commanders and merchants have arrived and they beseech your audience. Please awake.
data.anv: राघव born in the family of Raghu, नृप O king, ब्राह्मणा: brahmins, बलमुख्या: च army commanders, नैगमा: च merchants also, आगता: have arrived, दर्शनम् your audience, (अभि)  कांक्षन्ते request, प्रतिबुध्यस्व may awaken.
data.md: Brāhmaṇas, commanders and merchants are assembled at the palace gate, desirous of seeing you, do you therefore arise, Oh descendant of Raghu.
